Job Description:
Colorful and Creative Word Artist


Based in Roswell, GA, we are a Digital Marketing agency working with multi-location national brands. We are looking for passionate and dedicated individuals who are self-motivated and can thrive in a team environment.

The content creation wizards we seek will have experience writing website content that is compelling and captures the hearts and minds of website visitors. Experience incorporating local SEO keywords in an unobtrusive way is essential.

What You Will Be Doing


Our team of extraordinary copywriters creates localized content for our client’s websites. Content will cover a variety of industries and topics. All content will be focus on how our clients meet the needs of their customers on a local level. A focus on solid local SEO strategy helps us to drive traffic to our client’s sites. Your job is to make the content so compelling potential customers can’t wait to pick up the phone to schedule an appointment!

What You Need for this Position


SKILL/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
Self-motivated, creative thinker
Ability to meet weekly deadlines with minimal supervision
Strong communication (verbal and written communication) and listening skills
Ability to mimic tone and content of current website in new content
Comfortable writing on a wide variety of topics
Strong project management skills
Ability to work independently while still being a collaborative team player
Ability to work in self-directed, fast-paced environment
PLUSES:
Solid understanding of Search Engine Optimization
Experience with WordPress
Understanding of local marketing
Solid communication skills
EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

College degree or equivalent plus experience writing SEO optimized content for websites
This is a part time, contract position.

Compensation: Hourly (Between 5 and 20 hours per week)

No phone calls, please.

No recruiters, please.

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Squarespace makes beautiful products to help people with creative ideas succeed. By blending elegant design and sophisticated engineering, we empower millions of people — from individuals and local artists to entrepreneurs shaping the world’s most iconic businesses — to share their stories with the world. Squarespace’s team of more than 1,000 is headquartered in downtown New York City, with offices in Dublin and Portland. For more information, visit www.squarespace.com/about.

The Social Media Specialist position is a key position in supporting all social efforts. This role will impact and maintain a best-in-class social presence of the oVertone brand to consumers, influencers, and advocates in social media, acting as a key conduit to driving our social digital strategy. The Social Media Specialist will collaborate with marketing counterparts to support planning content, engaging with our social communities, and develop social media content, strategy, engagement, and amplification. This position is part of the Integrated Marketing team and directly supports the Integrated Marketing Manager.
Key Responsibilities
Day to day running of oVertone’s social media accounts, ensuring we are telling stories consistently across our channels and supporting the team on content implementation
Collaborate cross-departmentally to support brand awareness and engagement, escalating issues when required and proactivity identifying trends and themes utilizing data to inform future social media plans
Social Platforms
Manage all consumer channels, partnering with team to ensure best-in-class presence, excellence in execution, and increase in engagement and growth across follower base, including but not limited to: Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, Twitter, Pinterest, and TikTok
Manage and oversee posting of social media content calendar for the brand - ensuring visuals and copy are aligned with brand aesthetic and voice and collaborating with counterparts to adjust when applicable
Leverage Social Media & Content Management tools (Dash Hudson) to improve overall processes & optimize ways of working
Understand social media analytics and be part of the team that brainstorms and makes recommendations on how to adjust content accordingly; drive insight into action through monthly & quarterly reporting
Content Creation
Coordinate across various teams to inform overall social calendar (Brand and Consumer Marketing, Creative, Communications, Development, Manufacturing, Client Services)
Create dynamic on-brand Instagram Story content to support all key categories, launches, events & moments
Ideate and brief social content for events, moments, campaigns and always on concepts
Attend and cover brand events/moments (some may be after hours or on weekends) for social content when needed
On an ongoing basis, identify issues, patterns, and trends in consumer comments/inquiries on social media and funnel information to the appropriate departments via regular reporting
Track beauty trends/news with momentum on social media and brainstorm with brand team new content ideas, ensuring the brand is participating in relevant social media conversations
Community Management
Engage in daily ongoing social conversations and listening within social platforms using the brand’s tone of voice with the ability to help create meaningful conversations with our customers to drive product awareness, brand buzz and equity
Identifying new influencers and brands to engage with and follow on Instagram on an ongoing basis
Possess the ability to identify potential negative or crisis situation and apply conflict resolution principles to mitigate issues and manage social escalations – escalating scenarios to appropriate parties, e.g. communications, leadership, legal
Collaborate with Client Engagement team in Tucson to ensure alignment in copypastas in response to clients for ongoing and campaign-specific efforts
Collaborate with Client Services, Brand Bastion and any other third partner partners, to ensure all client comments and questions are answered, and any high-risk social flags are responded to
Stay up to date on new social media tools, best practices and how other organizations and companies are using them so oVertone can be an early adopter of technologies

Qualifications & Skills
Knowledge & expertise of social media – owned, earned and paid
Understanding the nuances of social platforms, how to engage on them, what content makes sense for which platform, etcetera
Excellent communication and writing skills – strong attention to detail, desire to be active and vocal within the department
Strong time management & ability to oversee multiple projects at one time
Creative & curious – constantly exploring new opportunities & ideas within the industry & social space, eager to share learnings with team and collaborate
Consumer-driven approach to lead brand effort in putting consumers, influencers and advocates at the center of its social media strategy
Demonstrates winning Social Customer Service techniques such as empathy, patience, advocacy, and conflict resolution
Pop culture savvy to identify trends and key influencers that we can target/follow within our social media outreach

Physical Requirements:
Continuously required to sit/stand
Occasionally required to walk, bend, stoop, push/pull, and reach above

Coordinate,prepare,review standard forms,expressions of interest,technical proposals and presentations
Participate in pre-proposal meetings,kick-off meetings and debriefings
Prepare product descriptions and resumes tailored for specific proposals
Coordinate proposal production,including typing,graphics,editing,reproduction,printing and delivery
Provide compliant, high-quality submissions with is high degree of accuracy and quality
Work directly with members of the proposal team in the strategy,development,coordination and final submission of proposals
Lead social media effort to enhance WSC brand to potential clients and A/E contacts
Coordinate use of drone and other photography of active and completed projects
Prepare targeted project post cards and e-blasts

CAMP Systems is the leading provider of aircraft compliance and health management services to the global business aviation industry. CAMP is the pre-eminent brand in its industry and is the exclusive recommended service provider for nearly all business aircraft manufacturers in the world including Airbus, Bell, Boeing, Bombardier, Cessna, Daher, Dassault, Embraer, Gulfstream, Hawker, HondaJet, Leonardo, and Pilatus. Our services are delivered through a“SaaS plus” model and we support over 20,000 aircraft on our maintenance tracking platform and over 31,000 engines on our engine health monitoring platform. Additionally, CAMP provides shop floor management ERP systems to over 1,300 aircraft maintenance facilities and parts suppliers around the world. CAMP has grown from a single location company in 2001, to over 800 employees in 12 locations around the world.

Company Description

KWSM is a full service digital marketing agency made up of journalists. We specialize in website development & SEO, social media strategy & management, content creation, PR & influencer marketing, and digital advertising. Clients hire us to create integrated digital marketing strategies to generate leads or sales. Half our clients are B2B and half are B2C.

We have offices in Orange County, CA, San Diego, CA, Atlanta, GA and Las Vegas, NV.

Job Description

We are looking for a website designer/developer to create new websites, and refresh existing websites, for our clients. We are a digital marketing agency that believes that social media and digital ads work best when we can drive traffic to a highly-functional hub. There is no reason for a company to invest in a digital strategy if their website is outdated. You will work with our Content Editors to create an outstanding online presence for each of our clients, ensuring that their website and social media channels are working together.

We're looking for someone who truly wants to be part of our team. We're building something amazing, and need your ideas and talent to take our website program to the next level.

You will need to be familiar with Wordpress, Google web tools, and have a basic understanding of the major social media channels (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube). The ability to work on non-wordpress sites is also a plus. Throw in some graphic design skills, and we would be pretty excited about you.

We are looking for someone innovative and creative. We expect our web designers to have design capabilities in addition to the ability to simply build out a website. You must be able to listen to a client's goals and ideas, and create a website that exceeds their expectations.

We value efficiency and the ability to juggle several projects at once. At any given time, we are working with several clients simultaneously, and each one of them needs to be treated as a priority. You must be able to prioritize a to-do list and meet deadlines without fail.

This isn't the kind of gig where you can work through a couple of rounds of changes, and be finished with the site. We will continue to tweak a project until the client is thrilled. We're looking for someone who is loyal, patient, and cares deeply about giving clients exactly what they want and need.

The right designer/developer for our team will have a solid understanding of search engine optimization, how social media and websites work together, and best practices for online marketing. We design great looking sites - that work to boost our clients' visibility (and bottom line).

This is a full-time, salaried position with benefits and job security.

We operate on a 9/80 workweek - Fridays off every other week, 9-hour workdays from 7:00 am - 4:30 pm Monday - Thursday.

Qualifications

The right person for this job will be...

Creative.

If creating exceptional websites was easy, anyone could do it. If you have big ideas, are willing to take risks, and want a job where you can be innovative and try new things, KWSM could be a very good fit.

Communicative.

We tell stories for a living. That involves engaging and communicating with an audience online, but it also requires the ability to communicate well with our clients, and each other. We’re a small company, and you will have a lot of opportunity to add your feedback. We need someone who wants to be heard.

Great at Time Management.

Can you take a lengthy ‘to do’ list and prioritize what’s important? Can you multi-task when necessary, while continuing to perform well? Can you thrive in a bustling and interactive environment, and still get your work done? If so, you’ll fit right in!

Team-oriented.

We have a very collaborative office, and want to work with people who want to be part of a team. If you’re the kind of person who likes the door to their office closed, you probably won’t be happy here. (Our offices don’t actually have doors.)

Passionate.

We want to work with people who are passionate. If you have the ability to get excited about something and throw yourself into it, you will find a lot of kindred spirits here.

Additional Information

If this sounds like you, please email Katie Wagner at katie(at)kwsmdigital.com

We value our team culture. You can experience it on our Instagram account @KWSMteam.

Sure, we love seeing your resume. But we really want to know a little more about you. For bonus points, please take this test and share your results with us. https://www.16personalities.com

You can learn more about the benefits we provide here: https://kwsmdigital.com/about-us/careers/

The “Tour of Duty”
We currently have an opening for a Software Product Generalist- an exciting position that offers candidates a chance to immerse themselves in Cobalt’s Consulting, Support, and Marketing departments. This is a two-year rotational “Tour of Duty”, which will be broken into 8-month segments in each of the three departments. The term “Tour of Duty” and its structure come from the book “The Alliance: Managing Talent in the Networked Age” by Reid Hoffman, Ben Casnocha and Chris Yeh.

The ideal candidate would be new to the job market and interested in software but wants to figure out exactly where in a software development company they belong. The focus of this position is learning: learning about Cobalt, a small, high tech company, learning about software development, and learning about the candidate’s interests and strengths in the software industry.
Part 1: Project Management
The first part of the Tour will begin in our Consulting department working alongside our talented Project Managers on Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Cobalt’s products and processes. Part 1 will begin with an intensive training course, in which the candidate will learn about software project implementation and the project management process.

Skills Gained from this Phase of the Tour:
Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
Agile software development and Scrum methodology
Quality Assurance (QA) testing
Software configuration
Part 2: Client Support
For the second part of their Tour the candidate will transition to our Support department. There they will work closely with our extremely knowledgeable Software Support Specialists, getting to know our clients, their businesses and how they use the different Cobalt products.

Skills Gained from this Phase of the Tour:
Customer service
End-user support & training
In-depth product knowledge
Part 3: Product Marketing
The third and final portion of the Tour will be within Cobalt’s Marketing department. After spending 16 months getting to know our products, processes, and clients, the candidate will have gained the unique in-depth knowledge base to help market our products and services.

Skills Gained from this Phase of the Tour:
Conducting product-specific webinars & video content
Blog post creation
Website content creation and management
After the “Tour of Duty”
After two years of mastering the different functions of each department, the candidate will have a good understanding of who we are as a company and what we do, as well as understanding their own personal interests as it pertains to their career path in software development. The end of this three-part “Tour of Duty” will mark the end of the candidate’s time in the position. Candidates will have the opportunity to either continue their career at Cobalt-based on their interests, what they have learned about each department, and their performance in each of the three parts of their Tour, or continue their career elsewhere, taking the comprehensive training and knowledge they gained from Cobalt with them.
Required Qualifications
An interest in technology, particularly software development
A Bachelor’s Degree or higher
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Fluency in English
Ability to work in the U.S. without sponsorship
Benefits & Compensation
Cobalt provides all employees with medical, vision, dental, life and disability insurance, and a 401k plan with employer matching. We host multiple events for our employees each year including quarterly events and a holiday party.

Total annual compensation for this position:
Year 1: $64,000
Year 2: $69,000

Mission   RE·Center Race & Equity in Education (RE·Center) is committed to building an equitable and just world where everyone has what they need to grow and thrive.We work in partnership with youth, families, schools, and communities to facilitate nurturing spaces where people can understand and challenge systemic racism and oppression. In all of our programs, we practice critical questioning, cultivate connection, and inspire action.Background  RE·Center provides support to all of those working to transform their K-12 schools and school systems into equitable learning environments. Our goal is to create an ecosystem of empowered students supported by conscious, critically thinking adults and supportive, safe schools and communities.RE·Center (formerly The Discovery Center) has been working toward a future without prejudice since our founding by actor and philanthropist Paul Newman in 1992. We provide training, professional development, technical assistance, coaching, and other supports for all members of the school community including students, administrators, teachers, school staff, parents, and community members.RE·Center is in an exciting growth phase. The Program Director-Youth Development position is an opportunity to help build, refine, align and coordinate our youth programs.The Program Director-Youth Development Position OverviewThe Program Director-Youth Development (PDYD) oversees two major initiatives and serves as a lead facilitator and collaborator across the Programs department supporting outreach and adult education programming. In addition to their programmatic and facilitation work, the PDYD is also responsible for providing critical thought partnership to RE·Center’s Leadership Team as the organization journeys to becoming a more equitable multicultural organization.

This position will work primarily with young people of color in a process of identity development, critical consciousness raising, and strategizing for racial equity.The PDYD Directs
Equity Teams for Positive School Change
EDIfy-Youth

These initiatives consist of:
Program Development & Implementation
Project Management
Curriculum Research & Adaptation
Content Creation
Partnership and Stakeholder Development
Thought Partnership
Supervision and Mentorship
Facilitation
Evaluation and Assessment, in collaboration with Program Evaluation Manager
The PDYD is a Lead Facilitator and Collaborator in the following areas.
Co-create and co-facilitate all youth-centered components of our adult programming
Outreach (Youth Centered)

Program Director-Youth Development ResponsibilitiesProgram Development & Project Management (35%)

Envision, create, develop and implement all aspects of our youth programs
Develop and manage relationships with partner organizations and schools
Research and generate learning frameworks
Strategically scope and scaffold programs
Create and adapt curriculum for programs and workshops
Develop programmatic goals and outcomes
Coordinate programmatic logistics and operations
Participate in the evaluation and assessment of all youth centered and youth led programs
Document and codify programs
Collaboratively develop budgets, costs, and fee structures of programs
Develop Scopes of Service
Create materials (presentations, facilitator agendas, guidelines, handouts, handbooks, etc.)
Submit hours, timesheets, mileage reimbursements, etc.
Maintain current knowledge of the field of diversity/inclusion, social justice education, anti-racism/anti-oppression education to inform curriculum and strategic direction of RE·Center programs
Coordinate with RE·Center partner/client organizations to prepare for trainings/workshops
Talent Management & Supervision (20%)
Supervise and mentor per-diem facilitators for all projects PDYD oversees
Manage payroll for per-diem facilitators on each of your projects

Job Description (Role Profile)
Are you ready to join the world’s most innovative and influential community of media and entertainment professionals?
Avid Technology is looking for Solutions Engineer to join the Americas Professional Services Team on the East Coast (USA). Work can be carried out at customer sites, and at your home office if you are not located close to an Avid office.

About the role
You will analyze customer technical, workflow and operational requirements and define Asset Management solutions based on Avid’s product line.
You will also identify and scope customer-specific developments and will lead the development team as Product Owner.
You will be responsible for all technical aspects of an Avid Asset Management implementation, including configuration of the system as well as solution-specific training for the customer. A strong software development background is beneficial.
Additional tasks include support of pre-sales activities, product demonstrations and proof of concept (POC) builds. A strong broadcast industry knowledge and experience in the media workflow lifecycle is preferred.
Responsibilities & Duties
Consulting and requirements analysis for our domestic and international customers
Responsibility for the complete System Design (HW+SW) ensuring technical feasibility and support of the customer specific business processes
Specification, calculation, and planning of work packages and test cases
Advise customers and team members on technical best practices during the project lifecycle
Perform in an Agile environment as a Product Owner, delivering customer-specific developments
Manage the development of the customer specific solutions
Implementing customer-specific workflows
Installation, configuration, and test of complete solutions
Your profile
Master of Science degree in Computer Science or equivalent
5 years of experience in requirements analysis and system designs in large and complex technical environments, ideally in the field of (Digital or Media) Asset Management / Media workflow solutions
Thorough technical know-how in the IT sector
Good understanding of technology as it is applied in the media industry.
Experience in a high-level programming language
Understand the solutions and best practices integrating technical modules
Innovative and creative
Tenacious and dedicated
Highly self-motivated to drive self and others for successful outcomes.
Strong customer orientation and willingness to travel
Good communication and language skills, other languages are most welcome
Knowledge of SCRUM / Agile development process
About Avid
Through Avid Everywhere, Avid delivers the industry's most open, innovative and comprehensive media platform connecting content creation with collaboration, asset protection, distribution and consumption for the most listened to, most watched and most loved media in the world—from the most prestigious and award-winning feature films, music recordings, and television shows, to live concerts and news broadcasts. Industry leading solutions include Pro Tools®, Media Composer®, Nexis®, Interplay®, and Sibelius®. Our digital audio and video solutions continue to revolutionize the art of creative storytelling, and have earned us hundreds of awards, including two Oscar® statuettes, a Grammy®, and 16 Emmys®

Do you..

ITHAKA is seeking a Learning and Organizational Development Manager (L&OD Mgr) to join our dedicated Work Life& Culture (WLC) team.

The Role

As the Learning and Organizational Development Manager, you will work with the Work Life and Culture team in partnership with business leaders across the organization for the development, sourcing, content creation and curation, and overall execution of training needs for the ITHAKA organization.

This is an exciting opportunity for someone who wants to own the strategy but also stay close to the business by managing the development and execution of programs. Your focus will be on sourcing and delivering high-impact training that maximizes learner participation, comprehension, and application via a variety of methods. You will provide practical guidance and counsel on topics such as talent management, staff and manager development, organizational effectiveness, diversity& inclusion, and new hire onboarding. In addition to being a subject matter expert, you will anticipate needs and areas for improvement and transformation drawing upon your experience and industry best practices.

Our mission and culture shape who we are and how we operate. The right individual for this role is someone who is as passionate about the culture and mission as the work they are doing.

As a member of the Work Life and Culture team, you will enjoy the benefits associated with engaging and problem solving with a team of professionals that share your commitment to quality service, continuous improvement and success.

Responsibilities
Lead the design of annual learning, organizational development strategy and planning including: goal setting, project scoping, research and analysis, content creation and/or curation, delivery methodology, and implementation.
Establish, monitor and regularly report on learning and organizational development metrics: tracking participation/engagement, evaluating effectiveness, measuring ROI, and proactively improving and evolving training as we learn from our experiences.
Conduct ongoing needs assessment and diagnosis, identifying individual and team learning opportunities for managers and staff.
Lead manager development program in collaboration with the WLC team, including professional development for managers, continued development of a manager toolkit, and new manager training and coaching.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders to ensure that programs support and align with ITHAKA values, OKRs (Objectives and Key Results), business priorities and outcomes.
Lead enterprise coaching activities (internal and external) including coaching strategy evolution, enhancement of internal coaching capability, ensuring consistency in coaching experiences and evaluation of coaching outcomes.
Counsel business leaders and team members in all aspects of performance management via frequent and meaningful conversations to include performance feedback, goal setting and development planning.
Provide direct support and coaching to all levels of leadership as they develop themselves and their team members; identify lessons learned and recommend topics for further dissemination. Manage internal/external coaching and mentoring engagements and assess their effectiveness.
Develop meaningful learning and development programs to focus on internal talent and internal mobility.
Coordinate with WLC partners and key stakeholders to guide the organization in prioritizing and developing learning plans by leading the sourcing, implementation and customization of development initiatives, ensuring they are aligned and integrated to support talent management.
Develop, manage, and facilitate regularly scheduled learning events.
Continuous socialization, communication, and rollout of curriculum to optimize employee engagement and utilization.
Continuously build leadership bench strength and effectiveness based on talent assessment, succession planning and development plans, and in particular, insights gained from the annual Talent Review process. Serve as an internal coach to high-potential employees.
Ability to facilitate learning utilizing a combination of venues and platforms, including instructor-led training, speaker series, self-study, blended learning, and e-learning. Support our staff and managers with opportunities for on-the-job and experiential learning.
Develop and coordinate new hire training for all positions in collaboration with department subject matter experts; ensure that new hires have been provided all information and resources needed for successful job performance.
Develop innovative and effective Diversity& Inclusion training programs that reflect the latest thinking and best practices in the field; may also conduct/facilitate training.
Continually build knowledge of the Diversity& Inclusion landscape and emerging issues and opportunities
Develop and manage relationships with external consultants and vendors. Maintain contracts, and routinely assess relationships, tools, and technology to ensure quality and effectiveness of programs that are repeatable, sustainable, and cost effective.
Experience and Skills
Bachelor’s degree and 3-5 years experience in human resources, leadership, management, organizational development or related field; any combination of degree achievement, professional experience, volunteer work, and other transferable skills may be applied toward these qualifications.
Proven ability in building and developing new learning and development programs and strategies organizationally, and leadership development programs in particular.
Knowledge and curiosity in the most current thinking in the fields of leadership, professional, and organizational development.
Outstanding ability to build and maintain partnerships and relationships across all levels of the organization.
Excellent interpersonal, presentation/facilitation, written and verbal communication, coaching, and consulting skills. Ability to assess needs, influence, collaborate, deliver, and partner across all levels of the organization.
Passion to invest in and continuously develop a culture of learning.
Enthusiasm for a continuous improvement and coaching approach to management and people development, and sharing knowledge to empower others. Ability to receive feedback and course-correct when needed.
Interest in digging beneath the surface to understand root causes to enable strong solutions.
Understanding of how to adapt content and conversations to meet the needs of your audience seamlessly switching from strategic to operational thinking as needed.
Strong project management, planning, and organization skills.
Demonstrated ability to research, learn, and present new topics as requested.
Highly developed critical thinking and problem solving skills.
Sharp business acumen and the ability to link learning solutions to organizational impact.
Must be flexible to respond quickly and positively to shifting demands and opportunities; ability to work under tight deadlines and plan, organize, and carry out multiple detailed tasks.
Experience with MS Office and/or Google Suite; ability to quickly learn new systems and processes.
Some travel (10-15%) required.
Work for ITHAKA

We are committed to our organizational values of belonging, evidence, speed, trust, and teamwork.

Our team is passionate about our mission and supporting one another. We enjoy working together to create opportunities for people to learn and grow out in the world, and we bring that same commitment to helping our teammates develop in our careers and our lives. One of our core values is belonging. We embrace differences, and believe that the things that make each of us unique are the things that help us see new insights and build better solutions.

Learn more aboutWorking at ITHAKA.

E-Commerce Content Manager

Department: E-Commerce Sales

Reports to: Director E-Commerce Sales

Mission Statement:

We share our passion for the seasonal activities of the outdoor rural lifestyle through our home-grown expertise in the products and tools we design, manufacture, and sell. Through the values of resourcefulness, hard-work, and respect we develop long-term personal relationships and strategic business partnerships throughout the global community.

Job Summary:

E-Commerce is a very important part of Ardisam’s overall sales strategy. This includes selling to e-commerce retailers, brick and mortar retail sites, and direct to consumer. The Content Manager will assist in managing the entire process including item set-up, creating A+ content, content management, competitive analysis of listings, , and post-listing monitoring. Much of this work is done inside our customer web portals (Ex. Amazon Vendor Central, Amazon Seller Central, Home Depot IDM, Wal-Mart Retail Link) or through third party portals (Ex. SPS, Commerce Hub, EdgeNet).

Ecommerce Responsibilities:
Gather and load product copy, specifications, and images from multiple Ardisam sources to setup new (and update existing) products in our customer web portals.
Communicate our inventory levels to customers to maximize sales and minimize order rejections.
Confirm orders inventory, and pricing verification.
Manage inventory feeds to ensure adequate stock to maximize sales.
Running promos, coupons, etc. as need be and understanding all costs
Analyze competitive listing to ensure Ardisam has best in class content. Become a student of ecommerce and develop a process for constant improvement of our listings online.
Use analytics tools such as Helium 10 to ensure all components of a solid listing are being followed.
Compile and store listing information in a concise package so that it can be distributed to retailers for their use when selling our products on their sites.
Monitor listings for unauthorized changes and resolve any issues.
Identify and respond to end user reviews on our customer sites that require follow up service.
Charge backs, Disputing problems and resolving charge back and/or fine related issues working on fines within product lines
Internal Websites:
Running promotions
Adding content
Managing users
Creating user groups /fields
Working with 3 party aps and running promotions on mailchimp
Internal Sales:
Become the go to person for VIP, industry insider pricing, content creators, etc. within Business Unit (does not need to enter pricing or orders but needs to know how and where to direct quality candidates.)
Third Party Software:
PROWL and WTB Plugins
Running and managing the day to day information to be up to data.
Researching other tools
Jungle Scout/ Helium 10 Tools
Learning and understanding tools to be more successful
BAZAARVOICE or OTHER Review Software
Understanding and assisting in any other 3 party apps that apply to websites
Social Media (backup):
Answering questions
Assisting in promotions
Emphasis on understanding quality posts
Qualifications and Skills:
Analytical mindset – Questioning why things are the way they are and digging in to find answers
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills – Sifting through customer data to identify opportunities
Understands the ECommerce marketplace – Knows the difference between 1st Party, 3rd Party, and Direct to Consumer selling.
Amazon experience preferred
Education: Some college desired.

Benefits: Health Insurance, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Group Term Life Insurance, Long Term Disability, Personal Time Off, Paid Holidays, 401K Plan w/Company match, Flexible Spending Accounts (Dependent), Health Savings Account with employer contributions.

As Strategy Associate, you will work to improve access to mobility for our public transit partners. Working with senior members of the Strategy Team, you will leverage your deep understanding of potential partners' transportation challenges and goals, and apply your knowledge of Via's unique technical and operational strengths, to scope and design thoughtful and effective shared mobility services.

What You'll Do
Apply your strategic thinking skills and work closely with Via's Finance and Expansion Teams to create context-specific service plans and customized pricing and budgeting proposals.
Conduct rigorous research on global mobility trends by analyzing news and other forms of information and synthesizing findings into insightful commentary.
Generate compelling original content by closely ascertaining a partner's needs and deploying your familiarity with Via's technology and operational capabilities, transit norms, and the latest innovations from across the industry.
Lead competitive procurements from beginning to end -- through evaluation, content creation, review, and submission.
Skillfully manage communications with potential partner over the phone and email.
Support senior team members during interviews with cities and transit agencies.
Who You Are
An exceptional writer and communicator with an instinctive appreciation for tone and structure; your colleagues have told you that they enjoy reading your work (and maybe you've even won awards).
Socially-minded, action-oriented, and passionate about urbanism; you understand the importance of public transit and are motivated to improve worldwide access to mobility.
Meticulous and strategic; you can pay attention to every detail in a complex project while, at the same time, relate each of them to the big picture in a coherent way.

What Catches our Eye
Prior experience at a startup, transportation consulting firm, management consulting firm, or in the public sector is a plus.
"Via is re-engineering public transit, from a regulated system of rigid routes and schedules to a fully dynamic, on-demand network. Via's mobile app connects multiple passengers who are headed the same way, allowing riders to seamlessly share a dynamically-routed vehicle. First launched in New York City in September 2013, the Via platform operates in New York City, Chicago, and Washington DC, and in London and Amsterdam through ViaVan, its joint venture with Mercedes-Benz Vans. Via also licenses its revolutionary on-demand transit technology to transportation players globally."

Via offers above market compensation packages and benefits, including equity, health insurance, and relocation assistance.

Via is an equal opportunity employer.

Lovevery is a fast-growing direct-to-consumer startup cofounded by successful serial entrepreneurs and based in Boise, Idaho. Our customers are parents, and our mission is to help them feel confident in giving their children meaningful development experiences in the critical early years of life. To deliver an exceptional experience for our customers, Lovevery needs to consistently produce premium quality products, with customer safety and satisfaction as top priorities.

Lovevery is looking for an experienced Product Development leader to join the Product Development team. The right candidate will lead taking products from concept to reality through the management of a fast paced, cross-functional product development cycle that includes Design, Testing, Engineering, Content Creation and Manufacturing. The following attributes in a candidate are essential to success in this role:
Functional Leadership The success of the company depends on the ability of the Product team to execute on the product pipeline. You have a passion for creating best-in-class products, lead with vision, and collaborate naturally with others to reach the goals of the team and company. You drive the product roadmap and ensure that product launches are on time, within budget, and meet the standards of the brand.
Project Management Work ethic, responsiveness, and results orientation matter in every role at Lovevery. With everyone working hard to achieve the company's goals, having strong project planning skills and a structured approach to big decisions such as product launch dates, new supplier selection, and manufacturing tradeoffs are essential.
Communication It is especially critical for the person managing the development of our products to be an exceptional communicator with other teams. This is a connective role with important interfaces across the entire company. You are skilled at structured and complete communication, and you are comfortable articulating what needs to be done when things are ambiguous.
Process Improvement We are launching increasingly more products and need to do so with greater efficiency while maintaining exceptional product quality and customer experience. You are able to identify, analyze, and improve upon existing product development and business processes. While we are not tied to specific methodologies, you help us implement best practices and new ideas to help us increase productivity to reach our goals.
Passion for Early Childhood Development

Job Title: Campaign Producer, The Well - Everyday Health
Job Description:
EverydayHealth.com, the leading health and wellness digital platform, is seeking a highly organized and experienced Campaign Producer for The Well, our brand and content studio located in NYC. As Everyday Health aims to inspire and enable wellness for consumers, the ideal candidate will have a passion for health and wellness, experience in the space, and the ability to multi-task and calmly keep up in a fast-paced and demanding environment. This position will report in to the Executive Editor of The Well Programs.

In this role, the candidate will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic, creative, close-knit environment where they can apply and grow their digital, production, and storytelling skills. The Campaign Producer will be responsible for overseeing the delivery of contentmarketing campaigns featuring a variety of formats, includingarticles, quizzes, videos, tools, interactives, and more. The Campaign Producer will provide a broad range of support responsibilities, including management of timelines and deliverables; collaborating internally with cross-functional teams such as Marketing Solutions, Creative Services, Client Success Management, Sales, Product, and Editorial; interfacing externally with vendors and freelancers; and partnering with other Everyday Health Group properties. Additionally, the Campaign Producer will have the opportunity to partner with senior members of the content studio to brainstorm new product and content ideas, and to assist with content creation across channels, particularly on social.

What Youll Do
• Manage multiple project schedules against tight timelines
• Manage the process for the successful creation and delivery of content marketing campaigns, keeping track of many moving pieces and people
• Coordinate with Client Success Managers to ensure fulfillment of campaign expectations
• Collaborate with designers, product managers, and editors to produce new tools, videos, and other interactive elements
• Coordinate with social, email, and audience teams to deliver robust promotional campaigns
• Coordinate with internal teams to gather analytics to optimize campaigns
• Lead kickoff calls and post-campaign debriefs, as needed
• Perform a variety of administrative tasks, including vendor on-boarding, invoicing, scheduling, and more
• Identify influencers within condition areas and assist with outreach for participation in video-based projects and partnership opportunities
• Assist in the writing of click-worthy promotional copy for social media, newsletters, and other promotional levers, as needed
• Contribute to team brainstorms on smart content solutions that generate revenue opportunities

The ideal candidate will be:
• Smart, energetic, confident, and creative, with strong organizational skills
• Meticulously detailed with a focus on accuracy and quality
• Able to juggle multiple tasks, meet deadlines, and adapt to new assignments
• Comfortable in a fast-paced, deadline-driven, creative work environment
• Able to work collaboratively and effectively within the team and with other departments across the company

The ideal candidate will have:
• 4+ years production or project management experience with a track record of success
• Experience working with cross-functional teams and a variety of roles
• Strong written and verbal communication skills
• Experience working in web-based project management tools and dashboards
• The ability to represent Everyday Health externally to vendors, talent, and freelancers
• An understanding of media and experience working with agencies and/or clients a strong plus
• Health and wellness digital content experience a strong plus
• Experience working at a content studio a plus
• Video editing and/or social media experience a plus

PacBio is looking for a highly-motivated individual with content marketing experience to help develop and execute compelling campaigns across our long-read sequencing market segments.

What you get to do daily

You will focus on creating and distributing valuable, relevant, and consistent scientific marketing content to attract and retain clearly defined audiences, and ultimately drive demand across our market segments Plant and Animal Sciences (PAS), Human Biomedical Research (HBR), Microbial and Infectious Disease.

You will work collaboratively with internal Marketing teams including application scientists, market segment leads and product management to ensure scientific integrity of newly generated content and alignment with our strategic market messaging. You will then coordinate across the marketing and regional marketing organization to deploy newly created content through communication and distribution channels to drive engagement with a defined target end-user audience.

You will also be responsible for collaborating with the broader marketing team to distill new high-impact scientific literature (publications and presentations) into engaging new content marketing pieces to inspire our target audience. This will require marketing savvy for identifying the best ways to create and distribute new content and messaging across a variety of channels to maximize impact.

Keys to your success in this role

In this role, you will partner with the extended marketing and commercial teams to identify content marketing opportunities, develop those into marketing assets, and distribute newly created assets through various marketing campaigns to build awareness and generate leads. Maintaining focus on key performance indicators, including content engagement across distribution channels, will be critical to your success.

To really excel in this position, you must be a passionate marketer and communicator who has the capacity to understand and distill scientific concepts into creative and compelling marketing content to engage your audience.

Whats in it for you

You will get to work alongside a small yet agile team of smart, creative and driven marketers in the cutting-edge field of long-read sequencing. What we do on a daily basis helps scientists better understand the world we live in and, in many ways, helps them make it a better place to live.

Responsibilities of this position include:

Conduct review of current existing marketing collateral, identify any gaps, and develop content creation plan
Support Market Segment content development for conference and trade show activities as needed
Conceptualize and deliver case studies, newsletter content, and social media content across Market Segments
Create marketing and promotional materials concepts, both print and electronic, and consult with designer on layout
Copywrite, edit, proofread, and revise communications
Design and develop content for digital marketing campaigns, work with the Marketing Communications group on deployment and monitoring
Research media coverage and trends
Develop fresh story ideas for discussion with external PR agency
Organize webinars of invited speakers
Support Sales and field teams with meeting materials
All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional tasks and responsibilities.

Requirements:

2+ years of experience in life science marketing
Significant knowledge and experience with Plant and/or Animal research markets preferred
Direct experience in the genomics or sequencing field is a plus
Experience in content generation aimed at the scientific research community
Strategic thinking, but also able to execute on plans
Excellent communication and proven writing skills
Highly motivated, self-starter who can work with minimal supervision
Strong team player is required to work within a small team and contribute to the positive team spirit
Ability to prioritize tasks for highest efficiency
Scientific background or degree required, with advanced degree preferred
This position is located at PacBio headquarters in Menlo Park, California
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability, gender identity, and sexual orientation.

MRI Software is seeking a Vice President of Occupier Solutions to join our growing organization! The Vice President of Occupier Solutions will be responsible for developing and managing a suite of Integrated Worksplace Management (IWMS) solutions serving the corporate occupier market. We are looking for someone with corporate occupier real estate experience to help drive this arm of our business. This position will be responsible for increasing MRI’s market share and leadership position in a strategic growth market for the business. This team member will partner with product development, marketing, sales, customer service and other shared services to ensure execution of the go-to-market strategy and achievement the company’s financial and market penetration goals. The initial focus will be on growing MRI’s share in the US, UK and Australian markets.

Key Responsibilities:

BUSINESS MANAGEMENT
Create and maintain business plan to grow MRI’s position and market share in the corporate occupier sector
Develop and maintain a high level of expertise regarding business-line, competitor and industry-related products, pricing practices and trends and be the voice of the market to the business unit
Promote market awareness, thought leadership and growth through public speaking engagements, webinars and written content creation
PRODUCT MANAGEMENT
Oversee product strategy and roadmaps to support the business plan and commercial objectives
Work closely with the business, technology, marketing and sales teams to review current product offerings for expansion and/or enhancement and design new products to round out MRI’s IWMS offering and capture greater share of wallet among current clients
Develop best-in-class user experience and product roadmaps across all of MRI’s occupier offerings
Work closely with Marketing on the occupier market brand strategy, launch of new offerings, marketing plan and sales enablement tools
Above all else, the ideal candidate will demonstrate strong leadership traits in setting a vision for the business unit and driving toward successful execution of that vision.

Key traits include:
Ability to drive product concepts from strategy to execution on the development and delivery of new products and services to the business
Demonstrated success managing a large and diverse portfolio of products across the product management life-cycle from new product introduction to product retirement and sunsetting
Approaches strategy and product management with a P&L mindset – owning the entirety of the proposition and displaying a sense of true business ownership
Understanding of product best practices and the ability to bring products to market; expertise in full lifecycle product development, management and marketing
Experience Required:
Thorough understanding of the corporate occupier real estate industry
10+ years of experience in product management and leadership with demonstrated expertise in accounting, lease management and/or IWMS software
Understanding of product management and product development best practices
Thorough knowledge of business systems and technology concepts with the ability to apply towards solving complex business users’ needs
Demonstrated success managing a P&L and achieving financial targets
Demonstrated success at driving innovation in a dynamic environment using analytical and quantitative skills
MRI Software delivers innovative applications and hosted solutions that free real estate companies to elevate their business. Our flexible technology platform, along with an open and connected ecosystem, allows us to meet the unique needs of real estate businesses, from property-level management and accounting, to investment modeling and analytics for the global commercial and residential markets. With nearly five decades of expertise and insight, we have grown to include offices in across the United States, the United Kingdom, Hong Kong, Singapore, Australia, South Africa, New Zealand, Canada, Ireland, and India, with over 1600 team members to support our clients and their unique needs!

Job Description:
Introduction


Allina Health is dedicated to the prevention and treatment of illness and enhancing the greater health of individuals, families and communities throughout Minnesota and western Wisconsin. A not-for-profit health care system, Allina Health cares for patients from beginning to end-of-life through its 90+ clinics, 12 hospitals, 16 pharmacies, specialty care centers and specialty medical services that provide home care, senior transitions, hospice care, home oxygen and medical equipment, and emergency medical transportation services. Allina Health is a vibrant, growing organization with opportunities to suit your professional skills and a diverse work environment to match your specific interests. We believe employees are our greatest asset and are dedicated to helping you develop and maximize your professional skills.

The Commons, located in Minneapolis, is the headquarters of Allina Health, a not-for-profit health care organization serving patients and communities. Approximately 1,600 corporate and administrative service employees work at offices within Midtown Exchange, the site of the historic Sears retail complex at Chicago Avenue and E. Lake Street. This community landmark, adjacent to the campus of Abbott Northwestern Hospital, part of Allina Health, is the second largest building in Minnesota and includes offices, an internationally themed public market and residential units.

Responsibilities

Req ID: 62440

Sr. Copywriter is responsible for bringing the Allina Health brand to life through creative and inspirational copywriting. They will translate the exceptional work we do to create engaging, sharable and searchable content for our audiences with a focus on acquiring and retaining patients.

The Sr. Copywriter will be working closely with our digital teams to optimize our websites, social media and shareable content. They will also produce guides, templates and research that appeal to our target markets, working closely with internal and external thought leaders and SMEs. They will lead content planning, messaging and branding initiatives, content creation and delivery. This includes driving content across multiple platforms and formats to drive awareness, engagement, leads and retention. In addition, your copy should be curated to serve multiple diverse audiences in different life stages, races, interest groups, etc.

To be considered for this position, please submit three writing samples with your resume or a link to your portfolio.

Copywriting
Creates content that can cascaded numerous deliverables an channels including print and digital channels, webinars, executive presentations, email series and other advertising deliverables.
Presents work to internal customers.
Works directly with key leaders, physicians and subject matter experts.
Ensures content is on brief, aligned with best practices and brand standards.
Content Strategy and Creative Concepting
Manages and maintains editorial plans, calendars and content.
Acts as an expert for existing and emerging trends for our audience and channels.
Assists in the development of customer journeys and personas.
Plays a key role in the creative brief process with the ability to understand and translate marketing/strategic briefs and customer research into engaging creative concepts that support business objectives and goals.
Leads the copywriting concepting process.
Pitches work to internal and external stakeholders.
Brands Standards Support
Understands and champions brand standards. Takes a lead role the ongoing development and enhancement of the brand with a specific focus on brand voice.
Manages and maintains the style guide, message maps and brand standards.
Monitors brand application on individual and team projects to ensure consistency across all channels of communication.
Reinforces user-centered best practices and serves as a mentor for the team.
Provides best practice guidance and training to internal and external partners for effective visual design to raise the bar for the Allina Health brand identity.
Mentoring
Supports and mentors junior members of the content team.
Demonstrated ability to coach/cross train other team members in emerging trends and content marketing principles.
Education
Bachelors degree in English, Communications, Journalism or similar. Masters degree preferred.
Qualification/Skills
5+ years of experience as a B2C Content Writer, Copywriter or similar
2-3 years of experience in content strategy
Experience with content and channel optimization, SEO, storytelling and audience segmentation.
Experience doing research using multiple sources and writing for a range of audiences.
Experience in health literacy.

Position Summary:

Jewish Family & Children's Service seeks a creative, data-driven and results-oriented leader to oversee the strategy, implementation and management of JF&CS marketing, public relations and communication program. Reporting to the Chief Advancement Officer, this role is responsible for building awareness and support for JF&CS's wide range of human service programs, in order to drive philanthropy, fee-based revenue, client impact, and community support. The Director of Marketing will provide leadership, strategic vision and direction to a small team of marketing and communication professionals while also being a key hands-on contributor. The successful candidate will have a proven track record of success and bring expertise in multi-channel platforms, promoting diverse service lines and an ability to both manage and roll up their sleeves. With over $26 million in revenue, 40 programs, and 14,000 clients, JF&CS is a complex agency, and this highly visible position offers a unique combination of marketing challenge and social impact. This position works across the agency and with external partners, participates as a key business leader on organization-wide strategic priorities, and works closely with the agency's top executives. JF&CS provides an opportunity to innovate and work creatively in a mission driven and family-oriented culture.

Your workday will include:
Overseeing the planning, development and implementation of all marketing and communications, including social media, print and digital content, website, email marketing, public relations, newsletters, collateral and advertising.
Responsibility for agency internal communications and intranet content.
Developing agency-wide messaging, as well as plans and campaigns for particular programs, working closely with program directors as well as agency executives.
Measuring, tracking and analyzing marketing results to inform effective decision-making.
Ensuring that brand identity, messaging and marketing and communications strategy are infused in all organizational efforts.
Overseeing the daily activities of the Marketing Department including budgeting, planning and staff development.
Managing a small staff of 2 communications associates and 1 senior designer; set performance goals and conduct annual performance reviews.
Promoting a culture of entrepreneurship, high performance and continuous improvement, and develop staff using a supportive and collaborative approach.
Developing and overseeing all media relations including acting as agency liaison as needed.
Serving as the organization's lead writer and editor for a range of internal and external communications.
Supporting the Chief Advancement Officer in the development and implementation of departmental and organization strategic goals and objectives.
Maintaining strong relationships with key internal and external partners, including board-level contacts.
Building strong relationships across the organization to stay current on our wide range of programs and to infuse an awareness of marketing and messaging in all of our work.
What can you bring to this position?
A Bachelor's degree is required although a Master's degree/MBA is preferred.
A Minimum of 8 years of experience in managing marketing and communications to advance an organization's mission and goals, including experience in complex organizations with multiple services or products.
Your demonstrated skills, knowledge and experience in the design and execution of marketing and communications activities.
Exceptional writing, editing and story-telling skills.
High competence in Google analytics and other performance measurements.
Excellent collaboration skills'an ability to work proactively and effectively with a wide range of stakeholders.
Experience overseeing the design and production of email and print materials and publications, website management, digital/social media content creation and management, and public relations.
Strong budgeting and cost-management skills'an ability to maximize impact with a limited budget.
Strong listening skills, combined with effective, articulate, and persuasive public speaking.
Experience in building, mentoring, and coaching a team of marketing and communications specialists.
Your excellent judgment and creative problem-solving skills, including negotiation and conflict resolution.
Experience working with media outlets and handling crisis communications.
An ability to work independently and responsibly while managing numerous projects simultaneously.
An interest in and commitment to JF&CS's human service mission!
Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

We acknowledge and respect the fundamental value and dignity of all individuals and are committed to creating and maintaining an environment that is welcoming of all and celebrates the uniqueness of those we serve, staff, volunteers, donors, and business partners.

About Lastline

Lastline, Inc. is a venture backed cybersecurity company that provides innovative AI-powered network security products that detect and defeat advanced threats attempting to enter and operate within a network. We protect: network, email, cloud, and web infrastructures, minimizing the risk of damaging and costly data breaches with fewer resources and at a lower cost. Headquartered in San Mateo, California with offices throughout North America, Europe and Asia, Lastline's technology is used by Global 5000 enterprises, is offered directly and through resellers and security service providers, and is integrated into leading third-party security technologies worldwide. www.lastline.com

THE JOB:

We are looking for a Vice President (VP), Product Marketing to join our core Marketing team. As VP, Product Marketing you will be responsible for planning, implementing and managing our overall global product marketing strategy reporting directly to the Chief Marketing Officer.

In addition, you will lead a small team of marketers and consultants responsible for the messaging and content creation surrounding our product offering. As a subject matter expert, you will lead other functional groups in programs that will continue to build brand awareness and accelerate demand for Lastline security solutions. You'll be a key marketing security leader within the company and your work will have a direct impact on establishing Lastline as a leader in Network Detection and Response (NDR). You will be the primary link between the Product, Sales and Marketing teams and will own the strategic and tactical build out of our Product Marketing strategy and delivery.
Develop Product Marketing Strategy;
Make data-driven decisions to hit company goals;
Work closely with Finance, Product Management and Sales on our pricing, messaging, promotion and selling of our products;
Work closely with Product Management to keep the company up-to-date with market trends and competition;
Serve as an evangelist for our products and the Network Detection and Response (NDR) space through thought leadership and blogging, social media, and speaking
THE SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL BE REQUIRED TO HAVE:
BA/BS in similar discipline or equivalent working experience (Master's degree preferred)
15+ years of experience with Product Marketing and or Product Management
Experience with determining product-market fit and delivering products to the market
Leadership experience
A highly analytical approach
Ability to lead and effectively communicate cross-functionally with engineering and other departments
Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
We are looking for a passionate, dedicated individual who is looking to work in a distributed team and wants to get stuff done. If this sounds like a match for you and what you are looking for, please apply. We'd love to hear from you!

Job Summary

This is a work-from-home roll-up-your sleeves and get it done senior marketing consulting position.

Marketing Strategists at SmartBug Media have an important role serving as the liaison between your Client and SmartBug Media, as well as overseeing all activities required to help those Clients meet their goals and objectives. This means youll play a lead role in executing inbound and content marketing activities that include blogging, social media, marketing, SEO and marketing automation while leading Client communication and education. Youll also be responsible for analyzing each Clients marketing analytics, creating reports and recommending future strategies and tactics.

We know your leadership is what generates renewal business and increased trust and responsibility with our clients. That's why our Marketing Strategists are compensated for account growth and incremental revenue brought in. That doesn't make this a sales position. It's not. It means that you get to participate in the financial growth of your accounts.

Responsibilities and Duties
Create the vision and marketing strategy for your clients, then work with your team of consultants, copywriters, designers and developers to deliver on that strategy and vision.
Create new clients Inbound Marketing Playbook and Gap Analysis based on client and customer interviews, research and collaboration with our team.
Serve as the primary liaison and representative of SmartBug Media for your clients you are the extension of their team and will be expected to know their business as well as they do.
Assist and empower clients with the results, knowledge, content and tools to not only get their buy-in, but to evangelize their success through their organization.
Become an expert at inbound marketing tactics including blogging, social media marketing, search engine optimization, eBook/white paper/video content creation, website updates, email marketing, and others.
Become a HubSpot and SmartBug process ninja and keep up with software updates and best practices, educating your teammates as required.
Execute your clients inbound marketing plans proactively in order to meet schedules, performance, and budget goals.
Take the lead in creating monthly performance reports to highlight wins, areas of improvement and recommendations for future programs.

Job Description:
NYC or Remote

Haven Life is an insurtech innovator at MassMutual that offers a new way to get life insurance online that's actually simple.

We combine the culture of a startup with the stability and backing of a Fortune 500 company to create an environment that's truly unique.

Our diverse team is comprised of smart, collaborative people who think big, execute quickly and don't take themselves too seriously. We're located in New York's Flatiron District and in case you're wondering, yes, we provide free snacks. Cold brew too.

If you're creative, professional and kind, we'd love to hear from you.

ABOUT THIS ROLE:

We're a MassMutual-owned company with a new product that started in 2016. We are looking for someone to enhance and revamp our virtual knowledge base so customers will actively seek our online, self-directed, learning portal because of the immense value the portal provides. To create such an environment, you will need to fully understand what drives customer behavior to self-serve, the customer experience, frequently asked questions and common issues.

Although you don’t need the technical knowledge depth of a Developer Support Engineer, you need to be tech-savvy and interested in the DevOps world and jargon. You also need to be creative, proactive, have a bunch of ideas about how to improve our KB infrastructure and architecture and excited about the purpose of content serving knowledge. An output of your creativity and content creation/curation should be an active reduction in customer support center calls and an environment that shows active engagement.

Individuals must be able to format articles, content, videos and the like so that they appear in a professional manner on Zendesk's Guide site. Must be proficient in writing in US English. We plan on having 200-300 articles by the end of the year 2020, so you are expected to edit/write about 1-2 articles a day. You will be gathering information on the articles from communications with our developers, from reviewing tickets, listening to voice calls, and testing our software. The job would involve reformatting existing documents into Zendesk Guide as well as creating your own documents.

SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
3+ years of direct experience in a similar position
Create standards and best practices for writing and publishing processes
Redesign customer care's current knowledge base content and enhance Covepath’s end-user web support experience
Work with subject matter experts to develop content that addresses customer needs
Document customer support policy and procedures
Develop ideas on optimizing our knowledge base content (adding video casts, engaging landing pages, etc.)
Contribute to creating internal documentation for training and agent job aid reference
Proven project management, multitasking & prioritization skills
PREFERRED SKILLS
Content Management experience preferably from a SAAS company in the
Life insurance industry experience

BENEFITS:

Our salary structure is commensurate with experience. In addition, you will be eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits program including medical insurance and 401(K).

EO Products is a company with one mission and two brands: to create healthy personal care products that nurture the people who use them, respect the people who make them, and honor the planet we all share. We work hard to ensure our values come to life in each bottle of EO® and Everyone for Every Body® products.

We have been family owned, operated, and independent since 1995. We call Northern California home and manufacture our essential oil-based products in-house at our certified organic factory and HQ. You can find us at Whole Foods, Sprouts, Target, Walmart, Amazon, and many other retailers throughout the US and in 11 other countries.

Were a certified B Corp, meaning we are a for-profit business that operates like a nonprofit. B Lab recognizes EO Products as a company that prioritizes people, planet, purpose, and profit in that order.

We are a diverse and passionate team of free-thinking, soap-loving individuals.

As EO Products' Marketing Coordinator you will be responsible for content and campaigns for the internal Brand Studio. You will join a diverse team of writers, designers, marketers and product developers to plan an integrated content calendar that helps our brands engage with our customers.

Success in this role requires an understanding of how our brand messaging relates to the customer experience across digital and retail channels. You will need to understand our brands hero products and understand our brand ethos and core values. You will partner with channel owners to plan integrated campaigns that align with our marketing objectives, reporting on the the impact to engagement and sales. This position will be responsible for growing engagement rates across channels.

Specific Responsibilities include:

Integrated Marketing
Develop content strategy and messaging themes based on brand identity and seasonal business objectives of EO and Everyone
Own integrated marketing calendar, working with channel owners across sales, ecom and EOX retail store to align message and timing
Lead Brief writing and approval/alignment for major seasonal 360 campaigns, including the 360 comms planning for Everyone rebrand
Spark innovative content themes via monthly pitch process to keep our content fresh and ownable (in our brand voice)
Project Management
Partner with Brand Studio Production team to develop timelines for campaigns and product launches. Assign and monitor tasks in our project workflow tool (Asana).
Keep up to date with agile processes, serving as marketing point person for each design sprint.
Support agencies with assets and product sampling, partnering with CS and Ops for quality and timely response to Media and PR product requests
Community Engagement
Serve as point person for local Sponsorships, in kind donations and community partnerships.
Develop recommendations for evolving local strategy to a national strategy aligned to each brands vision and mission.
Please apply if you have:
Marketing education in the form of a Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience
1-2 years experience with social media & community or relevant internship or coursework
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Excel & Word
A passion for consumer products
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Ability to understand engagement metrics/data and communicate trends
Excellent time-management and organizational skills
Flexibility and composure under pressure
Excitement and adaptability when it comes to new strategies and platforms
Comfortable presenting insights and learnings to leadership and greater team
We offer a fun, casual place to work & grow, vacation, medical, dental, matching 401k, profit sharing bonus and employee discounts. Our company culture values responsibility, collaboration, integrity and passion. We've been named Best Places to Work by the North Bay Business Journal. The Marketing Project Coordinator provides on-site, internal support to the Marketing department, to help move projects forward, keep to deadlines, and prioritize tasks and time / resource management. The Marketing Project Coordinator’s primary responsibilities are to assist the Marketing team in organizing ongoing projects and manage project timelines from inception to approval. This involves monitoring project plans, schedules, follow-up, including our internal regulatory approval process, and any outside partner and vendor relationship management. The Project Coordinator ultimately ensures project deadlines and expectations are met in a timely manner.

About Us

Ambry Genetics Corporation is a CAP-accredited and CLIA-licensed molecular genetics laboratory based in Aliso Viejo, California. We are a genetics-based healthcare company that is dedicated to open scientific exchange so we can work together to understand and treat all human disease faster.

At Ambry, everyone is welcome. A career at Ambry Genetics is a chance to be part of a dynamic company that aims to improve health by understanding the relationships between genetics and human disease. We earned our reputation as industry leaders by responsibly introducing cutting-edge genetic testing solutions and continually sharing what we learn with the global scientific community. We also support those with genetic conditions through the Mauli Ola Foundation and other nonprofit organizations. At Ambry you will be learning, challenging yourself, and having fun while collaborating with teammates through the open exchange of ideas.

Employees at Ambry Genetics have many perks, including an onsite café with complimentary smoothies and infused waters! We also offer access to gym memberships, onsite food trucks,“Lunch and Learns,” Pajama Days, Chili Cook-Offs and more. Our outstanding benefits program includes medical, dental, vision, 401k, FSA, generous paid time off (PTO) program, and flexible scheduling as determined appropriate. Ambry Genetics is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) and we maintain a drug-free work environment.

Ambry Genetics is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

You should be comfortable in an open, fluid, fast-growth environment and bring an energetic and creative approach to your work, spanning high-level strategy as well as in-the-trenches execution.

We’re looking for smart, prolific writers to join our team.

This role requires prolific content writing skills and the ability to craft the story of who we are, whom we serve, what we do and how we do it. ·
