Job Title: Associate Director/Director, Global Medical Affairs, Medical Communications
Job Description:
BioMarin is the world leader in delivering therapeutics that provide meaningful advances to patients who live with serious and life-threatening rare genetic diseases. We target diseases that lack effective therapies and affect relatively small numbers of patients, many of whom are children. These conditions are often inherited, difficult to diagnose, progressively debilitating and have few, if any, treatment options. BioMarin will continue to focus on advancing therapies that are the first or best of their kind.

Overview

Global Medical Affairs (GMAF) is an expert scientific and medical function that develops and maintains non-promotional, evidence-based, transparent and balanced scientific and educational programs and resources in support of BioMarins products and disease states of interest. We do this by assuring safe and appropriate product use, supporting continuous scientific exchange and through ongoing and new data generation.

The Medical Communications group is responsible for leading clinical and scientific data dissemination efforts across BioMarin Medical Affairs. Medical Affairs communications are a critical element in the dissemination of scientific and clinical data to broad audiences including healthcare providers, enabling them to provide the best possible care to their patients. As a program lead, the Medical Communications Associate Director / Director develops publication strategies and plans based on scientific knowledge gaps, and scientific messaging platforms based on cross-functional needs. The effective Medical Communications Associate Director / Director will perform in-depth statistical analyses, facilitate systematic literature analyses, and manage a team medical writers and/or graphic designers to deliver best-in-class messaging, abstracts, posters, oral presentations, and manuscripts.

Summary

The Associate Director / Director is an emerging leadership position in Medical Communications with substantial strategic input across Global Medical Affairs for assigned product(s) or therapeutic area(s). The Associate Director / Director will focus on shaping and defining scientific message platforms and related publication plans for assigned products, including synthesizing stakeholder input, ensuring alignment cross-functionally, and conducting gap analyses for defining the publication strategy. The Associate Director / Director will also lead content creation activities including oversight of authors and ensure compliance with all BioMarin publication processes. This position may also oversee the advancement and implementation of end-to-end publication process including publication management systems and tools, and training of end users. This position may be responsible for supporting Medical Communications functional leadership activities including managing staff, budgets, and departmental activities.

Responsibilities

Scientific Messaging Development
Identify key literature and high-impact resources from which scientific messages can be derived
Build/manage scientific messaging database to support cross-functional messaging needs
Monitor relevant literature on an ongoing basis to update existing messages or develop new messages
Review cross-departmental materials to ensure alignment with scientific messaging database
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to identify novel messaging needs/gaps; ensure identified gaps are represented in strategic publication plan


Publication Strategy and Planning
Lead regular publication planning meetings to ensure organizational alignment on timelines, strategies, and gaps
Analyze current messaging database and published literature to identify gaps in scientific knowledgebase; ensure identified gaps are represented in strategic publication plan
Collaborate with BioMarin stakeholders to facilitate the development of publication concepts that address identified gaps
Oversee planning and development of manuscripts with foci on scientific research, clinical study outcomes, health economic and outcomes research, value and access issues, stakeholder education, and more
Provide global Medical Communication support to the expanding scope of Worldwide Research and Development activities


Publication Content Creation
Research, draft, and edit scientific and medical manuscripts, abstracts, posters, and presentations; incorporate author and reviewer comments
Manage agency and/or contract medical writers and/or statistical programmers, as needed
Oversee required graphic design for publications
Ensure all medical communications outputs meet the highest standards of medical/scientific integrity
Ensure appropriate adherence to authorship and publication guidelines as stipulated by BioMarin operating procedures, ICMJE, and GPP3
Work closely with biometrics, clinical science, research, and other colleagues to ensure timely collation, interpretation, and reporting of data to support publication plans; perform or facilitate data reviews as needed


Publication Process, Systems, & Reporting
Oversee the strategic consideration and appropriate internal review of new abstract/publication concepts; ensure compliance with all documentation steps
Oversee the daily maintenance of all publication records in Publication Management system; perform periodic audits to determine completeness of records and level of compliance with industry guidance; use the results to identify potential areas for process improvement
Ensure all published works are recorded, disseminated internally, and used to derive new scientific messages
Represent all publications in development and key forums for review and approval; maintain compliance with BioMarin publication processes and guidelines
Maintain and optimize publication management systems, including keeping user, drug, research, and study information up to date; maintaining workflow and email templates; managing built-in filtering and reporting capabilities; and monitoring integration with the internal publication review and approval systems
Manage the Medical Communications internal webpages including informational content, usage reporting, file structures, and permissions
Support preparation of Sunshine Act reports through compliant and consistent documentation practices


Publishing
Execute publication graphic design of figures and tables in Microsoft and Adobe, including incorporation of subsequent change requests
Compile materials required for electronic abstract and manuscript submissions
Copyedit manuscripts, abstracts, posters, and presentations for grammar, spelling, layout, data accuracy, correct citations, and alignment with pre-specified formats and industry standards
Arrange for payment of Open Access and other publication-related fees


Congress / Convention Management
Lead regular planning meetings to ensure organizational alignment on congress submission timelines, strategies, and gaps
Work closely with biometrics, clinical science, research, and other colleagues to ensure timely collation, interpretation, and reporting of data to support congress activities
Develop and maintain yearly congress calendars
Manage all aspects of scientific poster or presentation development
Support identification and confirmation of presenting authors, as needed
Contribute and implement ideas for improving poster development process
Develop tracking spreadsheet for each congress
Manage printing/shipping logistics for posters; presentation formatting and transfer logistics for presentations
Develop Congress Cards as needed to provide dates, times, and locations of posters and presentations
Functional Leadership
Serve as the Publication lead to the Research and Early Development function and Gene Therapy Franchises and oversee the other Medical Communications employees supporting this franchise
Respond to internal and external questions about any publications for product area
Participate in cross-functional team meetings to share publication planning status and issues and maintain awareness of overall product publication plan
Lead and/or contribute to functional improvement initiatives for the MSL team
Oversee the development and maintenance of Medical Communications work instructions
Provide support for management of the Medical Communications budget, including maintenance of the day-in, day-out accounting.
Education & Experience
BA/BS in life or health sciences; Advanced degree (MS or doctoral) preferred
10 or more years of relevant experience in medical communications, publication planning and/or medical writing
5 or more years managing a team of direct reports
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Title: Sales Enablement - Virtual Community Teams Specialist

JOB DESCRIPTION

As a Virtual Community Teams Program Manager on our Go-to-Market Enablement team, you will be responsible for supporting global program execution with a focus on developing vibrant, engaging communities of interest for our Virtual Teams program. Program initiatives range from curating industry sales content to employing best practice community engagement strategies to coordinating targeted industry summits, spanning various industries and functions that the Go-to-Market organization serves.

You are a motivated self-starter excited to work with cross-functional team members and sales account teams to collaborate and execute against a program scope, with day to day support and direction from your manager. Job Title: Online Community Manager - Higher Logic Experience Preferred
Job Description:
ONLINE COMMUNITIES AND SOCIAL CHANNELS MANAGER
The American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) serves more than 53,000 members in the U.S. and around the world. With more than 175 talented employees, our organization places tremendous value on the contributions, expertise and knowledge that each one brings to our table. Our Schaumburg, Illinois headquarters is home to member support, education, marketing and operational functions, while colleagues in Washington D.C. advocate on behalf of patients, physician anesthesiologists and the specialty. Thanks to our positive, supportive work environment, ASA has been named one of Chicago's Best & Brightest Companies to Work For® and ASA was also named one of the Best and Brightest Companies to Work For in the Nation® for the last three years. As we continually seek to strengthen the organization, we welcome individuals who are competent, innovative, motivated and agile. If this sounds like you, please consider reaching out!
Position Summary:
The Online Communities and Social Channels Manager position is responsible for setting strategic direction and leading the strategic use of the ASA’s internal and external online social channels -- with particular emphasis on ASA’s member-focused online communities, as well as public platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube, etc. With the guidance and direction of the Marketing and Communications Executive, and in robust collaboration with member and staff leadership, this position will build and grow meaningful engagement across these platforms. They are responsible for communicating, generating buy-in and understanding, and upholding the strategic approach and tactical implementation.
Primary Position Responsibilities:
· As a key component of the organizational communication strategy, develop and execute social channel strategy to uphold best practices and generate positive member engagement, desired action and participation through internal and external social communication channels. Includes primary focus on ASA member-facing online communities, as well as responsible and progressive use of public platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube, etc.
· Establish and maintain strategic ownership of the ASA-branded online community platform, driving selection, adoption, training, administration, and vendor management. Facilitate input and guidance from key, high-level member stakeholders and collaborate with Digital Product Management and Information Technology teams to ensure appropriately consistent look and feel, and functionality and user experience meets expectations and needs.
· Advise on content strategy. Initiate, curate, and develop audience-focused, on-brand, format-appropriate content for social channels, considering message priorities and business needs and goals. Create multimedia content elements including imagery, video, audio, copy and interactive components to effectively deliver compelling messages.
· Work in close partnership with Marketing and Communications and Public Relations teams to integrate social channels in all communication and promotional plans. Manage paid social advertising (in concert with organic social efforts) to reach campaign goals and organizational objectives. Consult various business units on the appropriate use of social channels for sub-brands.
· Manage ASA’s day-to-day social presence and tactics on all appropriate channels. Develop and implement audience engagement plans for ASA online communities. Test and recommend enhancements and adoption of new approaches for content and customer/audience interaction and engagement.
· Identify opportunities to leverage online communities and public social channels to forward the work and foster participation of the committees or other governance bodies through close collaboration with Governance and Membership teams, committee liaisons and high-level member leaders.
· Serve as moderator of key online communities, actively engaging with members to motivate their participation and user-generated content, to maximize their experience. Provide moderator training, coaching and guidance to other staff and member leaders who are aligned with specific online communities.
· Build efficient workflows for planning, managing, publishing online content in support of message priorities, business needs and goals, and promotional campaigns. Establish necessary processes and maintain centralized calendar for content management and publication.
· Mine social conversations as marketing research opportunity to understand key issues, needs, motivations and challenges for key audiences, as well as to identify competitive threats and public relations concerns and opportunities. Define escalation practices and roles.
· Determine, drive and report on Key Performance Indicators, including metrics for engagement and utilization and competitive activity. Communicate performance in meaningful ways for various staff and member audiences.
· Uphold best practices and stay abreast of innovations in the social and online community space.
Position Qualifications:
· Bachelor’s degree in related field required.
· Minimum 5 years of related experience.
· Minimum 3 years of hands-on management and implementation of internal organization- or company-branded online social communities within a member or customer-forward organization, with progressive growth in activity and engagement.
· Minimum 3 years of hands-on management and implementation of external social media communications with progressive growth in activity and engagement and demonstrated application of content creation and curation.
· Experience with online data reporting and social publishing tools. Exhibits strong technical understanding and adopts new tools without hesitance.
· Association experience desired. Understanding of governance and experience working with member leadership helpful.
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills and professionalism required. Ability to communicate with a variety of stakeholders, including key executive staff and member leaders, requiring a high level of finesse and diplomacy.

Position Summary:
As Content Creator, you will serve as the official videographer and photographer for all things Cardone Ventures, capturing mission-based objectives and unexpected moments in all facets of the business. Imagine traveling from NYC to Miami and back to Vancouver capturing clients and amazing crew members throughout our company. This is not your typical job and we’re not looking for your typical candidate. If you are an expert conversationalist and enjoy translating everyday stories into captivating media assets, then this role is for you.
You will lead the creation of Cardone Ventures content through videography, photography and graphic editing helping to share with consumers the numerous ways in which we live our mission and purpose throughout the organization every day. To succeed in this role, you must be passionate, fast paced and easily adapt to change.
About Cardone Ventures:
This company operates nationally and is growing by the day. You’ll be an integral part of our growth as you help to streamline existing recruitment and HR processes. You will enjoy working for a true leader in the industry alongside a very supportive team of business professionals. Our core values are the backbone of our business; we are inspirational, accountable, transparent, disciplined, intentional, and results oriented.
Performance Objectives:
Bring to life all the ways we are living our mission – there are wonderful things happening across the organization everyday with all our clients, partners and shareholders and you’ll have the opportunity to capture this in video and photography.
Create daily social media content in collaboration with our Associate Marketing Manager, Community Manager, and external content partners
Build rich storytelling content around what makes Cardone Ventures so special and drives revenue for our clients.
Embrace all stakeholders (executives, team members, clients) and share stories about how that are online with our business strategy and values.
Immerse yourself in the business and our like-minded interests in order to be an effective brand evangelist
Develop an ongoing and constantly updated robust asset library of brand content – video, photography and copy - for uses across website, social media, email newsletters and blogs
Establish deep understanding of our mission-based communications plans and key relationships across the organization
Develop a process and organization structure for all media assets.
Capabilities/Key Competencies:
Ability to work in various settings (office, airplanes and conferences), in a wide variety of capacities and get your hands dirty
Proficient in Gsuite, Adobe Suite, Final Cut, Premiere, Asana
Self-motivated and resourceful; wants to take initiative, sees a need and creates a solution
Excellent organizational skills, ability to prioritize and strong attention to detail
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to enthusiastically communicate with various functions at multiple levels in the organization both in-person and in writing
Willingness to travel regularly and work at events, evenings, and weekends if needed
Education & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or Communications preferred
Demonstrated success content creation and project oversight (3+ years)
Physical Requirements:
Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
Travel up to 60% of the time

Commitment to Diversity
As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates and partners.
If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, include the job title and source where you found this position in the subject line of your email to careers@cardoneventures.com. Already a Cardone Ventures candidate? Please connect directly with your recruiter to discuss this opportunity.

Everything we do is recorded, collected, mined, profiled, stored, targeted and sold. The balance of power has shifted to the cabal of tech giants and data miners who overtly or covertly control what you see, whom you connect with, what you read, click, and care about. Something has to be done! At Anonyome Labs, we are building the tools that shift control of your personal and private information from the big data miners back to you, the user. If you want to be a part of something innovative, challenging, meaningful and, most of all, something that mattersthen its time to talk.
Anonyome Labs is looking for a Content Development Specialist to conduct research, write and edit content, define and execute content strategies, and maintain an ongoing content calendar for the company. Were looking for someone who will help us expand our digital footprint and drive more value through online content. The ideal candidate should have a proven track record of producing pieces that increase engagement and drive customer acquisition. This position requires a high level of creativity, as well as the ability to use data-driven insights to write better material. The successful candidate should also be detail-oriented and committed to meeting tight deadlines.
You might be a fit for Anonyome Labs if
You are passionate about defending digital safety, security, and privacy.
You want to be part of a game-changing team, designing, and deploying radical new tools and systems.
You want to work with a team that has a deep personal investment in the success of its innovations.
You want to work at a company that is is privately funded and lead by some of the industrys most visionary leaders.
You want to work with a dream team of innovators with over 100 patents in cryptography, authentication, identity management, and network security under their belts.


Requirements:
Responsibilities
Content calendar execution across all media types for the company
Create content marketing campaigns to drive brand and product awareness
Use SEO best practices to generate traffic to websites and products
Regularly produce various content types, including social media posts, blog articles and white papers
Actively manage and promote our blog, and pitch articles to relevant third-party platforms
Edit content produced by other members of the team to drive consistency across our brand, voice, and messaging
Incorporate content marketing metrics into all campaigns to analyze and measure effectiveness
Collaborate with other departments to create innovative content ideas
Coordinate on cross-functional teams to determine content and training needs
Assess, test and document new and upcoming product features
Maintain and manage corporate style guide and terminology conventions
Coordinate with product management and engineering to execute content features into system
Execute internal processes to create documentation and content
Develop print, electronic and web communication to support company goals and client needs
Support company publications and information dissemination

Requirements
Bachelors degree in English, Journalism, Marketing or related field
+5 years experience in marketing related roles
Experience with digital marketing tactics, including SEO, ASO, social & content marketing campaigns, and measurement through analytics
Excellent writing skills, as well as the ability to communicate and collaborate effectively
The ability to consistently meet tight deadlines
At least three years of experience writing for consumers (B2C) or developer (B2B) audiences
Proven experience in editorial, education, learning science, publishing, or related cyber-security industries
Demonstrated experience developing a wide variety of content such as digital instructional materials and video scripts
Must be able to demonstrate effective supervisory skills
Excellent communication and writing skills with demonstrated ability to communicate complex ideas and projects in a straightforward way
Driven to seek data-supported decisions in creating instruction
Experience with Agile development methods is preferred
Understanding of,and ability to implement basic project management principles.
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously
Experience and proficiency using content management and creation tools including Microsoft Office, WordPress, and Adobe Suite.
Presentation and customer service skills
Ability to work independently and with a team

Finally, we expect you to score extremely high on our "Stuff That Matters":
BELIEVE: In the companys mission, in the team, and in your equity
ONE TEAM, ONE DREAM: We win together and lose individually
OK WITH AMBIGUITY: Comfortable making decisions with very little information
CURIOSITY: Seek out answers inside and outside the building
HUMILITY: Assume you dont have all the answers and seek to understand
BIAS TO ACTION: When in doubt, DO SOMETHING NOW
OWNERSHIP: When in doubt, TAKE IT ON.

Join Rally Health as a Senior Product Content Manager where you and the team will oversee the user experience in the Rally digital platform (suite of web and mobile apps). Work with the Marketing Product Content Manager in the planning, development and production of Subaru brand and carline materials, including but not limited to, vehicle still and action photography, running footage, long and short format video content, product and in-vehicle technology awareness videos such as 'How To' videos, interactive digital content and modules, long and short format print such as showroom and pre-launch brochures, posters, etc.
Help to develop creative execution of awards and accolades (IIHS, KBB, etc.), news, and emerging technologies, such as EyeSight and STARLINK by working closely with respective area managers and specialists for each project.
Coordinate and communicate asset assessment needs and distribution of all platforms and their respective agency partners, meeting all deadlines. Review and proof all product materials, both print and digital, to ensure optimal user experience and understanding. Assist the team in ad-hoc marketing projects or needs, including but not limited to: presentations, reports, miscellaneous projects, etc.
Assist in managing budget details and tracking sheets; reconciling Subaru and Agency estimates vs actuals, manage the accuracy of all recoveries including cross-departmental charges and allocations, global asset sharing, and employee and retailer billings.
Required Skills and Abilities:
Must have excellent communication, project management, multi-tasking, and organization skills. Attention to detail and meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment is required. Advertising Production experience and/or Advertising Agency experience is a plus. This position requires a strong marketing and analytical background, problem solving ability and highly developed verbal and written communication skills. Must have a thorough understanding of the Subaru product line, as well as SOA national, regional, and retailer operations is needed. The position interacts with all levels of management, FHI staff, various advertising agencies and field operations. MS Office skills required.
Ability to give clear direction to agency partners on strategy, and clearly define the creative problem we need solved on various types of materials.
Able to lead teams on production and make sure that the content or assets being captured meet the strategic objective for Subaru, the marketing department, etc.
Ability to make decisions rooted in strategy and communication objective independently.

Bachelor's degree and 4-6 years of experience.

KWT Global is looking for Account Supervisors to work across some of our top financial services and technology accounts, covering a mix of both consumer and corporate briefs.

Additionally, this role is expected to help develop and close new business opportunities and to mentor junior staff.

Account Supervisor candidates must be able to:

Strategic Thinking & Planning
Ability to lead internal planning meetings and brainstorm sessions, creating structure and actionable next steps for those meetings
Develop annual client plans inclusive of big ideas and always-on opportunities
Assume responsibility for spearheading new opportunities with existing and prospective clients, securing appropriate senior input
Account Leadership
Seen by clients as day-to-day strategic lead, anticipating client concerns/needs and providing counsel across multiple accounts
Possess in-depth industry-sector expertise or good knowledge of more than one industry sector
Demonstrate ability to manage delicate situations with clients and teams
Manage all administration of accounts, advising management of all aspects of ongoing client work
Contribute to the mentoring and professional development of account staff
Business Development
Take responsibility for leading new business opportunities with prospective clients
Recognize new business/organic growth opportunities with existing accounts
Develop new business proposals and programs, scopes of work, etc.
Administrative
Participate in staff planning and management
Ensure client scopes of work are adhered to (e.g. billing schedule, etc.)
Support accountability for the financial aspects of accounts, including profitability and potential for bad debt
Be aware of actual team hours/assigned and able to make program adjustments to maintain profitable operation of accounts

Bachelor’s degree in public relations, communications, or related field
4+ years agency-based PR experience; must be socially and digitally savvy
Strong writing, presentation and analytical abilities
Proficient with Muck Rack/Cision, MS Office and Keynote
Able to work independently and as part of a team
Strongly motivated and proactive in nature
Organized and articulate thought leader

AAA Life is seeking a Senior Communications Specialist at our corporate headquarters in Livonia, MI! The Senior Communications Specialist will be responsible for the development of communications regarding highly visible corporate initiatives. The primary responsibility for this role will be to work extensively with subject matter experts to research and translate information into clear and engaging communications, and recommend strategies for content development and execute through strong storytelling. This role will serve as the point of contact for high-level company communication projects and oversee detailed communication plans. In addition, this role will obtain the appropriate approvals for communications, including from business stakeholders, clubs, state filing and compliance, and partner to create the design and final delivery of the communications.

Position Responsibilities
Responsible for writing highly visible communications that support our corporate and department goals. Work extensively with subject matter experts to research and translate information into clear and engaging communications. Translate corporate objectives into simple, straightforward, easy-to-understand copy.
Work with channel owners to identify objectives and oversee communication plans
Provide creative and innovative ideas for communications
Point of contact for leading communications and organizing meetings
Gain deep understanding of the company’s products, policies, services, and guidelines and distill these into easy-to-understand and connected communications on a wide variety of topics that supports the corporate strategy.
Recommend strategies for campaigns and content development that support our corporate objectives and execute strategies through strong storytelling.
Responsible for concept development including partnering with team members, ideation, drafting of concept briefs, and presentation in internal creative review meetings.
Provide editorial review and mentor with feedback for content produced by the corporate communications tem and club partners to ensure compliance with AP guidelines, brand standards and advertising rules.
Partner closely with designers to create collateral and new layouts for communications including PowerPoint presentations and documentation for corporate projects and customer facing collateral.
Lead multiple projects simultaneously and work closely with others both internally and externally to ensure communication projects are completed within desired timeframes.
Ability to respond quickly to time-sensitive communications.
Act as primary point of contact and lead detailed communication plans for communication projects such as executive communications, product launches, change management, and campaigns.
Identify and communicate urgent priorities and keeps all parts of the creative communication process on track to meet deadlines. Instill a sense of urgency in all efforts throughout the department.
Facilitate and obtain appropriate approvals for creative, including from clubs, business stakeholders, state filing and compliance. Lead negotiation and drafting of new copy for required changes. Maintain detailed list of required reviewers and document all approvals.
Provide final materials to channel owners for release to the audience. Provides direction on necessary changes and edits to existing marketing material as required business stakeholders
Maintain external and internal relationships
Coordinate multiple projects with tight deadlines
Other special projects as requested by management.
Required Skills
Achieves Results/Has Bias for Action - Achieves stretch results. Strong bias for action with sense of urgency and high energy. Practices collaborative working environment to achieve more.
Customer Focus - Has ability to look from customer’s view. Viewed as business partner by external and internal customers. Anticipates customer needs to ensure no barriers to doing business.
Uses Effective Communication Skills - Candid, clear and concise in communication. Effectively matches style, tone, and method to audience. Connects with intended audience. Manages communication and feedback within the organization.
Displays Team Orientation - Works collaboratively to achieve organization’s success.
Technical/Professional Skills - Strives to stay ahead of technical/professional expertise, is proactive, and inspires others to stay current in areas of technical expertise.
Required Experience
Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Communications, Marketing or related area.
Minimum of 7 years of content creation experience in various forms of written communications with an emphasis in marketing, research, and strong storytelling.
Exceptional storyteller, writer, and editor
Proficient in personal computer (PC) skills, including Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe Creative Suite (with a focus on InDesign)
Possess sharp writing skills while ensuring effective business positioning and correct technical content.
Proven clarity and creativity in various forms of communication
Ability to provide direction to the Creative team and vendors and produce quality work in a limited timeframe

Job Title: Manager, Knowledge Management Technical Operations and Process Sciences
Job Description:
Summary:

This position develops and manages the flow of key business-critical knowledge for Technical Operations and Process Sciences (TOPS). The candidate will partner with TOPS SMEs and IT to develop business processes and technical solutions to capture, evaluate, report, maintain, and share contents for Product Quality Lifecycle Management (PQLM), business competitive intelligence, technology initiatives, and the Technical Report system. Success in the role enables the organization to quickly adapt to industry and regulatory trends, maximize learnings from our process and product understanding, and make high quality and timely data-driven decisions.

This position reports to the V.P. of Process Sciences but the scope of work and impact extends to the broader TOPS organization. For some projects, the candidate will facilitate the business/governance process and work with content authors to manage the creation, flow, and sharing of information. For others, the candidate is responsible for content creation based on inputs from SMEs. Regardless of project scope, the objective of the position is to present information that is easily accessible and in an actionable manner to facilitate timely sharing and collaboration by stakeholders. Where appropriate this position will partner with IT Knowledge Management to pilot new capabilities or implement enterprise-wide solutions and provide connectivity to existing infrastructure such as Library & Information Services, Data Sciences Quality and Regulatory Information Management systems, etc.

Principal Responsibilities:
Manage the work flow for Product Quality Lifecycle Management. Facilitate the revision of guidance document set to reflect the current strategies for QTPP, CQA, Process Design Summary, Control strategy, and CPV. Work with Process Sciences and Product Quality leaders to develop a business process to create, review, approve, maintain, and update these lifecycle documents for Seattle Genetics’ clinical and commercial programs
Collect, organize and make industry trends and CMC competitive intelligence readily and promptly available to TOPS staff. Make effective use of modern collaboration tools to turn conference trip reports and impactful publications into useful competitive intelligence for consumption
Work with TOPS participants in industry consortia and interest/focus groups to report progress and outputs. Make effective use of modern collaboration tools to capture, collaborate and share information to TOPS
Work with Prior Knowledge Workgroup and Data Sciences to make summaries of development history and supportive data sets useful for implementation. Organize prior knowledge in a findable, accessible and updatable manner for functional area SMEs
Make visible all active technology development initiatives from Process Sciences, Small Molecule Development, MSAT and ASAT. Without creating unnecessary bureaucracy, organize and share information in manners to promote cross-functional collaboration and learning, foster creative problem solving, and reduce redundancies
Work with IT Enterprise Knowledge Management to improve the functions and user experience of our Technical Report System. Provide report templates wherever possible. Automate process of ingestion, publication, and notification where possible. Improve search function so it is comprehensive yet useful and intuitive to users. Eliminate wet signatures and make routing process for review and approval fast and simple
Required Qualifications:
B.S with 8+ years or Ph.D. with 2+ years in biotech/pharma industry with process development or manufacturing focus
Clear understanding of CMC drug development and technologies employed; familiar with current regulatory guidance and industry trends
Effective communicator utilizing various media
Skillful listener with an open style; good at facilitating discussion and balancing stakeholders
Good appreciation of customer needs
Creative (think outside the box) and self-motivated with strong problem-solving skills to overcome obstacles
Able to rapidly learn and apply new concepts, tools, and technologies
Excellent project management skills; able to make progress on multiple projects at once
Experience with Office 365 and SharePoint Online a plus
As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seattle Genetics is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. Benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage, group and supplemental life insurance, 401(k) with company match, tuition reimbursement, relocation assistance and much more. To learn more about Seattle Genetics, please visit www.seattlegenetics.com.

Seattle Genetics is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applications will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.

Job Description:
Who We Are:
Storyblocks is a subscription-based stock media service focused on empowering the creative community. We offer a suite of content - video, audio, and images - to fuel our mission of helping our customers create more moving stories. Storyblocks helps digital storytellers unlock their creative potential by providing beautiful stock videos, images, and music that fit with any budget. We are a member-driven company, serving over 200,000 content creators that range from prosumers to SMBs to studios and Fortune 500 brands. Our members can subscribe to our video, image or music libraries, or any combination of the three, to ensure they are able to be brilliant on any budget.
Who You Are:
We are looking for a Business Development Manager who brings exceptional commercial and analytical skills to join our team in the Washington, DC area. Storyblocks has very ambitious goals for 2020 and beyond and you will join a fast paced, scrappy, and creative team to help move the company and the industry forward!
What You'll Do:
Passion for practicing the art and science of sales at one of the fastest growing startups in the Washington, DC metro area
Consistently hit and exceed revenue targets
Partner with potential customers from the content creation software and film and tv production industry to understand their content needs and prescribe appropriate solutions
Research and report customer feedback and industry trends to internal stakeholders (product, engineering, marketing,)
Be a great teammate!
What You Bring to the Table:
5+ years of Sales / Account Management experience with a proven track record of developing opportunities, managing pipeline, and hitting numbers
Superior Commercial Skills: internal and external communication, ability to close deals, understanding of sales cycle and process, and experience with CRM systems
BA / BS from a leading University
Inclination to partner with SDRs to build robust opportunity and pipeline numbers
Knowledge of the stock industry, including licensing and indemnification
High degree of self motivation and drive
Experience with and knowledge of content creation software and applications such as Adobe, AVID, Giphy, Apple Pro, a plus
Relationships within and knowledge of the TV and film production industry, preferred
Proactive problem solver who operates effectively and independently, even in areas of uncertainty and ambiguity
Ready for everything, can do anything!
What We Bring To The Table:
Competitive and fair compensation - We believe in fair pay--equal pay for equal work. For each title, we have consistently applied competitive salary bands based on market data and benchmarks. What you’ve been paid before, fear of conflict, or willingness to negotiate does not play a part.
Company-paid medical - Our medical, dental and vision premiums are covered 100% for you and your dependents.
Paid parental leave - Welcoming new family members is exciting, but it can also be challenging. We offer twelve weeks paid leave for primary caregivers and four weeks for secondary caregivers. We have a dedicated private nursing room available to new mothers.
Unlimited vacation - At Storyblocks we take vacation seriously. That means take the time off when you need it. Don’t worry about tracking hours or accounting for partial days. Typically employees take about three or four weeks each year.
Flexible work-from-home options - Much of our workflow is online, and for meetings, we have dedicated video-conferencing setups. As long as you deliver results, you are welcome to get your work done outside of the office or during unusual times when desired.
Company-sponsored mentorship and growth - We have a formal mentorship program that involves regular career and growth conversations. “360-degree” feedback is collected twice a year and synthesized into actionable, peer-reviewed, performance reviews. We happily foot the bill for conferences and online courses that will add value to the organization. We encourage attending meetups and are happy to host them as well.
Casual Work Environment - Sure we all get dressed up once in a while, but in general we want you to be comfortable at the office – whatever that means to you (flip-flops, shorts, jeans, etc.).
Fully stocked kitchen - Everyone gets input on the food and drinks we stock in our shared refrigerators and snack room. We have multiple mechanisms for making coffee and cold-brew kegs are often on tap.
Dogs in the office - We love dogs and we will probably love your dog too. With help from a calendar, we allow employees to bring in their dogs to help guide us through the day.
Storyblocks supports workplace diversity and does not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

Do you believe that creators should have the ability to get paid for the value they give to their fans?

We do, which is why we're building Patreon, a platform that powers membership services for creators with established followings. Patreon strives to provide creators with insight, education, and tools that make it possible to retain creative control while running their creative business, so creators can focus on creating and energizing their fanbases.

Our user base has doubled in the last year alone, and we have paid over $1 billion directly to creators on our platform. In order to support this level of growth, Patreon is looking for a Video Producer and Editor to bring Patreon thought leadership content, creator stories and recorded events to life.

What you'll do

The successful candidate will
Be an excellent visual storyteller with the ability to shoot and edit footage to tell Patreon's story.
Manage and help build out Patreon's first in-house production studio, including managing rentals and booking locations
Maintain and improve the standard of video, animation and photography created at Patreon.
Oversee video production crew and content creation for owned and third party events
Manage agency or contractor video producers as necessary to scale creation of Patreon thought leadership content
Implement the right video hosting tool to track video ROI and align to broader campaign goals.
Create production estimates and manage production budgets, schedules and delivery.
Prepare concept treatments, storyboards and animatics/prototypes.
Work closely with creative colleagues and cultivate relationships with third party production companies for when production support is required.
Partner with the content, design and brand marketing teams to develop and execute our YouTube and related channel programming
Collaborate with our Legal Team on consent process and release forms for creators and patrons
Repurpose and edit video content for use in other mediums such as podcasts and social
About you
4-7 years experience in video production or related fields
Ability to self-shoot video content to broadcast standards
Ideally knowledge of, or experience in marketing technology subscription platforms
Experience interacting with Executives and Marketing Leadership
An analytical mindset, coupled with a healthy love of documenting plans and measuring outcomes
Experience with best-in-class video production technologies such as Adobe Premiere, Motion Graphics: Adobe After Effects, Photoshop, Illustrator, and Audio Editing: Adobe Audition
Adeptness at audio mixing, coloring and color correction
Experience in podcast production a plus
Understanding of the latest social media platforms and trends a plus
High energy and bias toward action -- with the execution skills to make it all count
How you'll grow
Your work will directly contribute to Patreon's mission and bottom-line goals.
You will have the opportunity to grow with the Creative function at Patreon and take on new projects as the organization grows.
You will build deep relationships across the organization.
You will be asked to draw and summarize insights.
You will get to interact with interesting and influential creators across a variety of creator categories.
You'll love working here if
You care about getting artists and creators paid
You work best in a highly collaborative environment
You're metrics-driven in your decision-making
You strive to improve existing processes
You want to work with teammates who excel at their jobs and have artistic talents
You are committed to challenging the status quo and make sure our culture at Patreon is among the most diverse and inclusive places to work
Who you'll work with:

At Patreon, you'll join a high-performing and highly-empathetic team of people who proudly work on fulfilling our mission of funding the creative class. Our culture of creator-first, thoughtful teammates keeps work creative, stretching, and rewarding.

Our Core Behaviors:
Put Creators First. Patreon is nothing without our creators.
Achieve Ambitious Outcomes. Set, measure, and accomplish goals that deliver massive value to our creators and patrons.
Cultivate Inclusion. We want an environment that retains and engages the diverse teams we build.
Bias Towards Action. When in doubt, we take the next best step, then course correct when needed. We go out of our way to fix problems when we see them. We take ownership seriously.
Be Candid and Kind. Be extremely caring and extremely direct in all you do at Patreon, especially when it comes to giving positive and constructive feedback.
Be Curious. You don't know it all, and that's the fun part. Everything gets better when you're curious. Things get more interesting, more clear, and more approachable. When you bring curiosity into the workplace, you're growing yourself, your teammates, and Patreon as a whole.
Want to learn more about Patreon?
Check out our reviews on Glassdoor
Check to see if you know a Patreon teammate on LinkedIn

A world leader in the field of in vitro diagnostics for over 55 years, bioMérieux provides diagnostic solutions that detect disease and contamination to improve patient health and ensure consumer safety. bioMérieux’s global headquarters is located in Marcy L’Étoile, France, and we have more than 11,200 team members in 43 countries. With our distributor network, we serve more than 160 countries. bioMérieux, Inc., our Americas division, has more than 4,000 team members across 12 sites or subsidiaries. Our Americas headquarters is in Durham, NC, with nearly 1,200 team members. bioMérieux, Inc. sponsors public health initiatives and partnerships to address antimicrobial resistance, sepsis awareness, food safety, and consumer health. Our passionate team members recognize the power of diagnostics and rally behind our mission to help save lives.



Engagement Program Manager
Location: Durham, NC
Position Overview:
This position is responsible for developing and executing initiatives, programs, and campaigns to drive positive experiences throughout the entire team member lifecycle. In this role, you will help team members remain informed and aligned with the Company’s vision, strategy and priorities; and will build team member advocacy driving active dialogue across the company, leading to greater inclusion and innovation. Working with a variety of stakeholders to shape messaging and ensure our people are informed, included and inspired, you’ll have the opportunity to innovate and bring new ideas to a dynamic organization that directly impacts public health. Ready to make a difference?
Job Responsibilities:

Create and execute comprehensive and sustainable team member engagement programs, including:
Serving as a project manager by designing, developing and implementing various team member engagement programs, campaigns and initiatives
Managing our team member engagement pulse survey and analyzing results to create innovative solutions to drive positive experiences and culture change
Facilitating regional discussions and optimizing feedback through these forums; and measuring and adapting programs, as needed
Develop and maintain an indexing tool to shape and drive engagement activities
Continually refreshing bioMérieux’ s internal team member engagement campaigns ensuring they are fun, unexpected, insightful and relevant
HR Business Interface (DARE)
Coordinate with and support Regional HR teams to promote, implement and facilitate team member events and programs aligned with the Team member Engagement strategy
Partner with Internal Communication to drive content creation for internal online content and quarterly all hands events
Partner with HR leadership to create and implement a HR branding strategy.
Report on key information (budgets, metrics and insights)
Team Member Experience (IMPACT)
Formalize team member outreach programs to ensure content and team member engagement programs
Collaborate with HR, recruitment and local management teams to support broad-based team member and manager programs, to include an effective team member onboarding program
Identify and recommend solutions to address issues related to the team member experience
Promoting recognition and rewards platform
Partner with Internal Communications to ensure consistency and alignment between internal and external messaging, activities and experiences
Education & Experience:
Required:
4 year degree in Human Resources or related field; and 4+ years of progressive HR experience
Project Management experience
Experience in HR Program development and execution
Strong facilitation, presentation, written/verbal communication skills, and experience working with cross-functional teams.
Proven ability to thrive in a high energy environment where tactical and strategic activities are expected to be driven in parallel
Proven track record of building collaborative and consultative partnerships
Ability to recognize leading indicators for communication and organizational change
Experience within a matrix environment
Ability to handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion
Expert Excel and PowerPoint proficiency
Ability to travel domestically 15%; infrequent international travel possible
Preferred:
MBA/MS/MA
HR Generalist Experience
Experience with Team Member Engagement & Recognition Platforms (ex: Culture Amp, Achievers, etc.)
Experience working with team members in multiple countries
bioMérieux is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer. M/F/Vet/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/GINA

Joining bioMérieux, is choosing to join an innovative company with a long term vision, committed to the service of public health and carried out with a humanistic corporate culture. Our Group offers numerous possibilities: so come and join the 11,200 bioMérieux employees who already identify with these values!

Nearest Major Market: Durham
Nearest Secondary Market: Raleigh

Job Title: Financial Content Creator - Brand Strategy & Communications
Job Description:
Overview


Ayco is an industry pioneer and preeminent leader of company-sponsored financial counseling services. We believe companies best serve their stakeholders and the greater economy when their employees’ financial lives are clear, understood and in their own control. For nearly 50 years, we’ve aspired to deliver a more productive and engaged workforce to our clients by providing their employees a path to financial well-being through holistic and personalized services tailored for each stage of the career cycle—from entry-level to C-suite.

Training: Ayco has a best-in-class new hire training program, covering the technical and practical elements of the job. Initial new hire training includes a combination of classroom learning, practical exercises, and shadowing of existing associates. Through Ayco and Goldman Sachs University, new hires have access to classes that focus on building foundational professional and technical skills, to culture and learning focused training. We take a personal approach to talent development and foster an environment that values different perspectives, challenges thinking and maximizes the potential of our people. Our annual and ongoing feedback ensures our people and their managers have the information they need to excel in their careers.

Diversity & Inclusion: Ayco values the different perspectives and experiences our associates bring. The firm supports the Ayco Diversity Network, an employee-led initiative open to all associates that provides education and awareness on topics of interest to diverse communities. In addition, our firm wide diversity and inclusion efforts expand professional and career development opportunities through programs such as the Women’s Advisor Initiative to support our commitment to having the best talent at all levels.

Benefits & Wellness: From benefits to wellness, we aim to support your commitment to your job as well as your priorities and interests outside of work.

Career Advancement: Ayco offers coaching, mentoring and on-the-job learning that supports your growth and development.

Visit Ayco.com/careers for more information about the firm.

Responsibilities


• Support firmwide business strategy and goals by generating content for digital and print campaigns to engage Ayco’s various audiences including clients, prospects and the public

• Work with head of group education content and strategy to develop and deploy engaging and accessible group education content

• Work with writing and design teams to coordinate production of content ideas and concepts

• Source and develop original content for articles, whitepapers, emails, videos, webinars and infographics, from inception to delivery, in partnership with the Brand Strategy and Communications team

• Develop and maintain close relationships with subject matter experts to gain timely insights into the needs and concerns of our target audiences, generate ideas and ensure all information is technically accurate

• Distill complex financial concepts and technical content created by subject matter experts into simple language that can be broadly understood

• Serve as a financial planning technical expert to the Brand Strategy and Communications team across all content production areas (public, client, prospect, media, etc.)

• Monitor content development and group learning industry trends and best practices to inform content that will resonate with Ayco’s various audiences

• Supplement Ayco’s organic content strategy with curated external content and content from other GS family brands

• Work with analytics resources to measure impact of content through surveys and other data collection methods to generate reports; use data and research to improve content

• Help drive and perpetuate the advancement of Ayco’s brand and communications strategies through thoughtful, innovative content approaches

Qualifications


• Bachelor’s degree required; major in finance, communications or marketing preferred

• Three years of financial planning experience, preferably with an investment advisor OR three years of financial writing or content development experience

• Ability to represent complex ideas across a spectrum of audiences and sophistication levels

• Strong ability to help visualize content in learning curriculum and other channels

• A self-starter and the ability to build strong relationships a must

• Financial designations (CFA, CFP, CMFC, CIMA, etc.) a plus

• Knowledge and experience with multi-channel (print, web, video) content a plus

• Strong time management skills with the ability to prioritize and multi-task in a fast-paced environment.

The Web and Digital Services Senior Specialist is responsible for the day-to-day management and support of the firm’s digital marketing channels, in particular, the website and email marketing platforms and their users. This role requires a high level of technical expertise and analytical strengths, as well as experience with website management and digital marketing tools.

The senior specialist sits within the marketing department, serving as a bridge between technology and the content creation process. The Web and Digital Services Senior Specialist will be solutions-focused, working closely with the firm’s developers, the Senior Manager of Digital Marketing and other members of the department to ensure technologies are performing well and serving the needs of external and internal users.

Job Description

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Takes ownership of the operation of website and email marketing platforms, liaising with users as necessary to correct and detect issues.
Performs regular website and email testing to ensure technology is functioning properly. Conducts UAT of new technology.
Creates reports on website health and issues logs, detailing bugs and fixes for the Senior Digital Marketing Manager. Provides regular updates on the functioning of digital channels and planned enhancements.
Creates project plans for improvements to web and email platforms, working with input from developers and others.
Conducts trainings on content management systems for marketing colleagues firm-wide and serves as a resource for those users, providing troubleshooting and general guidance.
Develops new training materials and oversees library of digital resources.
Recommends new features and functionality based on observation, input from colleagues and trends in the digital space.
Reports on digital trends and analyzes statistics in order to seed strategic initiatives and improvements.
Uses Google Analytics and other tools to compile statistics on usage and prepares reports for various audiences. GA certification a plus.
Performs research for the Senior Digital Marketing Manager as needed.
Posts updates to the website.
Performs any and all other duties as necessary and as assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS / KSAs:
Technically savvy and skilled; has an aptitude for and curiosity of all things digital and can quickly master new technology
Minimum of seven years of experience managing a website and proven success in digital marketing.
Advanced experience with digital and content management systems and marketing automation tools. Experience with Adobe Experience Management a plus.
Proficient in html; coding background is helpful.
Ability to understand user and developer requirements, including technical aspects of SEO.
Excellent communication skills, including the ability to deal with stakeholders working at all levels of the firm.
Bachelor’s degree required.
Excellent analytical, organizational and research skills with a high level of attention to detail.
Advanced understanding of analytics, Google Analytics in particular
Familiarity with professional services and the marketing thereof; experience in the legal services industry is a plus
An ability to handle time-sensitive requests from lawyers and to generate quality work in a fast-paced environment.
Will be required to work outside of business hours as needed to complete time-sensitive requests and to respond to urgent issues.
Proficiency in standard spreadsheet, database, word processing and presentation applications (e.g., Excel, PowerPoint, Word, SharePoint), as well as with a variety of online information resources.
A confident, professional manner that comes across effectively with the firm’s lawyers and staff.
Additional Job Description

PHYSICAL EFFORT / WORK CONDITIONS:
This position operates in a professional office environment which is generally free of hazards and exposure to adverse environmental conditions.
This position requires regular attendance on-site at a Dechert location with some travel to different sites using various modes of private and commercial transportation. Incumbents may be required to work extended hours including evenings and weekends.
This position routinely operates standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopy machines, fax machines and filing cabinets, and requires frequent communication with the firm’s employees and partners as well as third parties.
This position is mainly sedentary. Primary functions require sufficient physical ability and mobility to work in an office setting; to read, sit and type for sustained periods of time; to walk, stand, reach, and bend; to open and close filing cabinets and access and retrieve materials in file rooms; to lift, carry and move files or other items of light to moderate weight; to operate equipment requiring repetitive hand movement and fine coordination; and to verbally communicate to exchange information.
This position requires a normal audio range, with or without correction. It also requires the normal visual range, with or without correction. Specific vision abilities required include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
Location(s)

Philadelphia

Time Type

Full time

Dechert LLP is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity and non-discrimination. The Firm prohibits unlawful discrimination in any term or condition of employment against any employee or applicant for employment because of the individual’s race, color, creed, religion, sex, age, marital status, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, disability, membership or service in the armed forces, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Ekata provides global identity verification via enterprise-grade APIs and a SaaS solution. Our product suite is powered by Ekata Identity Engine, the first and only cross-border identity engine of its kind. It uses complex machine learning algorithms across the five consumer attributes of email, phone, name, physical address, and IP to derive unique data links and features from billions of real-time transactions within our customer network and the globally sourced data of our graph. Businesses around the world including Alipay, Stripe, Airbnb, and Microsoft leverage our solutions to approve more good transactions, reduce friction, and find fraud.

Ekata is looking for a Senior Marketing Manager to own our global content strategy, the “awareness” and “interest” portions of our marketing funnel, as well as all demand and lead generation efforts for our enterprise sales teams. This role will work closely with the rest of the marketing team, sales teams, revenue operations team, product marketing as well as our outside resources and agencies. A successful candidate will have experience researching industry trends across the globe, developing full-funnel campaigns for enterprise teams, and 7+ years’ experience marketing a B2B SaaS or data product globally.

Our Senior Marketing Manager will be focused in three main areas:
Managing all content marketing, from global brand awareness and thought leadership campaigns to social media management, blog sharing, and more.
Creating interest campaigns (email nurtures, etc.) to funnel our audience from brand awareness to product consideration.
Creating targeted campaigns that feed our Enterprise teams qualified new business and current customer expansion leads.
Based on these focus areas, the following are required for all applicants:
Expert in content strategy, including global regional efforts. Must be an excellent writer: engaging, personable, intelligent, and grammatically perfect. Writing samples are required.
Must have 3+ years’ experience in Marketo, building email nurtures, complex programs, landing pages, managing data, and reporting results.
Growth marketing mindset: Focused on lifetime value, building trust through the marketing funnel and beyond, from customer loyalty to brand advocacy.
This role will work closely with the rest of the marketing team, sales teams, revenue operations team, product marketing as well as our outside resources and agencies. We’re looking for someone to join our team who is an engaging B2B writer, metrics driven, smart, adaptable, and motivated by demand generation for a growth company.

In the Senior Marketing Manager role, you will:
Be our primary engagement strategist: You will research, document, and train our team and company on how to engage and build trust with our target personas within each industry we target globally. This will include writing content, emails, managing social channels, and assisting sales with outreach
Create campaigns and content that are relevant to our target audience and effectively funnel leads from brand awareness to product interest, helping us fulfill our growth lead quota month over month
Partner with sales teams to create email sequences to increase MQL (lead) to SQL (opportunity) conversion rates
Make data-driven decisions: Manage and report on your marketing campaigns’ digital performance metrics and analytics
Collaborate with other marketing managers on processes and procedures that need to be optimized (and how to optimize them), and how to elevate our strategies and campaigns for optimal ROI and growth
The right person for this role will grow into managing lead generation campaign strategy across Mid-Market, EMEA, and APAC channels as well as Enterprise within the first 6 months
Our ideal Senior Marketing Manager will have:
7+ years’ experience in B2B marketing with a portfolio of successful content creation, international lead generation programs and growth marketing
Experience researching industry trends as a basis for new campaigns, search terms, and content
Talent for creating engaging content about complex business problems and solutions.
Experience creating personalized digital experiences/campaigns to attract enterprise-level leads and expansions
Demonstrated time and project management abilities, especially an ability to manage complex projects with a lot of moving parts, balancing competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
A natural problem solver: creating order out of chaos, strategy out of ambiguity, and evoking trust
Self-directed and creative thinker; ready to proactively bring new ideas to the table, solve problems and take risks, to find new and innovative ways to improve results
A disdain for complacency; able to think and act outside the confines of the job description, desire to contribute value in other areas as part of a small team, and drive to always be evaluating new ideas and approaches for improving results
We help cross-border digital commerce companies grow their revenue by maximizing predictability of good transactions. From our Transaction Risk API delivered in under 100ms for pre-authorization models through to our robust manual review tool, Pro Insight, our identity verification product suite verifies over 1.8B requests per year in 238 countries for 1700+ companies, including:
Seven of the ten largest US retailers
Six of the ten top global marketplace companies
Five of the top ten global retailers
Two major card brands
Top 3 global online travel and hospitality sites
Integrated with the top 5 global fraud platforms

PURPLE

Purple exists to meaningfully improve lives through true innovation that evolves comfort from end to end. Position Summary
Summary:

We are looking for a senior-level editor with a good sense of timing and the ability to crank out materials representative of our brand.

Join a team of passionate consumer marketers at a rapidly growing healthcare startup that is committed to empowering women with personalized health care. Pill Club is the first company to have a birth control pharmacy service in all 50 states. Our business has grown tremendously over the past year, and our expansion continues as we become the definitive leader in this space.

We are looking for a Content Marketing Manager to support the Marketing and Growth team by executing a data-driven content marketing strategy to drive visibility (via SEO and other organic platforms) and increase content engagement by providing transparency to women’s healthcare and building trust with our audience. Our ideal candidate is both creative and analytical. You are a natural problem solver with a passion for empowering women, and understand how driving toward key metrics and uncovering new opportunities to maximize inbound traffic and engagement facilitates that.

This role requires expertise in content marketing metrics and optimization, collaboration with internal and external content creators, and the ability to create and tailor content yourself. You’ll bring a mix of creativity, collaboration, execution discipline, and accountability to results.
Responsibilities:
Make Pill Club the trusted destination for women’s healthcare and sexual well-being by owning Pill Club’s written content strategy and optimization roadmap and optimizing towards awareness and engagement.
Lead content creation across the website and blog.
Collaborate with the broader marketing team to define content strategy in other channels: email, paid acquisition, etc.
Develop an in-depth knowledge of Pill Club’s patient journey; work with healthcare experts and internal teams to ideate on content strategy that helps our patients in their journey.
Collaborate with SEO partners to uncover traffic expansion opportunities and partner with creative, product, and engineering teams to implement SEO recommendations.
Develop and maintain ongoing website and content performance dashboards.

Requirements:

5+ years of experience with at least 1 year of a proven track record of leading content strategy and execution, and growing a brand’s traffic and engagement across platforms.
Experience working with analytical tools (Google Analytics, etc.) to drive performance.
Experience leading content marketing with an understanding of the tone/voice of our customer (women, 18-45).
Data-driven. You love to dig into the data to understand trends, generate hypotheses, and scale successful findings.
Creative, growth-oriented, and collaborative. You collaborate well with other teams and get excited about trying new ideas in an effort to get better.
Strong verbal and written communication skills. You have the innate ability to present information and ideas logically and clearly.
Direct and recent experience working with digital marketing platforms (Pinterest, Medium, etc.) to drive awareness in addition to owned content is a plus.
Experience writing content at an e-commerce, fashion, subscription commerce brands is a plus.
Experience with content creation and editing tools (e.g. Adobe Creative Cloud) a plus.

We are currently looking to fill a full time position in our BIM/VDC department. You will be implementing the latest in BIM/VDC technology to assist in the design & Construction Coordination process. As a BIM Coordinator you will be working in a fast paced, ever changing environment, driving exceptional quality and service for large industrial clients. Must be highly organized, detail-oriented, & have the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

The BIM coordinator will coordinate the process of generating and managing digital 3d models; building information models are virtual files that streamline the decision-making process & provide a fully coordinated ‘digital twin’ of the design throughout the entire project lifecycle. The BIM coordinator must be well-educated in all phases of design and construction.

DUTIES AND ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Conduct clash detection meetings / constructability reviews
Setup Revit Projects for design teams / Develop & Maintain templates
Provide on-going QA/QC for standards adherence to Austin Corporate Standards
Review & Audit consultant models & 2d cad files and link into design enviroment
Provide discipline specific training in Revit, Navisworks and Autocad
Provide On-going advanced training to Revit Discipline Leads
Support BIM Manager in standards development, maintenance & enforcement
Support BIM Manager in creation of standard families & content creation
Utilize Automation software to track model metrics, standards
Manage data transfers between clients, owners, consultants & sub-contractors
Support BIM Manager in development of standard workflow enhancements
Coordinate / Collaborate with sister company BIM personnel
On-boarding/training of new staff in all BIM software
Coordinate / Manage BIM data among project teams
Support marketing/sales efforts
Attend BIM conferences & stay up to date on latest trends
Qualifications and Experience


As a BIM Coordinator you will need to be highly organized, detail-oriented, hardworking and have the ability to effectively manage multiple tasks & projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment. The Successful candidate will possess excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills as well as the ability to communicate effectively with personnel at all organizational levels.

Specific qualification includes:
Knowledge in Autodesk Revit, NavisWorks & AutoCAD
Knowledge of basic design/construction process’s and procedures
Advanced PC skills, specifically Microsoft Windows Applications (Word, Excel, Outlook & PowerPoint)
Experience with Dynamo preferred
Experience with laser scanning workflows preferred
Experience with Plant3D preferred
Experience with preparing & implementing group training
Completed coursework in Construction, Architecture or an equivalent combination of training and or work experience.
BIM knowledge and interest in working with Construction Technology, laser scanning, Drones, & VR/AR.
