Description
At Belcampo, our purpose is revolutionizing meat for the wellbeing of people, planet, and animals. We are seeking a creative, collaborative, and motivated MARKETING COORDINATOR + COMMUNITY MANAGER to join our team for a full-time assignment.

At BELCAMPO, you’ll work alongside a talented team of experienced marketers who are passionate in our drive to bring Belcampo’s mission to the world, while also finding the time to offer guidance and support to their colleagues.

The MARKETING COORDINATOR + COMMUNITY MANAGER will join the Director of Marketing and Content Marketing Manager in supporting a multi-tiered business in all marketing and communications efforts, with a strong emphasis in growing our devoted following both online and through in-person events.

The MARKETING COORDINATOR + COMMUNITY MANAGER position requires knowledge of the digital landscape as well as a willingness to be hands-on in event planning and execution. The position requires someone comfortable in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

The MARKETING COORDINATOR + COMMUNITY MANAGER plays a key role in Belcampo’s marketing team. Your primary responsibility will involve executing tasks associated with managing Belcampo’s brand advocacy program both online and through in-restaurant and publicity events. Daily responsibilities will include engaging with our social media communities across Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, and Twitter – while nurturing strong relationships with influencers, fans and current and potential customers.

On a daily basis, you will publish, monitor, and engage with Belcampo’s social audience across several platforms while keeping in line with the organization's community management standards. This includes responding to and engaging with comments, posts and branded hashtags content across social channels.

On a monthly basis, you’ll support initiatives to engage our community of brand advocates through creative product distributions, events and other in-person activations.

Work with Social
Support planning and execution of social media programs and campaigns as needed.
Monitor private/direct messages across social channels and work with our customer service team to respond to consumers comments and questions in a timely manner and with attention to detail.
Proactively find engagement opportunities with influencers and bloggers in the health, wellness and regenerative agriculture social media space to directly impact business objectives.
Provide assistance in planning, coordinating and administering product fulfillment for contests and influencer programs, interacting with winners/influencers as needed.
Monitor social media management and analytics tools. Contribute to Belcampo’s monthly social content calendar by participating in brainstorms, to generate new ideas that would appeal to our audiences.
Manage our photo library, including sourcing UGC (user-generated content) from across our social channels, cropping/editing as needed.
Write copy and source photo assets for social, website, and print collateral
Website Administration
Update website
Field customer service questions inbound from the website
Support in deployment of email campaigns
Event Management
Plan and execute in-restaurant marketing events with influencers, internal talent and other business partners to drive brand awareness and restaurant and retail traffic.
Developing event-related schedules and task plans for coordinating event registration
Support communication, web content management, and digital marketing efforts including creating marketing announcements promoting events
Ideal Qualifications
Most importantly: a positive attitude and willingness to participate at any level needed in an exciting and fast-moving environment
Strong copywriting skills
Bachelor's degree in marketing or relevant area.
Experience working with social tools including publishers, aggregators and analytics.
Strong project management skills, high attention to and care of detail, and ability to work independently and as part of a team and manage projects in a timely manner.
1-3 years experience in social media, digital marketing, events and/or community management (or a combination there-of)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; strong editing skills
An interest in health, wellness and/or regenerative agriculture a plus!
Effective time and project management skills with commitment to timelines, accuracy & professionalism
Creative thinker that thrives in a dynamic, collaborative & fast paced environment
Proficient with Google Docs, Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook and project management tools; adept at learning new tools and technologies
Belcampo Meat Company provides equal opportunity employment opportunities to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

Team orientation and strong collaborator.
Peer leadership and influence.

Commitment to Diversity
As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. Skillshare is looking for a Senior Content Marketing Manager to create content and lead the editorial strategy for our owned channels, with the goal of growing our engaged membership base and increasing brand awareness. Working closely with our brand & creative teams (as well as departments across the company), you’ll publish relevant content that fosters community, conveys the sense of fun and inspiration at the heart of our brand, and ultimately demonstrates the value of Skillshare. You’ll be a driving force in establishing the foundation for content marketing operations at the company – developing collaborative workflows, upholding editorial governance, and optimizing our content and publishing cadence for social channels and our blog as we scale.

The ideal candidate for this role is a passionate, enthusiastic storyteller and strong writer who balances creativity with leveraging data to inform strategy. You’ll be a key stakeholder in making content marketing a reliable growth engine for Skillshare’s brand and business.
What you'll do:
Produce, publish, and promote content for our owned channels – including social media, our blog, and YouTube – that drives traffic and engages our community
Collaborate with our Brand, Creative, Marketing, Originals, Product, and Data teams to create high quality content that is relevant to our audience and demonstrates the value of Skillshare
Create organizational workflows and uphold editorial governance to ensure all content is consistent with our brand voice, style, and tone
Optimize our content and publishing cadence on regular basis, based on the success of our programming as measured by engagement and conversion
Upgrade and scale our channel infrastructure with SEO and content categorization best practices in mind
Stay up-to-date on trends and algorithmic updates across channels to maximize our promotion efforts
Plan and manage our social media presence and strategy
Proactively identify and drive new tests on our channels
Build and nurture a strong freelancer network to accelerate quality content creation
Why we're excited about you:
You have experience owning and scaling social media and blog channels for a high-growth company
You have demonstrated impact through building large, engaged online communities
You’re a strong, versatile writer with experience writing across social media channels and blogs
You’re a natural storyteller with great editorial judgment and strong visual aesthetic
You are fluent in best practices around SEO, content categorization and structure, content development, distribution, and measurement
You leverage insights for impact: you look at patterns in the data, synthesize insights, and use them to make content and conversion funnels stronger
You’re a self-starter with a spirit of experimentation, always identifying opportunities to improve and test new ideas for our channels
You have strong project management skills, with high attention to detail and accuracy
Bonus: you have experience with video creation for social media and/or YouTube
Why you're excited about us:
Impact: You’ll be the driving force behind the strategy and content for our owned channels, and a key stakeholder in making content marketing a reliable growth engine for Skillshare’s brand and business.
Growth: You’ll have the opportunity to wear a lot of hats and take on more responsibility over time.
Our team: We have a passionate, talented team that is a lot of fun to work with.
Our mission: We’re doing work that matters – connecting lifelong learners around the world and empowering them to pursue their creativity.
Flexibility: We believe that doing your best work means living a full life. That means different things for everyone, so we optimize for trust, invest to support remote teams, have an unlimited vacation policy (with a required minimum!), and encourage work-life balance.
About Skillshare:

Skillshare is an online learning community for creatives. We have thousands of inspiring classes for creative and curious people, and millions of members who come together to find inspiration and take the next step in their creative journey. We are backed by Union Square Ventures, Spark Capital, Amasia, Spero Ventures, and Burda Principal Investments.

Skillshare is committed to building a diverse team that reflects a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We’re proud to be recognized as a top place to work by BuiltinNYC, Crain’s, and Forbes, in addition to being one of the five best places to work for women by Bpeace, and a top-rated workplace for dads by Fatherly. We work to ensure a consistent interview process, fair compensation, and inclusive work environment for all.

Dickinson Fleet Services keeps your fleet moving. Dickinson Fleet Services is the largest independent fleet maintenance company in the country. As a leader in the mobile fleet service industry, we provide preventative maintenance excellence tailored to each customer's unique needs. As our business continues to expand, we are always on the lookout for motivated, energetic individuals to fill the positions now available on our talented team of professionals.

JOB TITLE: Digital Marketing Manager



We are searching for a highly-creative Digital Marketing Manager to lead our marketing initiatives. In this position, you will be responsible for all aspects of our marketing operations. Your central goal is to help grow our brands influence nationally, while also increasing brand loyalty and awareness.

Your duties will include planning, implementing, and monitoring our digital marketing campaigns across all digital networks. Our ideal candidate is someone with experience in marketing, digital content creation, and social media management. In addition to being an outstanding communicator, you will also demonstrate excellent interpersonal and analytical skills.

Job Responsibilities
Be Responsible for the Companys short term and long-term marketing strategy, efforts and success of digital marketing programs, including search and social media advertising, SEO, website tracking and analytics, email campaigns, blogs and all marketing efforts surrounding product and content launches.
Work with our social media platforms to create visual content for Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Yelp, Google Business and LinkedIn
Compose quality, well written content for blogs, landing pages, press releases, email/text marketing campaigns, etc.
Ability to work with WordPress: manage company website, create landing pages, work with plugins, etc.
Evaluate, regularly analyze and report out on the performance and ROI of every marketing campaign by channel and recommend/implement needed changes, enhancements, additional investment or termination of campaigns, etc.
Evaluate important metrics that affect our website traffic, service quotas, and target audience.
Serve as a point of contact for the company when interacting with outside media and digital marketing agencies
Create frequent and targeted email marketing campaigns (MailChimp and Constant Contact)
Stay current with best practices, strategies, and industry standards for social media, SEO and search engine marketing (SEM).
Oversee the lead handling process, ensure that lead referral sources are being accurately entered in the CRM and make sure staff is appropriately interacting with leads and ensuring a positive customer service experience
Provide project management or project management support for special projects and trade shows.
Required Competencies:

Bachelors degree in Marketing or relevant field.
A minimum of 5 years experience in a digital marketing position developing and implementing digital marketing strategies
2 years of hands-on experience with SEO, Google Analytics and CRM software
In-depth knowledge of various social media platforms, best practices, and website analytics.
Working knowledge of Adobe Suite, Microsoft PowerPoint, WordPress, Email marketing applications, Constant Contact, Canvas, etc.
Highly creative with excellent analytical abilities.
Transportation and Maintenance industry experience preferred
Digital photography and videography, with associated editing experience preferred
Sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on a companys success
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills.
Familiarity with web design
Up-to-date on the latest trends and technologies in digital marketing.
Sense of urgency daily and action oriented; not fearful of acting with a minimum of planning
Why Dickinson?

Excellent benefits: An excellent medical, dental and vision plan with a zero premium monthly contribution option, a 401(k) plan with company match, wellness program, short and long term disability insurance and more.

Strong values: We're family owned, we value our people and we've created a culture based on strong values.

Grow your skills: We'll set you up for success with great training, as you come on board and on an ongoing basis.

Accelerate your career: History shows that strong performers can move up to a Lead or Manager role, or follow other paths within our company.

The stability of an industry leader: Our passion for quality work and excellent customer service have helped us dominate our market. Our customers include some of the nation's largest fleet operators.

Job Description

ENERGY FOR WHATS AHEAD
Are you looking to make a difference in your career? Were working on smarter grids, cleaner energy and tools to help people manage energy more efficiently.

The job is
As the Corporate Communications Senior Advisor, you will work with the Senior Manager of Executive Communications in executing communications strategies and tactics. You will work closely with several lines of business and subject matter experts to develop compelling content across a wide range of subjects, including prepared remarks, internal and external communications, social media content and other communications content. You will also assist in the development and execution of executive communications strategies. To be successful, you must have strong writing and communications skills. A high level of discretion is essential as you will handle confidential, sensitive and market-moving information before it is publicly disclosed.

Day to day
Develop speeches and written materials for executives.
Develop written, audio, web and social media communication materials.
Research, develop, plan, design, maintain and implement integrated strategic communications plans that shape reputation for Edison International and other Edison International companies, specifically related to executive communications.
Identify target audiences and coordinate distribution of messages through a variety of channels, including special events, public speaking and other means to meet specific program objectives.
Serve as a Public Information Officer for the companys Incident Management Teams during crisis events.
Work with company executives to develop and implement communications plans that raise visibility and support company objectives.
Qualifications

Qualifications you need
Ten (10) or more years of communications experience.
Five (5) or more years of direct corporate communications experience.
Other details that will set you up for success
Experience in communications planning and project management.
3 years of experience in speech writing.
Bachelors degree or higher in Business, Communications or related discipline.
Journalism experience.
Experience in a corporate or agency setting.
Demonstrated content creation skills across multiple platforms and channels.
Must have strong creative and problem-solving skills.
Must have strong written and oral communications skills.
Demonstrated ability to lead others through influence and collaboration.
Extensive executive communications experience.
Experience in the utility and/or other regulated industry.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Ability to work as part of a cohesive team.
You should know
Relocation is not available for this position.
You are legally authorized to work directly as employee for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship.
We offer a fantastic Total Rewards Package that includes things like a wide selection of health plans, preventative health reimbursement, 401(k) savings plan with company match and automatic company contributions, tuition reimbursement, professional development, volunteer programs, employee assistance program, electric service discount, and many more perks.

Southern California Edison, an Edison International (NYSE:EIX) company, serves a population of nearly 14 million via 5 million customer accounts in a 50,000-square-mile service area within Central, Coastal and Southern California. Join the utility leader that is safely delivering reliable, affordable electricity to our customers for over 125 years.

At SCE we celebrate our differences. We are a proud Equal Opportunity Employer and will not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected status. #LI-MM1

The TIBCO Value Engineer (VE) is recognized as a senior team member who will lead efforts to resolve complex industry business matters, support the growth of our sales pipeline, and engage with our customers to secure revenue. The role focuses on adopting standardized approaches for value-based sales activities and related solutions, from TIBCO and our partners, in focused accounts. This is a home-office based position and will cover our West Coast territory.
Assume a leadership role in devising strategies in targeted sales cycles; drive VE credibility to influence the markets opinion of TIBOC’s solutions offerings.
Lead multi-disciplined teams to develop and refine customer deliverables while incorporating our differentiated value proposition.

Identify and build a pipeline of customer reference stories to showcase achieved value.
Develop TIBCO’s VE brand through thought leadership, content creation, appearances at marketing events, publishing articles and contributing to social media.
Partner with field sales leadership to identify revenue opportunities, create account strategies, ensure coverage of strategic opportunities, and execute sales plays.

Lead customer co-innovation, enterprise transformation, and business process performance improvement programs.
Provide consultation on strategic GTM decisions in areas such as: value creation strategy, enablement approach, investment cases, M&A, and strategic partnering.

Prior experience with software/IT organizations with a demonstrated proficiency in at least one industry or line of business solution segment (e.g. through Solution Management, Sales, Presales, Consulting or Business Development roles).
Use of change management methodologies and approaches.

Overview


The Baltimore Sun seeks an enterprising digital journalist to help lead its emerging news desk. The ideal candidate will help us grow The Sun’s audience through engaging and innovative content. Speed and comfort in working across digital platforms are essential.

Responsibilities

in a timely fashion.

subjects

to develop innovative ways to present content digitally

Superior news editing skills

Job Description:
About the Opportunity
Do you believe brands have the power to make a lasting positive impact on the social and environmental issues of our day? Are you a passionate storyteller looking to join a market leader in the food movement? Driscoll’s is hiring for a Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) Marketing Manager.

Join a Brand Marketing Team who focuses on creating brand value and influence through a sustainable relationship with consumers. The department’s functional areas of responsibilities include: Brand Development and Global Architecture; Digital Marketing focused on digital ecosystem of web; social and loyalty communities, Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) Marketing: PR, Content Creation, Partnerships; Channel Marketing: Optimization of customer and in-store activation, Consumer Relations

The CSR Marketing Manager will be responsible for safeguarding the brand voice and reputation across a range of sustainable, environmental and community topics and initiatives that matter to external stakeholders including consumers, media and advocacy groups. In addition, the CSR Marketing Manager will champion internal Driscoll’s programs and initiatives that position our brand as positive market leaders in the food industry. CSR involves doing business in a responsible fashion that delivers value not only to the organization, but also to its stakeholders and the community within which it operates. CSR covers five main areas: environment, community, worker welfare, financial performance and corporate governance.

This newly created role will work closely with internal cross-functional teams (philanthropy, sustainability, production, product leadership and growers) to assess and prioritize key community and thought leadership practices that require brand and marketing support. This is a highly visible role with the unique opportunity to combine compelling storytelling and data-driven driven strategy to positively impact Driscoll’s important role in the food system. The CSR Marketing Manager will be the marketing subject-matter expert and the go-to contact point for all areas under Thought Leadership that may include but are not limited to the topics of AgTech, organics, water, worker welfare, food-safety and environmental issues.

The CSR Marketing Manager will play a critical role in the external launch of Sustainable Communities, a global strategic framework for our business enterprise. The CSR marketing efforts will include a comprehensive CEO communication platform across PR, Events and Panel Participation. The CSR Manager will also be responsible for launching and sustaining a long-term communication strategy for The Last Harvest, an original documentary commissioned by Driscoll’s to highlight challenges and opportunities within our grower network.

The CSR Marketing Manager will work closely with the Director of Marketing to create a meaningful stakeholder mapping process that intersects with the needs of media, advocacy groups, and consumers. The stakeholder process must identify topics that can either create value for the brand and/or protect the brand from negative perceptions.

The CSR Marketing Manager will then partner and collaborate with others to translate the topics into effective marketing strategies and programs.
Responsibilities


The CSR Marketing Manager will be responsible for managing all aspects of thought leadership topics both pro-active and issues management. In creating short-term and long-term marketing programs, the Corporate Social Responsibility Marketing Manager will lead:

External Thought Leadership Events
Co-develop the portfolio of external events where executives and subject matter experts should be present.
Pitch and secure new speaking engagements; respond to roster of incoming speaking opportunities.
Managing relationships with key organizations and event partners.
Provide support and periodic development for earned engagements.
Current event examples include Eco-Farm, Organic Produce Summit, Food Tank, etc.
Media Relations
Partner with the Director of Marketing as the subject matter expert to ensure accuracy of all key points are communicated in a factual and effective way.
Amplification
Work closely with Digital Marketing, Channel and Brand team members to appropriately amplify thought leadership strategies and initiatives.
Maintain an ‘editorial calendar’ for the platform to inform internal and external parties of thought leadership activity, and leverage appropriately. Work closely with the Philanthropy team and local SEIs to assess meaningful stories and activities to external stakeholders.
Brand Advocate and Marketing Subject Matter Expert
High collaboration and partnership with subject-matter experts to gain deeper knowledge of thought-leadership topics and then translate knowledge into compelling marketing opportunities. Create and develop a check-in or update process across organics, water, worker welfare, Legal (policy such NAFTA), R&D (AgTech and genetics) to ensure the brand team is connected with the latest trends and information.
Budget
Responsible for developing and managing designated components of the annual marketing budget against target goals.
Other duties as assigned.
Candidate Profile
5+ years of progressive brand management.
Bachelor degree in Marketing or Business administration required; M.B.A. preferred.
Effective in managing complex program executions through superior organization, communication skills and attention to detail.
Skilled in advancing multiple brand marketing initiatives against approved timelines and budget parameters.
Strong marketing acumen and ability to align digital, communication and social media strategies with business objectives.
Superior written communication skills with prior experience in press releases, message maps and white papers.
Compelling spokesperson and presenter experienced with presenting to large groups and senior management.
Previous experience with the food industry or agriculture is a plus.
May travel for business up to 15% of work time.
Driscoll's
Competitors: Dole Food Company, Naturipe Farms, California Giant

Job Description:
Mendix is on a mission to enable anyone in any organization – from the marketing coordinator to the software developer to the CEO – to create things that are transformational for their company. We are fundamentally reinventing the way applications are created and we’re reinventing the future of software development. Sounds ambitious, right? We agree.

Not to brag, but nearly 4,000 organizations worldwide, including KLM, Medtronic, Merck, and Philips, rely on Mendix to build web and mobile applications. Thousands of our customers use our platform to delight their clients and empower their employees. It’s no surprise that we’re a recognized Leader by Gartner and Forrester in a red-hot market expected to exceed $21 billion by 2022. Ok, maybe we did want to brag a little. But we’re proud of what we’ve accomplished…and…we’re humble enough to admit that we need you to make us even more effective.

We are looking for a Faculty Technology Advisor to facilitate professor learning and curriculum adoption activities for the Mendix University Program Pipeline. This role will be measured on delivering successful outcomes to help achieve the University Program annual growth goals. This role reports to the Director, Education & University Programs.
You'll be one of the first 5 team members of the Mendix University Program - a startup within a startup. As part of this fast-paced, high-growth team, you will be responsible for introducing the Mendix technology to qualified, engaged professors, facilitating their learning of Mendix, and guiding them through the curriculum adoption process through to the first day of teaching Mendix in class.

You’ll help structure and scale this department in a variety of ways. You will:
-Design and manage training experiences to drive professor Mendix certifications:
-Get Professors officially signed up & prepared to begin teaching Mendix in curriculum for each upcoming semester.
-Design curriculum & create Workshop & Training Class Materials for use at Faculty workshops & Workshops & Tutorials @ quarterly Events
-Initiate Training Facilitation & Delivery: deliver in-person training to professors and faculty in a variety of settings around the world
-Create excellent attendee learner experience at Faculty Workshops
-Create Reusable materials to help professors learn Mendix
-Facilitate self-service learning through webinars, videos and other on-demand
-Create marketing automation materials to guide the professor through week-by-week topics, one at a time. These include both Mendix videos to learn the feature/functionality, and assignment instructions.
-Manage a pipeline of engaged professors
-Establish and maintain/monitor reporting in salesforce (and other systems) & optimize conversion metrics to achieve successful outcomes
-Create scalable curriculum adoption options
-Conduct curriculum assessments of professors’ current courses & design customized curriculum that incorporates Mendix
-Create Sample Syllabus, assignments and projects
-Co-author & publish academic texts and academic white papers with professor co-authors

You’re the innovator we need if you have:
-Experience in instructional design or technical product training
-Experience learning complex technologies independently
-Knowledge of javascript, data modeling, workflow programming and coding
-Excellent communication skills across all channels; digital, remote, phone, live and recorded video and audio, written, and in-person
-A passion for teaching
-Content creation skills
-Experience executing and optimizing marketing activities



#LI-AG1

Our Guiding Principles

While we live on different continents, speak different languages, and work on different things, we are bound by our “MendixBlue” guiding principles. Being “MendixBlue” means that you live the culture, and you consistently improve it as we grow. It’s kind of a big deal.

We put the customer first. Without our customers, we have no business. So, if you act in the best interest of our customers, always…you belong here.

We think big. We work to have a meaningful, lasting impact on the world. So, if you aim high and think long term…you belong here.

We innovate. We want to be what happens next. So, if you ask “what if?” and work to find a way or make one…you belong here.

We nurture talent. We look, not just at the sum of what an individual has done, but at the potential of who they can be. So, if you’re up for learning from your failures…you belong here.

We hear every voice. Inflated egos don’t last here, humility does. So, if you share credit and ensure that the best ideas win – regardless of who they come from…you belong here.

We own it. If something needs doing, we do it. So, if you focus on the outcome, and take initiative to get it done…you belong here.

We have fun. We use laughter as a common language. We can ask for help and we’re happy to give it. So, if you find joy and purpose in what you do…you belong here.

Make your career at Mendix.

There are precious few jobs that let you create the future. But you’ll find one at Mendix. We are at a pivotal time in our company’s existence: where rapid growth meets stable funding. This is the time for industrious people to raise their hands to solve the next generation of problems. Mendix is a place where ambitious people can thrive; where you can identify an issue, propose a solution, and build the structure to make it happen.

Important to know: Mendix is a Siemens business, which means we’re backed by the resources and stability of one of the world’s largest and most forward-looking enterprises. Think: job security.

Since our company was founded in 2005, our aim has been to create a great work environment for people at all stages in their careers. That’s why we are so pleased and honored that we were rated a top Cloud Computing Company to work for in 2019, based on feedback from our employees on Glassdoor. With offices in the Netherlands, the UK, Germany, and the US, (and more coming), we provide an international playground to truly impact the world through low-code.

Marketing & Sales Manager
We are seeking an experienced marketing and sales professional for a hands-on role leading membership and revenue growth for the East Bay Rental Housing Association (EBRHA). If you are a people-oriented and persuasive marketing/sales professional who enjoys working as part of a team and getting things done at a fast pace, this is the job for you.
EBRHA is a membership organization serving property owners, property managers, and industry-related vendors in Alameda and Contra Costa Counties. Reporting to the Association Executive, this position will develop and implement a marketing plan retain our base of 1,300 members, reenroll lapsed members, and build membership in untapped communities of the East Bay.
Key duties and responsibilities include:
Analyzing our markets and gathering data on our current and potential members, and how best to reach them (message, medium, frequency, etc.).
Creating and implementing a marketing plan based on EBRHA’s strategic plan and utilizing best practices from our national organization, the National Apartment Association, and other chapters of the NAA.
Personally reaching out to lapsed members and prospective members to enroll them in EBRHA.
Participating in the development of marketing materials, ad copy, and related campaigns in collaboration with the Communications & Events Specialist.
Contributing to content creation for EBRHA’s magazine and other communications.
Creating and maintaining a sales dashboard and metrics, in partnership with the Association Executive.
Serving as one of our liaisons to the NAA.
EBRHA is an 80-year-old membership organization with a staff of five full-time and two part-time employees. There are no other staff in the marketing/sales function, so the ideal candidate will enjoy doing all aspects of the marketing and sales functions.
This is a full-time position in downtown Oakland near Lake Merritt. EBHRA offers medical/dental benefits, vacation and sick pay. The pay rate for this position is $60,000-$65,000, depending on qualifications.

Qualifications:
The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of related experience demonstrating:
Excellent communication skills (speaking, listening, and writing), over the phone, in person, and online.
Experience developing marketing plans and conducting market research.
Success leading sales presentations to individuals and groups.
Proven track record in business development and relationship building.
Experience with Constant Contact, drip marketing campaigns, content marketing, and social media marketing is preferred.
Strong skills in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Initiative and sense of personal responsibility for getting things done.
Team player: someone who communicates openly, keeps others informed, asks questions, and is happy to help others as needed.
Excellent interpersonal skills to build strong relationships and work effectively with board members and a wide range of people.
Bachelor’s degree in a related area is preferred.

About Us:
We are the East Bay Rental Housing Association (EBRHA), and for 80+ years we have provided service and education to property owners, helping them stay in compliance with all regulations related to housing. We are a 501C(6) nonprofit membership organization, serving 1,300 members in Alameda and Contra Costa Counties. Our small and friendly staff team is headquartered on Grand Avenue near Lake Merritt in Oakland. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone is able to thrive and do their best work.

What we're Building
We’re on a mission to make marketing more meaningful by building the next-generation B2B marketing platform.

Our ABM automation platform helps B2B organizations operationalize Account Based Marketing (ABM). With our product suite, revenue teams can get insight into which accounts are engaging, know where to focus time and resources, automate multi-channel campaigns, and measure the ROI of their campaigns.

Backed by leading venture investors and headquartered in San Mateo, CA, Engagio was named as one of the Top 10 Best Small Companies to Work For in the Bay Area, and is on the JMP Securities 2018 Hot 100 List of Privately Held Software Companies. Some of our customers include Atlassian, Snowflake, Symantec, TrendMicro, and Vonage.

Provide responses to RFPs and RFIs

The Challenge: We are looking for a marketing generalist who is an expert communicator and strong creator. This person will have experience across multiple facets of marketing including content creation, social media, and product marketing. We've gained a ton of market traction, and need an excellent storyteller to communicate Zyper’s value proposition to key channels.

Our Goal: We are the home for community. We want to connect the world’s leading brands to their fans, and those fans to each other. To do so, we’ve developed an innovative software that has defined a new category and is disrupting the digital and social media space. At this moment, we are focused on hyper-growth - it’s critical that we reach our existing and potential customers with targeted messaging that resonates.
This is an opportunity to:
Move important company metrics - directly impact our ARR and customer satisfaction rates through your work.
Convey Zyper’s unique selling proposition to the world through creative marketing campaigns and press releases.
Drive initiatives to maximize our product adoption across markets and propel the company to Series B.
Join a growth stage and stable startup at the right time. You’ll be an early employee of a hard working team; set on our mission to create a technology layer that connects brands to their fans and helps foster community.
What you'll do
Work across multiple aspects of marketing, including product marketing, social media, email, and content creation.
Collaborate with our Head of Product and Head of Sales to develop product positioning and messaging that resonates with our target customer personas.
Own content creation and development for all marketing channels.
Help craft the strategy for our social media channels, ensuring Zyper’s brand is represented correctly and efficiently, as a thought leader.
Plan the launches of new products and releases of existing products, develop written and visual assets, and manage the cross-functional implementation of the plan.
Communicate the vision and value of our brand in collateral for our sales team that enables them in pitches and demos.
Obtain, analyze, and develop actionable recommendations from customer product use, feedback, and market research.
Assess the effectiveness of the marketing programs on an ongoing basis, and report back to internal stakeholders.
People you'll work with:
CEO
Head of Sales
Head of Product
Head of Operations
Designer
External Stakeholders
Who you are...
You are strong communicator with 2+ years of marketing experience (agency, brand, copywriting, graphic design, and social media marketing roles are a plus)
You have a proven ability to quickly gain trust with internal senior leadership & external stakeholders of all levels.
You are highly organized with an exceptional ability to lead cross-functional projects across the finish line.
You enjoy educating others. We are creating a new category of community marketing and it’s critical to evangelize this value in our marketing efforts to drive growth.
You are a humble hustler who wants to get the job done - even if that means rolling up your sleeves. No task is too big or too small.
You have the basic knowledge and skills for the creative projects, familiarity with Photoshop, Keynote, etc.
Some of our benefits include:
Global and remote friendly team
Employer paid healthcare premiums (90%+)
Vision and Dental
Team lunch on Fridays!

EvolveMKD

Vice President, Digital

EvolveMKD is looking for a dynamic and energetic leader to join our Digital Team as Vice President. This position provides the opportunity to lead a collaborative team in a fast-paced, creative environment on a wide variety of businesses, and to shape the development of the digital team and the growth of the entire agency.

Company Overview

Based in the heart of Manhattan, EvolveMKD specializes in brand caretaking for a variety of healthcare, beauty, lifestyle, and consumer partners. Our team of experts build and deliver marketing campaigns, encompassing both traditional and unconventional PR marketing tactics as well as developing, executing, and analyzing digital & social media strategy, content creation, and social influencer marketing tactics. Recently honored as a 2019/20 Great Place to Work and as a finalist for PR Week’s Awards’ 2020 Small Agency of the Year, EvolveMKD promotes solid partner performance and nurtures development among our team of experts. Above all, EvolveMKD is committed to delivering the best performance for every client partner: brand caretaking at its finest.

Job Overview

A successful Vice President will have a creative and analytic mind for all things digital, a proven track record of executing and generating results for social media, influencer and paid campaigns, and prior success managing a small growth-oriented team. This person should be motivated by driving strategy and overall team development. We expect team members at this level have an inner sense of “restless discontent,” i.e. they are constantly looking to elevate their client work and their personal skill set and helping everyone on their team to do the same.

Passion and enthusiasm for the work, as well as team collaboration and respect are required.

Key Responsibilities

Client Partner Management

· Manage the day-to-day workflow across direct reports, peers, clients, vendors and freelancers, reporting to the SVP Digital

· Collaborate and lead digital team across all client partners to develop strategy and execute overarching brand campaigns with an emphasis on results-driven tactics, excellent client service, and execution of timelines and budget management

· Oversee account billing and budget management for all client accounts

· Strategize, ideate, and assist in the execution of organic social, paid social media campaigns (such as website conversions, reach/frequency, engagement, fan acquisition and lead generation) across social platforms, programmatic (display, native, video, mobile), and promotional campaigns (such as sweepstakes/giveaways, brand content integrations, third-party promotions, influencers)

· Analyze metrics from influencer content campaigns and social media ad activations, ensuring that ongoing and future efforts are optimized and ladder up to overall strategies

· Assist in social listening, monitoring and reporting deliverables

Agency Development

· Actively seek out new business, help develop strategic new business proposals and budgets, present to potential clients, and ultimately win new accounts with forward-thinking strategies

· Collaborate with our traditional PR team in order to provide holistic integrated media counsel that is rooted in strategy and insights

· Educate internal team about performance metrics for social, display, and influencer initiatives

· Identify emerging market opportunities and develop potential core services for the agency

· Work in partnership with the Senior Team to effectively develop and grow the digital team, as well as delegate and leverage cross-functional resources to achieve outcomes

Team Management

· Act as a role model by representing, communicating, and leading our overall vision, mission, and values – both internally and externally

· Manage and mentor Account Supervisors/SAEs to further their professional and personal growth

· Execute quarterly reviews for direct report(s)

Qualifications
Minimum 7+ years’ digital experience, some agency experience preferred
4-5+ years management experience
Bachelor’s degree; degree in Communications, Journalism, Public Relations, English, Marketing a plus but not required
About 15% client partner and new business travel, when needed
Comfortable prioritizing excellent client partner service above all else; flexibility to adjust to an all-hands-on-deck approach
Ability to lead a team across digital strategy from concepting, content, and creative development to executions and campaign analysis
Ability to address and resolve any complex internal issues with a sense of ownership and urgency
Advanced knowledge of Facebook Ads Manager/Business Manager, Twitter, LinkedIn, and Pinterest, and baseline knowledge of display/programmatic, mobile, video, e-newsletters, blogs and websites
Experience in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, as well as various social media UI, and scheduling/monitoring tools (Meltwater, Fohr, Sprout); Photoshop a plus
Benefits Include:

· Competitive salary based on experience

· Performance-based bonus

· Generous contribution to healthcare, dental and vision plans

· 401K with company match and profit-sharing opportunities

· Unlimited PTO, summer Fridays, and generous company holiday schedule

· Commuter benefits + FSA

· Cell phone reimbursement

· Paid family leave

· In-office Family Party each July + Holiday Party each December

To apply, get in touch at careers@evolvemkd.com

HZ is looking for a Visionary type accustomed to hearing an art direction and developing the best visual aesthetic for a production. Must be ready and willing to travel and have non-traditional work hours and a flexible schedule. This position will include evening and weekend work. A director of photography on set that makes technical decisions and translates those choices to the rest of the team. Ideal candidate could be described as easygoing, collaborative attitude Fast, efficient, nimble.

Responsibilities
Manage camera and lighting crew, direct the technical equipment and at times, directing
Minimum of 5 years experience (demonstrable achievements)
Support day-to-day activities within the studio such as pre-production — weighing in on creative, shotlist development, project coordination and vendor management
Capture and edit video and sound projects, including selecting program format for final output, capturing/importing media, organizing raw media, editing footage and sound files, creating and inserting static and motion graphics, titling, adding music/voice-over/sfx, media management and archiving project media

Job Title: Senior Marketing Strategist & HubSpot Team Lead (Remote)
Job Description:
PLEASE READ:
The following requirements are must-haves for this position:
2+ years of hands-on experience with the marketing automation platform, HubSpot
10+ years experience building comprehensive multi-channel and multi-layer digital marketing campaigns and content marketing
2+ years in a management role where you were responsible for leading 5 or more direct reports
Do you thrive on translating big-picture marketing strategies to real-world, revenue-driven results? Do you geek out about acquisition funnels, multi-channel campaigns, and getting your hands dirty executing those plans? This role is unique in that youll play a key role in growing the company by working directly with a portfolio of clients and leading a team of consultants to develop and execute strategic inbound marketing initiatives.

Were building a different kind of work environment at SmartBug Mediaone where you can deliver exceptional results, have a great time with people you respect, and still embrace the things that matter in life. If this sounds like an excellent role for you, you should read on!

Position Overview:
As a Senior Marketing Strategist and Team Leader, you will have revenue responsibility for a portfolio of SmartBugs clients that operate within the HubSpot ecosystem. Your team will grow to 6-10 direct reports that have the role of Marketing Strategist at the company. Each of these individuals will have 1-2 direct reports themselves. When your team is small, you will own several accounts. As your team grows, we will remove direct account responsibilities so you have time to focus on your team.
You and your team will recommend and execute digital marketing, lead generation, marketing automation, and sales enablement activities that include content marketing, SEO, sales, and marketing alignment. Growing revenue and marketing ROI is at the heart of what we do, so youll be responsible for measuring, analyzing, and understanding the performance of client campaigns and advising on opportunities for improvement.
To be successful in this role, you must be comfortable with both your strategic marketing skills and your ability to manage and mentor a group of smart, driven marketers.
In collaboration with the VP of Client Services, youll have a hand in shaping Client Services by continuously innovating client onboarding, marketing services, processes, and delivery. Youll be a champion that helps grow SmartBug Media and its brand by building a team of smart, like-minded marketers.

We know your leadership, the quality of your teams work, and your clients results are what generate increased trust, responsibility, and additional business opportunities for SmartBug. That's why our Senior Marketing Strategists are compensated for account growth and incremental revenue brought in. That doesn't make this a sales position. It's not. But it means that you get to participate in the success and financial growth of your accounts including some key strategic accounts.
The day-to-day:
Onboard and/or help your team onboard new clients and create a vision and revenue-generating marketing strategy based on client and customer interviews, research, and collaboration with our team. Then work with your team of consultants, copywriters, designers, and developers to deliver on that strategy and vision.
Serve as the primary face of SmartBug Media for your clientsyou are the extension of their team and will be expected to know their business as well as they do.
Assist and empower clients with the results, knowledge, content, and tools to not only get their buy-in but to also evangelize their success through their organization.
Demonstrate your expertise with inbound and lead generation tactics including blogging, social media marketing, search engine optimization, e-book/white paper/video content creation, website updates, email marketing, and others.
Use your experience as a marketing automation expert to craft strategies that generate real results; educate your team and clients as required.
Execute your clients digital marketing plans proactively to meet schedule, performance, and budget goals.
Take the lead in creating monthly performance reports and quarterly business reviews that provide deep data-driven insights about customer needs and behaviors to fuel innovation and identify strategic initiatives that will drive sales, growth, and profitability.
Stay informed about digital marketing industry developments and be able to utilize these developments to your clients benefit.
Practice your craft by contributing to SmartBug Medias blog and social media presence.
Work closely with the VP of Client Services to continuously improve services, systems, and delivery models for clients.
Manage, hire, and onboard a team of marketing consultants to serve our HubSpot clients.
Collaborate with other team leads to solve client challenges and innovate services as needed.
Address client concerns and issues as they arise and escalate when needed.
Other responsibilities as assigned.
Have fun and make some great friends!
Experience and Education Requirements:
Authorization to work in the U.S. without employer sponsorship is required
10+ years experience building comprehensive multi-channel and multi-layer digital and content marketing campaigns is required
2+ years in a management role where you were responsible for leading 5 or more direct reports is required
2+ years of hands-on experience with the marketing automation platform, HubSpot required
B.A. or B.S. degree required
Demonstrate strategic thinking and independent management skills
Solid business acumen, management, and problem-solving skills
Proven experience finding, analyzing, and assimilating market and customer data into marketing strategies
Experience communicating with executive-level clients or team members
Creative and innovative with a focus on excellence and execution
Working knowledge of search engine optimization, email marketing best practices, CMS platforms such as a WordPress, and CRM systems such as Salesforce
Excellent writing skills and a strong understanding of how to write SEO-friendly content
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Suite
Agency or client service experience is a bonus
Experience working remotely in similar roles is strongly preferred
Interview Process:
Application
Video Application
Phone Screen with HR
1st Interview with the VP of Client Services
Interview with the hiring team
2nd Interview with the VP of Client Services
Reference checking
Final video interview with SmartBugs CEO
Our extensive employee benefits program includes:
Generous compensation package with performance incentives
Health insurance with company contribution
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Paid vacation
Paid time off
401(k) with employer matching
Flexible spend plan
Company-funded short-term disability and life insurance
Long-term disability
Annual leadership conference, SmartBugapalooza
Training budget
The flexibility of working remotely
About SmartBug Media
SmartBug Media is a globally recognized Intelligent Inbound marketing agency that assists businesses in growing revenue through content marketing, sales enablement, web development, marketing automation, and PR. For more than 10 years, SmartBug has helped businesses increase qualified leads, close customers, and enhance the reach and loyalty of their brands. Were one of a handful of HubSpot Diamond partners in the world, the highest-rated agency in the history of the HubSpot ecosystem, and were named HubSpot's Global Partner of the Year in 2018. With five Comparably awards won in 2018 and certification as a "Great Place to Work" for the second year in a row, it's clear that it's not just our clients that like us.

Job Description:
Director of Marketing
Location


Vista, CA

Full time

Apply Now

Essential Functions:
Taking directive from the VP of Marketing, define and deliver global, multi-channel marketing strategy.
Manage company-wide global marketing calendar and ensure flawless execution of marketing initiatives.

Oversee development of all global and partner/ market/ channel-specific seasonal campaigns, , ensuring on-time and on-budget execution.
Represent commercial function at all strategic planning meetings.
Create a distribution strategy for the total portfolio and by segment in line with the company`s growth expectations.
Contribute to the development and achievement of financial goals including revenue and spend.
Develop and execute strategic plans for public relations and social media, inclusive of influencer marketing, content creation & curation, community management, collaborations, partnerships, and activations.
Drive overall brand awareness, engagement, and growth ensuring achievement of company KPIs.
Work with your team to develop the right mix of organic and earned media, and collaborate with Digital Marketing on paid media and affiliate opportunities.
Manage external PR agency and ensure ongoing cultivation and development of relationships with relevant media outlets on a national, regional, and community level.
Oversee the development and execution of highly experiential virtual and physical events that elevate client engagement.

Must be a self-starter with energy, drive and determination to accomplish goals.

Beauty industry experience a plus.

Job Title: Manager, Regional Medical Director Training - Medical Affairs
Job Description:
Working at Horizon is more than a job – it’s personal. For us, success is measured by the numbers that matter most – the number of lives we touch, the number we change and those we work tirelessly to help save. We’re a team of agile, out-of-the-box thinkers who are inspired to do more because we know we’re a part of something bigger. We strive to build meaningful careers at a company whose values we share because when we live up to our potential, we help others live up to theirs.

Position Summary:

The Manager, Medical Affairs Regional Medical Director (RMD) Training will assist the National Director RMD Training and Medical Affairs Operations team with daily operations, including support for training endeavors involving field-based RMD teams and in-house Medical Affairs departments. These duties include working collaboratively with Medical Affairs Operations team members, cross-functional partners, and vendors to provide support for RMD/Medical Affairs training needs, such as training content management, vendor management, organizing and maintaining content within different systems, contributing to internal and external meetings, and managing ad hoc requests.

Responsibilities:
Provide organization and ongoing maintenance of training content within an online platform (e.g., SharePoint)
Act as liaison to cross-functional partners, Medical Directors, and vendors to support training content creation, management, and delivery processes through use of existing platforms and venues
Provide logistical support for training processes, including planning for training roll-out/delivery, communication, scheduling of meetings with presenters and audience, and collaboration with other internal and external parties
Support on-boarding of new RMDs, including communication and collaboration with National Directors, Medical Affairs Operations, HR, and field-training personnel to provide a seamless experience
Manage approval process for externally-facing content used by RMD teams as designated by National Director, RMD Training within content approval system
Proofread training and other designated content for style and formatting in accordance with appropriate style guide
Assist with aspects of large-scale RMD training projects, including project management, understanding existing business processes, identifying opportunities for collaboration and improvement, obtaining guidance from Legal, Compliance, HR, IT or other partners as appropriate, and proposing and implementing solutions as a member of the Medical Affairs Operations team
Monitor changes and make recommendations for training tool technology options and other available courses aligned with needs of field-based teams
Effectively manage multiple tasks and projects with cross-functional stakeholders
Operate within established compliance and regulatory guidelines and regulations
Qualifications and Skills Required:
Minimum BA/BS, advanced scientific degree preferred
Minimum 3-5 years of relevant experience in the pharmaceutical industry, preferably with experience in academic/scientific training or Medical Affairs
Experience using business systems, such as WebEx and Veeva Vault MedComms, preferred
Strong organization and project management skills and experience are required
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to self-motivate and work independently to drive projects forward
Ability to travel up to 10% for business meetings
Experience working with remote team members
Proficiency with MS Office, including SharePoint, and Office365 required
Must have ability to learn to use new business applications across hardware tools (e.g., PC, iPad)

Growth

Demonstrates Self-awareness
Cultivates Innovation
Develops Talent
Accountability
Drives Results
Ensures Accountability

Courage

Job Description:
As Strategy Principal, you will take on a leadership role in establishing microtransit as a new, smart mode of public transit. By overseeing and coordinating the development of complex commercial proposals for cities and transit providers around the world, you will leverage your experience creating longform written content, understanding of our clients' challenges and goals, and knowledge of Via's unique technological and operational strengths, to produce compelling, RFP-winning proposals.

What You'll Do
Oversee the simultaneous development of multiple competitive procurements from beginning to end -- through evaluation, content creation, review, and submission.
Apply your strategic thinking skills and work closely with Via's Finance and Expansion Teams to create context-specific service plans and customized pricing and budgeting proposals.
Generate high-quality original content by closely ascertaining a partner's needs and deploying your familiarity with Via's technology and operational capabilities, transit norms, and the latest innovations from across the industry.
Oversee document flow to ensure responsiveness, adherence to quality standards, and legal compliance.
Provide expert peer review and editing feedback for other team members' proposals
Skillfully manage communications with procurement officials over the phone and email.
Support senior team members during off-site proposal interviews.
Who You Are
You have at least three years of experience creating content and managing deadlines as a writer in a dynamic, fast-paced business environment (five years or more plus managerial experience are strongly preferred).
You're an exceptional writer with an instinctive appreciation for tone and structure; your colleagues have told you that they enjoy reading your work (and maybe you've even won awards.)
Meticulous and strategic; you can pay attention to every detail in a complex proposal while, at the same time, relating each of them to the big picture in a coherent way.
A record of academic achievement, preferably in the humanities, social sciences, or another field that required regular long-form writing (undergraduate degree required, advanced degree preferred.)
What Catches Our Eye
Prior experience at a startup, consulting firm, or in a leadership role is a plus.
At Via, we're on the cutting edge of mobility. We're building revolutionary technology that's changing the way people get around. It's on-demand transit on a mass scale, a smarter transportation that's friendly to our planet. From on-demand autonomous shuttles in Australia to dynamically routed bus fleets in Singapore, our sophisticated operating system is powering transportation in the world's biggest cities and is sought after by prominent transportation players globally. We've provided more than 50 million shared rides already, and we're growing at an astonishing rate. We have offices in more than 15 countries and deployments in more than 50 markets, with a goal of hundreds of deployments within the next two years. If you're someone who relishes wearing multiple hats, never backs down from a challenge, and loves getting things done, we'd love to hear from you!

Via offers above market compensation packages and benefits, including equity, health insurance, and relocation assistance.

Via is an equal opportunity employer.

Job Title: Marketing Coordinator, Promotional Medical Education Marketing
Job Description:
About Lockwood: Lockwood collaborates with clients in the pharmaceutical, biotech, and medical device industries to identify effective, holistic, science-based strategies to address their objectives through medical communications. Our clients count on us to challenge their assumptions and help them creatively navigate around obstacles. From strategy through execution, we focus on accuracy, transparency, and scientific value to create programs that are evidence-based, clinically relevant, and contribute to the development of our clients’ brands. Over a third of our staff hold advanced scientific or medical degrees, and most work from where they live. Because our flexible structure provides better work-life balance, we attract the best talent, facilitate their best work, and as a result, we are more responsive to our clients, wherever and whenever they do business.

Summary: The Project Coordinator contributes to the development of many aspects of medical communications initiatives. Depending on the scope and nature of each project, this responsibility can range from managing segments of a project on which a Project Manager is taking a primary lead, to supporting segments of the project in which other team members have responsibility. The number of simultaneous projects is dependent on the scope and nature of each initiative, as well as on the skills of the individual.
Fulfillment of these responsibilities requires interaction with multidisciplinary teams, interfacing with each department within the company, meeting client and management expectations as communicated by the project team leader, maintaining strong faculty, speaker, and advisor relationships (when applicable), and contributing to the on-budget, on-time, on-strategy status of each project. The Project Coordinator also continually provides updates to internal and external team members. Although not a primary responsibility, the Project Coordinator also helps support budget and proposal development, maintenance and reconciliation, and managing external suppliers so these areas of responsibility become increasingly familiar. The Project Coordinator also facilitates the completion of central files for each project.
In order to perform these functions, the Project Coordinator must have strong verbal and written communication skills. He/she must also be highly organized, comfortable working on multidisciplinary teams, adept at multitasking and prioritizing activities, have basic financial management skills, have a positive attitude, and be able/eager to motivate others.

Responsibilities:
Contribute to the development and management of all project activities, including audience generation, Internet research on medical associations and industry events, database management, logistics management, registration/participant communication, production of materials, honoraria/reimbursement process, supplier performance, routing of all materials through copy editing, and central file establishment
Participate in start-up meetings for each project, contribute to establishment and maintenance of time and events schedules, and provide weekly updates on each initiative to Project Manager(s)
Utilize database system (Microsoft Access) for key opinion leader management, mail merges, faculty information requests, and report generation
Support Project Manager(s) on all assigned projects by managing and fulfilling tasks as requested. Adhere to all deadlines. If workload becomes overwhelming and deadlines are in jeopardy of being missed, immediately alert Project Manager(s) and ask for help in prioritizing workload and/or obtaining assistance from other team members
Maintain timely and professional written and verbal communications with internal team members, clients, faculty, and participants as they pertain to specific areas of project involvement
Contribute to development of new project budgets and new business development activities within the account team, as identified by Project Manager(s)
Learn and contribute to the budgeting process, including financial monitoring and reconciliation of individual projects within account teams
Contribute to progress of multidisciplinary internal teams (project management, editorial, meeting and events services, and creative services) to ensure within-budget, on-time, on-strategy performance
Maintain and adhere to client policies and SOPs as they pertain to all activities

The Associate User Experience Designer role is responsible for contributing to the design and execution of an intuitive experience strategy and a clean, modern, and efficient dashboard interface that drives content creation for NWEAs new, Through Year Assessment product.

Job Description:
Job Overview

We are looking for an enthusiastic, hardworking and dedicated professional with strong writing, editing and proofing skills with a background in healthcare and medical industries. This role will be responsible for producing engaging print and digital content for medical providers and patients based on research, interviews and historical company data. We are offering a great opportunity to work with a dynamic leader in the genomics and precision medicine industry. If you enjoy breaking down complex medical and research topics and turning them into digestible bites for consumers and professionals in a fast paced and creative environment, then come join our team.

About Us

Ambry Genetics Corporation is a CAP-accredited and CLIA-licensed molecular genetics laboratory based in Aliso Viejo, California. We are a genetics-based healthcare company that is dedicated to open scientific exchange so we can work together to understand and treat all human disease faster.

At Ambry, everyone is welcome. A career at Ambry Genetics is a chance to be part of a dynamic company that aims to improve health by understanding the relationships between genetics and human disease. We earned our reputation as industry leaders by responsibly introducing cutting-edge genetic testing solutions and continually sharing what we learn with the global scientific community.

At Ambry you will be learning, challenging yourself, and having fun while collaborating with teammates through the open exchange of ideas. Employees at Ambry Genetics have many perks, including an onsite café with complimentary smoothies and infused waters! Company Description:

InEight is a leading developer of construction project management software that enables contractors, engineers and owners to overcome their greatest project pain points. InEight’s solutions span every stage of the project life cycle from design to estimate and from field execution to turnover. The solutions give project stakeholders the real-time information and insights needed to minimize risks, improve operational efficiency, control project costs, and make educated decisions easily.

Based in Scottsdale, Arizona, InEight has offices in Omaha, Nebraska; Houston, Texas; Portland, OR; Melbourne, Australia; Sydney, Australia and Colombo, Sri Lanka. InEight, an ISO 9001:2015-registered company, is a subsidiary of Kiewit Corporation (Kiewit). Kiewit, through its subsidiaries, is one of North America’s largest and most respected construction and engineering organizations.

InEight is a fast-paced, innovative company comprised of high energy teams of self-starters playing integral roles in shaping the future of capital projects around the world. Our industry-leading solutions, dedicated employees, and proven leadership team provide a solid foundation to support our continued growth and success.

About InEight Portland:

InEight Portland is an engineering focused outpost of InEight with a distinctly start-up culture. Our office is on the 13th floor in downtown Portland, with tons of nearby shops, food carts, and restaurants within a quick walk. Benefits include medical, dental, vision, generous PTO, secure bike parking, easy public transit, gym, showers, free coffee, and more. We value an ego-less engineering culture for building the best solutions. We believe that a talented and cohesive team is the most critical element to developing good software. We want the 'right' amount of process, because if we are in meetings all day then no-one is building software.

Summary

As a Project Delivery Consultant at InEight, you will be responsible for carrying out the company’s commitment to solve industry problems. You will work directly with a wide range of owners, engineering and construction firms, using the InEight Model product. Customers will depend on you to guide them through the development of implementation plans, standards, and best practices procedures, you will also be responsible for facilitating product trainings and providing advanced support for high priority customers. Ultimately, you will utilize your construction or engineering background to facilitate better decision-making for our clients and ensure the overall success of our customers as they utilize InEight solutions.

** This position ideally will be located in Portland, and has the flexibility to work remotely.

QUALIFICATIONS
2+ years Experience with Revit, AutoCAD, or other 3D content creation tools
Experience on multi-discipline construction projects
Technology Savvy with the ability to quickly learn and adopt new technologies
Organized, self-managing, and focused on delivering against a plan
Experience managing customers and/or stakeholders - preferred
Experience leading product/process trainings or walkthroughs – preferred
Able to communicate well with teams demonstrating strong verbal and written communication skills, with proven ability to present information both to technical and non-technical to customers/stakeholders, in the appropriate media and form.
Able to synthesize and articulate complex concepts targeted at multiple audience
Experience working with geographically dispersed teams
Experience with standard Office products, PDF software, support tools (Zendesk, ServiceNow), project management and collaboration software
Able to travel domestically and/or internationally approximately 50% of the time
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Become an expert user of the InEight Model product.
Provide open channels of communication between the company and the customer.
Ensure projects have robust documentation outlining success criteria, metrics, and implementation plans.
Organize and support customer troubleshooting efforts.
Support customer escalations and provide a closed feedback loop on production issues.
Tie customer requirements back to product initiatives.
Create and successfully deliver product demonstration material.
Create customer workflow, training, and support material.
Provide customer(s) with advanced product training and support.
Participate in sales pursuit initiatives by helping with RFP responses, demo environments, and implementation proposals.
Collaborate across teams to achieve company and customer goals.
Organize, create, and communicate clear customer requirements to product development teams.
Provide constructive feedback into product development teams, utilizing your field expertise and customer experience.
Participate in and help lead product feedback discussions with customers.
Stays focused on delivering quality services, encourages teamwork, transparency and collaboration.

Triplemint is on a mission to create a better real estate experience for buyers, sellers, and renters. We're an innovative full-service brokerage combining technology, teamwork, and personalized service to serve the modern generation of homebuyers and sellers. Triplemint leverages data and predictive analytics to give our clients access to homes before they are listed, resulting in more options for buyers and a strategic approach for sellers. Founded in 2011, Triplemint is headquartered in New York City and has raised $20M from leading real estate VCs.

The Position:

Triplemint is looking for a social media and content manager to join our expanding Marketing department. You will be working to build our social media presence and humanize our brand through meticulous execution of brand and content strategies that engage our clients. You will also educate, inspire, and grow our agents, who are eager to learn from your direction. Research and coordinate paid influencer and blogger campaigns
Create and run social media trainings for our agents, helping with content strategy and creative development (some have very large followings!)
Develop an optimal posting schedule, considering web traffic and customer engagement metrics
Help manage corporate email marketing campaigns
Grow our social following using strategic growth strategies and innovative content
Manage our company blog including writing or curating multiple blog posts per week leveraging best practices for SEO
Who You Are:
Bachelor's degree, preferably in marketing, communication or journalism
2+ years of experience managing social media for an established brand
Strong writing skills, with an emphasis on writing for web and engaging social content
Familiarity with both paid and organic social strategies
Understanding of tone and marketing messaging as it relates to customer acquisition and brand guidelines
Proficient with Adobe Creative Suite; Google Analytics a plus
Organized and ambitious, with a strong dedication to accuracy and follow-through
