Job Description


About the role:

The Marketing Campaign Manager is responsible for planning and executing integrated marketing communications campaigns – for client markets – focusing around products and solutions in mobile computing, XR and smart home. This role uses the full marketing communications mix, including online and offline elements, as well as track, optimize, and report on the results of the programs to ensure accurate measurement and effectiveness.

This role will drive cross-functional marketing teams and serve as the point of execution for integrating the strategic, creative, and operations output of other teams within the company supporting our campaign platform.

The Marketing Campaign Manager is responsible for planning and executing integrated marketing communications campaigns – for client markets – focusing around products and solutions in mobile computing, XR and smart home. This role uses the full marketing communications mix, including online and offline elements, as well as track, optimize, and report on the results of the programs to ensure proper measurement and effectiveness.

This role will drive cross-functional marketing teams and serve as the point of execution for integrating the strategic, creative, and operations output of other teams within the company supporting our campaign platform.

What will I be accountable for:
Develop and execute marketing campaigns working closely with our business segment, product and corporate marketing teams to improve exposure of Arm’s leadership and technologies for client markets.
Partnerclosely with cross-functional teams to build themes, messages and supporting proof points and demonstrate those across various marketing activities including content creation, email, events, webinars, online sponsorships, digital content, case studies and white paper programs in a cohesive manner.
Deliver ideas that are innovative and provocative with your marketing activities,coming up with strategies on how to optimally engage with these audiences. Taking sophisticated technical products and solutions and crafting compelling strategies to tell its story.
Build and execute events plans, in support of specific events.
Execute creative, effective campaign and test plans; including marketing briefs, creative briefs, and segmentation matrices, as well as manage internal and external contacts.
Deliver projects on time and to an exceptional standard.
Lead the creation and management of effective tracking and reporting processes for campaign activities.

Job Requirements


What Skills, experience, & qualifications do I need:
Demonstrated time management, organizational and problem-solving skills.
Expertise in developing global strategies and optimization of messages and target audiences
Analytical skills that align with how to think about campaigns and their outcomes
Ability to manage and advance many projects simultaneously and adapt quickly to the unexpected.
Excellent interpersonal verbal, presentation and written communication adaptive to a broad range of audiences.
Ability to lead and encourage a cross-functional team to achieve high performance results within a positive, motivated and constantly evolving environment.
Self-motivated, proactive and collaborative.
Experience with digital marketing, content marketing, event management and media & analyst relations.
At Arm, we are guided by our core beliefs that reflect our rare culture and guide our decisions, defining how we work together to defy ordinary and shape extraordinary:

We, not I

Collaboration first, egos last.

•Start with long-term value to customers and partners, and work back from there.

•Collaborate, decide, commit, and bring people with you.

•Make the most of all the skills and knowledge across Arm; share information with those who need it.

•Care about the people around you.

Passion for progress

Innovation that enables our ecosystems, Arm and our people to thrive.

•Work with pace and judgement. Adapt to circumstances.

•Take risk in support of Arm's progress.

•Be accountable for the decisions you take. Learn from failure.

•Pursue innovation relentlessly.

Be your brilliant self

Skillful individuality, performance and fulfilment.

•Be authentic.

•Seek and embrace differences.

•Encourage curiosity and challenge.

•Give people trust and autonomy; show people they can trust you to do brilliant work in pursuit of Arm’s goals.

Job Description:
Site Name: USA - Pennsylvania - Upper Providence
Posted Date: Apr 22 2020

The Oncology Global Sales Training Manager/Director will develop and execute an effective knowledge acquisition strategy, with compelling content for learners in Oncology field selling roles, enabling selling outcomes, to be benchmarked in the top quartile amongst specialist Pharma organisations.

This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career. These responsibilities include some of the following:
Build sales training modules to drive sales success across the Oncology portfolio, encompassing therapy area, product knowledge and campaign. In addition, key capabilities required for LOCs to achieve their Oncology brand ambition such as market access, business acumen, key account management and closed loop marketing.
Foster strong and supportive cross functional internal and external relationships with senior stakeholders (VP level), customers and agencies, to align on requirements and deliver timely, high quality, engaging and practically applicable learning programs with heavy emphasis on US & Global Stakeholders and Regional European Leads.
Take a holistic view of all in field learning material being generated, to ensure that for each brand and X- portfolio, that this is synergistic for different audiences and incorporates best practice learnings from other brands or organisations.
Ensures that there is sufficient resourcing and signposting of learning work programs, to facilitate the right cross functional input, review and approval without placing undue pressure on commercial, access, medical, legal and analytics functions.
Accountable for developing, refining and embedding a Learning Capabilities Measurement Plan for Oncology, ensuring that this is appropriately integrated with existing measurement tools (e.g STEM) to provide confidence that learning modules, programs and frameworks are having the desired impact in tier one markets.
Able to identify knowledge gaps for sales teams and other customer facing audiences and rectify this working independently or by proposing solutions to be executed through other teams or appropriate channels.
Accountable for developing and delivery of promotional training content (including creation of materials and copy approval process) for major Oncology events such as Fast Starts and Global Product Launches. (National events in tier one markets should be supported where no other Regional or LOC sales training resource with this remit exists).
Expected to spend time in field with reps and field managers observing customer interactions and using insights generated to enhance or further shape learning interventions.
Ensures all Oncology training complies with GSKs code of practice, and all other relevant SOPs relating to customer interactions.
Maintain an external and customer-facing focus to evaluate innovative new training or learning trends and translates these into opportunities for upskilling activities within the oncology therapy area.
Why you?
Basic Qualifications:


We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
Bachelor level degree in Science, Business, Marketing, Leadership development, or similar.
5 plus years commercial experience in sales, sales training and/or marketing roles with demonstrated success in-market.
Specialist experience and similar B2B sales experience.
Leadership experience; ideally district manager experience
Evidence of instructional design/adult learning, capability building, upskilling or change initiatives.
US Sales and/or Marketing Training Experience
Preferred Qualifications:


If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:
Strong ability to understand GSKs Oncology therapy area strategic context and work pro-actively within role scope to achieve the organisations highest priorities.
Strong planning and program management skills with the ability to set priorities, meet deadlines and develop workflow processes and tasks for multiple projects

Brasfield & Gorrie, a recognized leader in the construction industry, has an exciting opportunity available for a Regional VDC Manager in Atlanta, Georiga and Nashville, Tennessee.

The Regional Manager of Virtual Design & Construction (VDC) is responsible for overseeing all aspects of VDC services within their area of responsibility. Generally, responsibilities include working with Division Managers, Preconstruction Managers, and Project Managers to understand upcoming workload, provide recommendations for VDC support on projects, develop project specific VDC Service Plans, and appropriately plan for staffing of VDC Coordinators. Additionally, the Regional VDC Manager will balance daily project tasks with the work capacity of their Coordinators. The Manager must report on the group's work capacity to the Director, and participate in Department capacity meetings. The Regional VDC Manager must be able to perform all base line level services offered by the VDC Department and train other departments in the company.

Responsibilities and Essential Duties include the following (other duties may be assigned):
Oversee all VDC Services for all projects associated with the area of responsibility
Develop project specific BIM Execution Plans by engaging with internal and external project teams including preconstruction, operations, architects, engineers, and subcontractors
Plan for and oversee the execution of VDC Services performed on projects included within area of responsibility- services include:
Regional Training & Support
Project Pursuit Services (BIM Execution Plan Development, RFP technical write-ups/responses, graphic content creation, animation creation, presentation support/attendance)
Preconstruction Support (Design Model Constructability Reviews, Modeling, Quantity Take-off support)
Construction Services (Trade Coordination start-up/check-ins, Trade Coordination extended support or on-site, Model Development, BIM360 use, Model based Layout Support)
Other Services (Modeling, Virtual Reality, Laser Scanning, UAVs guidance, 3D Printing, Facility Management Integration)
Manage a team of VDC Coordinators including staffing, oversight, general support, and project reviews/final reports
Be able to effectively communicate VDC Services performed on projects along with final reports to operational leads
Education - Skills - Knowledge - Qualifications & Experience
Bachelor degree in Engineering, Architecture or Construction
Minimum of 5 years of experience in the construction industry with minimum 3 years direct BIM/VDC responsibilities preferred
Proven capability of managing multiple projects and multiple people
Experience in implementing and managing every aspect of VDC Services
Proficiency with Autodesk Revit, Navisworks, AutoCad, A360 is required
Experience with Synchro, 3DS Max, Lumion, P6, Assemble Systems, Timberline, & Inventor is a plus
Strong written and verbal communications skills

Start your career in a big way

Job Title: Associate Director, Regulatory Medical Writing, Global Medical Affairs
Job Description:
BioMarin is the world leader in delivering therapeutics that provide meaningful advances to patients who live with serious and life-threatening rare genetic diseases. We target diseases that lack effective therapies and affect relatively small numbers of patients, many of whom are children. These conditions are often inherited, difficult to diagnose, progressively debilitating and have few, if any, treatment options. BioMarin will continue to focus on advancing therapies that are the first or best of their kind.

Overview

Global Medical Affairs (GMAF) is an expert scientific and medical function that develops and maintains non-promotional, evidence-based, transparent and balanced scientific and educational programs and resources in support of BioMarins products and disease states of interest. We do this by assuring safe and appropriate product use, supporting continuous scientific exchange and through ongoing and new data generation.

The Medical Communications group is responsible for leading the scientific publication and regulatory document development efforts across GMAF. The scientific publications are critical elements in the collection and dissemination of scientific and clinical data to healthcare providers, enabling them to provide the best possible care to their patients, while the regulatory documents help fulfill post-marketing commitments to ensure ongoing patient access to our therapies. The medical writer applies documentation preparation and project management skills to assist in the development, drafting, reviewing, editing, and finalization of documents used in conducting clinical studies and reporting clinical study results for regulatory submissions and publications.

Summary

The Associate Director supports the Medical Communications regulatory writing function in alignment with the requirements of GMAF and organizational goals. This is an emerging leadership position in Medical Communications with substantial strategic input across GMAF for assigned product(s) or therapeutic area(s). The Associate Director will focus on shaping and defining medical writing activities for assigned products, including synthesizing stakeholder input, ensuring alignment cross-functionally, and conducting gap analyses for defining the writing strategy. The Associate Director will also lead content creation activities including oversight of contract writers and ensure compliance with all BioMarin standard operation procedures. This position may be responsible for supporting Medical Communications functional leadership activities including managing staff, budgets, and departmental activities.

Responsibilities

Drafts and edits documents used in conducting and reporting the results of clinical studies, including protocols, protocol amendments, informed consent forms, and clinical study reports
Drafts and edits documents used in reporting aggregate safety and efficacy information for a molecule, such as investigators brochures and periodic study reports
Drafts and edits clinical summary documents (Modules 2.5 and 2.7) used in NDA/BLA filings that conform to ICH CTD structure
Provides peer review and editing support for other regulatory documents such as response documents and briefing packages
Manages study team participation in the preparation of such documents, including calling/running meetings and managing the document review and comment adjudication processes
Adheres to departmental procedures and practices and technical and industry standards during all aspects of work
Participates in providing oversight of external medical writing vendors and contributing to the development of documents
Works effectively in a highly cross-functional environment. Establishes and maintains effective cross-functional communication, including with key Study Management, Clinical, Commercial, and Regulatory counterparts and stakeholders
Establishes relationships with healthcare professionals/authors/investigators
Supports Medical Communications group in the management of departmental workflow and deliverables
Assists Director of Medical Communications to forecast and secure resources for document development
Other tasks as assigned
Education & Experience
BA/BS in life or health sciences; advanced degree (MS or doctoral) preferred
5 or more years of experience as a medical writer in the pharmaceutical industry
8 or more years of medical or scientific writing experience as a primary job responsibility
Evidence of medical writing career development desirable, eg, American Medical Writers Association certificate, Editor in Life Sciences certificate, or relevant training through Drug Information Association

Job Description:
Rubicon is seeking a Senior Specialist, Integrated Marketing whowill help develop and deliver multi-platform marketing programs with the goal of driving both brand awareness and business growth for the company.

Reporting to the company’s Senior Director of Marketing, the Senior Specialist will ensure alignment with the organization’s overall vision, mission, and strategy and will provide leadership in maintaining the company’s internal and external marketing plans. This individual must have an understanding of the full range of current marketing techniques in combination with excellent project management, analytical and communications skills. They must value teamwork above all as they will be working alongside specialists from different disciplines across the companyincluding, but not limited to, sales, technology, sustainability, social media, events, and content creation.

This position is based in the company’s rapidly growing New York City office andonly candidates located in New York City, or with the ability to relocate to New York City within 30 days of hiring, will be considered.

TheSenior Specialist, Integrated Marketing must have an understanding of the requirements and benefits of integrated campaigns, and of how different campaign elements work together to reinforce one another and improve results. Their knowledge and experience helps them conceptualize and develop messaging and creative direction, and deploy those in a coordinated fashion while preserving Rubicon’s brand standards across marketing channels.

Specific Responsibilities

· Support the development and execution of multi-channel marketing campaigns that include email, mobile, paid search, digital and web content, as well as traditional media (outdoor, transit) to build both brand awareness and add qualified leads to the sales pipeline

· Ensure all marketing programs, both internal and external, meet corporate brand guidelines

· Collaborate with key stakeholders across the business to build alignment and support for integrated campaigns

· Establish and track campaign objectives, KPIs and success metrics to evaluate effectiveness and overall performance; report back to management and adjust future tactics and campaigns as needed

· Develop and execute against creative briefs in collaboration with Rubicon’s web/digital agency of record, provide creative direction and articulate strategy on projects

· Help establish and implement scalable processes and project management for marketing campaign development

· Leverage trends and best practices in marketing to drive innovative and effective marketing strategy

· Help manage external agencies and vendors (e.g., direct the activities of outside designers, creative agencies, photographers, writers, event companies, etc.)

· Maintain awareness of new marketing technologies and techniques, and implement them in daily work

Candidate Qualifications/Experience

· BA/BS (or equivalent) and 4+ years of experience in integrated marketing

· Agency experience is preferred

· Strong knowledge of the digital and social media landscape

· Strong graphic design understanding/capabilities

· Familiarity with sustainability industry and principles

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with an eye for design and passion for storytelling

· Experience with media planning, buying and ad operations

· Solid understanding of content production across platforms

About Rubicon Global

Rubicon is a technology company that powers a digital marketplace, provides a suite of SaaS products for waste, recycling, and smart city solutions, and collects and analyzes data for businesses and governments worldwide. Using technology to drive environmental innovation, the company helps turn businesses into more sustainable enterprises, and neighborhoods into greener and smarter places to live and work. Rubicon’s mission is to end waste, in all of its forms, by helping its partners find economic value in their waste streams and confidently execute on their sustainability goals. The company is a Certified B Corporation, affirming that Rubicon meets the highest standards of verified social and environmental performance. Through its technology, Rubicon is transforming the entire category of waste and recycling. With more than 2.6 million service locations worldwide, Rubicon is headquartered in Atlanta, GA, and has core teams in New York, NY; San Francisco, CA; St. Louis, MO; and Tinton Falls, NJ. Rubicon was named a Great Place to Work® in 2018 and 2019, and was recognized as one of Glassdoor’s“Top Ten Companies with Seriously Impressive Benefits” in 2018.

Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well

Job Description:
Company Overview:

Vital Proteins is an emerging, dynamic brand consisting of a team of passionate individuals who believe whole-food-based nutrition is essential for overall health, fitness and wellbeing. Our team is comprised of intelligent and innovative talent who work collaboratively to ensure creativity, success, and global growth. At Vital Proteins, our mission is to empower our company, team, and customers to live a full, vibrant life. We seek to develop and support the right people, with the right chemistry, who continually ask questions, and in turn will develop and tactically execute good ideas. We are looking for individuals to help us think smarter and put a lot of ideas on the table in a short amount of time. Building a great company is our goal. Quality individuals and getting the team right is our business plan.

Role:

We are looking for a high energy, passionate and extremely communicative Influencer Marketing Coordinator to help us establish and grow our influencer relationships and build a true online community. This person will touch the wellness, fitness, and beauty communities to reach and connect with the right people, both on and offline. In a nutshell, this person will help us carry our marketing strategy through to the consumer by creating his/her own network of influencers to speak about the brand. The Influencer Marketing Coordinator role will operate out of our West Loop office and be assisting a team of Influencer Marketing Relationship Managers, reporting to the Senior Manager of Influencer Relationships.

What you will be responsible for:
Marketing Vital Proteins product to influencers, brand ambassadors and consumers through various social media platforms and email outreach
Cold outreach through social platforms to foster partnerships and help the team grow our social network
Assisting the social media and influencer teams with their daily objectives to meet key quarterly milestones
Having an active understanding of influencer/digital marketing knowledge & social media trends
Being an evangelist of the brand, coming up with new and inventive ways to promote the products to our network
Collaborating with the warehouse on product shipments to influencers and brand ambassadors
Who you are:
Bachelors degree in marketing or a related field
You have a minimum of 1+ years of experience in Marketing.
You have 1-2 years of experience in influencer marketing, preferably in the CPG industry
You are passionate about the fitness, beauty, wellness, fashion, and lifestyle
You are a self-starter with proven ability to take initiative, define what needs to get done and multi-task
You are a people person you enjoy communicating & are happiest when youre corresponding with others and forming new relationships
You are social, outgoing, personable and friendly
In your spare time, you always find yourself scouting new people to follow on Instagram or are out and about making new connections with like-minded individuals
You celebrate your success, and the success of the team even more
You have strong written and oral communication skills
Minimal travel required (tentatively once a quarter)
Must have strong business acumen and entrepreneurial spirit
You must be able to read, write and understand English
Vital Proteins is proud to be an equal employment opportunity employer

Company Description

At Optiv, we’re on a mission to help our clients make their businesses more secure. We’re one of the fastest growing companies in a truly essential industry.

In your role at Optiv, you’ll be inspired by a team of the brightest business and technical minds in cyber security. We are passionate champions for our clients, and know from experience that the best solutions for our clients’ needs come from working hard together. As part of our team, your voice matters, and you will do important work that has impact, on people, businesses and nations. Our industry and our company move fast, and you can be sure that you will always have room to learn and grow. We’re proud of our team and the important work we do to build confidence for a more connected world.

Job Description

Who we are looking for:

Optiv Solutions Marketing is seeking a Solutions Marketing Manager to own the go-to-market strategy and messaging development of Optiv services in partnership with Services practice leadership. He or she will be supporting the market opportunity and targeting at the beginning stages of ideation through the development of the marketing strategy. He or she will be accountable for working and collaborating with a cross-functional team to develop a marketing and content plan and manage to ensure it is flawlessly executed. Part of that process will ensure all stakeholders have a clear idea of the market, business problem, and how the service is differentiated in the market. The role must have a technical understanding with a marketing proficiency in the areas of go-to-market strategy and planning covering the launch of new products and evaluating new sales opportunities for an existing product. He or she must be organized, collaborative, and flexible to work in a fast-paced environment.

How you’ll make an impact:

The Solutions Marketing Manager will work with various departments within Optiv to define and position security services and solutions. A typical day would involve the following:
Own the go-to-market marketing strategy in working with the product management and technical stakeholders on the best positioning of Optiv services
Analysis of marketing opportunity, ability to identify marketing targets and sub-targets and competitive analysis
Ownership and development of marketing core content including, but not limited to: Sales pitch decks, whitepapers, messaging briefing documents, battle cards, blogs and collateral.
Understanding the information security landscape and the domain of offerings that are currently offered, what should be offered, the features provided, advantages to the client, and benefits that are addressed.
Accountable to manage a cross-functional team across marketing and product management to ensure a service campaign has everything required from knowledge transfer, analysis, marketing plan, content creation management, execution, and measurement
Collaborating with corporate brand and public relations departments for the promotion of solutions and building the marketing plan
Collaborating with demand generation team, local marketing, product management, sales enablement, digital marketing, etc.
Manage multiple programs and juggle various stages of the launch plan as well as ongoing service offering content support
Maintain a dashboard on performance and key learnings to make future and current launches better
Qualifications

Qualifications:
8+ years experience in any combination of: product marketing, go-to-market strategy, and/or product management in a technology field with cyber security being the area preferred
Must have Bachelor’s degree or Master’s Degree
Demonstrated ownership of marketing campaigns and solutions
Demonstrated partnership with product management on bringing a service to market (either new or existing)
Demonstrate ability to analyze the marketing and dive in research with high-degree of intellectual curiosity
Experience in creating differentiate positioning
Must demonstrate ability to create a go-to-market marketing strategy and plan for execution
Work in a collaborative and fast-paced environment
Excellent written and presentation skills
Experience with partnering with 3rd parties and vendor partners for content development and research preferred
Proficient in PowerPoint, Excel, Word
Experience using tools like WorkFront, Marketo, Salesforce and others preferred
#LI-SM1

It is a really exciting time to be at Extra Space Storage! We got our start in 1977. Today we are a New York Stock Exchange-traded company leading the self-storage industry in more ways than one. But in order to maintain this lead, we need exceptionally motivated, capable, and driven people like you. We offer a fast-paced collaborative environment where each of us directly contributes to the company’s success. Come join us and find out why Glassdoor recognized Extra Space Storage as one of the top 100 BEST places to work in the U.S.!

Extra Space Storage is currently hiring for a Digital Content Marketing Specialist for our corporate offices in Salt Lake City, UT.

If you are a vibrant storyteller who is passionate about making sure your story reaches its intended audience, this is the position for you. This role is ideal for someone who loves to write with prior PR experience using traditional and digital tactics for sharing a brand’s story. In this role, you will develop content and communications strategies that drive brand visibility and enhance SEO efforts.

Extra Space Storage’s Digital Content Marketing Specialist will be responsible for creating content strategies that are highly engaging, bring social and SEO value, while demonstrating the benefits of the company’s products and services. In addition to building strategies, responsibilities may include writing a portion of the website, social and blog content.

In this role you will be working closely with social media marketing teams to help identify social opportunities as part of the integrated content strategy and looking for off-website publishing opportunities. Your work will need to engage each defined target audience while adhering to established keyword research strategies.

While design duties are not required as a part of this position, experience creating or managing the creation of visual, interactive and video elements of a content strategy are a plus.

You must be authentic and collaborative with general excitement to tell the story of your wins and losses to leadership and coworkers. Reporting and accountability is important in this role. Can you own your wins and losses, and are you willing to share both to make your teammates and the organization stronger?

The ideal candidate will be able to identify two or more of the following prior successes and should tell the story of these successes in cover letter accompanying resume submission:
A content strategy built as a multi-channel campaign that met predefined goals.
Ecommerce digital marketing success story (positive ROI) utilizing each of the following disciplines: content marketing, social media marketing, search engine optimization.
Successful social media campaign designed to reach and activate a pre-defined audience.
Example of creative, web, or other interactive elements created/designed for use in a digital marketing campaign.
Successful custom, white-hat link building strategy that used new strategies.
Recognized public relations work for small, medium and large businesses on both a local and national level.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Prepare content strategies for website, blog, and other channels to meet the goals of multiple digital marketing disciplines.
Publish and control master content calendar.
Research competitors and build strategies to advance Extra Space in multiple markets.
Conduct outreach to promote content among top domains and social influencers.
Generate copy in a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines.
Ensure written content meets and adheres to overall brand guidelines and individual project strategies.
Collaborate with other teams to develop and execute holistic digital marketing efforts.
Managing relationship with external partners.
Education and/or Experience:
Degree in Advertising, Communications, English, Journalism, Marketing, or related field.
6+ years of experience in content creation, copywriting, editing, marketing, public relations or similar advertising position(s)
Prior WordPress publishing experience.
Proven ability to find and manage vendors necessary for executing on digital strategies.
Excellent editing skills used to review your own and others’ work for spelling and grammatical errors, word choice, organization and formatting issues.
Thorough understanding of AP Stylebook.
Familiarity with SEO-driven keyword research.
Willingness to stay up-to-date on the latest digital marketing offerings and trends impacting your position.
Must be a self-starter who understands the importance of being responsible to yourself and our team.
Outstanding creative, collaboration, and teamwork skills.
Strong organizational and problem-solving skills.
Strong marketing mind with the ability to communicate value to the intended audience.
Strong writing and communication skills with ability to adjust voice and style to type of content being created.
Desire to keep learning and growing as a writer/marketer.
Ability to manage multiple content development and promotion initiatives and meet deadlines.
Ability to research and connect with sources independently.
Ability to review own work for organization, spelling and grammar, tone, and brand guidelines.
Ability to review information and data then turn your learnings into actionable, compelling, and engaging content.
Ability to test and measure results with excitement.

What’s it like to work at iZotope?
We’re the leaders in intelligent audio production and you’ll see that all iZotopians have a passion for what we do. Our company, our market and our customers are growing fast. This means all iZotope employees are engaged in interesting and challenging work. We have the opportunity to try new and different things and lots of room for career enrichment. We work with exceptional colleagues and foster an environment that empowers those closest to the work to make decisions and provide each other the support to move quickly and learn as we go. iZotope combines the excitement and pace of a startup with the stability and work/life balance of a market leader. Plus, it’s really cool to work for a company in the music and film industry!

The Customer Care mission: To reinforce the iZotope brand by providing a best-in-class support experience, to educate our customers through our interactions and content creation, and to advocate for improvements within the company using customer data and insights.

The role: Under the direction of the Customer Care Team Leader our seasonal chat support agent will be the first line of contact for customers shopping at iZotope.com

Receiving and promptly responding to live chats about product and pricing inquiries.
Making recommendations for specific iZotope products based on customer needs, and informing customers of current promotions
Providing live support for basic troubleshooting and authorization issues.
Identifying and escalating website errors to the Customer Care Team Leader.
Coordinating with other teams to prepare for product launches, campaigns, and new business requirements
Requirements of this role:
Practical experience with the iZotope product line and working knowledge of Audio software and Plugins.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to handle difficult customer situations with empathy and professionalism.
Flexibility with schedule and occasional overtime when needed.
Real world experience with audio processing in recording, production, sound design, and post production is a plus.
To be successful as a Customer Care Team Member at iZotope:
Members of the Customer Care team at iZotope come from a diverse array of backgrounds and areas of expertise that combine to create a unique and highly effective team. The following qualities are shared by all team members.

Positive attitude
Strong discipline and work ethic
Team mentality
Unfailing integrity
Passionate about advocating for customer needs
Showing empathy and understanding towards customers

Passion for audio technology
About iZotope

iZotope makes audio products and technologies that are used around the world. We have a wide range of customers, from the millions of consumers who enjoy our audio enhancement to GRAMMY-winning producers using our products to the corporations who license our technology for use in their own products. We are a growing team of highly motivated people who are constantly looking to innovate and improve the way we create and listen to audio.

HomeServe USA, a 2019 certified Great Place to Work, provides emergency repair plans which are like roadside assistance for your home. Our vision is to become the top-of-mind solution for consumers when something goes wrong in their home. Our incredible growth is fueled by a dynamic team who values collaboration, innovation and delivering exceptional customer service, all while working in a fun and friendly environment. HomeServe USA is part of a global organization that serves millions of customers in the US, UK, France, Italy and Spain. Come see why you should work for HomeServe USA!

Position Overview:
The Senior Director, Content Strategy, reporting to the Chief Digital Officer will be responsible for and own the planning, development and implementation of HomeServe’s digital content strategy. This role will develop a forward-thinking content strategy to grow and engage our audiences, partnering closely with cross functional teams. Under his/her leadership, the team will help raise awareness of HomeServe that will lead to increased site traffic, customer acquisition and prospect and partner engagement. Critically, this individual will develop a strategy and execution capabilities designed to leverage HomeServe’s core content and operational assets as a differentiator in the marketplace. They will establish an overarching content strategy and will establish workflows and processes to support sourcing of content, editing and packaging for redistribution and related channel strategies. This individual will work closely with teams across the business to build our content strategy. The ideal candidate will be ready to take on an entrepreneurial role that will require strong influencer skills as well as a deep understanding of the impact of content on user engagement, lead generation, and revenue.
Responsibilities:
Content Leadership — Define, communicate and measure the value of content in order to build followership across Digital, Account Management, Customer Service, Product and other teams at HomeServe.
Content Strategy — Leverage holistic understanding of HomeServe’s offerings and future roadmap, as well as prospective customer interests and needs, to define the editorial roadmap leveraging proprietary content and data as well as third party content, working cross functionally to ensure flawless execution of various distribution efforts.
Content Development — Oversee the development of content for all HomeServe digital marketing channels, including paid media, social, lead generation, email, and organic. Take the lead on creative content packaging using both existing executions and testing new ideas/formats to ensure optimized use of all proprietary and 3rd party content across HomeServe channels, with particular focus initially on leveraging proprietary claims and repairs content. Ensure consistent editorial voice across all materials.
Content Distribution — Influence channel strategy to ensure optimized deployment of content across HomeServe.com, other HomeServe-owned channels, and third-party partner and media properties.
Research — Play an active role in building tooling to capture customer interest areas and other research to gather information from key stakeholders to determine the validity of proposed topics and themes for HomeServe’s content. Maintain an awareness of competitive activity and gather market data for the business using the results to come up with well-informed topics and themes for further content creation.
Measurement and Analytics — Enable structured content creation capabilities through the implementation of models and processes for sourcing information, analyzing, and creating content. Design and implement measurement systems that actively measure, manage, optimize and communicate the performance of the content put out by the business against operational objectives and strategies.
Specifically, define and achieve KPIs including:
Content engagement across marketing channels (email, social, organic, etc.)
User acquisition and lead generation via content distribution
Editorial capacity, volume, and quality of content being published

Bachelor's degree in Marketing or equivalent experience
7-10 years’ experience in marketing, with a focus on editing, content creation and strategy for B2C environments, including experience managing internal and freelance teams
Ideally B2C services or platform experience, such as a digital asset manager
Experience across the entire content marketing process, from needs assessment through to measurement
Experience producing content for the web specifically, as well as channel-specific knowledge (blog, website, campaigns, social media, third parties)
Innate understanding of Brand Voice and channels in all content creation
Ability to process and make decisions based on data and set quantitative goals
Experience inspiring, motivating and leading a high performing team as well as leading by influence with a consultative approach
Determined and test-and-learn oriented to “figure it out”

The physical demands described represent those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this position. While performing the duties of this position, the employee is regularly required to listen, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to use hands or fingers, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls while executing tasks like working on a computer or talking on the telephone. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this position include close vision, distance vision, and the ability to adjust focus. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to low.

Career development and advancement opportunities
Casual attire throughout the week
Friendly, open and team oriented work atmosphere
Excellent benefits including generous medical, vision, dental and life & disability insurance
401(k) plan with a company match

Research Analyst I - Horizon Scanning

Job Details

Description
POSITION SUMMARY The Horizon Scanning Analyst I reviews information on novel healthcare innovations (e.g., treatments, vaccines and prophylaxis, prognostic indicators, systems and management innovations, devices, screening and diagnostics) to identify innovations that could have a high impact on important patient outcomes, public health, and the healthcare system, particularly in regard to infectious disease outbreak response and recovery, in the United States. The Analyst I writes short profiles summarizing each innovation and its potentials impacts and analyzes and synthesizes reviewer ratings and comments to prepare reports on topics with high impact potential. The Analyst I is expected to maintain knowledge of new developments and important new scientific discoveries in assigned content areas. The Analyst I participates in leads review, topic identification and nomination, database content creation, topic profile development, reviewer rating and comment analysis and synthesis, and report writing.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Reasonable Accommodations Statement
To accomplish this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform, with or without reasonable accommodation, each essential function satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to help enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Essential Functions Statements(s)
Review information leads in assigned content areas to identify topics (e.g., treatments, vaccines and prophylaxis, prognostic indicators, systems and management innovations, devices, screening and diagnostics) with high impact potential on individual patient outcomes, public health, and/or the healthcare system in the United States
Verbally present identified interventions and trends at nomination meetings
Write profiles summarizing key information for each topic selected during the nomination process in assigned clinical areas
Analyze and synthesize reviewer ratings and comments from physicians, nurses, allied health professionals, health systems professionals, researchers, patients, caregivers, and other to assess topic’s potential for impact on patient outcomes and the healthcare system in the United States
Expand written profiles to include analysis of reviewer ratings and comments
Maintain thorough understanding of the key clinical research developments and major scientific trends in the assigned clinical areas
Apply understanding about U.S. regulatory processes, coverage, coding, payment, etc.
Attend and contribute to team meetings
Meet assigned deadlines
Other duties as assigned
Accountability Metrics:
Meet deadlines as assigned
Maintain high quality standards
Qualifications
Experience:
1 or more years’ experience in a clinical or research healthcare environment
Broad knowledge of disease etiologies, processes, and treatments
Understanding of pharmacology and other treatment modalities (e.g., biologics, cell and gene therapies, devices, surgical procedures)
Basic knowledge of U.S. healthcare system, public and population health, evidence-based medicine, and healthcare horizon scanning
Knowledge (preferred) in one or more of the following areas related to infectious disease outbreak responses and recovery efforts: treatments, vaccines and prophylaxis, identifiable risk factors or prognostic indicators, systems and management, devices, screening and diagnostics.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to distill highly technical information into content accessible to wide audience
Demonstrated ability to meet aggressive deadlines
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, healthcare information production-oriented environment
Must be a well-organized self-starter and proficient multi-tasker
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word and Excel) essential
Experience with Microsoft SharePoint helpful
Education: Master’s degree in a scientific or medical discipline, such as microbiology, immunology, pharmacology, molecular genetics, physiology, biochemistry; or master’s degree in public health, population health, or epidemiology; or clinical healthcare professional with advanced degree.

Computer Skills: Proficient with Microsoft Office 2007+

Certifications & Licenses: None required

Job Title: Sr. Software Development Engineer - Studio Tech
Job Description:
We are a team of motivated and innovative software engineers with a mandate to deliver cloud-native content creation solutions to the film, television, and gaming industries. We have significant opportunities for technological exploration in the name of customer obsession and are looking for a skilled engineer to join our team. We work in a highly ambiguous and complex problem space. You will be in a key position to influence team strategy, design and service architecture. You will be also able to influence other teams, product through design review, collaborations, and requirements gathering across teams.

As a technical leader in the team, you will leverage your deep knowledge of relevant AWS services such as ECS, Fargate, SQS, and AWS Batch as well as operational and engineering best practices to translate project requirements and big ideas into a deployable, highly available, and scalable managed service.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation/ Age



Basic Qualifications

· 6+ years of experience as a software engineer focused on relevant engineering projects
· Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or related field
· Expertise in C/C++, Go, Rust, Node.js, or Python
· Expertise building artist-friendly, intuitive user interfaces with Qt, OpenGL, Vue.js, React.js, and other UI frameworks
· A solid grasp of fundamental algorithms, data structures, and computational complexity analysis
· Proven track record of leading the delivery and operations of large-scale, mission-critical distributed systems
· Deep hands-on technical expertise in at least one relevant technical area: large scale systems engineering, queuing and messaging, Linux networking, performance analysis, software-defined networking, etc.
· Experience leading complex projects, with significant bottom-line impact
· Experience playing a visionary technical leadership role within a large organization

Preferred Qualifications

· Experience with architecture, design and development of asynchronous messaging platforms
· Knowledge of network protocols and their implementations
· Experience with high performance serialization and RPC systems such as gRPC, Protobuf, and Capn Proto
· Experience with messaging systems such as SQS, ActiveMQ, and ZeroMQ

We are looking for a Research Strategist who lives for research and uncovering data-driven insights. As part of the strategy team, you are an integral part of Small Army working cross-departmentally to help inform our strategies and inspire our creative.

It will also probably include a lot of candy.

What You Need

At Lundbeck, we are tirelessly dedicated to restoring brain health so every person can be their best. Headquartered in Copenhagen with a U.S. home office in Deerfield, Ill., Lundbeck is the only global biopharmaceutical company focused solely on brain diseases. Our legacy in neuroscience goes back seven decades and we have a long heritage of innovation. Lundbeck has developed and commercialized some of the world’s most widely prescribed therapies for psychiatric and neurological disorders. Today, we remain uncompromisingly committed to improving the quality of life for people impacted by brain disorders. Lundbeck is unique from other biopharmaceutical companies in that we are 70 percent owned by a research-focused foundation. We have a deep and productive pipeline, and we continue to bring forward symptomatic therapies to help people live better lives, while simultaneously pursuing disease-modifying treatments.

Builds employee understanding of and engagement with Perspectives relationship. Manages Internship Program, Scholarship Program, and annual school supplies drive
Creates materials and content to showcase our community efforts externally
Supporting Internal Organizational Communications
To ensure external corporate communications are seamless with internal communications, the Corporate Communications Specialist will have involvement with internal communications efforts, specifically assisting with employee communications as needed.

Accredited Bachelor’s degree
2+ years of Communications-related experience

Excellent project management skills
Self-starter, able to work well as a member of a team, but also work independently with limited oversight
PREFERRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:

Ability to work well under pressure, and to deal well with competing priorities and a changing business environment

Job Description
Lead projects with little oversight, during all phases of the marketing cycle and implement multi-channel customer relationship management strategies for various member segments.

Manage multiple timelines simultaneously for multiple product lines. Create and manage schedules for development and production of materials, including coordination with the procurement department and outside vendors.
Assess data, initiate, implement changes, provide recommendations to improve member education, and improve internal operating procedures for the purpose of increasing member satisfaction, retention and referral.
Oversee and manage the development, versioning, and approval process of required communications for multiple product lines.
Develop relationships with key contacts in the organization to gain support and compliance with the marketing process.
Keep manager informed regarding status of all projects and other job responsibilities. Provide Manager with weekly update summarizing all completed, pending, and upcoming activities.
Assist manager in tracking and preparing yearly budget. Process and track expenses as needed.

Bachelor’s degree preferably in Marketing or Communications
EXPERIENCE:
Minimum of five years of professional experience.
Knowledge of CMS Medicare Communications and Marketing Guidelines a strong plus.
SKILL REQUIREMENTS:
Ability to simplify complex information into easily understood formats and language.
Self- directed, move projects forward with limited oversight. Must be detail and deadline oriented.
Strong project management skills. Requires the ability to learn, understand, and communicate complex product details.
Requires the ability to create, version, and edit detailed regulatory documents, working independently and with subject matter experts.
Requires ability to perform in a fast paced, changing office environment handling multiple demands. Must be able to absorb large volumes of information from a variety of different sources, accurately interpret the information, and present it in a variety of different formats. Must be able to think quickly in a highly demanding environment and exercise appropriate judgment as necessary.
What we build together changes our customer's health for the better. We are looking for talented and innovative people to join our team. Come join us!

COMPANY

AccuWeather, recognized and documented as the most accurate source of weather forecasts and warnings in the world, has saved tens of thousands of lives, prevented hundreds of thousands of injuries and tens of billions of dollars in property damage. With global headquarters in State College, PA and other offices around the world, AccuWeather serves more than 1.5 billion people daily to help them plan their lives and get more out of their day through innovative digital media properties, such as AccuWeather.com and mobile, as well as Business Solutions (AES), radio, television, newspapers, and the 24/7 AccuWeather Network.

Additionally, AccuWeather produces and distributes news, weather content, and video for more than 180,000 third-party websites. Among AccuWeather's many innovative and award-winning features free to the public are MinuteCast® Minute by Minute™ forecasts with Superior Accuracy™. Further, AccuWeather serves more than half of Fortune 500 companies and thousands of businesses globally.

SUMMARY

The Video Producer Editor for AccuWeather will be producing compelling video segments for the AccuWeather Television Network on a daily and as-needed schedule, as well as for our digital platform. The Video Producer Editor will work with a team of on-air broadcasters, director, graphics, studio crew to develop innovative and engaging content. The weather and the news require 24/7/365 coverage and, the video producer editor will be required to work differing hours, depending on the severity of the weather situation or breaking news story.

This position will work out of our headquarters office in State College, Pennsylvania.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Work closely with content managers to research, write, produce, edit and program top videos for multiple platforms.
Arrange interviews with individuals and agencies in a bid to gather information for news items.
Exercise strong editorial judgment and adhere to company's standards and practices.
Perform other duties as assigned.


QUALIFICATIONS
Entrepreneurial spirit is necessary in this role.
BA or BS in journalism, communications or meteorology from an accredited institution
Demonstrated experience in a dynamic, live news production environment at a television station or broadcast network
Working knowledge of non-linear editing suites (Adobe Premiere, Final Cut Pro, others) is required.

Company Description

At Optiv, we’re on a mission to help our clients make their businesses more secure. We’re one of the fastest growing companies in a truly essential industry.

Job Description

The Principal SIEM Engineer works in Optiv Security’s 24x7x365 Security Operations Center as a member of the Managed Security Services (MSS) team. The employee will be responsible for creation of procedures, implementation of processes and development of staff for managing and maintaining security systems across internal and client environments. Experience and knowledge of Splunk (SIEM) or Situational Awareness are essential. The Principal Engineer will work closely with Management, Senior Engineers, Solution Architects, Senior Security Engineers, other Principal Security Engineers and clients to complete high profile, critical services to existing Managed Security Service clients. This person will serve as a subject matter expert and team lead for Managed Security Services, staying in tune with all client configuration issues and all internal projects.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Lead engineering team by prioritizing clients work requests, projects and service tasks related to their Splunk SIEM platform.
Work closely with Management, Service Delivery and other Principal Engineers in defining processes and procedures for internal projects.
Guide the design, development and review of complex security SIEM content.
Analyzes and identifies areas of improvement with existing processes, procedures and documentation.
Develop individual team, defining strategies and responsibilities to be successful and grow.
Develops internal training methods to support Managed Services and their clients.
Act as the point of escalation for other Engineers (Associate Engineer, Security Engineer, & Senior Engineer) and provide guidance and mentoring.
Assist with client transition and on-boarding serve as primary point of contact for Managed Security Service clients.
This will require documentation of Account Governance processes and responsibility for report generation and notification to senior leadership about potential client Service Level Agreement (SLA) issues.
Explain and demonstrate how to use SIEM and Enterprise Security products to both technical and relatively non-technical personnel.
Provide remote consulting services via interactive client sessions to assist with implementation of multiple product vendors and technologies.
Implement and configure SIEM software and appliance-based products in large enterprise and Government environments.
Qualifications

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
3+ years professional experience managing and maintaining SIEM systems, specifically Splunk.
2-3 years professional experience working with networks and network architecture.
1+ year professional experience writing SIEM content.
Prior experience in a technical team leadership role.
College degree or equivalent training with experience working in a Security Operations Center, Managed Security, or client network environment.
Advanced information security knowledge in one or more areas:
Enterprise end-point security products (i.e. McAfee e-Policy Orchestrator, Virus Scan, Anti-Spyware, Host Data Loss Protection, Endpoint Encryption, etc.)
Security Information and Event Manager (SIEM), to include: Splunk (a must have) and any additional SIEM platform knowledge is a plus (i.e. Nitro, ArcSight, RSA, QRadar, Exabeam, LogRhythm etc.)
Network Firewall, Web Proxy, E-Mail and Web Gateway etc. to include: Palo Alto / Checkpoint / Juniper / McAfee / Cisco / Blue Coat / Imperva.
Understanding of network architecture and implementation is a must; ideal candidate will have worked with network security analysis.
Experience with content SIEM content creation and reporting.
Excellent time management, reporting, and communication skills.
Superior IT problem-solving skills.
Experience with Linux OS.
MUST HAVE:
Shift flexibility, including the ability to provide on call support when needed
Demonstrated experience and success in a Managed Service client environment
Valid Driver’s License
Ability to work greater than 40 hours per week as needed
Ability to travel up to 10 percent of the time
Desired Qualifications
Experience working with Internal and client ticketing and knowledge base systems for Incident and Problem Tracking, as well as procedures. (i.e. Jira, Confluence, etc.).
General security knowledge (GIAC, CISSP, CCSE, CISA, HBSS, NSA, CEH, Cisco Security, Security +, or other security certifications).
Knowledge of Linux and Windows Operating Systems.
An understanding of a wide array of server grade applications such as: DBMS, Exchange, DNS, SMTP, IIS, Apache, SharePoint, Active Directory, Identity Management, Patch Management, LDAP, SQL, and others.
Experience with various SIEM security products such as: ArcSight, QRadar, Nitro, Splunk, LogRhythm and infrastructure components such as proxies, firewalls, IDS/IPS, DLP etc.
CCNA, CCDA, CCSA, CCIE, CISSP, CEH, or MCSE (a plus)
Familiarity with DevOps
Prior consulting experience is nice to have.

The Role
Loloi is on a mission to become the first true rug brand in America, and we’re seeking a talented Senior Director of Marketing to help us get there. This is a unique opportunity to build upon a brand our industry already respects, and scale it to reach new people. This position reports directly to company principals, and will play an integral role in our leadership team.
You’ll be responsible for leading the integrated marketing and creative team of 13 people (and growing) and create the vision, strategy, and KPI’s for brand campaigns across owned and paid channels. We’re looking for a great storyteller with an ability to develop, measure, and amplify campaigns to the right audience. Our goal is to create an emotional connection—and always do it in a way that feels on brand.
If you have experience leading a marketing/creative team, enjoy using both sides of your brain, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you!
Responsibilities:
Develop and be accountable for the brand vision, strategy, and results of campaigns both online and offline.
Create quarterly plans that align our marketing, creative, and cross-functional teams on new product launches, markets, new verticals, e-commerce, and more. It’s important to communicate and calendar in a way that empowers the team, while lending visibility into the broader company strategy.
Lead and manage a marketing/creative team of 13 people.
Play a key role in building our team with new hires across disciplines such as performance marketing, content creation, email, social and more.
Oversee production team responsible for biweekly photoshoots.
Identify, test and scale new marketing ideas that resonates with our customers and our community.
Identify and own the communication with vendors and outside agencies that support us, such as packaging, printing, PR, or paid media.
Lead strategy and execution for teams that create and distribute marketing assets for different customer types including retailers, designers, and third party e-commerce partners (such as Wayfair, Amazon, etc).
Manage change and train new employees as our team grows.
Create an environment that fosters creativity, performance, and structure.
Be a dependable resource for cross-departmental needs. Whether it’s a custom product label or a sign needed for one of our showrooms, other departments can count on you to see it through and meet deadlines.
Qualifications:
Minimum 5-8 years relevant marketing leadership experience.
You’re a natural-born storyteller. You believe in the value of a strong brand and enjoy the art and science of telling its story.
You’re a leader and doer. You do strategy well, but you also roll up your sleeves and help execute.
You value a consistent and harmonious brand message across all channels.
You question assumptions.
You have an exceptional work ethic and are highly self-motivated. You refuse to work anywhere that accepts average.
You’re a fair, constructive leader who enjoys helping your team grow.
Experience with Netsuite, Shopify and Basecamp platforms are a plus.
Requirements:
BA/BS degree required.
How to Apply
Please submit your resume as well as a cover letter that details your interest in the role, your preferred salary range, and your available start date.
What We Offer
Whether it's the products we develop or the showrooms we design, Loloi believes there's always room to be better. We extend that belief to our team, continuously striving to improve our employee’s quality of life. We offer comprehensive health, dental and vision benefits, 401k, sound meditation and professional massage to our full-time employees.
Our fast-paced culture values people who act and think like founders. If you're someone who takes initiative, works hard and brings a positive spirit, there's no limit to how far you'll go here.
About Loloi Rugs
Loloi Rugs is a leading textile brand that designs and crafts rugs, pillows, and throws for the thoughtfully layered home. Family-owned and led since 2004, Loloi is growing more quickly than ever. To date, we’ve expanded our diverse team to hundreds of employees, invested in multiple distribution facilities, introduced thousands of products, and earned the respect and business of retailers and designers worldwide. A testament to our products and our team, Loloi has earned the ARTS Award for “Best Rug Manufacturer” in 2010, 2011, 2015, 2016, and 2018. For more information, visit loloirugs.com.
Loloi Rugs does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

About the Role
The FiscalNote Executive Institute brings together leading global companies to discuss, examine, define and promote best practices through thought leadership. We help to advance collaboration through the sharing of ideas, guidance, and experiences. Our goal is to help companies better manage risk and uncertainty.

The Director of Thought Leadership and Engagement will serve as a critical member of the marketing team, responsible for driving marketing strategy among our enterprise community. Reporting to the VP of Marketing, this role will be responsible for developing and maintaining deep relationships with senior level executives through the FiscalNote Executive Institute, serving as a lead contributor of in-person and digital programing and content creation, and helping to build and reinforce the FiscalNote brand. This role will also work closely with demand generation and business development to formulate marketing strategies that drive revenue growth and retention in our enterprise segment. Finally, this role will serve as the strategic company lead for community development and serve as a resource for helping build communities throughout the organization.

The position requires frequent interaction with the FiscalNote Executive Institute community and board of advisors, partners, government organizations, subject matter experts, universities, and in-house teams. The candidate must have excellent relationship building, project management, and communication skills, and the ability to to create tangible results from high-level ideas.

About the Marketing Team
The Marketing Team at FiscalNote collaborates across business units to help drive sales and support the growth goals of the company using data and creativity. With a demand-generation approach, the marketing team targets high quality leads and nurtures them with compelling content and events including webinars, blogs, lunch & learns, white papers, case studies, and the like.

What to Expect:
Create thought leadership/community strategy for the FiscalNote Executive Institute that drives deep engagement and participation.
Develop a programming and editorial calendar that incorporates a wide range of subject matter experts, in-house experts, and partners.
Create original content and work with outside experts on a variety of content pieces including blogs, surveys, white papers, etc.
Share insights and learnings across the organization and report back on program success metrics.
Create and successfully execute a robust communications calendar.
Partner with demand generation account-based marketing and enterprise marketing strategies; deploy campaigns as needed.
Partner with account management and sellers to drive leads to sales to grow revenue in enterprise accounts.
Develop a schedule of in-person and virtual events and execute on all aspects of their success from start/schedule to completion, leveraging existing internal resources where appropriate. Lead conversations (1:1) and 1:many with senior leadership, both inside the company and across clients and prospects, across various relevant topics to gain and share insights.
Serve as a connector and brand ambassador across the enterprise segment.
Serve as an expert in community development and work throughout the organization to share best practices and serve as project manager, when needed.
Provide editorial and thought leadership support, join sales/CS calls, where needed throughout the organization.

What Sets You Apart:
7–10 years of sales, relationship management, marketing communications, and/or community development experience preferred.
Experience managing relationships with senior level executives is required (ideally CXOs).
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to develop partnerships inside and outside the organization, and influence others.
Very strong oral and verbal communication skills; must be a superb writer and editor.
Ability to translate ideas into useful content pieces and events that drive meaningful conversations.
Experience in hosting and leading virtual and in-person events.
A strong understanding of the marketing funnel, and how thought leadership work fits into a larger marketing strategy.
Experience in government affairs, external affairs or at a trade association is preferred.
Self-starter who can take initiative and begin projects independently.
About Us
FiscalNote is a technology-powered global software data and media company that uses powerful machine learning to provide clients with the right policy information and insights, and at the right time so that they can better navigate market risk and uncertainty and maximize new opportunities.

As the premier hub of domestic and global information for more than 5,000 clients worldwide, FiscalNote’s tools, analysis, news, and award-winning journalism delivers context, clarity, and a competitive edge in a rapidly changing world.

If your background and experience align with the competencies above, we encourage you to apply so that we can review your experience and learn more about how you can add to FiscalNote’s growth and success.

Company Benefits
FiscalNote offers competitive salaries, equity packages, and retirement accounts to ensure we’re all FN owners. We work hard, so we want you to play hard; our open vacation policy help us ensure you’re getting the R&R you need. We offer comprehensive health, vision, and dental insurance options supplemented by a flexible spending account (FSA). We have a slew of other benefits which you can check out at careers.FiscalNote.com.

FiscalNote values diversity. We are committed to equal opportunities and creating an inclusive environment for all our employees. Job Details:

We are looking for a meticulous digital project manager to join our customer-focused marketing team. As the digital project manager, you will manage the migration of one of the largest consumer sports websites in the country that reaches over 11MM people annually.

NCSA is a dynamic and growing company and we need our website to be able to grow with us. This is a new in-house role for our company, and much needed as we face complex technical challenges moving our website to modern infrastructure and design. You will be a key decision maker in the underlying technical strategies and work with a mix of contractors and in-house developers to implement the work.

NCSASPORTS.ORG is one of the larger consumers facing websites in Chicago with over 2MM pages and 11MM unique visitors a year. We are coming off of a year where we saw 50% YoY organic growth and we need to update our web infrastructure to maintain the growth.

The digital project manager will report to the Marketing Manager and also work closely with the VP of Marketing, VP of Engineering, Senior Web Developer and other business leaders providing structure and clear communication on critical projects.

This is a great opportunity for someone looking to become part of a great technical marketing team making a difference in young athletes lives. At the end of the day what we care about most is creating world-class tools and resources for families, athletes and coaches in the college recruiting process.

Track all bugs and manage resolution

3+ years of experience in a significant website project management role
Experience with WordPress

Website migration experience a significant plus
Self-motivated and takes initiative

Job Title: Senior Digital and Social Media Strategist
Job Description:
Prosek Partners is looking for a Senior Digital and Social Media Strategist to play an integral role in a growing practice at a high-growth firm. This person will work closely with our internal account teams, playing an integral role to develop digital strategies that complement clients' earned media goals, and will create and manage a number of social media campaigns for clients to drive brand awareness and engage audiences on multiple platforms.

The Senior Digital and Social Media Strategist must be experienced in social media content creation, an expert in platform-specific best practices and campaign analysis, with the ability to translate emerging digital trends into actionable plans. The candidate will be expected to create content (LinkedIn, Twitter, YouTube) on behalf of our clients, monitor earned and owned conversation and activity across relevant platforms and cultivate online relationships with target audiences through paid, owned and earned channels.

Responsibilities
Develop and execute social media strategy through competitive research, platform determination, messaging and audience identification
Manage tactical execution of digital advertising and social media programming including content development, community management and influencer engagement
Have familiarity and experience in a wide range of digital tactics including measurement and analytics, organic and paid social media, email marketing and digital reputation management
Generate, edit and publish daily content to appropriate social media channels
Coordinate with PR account teams to provide social media guidance and expertise for specific campaigns
Produce client-ready written communications and have strong verbal communication with our clients
Ability to articulate the capabilities and services of the digital practice across the team, as well as with existing and potential clients
Requirements
5-8 years of experience in a digital content development role
Excellent writing and communication skills
Experience with social networking and social analytics tools (i.e. Google Analytics, TrendKite, Spredfast, Buzzsumo, Sprout Social, Sprinklr, etc.)
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high growth environment
Team player and self-starter
