The VP Investor Relations will report to the CFO and will lead the strategy and development of our investor relations ("IR") story to develop investor confidence and belief in our vision and strategy for delivering shareholder value. The VP IR will be a key collaborator with our other financial leaders in the Controller and FP&A functions in helping the CFO organization scale for growth and be World Class. A background in internet marketplaces and experience leading investor relations for a publicly traded company will set you up for success. This is an exciting time for Upwork, and we are looking for the right leader to own our IR function and share our story.

Responsibilities

Positioning & Strategy
Develop, plan and execute a comprehensive, strategic investor relations program to increase Upwork's visibility with the investment community
Assist with the ongoing refinement of key messaging and market positioning based on company performance, market perception, expectations, peer performance and relative valuation
Develop and provide counsel on key metrics, guidance progression, and disclosure policies
Analyze internal and external forecasts, data, and assumptions to provide aggregated view of expectations and implications for stock price and investor and analysts perception
Relationship Management & Infrastructure
Build a targeted investor strategy with current and potential investors
Manage relationships with Wall Street sell-side analysts and broaden exposure to sell-side analysts and investors
Advise on optimal communications for analysts and investors including post-earnings call messaging for each
Speak to investors on behalf of Upwork
Plan, manage and attend investor events, investor and analyst meetings, roadshows and conference calls and manage relationship with the stock exchange (Nasdaq)
Content Creation & Process Management
Collaborate cross-functionally to gain a deep understanding of Upwork's business and ensure that corporate messaging is consistent
Craft and communicate messaging around financial results, strategy, growth opportunities and business initiatives to analysts and investors
Manage the process for quarterly earnings process preparation of materials including earnings conference call scripts, press releases, Q&A documents, and other associated materials for sell-side and buy-side post-earnings calls
Advise and update investor presentation and accompanying voiceover for investor conferences, 1x1 meetings and non-deal roadshows
Provide guidance on IR website and corporate content
Intelligence & Analysis
Monitor analyst and peer estimates, consensus estimates, sell-side research, and market-related trends impacting valuation and perception
Stay informed on relevant macro and sector news flow and trends; monitor and communicate internally about competitive information
What it takes to catch our eye:
High integrity and a passion for Upwork's mission!
Structured thinking: comfort with numbers, details, and ambiguity and a collaborative working style
Communication skills and presence: Ability to express oneself clearly and concisely with excellent written and verbal communications
Critical thinking and autonomy to solve problems with minimal direct supervision and comfort working in a highly dynamic environment where your voice will be heard, and your decisions will have a significant impact
Enthusiasm or familiarity with internet, technology trends and startups and a deep understanding of two sided marketplaces
A leadership background in investor relations with a public company and experience with B2B, Marketplace or SaaS businesses
Strong network within investor community including relationships with the buy-side and sell-side internet analysts
How to really knock our socks off:
History of seeing companies develop and grow both SMB and Enterprise offerings
Equity research experience in technology, internet, marketplaces or software industries with an investment bank

Marketing Opportunity in Financial Services

Advisor Marketing Strategist, Content Specialist

This position will have two main areas of focus: first, developing content strategy for our proprietary, in-house marketing content platform available exclusively to our financial professionals; and second, helping financial professionals on a consultative basis to grow their business through marketing best practices.

Deliver an outstanding, white glove customer service experience to our financial professionals while demonstrating deep financial marketing expertise

Experience in financial industry marketing with focus on client/public-facing communication
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, and a willingness to try creative approaches to business-building

Experience working with executives and other senior-level leaders

Job Title: Manager - North American Student Competition Team
Job Description:
If you have experience with MATLAB and Simulink and are passionate about building and leading a team that will drive adoption of MATLAB and Simulink among students this role is for you. MathWorks has established a technical team dedicated to developing the technical strategy and driving the execution to increase usage of MATLAB and Simulink in Student Competitions around the world.

As the manager of the North American Student Competition team you will build and lead the MathWorks technical team dedicated to increasing adoption in Student Competitions. You will provide strong leadership, coaching, guidance to your team members and empower them to work to achieve their technical goals. You will put your passion for MATLAB and Simulink into action by working directly with students, researchers, competition organizers and faculty and grow the usage and understanding of our products within Student Competitions and education. Through these efforts you and your team will prepare and support the next generation of scientists and engineers with software, training, and mentoring to tackle the same technical issues as professional engineers.
Build and lead a technical team in North America focused on supporting future engineers and students to adopt MATLAB and Simulink
Recruit individuals with student competition experience and a true passion for MATLAB and Simulink.
Visit strategic customers at events and universities with your team members to understand the use of MATLAB and Simulink.
Model the way for your team members by creating and executing technical strategies for your own areas of expertise.
Build and nurture relationships with key decision makers in the Student Competition Community; enlist them as advocates for the use of MATLAB and Simulink among students.
Manage the internal technical content creation plan for videos, file exchange, and blogs.
Collaborate with Education Business managers and stakeholder in executing the business strategy for growing usage in the student market.
Work with the Worldwide Education Programs Manager and internal Education stakeholders to drive alignment between their business plans for student usage and growth.
Collaborate with the Edu Marketing Management team to build new programs and technical content for students worldwide.
Deliver papers and presentations at appropriate Student Competitions and Educational events.
Synthesize your teams customer facing experiences into student trends academia and advocate for the impact of those on MathWorks product plans and internal development strategies.
Develop content and lead your team to develop scalable content to help teams be successful using MATLAB and Simulink.
Effective leadership and coaching skills; ability to hire, guide, motivate, and inspire others
Experience leading or participating in a Student Competition as either a teacher or a student.
Ability to lead both technical and non-technical projects.
Experience as a professor or postdoc developing proposals for student funding/projects preferred.
Marketing experience with global technology company preferred.
Prior employment with a global software company involved in scientific computing, data analysis and/or modeling and simulation tools.
Technical experience in either Robotics or Autonomous Driving preferred.
Experience with Simulink
Experience with MATLAB
Candidates must be willing to travel up to 25% of the time
A bachelor's degree and 7 years of professional work experience (or a master's degree and 5 years of professional work experience, or a PhD degree, or equivalent experience) is required.

Ekata provides global identity verification via enterprise-grade APIs and a SaaS solution. Our product suite is powered by Ekata Identity Engine, the first and only cross-border identity engine of its kind. It uses complex machine learning algorithms across the five consumer attributes of email, phone, name, physical address, and IP to derive unique data links and features from billions of real-time transactions within our customer network and the globally sourced data of our graph. Businesses around the world including Alipay, Stripe, Airbnb, and Microsoft leverage our solutions to approve more good transactions, reduce friction, and find fraud.

Ekata is looking for a Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager to own our global content strategy, the awareness and interest portions of our marketing funnel, as well as all demand and lead generation efforts for our enterprise sales teams. This role will work closely with the rest of the marketing team, sales teams, revenue operations team, product marketing as well as our outside resources and agencies. A successful candidate will have experience researching industry trends across the globe, developing full-funnel campaigns for enterprise teams, and 7+ years experience marketing a B2B SaaS or data product globally.

Our Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager will be focused in three main areas:
Managing all content marketing, from global brand awareness and thought leadership campaigns to social media management, blog sharing, and more.
Creating interest campaigns (email nurtures, etc.) to funnel our audience from brand awareness to product consideration.
Creating targeted campaigns that feed our Enterprise teams qualified new business and current customer expansion leads.
Based on these focus areas, the following are required for all applicants:
Expert in content strategy, including global regional efforts. Must be an excellent writer: engaging, personable, intelligent, and grammatically perfect. Writing samples are required.
Must have 3+ years experience in Marketo, building email nurtures, complex programs, landing pages, managing data, and reporting results.
Growth marketing mindset: Focused on lifetime value, building trust through the marketing funnel and beyond, from customer loyalty to brand advocacy.
This role will work closely with the rest of the marketing team, sales teams, revenue operations team, product marketing as well as our outside resources and agencies. Were looking for someone to join our team who is an engaging B2B writer, metrics driven, smart, adaptable, and motivated by demand generation for a growth company.

In the Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager role, you will:
Be our primary engagement strategist: You will research, document, and train our team and company on how to engage and build trust with our target personas within each industry we target globally. This will include writing content, emails, managing social channels, and assisting sales with outreach
Create campaigns and content that are relevant to our target audience and effectively funnel leads from brand awareness to product interest, helping us fulfill our growth lead quota month over month
Partner with sales teams to create email sequences to increase MQL (lead) to SQL (opportunity) conversion rates
Make data-driven decisions: Manage and report on your marketing campaigns digital performance metrics and analytics
Collaborate with other marketing managers on processes and procedures that need to be optimized (and how to optimize them), and how to elevate our strategies and campaigns for optimal ROI and growth
The right person for this role will grow into managing lead generation campaign strategy across Mid-Market, EMEA, and APAC channels as well as Enterprise within the first 6 months
Our ideal Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager will have:

About Us

KiwiCo is an innovative eCommerce company that sparks kids' creativity and curiosity through offline and online materials and inspiration. We offer kids a delightful, engaging way to explore, create, and learn. Our core offering is a subscription service that delivers curated hands-on projects to kids. We take great pride and ownership in the products we build and in the community of parents and kids we serve. We're backed by leading investors and were named one of the "20 Startups to Watch" by Business Insider. Our office is located in Mountain View, CA.

Role and Responsibilities

We are looking for a Video Editor who can quickly grok our brand identity, who is highly collaborative as well as efficient, and who can help bring our brand to life through creative and thoughtful editing of a wide range of assets.

In this role, you will:
Design and build essential graphics toolkits for KiwiCo marketing assets, videos and original series
Establish brand identity and consistency through video and graphic styling
Edit marketing, social media and editorial assets and videos
Animate KiwiCo illustrations to use across our social channels
Edit short and long form how-to tutorials for our crate lines
Help establish a language for graphic design and video assets
Assist in file organization and sharing across teams and stakeholders
Shoot in-office video footage, as needed
Required Qualifications

As a start-up celebrating creativity and development, we believe and encourage the same in our team. We seek team players with an infectious positive energy, great initiative, and a get-it-done attitude. Candidates must thrive in ambiguity and love a rapid pace. You must have a strong desire to learn and improve.

The ideal candidate has great initiative and operating range. Required skills and responsibilities:
Experience. Bachelor's degree with 4+ years of graphic design for video and editing experience. You have excellent storytelling and editing skills, with the experience and skills required to work in a fast-paced video production environment.
Passionate about kids and education. You love our young customers and understand how to communicate enriching educational concepts in a fun and relatable way.
Detail-oriented. Exceptional attention to detail, grammar, and logical story construction, with an eye for visual communication.
Communication. Excellent written and visual communication skills and the ability to collaborate across various departments.
Organization. This is a fast-paced, deadline-driven role, which requires collaborating with the entire product design team, so great organizational skills are a must.
Hands-on, get things done mentality. Self-starter with the ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment and meet changing deadlines and priorities on multiple simultaneous projects. Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines while still paying attention to details and executing flawlessly. Strong project management skills.
Resourceful and flexible. You see a project from idea stage through successful completion and do whatever it takes to make it a success. You are comfortable with the rapid pace of change in a small, nimble team. You are an innovative thinker and can solve problems creatively.
Collaborative. Ability to lead and influence cross-functional teams in a matrixed organization, as well as confidently make presentations to senior management. Able to give and receive feedback well.
Broad operating range. Have the ability to think strategically and create processes and organizational efficiencies, while also having a love of detail and editorial finesse. Thrives in a fast-paced, small company environment.
Desired Qualifications/Experience
Proficiency in the Adobe Creative Suite, with special emphasis in Premiere and After Effects
Experience editing short and long form DIY, tutorial and STEAM videos, specifically relating to kids content
Experience creating graphics and videos for YouTube, Facebook, Instagram and other social media platforms
Experience designing and building essential graphics toolkits for a variety of content types
Experience working collaboratively with video editors, photographers, and producers in a start-up environment
High attention to detail and creative confidence
Passion for teaching and learning

The Portuguese Content Editor has a strong background in editing, proofreading, creative content writing, journalism or blogging. They have a great eye for detail. The Content Editor is able to work independently and collaboratively as a part of an international team. The Content Editor is a dynamic and vibrant professional, passionate about modern pop-culture, including Music, Videos, Apps, Books and Podcasts. The Content Editor is eager to learn new skills.

Job Description:
Summary

As a product manager, you will be responsible for generating informative content for the leading online retailer of trailer, towing, and RV accessories in the US. At etrailer.com it's our mission to create high-quality original content and to ensure accurate product data to help our customers find the products they need to solve their problems. Through hands-on research and collaboration with external vendor contacts and internal teams, you'll create accurate, customer-focused content, including written product descriptions. This role requires strong writing, interpersonal, project management, and critical thinking skills. This is a permanent, full-time position at our offices in Wentzville, Missouri.

Job responsibilities
Grow and maintain a deep understanding of and familiarity with our products and our customers through research and hands-on training
Write accurate, customer-focused copy for website product descriptions, working with category manager to refine written content
Collaborate with other teams (photo, video, and marketing) to create content that aligns with our mission of treating our customers like neighbors
Manage product lines, ensuring that all product data is accurate and maintaining relationships with external vendor contacts
Ensure that existing product lines are up to date and content is accurate
Experience and Skills
Self-starter and quick learner who enjoys studying new topics and applying critical thinking skills
Strong project management and organizational skills - able to manage several complex projects simultaneously
Ability to efficiently manage workload and reprioritize as needed
Strong interpersonal and communication skills - able to communicate effectively through written and spoken word
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to interact professionally with vendor contacts and other team members
Ability to work well independently and within a team
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) - moderate level of skill in Excel preferred
Bachelor's degree in journalism, marketing, communications, or related field required
Professional writing experience and/or writing for the web a plus
Industry knowledge not required but a plus
About you

You're a curious person who's passionate about research and learning new things every day. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where you complete projects quickly and efficiently and find creative solutions to problems. Your work is meticulous, and you have a strong grasp of the English language, both in writing (email communication, content creation) and in person or over the phone. You welcome critical feedback and input from a variety of perspectives on your work.

Why etrailer.com?

etrailer.com is the leading online retailer of trailer, towing, and RV accessories in the US. We’re not an ordinary e-commerce retailer. We’re more than a few developers and marketers sitting in a small office just trying to convince you to buy at the cheapest price. At etrailer.com you’ll find an entire company dedicated to helping customers find the best possible solutions for their needs. Our team of 300+ people creatively works together to ensure that each person who visits our website has the most personalized shopping experience on the web.

The Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia is one of the 12 regional Reserve Banks that, together with the Board of Governors in Washington, D.C., make up the Federal Reserve System. It helps formulate and implement monetary policy, supervises banks and bank and savings and loan holding companies, and provides financial services to depository institutions and the federal government. The Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia serves eastern and central Pennsylvania, southern New Jersey, and Delaware.

Job Summary:

The Social Media and Digital Engagement Associate is a knowledgeable and energetic internal advocate for social engagement, with the ability to create clear and compelling digital (social, email, etc.) content, working as part of the Digital Strategy Group within Corporate Affairs. The position works closely with management to execute the social media strategy for the Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia. This includes managing the day-to-day operation of the Bank's social media outlets and ensuring alignment with overall digital strategy of the organization. The analyst conceives, researches, creates, posts, and promotes compelling content on the Bank's various social channels in collaboration with internal content creators and subject matter experts. The position serves as a front-line thought leader and internal resource for the implementation of social tactics to promote the Bank’s work and enhance the reputation of the organization and its experts.

All applicants must submit a list of social media accounts managed, detailing the account names, dates that the accounts were managed, and the applicant's role in maintaining those accounts.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:

Contributes to the ongoing development of the social media strategy, working to ensure that the Bank's social media efforts are in alignment with the organization's overall digital communications efforts.

Works both independently and collaboratively with internal staff to conceive, compose, and post social media content that supports the organization's communications and digital strategy efforts.

Maintains, manages, and executes a calendar of social media communication content. These messages will include planned releases, breaking news, and general content highlighting the Bank's work.

Engages with external stakeholders including partner organizations and audience members through appropriate interactions.

Partners with the Digital Solutions and Creative Services teams to identify and produce technological and creative assets for use on social channels.

Provides quality assurance for social media content, including proofreading and link accuracy.

Conceives, plans, administers, and reports out on measurement tools examining the impact of the Bank's social media efforts for our relevant audiences.

Maintains digital accounts according to best practices. This includes creating or updating account profile information and artwork, creating or consolidating accounts, managing follower lists, etc.

Keeps abreast of the latest trends in social and digital communications and helps develop new social media strategies and tactics for the Bank.

WHAT YOUD DO
Responsible for executing our digital deliverables, including websites, landing pages, CMS, marketing automation, mobile apps, email, and display ads

Deliver successful digital solutions clients big and small across a range of clients (from tech and healthcare to CPG and media)
Solve all sorts of problems for all sorts of businesses and teams

FINN Partners fosters an enriching work environment that facilitates creativity and professional growth. Compensation includes competitive salary, excellent medical benefits, 401k, generous vacation package and more. Visit us at www.finnpartners.com.

Job Description:
Company Description

null
Job Description

Founded with a commitment to build a different kind of law firm, Crowell & Moring LLP today is an international law firm representing clients in litigation and investigations, regulatory and transactional matters. We are internationally recognized for our representation of Fortune 500 companies in high-stakes litigation, as well as our ongoing commitment to pro bono service and diversity. With nearly 550 lawyers based in seven offices in the United States and Europe, the firm helps international corporations and emerging enterprises navigate complex legal challenges and create business solutions across the globe.

Job Summary:
The Senior Business Development Manager will develop and implement strategies to elevate the profile of the offices, practices, and attorneys in California to drive brand recognition and business growth. The Senior Business Development Manager will identify and execute strategies and signature programs to educate, inform, and strengthen client relationships and will facilitate connections among attorneys to help capitalize on business opportunities.

The position can be based at our OC or LA offices.

Primary Areas of Responsibility:

Business Development and Marketing
• Develop and execute marketing and business plans for the Los Angeles, Orange County and San Francisco offices.
• Develop strategies and approaches to facilitate collaborative business development, branding and strategic involvement in the legal and business communities.
• Secure and distribute market intelligence to further inform business development, branding and recruiting initiatives and to capitalize on opportunities that align with the firm’s strategic priorities.
• Capitalize on opportunities to work across offices to facilitate client growth and new client development initiatives.
• Engage with California attorneys to assist with integrating their business plans and aligning their initiatives with the broader plans and priorities of the firm.
• Manage and implement signature client development programs in California.
• Support client service teams as assigned.
• Research and identify organizations, events and Boards that align with each office’s strategic priorities. Develop a plan for maximizing on attorney involvement.
• Maintain and distribute a calendar of important local and regional events, including detail on attorney involvement, on a monthly basis.
• Ensure that tables at events that the firm is sponsoring are filled appropriately.
• Serve as a brand ambassador for the firm at events and become involved in organizations that will help support the firm’s strategic objectives in the three California markets.
• Work with the Senior Director, Business Development and practice leadership to implement lateral integration plans for new partners in the California offices.

Communications
• Identify opportunities for expert commentary, as well as promotion of client successes.
• Identify publishing and speaking opportunities that align with the profile-raising objectives of the practices represented in the California offices in coordination with the firm’s communications team.
• Contribute to the establishment of priorities for the PR firm supporting the California offices and identify timely opportunities to feature firm attorneys in media stories. Provide input on results and effectiveness.
• Work with the communications team to develop submissions for awards that are of strategic importance.

Qualifications

Requirements:

Education
The position requires a Bachelor’s Degree. A JD, MBA or other related advanced degree may substitute for required experience.

Experience
The position requires a minimum of eight (8) years of increasingly responsible, directly related experience during which knowledge, skills and abilities applicable to the position were demonstrated.

Experience in the direct supervision of others on a regular basis preferred. Direct experience in a law firm or professional services environment in a professional capacity preferred.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
• Strong business and marketing acumen, including the ability to leverage research and competitive intelligence to identify business opportunities and support go-to-market strategies.
• Demonstrated ability to build strong working relationships across all levels of the organization and work both independently and with others in a cooperative, enthusiastic and friendly manner to accomplish position functions and participate in team efforts.
• Ability to adapt to changing priorities and maintain a productive and committed work effort, meeting deadlines and managing workload.
• Excellent time management, organization, and prioritization skills.
• Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both orally and in writing with internal and external clients/personnel at all levels.
• Experience with content creation and messaging development.
• Strong knowledge of and familiarity with legal and business environments.
• Demonstrated knowledge of the Orange County, Los Angeles and San Francisco markets.
• Demonstrated knowledge of CRM systems and experience management databases.
• Must be willing to travel regularly among the firm’s three California offices.

Additional Information

Crowell & Moring LLP offers a competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package which includes progressive options such as back up child care, wellness programs, cultural events and social activities. We take great pride in our positive, friendly culture that rewards hard work and success, at the same time recognizing the importance of family and community service.

EOE m/f/d/v
Crowell & Moring LLP participates in the E-Verify program.

About MobileIron

Industry leading brands who are defining the future of work, adopt MobileIron to secure access to the enterprise, through the world's most ubiquitous product—the mobile device. We've created a single point of secure and frictionless access to the perimeter-less enterprise —from any device, managed by MobileIron, someone else, or not all.

Our mobile-centric, zero trust approach validates and verifies a comprehensive set of signals and the correlation between the user, device, applications, networks and potential threats before granting secure access to the device. Our zero trust platform is built on the foundation of our award-winning and industry-leading unified endpoint management (UEM) capabilities with enabling technologies of zero sign-on (ZSO) user and device authentication, multi-factor authentication (MFA), and mobile threat detection (MTD.) And we didn't stop there. We've gone beyond traditional UEM, identity and gateway solutions, to bring together mobile, security and the way people want to work—so you can free your people to be productive without limits and passwords.

MobileIron. The center of enterprise security

Recognized by Gartner as a leader in eight UEM MQs and recently noted by Forbes as one of the "Top 10 Cybersecurity Companies To Watch In 2020"

What you'll be doing…
Leading a dynamic product marketing team
Speaking at industry events
Partnering closely with industry analysts
Creating product positioning that clearly articulates our unique value proposition, enabling target customers to fully understand the benefits of MobileIron solutions
Developing a content strategy and lead content creation with key solutions partners for use in sales collateral, customer presentations, solutions briefs, website and videos
Creating and driving integrated go-to-market plans for new initiatives and products
Developing and delivering sales enablement to MobileIron sales organization, including channel sales.
Who you are...
You are an excellent written, graphical and verbal communicator with the ability to translate technical details into business value propositions.
You have a passion for building content, buyer personas and buyer journeys and overall messaging for the company
You have experience and a network with leading industry analysts
You have a clear understanding of the mobile industry, security as well as SaaS based products & services
You have technical aptitude in the area of mobility, security and enterprise infrastructure
What you've done…
BA/BS degree in Marketing or related field. MBA preferred; Technical background is a plus
Experience driving product marketing or product management efforts, including product launches for a major product line
Minimum 10 years of experience in leadership of Product Marketing
* We are an EEO/AA Employer. Protected veterans and individuals with disability encouraged to apply.

About LaunchDarkly:
LaunchDarkly is a Feature Management Platform that serves hundreds of billions of feature flags daily to help software teams build better software, faster. Feature flagging is an industry standard methodology of wrapping a new or risky section of code or infrastructure change with a flag. Each flag can easily be turned off independent of code deployment (aka "dark launching"). LaunchDarkly has SDKs for all major web and mobile platforms. We are building a diverse team so that we can offer robust products and services. Our team culture is dynamic, friendly, and supportive. Our headquarters are in Oakland.

At LaunchDarkly, we believe in the power of teams. We're building a team that is humble, open, collaborative, respectful and kind. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We've partnered with KeyValues to help demonstrate the amazing culture we've built here at LaunchDarkly, find more info at https://www.keyvalues.com/launchdarkly

We have an opportunity to join the Alliance as a Communications Content Specialist in the Communications Department.

WHAT YOU'LL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR


Reporting to the Media and Content Manager, you will develop, write and edit content for internal and external communications and assist with media relations. You will also perform communications research and planning and assist with providing oversight and support of Communications Department activities.

ABOUT THE TEAM

The Alliance's Communications Department is relatively new to the Alliance organization, having been established in 2018. As such, there's a bit of a startup mentality for our department within the larger organization, as we work to establish foundational processes and procedures and champion the Communications function and role within the organization. We use strategy, creativity and insights to develop messaging and visual communications for internal and external audiences. We partner with each department and on a variety of tasks, from an intranet webpage to a flu shot media campaign, and our committed and talented team of go-getters is always looking for the best way to communicate our messaging.

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE

You are a highly motivated individual with strong written and verbal communication skills. You can craft your writing to fit the Alliance voice and tone for internal and external audiences, and can draft a variety of content, including press releases, web copy or a newsletter article. You have the ability to work cohesively in a team-oriented environment and interact with others with diplomacy and tact, and you thrive in a fast-paced environment. You have recent experience working with Facebook Ads Manager, among other social media tools, and are familiar with best practices for increasing engagement and brand awareness using social media.

WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL

To read the full position description, and list of requirements click here.

Knowledge of:
Tools and techniques of copywriting for publication
Principles and practices of public relations, marketing, media relations and/or corporate communications
Methods of utilizing traditional media, internet, social media and alternative media to increase public awareness of the organization and promote organizational objectives
Principles and practices of content development and writing for websites and social media
Ability to:
Think creatively and develop fresh, compelling, and innovative content that aligns with the overall communications strategy and results in maximum response and engagement
Incorporate branding into the design and production of a variety of communications materials, including electronic media and printed materials
Compose content and proofread and edit high profile documents in a variety of media formats
Proofread and edit content for style, tone, completeness, and consistency of brand message
Interpret and synthesize a wide range of information from a variety of sources and translate complex information and concepts into clear, succinct copy
Education and Experience:
Bachelor's degree in English, journalism, communications or a related field
A minimum of five years of experience creating, writing, editing and publishing content in a business environment (or a Master's degree and a minimum of three years) or an equivalent combination of education and experience may be qualifying

OUR BENEFITS
Medical, Dental and Vision Plans
Ample Paid Time Off
11 Paid Holidays per year
401(a) Retirement Plan
457 Deferred Compensation Plan
Robust Health and Wellness Program
EV Charging Stations
And many more
ABOUT US


We are a group of over 500 dedicated employees, committed to our mission of providing accessible, quality health care that is guided by local innovation. We feel that our work is bigger than ourselves. We leave work each day knowing that we made a difference in the community around us.

Join us at Central California Alliance for Health (the Alliance), where you will be part of a culture that is respectful, diverse, professional and fun, and where you are empowered to do your best work. As a regional non-profit health plan, we serve over 330,000 members in Santa Cruz, Monterey and Merced counties. To learn more about us, click here or check out this video.

At this time the Alliance does not provide any type of sponsorship. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time, ongoing basis without current or future needs for sponsorship.

JOB MISSION
We’re seeking a creative, enthusiastic person with amazing communication and project management skills to help nurture, tend and grow relationships with bloggers and brands. Based in our OTR office, you will work with our Digital Campaign Strategist to help build strong relationships with bloggers and content creators, facilitate new opportunities with brands and deliver amazing insights that lead to better marketing, client satisfaction and continued growth.
JOB DESCRIPTION
Your job will be a unique blend of problem-solving, customer service, and project management. By partnering with content creators and internal cross-functional teams, you are both the content creators’ representative at Ahalogy and the face of Ahalogy to our brand clients. Most of your time will be spent building relationships with brands and bloggers, onboarding brands to the Ahalogy process, managing project timelines, educating brands on content-related trends, and overseeing the sponsored content projects from the creation of content to the delivery of the final report. The Digital Campaign Manager will have ample opportunities to touch many facets of our business and help form what Ahalogy becomes.
The ideal candidate will have a bachelor’s degree in English, communications, journalism, public relations, digital marketing or related field, with relevant work experience ranging from college internships to 2-3 years in a professional position. Project management background will be a big plus.
A pretty cool gig, all the way around.
SPECIFIC SKILLS WE'RE LOOKING FOR INCLUDE...
Attention to detail, confidence, and a can-do attitude.
Drive, ambition and motivation for success.
Ability to evaluate design and give feedback on content and creative.
Excellent written and oral skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time and commitment to meet deadlines.
Knowledge of brand marketing and personal experience with/ knowledge of social media.
Experience with Pinterest and Paid Media activations is a plus.
Lead ongoing support for 5-10 brand campaigns in the first quarter. Manage all aspects of the sponsored content campaign from timeline development, trend delivery, content creation, paid media execution, and reporting. Ensure quality of content and creative deliverables with a goal of 95% of content delivered to client is approved in the first round.
Professional experience in one or more of the key industry verticals: Food, Fashion, Fitness, Beauty, Décor, Crafts, Travel, Pets, and Baby.
Entrepreneurial mindset that allows you and your role to evolve over time. We want someone who’s eager to be an integral part of our dynamic, fun team and who’s comfortable working in a sometimes chaotic (dogs! babies! exploding sodas!), always fast-paced startup environment. You will work hard, learn a ton and have a blast.

SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE...
Lead ongoing support for 5-10 brand campaigns in the first 90 days of work.
Create content strategy plans for a brands’ custom content campaign.
Onboard at least one new content partner to Ahalogy in your first quarter.
Ensure quality of content and creative deliverables with a goal of 95% of content delivered to client is approved in the first round.

Why Ahalogy?
Ahalogy is the Passion to Purchase Platform. Brands and agencies tap into Ahalogy to grow users and use occasions by connecting with their consumers’ interests. We deliver proven ROI for our clients through our category trend data, authentic influencer content, and social optimization technology.
We’re located in Cincinnati's OTR—walking distance from some of the city's best coffee, burgers, beers, and carryout. We pride ourselves on having an open, fast-paced, and results-driven culture and we're passionate about continuing to build out a team of like-minded individuals as we continue to grow and win.
We don’t hold hands or micromanage at Ahalogy, so we need candidates with a self-driven, figure-it-out mindset. In return, we take care of you with zero cost health insurance, flexible vacation time, and if you're a full-time employee, the potential for an annual bonus. You can learn more about us by reading our Manifesto.
If you have the experience, drive, and grit to win, we'd love to hear from you!

Job Title: Manager - Digital Supply Chain - Digital Asset Management - LA
Job Description:
About You
I am passionate about digital supply chain, and making the entire process of digital content creation through management and distribution more efficient and streamlined.
I am thoroughly organized, have exemplary attention to detail, and demonstrate strong analytical, presentation, and communication skills.
I am consultative in nature and have a passion for and experience in helping my clients to succeed.
I love to manage people, timelines, tasks, issues and risks. I am an expert at motivating my team to have fun, learn more, and deliver.
I am an industrious team-player; I’m not afraid to roll up my sleeves and work diligently on any task.
I can identify project opportunities and make recommendations for new work based on my thorough knowledge of client needs.
I bring an innovative spirit and a superior work ethic to every engagement.

Job Description
As an OnPrem Project Manager, you will dive deep into the client business, working alongside a project team of other analysts, consultants and/or senior consultants. You will engage in different types of consulting projects ranging from the formulation and analysis of business, process, and organizational strategies, to the implementation of technology solutions. The methodologies will range depending on client preference. Facilitating sessions with client executives, you will identify risks and provide mitigation strategies, conduct deliverable reviews and give feedback, and lead your team through hands-on example. Our managers build and maintain strong client relationships while identifying opportunities beyond her or his current engagement, help mentor and develop exceptional talent within our firm, and contribute to other growth areas such as recruiting, strategy, and/or methodology enhancement.

Our consultants work at our client sites. As with all consultants, you should be willing to travel on occasion for work. We work in a number of fields, but have a primary focus on the Media & Entertainment industry.

About Us
We’re in the business of making businesses better—people, processes, and systems. We’re an end-to-end technology solutions provider focused on connecting disparate parts within organizations. We bring a balance of IQ and EQ to every engagement, and a depth of business and technical acumen to every problem. We are a team that is driven by following through for our clients, and being upfront, honest and sincere.

5-7+ years System Implementation, SDLC, Integration, and Project Management experience

Experience managing storage and network solutions to support large file distribution, and experience with localization use cases

Preferred
Experience in Media & Entertainment/Broadcast and/or Consumer Products industries
Experience at a large consulting firm (e.g., Accenture, Deloitte, EY, CapGemini, PWC)
Agile or Scrum Experience
Life at OnPrem
We were founded on a culture of collaboration and inclusiveness, and this permeates each of our initiatives, both client-facing and internal. We offer a wide selection of benefits including medical, dental & vision, 401k matching and flexible vacation; we sponsor trainings to advance our teams’ skill sets; we prioritize our employees’ professional growth paths. Schneider is seeking an experienced Commercial Marketing Director to identify new commercial opportunities and manage marketing efforts by keeping abreast of trends and market conditions to provide strategic advice to upper management. You will build the commercial business strategy around our CRM and Martech platforms to enable the sales team with innovative solutions to bolster productivity while acting as a core team member for commercial projects and initiatives. You will also lead a team of Marketing Business Partners and the commercial Lead Generation team. These teams are assigned to deliver plans and actions to meet commercial goals for specific service offerings, as well as brand management at the enterprise level.

About the role:
Develop and lead marketing automation and sales automation strategies for lead generation to develop
marketing qualified leads. Implement and continuously improve marketing automation platform for the
business.
Manage campaign tracking tools while measuring ROI across campaign channels.
Work with cross-functional teams using CRM and marketing automation technologies to manage and
nurture the lifecycle of a customer.
Collaborate with and coordinate diverse teams (marketing, sales, customer service, etc.) to drive
compliance and development of tools and processes (such as marketing analytics, data capture, solicitation process, segmentation, persona identification and content creation/delivery) to support the coordination and execution of commercial efforts (database marketing).
Provide leadership in implementing go-to-market strategy, segmentation and personas to improve the
sales funnel across prospecting, awareness and the customer lifecycle.
As an associate you will enjoy a strong work/life balance that includes paid vacation and holidays along with paid personal time off. You will also have access to medical, dental, and vision insurance and enjoy our company-paid life insurance and 401k savings with a company funded retirement plan. Schneider is dedicated to continuous individual development and offers a wide variety of opportunities through company-paid training and more than 170 personal development courses. What are you waiting for? You will love it here!

Automation or others.

Solid understanding of the lead to sales to post-sales process and understand multi-channel go-to market models.
Excellent email marketing and campaign experience is essential.
Intellectual curiosity to learn and stay in front of trends.

Schneider is a premier provider of transportation and logistics services. Our legacy started in 1935 with one man, one truck and one dream. Since then, we’ve grown and evolved to become a nearly $5 billion company (2018 revenue) with one of the broadest portfolios of services in the industry delivering superior customer experiences.

Job Description:
Marketing Manager, Content
Arlington, Virginia · Marketing/Public Relations

Hanover Research
Arlington, VA

Hanover Research is seeking a Marketing Manager, Content who will lead the companys content marketing efforts in order to build awareness of Hanovers offerings, foster engaging conversations, and drive inbound leads. The Marketing Manager, Content will work closely with the Content Marketing Specialist and a cross-functional team including sales, research, and account management. The ideal candidate must have prior experience working in a fast-paced, multi-channel marketing department and have proven success managing complex, content-rich marketing deliverables with multiple stakeholders from start to finish.

Main Responsibilities:
Craft the content experience for Hanover by writing pieces that generate awareness, consideration, and purchase including downloadable content, whitepapers, eBooks, infographics, guides, sales decks, case studies, blogs etc.
Create and promote compelling content to attract and engage site visitors through search, social media, and e-newsletter subscribers.
Develop scripts for video collateral and partner with Digital Graphics team to create video content.
Establish and manage a workflow for requesting, creating, editing, publishing, and retiring content.
Manage all content resources including collateral and monthly content marketing calendar.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to produce relevant content that meets the needs of both key stakeholders and our audience.
Secondary Responsibilities:
Execute lead generation marketing campaigns including direct, event, email, e-newsletter, website, and social media tactics.
Create SEO titles, tags, content categorization and structure for company website and all digital assets.
Partner with Digital Graphics team to create content assets in a variety of visually compelling formats.
Qualifications:
This position requires significant attention to detail, as well as constant communication across various internal stakeholders. The successful candidate is proactive, possesses analytical aptitude, problem-solving skills, works well with others and learns quickly, as well as, the following:
Writes succinctly.
Proven ability to translate complex concepts into compelling content that engages customers.
Experience working in a fast-paced environment desired, with strong do it yourself work ethic. Youll work with a team but will need to be a self-starter on many projects.
Must be able to multi-task and handle multiple projects hitting firm delivery deadlines.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.
Experience using social media in a corporate setting.
Collaborative individual performer who enjoys working with a small, close-knit team.
Knowledge of inbound marketing best practices and on-page SEO.
Familiarity with marketing automation software (HubSpot preferred).
Familiarity with WordPress a plus.
Minimum Education Required:
A Bachelors degree from an accredited institution in marketing, PR, communications, journalism, English, creative writing, technical writing, or related fields.

Minimum Experience:
5+ years of experience in marketing, public relations, or content creation in a corporate marketing department or agency; experience in B2B or Education preferred.

Benefits:
Competitive base salary
Starting at 18+ days PTO with unlimited annual rollover
401(K) employer matching program
Comprehensive health and dental benefits package
Health and wellness packages with discounts to local gym
Annual company-wide day of service and monthly events partnering with local organizations such as KidPower, Marthas Kitchen, DC SPCA
How to Apply:
If you feel that you would be the ideal candidate for this position, please submit your résumé through our online application portal at: http://hanoverresearchcareers.catsone.com/careers/

Only documents in Word, PPT or PDF will be accepted. Writing samples/supporting documents are highly encouraged but not required.

Hanover Values:
Business Building We build our business quickly and intelligently and we help our clients do the same
Thought Leadership and Innovation We strive constantly to deliver better information in a better way
Service To our clients and our community, service is our guiding principle
Leadership and Mentorship Our talent is our greatest asset, and we hope to help our people be their best
Firm Citizenship We are optimists who believe there are endless possibilities for our company and ourselves
About Hanover Research:
Hanover was named a Top 50 Market Research Firm by the American Marketing Association/GreenBook Market Leaders Report in 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, and 2019, and has also been twice named a Washington Business Journal Fastest Growing Company.

Hanover Research is a global research and analytics firm that provides high quality, custom research through an annual, fixed-fee model for clients in the corporate, education, and healthcare sectors. Founded in 2003 and headquartered in Arlington, Virginia, Hanover employs high-caliber market researchers, analysts, and account professionals to deliver a robust service infrastructure that is revolutionary in its combination of flexibility and affordability. The core capabilities that drive Hanovers research engine include primary research, secondary research, data analysis, and grant development. By enthusiastically fostering an environment of respect, encouragement, and support, we empower our clients and employees to seize opportunities for growth, impact, and advancement.

Hanover Research is an Equal Opportunity Employer, providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, compensation, training, promotion, transfer, leaves of absence, and termination.

The Manufacturing and Trade practice of FINN Partners is seeking an Account Executive or Senior Account Executive to join our New York team to service B2B clients. Our diverse client base ranges from multi-billion dollar, global organizations to entrepreneurial, regionally focused companies that operate in industries such as packaging, pharmaceutical, medical device, robotics and automation. Our forte is working closely with clients, deeply rooting ourselves in their business to understand challenges and opportunities and then proactively bringing them ideas to accelerate growth.

Our ideal candidate is someone that has excellent writing skills, an inquisitive nature, displays resourcefulness and flexibility, works collaboratively and thinks creatively to generate new ideas. The candidate should also have strong organizational and problem-solving skills, be detail oriented and be able to see projects to completion on deadline. The position requires the ability to think strategically and multi-task; solid writing and speaking skills are also critical.

Core responsibilities include:
Helping execute and manage several client programs as directed by senior staff. This includes keeping teams and deliverables organized, ensuring they meet internal or client requirements, and that work is performed to established standards.
Creating a variety of public relations and marketing content; candidate must have solid PR writing experience.
Serving as a day-to-day contact with clients (in conjunction with other team members).
Conducting media relations efforts to generate targeted publicity in print and online trade and business media.
Cultivating relationships with key client contacts as well as the media.
Supervising and guiding junior team members, including interns.
Regularly articulating ideas for organic business growth and agency improvement and participating in proposal development.
Requirements include:
2-3 years of full-time work experience in an agency or corporate setting.
B2B experience or interest.
Fluency in Spanish and/or Portuguese desired, but not required.
Excellent writing and editing skills.
Experience pitching and placing positive stories by and about clients in the media.
Strong organizational and problem-solving skills; displays flexibility and adaptability.
Understanding of and experience using a range of digital and social media tools.
Aptitude for understanding complex, technology-based businesses.
Strong work ethic, enthusiastic attitude and curious nature.
Enjoy working with other talented people in a creative, collaborative and fast-paced environment.
About us

Finn Partners is a global communications agency, made up of nine practice areas with 800+ people in 19 locations worldwide. The firm offers a full-service approach including integrated public relations, content creation, social, digital marketing and research services. Founded in New York in 2011 by Peter Finn with an innovative new model in which entrepreneurial spirit, innovation and partnership drive client success and sustainable agency growth, the firm delivers world class client service, coupled with best-in-class employment practices, to produce award-winning work and a rewarding culture.

FINN Partners fosters an enriching work environment that facilitates creativity and professional growth. Compensation includes competitive salary, excellent medical benefits, 401k, generous vacation package and more. Visit us at www.finnpartners.com.

New York based applicants preferred, however for the right candidate, willing to consider remote work arrangements in Boston, Philadelphia, DC or Chicago.

The Windsor Story:
Beauty is eternal. It is captured in the way you feel and in the way you look. It is timeless. Every generation needs to feel beautiful. Some things don’t change. Some things should not change.

Helping women feel beautiful has been our mission since we first opened our doors in 1937. The fashions have changed but the Windsor dream has not. Icons come and go - from Jacqueline Kennedy, to Princess Diana to the red carpet of today. Throughout it all Windsor has made beauty accessible to all women, not just the celebrities.

Job Summary:
You will play a pivotal role in developing and leveraging the Windsor customer database. Analyzing customer behavior and deriving insights to drive business growth. You will create and maintain a suite of customer reports and a loyalty dashboard to track the performance of the loyalty program. You will identify and develop patterns that drive user conversions across all channels, focusing on email, sms, and loyalty, find opportunities to improve channel engagement, and increase LTV, retention rate, and purchase frequency. You will establish a test and iterate approach to enable rapid optimization of the omni customer experience. You will be essential to developing an omni-channel customer experience.

Key Responsibilities:
Take ownership of digital data ensuring that all systems and channels are tracking accurately, and data is processed in an automated, easy to read format to help drive strategy, vision and decision-making for key digital stakeholders.
Leverage multiple data sources, establish unified customer data view and reporting with clear KPI & tracking for digital and offline channels. Supplement with key insights – actionable nuggets that business partners can respond to.
Work on weekly business review reporting and executive dashboard from an Email and CRM perspective.
Work with CRM team to establish a single view of the Windsor customer & measurement of the personalization program.
Develop customer profiles, and customer segmentations based on recency, frequency, lapsed and monetary value of our customers
Work on developing and expanding the loyalty program and tracking key KPIs to measure the success of the program.
Develop in-store loyalty capture reporting and bad data capture reporting to distribute to store operations team on a regular basis.
Direct email marketing strategies that promote customer loyalty, reengage lapsed customers, and focus on cross-channel selling and upselling strategies.
Perform analyses including but not limited to: advertising performance analysis, website analytics, customer segmentation, survey design and analysis, ROI modeling, lifetime value analysis, cross channel analysis, and media mix analysis.
Working with platform experience & social teams, develop test and learn actionable program to constantly optimize user/shopper experience and drive value by channel and device.
Work with digital content team & develop ways to measure content performance and inform digital content creation.
Develop value-driven database segments to elevate digital channel performance and fuel revenue growth.
Build a framework linking online activity to offline behavior, developing valuations of online actions based on their impact to both brick-and-mortar and e-commerce sales.
Assist in building infrastructure, vision, and analytic tools to support customer centric programs that span campaigns and focus on customer level offer optimization.
Experience in simplifying complex information and explaining findings, outcomes and presenting insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders to reach commercial goals.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree required
Strong analytical and data visualization skills
Demonstrated experience conducting in-depth analysis of various marketing channels, including but not limited to, email, organic social, paid social/digital, SEM/SEO, and retail stores etc.
Versed in Google Analytics as well as various BI Platforms such as Alteryx
3+ years of marketing analyst experience in a dynamic, data-driven environment, preferably in fashion retail
Data management experience utilizing programming is a strong plus (e.g. SQL)
Strong computer skills particularly MS Office (Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills are necessary).
Ability to work under tight deadlines, deal with diverse levels of personnel in a multi-functional environment
Ability to work independently, under general direction, and create organized work plans and output requirements in a timely fashion.
Demonstrate creative thinking and good business judgment
Ability to be flexible, multi-task, have strong organizational, communication and leadership skills to meet strict deadlines and manage multiple projects
Must have strong interpersonal skills and the ability to deal with all levels of management.
Requires a minimum 3-5 years related and progressively responsible experience with the strategic use of data and analytics, preferably in the e-commerce field. Must have the proven ability to identify and assess trends with customer or market data, and experience analyzing campaigns, programs and tests. Requires knowledge of and skill utilizing various Microsoft Office Suite products. Requires Excel application expertise with the strong ability to analyze/manipulate data, perform trend analyses and create reporting and other analytical and planning templates. Must have experience creating complex forecasts which incorporate several inputs and variables. Requires expertise in developing and creating reports in BI Tools. Having Alteryx experience is a plus.

Job Description:
Who Are We?

Merchant e-Solutions is an innovative, technology-focused company providing a full-service platform to support the payment processing needs for merchants of all sizes, including small business retail shops, B2B wholesalers, and global eCommerce enterprises. We partner with financial institutions, software developers, independent sales organizations, and agents to bring our solutions to market.

Why Join Us?

We're growing and we're looking for collaborative, innovative, and hard-working individuals to grow with us! We offer a modern and inspiring work environment (including a game room and free snacks!) where your ideas and contributions are valued. Come experience, first-hand, the impact of your contributions.

The Opportunity:

Working within the analytics center of excellence team, the BI Analyst will be responsible for using Power BI to develop insightful actionable front-end content for the organization (dashboards, reports, & guided analytics). As familiarity with our data increases, the individual in this role will support back end content creation to expand and specialize the Power BI analytical layer. Successful candidates will have strong communication skills, adept and demonstrable knowledge of Power BI, and experience moving BI content through a full lifecycle.

Your Responsibilities will require you to:

Front end development 70%:
Gather requirements from stakeholders
Responsible for content design methodology and project documentation
Create advanced measures that articulate KPI's in Power BI using DAX
Optimize visualizations maximizing Power BI's speed of response
Create templates that standardize content presentation in PowerPoint, browser, & mobile formats
Develop actionable highly visual reports, dashboards and data narratives
Create interactive visualization allowing users to ask and answer questions through guided analytics
Organize content into apps & workspaces
Captivate non-technical stakeholders and promote the published content
Back end development 30%:
Responsible for data design methodology and project documentation
Build tabular and multidimensional data models in Power BI for apps & the excel plugin
Implement row level security and understand application security layer models in Power BI
Optimize data models Power BI's speed of response
Have strong knowledge of secondary tools like SQL scripting & plan optimization
Qualified Candidate Profile:

Required Skills:
Highly proficient recent T/SQL querying skills, including optimization, parameterization, and analytical queries
4+ years of current business intelligence development experience in a business setting utilizing one of the following tools (Tableau, Power BI, Domo, Sisense)
1+ year of current BI development experience utilizing Power BI as a primary tool
Demonstrable proficiency and experience building multidimensional data models in Power BI
Demonstrable proficiency and experience building advanced DAX based measures in Power BI
Demonstrable proficiency and experience building front end content and templates in Power BI
Demonstrable proficiency and experience supporting Power BI data distribution options (Apps, SharePoint, Excel plugins)
Preferred Skills:
Power BI Certification via Microsoft
Payments or other Financial services industry experience is a plus
BS in a quantitative, computer sciences, engineering, or business program; or equivalent work experience
Personal Drive - willingness and desire to go the extra mile in solving difficult business problems, even when it lies outside traditional boundaries
Team Player - willingness desire to be part of a strong team and contribute to a strong culture within and across organizations; in support of Sales, Product, Ops and other organizations.

Job Title: Senior Software Engineer, Computer Vision – Deep Learning
Job Description:
Intelligent machines powered by Artificial Intelligence computers that can learn, reason and interact with people are no longer science fiction. Deep Learning has provided the foundation for machines to learn, perceive, reason and solve problems. Now, NVIDIA’s GPU runs Deep Learning algorithms, simulating human intelligence, and acts as the brain of computers, robots and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world.

NVIDIA is known as “the AI computing company.” Come, join our Deep Learning team, where you can help build the real-time, cost-effective computing platform driving our success in this exciting and quickly growing field.

We are currently seeking an experienced software engineer with strong Deep Learning and Computer Vision fundamentals coupled with robust C/C++ skills to contribute to the development of NVIDIA RTX Broadcast engine - a comprehensive suite of SDKs and libraries that enable AI-driven features for game broadcasting, video conferencing and content creation.

What you’ll be doing:
Architect next generation Deep Learning and Computer Vision algorithms for processing of video, audio and augmented reality

Adaptiva is searching for a Senior Product Marketing Manager to manage the go-to-market planning and content for the company’s product line. This role reports to the VP of Marketing and will offer the opportunity to set the product marketing strategy for Adaptiva, an enterprise IT software company which is rapidly growing, highly profitable, and working with over 150 of the largest Fortune 1000 companies in the world.
Role and Responsibilities
The Senior Product Marketing Manager will be responsible for developing positioning, messaging, competitive differentiation, sales tools, and collateral for the company’s suite of endpoint management and security products. This role requires both the ability to understand the technology as well as eloquently communicate the high-level business value of those products. They will both define the drive the execution of the product marketing plan, creating most materials in-house.
Responsibilities
Positioning/Messaging – Develop product positioning and messaging that clearly differentiates Adaptiva’s products in the market.
Product Launch – Create the product launch strategy for new products, creating a detailed plan which outlines all the necessary sales tools and product materials required to meet audience needs along every step of the customer journey.
Product Content – Create the product marketing materials, website content, and tools necessary to help customers make educated purchasing decisions around the entire suite of Adaptiva products. This includes brochures, datasheets, website copy, product guides, videos, social postings, ads, landing pages, and blog posts.
Market Intelligence – Research the market and competitive offerings to create materials that perfectly speak to customer buying criteria and reasons Adaptiva products are superior to competitive offerings.
Sales Training and Enablement – Communicate the value proposition of the products to the sales team and develop the sales tools and competitive insight that support the selling process of Adaptiva products.
Demand Generation – Work to integrate new product marketing materials into the overall demand generation strategy. Strategically place materials across multiple channels (web, social, direct, etc.) to drive requests for demos and increased demand for Adaptiva products.
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience)
3+ years of product B2B, enterprise-focused marketing experience
Work experience in systems management or security-related product marketing
Demonstrated product marketing and content creation experience. Writing samples required
Creative and passionate about positioning products to stand out from the competition
Organized, detail-oriented with strong communication skills
Benefits
Highly competitive salaries and compensation packages
Opportunity to participate in company stock plan
100% coverage on top-of-the-line medical, dental, and vision benefits
18 vacation days to start + one additional day each year
Incredible team outings and events
Fully stocked kitchen, plus frequent team lunches and dinners

Strong facility to translate complex technical topics into clear, concise and compelling prose.

Using technology to optimize your own or the team's performance
Prioritizing, planning and organizing work activities, managing several projects at once

Medidata is making a real difference in the lives of patients everywhere by accelerating critical drug and medical device development, enabling life-saving drugs and medical devices to get to market faster. Our products sit at the convergence of the Technology and Life Sciences industries, one of most exciting areas for global innovation.
