Job Title: Part-Time ESL Teacher / Video Content Creator
Job Description:
Company Description

BlaBla is an online learning platform for native English speakers to teach English to learners in China (aged 12+) online through videos. The company recognizes the fragmented characteristic of language learning. Unlike traditional online tutoring, BlaBla empowers teachers (native English speakers) to create engaging video content for users to learn at their own pace online. BlaBla's mission is to foster a more convenient, fun, and effective educational experience for both teachers and learners. Founded in 2019, the company has established offices and R&D centers in Shanghai, Suzhou, and Silicon Valley. The company adheres to the belief that motivation and incentives are key to successful teaching and learning experiences.

BlaBla aims to deliver an experience similar to that of a full immersion language program that assists learners in building a native or bilingual language proficiency. The company continues to develop outstanding products with features such as speech recognition, scene recognition, user interest profile, and recommendation system using Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning technology. BlaBla believes that AI and machine learning will continue to be the core of quality educational experiences.
Mission: We are providing a platform for teachers and learners to experience convenient, fun, and effective English education.

Company Social Media

Website: bit.ly/3bBvzJW
LinkedIn: linkedin.com/company/blablaapp
Facebook: facebook.com/blabla.video/
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCT8rDjMUKYFJBgE8wDUTLCw/
Medium: medium.com/blabla


Job Description

If you have been searching for that perfect part-time job online, look no further. During the global pandemic, nothing beats a great opportunity to work from home part-time and make some extra money online! Do you spend hours scrolling through Tiktok, Instagram or other short-form video apps? Are you outgoing and far from camera-shy? Wonder what it's like to teach English online and already have similar experience teaching English as a second language (ESL)? This is your chance to experience the one of a kind online ESL teaching! Click the apply button to potentially become an ESL Teacher / ESL Video Content Creator with BlaBla, the best platform to teach English through online videos.

Once the application is approved, we will invite you to a trial video assessment to create a demo video lesson. If the quality and style of the video match with our requirements, you would be offered to join BlaBla's content creator team as a Part-Time ESL Video Content Creator to teach English to our users with more of your recorded video lessons. Once onboard, you would receive the regular base pay of $15 CAD/hr like the rest of our Part-Time ESL Video Content Creators. We are seeking native English speaking teachers, leaders, entrepreneurs, and anyone with a passion for and experience in ESL teaching to help Chinese users build their English skills with creative pre-recorded video lessons. Sounds like something you would try? Apply now!


Responsibilities

For the trial video assessment, you will:

● Follow our Video Creation Guide to record and upload ONE video lesson to our team for trial assessment:
Link to PDF: https://tinyurl.com/ydeufhcr
Link to Video: https://youtu.be/j2LLWoot1o0

● The DEADLINE to submit the video is 5 days after we receive your resume. Please submit the demo video as soon as possible so we can track your application.

Once offered the role of "Part-Time Video Content Creator", you will:

● Come up with meaningful, educational, and engaging topics for video content. (Ranging from TOEFL and IELTS' oral exam prep to daily conversations, locations, hobbies, and careers. The choice is unlimited).
● Record quality short videos between 15 to 60 seconds. You could do so either with a partner (e.g. Asking and answering IELTS questions) or you can record yourself (e.g. Explain frequent IELTS words or questions).
● Maintain a ratio of 2-3 video uploads per hour spent on video creation, with 2 videos per hour minimum.
● Each video is spoken entirely in English with a clear focus on a specific topic/subject matter.
● Upload recorded videos to and share within/through our app for Chinese ESL learners to absorb and learn.


Qualifications

● Native English speakers
● Excellent written and verbal communication skills
● Highly creative and articulate, able to explain concepts in videos with proper spelling, grammar, verbiage, and tools to effectively deliver a message
● Previous ESL teaching or related teaching experiences preferred
● Strong Familiarity with short-form online video platforms such as TikTok and Instagram
● Passionate about teaching and creating fun, educational, and story-telling videos
● Prior experience in video editing (knowledge of digital video editing, compositing) preferred
● Dedicated, consistent, and committed to posting quality video lessons regularly
● Enjoy the challenge to constantly grow the number of user followers with the video content they created, similar to a social media influencer in the ESL community
● Self-starters and impeccable communicators who think outside of the box
● An active participant in English speaking clubs/organizations/sports preferred
● Interested in digital media and entertainment, communications, business, marketing, social media, sales, and/or project management
● Previous experience or transferable skills in marketing, social media, creative, project and events management, and data analysis
● Strong problem-solvers who are not afraid to ask for help when needed
● Work well within a team and comfortable speaking in front of groups and interacting with new people
● Strong time-management skills and ability to juggle multiple tasks and projects at the same time


Benefits

● Competitive compensation
● Opportunities to increase earnings (fixed hourly pay + up to 40% commission) through more collaborative paid video lessons with BlaBla based on the quality and impact of teaching. The higher the number of followers and positive feedback teachers received, the better the chances for this advancement.
● Opportunities to receive tips from users who find the video lessons created to be of helpful and high quality
● Experience the thrill of an experience similar to a social media influencer (e.g. TikToker, Youtuber): seeing an increasing number of fans and gaining recognition in the field with the videos you shared
● Flexible, collaborative, friendly, and supportive tech start-up working environment
● Chance to be part of an international business community
● Exclusive brand merchandise

Pay Rate

● $15 CAD/hr

Hours of Commitment

● Between 4-6 hours per week on average
● Maintain at least 5 billable hours per month
● At least 1 video creation for the first 10 days since the started date
● More than 50 short video lesson uploads per month preferred
● Maintain a ratio of 2-3 video uploads per hour spent on video creation, with 2 videos uploads per hour minimum


If you feel like you're a good fit, don't hesitate to contact us at hr@blabla.app. We'd love to meet you!

Collective Health is changing the face of health insurance. We're crafting tech-forward products to completely reinvent the healthcare experience for our members and employers.

About the role

As a Sales Enablement Associate at Collective Health, you'll develop meaningful, helpful content that will directly impact the growth of our business. You'll flex your talents in content writing, project management, data analysis, and relationship building to empower our sales engine to succeed. You'll live at the intersection between our sales, product marketing, and partnerships teams to ensure clear understanding, prioritization, and alignment around our product offerings and product strategy while also helping to enable the sales organization to be successful in the field through proposal writing and network analysis generation.

The ideal candidate is focused, agile, energetic, driven, and a self-starter with previous experience in sales and sales training/content creation.

What you'll do
Work across the commercial organization to project manage, write, and edit proposals.
Coordinate responses for questionnaires using our internal knowledge database, subject matter experts (SMEs), and our network partners.
Project manage the completion of proposals and quote requests with our internal and external stakeholders, including network partners, for items such as: pricing, analyses, metrics, and written responses.
Serve as the internal process czar within Commercial to promote and iterate internal processes and discipline for product feedback, requests, consistent collateral usage in market, etc.
Assist Product Marketing in training and certifying commercial-facing teams.
Coordinate with Product Marketing to create prospect-facing collateral.
Support deal-specific resource customization.
Routinely update and refresh our knowledge database to ensure we are selling the product well and accurately.
Triage sales questions via saleshelp@ alias.
Your skills include
0-2 years of experience.
Strong project management skills with exceptional attention to detail.
Ability to execute multiple projects and deliverables within tight timelines.
Excellent proofreading, communication, and strategic problem solving skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders.
Nice to have
A background in writing and editing
A sales or marketing background
Working knowledge of health plans, employee benefits and health care innovation landscape.
Who you are
A self starter. You're ready for the autonomy that comes with building new things at Collective Health and managing multiple projects at any given moment.
Reliable. You do the things you say you're going to do, with a strong sense of urgency. You are prepared and are always thinking 10 steps ahead, and over-communicate to ensure everyone is on the same page.
Detail oriented. You sweat the details and focus on doing the little things right. It is with this consistency and accuracy that we build a foundation of trust that enables us to achieve excellence.
Team focused. We know that all success is shared and we invest in and root for each other always.
Deeply committed to the Collective Health mission of improving healthcare.
Collective Health is a technology company simplifying employer healthcare to make health insurance work for everyone. With more than 200,000 members and over 45 enterprise clients—including Pinterest, Red Bull, Restoration Hardware, Activision Blizzard, and more—our technical and customer experience teams are reinventing the healthcare experience for forward-thinking employers and their people across the U.S.

Collective Health is headquartered in San Francisco, CA, with additional offices in Chicago, IL, and Lehi, UT. Founded in 2013, Collective Health is backed by the SoftBank Vision Fund, DFJ Growth, PSP Investments, NEA, GV, G Squared, Founders Fund, Maverick Ventures, Mubadala Ventures, Sun Life, and other leading investors. For more information, visit us at https://www.collectivehealth.com

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Job Title: Account Supervisor - Integrated Brand Programming - Consumer Lifestyle
Job Description:
ACCOUNT SUPERVISOR

INTEGRATED BRAND PROGRAMMING CONSUMER LIFESTYLE

NEW YORK

Ready to make a difference at one of the most dynamic, integrated public relations firms in the world? Finn Partners has an opportunity for an amazing Account Supervisor in New York to supervise one of our most prestigious lifestyle accounts.

Our ideal candidate can independently lead programs and strategically advise clients on the latest trends, deliver excellent client service and supervise staff. Applicants must demonstrate strong communication and time management skills, set the standard for quality control in his/her work and consistently deliver stellar results that exceed expectations.

Responsibilities
Develop and oversee development of comprehensive brand programs, from targeted media lists, influencer lists, tailored pitches, and content calendars, to client content, media materials, and social content that requires minimal input from senior leadership
Proactively generate new ideas and opportunities to ensure client program success and growth
Showcase knowledge and connections with top-tier traditional and social media outlets important to clients business

About Finn Partners:

Finn Partners is a global communications agency, made up of nine practice areas with 700+ people in 19 locations worldwide. The firm offers a full-service approach including integrated public relations, content creation, social, digital marketing and research services. Founded in New York in 2011 by Peter Finn with an innovative new model in which entrepreneurial spirit, innovation and partnership drive client success and sustainable agency growth, the firm delivers world class client service, coupled with best-in-class employment practices, to produce award-winning work and a rewarding culture. The Marketing Coordinator plays an integral role in achieving Framework’s ambitious growth marketing goals by managing all administrative functions that support the team. A Key function of this role will be to assist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all the relevant stakeholders and leveraging project management and collaboration platforms.

The ideal candidate is extremely organized and a creative thinker. They will have at least 3 years of experience working in a marketing role (agency experience is a plus), and at least 1 year of hands-on experience as a project coordinator. In addition, she/he will feel comfortable working with multiple teams, internal and external, as well as multiple stakeholders, and under tight deadlines.

This position reports to the Brand Marketing Manager and is based in Boston, MA.

What You’ll Do:
Help us build the systems and processes that will support the marketing operations at Framework
Assist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders
Identify and document project requirements and translate into tasks, develop project schedule and assign tasks
Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects
Schedule and manage project and team meetings, preparing agendas, taking minutes, identifying action items, and follow up within PM and collaboration platforms
Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation
Communicate proactively with project owners regarding possible or current blockers, changes, or conflicts
Report on project status at weekly team stand ups
Assist with market research
Support the maintenance and development of internal tools, including Confluence, Box, Jira, and Slack
What You’ll Bring
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage a workload involving multiple activities, tight deadlines, and multiple stakeholders
Empathy and active listening skills
Curiosity and an eagerness to learn new things
An interest in being part of a highly collaborative team
Tenacity and passion for finding out-of-the-box solutions
Experience with project management practices and tools to create, manage, and track project progress
Preferred Qualifications and Experience
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a marketing role, with 1-2 of those years in a project coordinator role
Ability to work well independently and as part of a larger team
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, and Outlook
Experience using project management tools (Jira and Confluence preferred)
Working knowledge of marketing tools, including marketing automation (HubSpot preferred) and Google Analytics
Job Classification

This is a full-time, non-exempt position.

Work Environment and Physical Demands

This job requires the routine use of standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. It requires the ability to speak and hear in person, over the phone, and in settings where there are groups of people. Occasional travel is required, including overnight travel for up to four days at a time and travel via airplane.

What We’ll Offer You / Benefits of Working for Framework

The Framework team is a group of thoughtful, creative, and caring human beings. Our company boasts employees that hail from several different countries and speak a multitude of languages. We are collaborators who value each other’s differences and are committed to bringing our authentic selves to work each day, so that we might design quality products for humans that need them. We offer a suite of benefits designed to support our employees’ thriving in the workplace, including but not limited to:

• Flexible Work Schedules
• Remote Work
• Health Plans Incl. Dental and Vision
• 401(k) Savings Plan
• 11 Paid Holidays Incl. Election Day
• Open Vacation
• 52 Weeks Paid Parental Leave
• Personal and Professional Growth Opportunities
• Opportunity to help build and deliver cutting edge, socially-driven products from scratch!

About the Team

The Marketing Coordinator is a key functional member of Framework's Marketing team. The Marketing team’s mission is to deliver an integrated, omni-channel brand experience that fosters trust and delivers content and messaging that resonates with our customers and aligns their experience with our brand values and promise.

About the Company

Framework is a startup social enterprise built on a simple idea: every homebuyer should have access to unbiased information about the mortgage process and feel knowledgeable about the responsibilities of owning a home. And more—it should be easy and affordable.

We are proudly pro-homeownership and believe it is a uniquely accessible and powerful way for people to build long term financial security. We make it easier for people to do this by providing the tools we believe will lead prospective homebuyers into homes that improve their quality of life, giving them the space to grow into their future, and gain value over time.

From our state-of-the art homebuyer education course that has helped over 700K people into their homes since its inception, to our newest digital homebuyer and homeownership experience—KeepHome—our mission to support homeowners continues to grow every year, and so does our team!

As we leverage the power of technology to strengthen communities one homeowner at a time, the individual contributions of our tight-knit team play a vital, daily role in shaping our products and services. Creative thinking, collaboration, and problem solving are at the core of the Framework culture, and we’re seeking team members with drive and ingenuity to add to the mix.

Come join us!


The position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet Framework’s changing needs, at the sole discretion of management.

Marketing Coordinator

Salary: $50K - $60K

4+ years of social media marketing experience required

Responsibilities

4+ years of social media marketing

Job Title: Senior Consultant - Digital Supply Chain - Digital Asset Management - NY
Job Description:
About You
I am passionate about digital supply chain, and making the entire process of digital content creation through management and distribution more efficient and streamlined.
I am thoroughly organized, have exemplary attention to detail, and demonstrate strong analytical and communication skills.
I am consultative in nature and have a passion for and experience in helping my clients to succeed.
I am an industrious team-player; I’m not afraid to roll up my sleeves and work diligently on any task.
I love to help plan or lead client-facing meetings.
I thrive when working with senior-level members of my team to ensure project goals are met.
I am passionate about the company I work for and love to help with internal initiatives.
I bring an innovative spirit and a superior work ethic to every engagement.
I excel when working with a team, even when faced with demanding deadlines.

Job Description
As an OnPrem Senior Consultant with Digital Supply Chain experience, you will dive deep into the client business, working alongside a project team of other analysts, consultants and/or a project manager. You will engage in different types of consulting projects ranging from the formulation and analysis of business, process, and organizational strategies, to the implementation of technology solutions. You will provide initial reviews of deliverables, identify risks/issues and provide mitigation strategies, give project status to your Project Manager and/or client, and assist with or lead client meetings (e.g. stakeholder interviews, workshops, status updates, etc.)

Our consultants work at our client sites. As with all consultants, you should be willing to travel on occasion for work. In this role, you may have an opportunity to mentor junior resources.

About Us
We’re in the business of making businesses better—people, processes, and systems. We’re an end-to-end technology solutions provider focused on connecting disparate parts within organizations. We bring a balance of IQ and EQ to every engagement, and a depth of business and technical acumen to every problem. We are a team that is driven by following through for our clients, and being upfront, honest and sincere.
Requirements
3-5+ years System Implementation, SDLC, Integration, and Project Management experience
3+ years in consulting / professional services, big firm experience preferred
2+ years of implementation experience for DSC/DAM or other digital media delivery solutions over the full lifecycle (analysis, design, develop, test, deploy, support) at a consulting / professional services firm
Experience managing storage and network solutions to be able to support large file distribution
Knowledge of numerous file formats and codecs with a focus on video
Experience with localization use cases
Demonstrated ability to manage upwards and communicate with leadership
Demonstrated ability to collaborate with subject matter experts, cross-functional resources and business stakeholders to understand and document business requirements
Ability to plan, prioritize and manage custom development project delivery based on business requirements
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, information systems, computer science, business administration or other related fields
Preferred
Experience in Media & Entertainment/Broadcast and/or Consumer Products industries
Experience at a large consulting firm (e.g., Accenture, Deloitte, EY, CapGemini, PWC)
Experience setting up security policies, users, roles, and groups within a DAM system
Agile or Scrum Trained and/or Certified
OpenText experience
Life at OnPrem

Job Title: Manager - Digital Media Supply Chain - NY
Job Description:
About You
I am passionate about digital supply chain, and making the entire process of digital content creation through management and distribution more efficient and streamlined.
I am thoroughly organized, have exemplary attention to detail, and demonstrate strong analytical, presentation, and communication skills.
I am consultative in nature and have a passion for and experience in helping my clients to succeed.
I love to manage people, timelines, tasks, issues and risks. I am an expert at motivating my team to have fun, learn more, and deliver.
I am an industrious team-player; I’m not afraid to roll up my sleeves and work diligently on any task.
I can identify project opportunities and make recommendations for new work based on my thorough knowledge of client needs.
I bring an innovative spirit and a superior work ethic to every engagement.

Job Description
As an OnPrem Project Manager, you will dive deep into the client business, working alongside a project team of other analysts, consultants and/or senior consultants. You will engage in different types of consulting projects ranging from the formulation and analysis of business, process, and organizational strategies, to the implementation of technology solutions. The methodologies will range depending on client preference. Facilitating sessions with client executives, you will identify risks and provide mitigation strategies, conduct deliverable reviews and give feedback, and lead your team through hands-on example. Our managers build and maintain strong client relationships while identifying opportunities beyond her or his current engagement, help mentor and develop exceptional talent within our firm, and contribute to other growth areas such as recruiting, strategy, and/or methodology enhancement.

Our consultants work at our client sites. As with all consultants, you should be willing to travel on occasion for work. We work in a number of fields, but have a primary focus on the Media & Entertainment industry.

About Us
We’re in the business of making businesses better—people, processes, and systems. We’re an end-to-end technology solutions provider focused on connecting disparate parts within organizations. We bring a balance of IQ and EQ to every engagement, and a depth of business and technical acumen to every problem. We are a team that is driven by following through for our clients, and being upfront, honest and sincere.
Requirements
5-7+ years System Implementation, SDLC, Integration, and Project Management experience
3+ years in consulting / professional services, big firm experience preferred
5+ years experience managing the full implementation lifecycle (analysis, design, develop, test, deploy, support) for Digital Media Supply Chain, including Digital Asset Management systems or other digital media delivery solutions
Experience managing storage and network solutions to support large file distribution, and experience with localization use cases
Knowledge of numerous file formats and codecs with a focus on video
Ability to collaborate with subject matter experts, cross-functional resources and business stakeholders to understand and document business requirements
Experience in project planning, including building and managing to project plans, budgeting, resource allocation, and reporting status to clients and internal teams
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, information systems, computer science, business administration or other related fields
Experience in any Digital Asset Management systems, including but not limited to: OpenText Media Management (OTMM), Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), MediaBeacon, Adam Systems, Nuxeo
Preferred
Experience in Media & Entertainment/Broadcast and/or Consumer Products industries
Experience at a large consulting firm (e.g., Accenture, Deloitte, EY, CapGemini, PWC)
Agile or Scrum Experience
Life at OnPrem
We were founded on a culture of collaboration and inclusiveness, and this permeates each of our initiatives, both client-facing and internal. We offer a wide selection of benefits including medical, dental & vision, 401k matching and flexible vacation; we sponsor trainings to advance our teams’ skill sets; we prioritize our employees’ professional growth paths. Company Description

Kinetica helps many of the world’s largest companies solve some of the world’s most complex problems, including Citibank, GSK, OVO, Softbank, and Telkomsel, among others. The Kinetica Active Analytics Platform combines streaming and historical data with location intelligence and machine learning-powered analytics. Organizations across automotive, energy, telecommunications, retail, healthcare, financial services, and beyond leverage the platform’s GPU-accelerated computing power to build custom analytical applications that deliver immediate, dynamic insight. Kinetica has a rich partner ecosystem, including Dell, HP, IBM, NVIDIA, and Oracle, and is privately held, backed by leading global venture capital firms Canvas Ventures, Citi Ventures, GreatPoint Ventures, and Meritech Capital Partners.

Join Kinetica and help us change the way people interact with our world.

Job Description

Kinetica is looking for an accomplished sales enablement professional to add to our growing team. This person will be responsible for developing and managing sales enablement at Kinetica. Kinetica is doubling annual revenue year-over-year, and our enterprise customer list is growing at a steady across all markets globally. We are seeking proven sales enablement leaders who can own training, onboarding, content management, and strategy for our sales department.

As the Sales Enablement Manager you will be focused on core sales systems, processes, tools and enablement. Helping to empower the reps to increase velocity, shaping our systems to meet the needs of the business, and building the necessary infrastructure for a global sales organization. You will partner with our sales team to improve critical processes, develop a strategy for sales team training and content while also partnering with sales leadership, sales operations, product, and marketing to drive strategy execution.

Role and Responsibilities
Partner with sales leadership to uncover business needs, and design training solutions to address these needs, then launch and measure the success of those solutions
Manage cross-functional efforts that impact the sales team while effectively executing against defined plans
Design and develop Sales Enablement solutions across a variety of mediums (i.e. classroom, virtual, elearnings, content, coaching, video, on the job support, etc.) to improve the way we sell into various markets
Measure the impact of Enablement solutions and make changes if needed
Develop new hire onboarding programs that decrease ramp time of incoming reps
Design and optimize programs like GTM Kickoff and certification programs to improve business performance.
Support bespoke content creation for proposals and executive presentations
Become the expert on the Kinetica Sales Tool stack - work to optimize our CRM, email marketing, sales engagement, communication, and messaging
Qualifications

Qualifications
3-5 years experience in either outbound marketing or sales enablement
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience with Salesforce, Marketing Automation, or Sales Engagement tools
Experience with Excel and PowerPoint, Google Apps (Adobe PDF design experience is a huge plus!)
Excel in executing, establishing priorities, and meeting swift deadlines in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

We are committed to building a diverse team and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds.

Title Photo and Video Editor
Location Marketing & Communications
Department Name 9210-Marketing/Communications
Description
Interlochen Center for the Arts is seeking to hire a Photo and Video Editor. This person will contribute to the Interlochen brand through production and editing of high-quality photo and video assets and deliverables (using existing content). This is a temporary position that will run from May 18 through June 26, 2020.

Major Responsibilities
Consult with the Director of Digital Media and execute assigned photo and video deliverables
Ensure that all photo and video deliverables adhere to the following brand standards
Brand Messaging Map
Brand Guidelines
Video Style Guide
Prepare final files for online distribution i.e. proper sizing, formats, thumbnails, closed captioning, lower-thirds, etc.
This position must develop a thorough understanding of Interlochen’s standards in order to obtain approval for publication. This requires constant artistic, aesthetic, and narrative decision making for photo and video content in a manner that meets Interlochen’s goals
Qualifications and Experience
Expert knowledge of Adobe Premiere, Photoshop, Illustrator, Audition, and AfterEffects
Expert knowledge of the fundamentals of digital photography (photo formats, resolution, downloading / uploading files, etc.)
Strong familiarity with SmugMug and other photo management systems
Strong computer and organizational skills
Strong self-motivation and interpersonal skills
Application Process:

If interested in applying please begin your application by clicking the "Apply Now" button at the bottom of the page. On the top of the application page, upload your resume FIRST by clicking “Upload Resume”. Review of materials will commence immediately and continue until the position has been filled. Materials submitted will be held in the strictest confidence.

Application documents required for this position:

• Resume - required

• Cover letter - required

More information about Interlochen Center for the Arts:

A global destination for artists and arts enthusiasts, Interlochen Center for the Arts nurtures creativity through five dynamic platforms: Interlochen Arts Camp, the renowned summer arts program; Interlochen Arts Academy, the nation’s premier fine arts boarding high school; Interlochen Presents, a producer of more than 600 annual performances by internationally celebrated guest artists, Interlochen students, and faculty; Interlochen Public Radio, two listener-supported, 24-hour public radio stations (classical music and news); and Interlochen College of Creative Arts, a convener for lifelong learning in the arts.

Since 1928, Interlochen’s mission to inspire people worldwide through excellence in the arts and education has produced generations of purposeful creative lives. For more information, visit interlochen.org. Follow Interlochen on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and YouTube at @interlochenarts

Company Overview

WhiteOwl provides ERP and CRM consulting services, as well as cloud computing services, to growing businesses and non-profits. Our services include business process consulting, application (ERP, CRM, etc.) implementation, custom software, cloud and virtualization services, managed and virtual CIO services, and business continuity and security consulting.

WhiteOwl is also the developer and implementer of PaperSave®, a cloud-based document management, workflow, and transaction automation software product. In addition, we are resellers and partners for Microsoft, Intacct, and Blackbaud technologies.

Based in South Florida, we were founded in 1997, and have over 1,000 clients throughout the United States and internationally. WhiteOwl is the technology affiliate of MBAF, a top-40 CPA and consulting firm. To learn more about WhiteOwl, visit https://www.gowhiteowl.com/.

Our Culture

We collaborate with one another and are fast paced! We are committed to our clients, and, at the same time, we are committed to making ourselves and each other better.

We attend sporting events which include baseball, basketball, football, and hockey for our local teams. We get together for "Happy Hour, wear our WhiteOwl shirts for bowling nights, and have internal clubs and leadership groups.

We are good community citizens with a strong desire to give back. We are heavily involved in various non-profit initiatives which include beach clean-ups, Feeding South Florida, the Back to School Drive, amongst others. Our Holiday parties are the talk of the town; every year tops the year before!

We believe in developing and mentoring our employees for, frankly, selfish reasons. We want you to stay! Therefore, we invest in you by tapping into your growth potential. The sky is the limit at WhiteOwl!

Position Summary

Our PaperSave® professional services organization, a part of WhiteOwl and the MBAF accounting firm, delivers document management and workflow solutions to small and medium sized North American and international businesses and foundations.

Position Summary

The Marketing Coordinator assists in planning and executes marketing programs and activities that are in line with the larger goals of WhiteOwl with a strong focus on generating and nurturing sales leads. Working with the director of marketing and key executives, the coordinator will establish realistic and attainable goals for each program/initiative. The marketing coordinator works with all departments of WhiteOwl to build internal relationships, ensuring all sales and marketing needs are addressed.

Responsibilities
Works together with and provides support to sales and marketing as necessary including the development, review, and enhancement of all firm collateral materials, including brochures, presentations, and other sales/marketing resources including proposal development support
Plans and execute all email marketing campaigns including newsletters, alerts, and lead generation/nurturing campaigns
Works with outsourced vendors to create all content including blogs, whitepapers, videos, case studies, etc.
Coordinates website maintenance and updates; manages relationship with vendor
Organizes and coordinates cross-selling initiatives with MBAF
Coordinates all aspects of client-related events including learning events, live demos, webinars, etc.
Collaborates, plans, and executes all tradeshow events may include travel
Assist in social media strategy and execution
Works with affiliates cross-functional marketing team to help coordinate/execute marketing initiatives
Performs other duties and special projects, as assigned
Qualifications and Requirements
Bachelors degree in marketing, or business degree, required
Two to Three (23) years marketing experience, preferred
Knowledge in Adobe Suite, preferred
Knowledge of digital/email marketing, Marketing Automation (Act-On) and CRM (Microsoft Dynamics) is a plus
Knowledge of Social Media platforms such as Hootsuite is a plus
Excellent writing skills; critical-thinker; team-oriented; detailed; multi-tasker
High initiative and aptitude to work with minimal supervision
Ability to manage multiple priorities
Strong judgment, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities
Strong MS Office, Outlook, PowerPoint and knowledge of HTML

Donnelley Financial Solutions (DFIN) is a leader in risk and compliance solutions, providing insightful technology, industry expertise and data insights to clients across the globe. We’re here to help you make smarter decisions with insightful technology, industry expertise and data insights at every stage of your business and investment lifecycles. As markets fluctuate, regulations evolve and technology advances, we’re there. And through it all, we deliver confidence with the right solutions in moments that matter.
DFIN ActiveDisclosure℠ is a financial reporting solution specifically designed for companies that rely on the Microsoft Office® productivity suite to draft, collaborate and finalize SEC disclosures. ActiveDisclosure helps streamline content creation, review and distribution improving efficiency, governance and the overall quality of all financial reports. The ActiveDisclosure Account Manager at RR Donnelley is a member of the sales delivery team for the ActiveDisclosure product line. Generally, this role is responsible for managing a pipeline of sales opportunities, supporting Regional Managing Directors, field Sales Executives and Deal Managers with prospect engagement, and utilizing teams to deliver client wins.
Responsibilities
• Build and maintain a strong understanding of the product and services associated with the ActiveDisclosure product line.
• Develop and maintain relationships with sales delivery team members including Regional Managing Directors, field Sales Executives, and Deal Managers within your territory
• Prospect and qualify sales leads, coordinating as required with the DFIN field sales team
• Manage and track sales opportunities and forecasts within Salesforce.com, providing reports to the Director of Sales as requested
• Manage a complex sales cycle, starting with the needs assessment process for each prospect, identifying pain points and determining the fit for our solutions
• Identify various buying roles within each prospect account and develop a suitable sales execution plan
• Educate prospects on the value of an ActiveDisclosure solution and how it addresses their needs
• Engage the Solutions Engineer at the appropriate stage of the sales cycle to tailor more detailed solutions presentations and/or software demonstrations
• As needed, engage the Implementation team at the appropriate stage of the sales cycle to assess technical needs and prepare an implementation plan
• Prepare and deliver sales quotes to the prospect
• Work with Sales Executives to successfully close opportunities
• Coordinate with the Post-Sale and Services team to hand off new clients
Qualifications
• Proven ability to sell enterprise software licensing and/or projects in the $50-500k range with yearly results of $2M or greater.
• Ability to prospect, develop and close software opportunities
• Thorough understanding of the enterprise software needs of finance and compliance teams
• General understanding of the financial and/or regulatory disclosure process
• Strong verbal and written communication skills with a focus on negotiation, needs analysis, positioning, business justification, and closing techniques
• Superior presentation skills
• A broad understanding of the financial close process and the SEC filing process
• An in-depth understanding of the technology used by public companies for external reporting
• 4 - 6 years of quota carrying, technology based sales experience
• Proven track record of B2B solution selling with demonstrated ability to sell to all levels of management up to, and including, the C-suite
• Experience in meeting and exceeding quotas or annual sales targets of at least $2M
• Experience tracking a sales pipeline using sales automation software (Salesforce.com preferred)
• CPA highly desired but not required

A Few Signs That The Job Isn't Right for You
Can’t someone else do that?”, “That’s not my responsibility”, and “Why does this depend on me?” are routine parts of your inner dialogue.
You’ve said, “The deadline is tomorrow, but it’s 6:00 PM so it’ll have to wait” and meant it.
You assess someone who lets a deadline slip because they’re working 70 hours per week serving clients as just “not having it all together.”
You often ask questions of others that can be answered with a brief Google search, phone call, or record check.
You believe file versioning and naming conventions are a stupid waste of time.
You think it’s unreasonable when stakeholders expect you to provide information that will give them assurance that tasks are being completed appropriately.
If you don’t know what to do next, you wait. And wait.
You’re more worried about what people think of you than the quality of the outcome you produce.
You resent ambiguous or unstructured situations and require perfect clarity at all times to be happy at work.
Changes to plan, multiple revisions, and new assignments that pop up unexpectedly are unacceptable to you.
You are comfortable letting team members down.

Job Description
The Lonely Entrepreneur (www.lonelyentrepreneur.com) (TLE) is looking to hire a highly qualified marketing coordinator to help with marketing efforts across our Company. From day one, this individual will contribute to existing marketing programs, while assisting with the development of new initiatives aligned with company and client goals. The ideal candidate will have prior experience with a wide range of marketing functions, including communications, advertising, branding, digital marketing, and social media.

The ideal candidate must be able to handle many diverse projects at once and meet tight deadlines data driven, results-oriented, and a self-starter who can hit the ground running and immediately contribute.

Please note: This position is remote. Travel is not required.

WHO WE ARE

Our brand represents a unique understanding of the entrepreneurial struggle and opportunity to help entrepreneurs throughout the world. TLE looks to leverage its brand to engage entrepreneurs and the organizations that serve them. To learn a little more about us, see our book, watch this video and visit our news page.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Assist in the development and implementation of the company’s brand strategy
Ensure all marketing efforts serve to achieve immediate and long-term business goals, identifying and executing improvements for processes, content, and lead generation
Support the marketing department's initiatives with the planning, executing, and tracking of marketing programs such as email, event, social media, or content marketing
Execute community engagement plan and process
Coordinate product, event, or content email marketing campaigns, including copy, scheduling, testing, and database management
Create, proofread, and edit copy for various marketing channels, ensuring consistent voice
Assist with developing and managing content and social media marketing programs, including blogs and public relations efforts
Prepare marketing activity reports and metrics for measuring program success
Provide market research, campaign results, and consumer trends
Support the maintenance and development of internal tools, including a credentials database, tracking capability, global contact directory, and intranet sites
Support the Marketing Director in evaluating and establishing the marketing plan and strategy by assembling and analyzing sales forecasts, setting objectives, planning and organizing promotional presentations, and updating calendars
Communicate campaign objectives, timelines, and deliverables to sales team, and provide instructions for use or promotion
Maintain a directory and inventory of sales support materials, ensuring all resources are current and accurate, and coordinate the creation of new materials as needed
Continually seek and research new sources of prospective customer data, and provide recommendations to sales and marketing leadership
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, advertising, or communications
3+ years of experience in a marketing coordinator or similar role
B2B experience preferred
Community engagement experience
Knowledge of traditional and digital marketing, content marketing, and social media marketing
Experience with research using data analytics software
Excellent writing, communication, and presentation skills
Proficiency in full Microsoft Office suite, especially with Excel and PowerPoint
Must have strong organizational and project management skills, as well as attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as outstanding copywriting and proofreading skills
Firm grasp on various marketing platforms, channels, and best practices, including social, digital, and email marketing
Must be a self-starter and able to independently move projects forward, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines

Company Description
The Lonely Entrepreneur Community is an a one stop shop for entrepreneurs to bring together the knowledge, skills and tools every entrepreneur needs including:

Learning: 300 learning modules organized into the 12 key areas of a business covering all the key skills and lessons entrepreneurs need to know
Community: an online community to share and learn with us and entrepreneurs
Coaching: live weekly video group coaching sessions
Tools and Templates: the tools and templates entrepreneurs needVendor Reviews: reviews of the top software and tools you need to run your business

For more information, visit https://lonelyentrepreneur.com/learning-community/

Our Mission
We’re here to create a safer, happier and more mindful future for all with the help of data science, engineering, design, and mobile technology. We're starting by reinventing insurance, by rethinking the technologies that enable it, but our true goal is to build a platform that rewards people for driving well — creating safer roads with fewer accidents in the process.

Backed by impressive funding, we're poised to re-engineer a trillion-dollar category, and that’s just the beginning. We’re using rich customer insights, advanced technology and data science to build our cloud-native InsurTech solution, and other things we haven’t even dreamt up yet. We're out to change behavior and promote mindful living at a societal level. But the key to us being successful in our mission isn’t just about nailing the technology—it’s about hiring the talented people who can help us make a quantifiable impact in the world. We’re growing our world-class team.
And that’s where you come in.

The Role
The Sr. Motion Designer/Video Editor is responsible for creating outstanding video, motion and animation content for the HiRoad brand across channels and media. Working within the integrated Growth team, you will craft beautiful and delightful videos and animations—be it customer stories, product videos, brand videos, social media, etc—for use in marketing and experiences across the customer lifecycle to formulate the visual representation of our brand, explain our products and services to engage multiple audiences.

About You
You’re an experienced and motivated talent that’s traveled many roads from startups to the agency world, and you have the hybrid skill sets to show for it: video editing, motion graphics and animation design. You have the technical acumen for capturing, editing, and producing video for internal and external initiatives that engage and explain. As such, you’re not only able to edit, do post-production and compress in different formats, but also leverage your amazing motion graphics and design skills to collaborate with our multi-talented brand and marketing creative team to produce social and paid media, ads and short form video stories that power growth, expand the brand, educate and communicate our mission.

Tasks of the Sr. Motion Designer/Video Editor involves concepting, storyboarding, designing, filming and editing video and animated assets while working side-by-side with Copywriters, Art Director and Designers, as well as Marketing and Product leadership. You'll also partner with content creation teams to develop our content marketing program and execute on initiatives that make short form video one of our most compelling storytelling methods to engage customers.

Key Qualities:

Your work speaks for itself. You've produced unique, artistic and award-winning video content. You are a master of the moving visual with an eye for detail and style. You can orchestrate emotionally engaging stories that capture a viewer's attention, as well as craft clear, simple video that demystifies the complex and technical with delight.
You're a team player. You’re a great listener, open to feedback and able to take the creative vision and bring it to life. You’re low ego and don’t fall in love with your own ideas, and instead have a strong desire to push them. You involve your team members throughout the process to assure your work stuns your audience and delivers results.
You design with energy and passion for your craft. Creativity, design, motion and video are your lifeblood and you inspire the creative team with your energy and ambition for this medium. And you want to work where you can help grow these capabilities within design culture.
You create strategically. You have the ability to see a vision through from sketch to viewer while meeting customer and business needs. Delivering amazing work that generates results and compels action is your target.
You are organized, methodical, and timely. You should be able to meet or exceed all creative expectations for deliverables, estimates for projects. You can work within deadlines, briefs, and creative direction, as well as outside vendors such as videographers, photographers and illustrators as needed.

Responsibilities:

Act as a champion for high-caliber video experiences for the HiRoad brand, owning the process from start to finish.
Help establish our video and photography program, technology/equipment inventory, lighting kits and set-ups, while coordinating and setting up video shoots, filming, and editing plans.

Rubicon is seeking a Senior Specialist, Integrated Marketing whowill help develop and deliver multi-platform marketing programs with the goal of driving both brand awareness and business growth for the company.

Reporting to the company’s Senior Director of Marketing, the Senior Specialist will ensure alignment with the organization’s overall vision, mission, and strategy and will provide leadership in maintaining the company’s internal and external marketing plans. Their knowledge and experience helps them conceptualize and develop messaging and creative direction, and deploy those in a coordinated fashion while preserving Rubicon’s brand standards across marketing channels.

About Rubicon Global

Rubicon is a technology company that powers a digital marketplace, provides a suite of SaaS products for waste, recycling, and smart city solutions, and collects and analyzes data for businesses and governments worldwide. Using technology to drive environmental innovation, the company helps turn businesses into more sustainable enterprises, and neighborhoods into greener and smarter places to live and work. Rubicon’s mission is to end waste, in all of its forms, by helping its partners find economic value in their waste streams and confidently execute on their sustainability goals. The company is a Certified B Corporation, affirming that Rubicon meets the highest standards of verified social and environmental performance. Through its technology, Rubicon is transforming the entire category of waste and recycling. With more than 2.6 million service locations worldwide, Rubicon is headquartered in Atlanta, GA, and has core teams in New York, NY; San Francisco, CA; St. Louis, MO; and Tinton Falls, NJ. Rubicon was named a Great Place to Work® in 2018 and 2019, and was recognized as one of Glassdoor’s“Top Ten Companies with Seriously Impressive Benefits” in 2018.

Ekata provides global identity verification via enterprise-grade APIs and a SaaS solution. Our product suite is powered by Ekata Identity Engine, the first and only cross-border identity engine of its kind. It uses complex machine learning algorithms across the five consumer attributes of email, phone, name, physical address, and IP to derive unique data links and features from billions of real-time transactions within our customer network and the globally sourced data of our graph. Businesses around the world including Alipay, Stripe, Airbnb, and Microsoft leverage our solutions to approve more good transactions, reduce friction, and find fraud.

Ekata is looking for a Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager to own our global content strategy, the awareness and interest portions of our marketing funnel, as well as all demand and lead generation efforts for our enterprise sales teams. This role will work closely with the rest of the marketing team, sales teams, revenue operations team, product marketing as well as our outside resources and agencies. A successful candidate will have experience researching industry trends across the globe, developing full-funnel campaigns for enterprise teams, and 7+ years experience marketing a B2B SaaS or data product globally.

Our Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager will be focused in three main areas:
Managing all content marketing, from global brand awareness and thought leadership campaigns to social media management, blog sharing, and more.
Creating interest campaigns (email nurtures, etc.) to funnel our audience from brand awareness to product consideration.
Creating targeted campaigns that feed our Enterprise teams qualified new business and current customer expansion leads.

Expert in content strategy, including global regional efforts. Must be an excellent writer: engaging, personable, intelligent, and grammatically perfect. Writing samples are required.

Growth marketing mindset: Focused on lifetime value, building trust through the marketing funnel and beyond, from customer loyalty to brand advocacy.
This role will work closely with the rest of the marketing team, sales teams, revenue operations team, product marketing as well as our outside resources and agencies. Were looking for someone to join our team who is an engaging B2B writer, metrics driven, smart, adaptable, and motivated by demand generation for a growth company.

In the Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager role, you will:
Be our primary engagement strategist: You will research, document, and train our team and company on how to engage and build trust with our target personas within each industry we target globally. This will include writing content, emails, managing social channels, and assisting sales with outreach
Create campaigns and content that are relevant to our target audience and effectively funnel leads from brand awareness to product interest, helping us fulfill our growth lead quota month over month
Partner with sales teams to create email sequences to increase MQL (lead) to SQL (opportunity) conversion rates
Make data-driven decisions: Manage and report on your marketing campaigns digital performance metrics and analytics
Collaborate with other marketing managers on processes and procedures that need to be optimized (and how to optimize them), and how to elevate our strategies and campaigns for optimal ROI and growth
The right person for this role will grow into managing lead generation campaign strategy across Mid-Market, EMEA, and APAC channels as well as Enterprise within the first 6 months
Our ideal Senior Demand Generation Marketing Manager will have:
7+ years experience in B2B marketing with a portfolio of successful content creation, international lead generation programs and growth marketing
Experience researching industry trends as a basis for new campaigns, search terms, and content
Talent for creating engaging content about complex business problems and solutions.
Experience creating personalized digital experiences/campaigns to attract enterprise-level leads and expansions
Demonstrated time and project management abilities, especially an ability to manage complex projects with a lot of moving parts, balancing competing priorities in a fast-paced environment
A natural problem solver: creating order out of chaos, strategy out of ambiguity, and evoking trust
Self-directed and creative thinker; ready to proactively bring new ideas to the table, solve problems and take risks, to find new and innovative ways to improve results
A disdain for complacency; able to think and act outside the confines of the job description, desire to contribute value in other areas as part of a small team, and drive to always be evaluating new ideas and approaches for improving results
We help cross-border digital commerce companies grow their revenue by maximizing predictability of good transactions. From our Transaction Risk API delivered in under 100ms for pre-authorization models through to our robust manual review tool, Pro Insight, our identity verification product suite verifies over 1.8B requests per year in 238 countries for 1700+ companies, including:
Seven of the ten largest US retailers
Six of the ten top global marketplace companies
Five of the top ten global retailers
Two major card brands
Top 3 global online travel and hospitality sites
Integrated with the top 5 global fraud platforms
We have strong company values and culture and would love to share why ours is an opportunity worth considering. We appreciate and actively seek diversity and are an equal opportunity employer.

Description
POSITION SUMMARY The Horizon Scanning Analyst I reviews information on novel healthcare innovations (e.g., treatments, vaccines and prophylaxis, prognostic indicators, systems and management innovations, devices, screening and diagnostics) to identify innovations that could have a high impact on important patient outcomes, public health, and the healthcare system, particularly in regard to infectious disease outbreak response and recovery, in the United States. The Analyst I writes short profiles summarizing each innovation and its potentials impacts and analyzes and synthesizes reviewer ratings and comments to prepare reports on topics with high impact potential. The Analyst I is expected to maintain knowledge of new developments and important new scientific discoveries in assigned content areas. The Analyst I participates in leads review, topic identification and nomination, database content creation, topic profile development, reviewer rating and comment analysis and synthesis, and report writing.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
Reasonable Accommodations Statement
To accomplish this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform, with or without reasonable accommodation, each essential function satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to help enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Essential Functions Statements(s)
Review information leads in assigned content areas to identify topics (e.g., treatments, vaccines and prophylaxis, prognostic indicators, systems and management innovations, devices, screening and diagnostics) with high impact potential on individual patient outcomes, public health, and/or the healthcare system in the United States
Verbally present identified interventions and trends at nomination meetings
Write profiles summarizing key information for each topic selected during the nomination process in assigned clinical areas
Analyze and synthesize reviewer ratings and comments from physicians, nurses, allied health professionals, health systems professionals, researchers, patients, caregivers, and other to assess topic’s potential for impact on patient outcomes and the healthcare system in the United States
Expand written profiles to include analysis of reviewer ratings and comments
Maintain thorough understanding of the key clinical research developments and major scientific trends in the assigned clinical areas
Apply understanding about U.S. regulatory processes, coverage, coding, payment, etc.
Attend and contribute to team meetings
Meet assigned deadlines
Other duties as assigned
Accountability Metrics:
Meet deadlines as assigned
Maintain high quality standards
Qualifications
Experience:
1 or more years’ experience in a clinical or research healthcare environment
Broad knowledge of disease etiologies, processes, and treatments
Understanding of pharmacology and other treatment modalities (e.g., biologics, cell and gene therapies, devices, surgical procedures)
Basic knowledge of U.S. healthcare system, public and population health, evidence-based medicine, and healthcare horizon scanning
Knowledge (preferred) in one or more of the following areas related to infectious disease outbreak responses and recovery efforts: treatments, vaccines and prophylaxis, identifiable risk factors or prognostic indicators, systems and management, devices, screening and diagnostics.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to distill highly technical information into content accessible to wide audience
Demonstrated ability to meet aggressive deadlines
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, healthcare information production-oriented environment
Must be a well-organized self-starter and proficient multi-tasker
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word and Excel) essential
Experience with Microsoft SharePoint helpful
Education: Master’s degree in a scientific or medical discipline, such as microbiology, immunology, pharmacology, molecular genetics, physiology, biochemistry; or master’s degree in public health, population health, or epidemiology; or clinical healthcare professional with advanced degree.

Computer Skills: Proficient with Microsoft Office 2007+

Certifications & Licenses: None required

Job Title: Manager - North American Student Competition Team
Job Description:
If you have experience with MATLAB and Simulink and are passionate about building and leading a team that will drive adoption of MATLAB and Simulink among students this role is for you. MathWorks has established a technical team dedicated to developing the technical strategy and driving the execution to increase usage of MATLAB and Simulink in Student Competitions around the world.

As the manager of the North American Student Competition team you will build and lead the MathWorks technical team dedicated to increasing adoption in Student Competitions. You will provide strong leadership, coaching, guidance to your team members and empower them to work to achieve their technical goals. You will put your passion for MATLAB and Simulink into action by working directly with students, researchers, competition organizers and faculty and grow the usage and understanding of our products within Student Competitions and education. Through these efforts you and your team will prepare and support the next generation of scientists and engineers with software, training, and mentoring to tackle the same technical issues as professional engineers.
Build and lead a technical team in North America focused on supporting future engineers and students to adopt MATLAB and Simulink
Recruit individuals with student competition experience and a true passion for MATLAB and Simulink.
Visit strategic customers at events and universities with your team members to understand the use of MATLAB and Simulink.
Model the way for your team members by creating and executing technical strategies for your own areas of expertise.
Build and nurture relationships with key decision makers in the Student Competition Community; enlist them as advocates for the use of MATLAB and Simulink among students.
Manage the internal technical content creation plan for videos, file exchange, and blogs.
Collaborate with Education Business managers and stakeholder in executing the business strategy for growing usage in the student market.
Work with the Worldwide Education Programs Manager and internal Education stakeholders to drive alignment between their business plans for student usage and growth.
Collaborate with the Edu Marketing Management team to build new programs and technical content for students worldwide.
Deliver papers and presentations at appropriate Student Competitions and Educational events.
Synthesize your teams customer facing experiences into student trends academia and advocate for the impact of those on MathWorks product plans and internal development strategies.
Develop content and lead your team to develop scalable content to help teams be successful using MATLAB and Simulink.
Effective leadership and coaching skills; ability to hire, guide, motivate, and inspire others
Experience leading or participating in a Student Competition as either a teacher or a student.
Ability to lead both technical and non-technical projects.
Experience as a professor or postdoc developing proposals for student funding/projects preferred.
Marketing experience with global technology company preferred.
Prior employment with a global software company involved in scientific computing, data analysis and/or modeling and simulation tools.
Technical experience in either Robotics or Autonomous Driving preferred.
Experience with Simulink
Experience with MATLAB
Candidates must be willing to travel up to 25% of the time
A bachelor's degree and 7 years of professional work experience (or a master's degree and 5 years of professional work experience, or a PhD degree, or equivalent experience) is required.

Metro Inclusive Health is seeking a full-time Social Content Strategist to join our fast-growing team. This role is an integral part of METROs growth strategy and will be responsible for curating a highly active daily social media presence in addition to developing and maintaining accurate representations of the organization on MetroTampaBay.org and third-party sources such as Google My Business, Yelp, and TripAdvisor.

This position will actively contribute to overall marketing strategies by creating top-notch daily content while tracking metrics to report and continually optimize results in real-time. The ideal candidate is highly active on multiple social platforms on a daily basis and likes to keep his or her finger on the pulse of best practices, features, tools and algorithm changes, while also dabbling in emerging platforms.

Job Responsibilities:
Work with Chief Marketing and Experience Officer to implement a social media protocol that fits the organizations needs: Assisting multiple departments with ongoing communications while putting the value of METRO social and digital guests, first.
Assist in building and executing social media strategy through competitive research, platform optimization and messaging.
Actively curate and post engaging daily social media concepts across all METRO platforms that are vetted by Chief Marketing and Experience Officer unless otherwise indicated.
Visit METRO locations and attend METRO events across Tampa Bay to curate content, including live feeds, real-time posts and post-event coverage across multiple platforms.
Work closely with in-house graphic designer to develop appropriate visual and timely content for social, events, digital and website use that in-line with METROs brand standards.
Be on top of news cycles, holidays and LGBTQ+ community milestones to create social and digital content opportunities for METRO.
Assist in the development of written content for digital event listings to maintain a consistent and unified METRO voice, organization-wide.
Actively build social interactions and followings through daily digital community engagement, conversations, comments, likes, shares, etc.
Monitor social media inboxes and comments answering factual inquiries in a timely manner. When necessary, seek accurate and appropriate responses or the assistance of senior management.
Be willing to assist other members of the METRO team in learning how to use social media to their benefit.
Be able to provide detailed bi-monthly reports on social media usage for the Chief Marketing and Experience Officer, CEO, COO, and Board members.
Liaise with the in-house marketing team and third-party vendors to develop and report on high-end, paid digital and traditional media campaigns for specific services and products provided by METRO
Job Requirements:
College Degree in Communications, Public Relations or Advertising Preferred.
2+ years of social media content development and management experience.
Fluent in the use and maximization of all major social media platforms including, but not limited to, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and YouTube.
Strong content creation skills including copywriting, spelling, grammar and punctuation; taking photos, live and recorded video, and use of hashtags, gifs, locations, emojis, face filters; etc.
Ability to read and translate social and digital media metric tools including Facebook and Instagram Insights, Google Analytics for Web, YouTube, Email and Social Integration; Google My Business Metrics, Twitter Analytics, Pinterest Analytics, etc.
Familiarity with up-and-coming social media platforms including, but not limited to, Nextdoor and WhatsApp
Must possess and maintain valid Florida drivers license and proof of insurance
Must have a reliable and accessible auto vehicle.

The Content Editor is a dynamic and vibrant professional, passionate about modern pop-culture, including Music, Videos, Apps, Books and Podcasts. The Content Editor is eager to learn new skills.

• The support and collaboration of a wonderful linguistic team

About Us

KiwiCo is an innovative eCommerce company that sparks kids' creativity and curiosity through offline and online materials and inspiration. We offer kids a delightful, engaging way to explore, create, and learn. Our core offering is a subscription service that delivers curated hands-on projects to kids. We take great pride and ownership in the products we build and in the community of parents and kids we serve. We're backed by leading investors and were named one of the "20 Startups to Watch" by Business Insider. Our office is located in Mountain View, CA.

Role and Responsibilities

We are looking for a Video Editor who can quickly grok our brand identity, who is highly collaborative as well as efficient, and who can help bring our brand to life through creative and thoughtful editing of a wide range of assets.

In this role, you will:
Design and build essential graphics toolkits for KiwiCo marketing assets, videos and original series
Establish brand identity and consistency through video and graphic styling
Edit marketing, social media and editorial assets and videos
Animate KiwiCo illustrations to use across our social channels
Edit short and long form how-to tutorials for our crate lines
Help establish a language for graphic design and video assets
Assist in file organization and sharing across teams and stakeholders
Shoot in-office video footage, as needed
Required Qualifications

As a start-up celebrating creativity and development, we believe and encourage the same in our team. We seek team players with an infectious positive energy, great initiative, and a get-it-done attitude. Candidates must thrive in ambiguity and love a rapid pace. You must have a strong desire to learn and improve.

The ideal candidate has great initiative and operating range. Required skills and responsibilities:
Experience. Bachelor's degree with 4+ years of graphic design for video and editing experience. You have excellent storytelling and editing skills, with the experience and skills required to work in a fast-paced video production environment.
Passionate about kids and education. You love our young customers and understand how to communicate enriching educational concepts in a fun and relatable way.
Detail-oriented. Exceptional attention to detail, grammar, and logical story construction, with an eye for visual communication.
Communication. Excellent written and visual communication skills and the ability to collaborate across various departments.
Organization. This is a fast-paced, deadline-driven role, which requires collaborating with the entire product design team, so great organizational skills are a must.
Hands-on, get things done mentality. Self-starter with the ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment and meet changing deadlines and priorities on multiple simultaneous projects. Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines while still paying attention to details and executing flawlessly. Strong project management skills.
Resourceful and flexible. You see a project from idea stage through successful completion and do whatever it takes to make it a success. You are comfortable with the rapid pace of change in a small, nimble team. You are an innovative thinker and can solve problems creatively.
Collaborative. Ability to lead and influence cross-functional teams in a matrixed organization, as well as confidently make presentations to senior management. Able to give and receive feedback well.
Broad operating range. Have the ability to think strategically and create processes and organizational efficiencies, while also having a love of detail and editorial finesse. Thrives in a fast-paced, small company environment.
Desired Qualifications/Experience
Proficiency in the Adobe Creative Suite, with special emphasis in Premiere and After Effects
Experience editing short and long form DIY, tutorial and STEAM videos, specifically relating to kids content
Experience creating graphics and videos for YouTube, Facebook, Instagram and other social media platforms
Experience designing and building essential graphics toolkits for a variety of content types
Experience working collaboratively with video editors, photographers, and producers in a start-up environment
High attention to detail and creative confidence
Passion for teaching and learning
