About Global Citizen:

Global Citizen is a movement of engaged citizens who are using their collective voice to end extreme poverty by 2030. On our platform, Global Citizens learn about the systemic causes of extreme poverty, take action on those issues, and earn rewards for their actions as part of a global community committed to lasting change.

One of the key ways we can grow that movement is through the editorial content on GlobalCitizen.org and its accompanying channels: stories, videos, and social media that bring the important human rights issues of the world to readers where they are. This is journalism with a purpose — content creation to help make the world a better place for all.

So far, 24.8 million actions have been taken by Global Citizens, leading to $48.4 billion commitments being made by world leaders, which has affected 880 million lives to date.

Responsibilities

· Prepare monthly reporting and analysis of financial performance. Lead monthly budget review meetings with each department, which involves preparing a summary of financial performance and conducting variance analysis. Partner with senior leadership to provide financial and budgetary support, guidance and recommendations regarding the use of budgets.

· Drive the scoping, project management, creation and execution of our annual and project budgets.

· Build/maintain financial models and forecasting tools that allow for long-term scenario planning in support of the strategic planning process.

· Build/maintain fundraising/revenue models for development teams using Salesforce.

· Responsible for the management and maintenance of our budgeting and reporting tool, Adaptive Insights.

· Support operational excellence across GC by contributing to finance team efficiency, e.g. through supporting the monthly close process and other ad hoc support.

· Support GC’s organization-wide initiatives, requiring occasional evening and/or weekend work.

Requirements

· At least 3 years of relevant experience in roles with increasing responsibility; preferably in budget management and/or financial accounting and reporting, non-profit experience a plus

· Skilled at using and creating financial models to develop unexpected insights

· Demonstrate experience and active willingness to adapt to changing organizational needs and priorities

· Excellent at financial data visualization for internal and external stakeholders

· Able to manage multiple complex projects at once while meeting mission critical deadlines

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills; a good listener who can motivate others through influence, manage expectations, be willing to engage in difficult conversations in order to advance the work

· Patient and able to successfully convey financial concepts to stakeholders across lines of difference including varying levels of expertise and familiarity with finance and budgeting

· Superior professional judgement and ability to handle confidential information appropriately

· Experience working with automated financial software systems, cloud-based technology and office software. Knowledge of SalesForce, and Intacct strongly preferred

· Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance required

· Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail

· Expert-level knowledge of Microsoft Excel; experience with pivot tables, v-lookup equations, and large data sets highly desirable

· Demonstrated alignment with GC's mission, values, and commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion.

Equal Employment Opportunity:

Global Citizen does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

The Marketing Coordinator develops and executes comprehensive marketing campaigns that build and sustain strong sales revenue. He or she promotes growth in product sales, services, and referrals through creative and highly effective marketing campaigns, including print and email newsletters, direct mail, and sample offers, attending networking events, participating in the local community events and local outreach. In addition, the Marketing Coordinator actively manages the marketing budget and helps with audits and reporting.

The ideal candidate has a Bachelor's degree in Marketing or a related field and two to four years of experience in a marketing position with supervisory/management responsibilities and demonstrated and verifiable success in planning, implementing, and evaluating successful marketing campaigns. He or she must have strong computer and internet skills, good public speaking and presentation skills, strong organizational and time management skills, and excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills. Experience with online marketing campaigns, social media platforms, website design, and with graphic design/photo editing software packages a plus.

Job Description
Grace Management Group is based in Spartanburg, South Carolina. Founded in 1975, we have been leaders in the fragrance and gift industry for over 40 years. Our brands include Votivo, Greenleaf, Bridgewater Candle Company and The WillowBrook Company. Still family-owned and operated, we sell into multiple distribution channels in the US, and in over 90 countries internationally.

We hire talented, motivated, fun and friendly people, and are currently looking to fill the position of Digital Marketing Coordinator!

As the Digital Marketing Coordinator you will report directly to the Marketing Manager and be responsible for representing the Grace Management Group family of brands through timely execution of digital marketing campaigns.

This role requires a task-oriented individual who has the ability to multi-task, meet deadlines, and execute a variety of digital needs using numerous platforms and tools in a fast-paced environment.

Your day to day responsibilities will include:

· Execute digital tasks to drive digital sales growth

· Update B2C & B2B websites, including homepage banners, promotions, and product launches

· Execute B2C & B2B Email Campaigns using Klaviyo & Mailchimp

· Identify opportunities & execute creation of B2C Email Flows

· Collaborate with Marketing Team & Brand Creative to implement strategies aligned with brand & company goals

· Understand holistic view of the brand to maintain brand consistency across all channels

· Monitor Yotpo & tag new UGC and review submitted photos for PDPs & other galleries

· Create & Update custom landing pages using Shogun and Zipify as needed

· Create Amazon Listings as needed

· Submit Amazon Case Log Tickets for team as needed

· Provide insights & implementation of website optimizations

· Additional tasks as assigned

Requirements:

· A motivated self-starter that can take the initiative and maintain accountability in a fast-paced environment

· Experience with Shopify, Amazon, and Email Marketing Platforms

· Demonstrated understanding of e-commerce and email marketing best practices

· Effective communication of brand through various web platforms

· Excellent attention to detail

· Resourceful, ability to troubleshoot and work through roadblocks

Check out www.gracemg.com for more information on our brands!

This is a tremendous opportunity for the right individual. SEND YOUR RESUME TODAY!
Company Description
Grace Management Group is a group of privately-held gift and fragrance companies based in Spartanburg, South Carolina who have been leaders in the fragrance industry for over 40 years! Our brands include Votivo, Greenleaf, Bridgewater Candle Company and The WillowBrook Company.

Since 1975, we have refined our expertise in fragrance, color, product formulation, packaging trends to transform into one of the largest home fragrance manufacturers in the United States. Still family-owned and operated, the Grace Management brands have blossomed into international players, with our products currently being sold in over 90 countries.

Here in the U.S., we partner with the OneCoast sales force to sell our brands into the independent retail marketplace. You will find our products in all types of retailers, from pharmacies, college bookstores and hospital gift shops to high end boutiques, spas and hotels.

As the leader in Lead-to-Account Matching, Routing and Marketing Attribution solutions, LeanData drives growth for business. We help many of the world’s fastest-growing enterprises automate, simplify and accelerate revenue.

The Head of FP&A will provide financial leadership and business partnership reporting to the CFO. The role manages all short-and long term financial planning while providing senior management and institutional shareholders with analysis & management reporting of various businesses and opportunities as identified and or requested.

What you will do:
Provide leadership and oversight of LegalZoom’s financial annual operating plan, forecasting and long term strategic planning.
Lead the budgeting & forecast process for all groups. This includes the business model, its drivers, P&L, Balance sheet, Cash flow & CAPEX.
Partner with Executive team and Department VPs in reviewing and delivering monthly financial results and KPIs, identifying areas needing action and providing recommendations for organic growth, margin improvement and cost savings initiatives.
Provide support and leadership to the global headcount planning process.
Oversee the financial systems as it relates to forecasting/budgeting, analysis, and management reporting.
Drive improvements to company global FP&A practices: deeper P&L analysis, multi-year forecasting, etc.
Establish and develops disciplines for quarterly guidance to Wall Street and collaborate with investor relations.
Manages preparation of presentations to Executive Management, Board, and Investors including content creation, clear and concise presentation, timely delivery and accuracy of all management reports.
Partnership with accounting to sync accounting with forecasting & reporting, and works with Data Services and business units to streamline and automate reporting.
Provide leadership and oversight to the US Core business including its web and mobile funnel and its KPIs, gross margin improvements, CAC, LTV and Opex efficiencies.
Drive strategic profitability and organic growth & margin expansion to the overall US Core business.
Identify areas of opportunity for revenue generation or cost savings; develop business cases for company initiatives.
Develop additional KPI’s to measure effectiveness and efficiency of department cost.
Qualifications:
10+ years in a related position
Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance
MBA preferred
Private Equity/Hedge fund experience preferred
Extremely well developed analytical skills
Extensive financial modeling experience (10+ years)
Strong leadership and people management skills with a bias towards collaboration
Ability to lead and drive change in a global organization
Must be detail oriented
Solid organization skills; ability to manage time effectively
Strong communication and relationship building skills
Able to effectively manage projects; results oriented and able to roll-up the sleeves in order to accomplish necessary tasks
Self-starter with proven ability to work well across an organization and as a part of a team
Proven ability to work effectively in fast paced, deadline oriented environment
Strong Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills are necessary.

And we love what we do! Were rated highly on Glassdoor and ranked #3 Best Workplace in America by Inc. Magazine. The Job in a Nutshell:

We are looking for individuals with polished writing skills who are passionate about content writing and interested in the digital marketing. The SEO Content Writer will work directly with the SEO team to write compelling copy and high-quality website content in line with current best practices. This entry-level writing position is a fantastic way to transfer your writing skills to the internet marketing industry. While previous SEO experience is not required, an ability to work independently and pick up new skills quickly are a must. We require submissions of relevant writing samples and examples of unique content creation (blog posts or college writing samples are acceptable).

What You Will Love Doing:
Writing unique and high-quality content for placement on client and 3rd party websites
Researching client industries, influencers, and partners to assist in creating content that incorporates SEO strategies
Staying current with SEO industry trends and algorithm development

Overview


The Morning Call, in Allentown, Pa., is looking for a digitally focused leader for our sports department, engaging our readers with interesting, diverse and relevant content on a daily basis. The Senior Content Editor Sports drives our local/high school sports coverage for a digital audience, with a focus on adding subscribers and increasing engagement to retain them. This person leads a team of journalists to plan and produce impactful sports features and enterprise stories, as well as coverage of breaking news.

Responsibilities


The successful candidate will develop digital plans for the sports site/section both daily and long-term, and for other special events that are audience drivers. Job Description:
In-House Marketing Coordinator
Large Plastic Surgery Practice
2 Locations: Chevy Chase, MD & Annandale, VA

Job Description:
Are you creative, tech-savvy and good with words?
Do you know how to build a brand online using todays digital tools?
If so, keep reading

We're looking for an amazing team player to manage our social media presence online, as well as our database and in-house marketing including flyers and email.

We are a large 4-surgeon practice with lots of moving parts, so you need initiative and strong conviction to see projects through to execution and meet tight content deadlines.
You should have a command of best practices and trends in social media marketing and understand how to build brand to build a digital audience of prospective plastic surgery patients.

Responsibilities:
Build our practice brand, awareness, and personality with the objective to attract new prospective plastic surgery patients.
Social Media
Build and creatively manage the practices social media profiles and presence, including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn, YouTube, Blog, Web Content, and additional channels that are deemed relevant.
Create shareable content using a content calendar with deadline dates.
Work with other staff members and the surgeons to help create content that educates and entertains our audience and supports marketing goals.
Monitor and engage in relevant social discussions about our practice, our surgeons, procedures, and our industry.
Drive consistent, relevant traffic and leads from our social network presence.
Explore new ways to engage and identify new social networks to reach our preferred cosmetic patients through relevant directories and FB groups.
Video & Photos
You must be comfortable shooting, editing, and posting videos and photos to show our surgeons and practice in the best light.
Email
You will use an email platform to send out e-blasts to our current patient list (training provided).
Tracking
Track, measure, and report on efforts and ROI regularly.

Note:
Additional Training will be provided including database marketing via email, social posting and content machine to keep a steady flow of content circulating.

Requirements:
BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience with at least 1-year marketing a business using social, email and video.
Experience in the plastic surgery industry is a plus.
Excellent communicator and creative thinker.
Bonus skills: Hootsuite, Hubspot, PhotoShop, video editing, and social post-editing.
This is a full-time position. Hours are Monday-Friday 9-5pm.

References required.
Compensation:
$25/ hour + Health/Dental Insurance + Holidays + PTO + Vacation + 401K + complimentary cosmetic non-surgical treatments.

About Center for Plastic Surgery:

The Center for Plastic Surgery, CPS, was established in 1986. It combines the reconstructive and cosmetic surgery practices of Dr. James French, Dr. Wesley Price, Dr. Samir S. Rao and Dr. Frank P. Albino. With a reputation for aesthetic judgment, surgical skill and artistry, our surgeons work together to offer patients a comprehensive range of options for specialized aesthetic and reconstructive surgery. The Center for Plastic Surgery has two offices in the Washington DC area, minutes from the Washington Beltway in Chevy Chase, Maryland and Northern Virginia. We see patients for surgical and skin health care consultations, BOTOX® Cosmetic treatment, filler injections and other services in both offices. Please visit our website to learn more about our practice - www.cpsdcocs.com

The Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia is one of the 12 regional Reserve Banks that, together with the Board of Governors in Washington, D.C., make up the Federal Reserve System. Job Summary:

The Social Media and Digital Engagement Associate is a knowledgeable and energetic internal advocate for social engagement, with the ability to create clear and compelling digital (social, email, etc.) content, working as part of the Digital Strategy Group within Corporate Affairs. The position works closely with management to execute the social media strategy for the Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia. This includes managing the day-to-day operation of the Bank's social media outlets and ensuring alignment with overall digital strategy of the organization. The analyst conceives, researches, creates, posts, and promotes compelling content on the Bank's various social channels in collaboration with internal content creators and subject matter experts. The position serves as a front-line thought leader and internal resource for the implementation of social tactics to promote the Bank’s work and enhance the reputation of the organization and its experts.

All applicants must submit a list of social media accounts managed, detailing the account names, dates that the accounts were managed, and the applicant's role in maintaining those accounts.

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:

Contributes to the ongoing development of the social media strategy, working to ensure that the Bank's social media efforts are in alignment with the organization's overall digital communications efforts.

Works both independently and collaboratively with internal staff to conceive, compose, and post social media content that supports the organization's communications and digital strategy efforts.

Maintains, manages, and executes a calendar of social media communication content. These messages will include planned releases, breaking news, and general content highlighting the Bank's work.

Engages with external stakeholders including partner organizations and audience members through appropriate interactions.

Partners with the Digital Solutions and Creative Services teams to identify and produce technological and creative assets for use on social channels.

Provides quality assurance for social media content, including proofreading and link accuracy.

Conceives, plans, administers, and reports out on measurement tools examining the impact of the Bank's social media efforts for our relevant audiences.

Maintains digital accounts according to best practices. This includes creating or updating account profile information and artwork, creating or consolidating accounts, managing follower lists, etc.

Keeps abreast of the latest trends in social and digital communications and helps develop new social media strategies and tactics for the Bank.

Conducts continual monitoring of the Bank's reputation and matters of concern to the Bank on social media, reports findings, and escalates potential issues or opportunities for enhancement.

Performs additional digital content tasks as required.

Bachelor's degree in communications, marketing, journalism, English, or related field.

Minimum of 3 years of progressive, hands-on social media experience, including content creation and channel management required, and 3 to 5 years of editorial experience in a digital communications, advertising or marketing related environment is preferred.

Demonstrated tactical expertise in the use of social media to support an organization's strategic digital communication efforts.

Track record of managing the creation and distribution of impactful content across various platforms for a number of clients with unique business needs and for a variety of diverse audiences.

Strong ability to identify, conceive, or adapt engaging content on a variety of topics.

Extensive experience with industry-standard social media management tools.

Ability to drive engagement through message content, distribution strategies, and audience interaction.

Expertise in integrating social content plan into organization's overall digital and public communication approach, including strategic alignment, tactical consistency, and calendar coordination.

Ability to plan and execute social media efforts in support of events and campaigns.

Skill with image editing tools and knowledge of basic design concepts preferred.

Familiarity with website content management systems (CMS) for content updates and optimization of social sharing features preferred.

Experience managing the creation, writing, and distribution of e-mail newsletters, alerts, and other messaging channels as part of a customer relationship management (CRM) system a plus.

Track record of serving as a champion for social and digital communication within an organization.

Entrepreneurial, results-oriented, and possessing a flair for creative problem solving.

Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.

Impeccable attention to detail.

Other:

Background investigations including drug testing are required for all new hires as a condition of employment, after the job offer is made. Employment may not begin until the Bank accepts the results of the background investigation.

Certain eligibility rules apply.

Our benefit plans are designed to be the best fit for you at every stage of your career!

Excellent health, prescription, dental and vision coverage

Savings Thrift Plan (401K) with a 100& match up to 6& and a pension plan

Paid vacation / sick time / paid holidays and a flexible work environment

Numerous Employee Resource Groups to help you thrive and grow at the Fed in a diverse and inclusive environment

Healthy lifestyle assistance through an on-site fitness center, subsidized cafeteria with healthy food options, and health and wellness programs

Monthly public transportation allowance

Numerous internal development programs plus annual tuition reimbursement programs

Free credit protection, financial planning, and flexible spending accounts or health savings accounts .. and much more!

Summary

As a product manager, you will be responsible for generating informative content for the leading online retailer of trailer, towing, and RV accessories in the US. At etrailer.com it's our mission to create high-quality original content and to ensure accurate product data to help our customers find the products they need to solve their problems. Through hands-on research and collaboration with external vendor contacts and internal teams, you'll create accurate, customer-focused content, including written product descriptions. This role requires strong writing, interpersonal, project management, and critical thinking skills. This is a permanent, full-time position at our offices in Wentzville, Missouri.

Job responsibilities
Grow and maintain a deep understanding of and familiarity with our products and our customers through research and hands-on training
Write accurate, customer-focused copy for website product descriptions, working with category manager to refine written content
Collaborate with other teams (photo, video, and marketing) to create content that aligns with our mission of treating our customers like neighbors
Manage product lines, ensuring that all product data is accurate and maintaining relationships with external vendor contacts
Ensure that existing product lines are up to date and content is accurate
Experience and Skills
Self-starter and quick learner who enjoys studying new topics and applying critical thinking skills
Strong project management and organizational skills - able to manage several complex projects simultaneously
Ability to efficiently manage workload and reprioritize as needed
Strong interpersonal and communication skills - able to communicate effectively through written and spoken word
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to interact professionally with vendor contacts and other team members
Ability to work well independently and within a team
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook) - moderate level of skill in Excel preferred
Bachelor's degree in journalism, marketing, communications, or related field required
Professional writing experience and/or writing for the web a plus
Industry knowledge not required but a plus
About you

You're a curious person who's passionate about research and learning new things every day. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where you complete projects quickly and efficiently and find creative solutions to problems. Your work is meticulous, and you have a strong grasp of the English language, both in writing (email communication, content creation) and in person or over the phone. You welcome critical feedback and input from a variety of perspectives on your work.

Why etrailer.com?

etrailer.com is the leading online retailer of trailer, towing, and RV accessories in the US. We’re not an ordinary e-commerce retailer. We’re more than a few developers and marketers sitting in a small office just trying to convince you to buy at the cheapest price. At etrailer.com you’ll find an entire company dedicated to helping customers find the best possible solutions for their needs. Our team of 300+ people creatively works together to ensure that each person who visits our website has the most personalized shopping experience on the web.

The Schools student recruitment and retention efforts, alumni and donor engagement, and fundraising, while highlighting the accomplishments of faculty and staff to increase visibility of Benerd as part of Pacifics outstanding academic offerings.

In this role, you will report to the CEO, while working collaboratively across all other agency departments to produce deliverables that help our clients build stronger relationships with their audiences. Opportunities for growth are potentially limitless, and yours to create.

WHAT YOUD DO
Responsible for executing our digital deliverables, including websites, landing pages, CMS, marketing automation, mobile apps, email, and display ads

Deliver successful digital solutions clients big and small across a range of clients (from tech and healthcare to CPG and media)
Solve all sorts of problems for all sorts of businesses and teams

Finn Partners is a global communications agency, made up of nine practice areas with 800+ people in 19 locations worldwide. The firm offers a full-service approach including integrated public relations, content creation, social, digital marketing and research services. Founded in New York in 2011 by Peter Finn with an innovative new model in which entrepreneurial spirit, innovation and partnership drive client success and sustainable agency growth, the firm delivers world class client service, coupled with best-in-class employment practices, to produce award-winning work and a rewarding culture.

FINN Partners fosters an enriching work environment that facilitates creativity and professional growth. Compensation includes competitive salary, excellent medical benefits, 401k, generous vacation package and more. Visit us at www.finnpartners.com.

WHO WE'RE LOOKING FOR

Job Description:
Job Description
DHC Austin - Brush Country Nursing & Rehabilitation a division of Dynasty Healthcare Group, LLC (An Anniversary Holding Company) is looking for a Marketing Director to work closely with our executive staff to screen prospective residents to determine appropriateness of admission. The Marketing Coordinator works with residents/families on the front end of the admission process to ensure an efficient admission process. This position will drive occupancy through the implementation of internal and external marketing while acting as the representative and face of the community in the marketplace.

Essential Job Functions:
Designs and develops marketing and promotional materials for the facility
Coordinates advertising, social media initiatives and public relations to build brand awareness and generate new referrals
Meets and exceeds sales targets by driving business and generating admissions to help reach and maintain 90% occupancy.
Develops a measuring system for determining the success of each marketing program
Arranges and conducts on-site tours with prospective residents and their families Handles all admission screenings and initial inquiries
Creates unique and personal follow up for prospects and their families
Able to build and maintain strong relationships with community members, families, organizations and Senior Citizen's groups
Builds and maintain working relationships with physicians, clinics, and other health care referral sources, to educate on the facility programs and services to increase referrals and new resident admissions
Acts as liaison between the facility and family members during the pre-admission and admission process
The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for all public relations/special events, marketing and admissions screenings for the facility
Completes admission paperwork with the responsible party, family member, power of attorney or resident upon admission.
Works with the Director of Nursing to ensure that all admissions are screened thoroughly and adequately prior to admission
Works with the Social Services staff to ensure that all advanced directives have been discussed prior to admission, so that appropriate paperwork can be in place upon admission
Responsible for all census development
Maintains data (inquiries, admissions, discharges and referral sources, customer satisfaction)
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in health-related field, preferred
2 or more years of experience in healthcare, preferably in a skilled nursing facility
LPN license, preferred
Minimum of 1-3 years nursing experience
Able to communicate clearly using both written and verbal methods
Able to communicate effectively with residents, families, staff, community officials and the public
Able to work in a team oriented environment, as well as independently
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Respect for the principles of resident rights, confidentiality, EEO and ADA
Other Requirements:
HEALTHCARE MARKETING OR NURSING FACILITY MARKETING EXPERIENCE REQUIRED.
Must pass criminal background check and meet other hiring requirements.

Job Description

Founded with a commitment to build a different kind of law firm, Crowell & Moring LLP today is an international law firm representing clients in litigation and investigations, regulatory and transactional matters. We are internationally recognized for our representation of Fortune 500 companies in high-stakes litigation, as well as our ongoing commitment to pro bono service and diversity. With nearly 550 lawyers based in seven offices in the United States and Europe, the firm helps international corporations and emerging enterprises navigate complex legal challenges and create business solutions across the globe.

Job Summary:
The Senior Business Development Manager will develop and implement strategies to elevate the profile of the offices, practices, and attorneys in California to drive brand recognition and business growth. The Senior Business Development Manager will identify and execute strategies and signature programs to educate, inform, and strengthen client relationships and will facilitate connections among attorneys to help capitalize on business opportunities.

The position can be based at our OC or LA offices.

Primary Areas of Responsibility:

Business Development and Marketing
• Develop and execute marketing and business plans for the Los Angeles, Orange County and San Francisco offices.
• Develop strategies and approaches to facilitate collaborative business development, branding and strategic involvement in the legal and business communities.
• Secure and distribute market intelligence to further inform business development, branding and recruiting initiatives and to capitalize on opportunities that align with the firm’s strategic priorities.
• Capitalize on opportunities to work across offices to facilitate client growth and new client development initiatives.
• Engage with California attorneys to assist with integrating their business plans and aligning their initiatives with the broader plans and priorities of the firm.
• Manage and implement signature client development programs in California.
• Support client service teams as assigned.
• Research and identify organizations, events and Boards that align with each office’s strategic priorities. Develop a plan for maximizing on attorney involvement.
• Maintain and distribute a calendar of important local and regional events, including detail on attorney involvement, on a monthly basis.
• Ensure that tables at events that the firm is sponsoring are filled appropriately.
• Serve as a brand ambassador for the firm at events and become involved in organizations that will help support the firm’s strategic objectives in the three California markets.
• Work with the Senior Director, Business Development and practice leadership to implement lateral integration plans for new partners in the California offices.

Communications
• Identify opportunities for expert commentary, as well as promotion of client successes.
• Identify publishing and speaking opportunities that align with the profile-raising objectives of the practices represented in the California offices in coordination with the firm’s communications team.
• Contribute to the establishment of priorities for the PR firm supporting the California offices and identify timely opportunities to feature firm attorneys in media stories. Provide input on results and effectiveness.
• Work with the communications team to develop submissions for awards that are of strategic importance.

Qualifications

Requirements:

Education
The position requires a Bachelor’s Degree. A JD, MBA or other related advanced degree may substitute for required experience.

Experience
The position requires a minimum of eight (8) years of increasingly responsible, directly related experience during which knowledge, skills and abilities applicable to the position were demonstrated.

Experience in the direct supervision of others on a regular basis preferred. Direct experience in a law firm or professional services environment in a professional capacity preferred.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
• Strong business and marketing acumen, including the ability to leverage research and competitive intelligence to identify business opportunities and support go-to-market strategies.
• Demonstrated ability to build strong working relationships across all levels of the organization and work both independently and with others in a cooperative, enthusiastic and friendly manner to accomplish position functions and participate in team efforts.
• Ability to adapt to changing priorities and maintain a productive and committed work effort, meeting deadlines and managing workload.
• Excellent time management, organization, and prioritization skills.
• Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both orally and in writing with internal and external clients/personnel at all levels.
• Experience with content creation and messaging development.
• Strong knowledge of and familiarity with legal and business environments.
• Demonstrated knowledge of the Orange County, Los Angeles and San Francisco markets.
• Demonstrated knowledge of CRM systems and experience management databases.
• Must be willing to travel regularly among the firm’s three California offices.

Additional Information

Crowell & Moring LLP offers a competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package which includes progressive options such as back up child care, wellness programs, cultural events and social activities. We take great pride in our positive, friendly culture that rewards hard work and success, at the same time recognizing the importance of family and community service.

EOE m/f/d/v
Crowell & Moring LLP participates in the E-Verify program.

Job Title: Internship: Website Merchandising and Content Creation
Job Description:
The Company. Twisted Throttle® is an established company with a healthy growth record and a dynamic management team. Located in Exeter, Rhode Island, Twisted Throttle was founded at the cusp of the now-exploding adventure motorcycling craze and is currently positioned as one of the major players in the market. We provide premium bolt-on motorcycle accessories for the adventure, sport-touring, and sport bike markets, primarily serving European and Japanese motorcycle riders. As exclusive North American distributor for leading powersports and ADV brands (including SW-Motech, R&G and others), we also specialize in prototyping, product development, wholesale distribution, and Internet retail sales for the full line of Twisted Throttles house of brands.

The Experience. Our interns are placed within teams and given a manager and mentor to help them build technical skills, cultural competencies, and self confidence. By being integrated into a team, our interns get the opportunity to work on projects that have a real impact on our bottom line. Paid internships are available for students in many of the functional areas of our company, including:
Data loading and management
Writing and maintaining compelling content
Organizing and editing images, videos, and product attributes
Optimizing pages and websites to drive sales
and more!
We are located in Exeter, Rhode Island (20 minutes west of URI in South Kingstown via route 138, 30 minutes south of RISD in Providence via I-95, or 45 minutes west of Salve Regina in Newport). Seasonal and annual internships are available with flexible hours, and many interns stay on after graduation as full time employees. Come join us for fun, learning, and motos!

Working Conditions: Enthusiasm for motorcycles is preferred for all positions at Twisted Throttle, as enthusiasm for any sport, outdoor, or adventure activity is key to fitting in with our passionate culture. (All new hires without previous motorcycle experience are provided opportunity to attend the motorcycle safety course and obtain their motorcycle driver's license.) Whether you are a motorcycle enthusiast or not, count on the contagion of the Twisted Throttle organizations passion and drive. You will work in an office environment with a great management team that loves to work hard, have fun, and win!

Benefits and Perks:
The Tame. Twisted Throttle provides competitive benefits for full time staff, including multiple health, dental and vision insurance options, Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Account (FSA), term life insurance equivalent to one year's pay, 401k with company match, gym membership reimbursement, an Employee Assistance Program (EAP), subsidized classes and convention entry for professional development, and paid time off that grows with your time at the company. AFLAC benefits, including Cancer, Life, Disability and Accident plans, are also available.
The Twisted. Aside from awesome discounts on powersports gear and motorcycles, our culture includes a few unconventional traditions. Quarterly employee appreciation days include Nerf jousting, trips to breweries, and motorcycle release parties. Our weekly "Meat Wednesday" is a group lunch where all departments get together for fun, recognition and vittles. Our Ducati espresso machine keeps us fueled in the office, and our Moto Sabbatical rewards completing four years of service with a nine-day paid motorcycle-related trip; Twisted Crew members have ventured on two wheels to Alaska, Key West, the Alps, Mexico and more on their sabbaticals.

Hi! We’re ACRONYM.

We’re a non-profit committed to building power and lasting digital infrastructure for a new progressive movement.

We design, develop, and deploy sophisticated digital marketing campaigns to advance progressive causes. But no more dry, traditional political ads — we want to entertain and make people feel something by combining culture and politics in new, fresh, and compelling ways.

To do this, we’re building the best and most diverse creative team in politics. And we’re looking for innovative creative content makers from inside and outside politics who aren’t afraid to take some strategic, interesting swings.

Video Editor

Using your creative thinking skills and a range of varied styles and techniques, you elevate every piece of content you touch, finding original and eye-grabbing ways to lure an audience in immediately.

A highly conceptual and original thinker, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality and innovative digital video advertising spots. You will work hand-in-hand a Content Producer or Creative Strategist, a Motion Graphics Editor, and Designers to ideate and drive the concept and layout for your projects from conceptualization to finish, consulting directly with the Head of Content.

The ideal candidate is:
A dynamic, highly conceptual, and innovative creative thinker that loves making digital content. You should have the ability to tell a wide variety of stories of varying tones and styles. From comedy and satire to explainer videos and aspirational verite, you will do it all. If there are specific areas you specialize in, that’s great too.
Unafraid to question convention, loves blue sky brainstorming, always asks “what if,” and constantly brings fresh ideas to the table even when they’re not asked to, but can also turn that idea into a piece of content on a dime.
Has a deep understanding of pop culture, Internet culture, digital video and social media platforms from YouTube to TikTok, and how people consume digital content.
Politically engaged. You don’t have to have direct political experience, but you have to have a voracious appetite for current affairs. The wind changes direction constantly in our business and we must always be prepared to respond.
Has a proven track record of being a team player, collaborating with other teams and a variety of stakeholders to ensure full understanding of creative and strategic objectives, execute projects accurately, and deliver them on time.
Has a nimble and flexible attitude as project needs and deadlines can and will be dynamic.
Unfazed by a fast-paced, high stakes environment with fast turnaround times. Comfortable juggling multiple projects at one time.
A scrappy and resourceful problem solver who proactively seeks out answers.
Lives in the Washington, DC metropolitan area (or are willing to relocate).

Expert editor in Adobe Premiere, with a demonstrated track record of executing ideas on tight turnaround times.
Proficient in all aspects of post-production and has the ability to transform footage in creative ways, using high-quality video, motion graphics, and a diverse range of editing techniques, styles, and tones.

Exceptional creative thinking skills that exhibit a range of varied styles and techniques, but excels at economical and highly visual, attention-grabbing storytelling.

Always open and willing to experiment with different versions of an edit, exploring multiple directions, and incorporating data and analytics insights into creative refreshes as needed.

Technically proficient in all video codecs and formats and the ability to transcode between them. Knows how to clip, transcode, and organize content for a variety of purposes.
As comfortable executing ideas with original material as you are with sourced materials.

Fluency in meme and animated GIF culture and experience making them
Portfolios

About MobileIron

Industry leading brands who are defining the future of work, adopt MobileIron to secure access to the enterprise, through the world's most ubiquitous product—the mobile device. We've created a single point of secure and frictionless access to the perimeter-less enterprise —from any device, managed by MobileIron, someone else, or not all.

Our mobile-centric, zero trust approach validates and verifies a comprehensive set of signals and the correlation between the user, device, applications, networks and potential threats before granting secure access to the device. Our zero trust platform is built on the foundation of our award-winning and industry-leading unified endpoint management (UEM) capabilities with enabling technologies of zero sign-on (ZSO) user and device authentication, multi-factor authentication (MFA), and mobile threat detection (MTD.) And we didn't stop there. We've gone beyond traditional UEM, identity and gateway solutions, to bring together mobile, security and the way people want to work—so you can free your people to be productive without limits and passwords.

MobileIron. The center of enterprise security

Recognized by Gartner as a leader in eight UEM MQs and recently noted by Forbes as one of the "Top 10 Cybersecurity Companies To Watch In 2020"

What you'll be doing…
Leading a dynamic product marketing team
Speaking at industry events
Partnering closely with industry analysts
Creating product positioning that clearly articulates our unique value proposition, enabling target customers to fully understand the benefits of MobileIron solutions
Developing a content strategy and lead content creation with key solutions partners for use in sales collateral, customer presentations, solutions briefs, website and videos
Creating and driving integrated go-to-market plans for new initiatives and products
Developing and delivering sales enablement to MobileIron sales organization, including channel sales.
Who you are...
You are an excellent written, graphical and verbal communicator with the ability to translate technical details into business value propositions.
You have a passion for building content, buyer personas and buyer journeys and overall messaging for the company
You have experience and a network with leading industry analysts
You have a clear understanding of the mobile industry, security as well as SaaS based products & services
You have technical aptitude in the area of mobility, security and enterprise infrastructure
What you've done…
BA/BS degree in Marketing or related field. MBA preferred; Technical background is a plus
Experience driving product marketing or product management efforts, including product launches for a major product line
Minimum 10 years of experience in leadership of Product Marketing
* We are an EEO/AA Employer. Protected veterans and individuals with disability encouraged to apply.

About LaunchDarkly:
LaunchDarkly is a Feature Management Platform that serves hundreds of billions of feature flags daily to help software teams build better software, faster. Feature flagging is an industry standard methodology of wrapping a new or risky section of code or infrastructure change with a flag. Each flag can easily be turned off independent of code deployment (aka "dark launching"). LaunchDarkly has SDKs for all major web and mobile platforms. We are building a diverse team so that we can offer robust products and services. Our team culture is dynamic, friendly, and supportive. Our headquarters are in Oakland.

At LaunchDarkly, we believe in the power of teams. We're building a team that is humble, open, collaborative, respectful and kind. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We've partnered with KeyValues to help demonstrate the amazing culture we've built here at LaunchDarkly, find more info at https://www.keyvalues.com/launchdarkly

Job Description

The Principal SIEM Engineer works in Optiv Security’s 24x7x365 Security Operations Center as a member of the Managed Security Services (MSS) team. The employee will be responsible for creation of procedures, implementation of processes and development of staff for managing and maintaining security systems across internal and client environments. Experience and knowledge of Splunk (SIEM) or Situational Awareness are essential. The Principal Engineer will work closely with Management, Senior Engineers, Solution Architects, Senior Security Engineers, other Principal Security Engineers and clients to complete high profile, critical services to existing Managed Security Service clients. This person will serve as a subject matter expert and team lead for Managed Security Services, staying in tune with all client configuration issues and all internal projects.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Lead engineering team by prioritizing clients work requests, projects and service tasks related to their Splunk SIEM platform.
Work closely with Management, Service Delivery and other Principal Engineers in defining processes and procedures for internal projects.
Guide the design, development and review of complex security SIEM content.
Analyzes and identifies areas of improvement with existing processes, procedures and documentation.
Develop individual team, defining strategies and responsibilities to be successful and grow.
Develops internal training methods to support Managed Services and their clients.
Act as the point of escalation for other Engineers (Associate Engineer, Security Engineer, & Senior Engineer) and provide guidance and mentoring.
Assist with client transition and on-boarding serve as primary point of contact for Managed Security Service clients.
This will require documentation of Account Governance processes and responsibility for report generation and notification to senior leadership about potential client Service Level Agreement (SLA) issues.
Explain and demonstrate how to use SIEM and Enterprise Security products to both technical and relatively non-technical personnel.
Provide remote consulting services via interactive client sessions to assist with implementation of multiple product vendors and technologies.
Implement and configure SIEM software and appliance-based products in large enterprise and Government environments.
Qualifications

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
3+ years professional experience managing and maintaining SIEM systems, specifically Splunk.
2-3 years professional experience working with networks and network architecture.
1+ year professional experience writing SIEM content.
Prior experience in a technical team leadership role.
College degree or equivalent training with experience working in a Security Operations Center, Managed Security, or client network environment.
Advanced information security knowledge in one or more areas:
Enterprise end-point security products (i.e. McAfee e-Policy Orchestrator, Virus Scan, Anti-Spyware, Host Data Loss Protection, Endpoint Encryption, etc.)
Security Information and Event Manager (SIEM), to include: Splunk (a must have) and any additional SIEM platform knowledge is a plus (i.e. Nitro, ArcSight, RSA, QRadar, Exabeam, LogRhythm etc.)
Network Firewall, Web Proxy, E-Mail and Web Gateway etc. to include: Palo Alto / Checkpoint / Juniper / McAfee / Cisco / Blue Coat / Imperva.
Understanding of network architecture and implementation is a must; ideal candidate will have worked with network security analysis.
Experience with content SIEM content creation and reporting.
Excellent time management, reporting, and communication skills.
Superior IT problem-solving skills.
Experience with Linux OS.
MUST HAVE:
Shift flexibility, including the ability to provide on call support when needed
Demonstrated experience and success in a Managed Service client environment
Valid Driver’s License
Ability to work greater than 40 hours per week as needed
Ability to travel up to 10 percent of the time
Desired Qualifications
Experience working with Internal and client ticketing and knowledge base systems for Incident and Problem Tracking, as well as procedures. (i.e. Jira, Confluence, etc.).
General security knowledge (GIAC, CISSP, CCSE, CISA, HBSS, NSA, CEH, Cisco Security, Security +, or other security certifications).
Knowledge of Linux and Windows Operating Systems.
An understanding of a wide array of server grade applications such as: DBMS, Exchange, DNS, SMTP, IIS, Apache, SharePoint, Active Directory, Identity Management, Patch Management, LDAP, SQL, and others.
Experience with various SIEM security products such as: ArcSight, QRadar, Nitro, Splunk, LogRhythm and infrastructure components such as proxies, firewalls, IDS/IPS, DLP etc.
CCNA, CCDA, CCSA, CCIE, CISSP, CEH, or MCSE (a plus)
Familiarity with DevOps
Prior consulting experience is nice to have.

We have an opportunity to join the Alliance as a Communications Content Specialist in the Communications Department.

WHAT YOU'LL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR


Reporting to the Media and Content Manager, you will develop, write and edit content for internal and external communications and assist with media relations. You will also perform communications research and planning and assist with providing oversight and support of Communications Department activities.

ABOUT THE TEAM

The Alliance's Communications Department is relatively new to the Alliance organization, having been established in 2018. As such, there's a bit of a startup mentality for our department within the larger organization, as we work to establish foundational processes and procedures and champion the Communications function and role within the organization. We use strategy, creativity and insights to develop messaging and visual communications for internal and external audiences. We partner with each department and on a variety of tasks, from an intranet webpage to a flu shot media campaign, and our committed and talented team of go-getters is always looking for the best way to communicate our messaging.

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE

You are a highly motivated individual with strong written and verbal communication skills. You can craft your writing to fit the Alliance voice and tone for internal and external audiences, and can draft a variety of content, including press releases, web copy or a newsletter article. You have the ability to work cohesively in a team-oriented environment and interact with others with diplomacy and tact, and you thrive in a fast-paced environment. You have recent experience working with Facebook Ads Manager, among other social media tools, and are familiar with best practices for increasing engagement and brand awareness using social media.

WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL

To read the full position description, and list of requirements click here.

Knowledge of:
Tools and techniques of copywriting for publication
Principles and practices of public relations, marketing, media relations and/or corporate communications
Methods of utilizing traditional media, internet, social media and alternative media to increase public awareness of the organization and promote organizational objectives
Principles and practices of content development and writing for websites and social media
Ability to:
Think creatively and develop fresh, compelling, and innovative content that aligns with the overall communications strategy and results in maximum response and engagement
Incorporate branding into the design and production of a variety of communications materials, including electronic media and printed materials
Compose content and proofread and edit high profile documents in a variety of media formats
Proofread and edit content for style, tone, completeness, and consistency of brand message
Interpret and synthesize a wide range of information from a variety of sources and translate complex information and concepts into clear, succinct copy

Bachelor's degree in English, journalism, communications or a related field
A minimum of five years of experience creating, writing, editing and publishing content in a business environment (or a Master's degree and a minimum of three years) or an equivalent combination of education and experience may be qualifying

ABOUT US


We are a group of over 500 dedicated employees, committed to our mission of providing accessible, quality health care that is guided by local innovation. We feel that our work is bigger than ourselves. We leave work each day knowing that we made a difference in the community around us.

Join us at Central California Alliance for Health (the Alliance), where you will be part of a culture that is respectful, diverse, professional and fun, and where you are empowered to do your best work. As a regional non-profit health plan, we serve over 330,000 members in Santa Cruz, Monterey and Merced counties. To learn more about us, click here or check out this video.

At this time the Alliance does not provide any type of sponsorship. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time, ongoing basis without current or future needs for sponsorship.

JOB MISSION
We’re seeking a creative, enthusiastic person with amazing communication and project management skills to help nurture, tend and grow relationships with bloggers and brands. Based in our OTR office, you will work with our Digital Campaign Strategist to help build strong relationships with bloggers and content creators, facilitate new opportunities with brands and deliver amazing insights that lead to better marketing, client satisfaction and continued growth.
JOB DESCRIPTION
Your job will be a unique blend of problem-solving, customer service, and project management. By partnering with content creators and internal cross-functional teams, you are both the content creators’ representative at Ahalogy and the face of Ahalogy to our brand clients. Most of your time will be spent building relationships with brands and bloggers, onboarding brands to the Ahalogy process, managing project timelines, educating brands on content-related trends, and overseeing the sponsored content projects from the creation of content to the delivery of the final report. The Digital Campaign Manager will have ample opportunities to touch many facets of our business and help form what Ahalogy becomes.
The ideal candidate will have a bachelor’s degree in English, communications, journalism, public relations, digital marketing or related field, with relevant work experience ranging from college internships to 2-3 years in a professional position. Project management background will be a big plus.
A pretty cool gig, all the way around.
SPECIFIC SKILLS WE'RE LOOKING FOR INCLUDE...
Attention to detail, confidence, and a can-do attitude.
Drive, ambition and motivation for success.
Ability to evaluate design and give feedback on content and creative.
Excellent written and oral skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time and commitment to meet deadlines.
Knowledge of brand marketing and personal experience with/ knowledge of social media.
Experience with Pinterest and Paid Media activations is a plus.
Lead ongoing support for 5-10 brand campaigns in the first quarter. Manage all aspects of the sponsored content campaign from timeline development, trend delivery, content creation, paid media execution, and reporting. Ensure quality of content and creative deliverables with a goal of 95% of content delivered to client is approved in the first round.
Professional experience in one or more of the key industry verticals: Food, Fashion, Fitness, Beauty, Décor, Crafts, Travel, Pets, and Baby.
Entrepreneurial mindset that allows you and your role to evolve over time. We want someone who’s eager to be an integral part of our dynamic, fun team and who’s comfortable working in a sometimes chaotic (dogs! babies! exploding sodas!), always fast-paced startup environment. You will work hard, learn a ton and have a blast.

SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE...
Lead ongoing support for 5-10 brand campaigns in the first 90 days of work.
Create content strategy plans for a brands’ custom content campaign.
Onboard at least one new content partner to Ahalogy in your first quarter.
Ensure quality of content and creative deliverables with a goal of 95% of content delivered to client is approved in the first round.

Why Ahalogy?
Ahalogy is the Passion to Purchase Platform. Brands and agencies tap into Ahalogy to grow users and use occasions by connecting with their consumers’ interests. We deliver proven ROI for our clients through our category trend data, authentic influencer content, and social optimization technology.
We’re located in Cincinnati's OTR—walking distance from some of the city's best coffee, burgers, beers, and carryout. We pride ourselves on having an open, fast-paced, and results-driven culture and we're passionate about continuing to build out a team of like-minded individuals as we continue to grow and win.
We don’t hold hands or micromanage at Ahalogy, so we need candidates with a self-driven, figure-it-out mindset. In return, we take care of you with zero cost health insurance, flexible vacation time, and if you're a full-time employee, the potential for an annual bonus. You can learn more about us by reading our Manifesto.
If you have the experience, drive, and grit to win, we'd love to hear from you!

Communicate clearly and frequently about work both in-person and with remote teams

Experience designing Web UIs for accessibility
Experience with WebSockets, ZMQ, UPD, TCP/IP, USB or other communication protocols
Experience using versioning, compiling, and scaffolding tools such as Webpack, Yeoman, Jenkins, Git, etc.
Working knowledge of interoperability specifications for learning content such as QTI, xAPI, etc
Effective communicator, including excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills

Ability to work positively with a wide range of individuals

Truly autonomous drones are a new product category that demand a new kind of mobile experience. Forget complex joysticks and awkward tilt-controls: we are crafting completely novel interactions that leverage Skydio’s onboard intelligence to empower a much broader, more diverse audience of drone users.
How you'll make an impact:
Define and develop the primary user interface for the world’s most advanced autonomous flying camera.
Combine your knowledge of the iOS ecosystem with our Drone Intelligence API and set the gold standard for what a drone app should be.
Develop features for controlling the drone’s movement and behaviors (3d camera manipulation, initiation of context-specific cinematic maneuvers, etc).
Improve user experiences by incorporating augmented reality, in-app content creation, and sharing capabilities.
Iterate on designs based on user feedback, internal testing, and your own experience piloting Skydio 2.
Establish and guide the quality assurance process for production mobile, including the App Store deployment.

Requirements:
You have a passion for meticulously crafted interfaces that strike the correct balance between ease-of-use, elegance, and power.
You’ve shipped code to the App Store and experienced the joys (and frustrations) of getting feedback from real users.
You appreciate the value of code-review and other collaborative development practices.
Technology stack:
Our iOS codebase is primarily written in Swift 5, leveraging Apple’s best practices for UI development.
Skydio’s Autonomy Engine is powered by an extensive C++ codebase, which our iOS and Android apps leverage for critical communication with the drone.

Provides weekly status reports to the HR Director

Position Summary

Posting Note: We are looking for a creative, talented and effective Content Writer to join our team to enrich the quality of our website, email, social, collateral and marketing copy. The person will deliver high quality writing pieces that appeal to our audiences, attract donors and boost brand awareness. As an integral member of the Marketing and Communications team within the Phoenix Children’s Hospital Foundation, responsibilities will include conducting research, interviewing patient families, individual donors and corporate partners, generating ideas for new content types and proofreading, providing support for strategic marketing and communications plans for campaigns and events, and more. Seeking someone with a keen eye for detail, a positive can-do attitude, and team player. If you are an experienced content and copy writer with a portfolio of published articles, can work independently and as part of a team, and are adept at working within content management systems in a fast passed environment, we encourage you to apply. This is a great opportunity for someone who is seeking to be a part of a dynamic and special organization whose philanthropic mission is to support our community’s children’s hospital.

Working in close collaboration with leadership, the Sr Specialist develops and implements all aspects of multiple programs that align with hospital’s mission and support the Foundation’s goals. Working independently, the Sr Specialist may be in charge of overseeing program/project execution that could include staffing, volunteers, budget and fundraising goals from start to finish. This position may also be responsible for special events that publicize the organization and its programs to the community. Position may have direct and/or indirect oversight of lower-level staff members and/or volunteers.

PCH Values

Family-Centered care that focuses on the need of the child first and values the family as an important member of the care team
Excellence in clinical care, service and communication
Collaborative within our institution and with others who share our mission and goals
Leadership that set the standard for pediatric health care today and innovations of the future
Accountability to our patients, community and each other for providing the best in the most cost-effective way.

Position Duties

Manage Budgets: Creates and analyzes budgets for each program in order to minimize unnecessary expenditures, including complex budgetary planning and forecasting.

Allocate Resources: Allocates a specific amount of resources for each program while avoiding the depletion of resources as well as the degradation of quality.

Program Development: Provides leadership and/or oversight in the development of fully-fledged programs complete with policies, procedures and techniques.

Staff Oversight: Responsible for training, assisting and collaborating with staff members who are involved in one or more programs. Indirect and/or direct supervision must facilitate communication, aid organization, coordinate objectives and ensure that standards are met.

Process Documentation: Manages the tracking of deliverables, monitoring progress and translating data towards future growth projections.

Performs miscellaneous job related duties as requested.

The Manufacturing and Trade practice of FINN Partners is seeking an Account Executive or Senior Account Executive to join our New York team to service B2B clients. Our diverse client base ranges from multi-billion dollar, global organizations to entrepreneurial, regionally focused companies that operate in industries such as packaging, pharmaceutical, medical device, robotics and automation. Our forte is working closely with clients, deeply rooting ourselves in their business to understand challenges and opportunities and then proactively bringing them ideas to accelerate growth.

Our ideal candidate is someone that has excellent writing skills, an inquisitive nature, displays resourcefulness and flexibility, works collaboratively and thinks creatively to generate new ideas. The candidate should also have strong organizational and problem-solving skills, be detail oriented and be able to see projects to completion on deadline. The position requires the ability to think strategically and multi-task; solid writing and speaking skills are also critical.

Core responsibilities include:
Helping execute and manage several client programs as directed by senior staff. This includes keeping teams and deliverables organized, ensuring they meet internal or client requirements, and that work is performed to established standards.
Creating a variety of public relations and marketing content; candidate must have solid PR writing experience.
Serving as a day-to-day contact with clients (in conjunction with other team members).
Conducting media relations efforts to generate targeted publicity in print and online trade and business media.
Cultivating relationships with key client contacts as well as the media.
Supervising and guiding junior team members, including interns.
Regularly articulating ideas for organic business growth and agency improvement and participating in proposal development.
Requirements include:
2-3 years of full-time work experience in an agency or corporate setting.
B2B experience or interest.
Fluency in Spanish and/or Portuguese desired, but not required.
Excellent writing and editing skills.
Experience pitching and placing positive stories by and about clients in the media.
Strong organizational and problem-solving skills; displays flexibility and adaptability.
Understanding of and experience using a range of digital and social media tools.
Aptitude for understanding complex, technology-based businesses.
Strong work ethic, enthusiastic attitude and curious nature.
Enjoy working with other talented people in a creative, collaborative and fast-paced environment.
About us

Finn Partners is a global communications agency, made up of nine practice areas with 800+ people in 19 locations worldwide. The firm offers a full-service approach including integrated public relations, content creation, social, digital marketing and research services. Founded in New York in 2011 by Peter Finn with an innovative new model in which entrepreneurial spirit, innovation and partnership drive client success and sustainable agency growth, the firm delivers world class client service, coupled with best-in-class employment practices, to produce award-winning work and a rewarding culture.

FINN Partners fosters an enriching work environment that facilitates creativity and professional growth. Compensation includes competitive salary, excellent medical benefits, 401k, generous vacation package and more. Visit us at www.finnpartners.com.

New York based applicants preferred, however for the right candidate, willing to consider remote work arrangements in Boston, Philadelphia, DC or Chicago.

Job Description:
About Starry:

Starry is proud to be an Equal Opportunity workplace. Just like the internet service we provide; we do not discriminate. We welcome people from all over the world to share their knowledge and perspectives. At Starry, you can discover the many careers and opportunities that are made possible when you connect people to the limitless possibilities of the internet.

Our mission focuses on two things. First, we're making the experience of accessing the internet simple, transparent, and delightful. Second, we're bringing that experience to underserved communities around the world. We approach our mission with a cutting-edge wireless technology, customer service designed to delight, and a culture of innovation and intellectual curiosity.

Who we're looking for:

Starry is seeking a Marketing Coordinator, who will be tasked with helping to coordinate and execute Starry's local marketing efforts. You should enjoy working collaboratively with other teams, including Sales and Creative, to ensure business objectives are met.

Reporting to the Director of Marketing, you will contribute to the success of the Starry brand by providing support to the New York marketing team. Our ideal candidate is a positive, self-starter who is confident, well-spoken and eager to learn.

What you'll do:
Define objective and messaging for field marketing events and collateral
Assist with planning, execution and reporting effectiveness of subscriber acquisition campaigns
Effectively communicate brand messaging to consumers, property managers, and stakeholders
Think critically and creatively about how to acquire new subscribers via field marketing events and various marketing channels
Support ongoing initiatives to foster a community, convert and engage new subscribers
Travel throughout the market and be available to work night and weekend events
Work collaboratively with internal teams and external vendors to achieve acquisition results
Qualifications:
BA or BS degree required
1-3 years experience in a sales or marketing
Positive outlook and tenacity
Advanced organizational skills and attention to detail
Ability to interact with potential customers face to face
Ability to communicate effectively to business stakeholders, team and partners
Passion and enthusiasm for events and people
Enthusiasm for new technology and the internet space
Outstanding shuffleboard skills a plus
We work hard, so we take care of each other and try to enjoy ourselves along the way. We have:
Premium medical, dental, and vision coverage with no employee contribution required
12 weeks of paid parental leave
Life insurance and short & long term disability insurances with no employee contribution required
Groups for skiing, biking, running, climbing, stretching, shuffleboard, darts, and more
Happy Interneting!

Convert strategy and marketing goals into compelling copy and promotional material by developing concise and engaging content for a variety of marketing campaigns
Manage, organize, and facilitate execution of marketing campaigns including: Email marketing, direct mail, interactive/web marketing, and advertising efforts (SEO, SEM, and social)
Partner cross-functionally to develop content and ensure smooth product development/rollout and audience growth

Bachelor’s Degree
1-3 years of marketing experience
Proficient in Outlook, Excel, Word and PowerPoint

Do the Right Thing

Do what is right every day. Your personal integrity and the reputation of Evolving depends on this.

Above all else, the Marketing Coordinator must be highly organized with impeccable project management skills, prioritization skills, and able to juggle multiple events with a high attention to detail and accuracy in a deadline-driven environment.

Assist department with budgeting, invoicing, scheduling and the SWAG supply inventory.
