The Windsor Story:
Beauty is eternal. It is captured in the way you feel and in the way you look. It is timeless. Every generation needs to feel beautiful. Some things don’t change. Some things should not change.

Helping women feel beautiful has been our mission since we first opened our doors in 1937. The fashions have changed but the Windsor dream has not. Icons come and go - from Jacqueline Kennedy, to Princess Diana to the red carpet of today. Throughout it all Windsor has made beauty accessible to all women, not just the celebrities.

From the beginning, Windsor has been owned and operated by generations of the Zekaria family. Their caring vision of shared beauty affects everything we do.

Women come to Windsor to find that perfect look that makes them feel beautiful and we have been there for them for all of life’s important moments - your first kiss at the dance, graduation, the big interview and the wedding party. Lives have been changed, and the memories will live forever.

Windsor continues to bring that Oasis experience to you in over 200 stores and through our online shop.

Some things should never change.
Job Summary:
You will play a pivotal role in developing and leveraging the Windsor customer database. Analyzing customer behavior and deriving insights to drive business growth. You will create and maintain a suite of customer reports and a loyalty dashboard to track the performance of the loyalty program. You will identify and develop patterns that drive user conversions across all channels, focusing on email, sms, and loyalty, find opportunities to improve channel engagement, and increase LTV, retention rate, and purchase frequency. You will establish a test and iterate approach to enable rapid optimization of the omni customer experience. You will be essential to developing an omni-channel customer experience.

Key Responsibilities:
Take ownership of digital data ensuring that all systems and channels are tracking accurately, and data is processed in an automated, easy to read format to help drive strategy, vision and decision-making for key digital stakeholders.
Leverage multiple data sources, establish unified customer data view and reporting with clear KPI & tracking for digital and offline channels. Supplement with key insights – actionable nuggets that business partners can respond to.
Work on weekly business review reporting and executive dashboard from an Email and CRM perspective.
Work with CRM team to establish a single view of the Windsor customer & measurement of the personalization program.
Develop customer profiles, and customer segmentations based on recency, frequency, lapsed and monetary value of our customers
Work on developing and expanding the loyalty program and tracking key KPIs to measure the success of the program.
Develop in-store loyalty capture reporting and bad data capture reporting to distribute to store operations team on a regular basis.
Direct email marketing strategies that promote customer loyalty, reengage lapsed customers, and focus on cross-channel selling and upselling strategies.
Perform analyses including but not limited to: advertising performance analysis, website analytics, customer segmentation, survey design and analysis, ROI modeling, lifetime value analysis, cross channel analysis, and media mix analysis.
Working with platform experience & social teams, develop test and learn actionable program to constantly optimize user/shopper experience and drive value by channel and device.
Work with digital content team & develop ways to measure content performance and inform digital content creation.
Develop value-driven database segments to elevate digital channel performance and fuel revenue growth.
Build a framework linking online activity to offline behavior, developing valuations of online actions based on their impact to both brick-and-mortar and e-commerce sales.
Assist in building infrastructure, vision, and analytic tools to support customer centric programs that span campaigns and focus on customer level offer optimization.
Experience in simplifying complex information and explaining findings, outcomes and presenting insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders to reach commercial goals.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree required
Strong analytical and data visualization skills
Demonstrated experience conducting in-depth analysis of various marketing channels, including but not limited to, email, organic social, paid social/digital, SEM/SEO, and retail stores etc.
Versed in Google Analytics as well as various BI Platforms such as Alteryx
3+ years of marketing analyst experience in a dynamic, data-driven environment, preferably in fashion retail
Data management experience utilizing programming is a strong plus (e.g. SQL)
Strong computer skills particularly MS Office (Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills are necessary).
Ability to work under tight deadlines, deal with diverse levels of personnel in a multi-functional environment
Ability to work independently, under general direction, and create organized work plans and output requirements in a timely fashion.
Demonstrate creative thinking and good business judgment
Ability to be flexible, multi-task, have strong organizational, communication and leadership skills to meet strict deadlines and manage multiple projects
Must have strong interpersonal skills and the ability to deal with all levels of management.
Requires a minimum 3-5 years related and progressively responsible experience with the strategic use of data and analytics, preferably in the e-commerce field. Must have the proven ability to identify and assess trends with customer or market data, and experience analyzing campaigns, programs and tests. Requires knowledge of and skill utilizing various Microsoft Office Suite products. Requires Excel application expertise with the strong ability to analyze/manipulate data, perform trend analyses and create reporting and other analytical and planning templates. Must have experience creating complex forecasts which incorporate several inputs and variables. Requires expertise in developing and creating reports in BI Tools. Having Alteryx experience is a plus.
Location: Santa Fe Springs, Los Angeles, CA

Our team of experts is intensely focused on developing, constructing and managing community solar projects, and forging efficient client relationships that enable customers to participate in these projects. We are constantly innovating to keep pace with the evolving energy industry, and that spirit of innovation drives our company’s dynamic culture.

When you join the BlueWave community, you join a team doing all that we can to be transparent, sustainable, and of high integrity. We don’t just want to do business; we want to do good business. As a certified B Corp, we hold ourselves to high standards when it comes to our impact on the environment, our employees, our communities, and our customers.

JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY:

Supports the marketing and sales departments by facilitating internal and external collaboration and by assisting with the planning and execution of campaigns and programs. With responsibilities ranging from purchasing promotional items to booking venues and speakers for special events, the Marketing Coordinator brings strong attention to detail and organization to all projects. The Marketing Coordinator enables clear communication and fosters a dealership-wide culture of teamwork, serving as the point of contact between the marketing, sales, rental, product support, and executive leadership teams. The Marketing Coordinator also manages relationships with the Creative Services group to adhere to the dealership’s brand and standards.

COMPETENCIES LIST AND DESCRIBE:

Own all aspects of planning and coordinating meetings and special events hosted by the dealership for customers, leads, and internal teams while working directly with the Event Manager.

Use exceptional project management skills to execute campaigns and programs, assist with event planning, and assign responsibilities to teams of advertisers and coordinators to maximize performance and efficiency.

Support the Marketing Manager, marketing team, sales teams, and other departments by assisting with marketing efforts from strategic development to execution to analysis, ensuring they have the marketing materials and support they need.

Assist designers, writers, and creative agencies with concept development, content creation/copywriting and editing for both digital and print communications.

Create and manage the dealership’s content calendar (for their respective business segment), working with internal teams to keep it up to date and verify that milestones are met.

Use digital marketing tools to schedule content for social media sites, and coordinate with internal teams to respond to discussions promptly within brand guidelines.

Facilitate communication between the marketing, advertising, sales, rental, product support and executive leadership teams, serving as the main point of contact to align content production with sales funnel needs and boost growth strategies.

Communicate with customers to understand their needs and purchasing behaviors and use that intelligence to help the marketing department develop promotional strategies.

Bolster the dealership’s marketing and advertising efforts by selecting and ordering promotional items that are on brand, complement marketing strategies, and attract interest from customers and leads.

Develop relationships with Caterpillar counterparts to align on communication strategies and marketing goals.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or related business study is required.

Three years of progressive experience in marketing or creative functions are required.

An equivalent combination of education and experience is acceptable.

Ability to read, interpret, and explain documents such as financial reports, legal and service agreements, and procedure manuals.

Ability to write routine reports and effective correspondence for internal and external audiences.

Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees.

Excellent skills in written and verbal communications, planning, organizing, leadership, and interpersonal relationship building.

Solid computer skills including Microsoft Office suite and customer relationship management (CRM) software.

Strong data analysis and visualization skills.

Ability to relate to all levels of employees and be a team player who motivates and educates other team members.

Ability to set and manage priorities for individual responsibilities and tasks.

The ability to travel across the territory to visit customers and branches is required. Some out-of-region travel may be required (up to 25%).

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

Primary functions require sufficient physical ability and mobility to work in an office setting; to stand or sit for prolonged periods of time; to occasionally stoop, bend, kneel, crouch, reach, and twist; to lift, carry, push, and/or pull light to moderate amounts of weight; to operate office equipment requiring repetitive hand movement and fine coordination including use of a computer keyboard, and to verbally communicate to exchange information. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet in office settings and moderate to loud in other situations, with both constant and sudden loud noises possible.

Job Title: Senior Software Engineer, Computer Vision – Deep Learning
Job Description:
Intelligent machines powered by Artificial Intelligence computers that can learn, reason and interact with people are no longer science fiction. Deep Learning has provided the foundation for machines to learn, perceive, reason and solve problems. Now, NVIDIA’s GPU runs Deep Learning algorithms, simulating human intelligence, and acts as the brain of computers, robots and self-driving cars that can perceive and understand the world.

NVIDIA is known as “the AI computing company.” Come, join our Deep Learning team, where you can help build the real-time, cost-effective computing platform driving our success in this exciting and quickly growing field.

We are currently seeking an experienced software engineer with strong Deep Learning and Computer Vision fundamentals coupled with robust C/C++ skills to contribute to the development of NVIDIA RTX Broadcast engine - a comprehensive suite of SDKs and libraries that enable AI-driven features for game broadcasting, video conferencing and content creation.

What you’ll be doing:
Architect next generation Deep Learning and Computer Vision algorithms for processing of video, audio and augmented reality
Optimize algorithms for optimal performance on the GPU tensor cores
Collaborate with various teams to drive an end to end workflow from data curation and training to performance optimization and deployment
Influence strategic decisions in the team and product roadmap
Partner with system software engineering experts and validation teams to build shipping industrial strength code
What we need to see:
5+ years of relevant experience
PH.D./MS in Computer Science or a closely related engineering field or equivalent experience
Strong background in Deep Learning including model design, pruning & performance optimization, transfer learning etc
Hands on expertise with Python and one or more Deep Learning frameworks (Caffe, tensorflow, keras etc)
Advanced familiarity with state of the art algorithms related to 3D reconstruction , Video processing, Facial animation etc
Strong software engineering background with proficiency in C or C++
CUDA programming experience is a plus
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Self-motivated and able to find creative practical solutions to problems
NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most talented people on the planet working for us. As part of our team, you will have the opportunity to influence the future with your vision and expertise. Are you creative? Are your driven not just by data or the need to know why, but yearn to ask, 'why not'? We want to hear from you.

With competitive salaries and a generous benefits package, we are widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us and, due to unprecedented growth, our exclusive engineering teams are rapidly growing. If you're a creative and autonomous engineer with a real passion for technology, we want to hear from you.

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Mvix, a leading digital signage provider in the Dulles Technology Corridor has created the opportunity for a Marketing Coordinator in our Sterling, VA headquarters.

The ideal candidate is a highly motivated individual with experience and passion for planning campaigns, creating a process and collaborating with multiple teams to meet company objectives.

The Marketing Coordinator will be part of a dynamic team of marketing associates, business development associates, and graphic designers. Their ultimate goal of the Marketing Coordinator is to assist to develop and execute a strategy for demand and lead generation for the company’s SaaS platform.

This role reports to the Marketing Manager.

The candidate will gain extensive B2B experience in different marketing disciplines, including but not limited to content, paid media, communications, operations and analysis, lifecycle nurturing, and brand.

Responsibilities
Assist with the development and execution of marketing campaigns
Act as a project manager for marketing projects - ownership of the coordination and communication of marketing projects with internal teams and agencies
Management of a tracking system for marketing campaigns to ensure all details are captured correctly, costs accounted for, delivery to market on time, and follow up reporting received
Participate in generating new concepts for blog posts, white papers, and social media content
Manage and report on social media presence
Manage the press release and case study pipeline
Update internal communication assets e.g. sales handbook
Update and maintain internal reports (e.g. leads, case studies, etc)
Help managing the marketing collateral library
Help organize the marketing calendar for events and activities
Provide operational support for the marketing and business development teams for time-sensitive needs, such as event coordination, providing materials, and other activities that assist them in their opportunity pursuits.

Requirements
High school diploma required; an Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university with a concentration in Marketing or Communications preferred
Passionate: A strong desire & passion to start a career in Business (Marketing, Sales, etc)
Proactive: take initiative and own the projects and tasks assigned to you
Fast learner: our industry is young and fast-changing. You will be required to keep up with the workload, frequent changes in the industry, and new marketing trends
Creative: critical and creative thinking to help the team develop unique marketing strategies
A desire to learn and develop professional skills
Knowledge of Wordpress, Photoshop, Indesign, and/or HTML is a PLUS
How can this position help you grow? Proficiency in this position leads to the next step up - Senior Marketing Associate - where team members are exposed to managing larger marketing projects as well as leading junior team members.

Why is Mvix such an exciting place to work? We’ll let our accolades do the talking!
Ranked in The 20 Best Companies to Watch in 2017 by Insights Success
Acknowledged as one of the 50 Best Workplaces of 2016 by The Silicon Review
Voted Best in Show at InfoComm 2017
Awarded Best Digital Signage Software by DIGI (2017)

company-funded professional development

Summary of Job Duties:

Threshold Enterprises, owner of the brand Source Naturals is seeking a part-time Video Editor to join our in-house video team to create professional video and media content. This includes non-linear video editing of content for educational as well as marketing initiatives. This position requires extensive knowledge of post-production including professional video editing with Adobe Premiere Pro and After Effects, audio mixing, color correction, simple animated graphics, file and workflow management. Strong attention to detail and the ability to follow brand guidelines and workflow best practices are required.

The Video Editor is responsible for encoding, reviewing, and preparing content for a variety of digital distribution channels and assists in managing and uploading content to platforms both in 16x9 and 1x1 ratios. Most marketing videos will require stylish captions. If the Video Editor has production experience and is a positive team player thats a plus.

Specific Job Duties:
Professional nonlinear editing (NLE) with Adobe Premiere Pro and experience with the entire Adobe Creative Cloud toolset (Photoshop, After Effects, Encoder, etc.)
Video editing, audio mixing, color correction, animation, and graphics creation.
Working collaboratively with video producers to take projects from conception to completion.
Organizing and tracking assets with file and digital asset management best practices in a shared workflow environment.
Editing content from provided edit decision lists (EDLs), or independently using personal judgement on best takes, angles, and story structure.
Preparing and uploading content to digital distribution channels including YouTube, Facebook, and Instagram
Adding annotations, titles, descriptions, calls-to-action, thumbnails, and other associated media and metadata to video and media content before it is published.
Archiving projects and video assets.
Adhering to Thresholds brand and workflow guidelines.
Quality assurance and attention to detail in creating and reviewing work.
Assisting with video production as needed.
Perform all other duties as assigned by Threshold management.

Demonstrated video post-production expertise, including at least two years of experience in the following areas:
All areas of post-production, including motion graphics creation, color correction, audio mixing, video compression, and online distribution.
Non-linear, professional editing with Adobe Premiere Pro, Adobe Creative Cloud Suite tools.
Ability to work collaboratively and follow creative direction.
Willingness to learn new technologies and techniques as video production standards and workflows evolve.
Strong organizational skills, with the ability to meet deadlines, prioritize, and work on multiple projects simultaneously with great efficiency and attention to detail.

“Taking care of pets and people with our utmost C.A.R.E!” Compassion, Accommodation, Respect, and Empathy. Caring for your pets as our own.

Waipahu Waikele Pet Hospital proudly serves our Kama’aina, Military families, and community with exceptional veterinary care and aloha. Since opening our doors in 1972, we’ve grown into the largest locally-owned pet hospital in Hawaii, all while keeping the same family-friendly feel our customers have come to expect. Our staff believes in creating the best experience, from the time you walk through the doors till the time you leave, because we truly believe that our pets are part of our ohana.

About the Job:

We’re looking for a full-time, experienced and creative Marketing Coordinator to join our fast-paced, family-oriented team as we continue to grow and expand. You will be in charge of developing and implementing all marketing strategies to be in line with our company’s objectives and core values. You will also be tasked with managing and growing all of our marketing channels via: social, digital and print media. You will be working on task like:
Creating social media posts and campaigns for Instagram and Facebook.
Developing email communications.
Maintaining website content.
Planning, creating, and overseeing the design and content for our digital and traditional communication strategies.
Enhancing current marketing initiatives.
Researching other marketing opportunities and strategies.
And of course, providing our two and four-legged patients with exceptional communication, aloha, and C.A.R.E!
About you:

Think that sounds like the kind of challenge you’re up for? Here’s what you’ll bring to the team:
You love animals!
You’re a team-player with a can-do attitude.
You want to make a positive difference in the lives of all of our patients and clients.
You have a friendly, compassionate, and outgoing personality.
You have great written and verbal communication skills.
You have a Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications or a related field.
You preferably have marketing experience.
You preferably have experience working in a veterinarian or health care setting.

Competitive wages

Retirement plan, 401K
Paid time off
Flexible schedule
Personal pet discounts
Seeing adorable animals all day long

Your Mission:

As Scientific Data and Content Director, you will lead the design and creation of data and product-driven scientific content strategy within the streaming MEDS data engineering department.

You'll create, develop, plan, design, write, produce and edit compelling content to support diverse instructional, informational, operational and promotional use cases. You'll conduct interviews with various users and technical staff to gather data for documentation and research and translate technical information into web-based knowledge content for nontechnical and technical users. You may document engineering processes and specifications that conform to company standards and recommend documentation format for technical and customer requirements.

You'll research and understand software products, as well as technical processes
Work with product owners, developers, testers, and other key players to produce content deliverables
Assess content needs and scope deliverables
Determine appropriate content delivery mechanisms based on product goals, usage and audience needs
Translate complex technical concepts into clear, concise, and accurate content under tight deadlines
Create, maintain and update online help, knowledge articles, and other technical documentation with minimal supervision
Participate in multiple projects and meets all target deadlines
Document software interfaces (e.g., API, JSON)
Create content in accordance with Medidata brand standards
Perform audience analysis and develop plans to address their needs in content deliverables
Analyze content usage and feedback and determines areas of improvement
Research and lead implementations of new content creation and management technology for the team
Your Competencies:
Strong facility to translate complex technical topics into clear, concise and compelling prose.
Able to quickly decode, combine, and organize information into meaningful patterns.
Good judgement grounded in a strong ability to use logic and data to evaluate alternatives and recommend solutions to achieve results
Using technology to optimize your own or the team's performance
Prioritizing, planning and organizing work activities, managing several projects at once
Consider the relative costs and benefits when determining topic selection for knowledge spaces and exercise independent judgment around what content should be and shouldn't be included
Experience building and maintaining product knowledge in Knowledge Bases and authoring in Confluence preferred
Having wide-ranging experience, uses professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways
Proficiency in modern content creation and management best practices and technologies
Familiarity with modern software practices and tools
Experience with describing modern micro-service and big data architectures preferred
Experience working in cross-functional teams required
Experience with minimalistic and topic-based authoring preferred
Experience writing for translation preferred
Experience working in modern Agile development environments preferred
Your Education & Experience:
8+ years of technical writing experience documenting software or online systems required
4-year degree in Technical Communication, English, Education or Engineering/Scientific discipline required
Certified Professional Technical Communicator (CPTC) certification preferred
Medidata is making a real difference in the lives of patients everywhere by accelerating critical drug and medical device development, enabling life-saving drugs and medical devices to get to market faster. Our products sit at the convergence of the Technology and Life Sciences industries, one of most exciting areas for global innovation. Nine of the top 10 best-selling drugs in 2017 were developed on the Medidata platform.

Medidata’s solutions have powered over 14,000 clinical trials giving us the largest collection of clinical trial data in the world. With this asset, we pioneer innovative, advanced applications and intelligent data analytics, bringing an unmatched level of quality and efficiency to clinical trials enabling treatments to reach waiting patients sooner.

Job Description
EōS Organization is an Integrated Renewables Company that designs, installs, and maintains energy efficiency and generation projects for commercial and municipal clients internationally.

We are a rapidly growing company and looking to expand our support team. As Marketing Coordinator (MO) your overall goal will be to design, produce and implement the right marketing and PR strategies and will be responsible for providing all marketing materials for the organization. As MO you are responsible for monitoring market trends, creating advertising campaigns, and targeting strategies based on demographic data and working with the company to develop more awareness of what we offer.

You will be able to join our team that plans and coordinates our participation in the UN Global Compact which provides a universal language for corporate responsibility and provides a framework to guide all businesses regardless of size, complexity or location. As well as participating in any philanthropy we participate in.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Evaluate and monitor campaign performance on an ongoing basis by analyzing key metrics and creating reports.
Maintain, update and implement company marketing goals on all Social Media Platforms, Website, Digital Collateral, SEO, Content Marketing and Video Marketing.
Produce a monthly newsletter.
Keep our brand guidelines up to date and reinforce our brand through the company.
Manage relationships with external vendors to ensure high-quality and timely execution of marketing programs, and to ensure competitiveness.
Serves as media liaison.
Helps produce our case studies after jobs are completed.
Help build a podcast platform for the company.
Create, proofread, and edit copy for various marketing channels, ensuring a consistent voice.
Markets services by developing and implementing marketing and advertising campaigns.
Tracks sales data, maintains promotional materials inventory, manages/plans marketing meetings.
Independently coordinate marketing and community events, as needed, including overseeing logistics, managing registrations, coordinating with vendors, creating itineraries, and ordering marketing collateral.
Prepares marketing reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing sales data.
Keeps promotional materials ready, inventorying stock, placing orders, and verifying receipt.
Researches competitive products by identifying and evaluating product characteristics, market share, pricing, and advertising; maintaining research databases.
Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities and reading trade publications.
Accomplishes organizational goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests.
Explores opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
PROFESSIONAL ATTRIBUTES:
Ability to maintain timelines and have exceptional time management skills.
Exceptional communication skills.
Passion for learning.
Ability to think laterally across company departments space concurrently.
Comfortability being a part of a productive team environment.
Attentive and precise - detail-focused.
Critical thinker with strong problem-solving and research proficiencies.

Industry-specific knowledge in all of the following: Adobe Creative suite, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc., and familiar with Wix or other web editing packages.
Creative mind with superb written and verbal communication skills.
Experience in a Marketing position.

Collective Health is changing the face of health insurance. We're crafting tech-forward products to completely reinvent the healthcare experience for our members and employers.

About the role

As a Sales Enablement Associate at Collective Health, you'll develop meaningful, helpful content that will directly impact the growth of our business. You'll flex your talents in content writing, project management, data analysis, and relationship building to empower our sales engine to succeed. You'll live at the intersection between our sales, product marketing, and partnerships teams to ensure clear understanding, prioritization, and alignment around our product offerings and product strategy while also helping to enable the sales organization to be successful in the field through proposal writing and network analysis generation.

The ideal candidate is focused, agile, energetic, driven, and a self-starter with previous experience in sales and sales training/content creation.

What you'll do
Work across the commercial organization to project manage, write, and edit proposals.
Coordinate responses for questionnaires using our internal knowledge database, subject matter experts (SMEs), and our network partners.
Project manage the completion of proposals and quote requests with our internal and external stakeholders, including network partners, for items such as: pricing, analyses, metrics, and written responses.
Serve as the internal process czar within Commercial to promote and iterate internal processes and discipline for product feedback, requests, consistent collateral usage in market, etc.
Assist Product Marketing in training and certifying commercial-facing teams.
Coordinate with Product Marketing to create prospect-facing collateral.
Support deal-specific resource customization.
Routinely update and refresh our knowledge database to ensure we are selling the product well and accurately.
Triage sales questions via saleshelp@ alias.
Your skills include
0-2 years of experience.
Strong project management skills with exceptional attention to detail.
Ability to execute multiple projects and deliverables within tight timelines.
Excellent proofreading, communication, and strategic problem solving skills.
Ability to work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders.
Nice to have
A background in writing and editing
A sales or marketing background
Working knowledge of health plans, employee benefits and health care innovation landscape.
Who you are
A self starter. You're ready for the autonomy that comes with building new things at Collective Health and managing multiple projects at any given moment.
Reliable. You do the things you say you're going to do, with a strong sense of urgency. You are prepared and are always thinking 10 steps ahead, and over-communicate to ensure everyone is on the same page.
Detail oriented. You sweat the details and focus on doing the little things right. It is with this consistency and accuracy that we build a foundation of trust that enables us to achieve excellence.
Team focused. We know that all success is shared and we invest in and root for each other always.
Deeply committed to the Collective Health mission of improving healthcare.
Collective Health is a technology company simplifying employer healthcare to make health insurance work for everyone. With more than 200,000 members and over 45 enterprise clients—including Pinterest, Red Bull, Restoration Hardware, Activision Blizzard, and more—our technical and customer experience teams are reinventing the healthcare experience for forward-thinking employers and their people across the U.S.

Collective Health is headquartered in San Francisco, CA, with additional offices in Chicago, IL, and Lehi, UT. Job Title: Part-Time ESL Teacher / Video Content Creator
Job Description:
Company Description

BlaBla is an online learning platform for native English speakers to teach English to learners in China (aged 12+) online through videos. The company recognizes the fragmented characteristic of language learning. Unlike traditional online tutoring, BlaBla empowers teachers (native English speakers) to create engaging video content for users to learn at their own pace online. BlaBla's mission is to foster a more convenient, fun, and effective educational experience for both teachers and learners. Founded in 2019, the company has established offices and R&D centers in Shanghai, Suzhou, and Silicon Valley. The company adheres to the belief that motivation and incentives are key to successful teaching and learning experiences.

BlaBla aims to deliver an experience similar to that of a full immersion language program that assists learners in building a native or bilingual language proficiency. The company continues to develop outstanding products with features such as speech recognition, scene recognition, user interest profile, and recommendation system using Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning technology. BlaBla believes that AI and machine learning will continue to be the core of quality educational experiences.
Mission: We are providing a platform for teachers and learners to experience convenient, fun, and effective English education.

Company Social Media

Website: bit.ly/3bBvzJW
LinkedIn: linkedin.com/company/blablaapp
Facebook: facebook.com/blabla.video/
YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCT8rDjMUKYFJBgE8wDUTLCw/
Medium: medium.com/blabla


Job Description

If you have been searching for that perfect part-time job online, look no further. During the global pandemic, nothing beats a great opportunity to work from home part-time and make some extra money online! Do you spend hours scrolling through Tiktok, Instagram or other short-form video apps? Are you outgoing and far from camera-shy? Wonder what it's like to teach English online and already have similar experience teaching English as a second language (ESL)? This is your chance to experience the one of a kind online ESL teaching! Click the apply button to potentially become an ESL Teacher / ESL Video Content Creator with BlaBla, the best platform to teach English through online videos.

Once the application is approved, we will invite you to a trial video assessment to create a demo video lesson. If the quality and style of the video match with our requirements, you would be offered to join BlaBla's content creator team as a Part-Time ESL Video Content Creator to teach English to our users with more of your recorded video lessons. Once onboard, you would receive the regular base pay of $15 CAD/hr like the rest of our Part-Time ESL Video Content Creators. We are seeking native English speaking teachers, leaders, entrepreneurs, and anyone with a passion for and experience in ESL teaching to help Chinese users build their English skills with creative pre-recorded video lessons. Sounds like something you would try? Apply now!


Responsibilities

For the trial video assessment, you will:

● Follow our Video Creation Guide to record and upload ONE video lesson to our team for trial assessment:
Link to PDF: https://tinyurl.com/ydeufhcr
Link to Video: https://youtu.be/j2LLWoot1o0

● The DEADLINE to submit the video is 5 days after we receive your resume. Please submit the demo video as soon as possible so we can track your application.

Once offered the role of "Part-Time Video Content Creator", you will:

● Come up with meaningful, educational, and engaging topics for video content. (Ranging from TOEFL and IELTS' oral exam prep to daily conversations, locations, hobbies, and careers. The choice is unlimited).
● Record quality short videos between 15 to 60 seconds. You could do so either with a partner (e.g. Asking and answering IELTS questions) or you can record yourself (e.g. Explain frequent IELTS words or questions).
● Maintain a ratio of 2-3 video uploads per hour spent on video creation, with 2 videos per hour minimum.
● Each video is spoken entirely in English with a clear focus on a specific topic/subject matter.
● Upload recorded videos to and share within/through our app for Chinese ESL learners to absorb and learn.


Qualifications

● Native English speakers
● Excellent written and verbal communication skills
● Highly creative and articulate, able to explain concepts in videos with proper spelling, grammar, verbiage, and tools to effectively deliver a message
● Previous ESL teaching or related teaching experiences preferred
● Strong Familiarity with short-form online video platforms such as TikTok and Instagram
● Passionate about teaching and creating fun, educational, and story-telling videos
● Prior experience in video editing (knowledge of digital video editing, compositing) preferred
● Dedicated, consistent, and committed to posting quality video lessons regularly
● Enjoy the challenge to constantly grow the number of user followers with the video content they created, similar to a social media influencer in the ESL community
● Self-starters and impeccable communicators who think outside of the box
● An active participant in English speaking clubs/organizations/sports preferred
● Interested in digital media and entertainment, communications, business, marketing, social media, sales, and/or project management
● Previous experience or transferable skills in marketing, social media, creative, project and events management, and data analysis
● Strong problem-solvers who are not afraid to ask for help when needed
● Work well within a team and comfortable speaking in front of groups and interacting with new people
● Strong time-management skills and ability to juggle multiple tasks and projects at the same time


Benefits

● Competitive compensation
● Opportunities to increase earnings (fixed hourly pay + up to 40% commission) through more collaborative paid video lessons with BlaBla based on the quality and impact of teaching. The higher the number of followers and positive feedback teachers received, the better the chances for this advancement.
● Opportunities to receive tips from users who find the video lessons created to be of helpful and high quality
● Experience the thrill of an experience similar to a social media influencer (e.g. TikToker, Youtuber): seeing an increasing number of fans and gaining recognition in the field with the videos you shared
● Flexible, collaborative, friendly, and supportive tech start-up working environment
● Chance to be part of an international business community
● Exclusive brand merchandise

Pay Rate

● $15 CAD/hr

Hours of Commitment

● Between 4-6 hours per week on average
● Maintain at least 5 billable hours per month
● At least 1 video creation for the first 10 days since the started date
● More than 50 short video lesson uploads per month preferred
● Maintain a ratio of 2-3 video uploads per hour spent on video creation, with 2 videos uploads per hour minimum


If you feel like you're a good fit, don't hesitate to contact us at hr@blabla.app. We'd love to meet you!

We are seeking a highly-motivated Marketing Coordinator to assist with creating proposals, qualification statements, and general marketing collateral for professional engineering services. This person will work in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment under the direction of senior managers.

10+ years of relevant experience

Ability to write and edit clear, user-friendly technical documents and creative copy.

Superb multi-tasking skills.
Ability to work well as part of a team, handle multiple tasks, and identify and swiftly solve problems.
Self-motivation, confidence, energy, and creativity.
Effective time management skills and good judgment.

Knowledge of A/E/C industry and specifically engineering terminology.
Experience with SF330 and SF254/255 proposals.
Knowledge of Mid-Atlantic DOT procurement requirements.
Benefits:

The Marketing Coordinator plays an integral role in achieving Framework’s ambitious growth marketing goals by managing all administrative functions that support the team. A Key function of this role will be to assist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all the relevant stakeholders and leveraging project management and collaboration platforms.

The ideal candidate is extremely organized and a creative thinker. They will have at least 3 years of experience working in a marketing role (agency experience is a plus), and at least 1 year of hands-on experience as a project coordinator. In addition, she/he will feel comfortable working with multiple teams, internal and external, as well as multiple stakeholders, and under tight deadlines.

This position reports to the Brand Marketing Manager and is based in Boston, MA.

What You’ll Do:
Help us build the systems and processes that will support the marketing operations at Framework
Assist in the definition of project scope and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders
Identify and document project requirements and translate into tasks, develop project schedule and assign tasks
Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects
Schedule and manage project and team meetings, preparing agendas, taking minutes, identifying action items, and follow up within PM and collaboration platforms
Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation
Communicate proactively with project owners regarding possible or current blockers, changes, or conflicts
Report on project status at weekly team stand ups
Assist with market research
Support the maintenance and development of internal tools, including Confluence, Box, Jira, and Slack
What You’ll Bring
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to manage a workload involving multiple activities, tight deadlines, and multiple stakeholders
Empathy and active listening skills
Curiosity and an eagerness to learn new things
An interest in being part of a highly collaborative team
Tenacity and passion for finding out-of-the-box solutions
Experience with project management practices and tools to create, manage, and track project progress
Preferred Qualifications and Experience
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a marketing role, with 1-2 of those years in a project coordinator role
Ability to work well independently and as part of a larger team
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, and Outlook
Experience using project management tools (Jira and Confluence preferred)
Working knowledge of marketing tools, including marketing automation (HubSpot preferred) and Google Analytics
Job Classification

This is a full-time, non-exempt position.

Work Environment and Physical Demands

This job requires the routine use of standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. It requires the ability to speak and hear in person, over the phone, and in settings where there are groups of people. Occasional travel is required, including overnight travel for up to four days at a time and travel via airplane.

What We’ll Offer You / Benefits of Working for Framework

The Framework team is a group of thoughtful, creative, and caring human beings. Our company boasts employees that hail from several different countries and speak a multitude of languages. We are collaborators who value each other’s differences and are committed to bringing our authentic selves to work each day, so that we might design quality products for humans that need them. We offer a suite of benefits designed to support our employees’ thriving in the workplace, including but not limited to:

• Flexible Work Schedules
• Remote Work
• Health Plans Incl. Dental and Vision
• 401(k) Savings Plan
• 11 Paid Holidays Incl. Election Day
• Open Vacation
• 52 Weeks Paid Parental Leave
• Personal and Professional Growth Opportunities
• Opportunity to help build and deliver cutting edge, socially-driven products from scratch!

About the Team

The Marketing Coordinator is a key functional member of Framework's Marketing team. The Marketing team’s mission is to deliver an integrated, omni-channel brand experience that fosters trust and delivers content and messaging that resonates with our customers and aligns their experience with our brand values and promise.

About the Company

Framework is a startup social enterprise built on a simple idea: every homebuyer should have access to unbiased information about the mortgage process and feel knowledgeable about the responsibilities of owning a home. And more—it should be easy and affordable.

We are proudly pro-homeownership and believe it is a uniquely accessible and powerful way for people to build long term financial security. We make it easier for people to do this by providing the tools we believe will lead prospective homebuyers into homes that improve their quality of life, giving them the space to grow into their future, and gain value over time.

From our state-of-the art homebuyer education course that has helped over 700K people into their homes since its inception, to our newest digital homebuyer and homeownership experience—KeepHome—our mission to support homeowners continues to grow every year, and so does our team!

As we leverage the power of technology to strengthen communities one homeowner at a time, the individual contributions of our tight-knit team play a vital, daily role in shaping our products and services. Creative thinking, collaboration, and problem solving are at the core of the Framework culture, and we’re seeking team members with drive and ingenuity to add to the mix.

Come join us!


The position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet Framework’s changing needs, at the sole discretion of management.

Job Description
Overall function is to coordinate the execution of a center’s marketing plan for the purpose of increasing sales, creating awareness and generating traffic.

Assist the Regional Marketing Director and/or the SVP of Marketing in the overall implementation of the annual marketing plan and budget, assist in the promotion of various sales promotions and events, ensure that all marketing materials have accurate information and artwork, and assist in the day to day successful operation of the shopping center. Responsible for the coordination and implementation of promotional programs for a property without a full-time marketing director.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
 Coordinate printed material and advertising for promotions to include quantities and timing.
 Assist with maintaining property website information and training new store managers on how to manage RetailHub.com.
 Assist with monthly reports and organization
 Assist in completing retailer sales calls after major events and Holidays
 Proof marketing collateral and all marketing communications, including memos, marketing scorecards, reports, etc.
 Place in-mall marketing signage and directories
 Perform all other duties as assigned by corporate marketing
 Initiate production requisitions in a timely manner
 Maintain property marketing commitment log, process invoices and monitor monthly financials closely to ensure budget compliance.
 Manage property social media accounts and business Google account with a monthly calendar; prepare analytics reports

Skills & Abilities
 Bachelor's Degree or at least two years of shopping center marketing experience
 Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
 Strong working knowledge of Social Media: Facebook and Instagram and social media analytics
 Effective communication (verbal/written), organizational and interpersonal skills
 Demonstrate effective conflict resolution and customer service skills for interaction with customers, tenants, and co-workers
 Ability to prioritize, coordinate, multi-task, and demonstrate initiative
 Work well independently and as a team member
 Ability to lift up to 25 pounds

Requirements:
 Must be able to work evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed.

Job Description
Finding the right career in this market is tough. Are you looking for stability?

An opportunity for a management position?

Want to work with the top clients in the area?

Welcome to a company that will provide you with a competitive edge!

We are looking for Competitive, Sports-Minded Individuals to fill Marketing Coordinator positions in our marketing and consulting firm. The right person will love the thrill of a challenge and be excited to dive into new things.

All positions start off entry-level as we believe in promoting ONLY from within.

We recognize that we owe much of our success to our people. Our tailored marketing techniques and consulting campaigns allow us to take a much more personal approach to the development of our clients’ brands. As a result, we strive to create unlimited opportunities for individuals to achieve their personal, professional, and financial goals. We do this by encouraging competition, making it easy for individuals engaged in sales and marketing, sharing effective techniques and communicating ideas openly, and by recognizing accomplishments both large and small.

Our philosophy emphasizes the importance of leading by example and having a comprehensive understanding of the entire business model. Our training program provides exposure to all facets of our campaigns as well as an opportunity for leadership and management positions.

We are looking for people with the following attributes:

• Natural leadership ability

• Looking to begin their career

• Able to complete tasks and meet deadlines

• Able to quickly learn and pick up on complex ideas

• Willing to multi-task, jump in and help any campaign

Job Description
VSR Industries has been a world leader for over 50 years in the casino gaming industry, manufacturing high security locks and custom fabricated sheet metal and wood products. Corporate headquarters and manufacturing plants are located in Henderson, NV.

We are seeking an energetic and self-motivated marketing coordinator to join our growing team. If you're an ambitious individual who wants to build a career and an excellent communicator then we want to work with you.

Summary/Objective

Markets products by developing and implementing marketing and advertising campaigns; tracking sales data; maintaining promotional materials inventory; planning meetings and trade shows; maintaining databases; and preparing reports.

Essential Functions

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Markets products by developing and implementing marketing and advertising campaigns.
Tracks sales data; maintains promotional materials inventory, plans meetings and trade shows, maintains databases, and prepares report.
Implements marketing and advertising campaigns by assembling and analyzing sales forecasts; preparing marketing and advertising strategies, plans, and objectives; planning and organizing promotional presentations; and updating calendars.

Prepares marketing reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing sales data.

Plans meetings and trade shows by identifying, assembling, and coordinating requirements, establishing contacts, developing schedules and assignments, and coordinating mailing lists.
Monitors budgets by comparing and analyzing actual results with plans and forecasts.
Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities and reading trade publications.
Accomplishes organization goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests.
Explores opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.
Performs other duties as assigned.

Coordination

Process improvement
Imitative
Planning
Financial skills

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

This job also operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines.

Job Description
Circa Interactive is passionate about establishing a new way of thinking in enrollment marketing. By amplifying a university's unique story, executing data-driven paid advertising campaigns, leveraging innovative technology and working with faculty members to inspire content creation, we connect colleges and universities with the students who will help change our world and push forward big ideas.

There is an incredible demand for this way of thinking in higher education, and we are growing fast. Our clients include some of the top institutions in the U.S. and the world, and we are looking for the best of the best to join our team, teach us new things and help us deliver even more value to our academic partners.

Why We Need You

Since 2011, Circa Interactive has gone above and beyond in providing our partners with the services that will help them meet their goals. This Paid Media Analyst position is responsible for collaborating directly with our partners to develop a strategy that hits their goals across all paid media channels. The new hire should be able to translate that strategy into effective implementation and management of search, social, display and video campaigns. The Paid Media Analyst will work directly with Paid Media Specialists, Partnership Managers, Creative Team Members, Clients and more.

This is a full-time role located in San Diego.

Responsibilities
Have the ability to focus on down funnel performance to ensure we are hitting our lead and student enrollment goals
Craft a omni-channel strategy that focuses on high intent ads and targeting specifically for search (Google and Microsoft)
Develop strategies for social media channels, such as Facebook and LinkedIn, to drive high quality leads
Has knowledge of the best practices for display and video campaigns and how to target users to fill the pipeline
Able to craft a remarketing strategy to re-engages and nurtures users through the enrollment process
Has the ability to review trends and data in the platforms, analytics platforms, CRM data and more to determine optimization opportunities
Requirements
Undergraduate degree, ideally in business or marketing
3-5 years of experience working with digital marketing platforms
Ability to read and interpret data with the goal of identifying trends
Strong communication skills including the ability to simplify our performance metrics, strategies and other components of our campaigns into digestible information
Positive outlook and overall passion towards digital and tech
A passion and desire to try new things, even if it means failing
Google Ads, Microsoft Ads and Facebook Blueprint Certifications are nice to have but not required
Benefits

We offer many benefits!
We offer a great 401k plan and match your contributions up to 4%.
The cost of your health insurance is 50% covered by Township.
The cost of dental insurance is 50% covered by Circa.
We are proud to offer competitive parental leave for when you add a new member to your family.
We go on team-wide retreats about every nine months so we can learn together and have some fun.
Every year we'll give you $1,500 to spend attending industry-relevent conferences or classes.
Our team works on a flexible schedule and we try to limit meetings as much as possible. You can get your work done each day at the time that works best for you.
About Circa Interactive

Through innovative, creative and analytical solutions, our mission is to help higher education institutions achieve their marketing and student enrollment goals as efficiently and effectively as possible. We are committed to preserving brand integrity, amplifying program awareness, building thought leadership and generating high-quality inquiries for our partner institutions.

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Visit circaedu.com to learn more.

You will engage in different types of consulting projects ranging from the formulation and analysis of business, process, and organizational strategies, to the implementation of technology solutions. We’re in the business of making businesses better—people, processes, and systems. We’re an end-to-end technology solutions provider focused on connecting disparate parts within organizations. OpenText experience

Who we are...

Connecting people in a more meaningful way is not just what BombBombs software delivers - its what drives our teams every day. Through simple, personal video, we aim to Rehumanize communication. Our team is resourceful and intelligent. Competitive and collaborative. Fun-loving and tenacious. Were close-knit and love adding new talent to the mix. If you are seeking a dynamic workplace and new challenges, we want to hear from you!

Who we're looking for...

The Senior Content Writer is responsible for creating, editing, and managing quality, professional, and timely content in support of the companys Customer Success initiatives. This individual has ownership of BombBombs Customer Success writing content, processes, and execution. They reside over our knowledge base, community, in-app messaging, post sale nurture campaigns, thought leadership, ticketing tool content, and more. Theyll partner closely with department leaders to create a vision for how CS content channels are used to drive and maintain brand messaging, technical accuracy, and the Voice of BombBomb throughout the customer journey. Doing these things creates clarity, direction, and support for our customers to be successful.

What you will do...
Lead CS content development. Partner with CS Leaders once per month to gather feedback on how we can optimize current and create new content. Develop content within an agreed upon time frame.

Participate in crisis communication/management needs during business or operational incidents as needed.
Develop, influence, and review cross-departmental content where requested, with the ability to evaluate, synthesize and incorporate ideas and feedback from multiple stakeholders. Check all copy for spelling, grammar, diction, consistency, accuracy, etc.
Work with the Product department to develop content for new and existing products and features. Contribute to UX writing, maintain consistency of brand voice throughout all areas.
Create original content meant to influence, inspire, and assist both customers and other entities in the Customer Success/SaaS industry. Create one thought leadership piece each month.
Establish and achieve SMART goals every quarter with your supervisor that yields quantifiable results around building, sustaining, and improving the business and your own personal development. Show progress of every goal in each 1:1.
How you'll do it...

Embody BombBombs core values: Relationships, Fun, Humility, Flexibility and Service

Listening Skills - Lets others speak and seeks to understand their viewpoints
Persuasion - Able to convince others to pursue a course of action
Attention to detail - Does not let important details slip through the cracks or derail a project.
Strategic thinking/visioning - Able to see and communicate the big picture in an inspiring way.
Intelligence - Learns quickly. Demonstrates ability to quickly and proficiently understand and absorb new information.
Teamwork - Reaches out to peers and cooperates with supervisors to establish an overall collaborative working relationship.
Enthusiasm - Exhibits passion and excitement over work. Has a can-do attitude.
Our ideal candidate will be or have...
3-5 years of professional writing experience
Familiarity with help center tools, such as Zendesk or other CRMs
Ability to partner cross functionally with internal teams
Proven track record crafting voice and tone
Immaculate attention to detail
Ability to successfully plan, organize, implement and monitor projects simultaneously to meet project deadlines
Excellent communication skills with outstanding proficiency in grammatical, writing and editorial capabilities
NOTE: Please supply a link with prior writing samples with your application in the 'Portfolio' section

Company Description

Kinetica helps many of the world’s largest companies solve some of the world’s most complex problems, including Citibank, GSK, OVO, Softbank, and Telkomsel, among others. The Kinetica Active Analytics Platform combines streaming and historical data with location intelligence and machine learning-powered analytics. Organizations across automotive, energy, telecommunications, retail, healthcare, financial services, and beyond leverage the platform’s GPU-accelerated computing power to build custom analytical applications that deliver immediate, dynamic insight. Kinetica has a rich partner ecosystem, including Dell, HP, IBM, NVIDIA, and Oracle, and is privately held, backed by leading global venture capital firms Canvas Ventures, Citi Ventures, GreatPoint Ventures, and Meritech Capital Partners.

Join Kinetica and help us change the way people interact with our world.

Job Description

Kinetica is looking for an accomplished sales enablement professional to add to our growing team. This person will be responsible for developing and managing sales enablement at Kinetica. Kinetica is doubling annual revenue year-over-year, and our enterprise customer list is growing at a steady across all markets globally. We are seeking proven sales enablement leaders who can own training, onboarding, content management, and strategy for our sales department.

As the Sales Enablement Manager you will be focused on core sales systems, processes, tools and enablement. Helping to empower the reps to increase velocity, shaping our systems to meet the needs of the business, and building the necessary infrastructure for a global sales organization. You will partner with our sales team to improve critical processes, develop a strategy for sales team training and content while also partnering with sales leadership, sales operations, product, and marketing to drive strategy execution.

Role and Responsibilities
Partner with sales leadership to uncover business needs, and design training solutions to address these needs, then launch and measure the success of those solutions
Manage cross-functional efforts that impact the sales team while effectively executing against defined plans
Design and develop Sales Enablement solutions across a variety of mediums (i.e. classroom, virtual, elearnings, content, coaching, video, on the job support, etc.) to improve the way we sell into various markets
Measure the impact of Enablement solutions and make changes if needed
Develop new hire onboarding programs that decrease ramp time of incoming reps
Design and optimize programs like GTM Kickoff and certification programs to improve business performance.
Support bespoke content creation for proposals and executive presentations
Become the expert on the Kinetica Sales Tool stack - work to optimize our CRM, email marketing, sales engagement, communication, and messaging
Qualifications

Qualifications
3-5 years experience in either outbound marketing or sales enablement
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience with Salesforce, Marketing Automation, or Sales Engagement tools
Experience with Excel and PowerPoint, Google Apps (Adobe PDF design experience is a huge plus!)
Excel in executing, establishing priorities, and meeting swift deadlines in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment
Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

We are committed to building a diverse team and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds.

Job Title: Manager - Digital Media Supply Chain - NY
Job Description:
About You
I am passionate about digital supply chain, and making the entire process of digital content creation through management and distribution more efficient and streamlined.
I am thoroughly organized, have exemplary attention to detail, and demonstrate strong analytical, presentation, and communication skills.
I am consultative in nature and have a passion for and experience in helping my clients to succeed.
I love to manage people, timelines, tasks, issues and risks. I am an expert at motivating my team to have fun, learn more, and deliver.
I am an industrious team-player; I’m not afraid to roll up my sleeves and work diligently on any task.
I can identify project opportunities and make recommendations for new work based on my thorough knowledge of client needs.
I bring an innovative spirit and a superior work ethic to every engagement.

Job Description
As an OnPrem Project Manager, you will dive deep into the client business, working alongside a project team of other analysts, consultants and/or senior consultants. You will engage in different types of consulting projects ranging from the formulation and analysis of business, process, and organizational strategies, to the implementation of technology solutions. The methodologies will range depending on client preference. Facilitating sessions with client executives, you will identify risks and provide mitigation strategies, conduct deliverable reviews and give feedback, and lead your team through hands-on example. Our managers build and maintain strong client relationships while identifying opportunities beyond her or his current engagement, help mentor and develop exceptional talent within our firm, and contribute to other growth areas such as recruiting, strategy, and/or methodology enhancement.

Our consultants work at our client sites. As with all consultants, you should be willing to travel on occasion for work. We work in a number of fields, but have a primary focus on the Media & Entertainment industry.

About Us
We’re in the business of making businesses better—people, processes, and systems. We’re an end-to-end technology solutions provider focused on connecting disparate parts within organizations. We bring a balance of IQ and EQ to every engagement, and a depth of business and technical acumen to every problem. We are a team that is driven by following through for our clients, and being upfront, honest and sincere.
Requirements
5-7+ years System Implementation, SDLC, Integration, and Project Management experience
3+ years in consulting / professional services, big firm experience preferred
5+ years experience managing the full implementation lifecycle (analysis, design, develop, test, deploy, support) for Digital Media Supply Chain, including Digital Asset Management systems or other digital media delivery solutions
Experience managing storage and network solutions to support large file distribution, and experience with localization use cases
Knowledge of numerous file formats and codecs with a focus on video
Ability to collaborate with subject matter experts, cross-functional resources and business stakeholders to understand and document business requirements
Experience in project planning, including building and managing to project plans, budgeting, resource allocation, and reporting status to clients and internal teams
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, information systems, computer science, business administration or other related fields
Experience in any Digital Asset Management systems, including but not limited to: OpenText Media Management (OTMM), Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), MediaBeacon, Adam Systems, Nuxeo
Preferred
Experience in Media & Entertainment/Broadcast and/or Consumer Products industries
Experience at a large consulting firm (e.g., Accenture, Deloitte, EY, CapGemini, PWC)
Agile or Scrum Experience
Life at OnPrem
We were founded on a culture of collaboration and inclusiveness, and this permeates each of our initiatives, both client-facing and internal. We offer a wide selection of benefits including medical, dental & vision, 401k matching and flexible vacation; we sponsor trainings to advance our teams’ skill sets; we prioritize our employees’ professional growth paths. Currently 200+ people strong in four geographic territories, we’ve been recognized as a “Best Place to Work,” a “Great Place to Work,” “Fastest Growing,” and “A Jewel.”

Visa Status
Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

Equal Employment Opportunity
OnPrem Solution Partners ensures equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Company Overview

WhiteOwl provides ERP and CRM consulting services, as well as cloud computing services, to growing businesses and non-profits. Our services include business process consulting, application (ERP, CRM, etc.) implementation, custom software, cloud and virtualization services, managed and virtual CIO services, and business continuity and security consulting.

WhiteOwl is also the developer and implementer of PaperSave®, a cloud-based document management, workflow, and transaction automation software product. In addition, we are resellers and partners for Microsoft, Intacct, and Blackbaud technologies.

Based in South Florida, we were founded in 1997, and have over 1,000 clients throughout the United States and internationally. WhiteOwl is the technology affiliate of MBAF, a top-40 CPA and consulting firm. To learn more about WhiteOwl, visit https://www.gowhiteowl.com/.

Our Culture

We collaborate with one another and are fast paced! We are committed to our clients, and, at the same time, we are committed to making ourselves and each other better.

We attend sporting events which include baseball, basketball, football, and hockey for our local teams. We get together for "Happy Hour, wear our WhiteOwl shirts for bowling nights, and have internal clubs and leadership groups.

We are good community citizens with a strong desire to give back. We are heavily involved in various non-profit initiatives which include beach clean-ups, Feeding South Florida, the Back to School Drive, amongst others. Our Holiday parties are the talk of the town; every year tops the year before!

We believe in developing and mentoring our employees for, frankly, selfish reasons. We want you to stay! Therefore, we invest in you by tapping into your growth potential. The sky is the limit at WhiteOwl!

Position Summary

Our PaperSave® professional services organization, a part of WhiteOwl and the MBAF accounting firm, delivers document management and workflow solutions to small and medium sized North American and international businesses and foundations.

Position Summary

The Marketing Coordinator assists in planning and executes marketing programs and activities that are in line with the larger goals of WhiteOwl with a strong focus on generating and nurturing sales leads. Working with the director of marketing and key executives, the coordinator will establish realistic and attainable goals for each program/initiative. The marketing coordinator works with all departments of WhiteOwl to build internal relationships, ensuring all sales and marketing needs are addressed.

Responsibilities
Works together with and provides support to sales and marketing as necessary including the development, review, and enhancement of all firm collateral materials, including brochures, presentations, and other sales/marketing resources including proposal development support
Plans and execute all email marketing campaigns including newsletters, alerts, and lead generation/nurturing campaigns
Works with outsourced vendors to create all content including blogs, whitepapers, videos, case studies, etc.
Coordinates website maintenance and updates; manages relationship with vendor
Organizes and coordinates cross-selling initiatives with MBAF
Coordinates all aspects of client-related events including learning events, live demos, webinars, etc.
Collaborates, plans, and executes all tradeshow events may include travel
Assist in social media strategy and execution
Works with affiliates cross-functional marketing team to help coordinate/execute marketing initiatives
Performs other duties and special projects, as assigned
Qualifications and Requirements
Bachelors degree in marketing, or business degree, required
Two to Three (23) years marketing experience, preferred
Knowledge in Adobe Suite, preferred
Knowledge of digital/email marketing, Marketing Automation (Act-On) and CRM (Microsoft Dynamics) is a plus
Knowledge of Social Media platforms such as Hootsuite is a plus
Excellent writing skills; critical-thinker; team-oriented; detailed; multi-tasker
High initiative and aptitude to work with minimal supervision
Ability to manage multiple priorities
Strong judgment, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities
Strong MS Office, Outlook, PowerPoint and knowledge of HTML
