ABOUT DHAR MANN STUDIOS:

Dhar Mann Studios creates viral video content that connects the world through storytelling. These short, motivational videos focused on life, business, and relationships receive over 1 Billion views monthly and have garnered over 6 Billion views on Facebook, YouTube and Instagram. The team is led by Dhar Mann, a seasoned entrepreneur with a global audience of over 20 Million social media followers and currently the highest viewed inspirational content creator in the world. These compelling stories depict real life situations shown by actors that teach important life lessons, inspired by Dhar's personal experience of success and failure. The company is driven by one founding principle: We’re not just telling stories, we’re changing lives.

BIG PICTURE:

We are searching for a full-time video Editor to help us create short cinematic viral videos! We have an awesome team of screenwriters, casting associates, directors and shooters so this role would require performing all the technical aspects of editing a film. This includes color grading and audio adjusting. The ideal candidate has strong experience with editing narrative films and knows how to build emotion, create tension and increase the overall entertainment value of each film with little or no direction. This position often requires working long hours including nights and weekends. Since we are a mission-led company and all of the content we create inspires people, the right candidate will find the long hours to be exciting and highly satisfying!

HOW YOU’LL SPEND YOUR TIME:
Editing in a creative way to help build emotion, increase tension and deliver greater payoff of the message for the audience
Working with Davinci Resolve to provide high quality color grading to enhance the film quality
Adjusting audio to provide the best quality possible
Adding subtitles and branding to all videos and ensuring all final files are complete and organized
WHAT YOU HAVE:
3 Years experience editing short form video content with narrative structure
High level experience with editing narrative work. (personal or professional)
Experience in the Adobe Creative Suite including Premiere, Photoshop, After Effects, etc.
High level experience with After Effects and color correcting/grading with DaVinci Resolve
Demonstrated video editing ability with a strong portfolio
Ability to work in a fast paced environment on a wide variety of projects
Ability to learn quickly and is a team player
Skilled in handling quick output without losing quality
Experience with Adobe Audition, and working with audio files to get acceptable audio
WHO OVERSEES YOU:

The Editor reports directly to the Editing Manager

WHO YOU OVERSEE:

Currently, the Editor has no personnel reporting directly to him or her

WHERE IT ALL GOES DOWN:

This is a remote role with the opportunity to work from a home office

WHEN THE MAGIC HAPPENS:

This is a 1099 Consultant role that will be around 20 hours a week with the potential to evolve into a full time position if all goes well

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US:
We've kept our hiring bar really high - you will work with the best
You will be paid $25-$35 per hour, based on experience
WHEN WE’LL TALK ABOUT HOW AWESOME YOU ARE:

No formal cover letters, please. Instead, provide the following:
A few short paragraphs explaining why you’d be a good fit for this particular position
Links to any content or channels that you have created/edited
Your resume
AN IMPORTANT NOTE BEFORE APPLYING TO US:

All of Dhar Mann Studios' new hires will begin at the associate level, regardless of what position was applied for. Our organization looks to hire the BEST of the best and we focus on finding candidates who are a strong cultural fit. We have a 3 month 'Discovery Period' in place that allows us to get to know each new hire better and assess their skill set. If you are applying for a management level position, you will be part of a different Discovery Period for each step of the ladder.

*** Disclaimer***

This information is not for use by any unauthorized person/ site and is only to be posted by Dhar Mann Studio’s affiliates.

At VillageMD, we are committed to helping patients achieve greater health by delivering the most accessible and efficient healthcare in the world through partnership with primary care physicians. We're in a unique position to impact everyone in primary care from independent, family-owned practices to world-class health systems. Integral to our Enterprise Technology team, the Asset Manager will be the owner of our Asset Lifecycle Management program and associated processes, standards, methods and tools.

What are some examples of projects you will be leading as an IT Asset Manager at VillageMD?
Design and execute asset management policies and procedures.
Develop asset control processes to monitor accountability identification, maintenance, location and contracts.
Implement tools and controls to discover, manage and maintain asset information.
What will make you successful here?
Highly organized approach to managing day to day tasks, communication, reporting, content creation and compliance improvement
Ability to breakup large objectives in smaller achievable chunks to make incremental progress
A low ego and humility; an ability to gain trust through strong communication and doing what you say you will do
What you might do in your first year:
Help us leverage modern Asset Management program to improve Employee Experience.
Define audit compliance processes and reporting needed, and ensure compliance for the IT assets.
Drive process improvements through collaboration, best practices and automation.
Manage asset reconciliation and asset disposal agreements.
Support IT end-of-life and vulnerability management reporting and remediation planning.
Support reporting and metrics dashboards on Asset Management.
Respond to requests from end users, managers, developers, audit, regulators and team members for specific IT Asset Management data information.
Monitor software licenses to ensure they comply with license agreements and usage standards.
Prepare and manage IT asset capital and expense budgets.
The following experience is relevant to us:
Solid understanding of ITAM, ITIL Framework and Lean IT concepts.
Experience with application and hardware relationship mapping.
Experience with CMDB technologies and processes.
Advanced skills with Microsoft Office Suite applications, ITSM Platforms (Jira, Cherwell) and IT asset auto-discovery tools and methods
Experience working in healthcare industry-regulated environments
At VillageMD, we see diversity and inclusion as a source of strength in transforming healthcare. We believe building trust and innovation are best achieved through diverse perspectives. More information about Interlochen Center for the Arts:

A global destination for artists and arts enthusiasts, Interlochen Center for the Arts nurtures creativity through five dynamic platforms: Interlochen Arts Camp, the renowned summer arts program; Interlochen Arts Academy, the nation’s premier fine arts boarding high school; Interlochen Presents, a producer of more than 600 annual performances by internationally celebrated guest artists, Interlochen students, and faculty; Interlochen Public Radio, two listener-supported, 24-hour public radio stations (classical music and news); and Interlochen College of Creative Arts, a convener for lifelong learning in the arts.

Since 1928, Interlochen’s mission to inspire people worldwide through excellence in the arts and education has produced generations of purposeful creative lives. For more information, visit interlochen.org. Follow Interlochen on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and YouTube at @interlochenarts

Job Title: Digital Marketing Manager in Charlotte, NC at Healthstat, Inc.
Job Description:
Job Description

Position Description:

As a Digital Marketing Manager at Healthstat, you will join our in-house marketing team and help support our mission and vision through digital communication for internal, B2B & B2C audiences. Our ideal candidate is a proactive individual with well-developed critical thinking skills. Someone who can process and solve problems as quickly as they arise. Your daily work can range widely from email marketing to content creation to developing comprehensive digital strategies. To find success in this role, you should possess a can-do attitude and the drive to back it up. You should also hold in-depth experience and proven skill in deploying comprehensive digital marketing plans. Ultimately, you will help support Healthstat by effectively increasing awareness, driving acquisition, and optimizing conversions.

Responsibilities

Functional:
Develop and implement effective email marketing strategies including contact strategy, segmentation/targeting, ongoing testing and content creation to drive sales and brand loyalty.
Develops, implements and manages integrated marketing campaigns that promote Healthstat and its products and services through digital channels to drive website traffic, leads, and sales.
Develops copy for email campaigns, social media posts scheduled within Pardot, and website transaction pages and calls-to-action.
Follow digital marketing strategy guidance and instruction to help ensure a cohesive digital consumer journey
Establish proper tracking mechanisms to measure the effectiveness of the strategy using Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, UTM tracking, etc. Track and report on KPIs
Stay up-to-date with digital marketing trends and benchmarks to help evolve our digital strategies.
Manage multiple projects from concept through completion under tight deadlines.
Work independently while maintaining excellent ongoing status communication.
Partner with leaders in other departments to understand business objectives and provide design solutions.

Job Requirements


Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing or related field.
5-plus years’ experience developing comprehensive, integrated digital strategies with a desired focus in healthcare.
Demonstrated skill in the areas of marketing automation (Pardot preferred)
Strong copywriting skills.
High-level knowledge of content marketing and B2B lead generation.
Computer savvy:
Microsoft Office suite: Excel, PowerPoint, Word, etc.
Google Analytics
Working understanding of HTML and CSS
Department project management and communication tools – Asana, Slack, GoToWebinar
Strong communication skills and ability to work with vendors, internal team members, and cross-functional teams
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure while maintaining quality.

Job Title: Transition Plus Association- Business Development and Marketing Coordinator
Job Description:
Transition Plus Program Objectives: We enable transitioning military to heal and learn a new career, reintegrating into rural America. Transition Plus is creating an Aeroponic Tower Farm and Education Center in Summerfield, KS. OUr administrative headquarters is in Leawood, KS. Sustainable agriculture and economic growth are essential to national security, and we’re proud to help prepare veterans for these important job opportunities.

Goal of the Project: The Business Development & Sustainability VISTA member will work with the Board of Directors to build our organizational, administrative, and financial capacity by developing and strengthening business practices to enhance business development, capacity building through grant writing & donor retention, nonprofit partnerships, and marketing to better serve
transitioning veterans and our rural communities.

This VISTA member will impact poverty by helping transitioning veterans avoid alcoholism, homelessness and thoughts of suicide. At the same time, this program assists the rural community with much needed economic growth and the region will have access to locally
grown healthy food & healthy living programs year-round. As a result of the VISTA member’s service, Transition Plus business practices, capacity and capabilities will be enhanced, marketing plans will be more effective, the Tower Farm facility will be production-ready, year 1 staffing in place and trained, and funding for years 1-3 identified.

First Objective:
Assess and improve the business plan utilized by Transition Plus for the Summerfield Tower Farm and Education Center and create or revise organization staffing plans, sales, marketing and distribution projections to improve effectiveness and sustainability.
Member Activities:
1. The VISTA member will improve capacity for the association through marketing
activities that will likely include social media and other means of communication –
externally and internally
a. Online & Social media presence (Google, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, etc)
b. Brochures, Presentations, E-newsletters and other Communications
2. Assist the association President in marketing all essential areas:
a. Attracting active military and veterans into our programs (open to civilians too)
b. Developing community support with donors, foundations, & customers
c. Marketing Tower Farm & Education Center offerings
i. produce to retail & wholesale customers
ii. beekeeping
iii. entrepreneurship (e.g. network marketing, grocery store, trades)
3. Assist the association Board with business administration (e.g. state and federal
reporting, taxes, SAMS and D&B updates, insurance, banking)

Second Objective:
Assess and improve the current capital project plan and operations plan to establish the Summerfield Tower Farm and Education Center facility GOAL: improve effectiveness and sustainability
Member Activities:
1. Recommend utilization of funds raised through KS Tax Credits and other sources
reserved for establishing the Tower Farm and Education Center in Summerfield
2. Research and recommend cost savings
Objective of the Assignment (06/01/2020 – 05/31/2021)
Assess volunteer & employee recruitment and training plans used to operate the Tower Farm
in Summerfield GOAL: improve effectiveness and sustainability.
Member Activities:
1. Evaluate staffing objectives and assist in developing or revising job descriptions and
recruiting plans for (primarily Veterans) employees, volunteers, trainees & students.
2. Assist in staff and employee recruitment and development.
3. Assist in creation of the Tower Farmer training package encompassing
entrepreneurship, tower farm aeroponics, and market-driven growing and
distribution.

Third Objective:
Assist with the ongoing fundraising program for Transition Plus emphasizing immediate needs for Summerfield Tower Farm and Education Center
Member Activities:
1. Assist the Board in Fundraising campaigns and donor support
2. Assist the Board with donation tracking and appropriate utilization
3. Identify and develop competitive applications for appropriate funding opportunities
including grants and private investments.
4. Other duties as assigned by either the President, Secretary or Treasurer.

Fourth Objective:
Assist with community outreach & partnerships with the rural community, community
organizations, local businesses, and public education institutions to increase knowledge of the
Summerfield Tower Farm and Education Center.
Member Activities:
1. Develop informational marketing materials used in the ongoing campaign
2. Assist with monthly outreach meetings with community organizations, local
businesses, and public education institutions to increase awareness of the
Summerfield Tower Farm an Education Center.

Required Skills:
Excellent written and oral communication skills; the ability to develop different products for different audiences
Nonprofit or business management experience, grant-writing and fundraising experience
An interest in serving veterans/enhancing economic opportunities in rural America
Social media marketing
Marketing
The ability to identify funding opportunities
Community outreach
Experience recruiting participants for nonprofit programs a plus

Please note that VISTA positions are volunteer positions, although a living wage stipend and relocation stipend are provided by the program at a pre-determined rate based on the location of the service project. Upon succesful completion of the year of service, the VISTA member is eligible for an education award or an additional cash stipend. The VISTA internship begins 6/01/2020 and ends 5/31/2021. Work will begin remotely due to COVID-19.

Donnelley Financial Solutions (DFIN) is a leader in risk and compliance solutions, providing insightful technology, industry expertise and data insights to clients across the globe. We’re here to help you make smarter decisions with insightful technology, industry expertise and data insights at every stage of your business and investment lifecycles. As markets fluctuate, regulations evolve and technology advances, we’re there. And through it all, we deliver confidence with the right solutions in moments that matter.
DFIN ActiveDisclosure℠ is a financial reporting solution specifically designed for companies that rely on the Microsoft Office® productivity suite to draft, collaborate and finalize SEC disclosures. ActiveDisclosure helps streamline content creation, review and distribution improving efficiency, governance and the overall quality of all financial reports. The ActiveDisclosure Account Manager at RR Donnelley is a member of the sales delivery team for the ActiveDisclosure product line. Generally, this role is responsible for managing a pipeline of sales opportunities, supporting Regional Managing Directors, field Sales Executives and Deal Managers with prospect engagement, and utilizing teams to deliver client wins.
Responsibilities
• Build and maintain a strong understanding of the product and services associated with the ActiveDisclosure product line.
• Develop and maintain relationships with sales delivery team members including Regional Managing Directors, field Sales Executives, and Deal Managers within your territory
• Prospect and qualify sales leads, coordinating as required with the DFIN field sales team
• Manage and track sales opportunities and forecasts within Salesforce.com, providing reports to the Director of Sales as requested
• Manage a complex sales cycle, starting with the needs assessment process for each prospect, identifying pain points and determining the fit for our solutions
• Identify various buying roles within each prospect account and develop a suitable sales execution plan
• Educate prospects on the value of an ActiveDisclosure solution and how it addresses their needs
• Engage the Solutions Engineer at the appropriate stage of the sales cycle to tailor more detailed solutions presentations and/or software demonstrations
• As needed, engage the Implementation team at the appropriate stage of the sales cycle to assess technical needs and prepare an implementation plan
• Prepare and deliver sales quotes to the prospect
• Work with Sales Executives to successfully close opportunities
• Coordinate with the Post-Sale and Services team to hand off new clients
Qualifications
• Proven ability to sell enterprise software licensing and/or projects in the $50-500k range with yearly results of $2M or greater.
• Ability to prospect, develop and close software opportunities
• Thorough understanding of the enterprise software needs of finance and compliance teams
• General understanding of the financial and/or regulatory disclosure process
• Strong verbal and written communication skills with a focus on negotiation, needs analysis, positioning, business justification, and closing techniques
• Superior presentation skills
• A broad understanding of the financial close process and the SEC filing process
• An in-depth understanding of the technology used by public companies for external reporting
• 4 - 6 years of quota carrying, technology based sales experience
• Proven track record of B2B solution selling with demonstrated ability to sell to all levels of management up to, and including, the C-suite
• Experience in meeting and exceeding quotas or annual sales targets of at least $2M
• Experience tracking a sales pipeline using sales automation software (Salesforce.com preferred)
• CPA highly desired but not required

Job Description
Digital Marketing Manager - Covington

The Digital Marketing Manager develops and implements the Company Brand Strategy across all digital channels (email marketing, digital advertising, social media, paid search, affiliates, etc). This position is responsible for growing the agency by developing and managing the marketing team, ensuring timely execution of strategies that drive qualified lead generation, and using KPIs to understand results and set marketing goals.

Responsibilities
Take ownership of all company marketing process; maintain current documentation of all processes and suggest improvements and updates as often as needed
Work closely with the CEO & PMO to transform visionary marketing strategies into working processes and executable projects
Define and manage the Canopy brand to engage and retain ideal clients
Produce marketing and promotional materials and ensure that they are consistently reviewed and up-to-date
Provide leadership and management during weekly meetings with the Social Proof team
Ensure high-level and consistent follow-up between copywriting, graphic design, ad management, & social media for cohesive strategy & quick execution
Implement internal marketing programs to keep other departments aligned with marketing initiatives
Support leadership growth strategies by delivering and executing on campaigns at an extremely fast pace, including email marketing campaigns and lists, monthly marketing and content calendars, website and SEO audience growth, strategic PR relationships and more
All Canopy managers must also:
Regularly measure and report on department performance to upper management
Set goals and objectives, report on progress and provide solutions at weekly, monthly and quarterly strategic planning meetings
Develop and manage marketing team, from hiring requests to terminations
Develop and maintain departmental and project budgets and P&L statements
Build and maintain critical relationships with vendors, agencies and contractors
Results
Consistent and predictable qualified lead generation that meets company goals
Marketing projects and initiatives are executed on time and on budget
Marketing metrics, including ROAS and department profit margin, show constant improvement over time
Average lead account size increases to meet Canopy goals and projections
Systems in place to manage all areas of the marketing department, including budgeting, performance reporting, department growth, internal communications and brand development
Requirements
3+ years of digital marketing experience
Agency experience is a plus!
Advanced skills in content creation including graphic design, copywriting, video production and editing, etc
Advanced knowledge of social media marketing, paid and organic advertising
Proficient in funnel marketing strategies
Excellent communicator and relationship manager
Proven track record of delegating work while maintaining excellent results
Expert at time management and self-directed success, focused on results
Access to a high-speed internet connection

A Few Signs That The Job Isn't Right for You
Can’t someone else do that?”, “That’s not my responsibility”, and “Why does this depend on me?” are routine parts of your inner dialogue.
You’ve said, “The deadline is tomorrow, but it’s 6:00 PM so it’ll have to wait” and meant it.
You assess someone who lets a deadline slip because they’re working 70 hours per week serving clients as just “not having it all together.”
You often ask questions of others that can be answered with a brief Google search, phone call, or record check.
You believe file versioning and naming conventions are a stupid waste of time.
You think it’s unreasonable when stakeholders expect you to provide information that will give them assurance that tasks are being completed appropriately.
If you don’t know what to do next, you wait. And wait.
You’re more worried about what people think of you than the quality of the outcome you produce.
You resent ambiguous or unstructured situations and require perfect clarity at all times to be happy at work.
Changes to plan, multiple revisions, and new assignments that pop up unexpectedly are unacceptable to you.
You are comfortable letting team members down.
About Equity Methods

Equity Methods is a finance, accounting, and human capital consulting firm that embraces the synergistic role of technology and expertise in creating client impact. We deliver impact-rich services across three core practice groups: financial reporting, valuation services, and HR advisory.

With over 80 professionals and experience serving hundreds of publicly traded clients (including 35 Fortune 100 companies), Equity Methods seeks to combine the best of a large professional services firm with the best of an entrepreneurial, technology-enabled company. We work hard in the quest to have high impact and deliver exemplary client service that supports our client retention and overall growth story. We have consistently been rated a Top Company to Work for in Arizona.

Job Description
The Rundown:

As a Marketing Coordinator you will focus on reaching our current running community and new running and fitness communities in our surrounding area. This position assists the Marketing Manager to drive customers into the store, reach sales goals and acquire and retain customers. You will focus on grassroots marketing efforts, social media marketing, email marketing, outreach events and expos, building and maintaining race partnerships, along with the coordination of packet pickups and race support. This position allows you to work closely with Store Management, the Retail Experience Team, the Running Club Team and the community. Joining Fleet Feet is joining a team and a community that ignites and promotes running and fitness. We pride ourselves on putting people first and know that what we do each day does not happen anywhere else, for staff or customers. We truly believe that running changes everything.

Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and deadline drive
Collaborative and customer-centric
Willing to go above and beyond when needed
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to lead and direct others
Action oriented, level-headed, and consistent
Communicate professionally with customers and team
Support all Fleet Feet initiatives, activities, and functions

High energy and fun atmosphere
Training and advancement opportunities within the Fleet Feet brand
Community involvement and community service activities
Training Program, Race entries, and Product discounts
Passionate team members

Job Description:
H+K is a communications agency, always in beta and always changing. We are the first and only large agency to structure itself around sectors to deliver deep industry knowledge, supported by specialist areas of ideas and strategy, content creation and publishing. Everyone in our agency is expected to constantly evolve, reinvent their skills and set a new standard in the industry for their role.

We currently have an opening on our NYC team for a for an experienced Health PR Account Manager with expertise in pharma.

Take your career to the next level with a global network of energized experts, working across a diverse roster of pharmaceutical and provider clients. Sensitive to the needs of professionals, patients, policymakers and advocates alike, our seasoned specialists have a proven track record of motivating health professional referrals, inspiring consumer understanding of health messaging, and driving business results in both traditional and digital channels.

Hill+Knowlton Strategies is creating a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone belongs. As a company and as co-workers, we are building a workplace where everyone can reach their full potential. We are an inclusive employer and are happy to consider flexible working arrangements.

6-9 years of PR agency experience or combination of agency + in-house with focus on pharmaceutical communications
High level media relations strategy and execution experience with relevant contacts
Proven trusted client adviser: an active listener who builds strong partnerships and confidently offers counsel
Strategic thinker: understands our clients’ business and communications challenges and develop smart, insight-driven strategies to overcome those challenge
Creative spark: brings a fresh perspective to our clients and develops ideas that challenge conventions
Growth mindset: actively seeks opportunities for organic growth; proactively seeks new business leads and has a history of leading and winning pitches
Operationally savvy: experience effectively managing multiple client budgets
People-centric: committed to the development of jr. level team members through active coaching and mentoring

Incorporate and coordinate use of video in communications

Work with Department Heads and Managers to develop effective ad campaigns
Create, revise, review and/or approve copy
Obtain proposals and cost estimates for campaigns and buy media
Measure ad effectiveness and optimize as needed

Provide creative and art direction, graphic design, copywriting, editing and production for exhibits as needed
Research, design and produce promotional materials
Design and produce signage in various mediums
General
Maintain MAC computers; system and software updates and backups
Manage and distribute digital assets (images, graphics, pdfs)
Job Qualifications:
Minimum of 5 years experience in marketing, communications, public relations, fundraising, or related field required
Bachelors degree in marketing, communications, advertising or related field strongly preferred
Expert level technology skills including use of Mac and Windows operating systems, Adobe Creative Suite and various web design applications
Access to and experience with photography equipment strongly preferred

Excellent visual design and layout skills

Ability to handle sensitive, highly confidential information with utmost tact and discretion
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously establishing priorities appropriately
Physical and Mental Abilities:

The Marketing Coordinator must have the physical and mental abilities to perform the essential job duties listed above. However, reasonable accommodation may be extended to help perform those duties. The job entails long periods of sitting at a desk. There may be prolonged periods of computer work. Occasional regional travel within Vermont. While performing the essential duties of this job the Marketing and Communications Project Manager may have to use hands and fingers, walk, stand, reach, or lift up to 25 pounds.

Champlain Housing Trust is a non-profit, member-based organization. The work entails significant self motivation. Occasional travel to meetings and seminars may be required.

Sandata Technologies is the leading supplier of technology solutions for the national Homecare industry. Sandata is uniquely positioned as a software technology vendor serving both Payers and Providers in this growing segment of the healthcare market. Sandata s solutions provide a strong Value Proposition for our clients, including compliance, transparency, efficiency, and cost savings. The Sandata solution has been implemented by thousands of homecare agencies nationwide, is leveraged by national MCOs, and has been selected by numerous state Medicaid agencies to ensure their compliance with the federal mandate to implement Electronic Visit Verification (EVV). The company has a national footprint, and is one of the largest technology vendors for the Medicaid homecare industry.

The company is experiencing significant growth, and is now looking for a Marketing Coordinator to support that growth. In this role you will interface and support the sales teams in the organization. The key responsibilities of the role include creating high quality presentations, documentation, campaigns, mailers, and webinar events for our external facing clients. In addition, manage our CRM system, Social Media Channels, plan trade show events, and develop content for releases and blogs. This role reports directly to the SVP of Provider Sales.

Press releases (PR newswire)

Company Description

Diamond Kinetics (diamondkinetics.com) is a growing sports-tech company focused in baseball and softball. As the market leader in the space, Diamond Kinetics combines motion-based-sensors with mobile applications and a robust digital platform to provide hitting and throwing data to players, parents, coaches, and teams – helping them understand their performance, improve, and have more fun playing the game they love. DK solutions enable player development, superior equipment fitting, objective scouting, and engagement-driven entertainment.

We are a fast-paced, performance-driven company where responsibility comes quickly, and exceeding expectations is the expectation. The work is challenging and exciting, especially for those who love sports. We believe in stretching for growth as a company, and as professionals, and seek competitive, self-motivated people as teammates who do the same.

Job Description

The Marketing Coordinator position is designed to elevate the output and efficiency of Diamond Kinetics Marketing Department. This role provides an essential function at Diamond Kinetics, steering content workflow through the company while coordinating with other key departments, including Product, Development, Customer Service, Sales, and Partner Management.

The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for overseeing projects from inception through completion and must understand the scope, business objectives, content strategy, and editorial calendar needs driving each project.

The Marketing Coordinator will have line-of-sight across Marketing, Commercial, and Product initiatives and will act in a key operational role to help spin up projects, assign resources, and get team members moving against a schedule. This role emphasizes execution, but will also require an understanding of the marketing strategy behind the tactics.

The role is divided into two primary areas – DK-Driven-Marketing projects conceived and executed in channels controlled by us – and Partner Marketing projects that execute in the partner’s space. Delivery will cut across digital and real-world tactics.

This position requires a self-motivated person with a problem-solving, can-do attitude who will take the initiative and work effectively with limited supervision. The Marketing Coordinator must be very organized and able to help the teams push multiple projects forward simultaneously.

Qualifications

Manage Marketing Workflow (75% of Effort)

• Manage the workflow of the DK Marketing Department across all phases of content creation, production, and distribution.

• Set timelines, coordinate internal team resources, and marshal external vendors to get projects done on-time and within budget.

• Coordinate with the Director of Marketing and the full Marketing Team to help build marketing strategies and annual plans.

• Coordinate with the Director of Marketing and the full Marketing Team to establish the editorial calendar. Then set due dates and run regular team meetings to facilitate asset delivery and review/approval processes.

• Field marketing requests from the larger Commercial Team - assess the need, define the deliverables, set timelines, and manage those projects thru delivery.

• Ensure team members understand their assignments and help them deal with inter- dependencies and overcome roadblocks.

• Assemble and communicate digital marketing specs for ad-units and organic content so the team can build-out all requisite materials.

• Manage DK’s email schedule to ensure smooth production, testing, delivery, reporting of email programs.

• Oversee website updates and ad-hoc projects.

• Oversee the production of real-world marketing components, include assets for events, conventions, POS, and print-collateral. Manage printing and manufacturing of physical marketing assets.

• Coordinate with media buying resources, internal and external, to ensure paid media components are delivered on time, run according to spec, and tracked effectively in DK’s reporting systems.

• Help facilitate DK’s photo and video shoots to ensure the team and vendors have everything they need.

• Set timelines for regular reporting and facilitate systems & processes to streamline delivery.

Support Partner Marketing Efforts (25% of Effort with Spikes in Attention)

• Work closely with Partner contacts to assess and define marketing projects – Be the liaison/gatekeeper of marketing projects between DK and our partners.

• Work to understand the strategic differences, intricacies, and idiosyncrasies of each partner to maximize the value of DK’s marketing efforts with each.

• Develop specifications and detailed timelines for Partner-Marketing projects, ensuring the DK and Partner teams understand their roles and responsibilities.

• Integrate Partner-Marketing deliverables into the overall DK Marketing workflow.

• Facilitate delivery of DK assets to the Partner.

• Check with Partners on a regular basis to ensure execution in their digital channels and real-world formats is going according to plan. Seek to optimize efforts whenever possible.

• Facilitate and continually improve reporting from Partner back into DK’s overall Marketing reporting infrastructure.

Be Customer-Centric and Leverage Functional Expertise to Create Value (Ongoing)

• Understand and apply knowledge about the sports of baseball and softball and the activity cycle of players and coaches throughout the year – stay current.

• Understand Diamond Kinetics’ technology, products and services at a very deep level.

• Understand internal and external customer requirements, expectations and needs.

• Deliver on commitments and create value for all customers.

• Stay informed about functional industry/practices and emerging technologies and approaches.

Experience Required

• BA or BS – Business/Communications/Marketing Preferred.

• 2-4 years of consistent success in tech company or digital marketing agency.

• Proven ability to assess a marketing need... and translate it into a strategic project that can be managed.

• Ability to multi-task, manage multiple simultaneous projects, and meet tight deadlines.

• Experience with project management processes and tools.

• High-level of knowledge digital campaign execution and coordination

• Strong cognitive skills including problem solving, decision making and analysis

• Experience managing budgets

• Ability to work occasional evening and weekend hours

• Excellent organization skills.

• Team player.

Additional Desired Experience

• Solid understanding of web development, app development principles.

• An understanding of email and/or CRM systems.

• Base-level knowledge of digital marketing tools such as Facebook Business Manager, Google Adwords, Google Tag Manager, and GA.

• Start-up and/or early-stage company experience

• Played competitive level amateur baseball or softball.

Additional Information

• Applicants must currently reside in the Pittsburgh area

• Requires reliable transportation to and from place of work

• Expect to work occasional evening and weekend hours. Potential for limited travel.

• Flexible work environment

• Competitive compensation package including salary, bonus, stock options, health insurance and 401K plan

The intent of this job description is to provide a non-exhaustive representation of the type of duties and responsibilities that will be required of the position given this title and shall not be construed as a declaration of the total of the specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position. Employees may be directed to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically presented in this description.

Diamond Kinetics may supplement, modify, or eliminate responsibilities from time to time, in its discretion. Diamond Kinetics is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity as a critical step in ensuring employee success.

Company Description
SEETECH Systems Corporation is located close to Interstate 83 in York, Pennsylvania (between Baltimore, MD and Harrisburg, PA). Our combined years of experience and knowledge are supplemented by those of specialist sub contractors located in the immediate area who possess an almost limitless array of special machine tools and finishing systems, including powerful laser cutting machines and paint systems, which provide a superior stain free finish in a myriad of colors

The Digital Web Content Manager will responsible for the growth and development of AZEK’s online organic presence. This person will define and run an inclusive and holistic web content strategy, ensuring that content organization and availability is effective to acquire and engage prospective and existing customers. This person will be directly responsible for auditing and organizing all changes on the website.

Job Duties and Responsibilities
Define and execute against a web content marketing strategy that includes both top of funnel and mid funnel content. Website content types may include: web pages, projects, whitepapers, infographics, etc.
Develop web digital content (copy, graphics, photos, infographics) that strengthens our story and enhances the online experience.
Maintain ownership of the quality and consistency of web content and structure in CMS.
Production (write, edit and proof) and content posting across digital channels.
Seek out internal stakeholders to source ideas, stories and collaborate with messaging across platforms.
Partner closely with product, brand and web teams for alignment.
Leverage metrics to make data-driven decisions about content

Be able to test content and website tactics with proven techniques backed by data (i.e. Google Analytics or other testing tools) and constantly monitor their performance
Provide Senior Manager Weekly Analytics/insights to adjust strategy if need be
Organize and execute changes and requests from multiple business owners

Key point person for content/digital experience of other platforms with third party vendors to project manage production schedules and provide critical feedback

2-5+ years of experience utilizing Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and Microsoft Office Suite as well as a working knowledge of basic audio/video editing software

Our leading Entertainment client is seeking a Community manager to join their team for 6 months! This position is fully remote.

Who Are We?

We’re looking for a creative powerhouse who will manage our social properties targeting the US Latino community. You’ll be responsible for the day-to-day management of our social properties, managing an external team of writers and designers, collaborating on strategies to launch and manage new social platforms, and developing original content. We’re looking for someone who is deeply passionate about elevating Latino culture, who can authentically represent fandom through our brand. You have a deep knowledge of the platforms where Latino audiences spend their time and can both identify and react appropriately to trends and cultural conversations. You have strong editorial judgment, sharp copy-writing skills, and the ability to make quick decisions.

Responsibilities:
Primary role: Community Management
Manage all social platforms
Create, manage, and execute on editorial calendar in Airtable
Prepare and post content on platforms in accurate, timely manner
Respond to comments from fans, talent, and notable influencers -- identifying unique opportunities to elevate community conversation
Manage external team of writers, designers, and vendors and well as internal Creative Studio teams
Manage the creation of assets and formats from ideation to execution
Run weekly brainstorm meetings and participation in editorial SLACK channel
Note platform updates and trends as they happen and make corresponding recommendations for the brand
Create weekly reports that highlight top performing and bottom performing posts and sentiment
Lead reactive opportunities
Identify reactive opportunities for titles
Liaise with title leads to develop and communicate promotional plans from Con Todo platforms
Contribute to the development of new platforms
Collaborate with Con Todo team on new-platform strategy with operational and creative lens.
Identify creators or writers who can contribute editorial content
Project manage creation of clip based content
Requirements:
Proficiency with the Spanish language i.e. Speak, Read, and Write
Strong Creative Instincts You’re constantly thinking of new ideas for posts, IG stories, and recurring features. You see a piece of content and know how to make it better, funnier, or more sincere. You love creating content that makes people laugh, engage in thoughtful discussion, and feel all the feelings.
Strong Communication Skills You will be working with a small core team of creatives as well as managers who will come in and out of the work on the periphery. You are clear and concise in speech and writing, you maintain calm poise in stressful situations, you are transparent and thoughtful in your communication about why or why you are not doing something.
Attention to Detail We move quickly here and plans often change at the last minute. You have strong attention to detail from grammar in your writing, to spotting typos in captions, to making up to the minute time and file changes in our content calendar.
Excellent Creative Writing Skills The account is developing a strong and differentiated tone of voice. We are more than just a landing place for our Latino content, we want someone who can use assets and comments to build an impactful, consistent online persona and an engaged community by identifying unique community management opportunities, and editing writer-submitted copy & assets to match our overall tone.
Deep Understanding of Instagram & Twitter Platforms You know what file formats are needed for the platforms, such as how to optimize IGTV videos for in feed preview, when to use a carousel vs a grid take over, when to use a Twitter thread vs individual Tweets, etc. You strive for high quality downloads over screengrabs and are deeply interested in asset performance and the future of each platform.
Ability to Be Nimble Things. Change. Constantly. You’re nimble and don’t get stressed by last minute priority changes or asks. You can adapt quickly to new asset requests without losing sight of other priorities. You identify creative opportunities that start in the community and work to make them bigger and bigger and bigger!
Deep Knowledge of Latino Communities You are well-versed in the many subgroups that make up the Latino community – from cultural references to slang – and are tapped in to the conversations these different groups are having on social.
YOU LOVE COMMUNITY MANAGEMENT Community Management - interacting with our audience, developing relationships and inside jokes, and being willing to be both vulnerable and funny with our users - is the backbone of the Latino accounts. You are strategic in who, when, and what you respond to. You love building online community and being a part of it!

At MetroNet, we pride ourselves on providing cutting-edge technology combined with outstanding customer care. We are a fast-growing telecommunication company, offering 100% fiber-optic technology. Job Summary:

The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for developing and executing local marketing campaigns in assigned markets to gain and retain new and existing customers. Collaborates with key cross functional teams and outside vendors to support campaigns. Monitors market trends, competitive intelligence, and analyzes campaign results to recommend enhancements of local marketing strategies.

What you will be doing:

Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications, or Sales
2+ years Marketing or equivalent experience required

Highly organized, self-motivated and strong attention to detail

Strategic thinker who can articulate objectives into actionable campaigns that produce results
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced, evolving, collaborative environment
Solid interpersonal skills with a high level of professionalism; in-person, phone and email
Proficient using the latest versions of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Internet software, email and database software
If you have a strong desire to impact, the success of our organization by ensuring we continue to attract and retain committed professionals, please apply today!

MetroNet is an EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
Company Description
Headquartered in Evansville, Indiana, MetroNet is a customer-focused company providing cutting-edge fiber optic telecommunication services, including high-speed Fiber Internet, full-featured Fiber Phone, Fiber IPTV with a wide variety of programming, and a home security product called MetroNet SmartHome.

We got our start in 2005, with our first fiber optic network in Greencastle, Indiana, and have since expanded into 50+ communities throughout Indiana, Illinois, and Kentucky. All MetroNet services are delivered across our 100% fiber-optic network made up of thousands of miles of fiber optic cables connected directly to homes and businesses.

At MetroNet, we are committed to bringing state-of-the-art telecommunication services to the communities we serve by delivering services comparable or superior to those offered in large metropolitan areas. This commitment not only means better internet, television and telephone options for our customers today but also the capacity to continually provide additional products and services in the future as new uses for 100% fiber are developed.

Our commitment to our communities doesn’t stop at bringing exciting new technology. We’re also proud to have local retail stores, staffed with friendly associates and technicians who actually live in the communities we serve. We find it is always reassuring to see a familiar face when your services are installed or when you stop by our store. Our innovative store design allows customers to test drive MetroNet products at interactive kiosks, sign up for services, pay their bills, and much more.

The Sr. Video Editor will be the head video editor and a key leader of the overall capture, execution and approval of final product quality of all Rock Film videos. They will have team hierarchy under the Director of Rock Films and Sundays in all aspects of video production including but not limited to the editing process and development of shot lists, shooting style, and influence in all production design both in studio and on site. They will take a leadership role in training and developing video editing volunteers. Must have a high level of expertise and working knowledge of all video equipment and post-production software.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Editor on all Rock Film projects.
Ensure that all videos are highly produced and edited to Rock branding and standard production values are fully met across every aspect of the video production process and delivery of the final product.
Key leadership voice during video production to ensure editing will reach the highest level of excellence possible for every Rock Film video.
Work directly under and closely with Director of Rock Films and Sundays in the logistics and scope development of all Rock Films pre and post-production.
Works as a team lead on high-level projects: pre-production, shooting, production design, lighting etc.
Participate in the training and development of post-production volunteers.
Will have influence in equipment acquisitions and purchases.
General administrative task management including calendar and critical path timelines of pre and post productions are accurate and staying on course.
Has the ability to adapt to changes in the work environment, delays, or unexpected events with poise and professionalism. Quickly adjusts to changing priorities.
Encourages, supports and motivates others, building mutual trust, respect, and cooperation among: department co-workers, dept. volunteers and toward all staff members.
The above summary of duties represents the major tasks and duties. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities.Therefore, the individual may perform other related tasks under the leadership of the Director of Rock Films and Sundays.

Job-related Qualifications:

Education, Training, and Experience
Minimum of 5-8 years experience in a video production environment.
Minimum of 4-6 years experience using Adobe Suite software.
Job Skills, Knowledge, Abilities
Professional working knowledge of: camera operation, image composition, lighting, editing, color grading, titling, music editing, transcoding and digital video post production flow.
Experience working with and directing on-camera talent
Graphic design and motion graphics experience
Various production styles and technique experience preferred; animation, stop-motion, special efx
Ability to multitask, prioritize assignments, and provide excellent customer service.
Work productively, both independently and collaboratively with others.
Follow verbal and written instructions.
Proficiency with Adobe Suite, Microsoft Office for MAC (Pages, Numbers and Keynote) and PC.
Ability to recognize and maintain confidentiality as appropriate.
Read, write, spell, and communicate clearly in English.
Demonstrated ability to make independent decisions based on the vision and values of the Rock Church and Production Arts.
Demonstrated skills and techniques to recognize problems and find solutions that uphold values of excellence and loving people first.
Proven ability to interact in a consistently positive & flexible manner with diverse external clientele, including volunteers, ministry leaders, marketing and communications department.
Demonstrated skills and techniques to recognize problems, issues and situations, and apply resourcefulness in finding appropriate solutions to mitigate potential negative effects. Ability to follow-through to ensure effective resolution.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy, including excellence in oral and written communications to verbalize issues clearly, concisely, and competently in positive or negative situations.
Ability to develop strategy and systems for achieving goals.
Organizational and Spiritual Requirements:
Demonstrate Christ-centered behavior at all times by treating people with dignity, respect, compassion and integrity.
Utilize the principles of Matthew 18 and Ephesians 4:15 to resolve differences of opinion with others.
Successful completion of a thorough pre-employment references and background checks, which includes: social security verification, Local, State & Federal criminal conviction records search, national security database, and sex offender registry.
Attendance at all mandatory meetings and events. This includes serving at Good Friday, Easter and Christmas services as well as the annual volunteer appreciation event.
Member of the Rock Church (or willing to transfer membership to the Rock Church).
Regular involvement in Rock Church activities, ministries and events.
Tithe 10% to the Rock Church.
Signed acknowledgment of the Rock's Statement of Faith.
Ability to interpret and adhere to the Rock's policies, procedures and employee handbook.
Be self-motivated and goal oriented, use good judgment, and be flexible and innovative.
Professional attitude and demeanor.

Position Summary

Looking to work with a creative team who loves aviation? Are you seeking experience in marketing, creative writing and content creation with an industry leading private aviation company? Do you enjoy taking on new challenges and projects? Apply for our marketing coordinator position.

The marketing coordinator will support and contribute to marketing initiatives, while assisting in the development of new communication strategies aligned with the company’s sales and marketing objectives. The ideal candidate is self-motivated, eager to learn, organized and detail oriented. The marketing coordinator will be responsible for executing tasks in line with the company’s strategy across a diverse range of marketing functions including written communications, print and digital advertising, branding, email campaigns, event coordination, graphic design, social media and more. The coordinator will be a member of the marketing department, and work closely with other Clay Lacy departments and outside vendors (graphic designers, copy writers, social media managers, etc.) to achieve their responsibilities and performance objectives.

Performance Objectives
Participate in the development and implementation of the company’s sales and marketing strategy.
Identify stories and write articles for the Clay Lacy blog, Partner communications, and Employee newsletter.
Prepare marketing activity reports and metrics for measuring program success.
Support the maintenance and development of marketing resources such as marketing sales sheets, client databases and campaign subscribers.
Become proficient in the use and capabilities of HubSpot marketing automation software.
Further both business aviation industry knowledge and personal development skills through workshops, research and seminars, and share best practices and new tactics with the team.
Responsibilities
Identifying story lines and writing articles that highlight the people, achievements and value of Clay Lacy Aviation.
Support the marketing manager in establishing marketing plans by setting objectives, planning and organizing support materials and content calendars.
Communicate campaign objectives, timelines and deliverables to sales team and provide instructions for use or promotion.
Coordinate onboarding deliverables and marketing support for new charter aircraft such as creating charter sales sheets, managing photoshoots, updating website listings, coordinating email, press and social media outreach, and updating executive travel and charter publications.
Coordinate, create and deliver written content for a variety of communication outlets including email communications, employee newsletters and blog articles.
Update website content using WordPress; build and send email communications using HubSpot.
Support the events manager with coordination and various responsibilities for meetings, events, sponsorships, and trade shows by identifying, assembling and coordinating project requirements, developing schedules and assignments and coordinating event communications.
Maintain a directory and inventory of sales support materials, ensuring all resources are current and accurate, and coordinate the creation of new materials as needed.
Analyze market trends, customer behavior and competitive landscape, and prepare reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing data. Continually seek and research new sources of prospective customer data and provide recommendations to sales and marketing leadership.
Qualifications
Skills and Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree.
Major in Journalism preferred. (Business, Marketing or other major considered for applicant with strong writing skills). Samples of your work would be welcomed
Excellent writing, communication, and presentation skills.
Proficiency in full Microsoft Office suite. (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)
Experience in WordPress, HubSpot, and Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator) preferred.
Familiarity with content management systems (CMS) and customer relationship management (CRM) tools.
Must be able to lift, pack and move boxes weighing 20-40 pounds.
Must be able to pass drug screening and background checks.
Personality and Character

The ideal candidate will exhibit the following traits:
Strong organizational skills
Good communicator
Trustworthy, responsible and dependable
Friendly, creative and fun
Critical thinker wants to understand the “why” in order to grow in their role and area of responsibility.
Able to multi-task across various projects and deadlines
Seeks feedback and constructive criticism on their work.
Gives feedback and constructive criticism on their team’s work.

About Clay Lacy Aviation

Founded in 1968 by legendary aviator and industry pioneer Clay Lacy. Today, Clay Lacy Aviation is considered the world’s most experienced operator of private jets. Prominent individuals and leading corporations trust Clay Lacy for aircraft management, charter, maintenance, avionics, interiors and FBO services. The company has aircraft operations and regional offices across the U.S., including a full-service FBO at Van Nuys Airport in Los Angeles, and aircraft maintenance centers in Los Angeles, San Diego, and Oxford, Connecticut. Clay Lacy is the authorized dealer for the Quest Kodiak 100 Series II in the Northeastern U.S. With the most knowledgeable team in the industry, Clay Lacy delivers superior safety, service and value to aircraft owners and jet travelers worldwide. Visit claylacy.com for more details.

Job Title: Medical Science Director - Scientific Collaborations Oncology Portfolio - Cross Portfolio
Job Description:
The Position


Purpose:

The Medical Science Director at Genentech puts patients and science at the center of all actions. They drive medical strategy and tactics aimed at maximizing medical progress. They collaborate to drive timely data generation and dissemination. They are expected to maintain an in-depth understanding of the medical strategy and relevant clinical and payer issues, while ensuring Genentech's partners understand key trends and shifts in the external healthcare landscape. They serve as the guardian for high standards of compliance, ethics and safety. This role is organized within a network of experts, and therefore may at any time be performing a variety of medical activities, as needed.

This specific role is focused on the role of scientific collaborations. The individual in this role will be expected to manage complex relationships with the various cooperative groups, the NCI and some private organizations and foundations (e.g., SU2C, Parker Institute, etc;). It will be critical to work in cross functional teams and manage experts within the organization and externally. Legal and compliance background is an advantage and there will be expectation in working through and having accountability for complex agreements, contracts and work relationships. This specific role will focus on the oncology portfolio as a whole, personalized healthcare and working closely with some major academic and private collaborators. There may be some work with the NCI in the pediatric space as well.

Key Responsibilities for all Medical Science Directors:

In this role the Medical Directors will be required to perform one or more of the following activities depending upon areas of expertise or assignment to specific activities, molecules, or disease/therapeutic areas:
Design, execute, and monitor medical strategies, plans and tactics spanning the lifecycle, including but not limited to:
clinical data generation design and management
thought leader interactions
sponsored and supported trials
registries, exploratory data analysis
publications
medical content creation and review
scientific exchange/engagement and scientific communications/collaborations
medical education
scientific congress planning and support
evaluate, synthesize, and visualize clinical and economic data and develop written scientific communication
identify access-related medical issues and opportunities
Actively participate and contribute to relevant communities of practice
Key Accountabilities for all Medical Science Directors:
Depending upon areas of assignment for specific activities or molecules, disease/therapeutic areas or for the full portfolio, acting as a medical individual for relevant study design and monitoring, data interpretation, medical content development and review, scientific exchange and collaboration, clinical training and insights generation to internal stakeholders and external customers.
Accountable for implementing strategy through medical tactics, tapping into the network of relevant expertise and insights
Contribute medical expertise to Genentech work products and coach/mentor others as needed
Facilitate sharing of information within, across and outside of Medical Affairs to enable medical progress
Maintain an in-depth understanding of relevant medical strategy and clinical, patient/caregiver, payer and healthcare/market landscape
Act as a guardian for high standards of compliance, ethics and safety; putting patients at the center of all actions
Scientific Engagement with Genentech's External Stakeholders:
Develop and execute on strategic scientific engagement/collaboration plans and cultivate long-terms strategic partnerships with relevant US-based external experts, academic institutions, professional societies, compendia and guideline entities, and other relevant organizations, including cooperative groups and their foundations, large multi-center research organizations and patient organizations
Guide internal teams on relevant external communications and interactions with strategic partners. As needed or otherwise appropriate, help facilitate contact between relevant internal personnel and external strategic partners
Provide scientific training to contracted HCP speakers
Job Requirements

Qualification:
Advanced Clinical/Science Degree Required (e.g. PharmD, PhD, etc.). Consideration will be given to those with extensive experience within managing collaborations with the NCI and cooperative groups
Required Experience:
3-10 years of pharmaceutical/biotechnology relevant industry experience required- preferably in Medical Affairs or product development or is a recognized expert in the field or therapeutic area (with a minimum of 2 years clinical experience)
Strong academic/teaching background preferred
Understanding of and/or previous experience with Phase I - III and/or Phase IV drug development
Considerable experience in the principles and techniques of data analysis, interpretation and clinical relevance, and medical writing
Proven record in working with the NCI, CTEP, cooperative groups and/or professional societies
Proven record in developing strong relationships with external constituents (therapeutic area experts, external organizations, etc.) preferred
Prior experience with pediatric oncology is also a plus
Proven track record of meeting or exceeding objectives and goals
Skills:
Strong customer orientation/focus
Ability to flex and thrive in an ambiguous environment undergoing transformational change
Works well within teams and is effective in collaborating with others internally and externally
Analytical and problem-solving capabilities and skills. Has demonstrated the ability to anticipate and solve problems of moderate complexity and scope e.g. evaluate, interpret and present highly complex data
Communication and presentation skills; highly effective at summarizing and presenting key considerations and decision-points
Strong business acumen: knows the industry, key competitors, marketplace factors/dynamics
Ability to effectively and efficiently manage multiple priorities
Good interpersonal and influencing skills; can effectively and quickly establish rapport with all key internal/external partners and stakeholders and influence without authority
Good negotiation skills: can drive discussions and decisions towards desired results
Understanding of legal and regulatory considerations impacting pharma/biotech industry and ability and judgement to apply principles to daily activities
Strong attention-to-detail
Business travel, by air or car, is required for regular internal and external business meetings

Job Description: 40 Hour Per Week.

The Marketing Coordinator is an important role for the right self motivated and organized individual. This role requires extreme organizational skills and a proactive mind set.

The primary role of the Marketing Coordinator is to promote the sale of new and used units, as well as the sale of parts and service. This position requires a proactive approach to posting and promoting sales to the public. These promotions will be done through platforms such as a web site, face book, email and twitter. Other platforms will be used as technology advances. The right candidate will be proficient in Adobe, Excel and computers in general.

The Marketing Coordinator will answer to each department manager and work with each manager to promote retail sales of the departments.

The Marketing Coordinator will be responsible for an assistant. The Marketing Coordinator will assign daily tasks and duties for the assistant to complete.

High School Diploma or equivalent required. Bachelor's degree in business or marketing preferred.
1-3 years of marketing and/or promotions and customer service leadership experience required.
Previous experience in the auto industry preferred.
Excellent communication (written and verbal), organization and interpersonal skills required.

Ability to work under pressure with time constraints.

Occasional exposure to outdoor weather conditions as well as noise, dust, and fumes in auction lanes.

EBSCO Health is part of EBSCO Information Services (EIS), a division of EBSCO Industries Inc. EIS provides a complete and optimized research solution comprised of e-journals, e-books, and research databases — all combined with the most powerful discovery service to support the information needs and maximize the research experience of our end-users. Headquartered in Ipswich, MA, EIS employs more than 3,300 people worldwide. EBSCO is a company that will motivate you, inspire you, and allow you to grow.

Manager, Editorial Support

The Manager, Editorial Support will be responsible for ensuring high internal customer satisfaction of shared editorial services. They will oversee a team of Associate Editors, who work with Medical Writers and Editors to develop and maintain DynaMed content. The Manager, Editorial Support will lead continuous improvement initiatives for existing editorial workflows, such as image licensing and incorporation in the database, and collaborate with leadership to develop new workflows as needed.

Primary Responsibilities
Oversee initiatives and goals for direct reports; remove barriers, provide feedback, and facilitate professional development, acting as a mentor and motivator
Scope, execute, and report on strategic projects; efficiently manage resources in the service of deliverables
Support and manage continuous improvement and optimization efforts for content creation and management workflows
Contribute to development and implementation of editorial policies that promote consistency across the database (including XML and template structure, editorial and scientific conventions, and writing style)
Meet regularly with editorial leadership to align support with editorial objectives
Assist management with hiring and new team member training
Identify new training opportunities and skills checks for entire Associate Editor team
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field
> 3 years of direct management experience
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects and deadlines
> 3 years experience with Microsoft Office Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and Word
Advanced verbal and written communication skills
Ability to collaborate cross-functionally and coordinate process workflow to meet implementation deadlines
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with writing/editing medical or scientific content
Working knowledge of editorial workflow concepts, such as XML mark-up, linking, tracking changes, and maintaining version control
Experience with working with media for publication, such as licensing, coordination of metadata, and/or minor editing
Excellent understanding of continuous improvement concepts including Six Sigma, Lean, value stream mapping
Experience with hands-on implementation of continuous improvement programs and Lean solutions

U.S. Electrical Services, Inc. located throughout NJ, NY, PA and DE is looking for a Marketing Coordinator to join its Team. This is an entry-level opportunity that offers career opportunity and growth.

Responsible for assisting in the conception and execution of custom multimedia projects for paid digital media campaigns on networks like Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, Pinterest, Google, YouTube, Bing, Outbrain, Taboola and more.

You will be responsible for planning and executing different creative assets required for a client’s advertising campaign. This can include editing and production of animations, images, banners, videos and desktop and mobile landing pages.

This role will work closely with our creative team to produce, convert and optimize all creative elements needed for all media channels - Facebook, YouTube, Google, and more. You will need to manage multiple productions at once from concept to final deliverables.

Their primary KPI is client revenue, customer satisfaction & retention and net promoter score.

Job Descriptions:
Understand client expectations and internal timelines around creative deliverables.
Conceptualize, design, and execute creative content for various advertising networks that include social, display, video, native, shopping and search channels.
Work alongside a production team to create copy/video/image content for various digital ad formats.
Create client-facing presentations actioning internal & client feedback.
Spearhead development of content creation processes, internally between creative and production.
Create and oversee the development of all creative, delivering a high level of excellence.
Remain constantly aware of new creative developments within the industry to better service the client and maintain current and new business.
Work with our media buying team in developing overall marketing strategies.
Participation in market research, presenting creative concept development, and strategic direction.
Oversee the creative process from inception to final product and ensures quality of content and style to meet clients marketing objectives and the proposed media buying strategies
Foster progressive thinking and the pushing of boundaries
Stimulate professional development and inspiration within the team and direct reports
Be able to succeed in a deadline-oriented, fast-paced environment
Manage your creative team and work with other teams to plan, execute and report
Brainstorm and collaborate on concept development, copywriting tasks, messaging and marketing materials, as well as presentations and client communications
Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Marketing or related major required.
3+ years of performance marketing experience in digital marketing is required.
Highly knowledgeable with Google and Facebook platforms, keyword research, Google Analytics, & ad creative testing
Ability to problem-solve and structure complex projects/plans with multiple stakeholders and deliverables
Ability to communicate effectively to all employee levels while understanding both the day to day and big picture
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while managing time effectively
Benefits

Join Us On Our Mission

We are a company where the world's best team members execute groundbreaking ideas through digital advertising.

About Jump 450

Jump 450, based in New York City, is a high-growth digital performance marketing agency that has seen rapid growth of over 250% over the past year. They have more than doubled their staff in the past year and expanded their resources to scalably grow their client's businesses. Jump 450's workplace culture, office environment, employee development approach, team engagement, perks, and benefits were part of the criteria that led to Ad Age's and Inc’s Best Places to Work and a 97% employee retention rate.

Jump 450 is the highest paying performance marketing agency in America. The company offers uncapped compensation for employees by sharing ~50 percent of top-line revenues with the team each month. On average, their media buyers make 400% higher than the average media buyer in the country. This work environment has created a triangle of alignment between company management, its employees, and its clients; resulting in Jump 450's clients always having the most skilled and coveted talent working on their accounts across their unique disciplines.

Jump 450’s office space is brand new and in a great complex (Brookfield Place) that has many amenities such as a robust food court, multiple restaurants within a minute walk, green space, water views, and great access to public transportation (Fulton St / World Trade Center / Cortland St / PATH stops within 5 a minute walk).
