401k match plans
Paid Holidays
Flexible / Numerous PTO Days
Volunteer Events, and Vacations
Gym subsidy
Commuter subsidies
Free daily snacks and drinks
Free weekly company breakfasts and lunches
In-Office massages
Company retreats
Half-Day Fridays
New MacBook Pro on your first day
Standing workstations
Company Events & Happy Hours

This position is responsible for driving verticalization for the Thryv product in Healthcare. It will require various types of analysis between industry software products and our Thryv software. Critical thinking skills and working independently are a must. This role will require you to work with various departments cross-functionally, assist with training, meet existing/potential software clients and attend conferences. Strong written and verbal communication is needed as you will be creating verticalized marketing campaigns and social media posts for our industry templates. This will also include creating content for our branding and lead generation teams. We need someone who can adapt quickly to change and is ready for new challenges each day. This role reports directly to the Sr. Manager Thryv Product.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Software Gap Analysis-- Become a master of Thryv software and competing software’s to perform gap analysis.

Manage the Verticalized Thryv Templates and Social Library Posts--Create content for marketing campaigns and social media libraries for the Healthcare vertical.

Build out Requirements for Software Updates and Changes--When submitting changes to developers, requirement documents will need to be created.

Support for Branding and Lead Generation-- Creating verticalized content for our lead generation team and branding team to use in collateral, training or for marketing campaigns.

Ride Along with Sales, Sit with Ops, and Attend Verticalized Conferences Feet on the street and getting in-front of SMBs. This will be through ride days with sales, listening to calls with our support teams and attending vertical specific conferences

Minimum Qualifications:

• Must be 18 years of age or older.

• Must successfully complete pre-employment screening process

· Two to four years of experience in product management

· Ability to work independently and collaboratively as a team based on project requirements

· Ability to prioritize projects, features and tasks from various sources

· Technical documentation writing

· Speak in-front of people or at a group conference

· Flexibility to travel

· Communicate effectively to developers and in layman’s terms to others who aren’t specialized in the industry

· Work in a fast paced environment that is changing on a daily basis

· Experience with SMB software

· Industry knowledge of the Home Service vertical

· Client facing experience

• Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university

Additional Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

· Content creation experience

· Demonstrate industry knowledge/expertise

Thryv is an equal opportunity employer.

Help build brand awareness through marketing and public relations activities

Social Mobile is an enterprise solutions provider that specializes in providing customizable and scalable Android-based solutions for the enterprise market. We are growing fast, and we are looking for the right candidate to join our team!

Position Summary:

Social Mobile is looking for a talented Marketing Coordinator to join our rapidly growing team!

This is a cross-functional role requiring collaboration across both production and sales, as well as with multiple stakeholders within the company. This is a rare opportunity to join at a pivotal point during the company’s growth where you will be able to intimately guide the company’s direction.

• Develop branding and product campaigns to raise brand awareness.

• Responsible for planning and budgeting control of all digital marketing.

In this entry level role, you will work directly with the management team to update their content on their website, write interesting and informative blogs and continue to improve their digital presence, while helping them execute their marketing strategy. Four degree in Marketing or Business
Must have Blog/Content writing experience
Proficient with Hubspot and Web Application

Company Description
HW Staffing Solutions is a family owned and operated business founded by Helen Walsh Holman in 1980. We have a strong 31 year history of providing our clients with quality candidates and service without sacrificing values. Helen’s vision and dedication has been carried down by her son Edward Walsh Jr. who as president has contributed to the vision of growth and success of the company through-out New England. We truly understand and respect the value of our clients’ time and need for a staffing partner to listen to what they are saying. Our approach is to offer in-depth customized staffing solutions to meet our clients' needs. Our consultative approach includes reviewing your best hiring practices and incorporating them into our screening process. Dedication and commitment has delivered success and growth for our clients, candidates and our organization.

Job Title:SharePoint Site Content Manager

Location:Scott Air Force Base, Illinois

Clearance Level: Secret Clearance

Summary:

SecuriGence is looking for a SharePoint Developer and Content Administrator to redesign, migrate and sustain United States Transportation Command (USTRANSCOM) SharePoint collaborative environment. Additionally, the candidate will be responsible to take advantage of the full scope of SharePoint built-in capabilities, especially in the area of content design. The candidate will be responsible for design, install, upgrade and performance monitoring of Microsoft SharePoint and its interface capabilities with other applications as needed; to include migration planning and execution.

Duties:
Analyzing business requirements and application objectives relating to SharePoint 2013
Developing, customizing, enhancing and sustaining SharePoint applications and sites
Maintaining and administering rights and permissions for site collection administrator, site owners and content managers
Engaging clients and vendors to gather requirements and troubleshoot work issues
Providing technical advice on requirements documentation and test planning as required
Configuring and administrating service applications, and managing disk usage across the site collection, and performing maintenance activities
Providing training on the use and application of SharePoint
Migrate data from existing SharePoint sites to DISA DEPS site
Required Skills and Experience:

Experience using JavaScript (including JQuerry), CSS3 (includes Bootstrap and W3.css), HTML5, C#, .Net, SharePoint JavaScript Object Model (JSOM) or Client-Side Object Model (CSOM), ASPX, REST SharePoint Designer 2013 and overall front-end web design

Education and Certifications:
Professional certifications (i.e. MCSD: SharePoint Application, or MCSE: SharePoint certification) desired
Requires US Government Secret clearance
Bachelor's Degree is highly desired and a minimum of five (5) years of relevant SharePoint experience.
About

SecuriGence LLC (SG) is an agile, HUBZone Certified Veteran-owned small business headquartered in the Washington, DC metropolitan region. Established in April 2010 we have been supporting the Department of Defense and other United States Civil agencies in Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Software Development, Cyber Security, and Cloud/Virtualization Management.

Job Description
Reporting to a the CMO, this role will be crucial in helping to drive the creation of strategic messaging, product positioning, customer engagement, competitive differentiation, persona development and content creation.
Product Positioning and Messaging – Own the relationship between the product team and marketing to communicate product updates and changes to customers, prospects, and employees and manage creating, retiring, and updating required marketing materials.
Work with sales and product management to develop and update market-ready messaging that demonstrates thought leadership, articulates our competitive differentiators, current and near-term product capabilities for TimeTrade. Communicate product roadmaps to the sales organization along with competitive positioning and key messages.
Support go-to-market strategy and planning that includes pricing, packaging, and feature delivery across a 12-18 month roadmap.
Run point on product related content strategy including white papers, webinars, event content/presentations, website and social content, video and often serve as editor to other key functional groups like product and corporate communications
Drive the competitive research strategy and execution including compiling, analyzing and distilling competitive information
Make sure the website always reflects up to date product functionality and positioning. Create website content that draws prospect interest and leads them to convert to leads and ultimately customers
Assist in creating materials to support the Sales team
Own customer marketing programs and strategy delivering webinars, product updates, industry information, best practices and thought leadership materials focused on driving retention, referencibility and upsell.
Own customer story development to produce marketable customer quotes
Customer Evangelism – Own customer relationship marketing to develop customer stories, case studies, quotes and references to strengthen our customer relationships and create engaging collateral our sales team can use to strengthen our successful customer experiences.
Managing and Measuring Work - Structure customer marketing programs so that benchmarks can be set and results achieved. Recommend and implement measurement methodologies and analyze program performance on an ongoing basis to ensure continual improvement.
Resource Management - Closely manage product marketing vendors to ensure quality support and execution of programs within timelines and budget.

Skills & Requirements
5-8 years of experience in Product Marketing, Product Management or Sales for a software company
Proven success in complex, solution-oriented market development
"Roll-up-your-sleeves" entrepreneurial attitude
Creative fountain of ideas to drive the business forward, both strategic and tactical
Exceptional writing and communication skillsExperience building impactful marketing collateral and informational content including; whitepapers; interactive product demos; webinars; and web video for content marketing programs
Ability to ‘ask the right questions’ to help shape message and product direction
Natural ability to relate to customers and prospects
Superb collaborator with proven ability to work with cross functional team
Extremely self-motivated and also able to help organize and motivate others

Job Description VLink is searching for a highly motivated and energetic Marketing Coordinator to work closely with the marketing and inside sales team. From the 1st day, the Marketing Coordinator will contribute to existing marketing programs, while assisting with the development of new marketing initiatives aligned with company goals. The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of digital marketing experience with a wide range of functions, including email marketing, social media, search ads, social media advertising and content marketing in the IT industry. The marketing coordinator must be an organized multitasker able to handle many diverse projects at once and meet tight deadlines. This role reports to the Marketing Manager at VLink’s headquarters in CT. Objectives · Assist in the development and implementation of digital campaigns.· Ensure all marketing efforts serve to achieve identified business goals, analyze and identify improvements for processes, content, and lead generation. · Prepare marketing activity reports.· Provide market research, competitive analysis and campaign results · Support the maintenance of internal tools such as Salesforce · Create social media posts, designing images, whitepaper/ebook designs. · Create or assist in creation of videos. Job Description
Miranda CompaniesinPort St Lucie, FLis seeking to hire afull-time Marketing Coordinatorto help us improve our customer service and marketing campaigns. Are you a creative self-starter with a passion for learning and knack for social media? Do you enjoy having variety in your job? Can you effectively switch between tasks? Are you looking for a company that will value you? If so, read on!

We pay our Marketing Coordinator acompetitive wagebased on experience. We also offer generous benefits includingmedical, vision, dental, paid holidays, and paid vacation. Our team also enjoys acasual work environment. If this sounds like the opportunity that you've been searching for, apply today!

ABOUT MIRANDA COMPANIES

Our company is committed to providing our customers with quality dependable, honest service at affordable costs when it comes to home and office service in south Florida. Family owned and operated since 1981 under the original ownership, Miranda has set the standard in how service and installations get done to perfection, the first time. Our company is certified and fully licensed in plumbing, air conditioning, electrical and leak detection and repair. Our technicians have been drug tested, screened and properly trained. Training is ongoing and includes technical skills, manufacturer lead training, and how to respectfully treat customers in their homes and businesses. We stand by a tradition of making our customers happy by showing up on time, respecting homes and businesses and providing an up-front price after diagnosis.

In addition to internal and external continuing education, we provide our team members withexcellent pay, fantastic benefits, and a team-oriented work atmosphere where success is the norm!

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A MARKETING COORDINATOR

As a Marketing Coordinator, you arrive at the office each day ready to get back to your projects. In this position to love that you have the opportunity to wear multiple hats to help grow our business. You engage your creative and out-of-the-box thinking as you develop social media and email marketing strategies to advance our brand and drive lead generation. Your excellent project management, research, and data analysis skills aid you in your success.

In addition to being part of our marketing team, you have the opportunity to improve our customer service efforts. You follow up with our clients over the phone to learn more about their experience with us. By collecting client reviews, you are able to see where we can improve in our customer service efforts and where we are excelling! You love that you get to engage both your analytical and creative sides in your work and get great satisfaction out of playing a key role in our company's success!

QUALIFICATIONS
Social media and marketing skills
Photoshop or other photo editing software experience
Proficiency in Microsoft Office
Experience with WordPress, Microsoft CRM, and Google Analytics
Ability to resize photos and utilize template software programs
Ability to pass a background check
Do you have an entrepreneurial spirit? Are you attentive to detail and organized? Do you have strong written and verbal communication skills? Is customer service important to you? Can you work quickly and independently? Are you able to juggle multiple projects at once in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment? If so, you may be the perfect social media maven for this position!

WORK SCHEDULE

The typical schedule for this position isMonday-Friday.

About Us


Simon Data was founded in 2015 by a team of successful serial entrepreneurs. We are an enterprise customer data platform that empowers marketers to create personalized data-driven experiences for the customers. We're scrappy problem solvers who believe in tackling big challenges with disruptive thinking and giving our customers the support they need to deliver great next-generation experiences at scale.

Simon Data is a data-first customer experience orchestration platform, designed to disrupt the marketing technology and marketing cloud category. Simon's platform empowers businesses to use enterprise-scale data and machine learning to power customer communications across every channel. Our unique approach allows brands to develop one-to-one relationships with their customers without building a bespoke in-house data infrastructure.

At Simon, we firmly believe that business success starts and ends with people. We all do our best work when we are surrounded by other friendly top performers who want to succeed together. This attitude is core to our values. When you trust your team, invest in their development, and give them ownership, great things happen.

The Role


We are looking for someone to own and develop content marketing strategy that increases our brand awareness, elevates our positioning, and improves sales effectiveness. If you are a person that believes that phenomenal content has the power to transform a business from the top of the funnel down, this is the role for you! Create and maintain content marketing calendar based on both external market and internal partner input. Facilitate partner consensus on a regular basis.

Maintain and nurture press relationships as well as proactively seek new opportunities
Support channel marketing efforts with content and strategic insights
Oversee organic strategy related to social media
Support SEO with content and enable our agency relationships with current content strategy and calendar
Ensure that our brand voice is consistently maintained and that we're always writing to delight our client personas
Occasional cross-functional content support
Qualifications
4-8 years experience in content creation, ideally for a high-growth, B2B company
Collaborative style when working across functions, partners, and vendor relationships
Demonstrated ability to drive top of funnel with content
Superior written and verbal communication skills
Ability to use engagement and performance analytics to adapt strategy and focus
Experience in SaaS and marketing tech space
Ability to join and thrive in dynamic conversations with diverse audiences: executives, client-facing conversations, etc.
Capacity to build high-quality content across multiple formats: webinars, guides, blog posts, long-form thought leadership, etc.
Ability to ensure consensus and utilization by the sales team

Job Description

Responsible for patients referred to the Organization; identifies insurance coverage, plans and coordinates referrals for home health services. Maintains liaison relationship with hospital and insurance personnel, providing and education on Organization services, coverage issues and related areas.

2. Demonstrate excellent observation verbal and written communication skills.

Company Overview
PURPLE

Purple exists to meaningfully improve lives through true innovation that evolves comfort from end to end. Our colorful company culture, award-winning marketing, unique (and extremely comfortable) technology, and incredible team make for a workplace you’ll be proud to be a part of. Purple is recognized as one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive companies in the comfort industry. We’re looking for amazing, motivated people who will help us improve lives and invent a better way for Purple. Come along for the ride!
Position Summary
SUMMARY:

As a UI Design Lead at Purple you’ll be joining us during an exciting time of reimagining our brand experience—how we evolve our look and feel to reflect our incredible growth and future opportunities. You will collaborate across the creative team of graphic designers, motion designers, copywriters, content creators, marketers, and leadership to define and drive the brand vision forward on all digital properties. In this role, you will work closely with our UX team to craft our visual brand identity on our digital properties through constant collaboration, iteration, and validation.



We look for and value patient and friendly individuals who are smart, kind, and brave. Curious people with a natural ability to learn quickly and develop points-of-view within a noisy and competitive category. Our team members value people over process, prioritizing effective and respectful collaboration. We look for proactive designers who can take and give direction, lead by example, and enjoy the thinking as much as the making.



RESPONSIBILITIES:
Ideate, concept, and design incredibly polished work that represents the Purple brand through storytelling, presentations, visual direction, prototypes, and everything in between
Translate brand identity standards including typography, photography, color etc., for our digital properties
Foster collaboration across teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities.
Propose concepts that elevate our digital brand experience and have the skillset to bring that to life
collaborating on the content creation to make a more compelling user experience on all digital properties
Work closely with the Creative Director and UX Director to align digital creative strategy to brand, seasonal promotions and product launches and efforts
Build and mentor a team of UI designers to support the growth of our business while actively working on your own projects
Understand and communicate the performance side of design, and also the business aspects of our products.
Directly impact our culture — bring your unique gifts and talents to add your point of view and perspective to our growing team
QUALIFICATIONS:
Hands on, roll up your sleeves, with a positive, unflappable attitude
An exceptional portfolio that reflects a foundation of design principles and awareness of current trends and how they translate to digital mediums
5 years minimum of solid UI design experience
3 years of experience in managing or leading design teams
High standards for craft
A unique point of view. You are trusted to question approaches, processes, and strategy to better serve the team to keep us fresh and distinct in a noisy, competitive industry
Thrives in an environment where ambiguity is part of the norm
Expertise with latest design software including Figma and Adobe CC
Experience working across organizational boundaries to define, manage, and prioritize work, with a collaborative and innovative approach.
Demonstrated ability to communicate complex concepts clearly across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
BENEFITS AND PERKS:
Medical, Dental, Vision
401(k) Match
Generous PTO
Market Money
Earn a Mattress
Purple Swag
Amazing Purple Products
WHY WORK AT PURPLE?
Make your mark: We value innovative thinking. At Purple, you will be empowered to bring your ideas to life as we work together to improve people’s lives through comfort.
Gain unique experience: Be a part of one of the fastest-growing companies in Utah! The contributions you make will matter at Purple as the company continues to grow with you.
Awesome culture: Join the tight-knit team at Purple and you can enjoy working alongside industry experts, making close friends, and annual employee appreciation events.

The Customer Enablement team is driving the Customer Enablement and Technical Training mission for Acoustic.

• Customer Enablement is focused on empowering users to maximize the value they derive from Acoustic solutions to drive software consumption and renewals. • Technical Training is focused on Acoustic employee and implementation business partner training around how to on-board, implement, integrate, and configure use cases within Acoustic solutions.

The Customer Enablement team is responsible for cross functional collaboration with Offering Management, Engineering, Support, Services, Client Success, Content Design, Marketing, and Sales for establishing content creation priorities, coordinating training for new product releases, and assuring consistent user experience.

This role will primarily be responsible for defining and managing enablement for a selected Acoustic product (or group of products), establishing a content creation frameworks & tools, designing/writing course content and certification criteria for users, sourcing and standardizing content from other Acoustic teams, publishing content to the Acoustic Academy, grading learners' assessments, and facilitating live training sessions.

Methods for training include how to videos and tutorials, textual guides and articles, self-paced online training, instructor led classes (both virtual and on-site), and other delivery mechanisms as needed.

The qualified candidate will work with management to determine appropriate training goals and will proactively coordinate ongoing maintenance of all training deliverables based on product roadmaps and received learners' feedback.

Responsibilities


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Develop working knowledge of selected Acoustic products and services.• Develop training plans using multiple methods of training delivery, including hands-on assessments for badges/certification.• Create and deliver industry-leading training (both online and in person) for business users and technical topics.• Manage training content, surveys, certification tests, and other assets hosted in the Learning Management System (Docebo).• Plan, configure, and manage training systems for hands-on exercises and assessments.• Meet or exceed the client’s expectations of knowledge, understanding and professionalism measured by Net Promoter Score, Customer Satisfaction and Customer Effort surveys.• Conduct needs analysis to determine the optimal scope as well as the best method of training delivery.• Proactively analyze learner’s feedback, revise and enhance online training deliverables. • Provide feedback and product enhancement ideas to Offering Management and Engineering.• Schedule and coordinate guest speakers for training classes and webinars as needed.• Facilitate online training sessions and deliver "live" instructor-led training programs.• Train the Trainer based on the created content.• Consistently deliver training materials on time and within budget.

Qualifications


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:

• Experience designing and developing e-learning courses is required, including developing instructional storyboards, content, text guides, and digital editing for multimedia required.• Three (3) years in a similar training design and content creation role preferred.• Experience with MS Office applications, video production (Camtasia), and e-learning authoring applications (Adobe Captivate)• Experience with using Learning Management Systems as well as other solutions for training delivery (e.g. Udemy, YouTube)• Demonstrated ability to understand users' needs and create world class training using principles of instructional design and adult learning theory.• Consistent focus on monitoring the feedback and providing outstanding Customer Experience to learners.• Ability to work collaboratively and effectively with all levels of management and staff within the organization.• Patient, practical and adaptable with desire to grow and develop expertise in digital marketing and analytics.• Strong attention to detail and continuous focus on accuracy of produced deliverables.• Self-motivated, consistently learning new technologies and applying those concepts to customer’s needs.

EDUCATION, TRAINING AND TRAVEL:

• Four (4) year degree in related field or certification in Instructional Design or related field.• Full business proficiency in English (C1/C2), knowledge of additional major global language is a plus.• Ability to work as part of a geographically dispersed team.• Flexibility to accommodate meetings in different time zones, sometimes planned outside of the business hours – for delivering enablement sessions for learners located around the world, as well as communicating with team members. • Up to 10% travel.

The function of this position is to support both the Sales and Quality Assurance departments. Duties will include working with all departments to coordinate the creation and distribution of literature, samples, and displays. The Marketing Coordinator will act as the point of contact for all website and social media marketing.

duties and responsibilities:

Responsibility for creating & maintaining all internal/external product specification files

Requires a working knowledge of websites to perform all necessary updates and Social Media marketing

Some college or BA degree in marketing, sales, business administration.
General knowledge of website management and social media marketing

Who we are


Who we areThe Spaceship Company (TSC) is an affiliate of Virgin Galactic as a space-system manufacturing organization. Headquartered at Mojave Air and Space Port in Mojave, California, it is building and testing a fleet of WhiteKnightTwo carrier aircraft and SpaceShipTwo reusable spaceships that, together, form Virgin Galactic’s human spaceflight system. Like many Virgin companies across the world, its team of over 400 talented and dedicated engineers, technicians and professionals are drawn together by a willingness to disrupt and challenge the status quo and deliver innovative aerospace solutions to our customers’ needs. TSC’s extensive capabilities encompass preliminary vehicle design and analysis, manufacturing, ground testing, flight testing and post-delivery support.

Our Values

TSC and the greater Virgin Organization have a relaxed and informal culture that encourages individuality and innovation. You will be motivated, enterprising and enthusiastic. Company culture is such that you need to be able to “check your ego at the door”, be a self-starter and possess a sense of humility. You will work well under pressure and thrive on being given challenges and responsibility. You will communicate clearly and be confident and persuasive. You will have a high level of integrity and understand the need of complete confidentiality.

Who You Are The Spaceship Company (TSC) is seeking a Technical Writer whose responsibilities include creating, writing, a variety of technical manuals including maintenance manuals (AMM, CMM, GMM), Pilot Operating Handbooks (POHs), Service Bulletins (SB), Operating Instructions (OI), training documents, and other manuals to S1000D specification, and outputting them into PDF, Interactive Electronic Technical Manuals (IETMs) and other formats. The Technical Writer will be expected to work hands-on with maintainers, engineers, and manufacturing personnel to create best-practices and procedures for custom-built aircraft. The Technical Writer will review and rework any discrepancies related to various aircraft/spacecraft systems. Additionally, the Technical Writer will make sure that the documentation conforms to established style guides and standards and will work with product managers and end users to make sure all technical documentation meets customer requirements. The Technical Writer is expected to become a subject matter expert on aircraft systems by interviewing product engineers, observing performance of production methods, referring to technical drawings and specifications, and engineering illustrations. He/she will oversee preparation of illustrative materials, select drawings, sketches, diagrams and charts. He/she will conduct quality review of materials.

Your Mission
Write and maintain spacecraft technical documentation to include operator, maintenance, training and other supporting materials
Collaborate with document users and product managers to make sure of accuracy, quality, clarity and effectiveness of documentation
Provide and solicit feedback for improvement of documentation and writing processes
Collaborate with other technical writers in development of procedures and methods of writing to reflect best industry practices
What you bring
Bachelors' degree and 5+ years minimum related experience in technical writing, preferably with aviation/aerospace experience
Familiar with space and/or aviation documentation formats, including ATA 100 / iSpec 2200 and/or S1000D authoring and publication standards, AMM, GOM, GMM, POH (including normal and emergency procedures), TO, SB, Technical Directives, Airworthiness Directives, etc.
Ability to work hands-on with cross-functional teams
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to create accurate and concise technical materials
Organized and detail-oriented
Flexible and open-minded
Creative and imaginative, open to unique ways of presenting information
Self-motivated, self-disciplined, and able to work with minimal supervision
Able to work independently and in a team environment
Ability to react to change and thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment
Demonstrated competency in the following:
Content Creation and Publishing Tools
Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project
Experience with SGML/XML
Strong overall computer skills.
Familiarity with aviation/aerospace operations, pilot and maintenance processes
ITAR RequirementsTo conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, applicant must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by ITAR (22 CFR §120.15) or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State.The Spaceship Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with The Spaceship Company is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.

Carlyle Financial is a boutique mortgage lender offering a comprehensive suite of common-sense jumbo home loan products to elite clientele throughout California. With offices at One Market Plaza in the heart of San Francisco and our Beverly Hills branch on South Beverly Drive, we serve silicon valley tech employees, entrepreneurs, entertainment industry professionals, and athletes. Our ability to tailor custom loan solutions and close loans in-house as well as broker through multiple channels affords us a strategic advantage and adds value for our clients.

You will be working as our digital marketing coordinator, planning and executing the day-to-day activities that lead to the successful completion of deliverable projects. You will also assist the Marketing and Sales team members with CRM tasks, social media accounts, etc. You will be expected to work closely and collaboratively with all Sales and Marketing staff, helping us to project manage requests with Design, Development, and Compliance teams. Additionally, you will be responsible for managing marketing campaigns to help expand and grow the Sales team’s presence.

Qualifications
Degree in Marketing or 2-4 years related experience (marketing preferred)
Familiar with social media platforms and strategies.
Working knowledge of Google Suite products required.
Ability to multi-task and take initiative.
Able to take direction and absorb information quickly.
Strong ability to prioritize and a keen sense of urgency and attention to detail.
Great time management and organizational skills.

Hardworking, dedicated and energetic.

A Stimulating Workplace

Carlyle Financial Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

COMPANY

AccuWeather, recognized and documented as the most accurate source of weather forecasts and warnings in the world, has saved tens of thousands of lives, prevented hundreds of thousands of injuries and tens of billions of dollars in property damage. With global headquarters in State College, Pennsylvania, and other offices around the world, AccuWeather serves more than 1.5 billion people daily to help them plan their lives and get more out of their day through innovative digital media properties, such as AccuWeather.com and mobile, as well as AccuWeather For Business, radio, television, newspapers, and the 24/7 AccuWeather Network.

Additionally, AccuWeather produces and distributes news, weather content, and video for more than 180,000 third-party websites. Among AccuWeather's many innovative and award-winning features free to the public are MinuteCast® Minute by Minute™ forecasts with Superior Accuracy™. Further, AccuWeather serves more than half of Fortune 500 companies and thousands of businesses globally.

SUMMARY

The Senior Video Producer/Editor (SVP) will be responsible for developing video producer/editing techniques, skills and workflow to ensure the production of the highest quality, most engaging content. The SVP will help improve workflow related to news editing, package production and archiving. The SVP will focus on advancing the team's production understanding and skill level. The SVP will also be responsible for coordinating video production for key series, franchise and ad sales/marketing/promotional requirements and do so with a deadline driven mentality. The SVP is a collaborative team player who works closely with the executive producer, executive editor and other management to develop a specific curriculum intended to improve storytelling and quality editing. The individual will utilize one-on-one and group training to grow storytelling skills that engage audiences and bring editorial concepts to life.

The SVP will introduce and advance After Effects and sound design knowledge. The SVP will also increase staff skill level in virtual reality, augmented reality and other emerging technologies.

The SVP will work in tandem with the Video Content Manager to identify ways to improve video production workflow related to speed, efficiency and prioritization. The SVP will utilize their extensive experience to define the best platforms and file transfer methods for video production collaboration. They will have a strong understanding of digital technology, media management and distribution, and have hands-on proficiency with post-production software: Adobe Premier, After Effects, Pro Tools, etc.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Help develop team competence with fundamental news and storytelling edit capability
Train teams in the use of After Effects, DaVinci Resolve, ProTools, and other finishing software.
Manage a daily post production workflow.
Manage and schedule the completion of edited programming according to the broadcast schedule.
Ensure quality control of all programming delivered for broadcast.
When required, assist in field and studio productions
Help improve content ideation process and conceptualization, covering end-to-end execution of shows/productions including social video content
Mentor and coach more junior members of the team to help develop their post-production skills
Continuously search for tools, plug-ins, software, and other relevant industry innovations to continue improving the overall look and feel of our video content
Build and maintain relationships across a variety of groups including sales, marketing, programming, digital, linear, studio and other show teams
QUALIFICATIONS
At least five years of Cable/TV news production and/or Digital editing experience
Proven ability to take ideas from creation and through execution
Demonstrated ability to produce both short and longform content in a stylized fashion
Must be able to communicate effectively with talent, management and others
Must have a command of production terminology and procedures
Must be knowledgeable on Mac, with strong proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite Production Suite (Photoshop, Premiere), After Effects, as well as an understanding of Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook
Must have experience working with social platforms and live streaming experience
News camera experience and professional audio experience highly preferred
Must be able to multitask and work well under pressure while dealing with
on-air scheduling deadlines
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to deal with multiple projects simultaneously and manage each through to high quality delivery

Job Title: Manager, Practice Group Business Development & Management (Corporate)
Job Description:
Company Description

null
Job Description

We are Crowell & Moring

Founded with a commitment to build a different kind of law firm, Crowell & Moring LLP today is an international law firm representing clients in litigation and arbitration, regulatory and transactional matters. We are internationally recognized for our representation of Fortune 500 companies in high-stakes litigation, as well as our ongoing commitment to pro bono service and diversity. With more than 500 lawyers based in the United States and Europe, the firm helps international corporations and emerging enterprises navigate complex legal challenges and create business solutions across the globe.

Job Summary

The Corporate Group Manager, Practice Group Business Development & Management (PGBD&M) works with and supports Crowell & Moring’s Corporate practice group. The Manager will develop and implement practice group business development strategies to strengthen and expand relationships with current clients and cultivate new clients. In addition, the Manager will identify and execute approaches to elevate the external and internal profile of the practice. The Manager will also support the leadership of the practice group in management areas, including operations, economics, recruiting and talent development.

The Manager will have the support of an assigned Practice Group Coordinator/Assistant and will report to a Director, Practice Group Business Development & Management.

This position will also work closely with other members of the Client Development & Practice Management Department, including public relations, marketing, and marketing technology, as well as the Financial Planning, Recruiting, Professional Development and Diversity Departments to ensure their initiatives support firm priorities and help drive overall firm strategy.

Primary Areas of Responsibility

Business Development and Marketing

· Partners with practice and working group leaders and assigned Director to develop and implement strategic plans.

· Engages with practice group and attorneys to understand the legal and business needs of clients and the corresponding legal solutions the firm provides. Through practice group “fluency,” contributes high-level business development advice and guidance that demonstrates a thorough understanding of the work the group and lawyers do.

· Drives business development goals of assigned group, including support for generating business leads and opportunities, expanding existing client matters, and identifying and pursuing cross-selling opportunities.

· Develops pitches and proposals, including firm responses to formal RFPs.

· Supports, monitors and reports on the progress of on-going business development efforts and initiatives for assigned groups.

· Works with individual lawyers and advises on business development best practices and strategies to assist in developing their practices.

· In collaboration with Research Services, digests and delivers meaningful research on existing and prospective clients, competitor activity, and industry or market trends to inform and support business development opportunities, strategies, and decisions.

· Develops compelling marketing collateral, website descriptions, and other client facing materials; ensures materials are regularly updated.

· Supports firm-wide efforts related to the knowledge management of pitches, proposals, and opportunities for their assigned groups.

· Ensures matters/experience lists and databases for assigned groups are maintained.

· Supports opportunities to increase brand awareness and profile for assigned practice, including outward facing activities such as sponsored events, in-house presentations, professional speaking opportunities, client alerts, and articles and other publications.

· Works with events team to plan and support practice group events.

· Oversees the timely preparation and submission of the Chambers, Law360 and other ranking submissions for the assigned groups.

Practice Management

· Working with practice group leaders, ensures practice group meetings have strong agendas and are well-run.

· In collaboration with the firm’s Financial Planning & Analysis Department, reviews and analyzes financial reports provided by the Finance Department and updates group leaders on key performance indicators.

· In collaboration with practice group leadership and the firm’s Financial Planning & Analysis Department, oversees the development, submission and ongoing monitoring of the group revenue and expense budgets for the year.

· Collaborates with the firm’s Attorney Recruiting group and Lawyer Development Committee supports recruiting initiatives.

· In collaboration with the firm’s Lateral Partner Recruiting Group, the Attorney Recruiting Group and a Senior Director, Practice Group Business Development & Management, supports the integration of lateral attorneys in the assigned group.

· Assists with other practice management functions as needed.

Qualifications

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

· Demonstrated ability to build strong working relationships across all levels of the organization and work both independently and with others.

· Excellent time management, organization, and prioritization skills.

· Excellent writing skills.

· Experience with content creation and messaging development.

· Strong business and marketing acumen. Ability to leverage research and competitive intelligence to identify business opportunities and support go-to-market strategies.

· Strong knowledge of and familiarity with legal and business environments.

· Knowledge of basic accounting and budgeting principles and experience monitoring and managing budgets.

Education

The position requires a Bachelor’s Degree. A JD, MBA or other related advanced degree may substitute for required experience.

Experience

The position requires a minimum of five (5) years of increasingly responsible, directly related experience during which the necessary knowledge, skills and abilities were attained. Strong preference for candidates with experience working with corporate/transactions attorneys or similar background. Experience in the direct supervision of others on a regular basis preferred. Direct experience in a law firm or professional services environment in any professional capacity preferred.

Additional Information

Crowell & Moring LLP offers a competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package which includes progressive options such as back up child care, wellness programs, cultural events and social activities. We take great pride in our positive, friendly culture that rewards hard work and success, at the same time recognizing the importance of family and community service.

EOE m/f/d/v
Crowell & Moring LLP participates in the E-Verify program.

Marketing Coordinator

Who we are

The Residential Real Estate Council (RRC), was established in 1976 to provide real estate brokers with shared knowledge and tools. Recognizing the need for advanced education, the Council developed training courses for sales agents and established the Certified Residential Specialist Designation.

Headquartered in downtown Chicago, the RRC is recognized as the leading provider of real estate education and networking for residential real estate agents, and the CRS Designation is considered the most prestigious designations a real estate agent can achieve.

The Residential Real Estate Council is looking for a marketing coordinator with email marketing and digital marketing experience to join our team and work directly under the Marketing Manager in implementing and executing marketing campaigns to promote the council’s education and events, acquire new members and retain current members. We’re looking for someone who is creative, curious and highly proactive, who can work in a fast paced environment producing engaging content, and execute distribution primarily through email and digital marketing platforms. Someone who is not afraid to ask questions and find answers, who can propose new ways of doing things, who understands strategy, and who is highly motivated in getting things done.

Responsibilities
Manage the Council’s advertising sales efforts.
Develop and produce emails and digital marketing campaigns sent by the Council to promote its education products.
Manage marketing calendar for the education products.
Manage and maintain the Adestra email marketing platform
Develops and creates Marketing campaigns and efforts
Manages and report on sales and sale activity by email
Report on results and recommend new approaches and promotions
Other activities as assigned.
This description should not be construed to contain every function or responsibility that may be required to be performed by an incumbent in this job. Incumbents are required to perform other related functions as assigned.

BA/BS in marketing or other relevant degree
2 to 5 years of related marketing experience
Experience managing marketing programs including website, email marketing, and social medial
Experience in copy writing for marketing/communications with preferred experience in real estate
Proven ability to produce accurate copy, as well as a demonstrated proficiency in editing and proofreading skills.
High level of creativity and initiative; able to balance multiple projects while maintaining attention to detail and meeting deadlines.
Strong verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
Proficient computer skills including MS Office applications and Adobe Creative Cloud.
Ability to work flexible schedule to meet high volume work periods.
Benefits of working for us:
This is a temp to hire position. After 90 days, this position can be converted to a full time role with full benefits.

Description
We are seeking a Marketing Coordinator for our corporate office in Chadds Ford, PA! Together we’re building a company that will endure and products people will love for generations to come.

We believe that people do their best in a culture that fosters inclusion, innovation, and success. Our values - Champion the Customer, Take the Lead, Run Together, Ack + Own and Bring Yourself - serve as the foundation of our collaborative and dynamic culture.

Whether it’s conducting a retrospective, participating in our monthly Hackdays, cranking out a new product feature, supporting our two PagerDuty bands, or doing our day to day work, Dutonians live and breathe these five values every day. Together, we solve real customer issues and fulfill our mission of connecting teams to real-time opportunities and elevate work to the outcomes that matter.

Solve for what’s next—at PagerDuty.

Why We Need You

We are seeking a Solutions Marketing Manager to drive positioning, messaging and go-to-market activities across multiple use cases and industries. In this role, you will work closely with Marketing, Growth, Sales, Customer Success and Product Management to deepen our understanding of customer pain points, the solutions they are looking for and buyer behavior that drive purchasing decisions.

Become the subject matter expert across target verticals and emerging use cases, understanding market trends, customer requirements and key opportunities for PagerDuty

Customer-centric mindset and ability to engage with business and technical audiences

Ability to quickly synthesize and organize information into actionable insights that can have wide business-impacting reach
Natural curiosity to dig deeper to understand market dynamics and customer motivations

Industry knowledge in retail, financial services, healthcare, and media
Bachelors’ degree or equivalent experience

Company Overview
PURPLE

Purple exists to meaningfully improve lives through true innovation that evolves comfort from end to end. Our colorful company culture, award-winning marketing, unique (and extremely comfortable) technology, and incredible team make for a workplace you’ll be proud to be a part of. Purple is recognized as one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive companies in the comfort industry. We’re looking for amazing, motivated people who will help us improve lives and invent a better way for Purple. Come along for the ride!
Position Summary
WHO WE ARE:

We are the Purple eCommerce Team. We are a fast-growing group of customer experience, product management, and digital business experts. Our mission is simple; drive measurable business value by delivering experiences that support our product and brand strategies as well as our customer's motivations, behaviors and needs across their journeys.

WHO YOU ARE:

You are a well-organized and strategic practitioner, with an enthusiasm for owning and driving numerous projects simultaneously. You are passionate about the customer journey and building a consistent brand story across products and platforms. You enjoy working with multiple teams in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, identifying opportunities to solve problems, and building out premier customer experiences throughout our eCommerce landscape.

YOUR ROLE:

We are looking for an experienced and passionate Site Merchandiser to join our eCommerce department. In this role, your primary responsibility will be to deliver product and brand experiences that support customer and business needs and drive outcomes. To achieve this, you will work with the eCommerce, Product, and Creative teams to build compelling, consumer-centric content that clearly and consistently explains our products and brand across Purple’s eCommerce ecosystem.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Research and report on consumer browsing and buying habits with the Analytics and Merchandising teams to identify product and brand messaging that resonates with our customers.
Integrate customer questions and learnings into creative briefs to strengthen product images, videos, and content that is delivered by the Creative team.
Partner with the Product, Creative, and Marketing to understand and differentiate our content across various marketplaces and customer shopping paths while maintaining the Purple brand story.
Manage product, brand, and promotional content delivery onto our web stores through Purple’s CMS platforms across an annual promotional calendar.
Partner with the eCommerce User Experience and Product teams to build new, exciting templates that communicate our product and brand messaging to customers.
Actively work with your team members to estimate content creation activities, delivery estimates, and timelines for single projects.
Develop strong cross-functional relationships with teams such as Product Management, Market Research, Product Development, Marketing, Brand, Analytics and User Experience to deliver experience that supports holistic business needs and points of view.
REQUIREMENTS:
4+ years creating eCommerce content deliverables
2+ years positioning Brand and Product stories into customer journeys
2+ years managing CMS content
2+ years working in an Agile environment
Expert level knowledge and experience identifying and resolving consumer questions and needs across eCommerce platforms.
Intermediate level understanding of the marketing, conversion motivators, and shopping behaviors between wholly owned eCommerce platforms and marketplace environments
Experience interpreting and reporting on multiple-source data and trend analysis such as social, analytics, customer feedback, customer service, etc.
Strong storytelling skills that enables you to turn various qualitative and quantitative data sources into a compelling and easily understood set of content recommendations.
BENEFITS AND PERKS:
Medical, Dental, Vision
401(k) Match
Generous PTO
Market Money
Earn a Mattress
Purple Swag
Amazing Purple Products
WHY WORK AT PURPLE?
Make your mark: We value innovative thinking. At Purple, you will be empowered to bring your ideas to life as we work together to improve people’s lives through comfort.
Gain unique experience: Be a part of one of the fastest growing companies in Utah! The contributions you make will matter at Purple as the company continues to grow with you.
Awesome culture: Join the tight-knit team at Purple and you can enjoy working alongside industry experts, making close friends, and annual employee appreciation events.

Job Title: Thryv Vertical Product Manager – Home Services
Job Description:
This position is responsible for driving verticalization for the Thryv product in Home Services. It will require various types of analysis between industry software products and our Thryv software. Critical thinking skills and working independently are a must. This role will require you to work with various departments cross-functionally, assist with training, meet existing/potential software clients and attend conferences. Strong written and verbal communication is needed as you will be creating verticalized marketing campaigns and social media posts for our industry templates. This will also include creating content for our branding and lead generation teams. We need someone who can adapt quickly to change and is ready for new challenges each day. This role reports directly to the Sr. Manager Thryv Product.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Software Gap Analysis -- Become a master of Thryv software and competing software’s to perform gap analysis 30%

Manage the Verticalized Thryv Templates and Social Library -- Posts Create content for marketing campaigns and social media libraries for the Home Services vertical

Build out Requirements for Software Updates and Changes -- When submitting changes to developers, requirement documents will need to be created

Support for Branding and Lead Generation -- Creating verticalized content for our lead generation team and branding team to use in collateral, training or for marketing campaign

Ride Along with Sales, Sit with Ops, and Attend Verticalized Conferences -- Feet on the street and getting in-front of SMBs. This will be through ride days with sales, listening to calls with our support teams and attending vertical specific conference

Minimum Qualifications:

• Must be 18 years of age or older.

• Must successfully complete pre-employment screening process

· Two to four years of experience in product management

· Ability to work independently and collaboratively as a team based on project requirements

· Ability to prioritize projects, features and tasks from various sources

· Technical documentation writing

· Speak in-front of people or at a group conference

· Flexibility to travel

· Communicate effectively to developers and in layman’s terms to others who aren’t specialized in the industry

· Work in a fast paced environment that is changing on a daily basis

· Experience with SMB software

· Industry knowledge of the Home Service vertical

· Client facing experience

• Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university

Additional Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

· Content creation experience

· Demonstrate industry knowledge/expertise

Company Description
Fidelity Payment Services is a world-class merchant services provider based in Brooklyn, New York that enables businesses to accept credit cards as a form of payment. We also provide a full suite of payment services options to businesses and industries throughout the United States, United Kingdom and Canada, including gift cards, ACH and check services. Founded in 1996, Fidelity has since garnered the distinct reputation as being one of the largest MSP’s in the Northeastern region with merchant retention rates exceeding industry baselines by double digits. The processing platforms utilized by Fidelity are responsible for more than 76% of America’s annual credit card processing volume. Professional in-house underwriting, risk, customer service and technical support departments allow for swift merchant approval and trouble-free processing procedures. Fidelity maintains a full-time staff of over 100 employees and features a network of over 180 certified agents and referral partners with representation in all 50 states, UK and Canada, allowing the company to service tens of thousands of merchants nationwide.
Cardknox, based in Howell, NJ, is premier payments gateway solution and subsidiary company of Fidelity Payment Services. Cardknox is a developer-friendly payment gateway, that has created a marketplace revolution with flexible EMV solutions that can be integrated with POS systems using only a few lines of code. Cardknox serves thousands of customers across every major industry throughout the United States, UK and Canada.

Job Title: Corporate Vice President, National Virtual Training Manager
Job Description:
A career at New York Life offers many opportunities. To be part of a growing and successful business. To reach your full potential, whatever your specialty. Above all, to make a difference in the world by helping people achieve financial security. It’s a career journey you can be proud of, and you’ll find plenty of support along the way. Our development programs range from skill-building to management training, and we value our diverse and inclusive workplace where all voices can be heard. Recognized as one of Fortune’s World’s Most Admired Companies, New York Life is committed to improving local communities through a culture of employee giving and service, supported by our Foundation. It all adds up to a rewarding career at a company where doing right by our customers is part of who we are, as a mutual company without outside shareholders. We invite you to bring your talents to New York Life, so we can continue to help families and businesses “Be Good At Life.” To learn more, please visit LinkedIn, our Newsroom and the Careers page of www.NewYorkLife.com.

New York Life’s primary distribution channel is the career Agency sales force of more than 12,000 agents, operating in virtually every major city in the United States. Every agent is affiliated with one of our 117 General Offices. These offices are operated by Agency management teams responsible for agent and management recruiting, development, and sales. Approximately half our agents operate their businesses out of our General Offices, while the other half maintains independent office locations.

Our General Offices are divided up among four Zones. In addition to our Zone offices, an Agency Home Office team responsible for strategy, finance, administration, standards, training, marketing and communications supports our agents and field managers. The Agency operation also comprises teams charged with growing our business in key market segments, including the middle-income market, the advanced (high-net-worth) market, select cultural markets, and the women’s markets. Agents sell individual life insurance, individual annuities, and long-term care insurance products, as well as mutual funds.

Role Overview:
Oversee specific aspects of the Field Development National Training program for our 12,000 agents and Field Agents.
Supervises the National Training team - People and Talent management.
Research and develop the content and delivery methods for online training to different segments of NYL Agents
Facilitates a wide array of training programs that could include: Onboarding, Essential and Progressive development training programs; Specialized Programs; Technology training; Product training
Deliver and implement programs using Adobe Connect and other web technologies.
Build and implement the training standards, systems and best practices for content creation, curation, distribution, archiving and ongoing maintenance.
Partner with DMs, ZTOs (Zone Training Officers) internal business stakeholders and Agency teams to define and build new content based on business plans and established key business goals.
Develop and continually manage an integrated training calendar for key initiatives along within Agency Management.
Conduct regular gap analysis of existing content, identifying sections that need a greater depth of material and removing outdated material. Develop content strategy to address identified gaps.
Review and communicate analytics and key success metrics on an ongoing basis to understand user behavior and help shape and manage content and training strategies.
Build and support metrics on remote adult learning and ROI on Virtual Training.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree
Minimum of 10+ years of relevant experience.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe Acrobat Pro.
Experience with Adobe Connect and webinar platforms and best practices. Experience with Adobe Creative Cloud a plus.
Must be a strong virtual training facilitator and be able to engage a sales team.
Understanding of Virtual Classroom user experience, especially as it pertains to adult learning and remote virtual learning experience.
Passion for creating great training with actionable knowledge of the digital landscape, including current industry and user trends, emerging technologies, and standards.
Strong writing ability with a focus on eLearning instructional design.
Familiarity and expertise with eLearning training platforms.
Ability to scope, organize and execute multiple projects with interrelated goals.
Must be comfortable with complicated technical and regulatory language.
Extensive experience building training content preferably within the financial services, insurance, or other highly regulated industry.
Proven experience conceptualizing and producing print, digital and web-based training assets.
Project management is a plus.
EOE M/F/D/V

At 10x Genomics, accelerating our understanding of biology is more than a mission for us. It's a commitment. This is the century of biology, and the breakthroughs we make now have the potential to change the world.

We enable scientists to advance their research, allowing them to address scientific questions they didn't even know they could ask. Our tools have enabled fundamental discoveries across multiple application areas, including cancer, immunology, and neuroscience.

Our teams are empowered and encouraged to follow their passions, pursue new ideas, and perform at their best in an inclusive and dynamic environment. We know that behind every scientific breakthrough, there is a deep infrastructure of talented individuals driving the life sciences industry and making it possible for scientists, engineers, clinicians, computational biologists, and more to make new strides. We're dedicated to finding the best person for every aspect of our work because the innovations and discoveries that we enable together will lead to better technologies, better treatments, and a better future. Find out how you can make a 10x difference.

Senior Marketing Content Writer - Based in Headquarters in Pleasanton, CA

10x Genomics is seeking a Senior Marketing Content Writer with a background in life science research and genomics, genetics, bioinformatics, or application of next-generation sequencing. The ideal candidate will have extensive scientific writing and creative storytelling experience.

The Senior Marketing Content Writer is primarily responsible for development of content across the department, including scientific and marketing communications, as well as development of advertising, promotional, and technical materials to support campaign and new product launch plans. This role reports to the Senior Marketing Manager, Content Writing in the Brand and Marketing Communications department. The person in this role will develop captivating content that enhances our brand voice and aligns with the company's strategy. A scientific background and experience in the single cell genomics and/or gene expression market and next generation sequencing (NGS) will make you an excellent candidate for this position.

Key Responsibilities
Develop content strategies and plans to assist in establishing positioning statements and messaging strategies for marketing campaigns and product launches
Establish standards and support the process of crafting messaging statements for marketing campaigns and product launches
Develop, draft, and edit short- and longform content including ebooks, brochures, flyers, guides, researcher interviews, publication summaries, advertorials, blogs, social media posts, videos scripts, plus print and digital ads
Create headlines, taglines, messaging statements, narratives, campaign copy, and clear CTAs to support marketing campaigns and product launches
Identify creative ways to repurpose technical content for marketing purposes
Understand and apply reader-centered copywriting principles and apply these to the creation of scientific and marketing materials
Understand principles of writing for the web, including search engine optimization and search engine marketing
Coordinate routing and review of literature in compliance with 10x Genomics Document Control requirements
Follow 10x Genomics voice and tone in development of scientific and technical content, as well as marketing tactics. Review and evaluate content for compliance with desired message, voice, tone, and style
Work collaboratively with the Creative team to generate creative concepts and align copy ideas
Work collaboratively in a team environment composed of Product Marketing, Marketing Program Managers, Designers, Marcomm Operations, and Regional Marketing teams, along with external agencies and contractors to help build whole story communications for inbound and outbound campaigns and programs
Review publications for annotations, create website summary statements and summarize key publications, monthly for Senior Staff
Required Skills and Background:
Background in life sciences. Minimum of a master's degree; PhD, or other advanced degree is preferred, in a relevant field (such as biology, genetics, biomedical, bioinformatics, biostatistics, or computational biology)
Proven knowledge of single cell analysis and/or gene expression, NGS products and market, along with understanding the buying influences of scientific customers. Ability to understand and interpret genetic/genomic data required
More than 5 years writing experience related to scientific, diagnostic, or medical content
Demonstrated writing skills, with focus on clear, concise communication to targeted technical audiences
Knowledge of scientific publication regulations and best practices
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with demonstrated success in creating and delivering effective presentations to senior-level audiences
Collaborative teamwork and leadership track record, ability to form, maintain, and lead productive cross-functional working teams who complete projects on deadline
Desired Skills and Background
Knowledge of GSuite, Atlassian/Confluence and Internet proficiencies are preferred
Adobe InDesign and html experience a plus
Experience with Workfront or comparable project management system and digital asset management system

Experience with enterprise and/or carrier Wi-Fi networks: wireless controllers and access points, location/asset tracking systems, handheld devices, NAC solutions, subscriber gateways, directory servers, connection managers, etc.
Proficiency and hands-on experience in routing, switching, and network administration
Industry certifications in routing and switching, and wireless are desirable
Familiarity with ESXi Servers, RADIUS, Active Directory, Windows, etc.
The will and attitude required to drive the companys success through thoughtful analysis and teamwork with other groups within and outside the company
An undergraduate degree in the sciences or engineering
Experience in a fast-paced, high-growth, fluid environment

LENAX services a broad range of markets, including airports, transportation, industrial, correctional, universities, and marine. LENAX is looking for a Marketing Coordinator to support the efforts of the Marketing team.

Key Identifiers for the Position:
Experience supporting Marketing and/or Business Development, within the Architecture, Engineering, and Construction industries;
Strong Administrative skills and experience utilizing, including advanced skills in MS Office: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc. within prior roles;
Must have experience utilizing all facets of a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system and database (preferably Cosential)--not just data entry! Must be able to fully use, develop, manage, run reports, update, and etc.

Understanding of Industry terminology and processes, including knowledge and understanding of the RFP process.
Experience supporting Social Media campaigns--using resourcefulness, ability to source imagery, and develop succinct, direct and meaningful headlines and notifications.
Time Management skills, ability to take direction, and run with multiple projects, based upon priorities set by Supervisor.

The Marketing Coordinator will support the Marketing Manager with Marketing tasks. ABOUT KENDO

Kendo Holdings, Inc. is a San Francisco-based beauty brand developer and wholesaler owned by LVMH Moët Hennessy - Louis Vuitton, the world's largest luxury group. A play on the words can do, Kendo has become the hub of creativity and next generation beauty product development for global Sephora channels and selective retailers outside of Sephora.

Through original development, collaborations and acquisitions the Kendo stable of brands will always be creative, inspiring and innovative. A dynamic engine of speed, expertise and market-savvy, the Kendo team continues to redefine the beauty industry through great product, great storytelling, great retail and direct-to-consumer partnerships. This shows up in everything we do and in what we stand for:
ENTREPRENEURIAL SPIRIT: We seek creative ways to get things done
PERSEVERANCE: We are moved by Winston Churchill's words, never, never, never give up'
GENEROSITY: The power of giving
STORYTELLING: Creating authentic stories to inspire
QUALITY OBSESSION: Our product quality is a reflection of ourselves
FUN: Work, life, and fun are woven of a single fabric
The Kendo house of brands currently includes: Bite, KVD Vegan Beauty, Marc Jacobs Beauty, Ole Henriksen and Fenty Beauty.

POSITION SUMMARY

The Senior Manager, KVDVeganBeauty.com is responsible for assuring the site drives profitable digital sales growth for the brand. This role oversees all aspects of the site (merchandising, content, promotions, site enhancements) and all marketing channels driving to it (email, SMS, SEO, paid search, paid social and affiliate partnerships).

The ideal candidate loves the beauty industry, can win over hearts and minds with creative storytelling, can sift through multiple data sources to find actionable opportunities, and has an aptitude to manage multiple projects. Collaboration, executive presence, and strong relationship-building skills are essential. The role has one direct report, is part of a diverse cross-functional team, and manages relationships with third-party vendors.

RESPONSIBILITIES

P&L ownership
Serve as general manager of KVDVeganBeauty.com to assure all aspects of site and marketing channels driving to it meet profitability targets.
Forecast annual, monthly and weekly sales and expenses needed to achieve profitability targets. Provide recurring updates to leadership on financial performance and plans to mitigate risks and seize opportunities.
Manage and negotiate expenses, ensuring projects and vendors stay within budget. Monitor invoices for accuracy and submit for payment. Track, measure and report on project results.
Build & present ROI-based business cases to leadership to secure funding above budget.
Campaign Calendar Management
Own ecommerce marketing calendar including promotions, website content, emails, SMS and paid ads. Partner with internal stakeholders to assure ecommerce content and inventory levels support the overall brand strategy while meeting traffic and sales goals.
Continually devise efficient processes that optimize marketing messages in influenced channels such as organic social, media publishers and affiliate.
Participate in the content creation process including creative briefs, providing feedback, passing assets to third-party marketing partners and assuring error-free content is loaded on site and in all marketing channels.
Digital Marketing Expert
Understand and execute best in class digital marketing practices that balance brand storytelling with sales tactics.
Optimize owned channels, including email and SEO, leveraging the insight of outside experts as needed.
Manage relationship with third-party marketing partners, including paid ads and affiliates. Continually inform them of campaigns, product launches and KPI targets. Assure they are delivering the best consumer experience to drive sales with a test-and-learn mindset.
Identify opportunities to AB test copy and visual content; share and implement learnings.
Stay current on innovations in digital marketing and ecommerce technologies and through conferences and competitive benchmarking.
Website Development and Operations
Identify opportunities for the full online shopping journey through web metrics and competitor analysis.
Partner with Product Development to devise development roadmap and prioritize site enhancements.
Ideate and prioritize AB tests; provide signoff for testing and implementation.
Research new technologies to determine if they add value to the customer journey. Regularly review portfolio of digital tools for alternatives.
Partner with warehouse operations and customer service teams to ensure on-time delivery of orders and on-brand client experience at every touchpoint.
Lead & Manage
Cultivate strong relationships with cross-functional teams including: Brand Management, Brand Marketing, Creative, and Finance.
Manage portfolio of third-party vendors with duties that include setting clear expectations, measuring goals and assuring deliverables are met.
Manage and develop one direct report with potential for additional reports.
REQUIREMENTS
BA or BS degree. MBA preferred.
Minimum 7 years combined work experience in ecommerce and digital marketing.
Fluent understanding of best-in-class digital marketing and ecommerce practices.
Advanced analytical skills with the ability to interpret and translate data into action. Advanced Excel skills required. Experience with Google Analytics preferred.
Experience with ecommerce platforms such as Salesforce Business Manager and Shopify.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with an apt for influencing and storytelling.
Experience leading direct and indirect teams with a track record for developing others.
