Job Title: Manager, Practice Group Business Development & Management
Job Description:
Company Description

null
Job Description

We are Crowell & Moring

Founded with a commitment to build a different kind of law firm, Crowell & Moring LLP today is an international law firm representing clients in litigation and arbitration, regulatory and transactional matters. We are internationally recognized for our representation of Fortune 500 companies in high-stakes litigation, as well as our ongoing commitment to pro bono service and diversity. With more than 500 lawyers based in the United States and Europe, the firm helps international corporations and emerging enterprises navigate complex legal challenges and create business solutions across the globe.

Job Summary

The Manager, Practice Group Business Development & Management (PGBD&M) primarily works with and supports Crowell & Moring’s Intellectual Property practice group. The Manager will develop and implement practice group business development strategies to strengthen and expand relationships with current clients and cultivate new clients. In addition, the Manager will identify and execute approaches to elevate the external and internal profile of the practice. The Manager will also support the leadership of the practice group in management areas, including operations, economics, recruiting and talent development. The Manager may also have responsibility for a working group, initiative, or secondary practice group as assigned.

The Manager will have the support of an assigned Practice Group Coordinator/Assistant and will report to a Director, Practice Group Business Development & Management.

This position will also work closely with other members of the Client Development & Practice Management Department, including public relations, marketing, and marketing technology, as well as the Financial Planning, Recruiting, Professional Development and Diversity Departments to ensure their initiatives support firm priorities and help drive overall firm strategy.

Primary Areas of Responsibility

Business Development and Marketing

· Partners with practice and working group leaders and assigned Director to develop and implement strategic plans.

· Engages with practice group and attorneys to understand the legal and business needs of clients and the corresponding legal solutions the firm provides. Through practice group “fluency,” contributes high-level business development advice and guidance that demonstrates a thorough understanding of the work the group and lawyers do.

· Drives business development goals of assigned group, including support for generating business leads and opportunities, expanding existing client matters, and identifying and pursuing cross-selling opportunities.

· Develops pitches and proposals, including firm responses to formal RFPs.

· Supports, monitors and reports on the progress of on-going business development efforts and initiatives for assigned groups.

· Works with individual lawyers and advises on business development best practices and strategies to assist in developing their practices.

· In collaboration with Research Services, digests and delivers meaningful research on existing and prospective clients, competitor activity, and industry or market trends to inform and support business development opportunities, strategies, and decisions.

· Develops compelling marketing collateral, website descriptions, and other client facing materials; ensures materials are regularly updated.

· Supports firm-wide efforts related to the knowledge management of pitches, proposals, and opportunities for their assigned groups.

· Ensures matters/experience lists and databases for assigned groups are maintained.

· Supports opportunities to increase brand awareness and profile for assigned practice, including outward facing activities such as sponsored events, in-house presentations, professional speaking opportunities, client alerts, and articles and other publications.

· Works with events team to plan and support practice group events.

· Oversees the timely preparation and submission of the Chambers, Law360 and other ranking submissions for the assigned groups.

Practice Management

· Working with practice group leaders, ensures practice group meetings have strong agendas and are well-run.

· In collaboration with the firm’s Financial Planning & Analysis Department, reviews and analyzes financial reports provided by the Finance Department and updates group leaders on key performance indicators.

· In collaboration with practice group leadership and the firm’s Financial Planning & Analysis Department, oversees the development, submission and ongoing monitoring of the group revenue and expense budgets for the year.

· Collaborates with the firm’s Attorney Recruiting group and Lawyer Development Committee supports recruiting initiatives.

· In collaboration with the firm’s Lateral Partner Recruiting Group, the Attorney Recruiting Group and a Senior Director, Practice Group Business Development & Management, supports the integration of lateral attorneys in the assigned group.

· Assists with other practice management functions as needed.

Qualifications

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

· Demonstrated ability to build strong working relationships across all levels of the organization and work both independently and with others.

· Demonstrated ability to organize and prioritize work in a dynamic and complex environment to meet deadlines and daily requirements.

· Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both orally and in writing with attorneys, staff, vendors and clients.

· Experience with content creation and messaging development.

· Strong business and marketing acumen. Ability to leverage research and competitive intelligence to identify business opportunities and support go-to-market strategies.

· Strong knowledge of and familiarity with legal and business environments.

· Knowledge of basic accounting and budgeting principles and experience monitoring and managing budgets.

Education

The position requires a Bachelor’s Degree. A JD, MBA or other related advanced degree may substitute for required experience.

Experience

The position requires a minimum of five (5) years of increasingly responsible, directly related experience during which the necessary knowledge, skills and abilities were attained. Strong preference for candidates with experience working with intellectual property attorneys or similar background. Experience in the direct supervision of others on a regular basis preferred. Direct experience in a law firm or professional services environment in any professional capacity preferred.

Additional Information

Crowell & Moring LLP offers a competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package which includes progressive options such as back up child care, wellness programs, cultural events and social activities. We take great pride in our positive, friendly culture that rewards hard work and success, at the same time recognizing the importance of family and community service.

EOE m/f/d/v
Crowell & Moring LLP participates in the E-Verify program.

Job Description:
BigCommerce, named a 2019 "Best Place to Work" in Austin, is looking for a technically savvy, data-driven content marketer whose focus is on growth. In this role you'll have the opportunity to positively influence the trajectory of a billion dollar company in a trillion dollar industry by working directly on customer acquisition through content strategy and creation. This role will allow you to work across the entire business, including Marketing, Sales, Product, and our Executive Leadership team.

The Content Marketing Manager will collaborate cross-functionally to develop integrated content strategies designed to support the entire funnel, from acquisition through to conversion. This role will be responsible for strategizing as well as writing content, and will report to the Director, Content Marketing. This person should be a skilled Marketing professional, with a strong communications background.

You Must...
Have 5+ years experience creating credible, professional content that moves people and builds brands.

Job Title: Senior Product Designer - Real-Time Mobile Communications
Job Description:
Our mission is to protect life.
We’re out to make the world a safer place by solving big problems and taking on the public safety challenges of our time. From our company's inception building the TASER device to a full suite of hardware and software solutions, we are focused on providing police agencies with the state-of-the-art devices and services they need to successfully serve and protect us. In the next few years, we're going to eliminate the burden of paperwork in policing, so officers can increase the time they spend building relationships and serving in their communities. We’ll put video at the heart of the police record so our justice system can get to the truth faster. And we won't stop innovating until the bullet is rendered obsolete.

It’s a big mission, but it’s one we’ll pursue relentlessly every single day.

Our Product
We are building a new product that will help first responders at the most critical moment – when they’re responding to a call for service. How do we get first responders the right information, at the right time, and in the right format, so that they can arrive at the scene prepared and ready to act? How can we equip them to coordinate with each other and their partners (fire, medical, other neighboring agencies)? The right solution will utilize intelligent mapping and routing, real-time communications, applications of artificial intelligence, and a heavy focus on making industry-leading experiences usable for both for first responders doing 60 MPH in a 35 zone and for dispatchers handling hundreds of calls a day.

Check out our future vision for Axon products here: https://vimeo.com/333871354
Check out our future vision for our records product here: https://vimeo.com/221924983
Read about our ethics board: https://www.axon.com/info/ai-ethics

Our Team
We believe that happy teams take good care of their customers, so we foster a friendly, open, introspective team culture that encourages everyone to speak their mind and deliberately avoids red tape, unnecessary rituals, politics, and jerks.

We believe we can only succeed if we deeply understand our customers and get to know them personally. We spend a lot of time with law enforcement officers to learn about their needs, watch their experience and see the real impact of our work. Your first ride-along with a patrol officer will forever change your perception of what the job is, and what the city is like.
Your Day-to-Day
Lead product design for mobile public safety communications. You'll own the full design process, from initial research and discovery through concepting, detailed design, testing and working with Engineering on implementation.
Partner closely with Product Management leadership on initial product definition and ongoing product evolution and execution.
Turn complex interactions involving a diverse set of users, a complex physical environment, social interactions, regional differences, and an ecosystem of hardware devices and software applications, into simple experience solutions.
Collaborate with Product Managers and UX Researchers to initiate, execute, and extract insights using a variety of research methods: observational, interviews, participatory, usability testing, competitive analysis, etc.
Collaborate with other design leads across product teams to ensure great user experiences across all of our products.
Participate in hiring across the larger product design and product management & engineering organizations keeping a high bar.
Contribute to defining global design mobile patterns, vision, and processes for Axon products.
Contribute to defining the general product design vision and process at Axon.
Be an ambassador and champion for the design culture at Axon.
Present products and feature ideas and execution up to executive level.
Qualifications
6+ years of product design experience with at least 2 years of leading major product design initiatives
Bachelor's degree in Interaction Design, Graphic Design, Industrial Design, HCI or related field. A master's degree is considered a plus.
At least 2 years experience researching, designing and shipping complete mobile applications for iOS and Android with a moderate to high level of complexity (enterprise workflows or complex consumer purchasing / content creation flows rather than simple consumer flows).
A proven track record of applying user-centered design processes and methodology to product definition, design, and development. You have experience with every stage of the design process, including: research, sketches, wireframes, high fidelity mock-ups, prototyping, and usability testing.
You enjoy collaborating on early product definition as much as you enjoy working with the larger product and engineering teams on implementation.
Strong conceptual skills and proven ability to rapidly prototype and design to communicate ideas to others.
A broad skillset with deep specialization in at least one area (IA, UX, visual, etc).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to clearly explain your ideas and decisions in a way that anyone can understand.
Highly knowledgeable of the latest design tools and proficient at quickly learning new ones. We currently use Sketch, Abstract and Invision, but are always evaluating new tools.
Able to function both independently and in a collaborative team environment. Comfortable in both leader and follower roles.
Experience with geospatial product design such as location tracking and map design is considered a big plus.
Experience with designing instant messaging, chat, or push-to-talk solutions is is considered a plus.
A great portfolio available for review.
Compensation and Benefits
Award-winning office and working environment with the newest technology.
Competitive salary and a comprehensive benefit package.
Discretionary PTO.
Fun team activities and outings.
Flexible working hours.
Options for training in the US.
Opportunities to ride along with local law enforcement.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Job Description
We’re looking for a Content Writer to join our growing Audience Development team!

You are a thorough, proactive writer with insatiable curiosity to learn about the latest trends in business technology and translate them for a busy audience. You can go from novice to expert on topics with efficient, targeted research. You don’t consider yourself “left-brained” or “right-brained”, rather you thrive in both creative and analytical environments. You are comfortable working with everything from micro-copy to long-form articles.

TechnologyAdvice team members benefit from an environment that pushes them to grow personally and professionally, with the support of a highly motivated team around them. On top of that, we also offer the following:

ABOUT US:

TechnologyAdvice’s purpose is to create opportunities for technology buyers, technology vendors, our team members and our communities. We are dedicated to educating, advising, and connecting buyers and sellers of business technology. As a trusted resource in a variety of technology verticals, the company helps buyers improve their businesses and vendors find their customers. Through unbiased research and crowd-sourced product reviews, TechnologyAdvice provides the insight that buyers need to find the right technology. Additionally, the company’s unique demand generation programs help vendors improve product awareness by placing matched solutions in front of qualified technology buyers.

TechnologyAdvice is based in Nashville, Tenn., and was named to the Inc. 5000 list of America’s Fastest-Growing Private Companies in 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017. In 2019, TechnologyAdvice was named a Tennessee Top Workplace, received a Nashville Business Journal Small Business Award and was named the Market Mover in the Nashville Chamber’s NEXT Awards.

ABOUT CR

CR architecture + design manages eight areas of market expertise nationally and strives to be recognized as the national design expert in the market segments in which we serve. Our commercial, higher education, K-12, government, hospitality, housing, senior living and retail groups focus on design creativity, technology, energy, value and most importantly, client service. As a market driven design firm, we maintain a balanced project workload, equally divided between the public and private sectors. Our commitment to our practice and the clients we serve continually fosters new ideas and platforms that are monitored and evaluated.

OUR VALUES

CR architecture + design is guided by our Four Values: Passion. Collaboration. Integrity. Innovation. Our values mold our behavior and drive our performance. We expect it from ourselves and we expect it from our partners. Each day, we measure our design practices, deliverables and services against these ideals and honestly assess our achievement. In our business, there are many factors beyond our control. Our values, however, can never be compromised and they will define who we are and why we do what we do. We are inspired. We nurture partnerships. We transform ordinary spaces into extraordinary places. We do work that gets our clients noticed. This is the ultimate measure of our success. There is no higher compliment.

OFFICE AMENITIES
CR's corporate headquarters is in downtown Cincinnati, just steps away from Fountain Square and in walking distance to the stadiums, waterfront, and historic Over-the-Rhine neighborhood.
With fantastic 360-degree views of the Queen City, we designed our office to have open, bright and flexible spaces that encourage community and collaboration, allowing our people and work to be the showpieces.
Not to mention a ping pong table, foosball, and cornhole for those competitive types, and equipped with a rotating keg of craft beer for those long days...or just because.

Louder Than Digital is searching for a Marketing Coordinator to join our Crew and start riffing strategy for our own marketing projects and ways to help support stellar performance across our client.

About our company:

At Louder, we are a tenacious team of marketers who help transform clients into the rockstars of their industry. We go beyond traffic and sales to really understand deep buying behavior patterns and adapt our strategies to capitalize on those trends. That way, clients can go beyond knowing what works and what doesn’t to understanding ways to drive the most amount of revenue for the best ROI.

We’re smart, like to have fun while we work, and leverage complex buyer behavior data to kick ass for our clients—it’s that simple!

About the position:

We are currently looking to fill a Marketing Coordinator position. If you live and breathe marketing, including social media management, light graphic design, email marketing, and project management, arnd are interested in or already have experience with CRM utilization or Digital

Advertising, we want to talk to you! We are looking for someone that has great organizational skills and can communicate and strategize to deliver on key marketing initiatives like social media postings, case studies, email marketing strategy and support, and more. Experience developing, implementing, tracking and optimizing marketing campaigns required. Your main responsibility would be to create and execute on meaningful marketing strategies and to implement campaigns with the support of our team. You will be responsible for keeping internal and customer marketing initiatives on track. Above all, you’re an upbeat crew member who enjoys working with other industry experts to optimize integrated marketing strategies.

Specs:

You will work directly with Louder leaders to learn the industry and strategize ways to create campaign ideas and grow revenue for our clients, as well as expand our own marketing presence.

You will be responsible for:

Louder Projects:
Create Email Marketing & Social Ads Campaigns to drive more brand awareness for Louder

Leverage Project Management tools (ZOHO) & best practices to enhance task accountability
Help implement and optimize CRM and Marketing Automation (ZOHO) capabilities

Identify industry trends and insights within digital marketing & advertising industry
Support Louder Sales efforts with Case Study creation, Client Announcements, and content creation
Client Projects:
Help plan, execute, and report on Client Campaigns goals, KPIs, and ROI
Optimize client account performance in collaboration with the Digital Account team
Collaborate with internal teams regarding client needs (graphic design, campaign ideas, copy)
Identify industry trends and insights within client’s businesses
Help manage social media & email growth efforts (leveraging easy technologies like Gleam)
Support with reporting and data visualization utilizing tools such as Google Data Studio +
Analytics + Adwords, Facebook Ad Manager, & ZOHO

Your talents:
2-3 years of digital marketing or marketing coordination experience – agency experience is ideal, but not needed, a versatile team player is most important
Content marketing (social media management, campaign concepts, copy, & email marketing) experience with some graphic design skills as a nice bonus
Consistently demonstrate ability to successfully move into problem-solving mode when challenges or roadblocks arise
A strong desire to constantly grow your own knowledge & help grow the knowledge of others
Experience in or interest in learning marketing and project management technologies
Self-organized and self-motivated with ability to manage time and resources well
You thrive in a fast-growing, small business environment
Compensation:
$36,000 + Bonus, with 60 day performance review check-in and addition of fringe benefits
What are the perks?

Work from anywhere. Literally. Backstage, from the road, beach, mountains, West Coast, East Coast, or Patagonia. We’ve done it all and you can too! As long as you get your work done and can maintain effective collaboration with the team and clients, you can work where you want, when you want.

Gain experience working with incredibly awesome leadership, co-workers, and freelance partners that love talking marketing shop, and even more, love unwinding by listening to live music, reveling in our humor and wit, traveling, nerding out on documentaries, eating good food, drinking great beer/wine, and most importantly, giving back to philanthropic causes we are passionate to support.

Company Description

Kinetica helps many of the world’s largest companies solve some of the world’s most complex problems, including Citibank, GSK, OVO, Softbank, and Telkomsel, among others. The Kinetica Active Analytics Platform combines streaming and historical data with location intelligence and machine learning-powered analytics. Organizations across automotive, energy, telecommunications, retail, healthcare, financial services, and beyond leverage the platform’s GPU-accelerated computing power to build custom analytical applications that deliver immediate, dynamic insight. Kinetica has a rich partner ecosystem, including Dell, HP, IBM, NVIDIA, and Oracle, and is privately held, backed by leading global venture capital firms Canvas Ventures, Citi Ventures, GreatPoint Ventures, and Meritech Capital Partners.

Join Kinetica and help us change the way people interact with our world.

Job Description

Kinetica is looking for an accomplished sales enablement professional to add to our growing team. This person will be responsible for developing and managing sales enablement at Kinetica. Kinetica is doubling annual revenue year-over-year, and our enterprise customer list is growing at a steady across all markets globally. We are seeking proven sales enablement leaders who can own training, onboarding, content management, and strategy for our sales department.

As the Sales Enablement Manager you will be focused on core sales systems, processes, tools and enablement. Helping to empower the reps to increase velocity, shaping our systems to meet the needs of the business, and building the necessary infrastructure for a global sales organization. You will partner with our sales team to improve critical processes, develop a strategy for sales team training and content while also partnering with sales leadership, sales operations, product, and marketing to drive strategy execution.

Role and Responsibilities
Partner with sales leadership to uncover business needs, and design training solutions to address these needs, then launch and measure the success of those solutions
Manage cross-functional efforts that impact the sales team while effectively executing against defined plans
Design and develop Sales Enablement solutions across a variety of mediums (i.e. classroom, virtual, elearnings, content, coaching, video, on the job support, etc.) to improve the way we sell into various markets
Measure the impact of Enablement solutions and make changes if needed
Develop new hire onboarding programs that decrease ramp time of incoming reps
Design and optimize programs like GTM Kickoff and certification programs to improve business performance.
Support bespoke content creation for proposals and executive presentations
Become the expert on the Kinetica Sales Tool stack - work to optimize our CRM, email marketing, sales engagement, communication, and messaging

3-5 years experience in either outbound marketing or sales enablement
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience with Salesforce, Marketing Automation, or Sales Engagement tools
Experience with Excel and PowerPoint, Google Apps (Adobe PDF design experience is a huge plus!)
Excel in executing, establishing priorities, and meeting swift deadlines in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

We are committed to building a diverse team and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds.

Youve been on a high-functioning marketing team. You love the energy, excitement, and challenges that come with each new week. You love to create, build, and make a difference. You thrive in a collaborative environment and no job is too small for you. Youre hungry for knowledge and want to learn by doing.

You work in a predictable and consistent manner and to do tasks in an orderly and systematic way. You are patient with processes that are stable and methodical. Synopsis Writer: Polish Content Specialist
Our client is seeking a seasoned, bilingual entertainment writer to join their team. The ideal candidate is a skilled wordsmith with passion and deep knowledge of the Polish entertainment landscape. They're also excited about taking on complex cross-functional projects to ensure our clients’ members around the globe are able to connect with content that is right for them.
This role is also intended to support writers working on other Slavic language content.
Responsibilities:
You'll watch Polish-language and other Slavic-languages TV shows and movies and discern the most important plot points in order to write title- and episode-level synopses about them, while avoiding spoilers and flagging any cultural sensitivities.
You'll be expected to research titles and gather information from regional, Slavic-language sources, but write clear, engaging and accurate short-form copy in English.
You are required to have full command of Polish and your fingers on the pulse of the Slavic socio-cultural landscape.
As one of the people responsible for product writing for the Slavic markets, you’ll write title- and episode-level synopses with a special focus on local-origin content, and you’ll work with a talented team of entertainment writers, editors and colleagues across the globe to build context around titles and help connect users to the content they love.
Occasionally, you’ll apply your writing expertise and passion for Polish-language film and television into cross-functional innovation projects, collaborating with other writing, analysis, translation, design, content and product teams. Many of our team members work remotely, so you’ll use Slack, Google Hangouts, email and other digital tools to communicate about assignments, projects and publishing deadlines.
What Will Help You Succeed:
Deep content and cultural knowledge about Polish media, including current trends in entertainment. Simply put, you’re a superfan who’s excited to write about film and TV from the region — and help get our members around the globe excited about it, too.
Experience and comfort collaborating with multifaceted digital production teams.
A love of language. Even though you’re an expert with deep knowledge, you’ll always write with an empathetic understanding of your audience in mind. You must be comfortable with rigorous editing, tight deadlines and workshopping copy with a team of writers and editors.
Flexibility and versatility as a writer. Whether the assignment at hand is a highbrow film, a blockbuster rom-com or an animated educational series for kids, you understand that different types of content should have copy tailored to their respective tones.
A commitment to our team’s core values, including candid feedback, passion and curiosity.
Key Qualifications:

Native fluency in English and full professional fluency in Polish, which will be critical to understand and evaluate Polish-language content without subtitles
A nuanced perspective on Polish-language media
5+ years of relevant writing experience
Exceptional ability in short-form writing and editing
Sharp attention to detail
Strong online research and fact-checking skills
Independent and self-motivated working style
Ability to keep track of and meet deadlines
Understanding of AP style
Excellent organizational skills
Outstanding communication skills
Professional fluency in another Slavic language, preferably Czech is a plus
Recently published examples of film/television criticism or culture writing is a plus
Experience working with global brands is a plus

Job Description:

Job Description
As an OnPrem Project Manager, you will dive deep into the client business, working alongside a project team of other analysts, consultants and/or senior consultants. You will engage in different types of consulting projects ranging from the formulation and analysis of business, process, and organizational strategies, to the implementation of technology solutions. The methodologies will range depending on client preference. Facilitating sessions with client executives, you will identify risks and provide mitigation strategies, conduct deliverable reviews and give feedback, and lead your team through hands-on example. Our managers build and maintain strong client relationships while identifying opportunities beyond her or his current engagement, help mentor and develop exceptional talent within our firm, and contribute to other growth areas such as recruiting, strategy, and/or methodology enhancement.

Our consultants work at our client sites. As with all consultants, you should be willing to travel on occasion for work. We work in a number of fields, but have a primary focus on the Media & Entertainment industry.

About Us
We’re in the business of making businesses better—people, processes, and systems. We’re an end-to-end technology solutions provider focused on connecting disparate parts within organizations. We bring a balance of IQ and EQ to every engagement, and a depth of business and technical acumen to every problem. We are a team that is driven by following through for our clients, and being upfront, honest and sincere.
Requirements
5-7+ years System Implementation, SDLC, Integration, and Project Management experience
3+ years in consulting / professional services, big firm experience preferred
5+ years experience managing the full implementation lifecycle (analysis, design, develop, test, deploy, support) for Digital Media Supply Chain, including Digital Asset Management systems or other digital media delivery solutions
Experience managing storage and network solutions to support large file distribution, and experience with localization use cases
Knowledge of numerous file formats and codecs with a focus on video
Ability to collaborate with subject matter experts, cross-functional resources and business stakeholders to understand and document business requirements
Experience in project planning, including building and managing to project plans, budgeting, resource allocation, and reporting status to clients and internal teams
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, information systems, computer science, business administration or other related fields
Experience in any Digital Asset Management systems, including but not limited to: OpenText Media Management (OTMM), Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), MediaBeacon, Adam Systems, Nuxeo
Preferred
Experience in Media & Entertainment/Broadcast and/or Consumer Products industries
Experience at a large consulting firm (e.g., Accenture, Deloitte, EY, CapGemini, PWC)
Agile or Scrum Experience
Life at OnPrem
We were founded on a culture of collaboration and inclusiveness, and this permeates each of our initiatives, both client-facing and internal. We offer a wide selection of benefits including medical, dental & vision, 401k matching and flexible vacation; we sponsor trainings to advance our teams’ skill sets; we prioritize our employees’ professional growth paths. Currently 200+ people strong in four geographic territories, we’ve been recognized as a “Best Place to Work,” a “Great Place to Work,” “Fastest Growing,” and “A Jewel.”

Visa Status
Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

Equal Employment Opportunity

ABOUT DHAR MANN STUDIOS:

Dhar Mann Studios creates viral video content that connects the world through storytelling. These short, motivational videos focused on life, business, and relationships receive over 1 Billion views monthly and have garnered over 6 Billion views on Facebook, YouTube and Instagram. The team is led by Dhar Mann, a seasoned entrepreneur with a global audience of over 20 Million social media followers and currently the highest viewed inspirational content creator in the world. These compelling stories depict real life situations shown by actors that teach important life lessons, inspired by Dhar's personal experience of success and failure. The company is driven by one founding principle: We’re not just telling stories, we’re changing lives.

BIG PICTURE:

We are searching for a full-time video Editor to help us create short cinematic viral videos! We have an awesome team of screenwriters, casting associates, directors and shooters so this role would require performing all the technical aspects of editing a film. This includes color grading and audio adjusting. The ideal candidate has strong experience with editing narrative films and knows how to build emotion, create tension and increase the overall entertainment value of each film with little or no direction. This position often requires working long hours including nights and weekends. Since we are a mission-led company and all of the content we create inspires people, the right candidate will find the long hours to be exciting and highly satisfying!

HOW YOU’LL SPEND YOUR TIME:
Editing in a creative way to help build emotion, increase tension and deliver greater payoff of the message for the audience
Working with Davinci Resolve to provide high quality color grading to enhance the film quality
Adjusting audio to provide the best quality possible
Adding subtitles and branding to all videos and ensuring all final files are complete and organized
WHAT YOU HAVE:
3 Years experience editing short form video content with narrative structure
High level experience with editing narrative work. (personal or professional)
Experience in the Adobe Creative Suite including Premiere, Photoshop, After Effects, etc.
High level experience with After Effects and color correcting/grading with DaVinci Resolve
Demonstrated video editing ability with a strong portfolio
Ability to work in a fast paced environment on a wide variety of projects
Ability to learn quickly and is a team player
Skilled in handling quick output without losing quality
Experience with Adobe Audition, and working with audio files to get acceptable audio
WHO OVERSEES YOU:

The Editor reports directly to the Editing Manager

WHO YOU OVERSEE:

Currently, the Editor has no personnel reporting directly to him or her

WHERE IT ALL GOES DOWN:

This is a remote role with the opportunity to work from a home office

WHEN THE MAGIC HAPPENS:

This is a 1099 Consultant role that will be around 20 hours a week with the potential to evolve into a full time position if all goes well

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US:
We've kept our hiring bar really high - you will work with the best
You will be paid $25-$35 per hour, based on experience
WHEN WE’LL TALK ABOUT HOW AWESOME YOU ARE:

No formal cover letters, please. Instead, provide the following:
A few short paragraphs explaining why you’d be a good fit for this particular position
Links to any content or channels that you have created/edited
Your resume
AN IMPORTANT NOTE BEFORE APPLYING TO US:

All of Dhar Mann Studios' new hires will begin at the associate level, regardless of what position was applied for. Our organization looks to hire the BEST of the best and we focus on finding candidates who are a strong cultural fit. We have a 3 month 'Discovery Period' in place that allows us to get to know each new hire better and assess their skill set. If you are applying for a management level position, you will be part of a different Discovery Period for each step of the ladder.

Company Overview

WhiteOwl provides ERP and CRM consulting services, as well as cloud computing services, to growing businesses and non-profits. Our services include business process consulting, application (ERP, CRM, etc.) implementation, custom software, cloud and virtualization services, managed and virtual CIO services, and business continuity and security consulting.

WhiteOwl is also the developer and implementer of PaperSave®, a cloud-based document management, workflow, and transaction automation software product. In addition, we are resellers and partners for Microsoft, Intacct, and Blackbaud technologies.

Based in South Florida, we were founded in 1997, and have over 1,000 clients throughout the United States and internationally. WhiteOwl is the technology affiliate of MBAF, a top-40 CPA and consulting firm. To learn more about WhiteOwl, visit https://www.gowhiteowl.com/.

Our Culture

We collaborate with one another and are fast paced! We are committed to our clients, and, at the same time, we are committed to making ourselves and each other better.

We attend sporting events which include baseball, basketball, football, and hockey for our local teams. We get together for "Happy Hour, wear our WhiteOwl shirts for bowling nights, and have internal clubs and leadership groups.

We are good community citizens with a strong desire to give back. We are heavily involved in various non-profit initiatives which include beach clean-ups, Feeding South Florida, the Back to School Drive, amongst others. Our Holiday parties are the talk of the town; every year tops the year before!

We believe in developing and mentoring our employees for, frankly, selfish reasons. We want you to stay! Therefore, we invest in you by tapping into your growth potential. The sky is the limit at WhiteOwl!

Position Summary

Our PaperSave® professional services organization, a part of WhiteOwl and the MBAF accounting firm, delivers document management and workflow solutions to small and medium sized North American and international businesses and foundations.

Position Summary

The Marketing Coordinator assists in planning and executes marketing programs and activities that are in line with the larger goals of WhiteOwl with a strong focus on generating and nurturing sales leads. Working with the director of marketing and key executives, the coordinator will establish realistic and attainable goals for each program/initiative. The marketing coordinator works with all departments of WhiteOwl to build internal relationships, ensuring all sales and marketing needs are addressed.

Responsibilities
Works together with and provides support to sales and marketing as necessary including the development, review, and enhancement of all firm collateral materials, including brochures, presentations, and other sales/marketing resources including proposal development support
Plans and execute all email marketing campaigns including newsletters, alerts, and lead generation/nurturing campaigns
Works with outsourced vendors to create all content including blogs, whitepapers, videos, case studies, etc.
Coordinates website maintenance and updates; manages relationship with vendor
Organizes and coordinates cross-selling initiatives with MBAF
Coordinates all aspects of client-related events including learning events, live demos, webinars, etc.
Collaborates, plans, and executes all tradeshow events may include travel
Assist in social media strategy and execution
Works with affiliates cross-functional marketing team to help coordinate/execute marketing initiatives
Performs other duties and special projects, as assigned
Qualifications and Requirements
Bachelors degree in marketing, or business degree, required
Two to Three (23) years marketing experience, preferred
Knowledge in Adobe Suite, preferred
Knowledge of digital/email marketing, Marketing Automation (Act-On) and CRM (Microsoft Dynamics) is a plus
Knowledge of Social Media platforms such as Hootsuite is a plus
Excellent writing skills; critical-thinker; team-oriented; detailed; multi-tasker
High initiative and aptitude to work with minimal supervision
Ability to manage multiple priorities
Strong judgment, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities
Strong MS Office, Outlook, PowerPoint and knowledge of HTML

Job Title: Transition Plus Association- Business Development and Marketing Coordinator
Job Description:
Transition Plus Program Objectives: We enable transitioning military to heal and learn a new career, reintegrating into rural America. Transition Plus is creating an Aeroponic Tower Farm and Education Center in Summerfield, KS. OUr administrative headquarters is in Leawood, KS. Sustainable agriculture and economic growth are essential to national security, and we’re proud to help prepare veterans for these important job opportunities.

Goal of the Project: The Business Development & Sustainability VISTA member will work with the Board of Directors to build our organizational, administrative, and financial capacity by developing and strengthening business practices to enhance business development, capacity building through grant writing & donor retention, nonprofit partnerships, and marketing to better serve
transitioning veterans and our rural communities.

This VISTA member will impact poverty by helping transitioning veterans avoid alcoholism, homelessness and thoughts of suicide. At the same time, this program assists the rural community with much needed economic growth and the region will have access to locally
grown healthy food & healthy living programs year-round. As a result of the VISTA member’s service, Transition Plus business practices, capacity and capabilities will be enhanced, marketing plans will be more effective, the Tower Farm facility will be production-ready, year 1 staffing in place and trained, and funding for years 1-3 identified.

First Objective:
Assess and improve the business plan utilized by Transition Plus for the Summerfield Tower Farm and Education Center and create or revise organization staffing plans, sales, marketing and distribution projections to improve effectiveness and sustainability.
Member Activities:
1. The VISTA member will improve capacity for the association through marketing
activities that will likely include social media and other means of communication –
externally and internally
a. Online & Social media presence (Google, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, etc)
b. Brochures, Presentations, E-newsletters and other Communications
2. Assist the association President in marketing all essential areas:
a. Attracting active military and veterans into our programs (open to civilians too)
b. Developing community support with donors, foundations, & customers
c. Marketing Tower Farm & Education Center offerings
i. produce to retail & wholesale customers
ii. beekeeping
iii. entrepreneurship (e.g. network marketing, grocery store, trades)
3. Assist the association Board with business administration (e.g. state and federal
reporting, taxes, SAMS and D&B updates, insurance, banking)

Second Objective:
Assess and improve the current capital project plan and operations plan to establish the Summerfield Tower Farm and Education Center facility GOAL: improve effectiveness and sustainability
Member Activities:
1. Recommend utilization of funds raised through KS Tax Credits and other sources
reserved for establishing the Tower Farm and Education Center in Summerfield
2. Research and recommend cost savings
Objective of the Assignment (06/01/2020 – 05/31/2021)
Assess volunteer & employee recruitment and training plans used to operate the Tower Farm
in Summerfield GOAL: improve effectiveness and sustainability.
Member Activities:
1. Evaluate staffing objectives and assist in developing or revising job descriptions and
recruiting plans for (primarily Veterans) employees, volunteers, trainees & students.
2. Assist in staff and employee recruitment and development.
3. Assist in creation of the Tower Farmer training package encompassing
entrepreneurship, tower farm aeroponics, and market-driven growing and
distribution.

Third Objective:
Assist with the ongoing fundraising program for Transition Plus emphasizing immediate needs for Summerfield Tower Farm and Education Center
Member Activities:
1. Assist the Board in Fundraising campaigns and donor support
2. Assist the Board with donation tracking and appropriate utilization
3. Identify and develop competitive applications for appropriate funding opportunities
including grants and private investments.
4. Other duties as assigned by either the President, Secretary or Treasurer.

Fourth Objective:
Assist with community outreach & partnerships with the rural community, community
organizations, local businesses, and public education institutions to increase knowledge of the
Summerfield Tower Farm and Education Center.
Member Activities:
1. Develop informational marketing materials used in the ongoing campaign
2. Assist with monthly outreach meetings with community organizations, local
businesses, and public education institutions to increase awareness of the
Summerfield Tower Farm an Education Center.

Required Skills:
Excellent written and oral communication skills; the ability to develop different products for different audiences
Nonprofit or business management experience, grant-writing and fundraising experience
An interest in serving veterans/enhancing economic opportunities in rural America
Social media marketing
Marketing
The ability to identify funding opportunities
Community outreach
Experience recruiting participants for nonprofit programs a plus

Please note that VISTA positions are volunteer positions, although a living wage stipend and relocation stipend are provided by the program at a pre-determined rate based on the location of the service project. Upon succesful completion of the year of service, the VISTA member is eligible for an education award or an additional cash stipend. The VISTA internship begins 6/01/2020 and ends 5/31/2021. Work will begin remotely due to COVID-19.

Two Sigma is a different kind of investment manager. Since 2001, we have used data science and technology to derive insights that forecast the future and discover value in markets worldwide. Our team of scientists, technologists and academics looks beyond traditional finance to understand the bigger picture and develop creative solutions to some of the world’s most difficult economic problems. Our work spans markets and industries, from insurance and securities to private investments and new ventures.

Two Sigma seeks an experienced writer to support the firm’s thought leadership efforts, with a particular focus on topics in data science and engineering. Sitting within the Marketing & Communications team, this individual will help drive the evolution of Two Sigma’s thought leadership platform through content creation, distribution, and measurement, as well as by contributing to strategy development.
The candidate must demonstrate exceptional writing and editing abilities, a broad understanding of brand and digital marketing, prior work experience in scientific fields, technology, and/or financial services, and insatiable intellectual curiosity. Finally, this candidate must be able to absorb new concepts quickly, possess strong collaboration and interpersonal skills, and be an organized, creative self-starter.

You will take on the following responsibilities:

Help drive growth and development of Two Sigma’s thought leadership platform
Source content by liaising with internal contributors
Write and edit content in collaboration with internal partners
Assist with content distribution on Two Sigma’s website, social channels, and other venues
Assist with measurement of content performance and impact
Help research and create other content, as needed

You should possess the following qualifications:

5-8 years’ experience in producing high-quality, authentic, and differentiated thought leadership for premium financial and/or technology brands, although we would also consider other relevant backgrounds, such as journalism or science communications.
Outstanding writing and verbal communication skills
Ability to manage relationships, work cross-functionally, juggle projects and partners, and earn trust from senior stakeholders
Bachelor’s degree is required

Core Benefits: Fully paid medical and dental insurance premiums for employees and dependents, 401k match, employer-paid life & disability insurance
Perks: Onsite gyms with laundry service, wellness activities, casual dress, snacks, game rooms
Learning: Tuition reimbursement, conference and training sponsorship
Time Off: Generous vacation, sick days, and paid caregiver leaves

Coursera is a leading online learning platform for higher education, where 53 million learners from around the world come to learn skills of the future. Nearly 200 of the world’s top universities and industry educators partner with Coursera to offer courses, Specializations, certificates, and degree programs. 2,300 companies trust the company’s enterprise platform Coursera for Business to transform their talent. Coursera for Government equips government employees and citizens with in-demand skills to build a competitive workforce. Coursera for Campus empowers any university to offer high-quality, job-relevant online education to students, alumni, faculty, and staff. Coursera is backed by leading investors that include Kleiner Perkins, New Enterprise Associates, Learn Capital, and SEEK Group.

The Content Platform team works on the fundamental building blocks for Coursera's course experience. This experience is 2-sided: learners want to learn by engaging actively with material and in many cases, earn a credential supported by rigorous and robust assessments, while content-creation partners want to author and grade content efficiently and effectively, with tools and data providing a feedback loop that allows them to create high-quality content. As a platform-focused team, we seek impact by building a customizable experience that can be used for a wide range of users.
Your Responsibilities...
Design and implement scalable systems and infrastructures
Continuous improvement of foundational components in the dimensions of configurability and quality
Measure your work thoroughly, analyze results, and generate hypotheses to drive new product changes through A/B testing
Setup monitoring and testing of your APIs and services to better understand real time health of your products
Your Skills:
5+ years of experience working in a relevant software engineering role
Expertise in designing highly-scalable and performant micro-services and storage layers using common frameworks, languages, and cloud infrastructure (e.g. Java, Play/Scala, MySql, Cassandra, Elastic Search, Kafka, AWS)
Experience in contributing to or leading large projects with cross-functional stakeholders
Comfortable working in a fast-moving team environment (we deploy many times a day!)Data-driven and strongly motivated by success and learnings through experiments and metrics analysis

Donnelley Financial Solutions (DFIN) is a leader in risk and compliance solutions, providing insightful technology, industry expertise and data insights to clients across the globe. We’re here to help you make smarter decisions with insightful technology, industry expertise and data insights at every stage of your business and investment lifecycles. As markets fluctuate, regulations evolve and technology advances, we’re there. And through it all, we deliver confidence with the right solutions in moments that matter.
DFIN ActiveDisclosure℠ is a financial reporting solution specifically designed for companies that rely on the Microsoft Office® productivity suite to draft, collaborate and finalize SEC disclosures. ActiveDisclosure helps streamline content creation, review and distribution improving efficiency, governance and the overall quality of all financial reports. The ActiveDisclosure Account Manager at RR Donnelley is a member of the sales delivery team for the ActiveDisclosure product line. Generally, this role is responsible for managing a pipeline of sales opportunities, supporting Regional Managing Directors, field Sales Executives and Deal Managers with prospect engagement, and utilizing teams to deliver client wins.
Responsibilities
• Build and maintain a strong understanding of the product and services associated with the ActiveDisclosure product line.
• Develop and maintain relationships with sales delivery team members including Regional Managing Directors, field Sales Executives, and Deal Managers within your territory
• Prospect and qualify sales leads, coordinating as required with the DFIN field sales team
• Manage and track sales opportunities and forecasts within Salesforce.com, providing reports to the Director of Sales as requested
• Manage a complex sales cycle, starting with the needs assessment process for each prospect, identifying pain points and determining the fit for our solutions
• Identify various buying roles within each prospect account and develop a suitable sales execution plan
• Educate prospects on the value of an ActiveDisclosure solution and how it addresses their needs
• Engage the Solutions Engineer at the appropriate stage of the sales cycle to tailor more detailed solutions presentations and/or software demonstrations
• As needed, engage the Implementation team at the appropriate stage of the sales cycle to assess technical needs and prepare an implementation plan
• Prepare and deliver sales quotes to the prospect
• Work with Sales Executives to successfully close opportunities
• Coordinate with the Post-Sale and Services team to hand off new clients
Qualifications
• Proven ability to sell enterprise software licensing and/or projects in the $50-500k range with yearly results of $2M or greater.
• Ability to prospect, develop and close software opportunities
• Thorough understanding of the enterprise software needs of finance and compliance teams
• General understanding of the financial and/or regulatory disclosure process
• Strong verbal and written communication skills with a focus on negotiation, needs analysis, positioning, business justification, and closing techniques
• Superior presentation skills
• A broad understanding of the financial close process and the SEC filing process
• An in-depth understanding of the technology used by public companies for external reporting
• 4 - 6 years of quota carrying, technology based sales experience
• Proven track record of B2B solution selling with demonstrated ability to sell to all levels of management up to, and including, the C-suite
• Experience in meeting and exceeding quotas or annual sales targets of at least $2M
• Experience tracking a sales pipeline using sales automation software (Salesforce.com preferred)
• CPA highly desired but not required

A Few Signs That The Job Isn't Right for You
Can’t someone else do that?”, “That’s not my responsibility”, and “Why does this depend on me?” are routine parts of your inner dialogue.
You’ve said, “The deadline is tomorrow, but it’s 6:00 PM so it’ll have to wait” and meant it.
You assess someone who lets a deadline slip because they’re working 70 hours per week serving clients as just “not having it all together.”
You often ask questions of others that can be answered with a brief Google search, phone call, or record check.
You believe file versioning and naming conventions are a stupid waste of time.
You think it’s unreasonable when stakeholders expect you to provide information that will give them assurance that tasks are being completed appropriately.
If you don’t know what to do next, you wait. And wait.
You’re more worried about what people think of you than the quality of the outcome you produce.
You resent ambiguous or unstructured situations and require perfect clarity at all times to be happy at work.
Changes to plan, multiple revisions, and new assignments that pop up unexpectedly are unacceptable to you.
You are comfortable letting team members down.

We work hard in the quest to have high impact and deliver exemplary client service that supports our client retention and overall growth story. We have consistently been rated a Top Company to Work for in Arizona.

Digital Marketing Manager - Covington

The Digital Marketing Manager develops and implements the Company Brand Strategy across all digital channels (email marketing, digital advertising, social media, paid search, affiliates, etc). This position is responsible for growing the agency by developing and managing the marketing team, ensuring timely execution of strategies that drive qualified lead generation, and using KPIs to understand results and set marketing goals.

Responsibilities
Take ownership of all company marketing process; maintain current documentation of all processes and suggest improvements and updates as often as needed

Define and manage the Canopy brand to engage and retain ideal clients

Provide leadership and management during weekly meetings with the Social Proof team
Ensure high-level and consistent follow-up between copywriting, graphic design, ad management, & social media for cohesive strategy & quick execution

Support leadership growth strategies by delivering and executing on campaigns at an extremely fast pace, including email marketing campaigns and lists, monthly marketing and content calendars, website and SEO audience growth, strategic PR relationships and more

Systems in place to manage all areas of the marketing department, including budgeting, performance reporting, department growth, internal communications and brand development

3+ years of digital marketing experience

Proficient in funnel marketing strategies
Excellent communicator and relationship manager

You’ll organize calendars, schedule and facilitate meetings, create agendas, consolidate documents, capture and send notes and next steps to keep all teams and tasks moving forward. You will also help develop presentations as needed for regular project updates and leadership meetings.
A deep knowledge of project management, as well as organization, time management skills and a positive, can-do attitude are key to this role. You must enjoy working at a fast pace and cope well under pressure. You should also have strong interpersonal skills including flexibility, collaboration, a high level of motivation and the ability to work as part of a team as well as an individual contributor.

• Project management for select retail formats and experiences
• Support the development and execution of store experience and marketing materials, like store signage, customer journey mapping, and owned assets/paid media
• Develop and facilitate projects briefs as well as required creative reviews and approvals
• Create a regular meeting and email schedule to report on project status, highlight challenges and suggest next steps

Strong interpersonal skills, able to work cross-functionally. Demonstrated initiative, ability to handle multiple projects in a fast paced environment. Strong project management and follow-up skills. Must be PC literate with a good command of word processing, presentation/graphics packages, spreadsheets and have strong Internet skills.

The Basics:

As a Director, Product Marketing you will be a key enabler for all facets of our go-to-market strategy as it pertains to our endpoint security solution portfolio. You'll play a critical role on a quickly growing team with the opportunity to make a significant impact in a short period of time. You will be responsible for product messaging, positioning, sales and partner enablement, new product launches, revenue planning and collaboration with the demand generation team. You will be the "voice of the customer" in the way we present our products and solutions to the world.

Our ideal candidate will be creative, analytical, and extremely well organized, with a high-level of attention to detail. You must have demonstrated experience creating interesting narratives out of complex topics, have excellent written and oral communication skills and the ability to influence and drive initiatives across cross-functional teams.

What you'll do:
Be the voice of the customer and oversee the marketing of the security suite of products and solutions
Be the quarterback for the product & solutions go-to-market plan that aligns with the revenue goals and develop marketing assets and overall execution plan in support of major launches.
Analyze the market, buyers, trends, industry-specific problems, and competitors to create strategic positioning that differentiates Tanium in the endpoint security market
Identify target personas, understand their key business problems and pain points and articulate Tanium's value proposition to drive desired outcomes.
Work closely with product management, sales leadership, enablement, customer success and marketing teams across all activities
Leverage strong content creation background to develop content, including sales tools, whitepapers, custom one-sheets, event collateral and thought-leadership content
Collaborate with demand generation teams to execute targeted campaigns that drive pipeline
Partner with sales, product etc. to facilitate feedback and drive continuous improvement of the product positioning, sales enablement tools etc.
Conduct market research, including buyer interviews to inform marketing content and create actionable insights
Present to customers, partners, and sales teams
Travel as needed - roughly 25%
We're looking for someone with:

Education:
BA or BS in Marketing or equivalent experience required
MBA strongly preferred
Experience:
We are looking for someone who is excited to work in a fast moving, high growth company for an opportunity to drive revenue growth and advance your career.
8+ years minimum of experience in product marketing, solutions marketing or outbound product management required
Experience crafting go-to-market strategy including pricing and packaging.
Experience marketing of an enterprise software solution to address cybersecurity issues
Experience at a business-to-business enterprise software company required
Experience understanding technology at a deep level and ability translate to business needs concisely required
Experience developing presentations to customers, sales teams, and partners preferred
Solid experience in positioning work and writing marketing plans for complex products and/or market dynamics
Other:
Strong presentation skills required. Must be comfortable speaking in front of all levels from entry level employees to the C Suite
You are a team player, knowing how to work well cross-functionally to rally teams around your strategy and plans
You can balance both art and science of marketing – having great creative intuition and an insatiable appetite for data and insights
Understanding of basic branding principles: brand identity, building equity, brand voice etc. a plus.
You possess excellent business judgement; ability to prioritize independently, overcome blockers, create clarity and move forward even in ambiguous circumstances
A profound sense of ownership and accountability is required along with the ability to influence (and inspire) and sometimes skeptical audiences
About Tanium:

At Tanium, we offer a proven platform for endpoint visibility and control that transforms how the world's largest and most sophisticated organizations manage and secure their computing devices with unparalleled speed and agility. There's a reason why more than half of the Fortune 100, top retailers and financial institutions, and four branches of the US Armed Forces rely on Tanium.

Our unstoppable spirit, drive to do the right thing and win as a team attitude has earned us the rank of 7th on the Forbes list of "Top 100 Private Companies in Cloud Computing" for 2019 and 10th on FORTUNE's list of the "100 Best Medium Workplaces."

On a mission. Together.

At Tanium, we are stewards of a culture that emphasizes the importance of collaboration, respect, and diversity. In our pursuit of revolutionizing the way some of the largest enterprises and governments in the world solve their most difficult IT challenges, we are strengthened by our unique perspectives and by our collective actions.

We are an organization with stakeholders around the world and it's imperative that the diversity of our customers and communities is reflected internally in our team members. We strive to create a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone feels they have opportunities to succeed and grow because we know that only together can we do great things

At Tanium, we take care of our employees and their communities with things like 5 days of Volunteer Time Off.

Company Description

Diamond Kinetics (diamondkinetics.com) is a growing sports-tech company focused in baseball and softball. As the market leader in the space, Diamond Kinetics combines motion-based-sensors with mobile applications and a robust digital platform to provide hitting and throwing data to players, parents, coaches, and teams – helping them understand their performance, improve, and have more fun playing the game they love. DK solutions enable player development, superior equipment fitting, objective scouting, and engagement-driven entertainment.

We are a fast-paced, performance-driven company where responsibility comes quickly, and exceeding expectations is the expectation. The work is challenging and exciting, especially for those who love sports. We believe in stretching for growth as a company, and as professionals, and seek competitive, self-motivated people as teammates who do the same.

Job Description

The Marketing Coordinator position is designed to elevate the output and efficiency of Diamond Kinetics Marketing Department. This role provides an essential function at Diamond Kinetics, steering content workflow through the company while coordinating with other key departments, including Product, Development, Customer Service, Sales, and Partner Management.

The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for overseeing projects from inception through completion and must understand the scope, business objectives, content strategy, and editorial calendar needs driving each project.

The Marketing Coordinator will have line-of-sight across Marketing, Commercial, and Product initiatives and will act in a key operational role to help spin up projects, assign resources, and get team members moving against a schedule. This role emphasizes execution, but will also require an understanding of the marketing strategy behind the tactics.

The role is divided into two primary areas – DK-Driven-Marketing projects conceived and executed in channels controlled by us – and Partner Marketing projects that execute in the partner’s space. Delivery will cut across digital and real-world tactics.

This position requires a self-motivated person with a problem-solving, can-do attitude who will take the initiative and work effectively with limited supervision. The Marketing Coordinator must be very organized and able to help the teams push multiple projects forward simultaneously.

Qualifications

Manage Marketing Workflow (75% of Effort)

• Manage the workflow of the DK Marketing Department across all phases of content creation, production, and distribution.

• Set timelines, coordinate internal team resources, and marshal external vendors to get projects done on-time and within budget.

• Coordinate with the Director of Marketing and the full Marketing Team to help build marketing strategies and annual plans.

• Coordinate with the Director of Marketing and the full Marketing Team to establish the editorial calendar. Then set due dates and run regular team meetings to facilitate asset delivery and review/approval processes.

• Field marketing requests from the larger Commercial Team - assess the need, define the deliverables, set timelines, and manage those projects thru delivery.

• Ensure team members understand their assignments and help them deal with inter- dependencies and overcome roadblocks.

• Assemble and communicate digital marketing specs for ad-units and organic content so the team can build-out all requisite materials.

• Manage DK’s email schedule to ensure smooth production, testing, delivery, reporting of email programs.

• Oversee website updates and ad-hoc projects.

• Oversee the production of real-world marketing components, include assets for events, conventions, POS, and print-collateral. Manage printing and manufacturing of physical marketing assets.

• Coordinate with media buying resources, internal and external, to ensure paid media components are delivered on time, run according to spec, and tracked effectively in DK’s reporting systems.

• Help facilitate DK’s photo and video shoots to ensure the team and vendors have everything they need.

• Set timelines for regular reporting and facilitate systems & processes to streamline delivery.

Support Partner Marketing Efforts (25% of Effort with Spikes in Attention)

• Work closely with Partner contacts to assess and define marketing projects – Be the liaison/gatekeeper of marketing projects between DK and our partners.

• Work to understand the strategic differences, intricacies, and idiosyncrasies of each partner to maximize the value of DK’s marketing efforts with each.

• Develop specifications and detailed timelines for Partner-Marketing projects, ensuring the DK and Partner teams understand their roles and responsibilities.

• Integrate Partner-Marketing deliverables into the overall DK Marketing workflow.

• Facilitate delivery of DK assets to the Partner.

• Check with Partners on a regular basis to ensure execution in their digital channels and real-world formats is going according to plan. Seek to optimize efforts whenever possible.

• Facilitate and continually improve reporting from Partner back into DK’s overall Marketing reporting infrastructure.

Be Customer-Centric and Leverage Functional Expertise to Create Value (Ongoing)

• Understand and apply knowledge about the sports of baseball and softball and the activity cycle of players and coaches throughout the year – stay current.

• Understand Diamond Kinetics’ technology, products and services at a very deep level.

• Understand internal and external customer requirements, expectations and needs.

• Deliver on commitments and create value for all customers.

• Stay informed about functional industry/practices and emerging technologies and approaches.

Experience Required

• BA or BS – Business/Communications/Marketing Preferred.

• 2-4 years of consistent success in tech company or digital marketing agency.

• Proven ability to assess a marketing need... and translate it into a strategic project that can be managed.

• Ability to multi-task, manage multiple simultaneous projects, and meet tight deadlines.

• Experience with project management processes and tools.

• High-level of knowledge digital campaign execution and coordination

• Strong cognitive skills including problem solving, decision making and analysis

• Experience managing budgets

• Ability to work occasional evening and weekend hours

• Excellent organization skills.

• Team player.

Additional Desired Experience

• Solid understanding of web development, app development principles.

• An understanding of email and/or CRM systems.

• Base-level knowledge of digital marketing tools such as Facebook Business Manager, Google Adwords, Google Tag Manager, and GA.

• Start-up and/or early-stage company experience

• Played competitive level amateur baseball or softball.

Additional Information

• Applicants must currently reside in the Pittsburgh area

• Requires reliable transportation to and from place of work

• Expect to work occasional evening and weekend hours. Potential for limited travel.

• Flexible work environment

• Competitive compensation package including salary, bonus, stock options, health insurance and 401K plan

The intent of this job description is to provide a non-exhaustive representation of the type of duties and responsibilities that will be required of the position given this title and shall not be construed as a declaration of the total of the specific duties and responsibilities of any particular position. Employees may be directed to perform job-related tasks other than those specifically presented in this description.

Diamond Kinetics may supplement, modify, or eliminate responsibilities from time to time, in its discretion. Diamond Kinetics is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity as a critical step in ensuring employee success.

The Digital Web Content Manager will responsible for the growth and development of AZEK’s online organic presence. This person will define and run an inclusive and holistic web content strategy, ensuring that content organization and availability is effective to acquire and engage prospective and existing customers. This person will be directly responsible for auditing and organizing all changes on the website.

Job Duties and Responsibilities
Define and execute against a web content marketing strategy that includes both top of funnel and mid funnel content. Website content types may include: web pages, projects, whitepapers, infographics, etc.
Develop web digital content (copy, graphics, photos, infographics) that strengthens our story and enhances the online experience.
Maintain ownership of the quality and consistency of web content and structure in CMS.
Production (write, edit and proof) and content posting across digital channels.
Seek out internal stakeholders to source ideas, stories and collaborate with messaging across platforms.
Partner closely with product, brand and web teams for alignment.
Leverage metrics to make data-driven decisions about content
Ensure communications are innovative and modernized by actively seeking new techniques and trends.
Partner with brand, media and social teams to share content, deliver consistent message and maintain brand alignment
Be able to test content and website tactics with proven techniques backed by data (i.e. Google Analytics or other testing tools) and constantly monitor their performance
Provide Senior Manager Weekly Analytics/insights to adjust strategy if need be
Organize and execute changes and requests from multiple business owners

Key point person for content/digital experience of other platforms with third party vendors to project manage production schedules and provide critical feedback

2-5+ years of experience in digital communications or digital marketing and content development
2-5+ years of experience utilizing Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and Microsoft Office Suite as well as a working knowledge of basic audio/video editing software
2-5+ years of direct experience with content management systems

Wish is looking for a Video Editor/Motion Graphics Artist with extensive experience taking the lead on all components of post-production from kick-off to delivery and makes working in a fast-paced environment and managing multiple projects look easy. The Video Editor/Motion Graphics Artist will work collaboratively alongside our Director of Creative, producers, designers, writers, and social media managers to create content that makes an impact.

As a Video Editor, you will be responsible for using your editorial experience to design engaging videos for a wide variety of audiences. You will need to be able to thrive as a self-starter while thinking of ways to improve processes and manage production timelines.

We are in a perpetual state of preparing, full-on production, and finishing/delivering. The ideal candidate is a highly motivated, organized individual with experience in all aspects of post-production.

For internal use only: #LI-JO1

What You'll Do
Edit for a variety of campaigns, this includes social, trade, etc.
Post-production supervision utilizing outside vendors.
Oversee the department's media, assets, and backup processes; including on set.
Spearhead creative for occasional projects on a case-by-case basis.
Help create videos for in-app, ads, social media, and more!
Who You Are:
You work well in an extremely fast-paced environment with high volume projects and quick turn-around.
Your portfolio of work showcases work you have edited.
Working knowledge of color correction, audio mixing, as well as industry standards for editorial and motion graphics deliveries.
Experience editing in a variety of voices and styles, including documentary, digital ads, explainer videos, influencer content, and commercials.
Deep knowledge of industry best practices, codecs, camera types, media management.
VFX experience is a plus.
Expert knowledge of Premiere, After Effects, Illustrator, and Photoshop.
Proficiency with GoogleDocs (Particularly Google Sheets).
Social media savvy, with a deep understanding of Facebook, Instagram, Tiktok, and Youtube video campaigns.
7+ years of relevant and recent experience in a fast-paced and demanding post-production environment.
Efficient, excellent attention to detail and organization.
General knowledge of on set production practices and workflows.
Ability to work independently and complete projects on time.
Bachelor's degree and valid California driver's license (willing to drive occasionally).
