Job Title: Marketing Coordinator

Location: New York City

About inMarket

inMarket is the leader in digital advertising and predictive location solutions that help brands sense and respond to consumer needs in real-time. Since 2010, inMarket has helped thousands of brands leverage SDK-derived, opt-in consumer data to better understand who consumers are, why they make decisions and how best to reach them.

With inMarket's suite of solutions, brands can better understand consumers, activate real-time digital advertising in the moments that matter and generate better campaign attribution.

inMarket's Moments solution drives an average of 7x the performance of traditional digital media and was a key factor in winning Best Mobile Marketing Platform at the 2019 Digiday Awards. inMarket, headquartered in Los Angeles, has offices in Atlanta, Bentonville, Chicago, New York and San Francisco. For more information, visit www.inmarket.com.

Job Description

inMarket is looking for a Marketing Coordinator to support our Sales & Marketing Teams. This person will work closely with our marketing team team to help track and distribute leads from inbound web leads, tradeshows, local events, conferences, demand generation initiatives (whitepapers, insights, benchmarks) . Strong analytical skills are required for this role.

Duties
Assist with planning, pacing, reporting and campaign management of large-scale digital and offline campaigns
Coordinate and track marketing automation process from demand and lead generation to optimize lead to pipeline conversion
Improve and optimize MQL to sales accepted lead percentage
Track and distribute leads across 25+ sales people
Support incoming RFP/RFI requests and prospect proposal development
Assist with events/conferences as an onsite member of the inMarket team
Requirements
1+ years of experience in marketing or related field
Strong verbal & written communication skills
Very comfortable working in Microsoft office, specifically Excel or Google sheets
Experience working in marketing
Structured thinking and organizational mindset
Self-motivation and keen eye for detail
Benefits Summary
Competitive salary, stock options, flexible vacation
Medical, dental and Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
Company Matched 401(k)
Unlimited PTO (Within reason)
Talented co-workers and management
Agile Development Program (For continued learning/professional development)
Paid Paternity & Maternity Leave
inMarket is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, or veteran status.

Our leading Entertainment client is seeking a Community manager to join their team for 6 months! This position is fully remote.

Who Are We?

We’re looking for a creative powerhouse who will manage our social properties targeting the US Latino community. You’ll be responsible for the day-to-day management of our social properties, managing an external team of writers and designers, collaborating on strategies to launch and manage new social platforms, and developing original content. We’re looking for someone who is deeply passionate about elevating Latino culture, who can authentically represent fandom through our brand. You have a deep knowledge of the platforms where Latino audiences spend their time and can both identify and react appropriately to trends and cultural conversations. You have strong editorial judgment, sharp copy-writing skills, and the ability to make quick decisions.

Responsibilities:
Primary role: Community Management
Manage all social platforms
Create, manage, and execute on editorial calendar in Airtable
Prepare and post content on platforms in accurate, timely manner
Respond to comments from fans, talent, and notable influencers -- identifying unique opportunities to elevate community conversation
Manage external team of writers, designers, and vendors and well as internal Creative Studio teams
Manage the creation of assets and formats from ideation to execution
Run weekly brainstorm meetings and participation in editorial SLACK channel
Note platform updates and trends as they happen and make corresponding recommendations for the brand
Create weekly reports that highlight top performing and bottom performing posts and sentiment
Lead reactive opportunities
Identify reactive opportunities for titles
Liaise with title leads to develop and communicate promotional plans from Con Todo platforms
Contribute to the development of new platforms
Collaborate with Con Todo team on new-platform strategy with operational and creative lens.
Identify creators or writers who can contribute editorial content
Project manage creation of clip based content
Requirements:
Proficiency with the Spanish language i.e. Speak, Read, and Write
Strong Creative Instincts You’re constantly thinking of new ideas for posts, IG stories, and recurring features. You see a piece of content and know how to make it better, funnier, or more sincere. You love creating content that makes people laugh, engage in thoughtful discussion, and feel all the feelings.
Strong Communication Skills You will be working with a small core team of creatives as well as managers who will come in and out of the work on the periphery. You are clear and concise in speech and writing, you maintain calm poise in stressful situations, you are transparent and thoughtful in your communication about why or why you are not doing something.
Attention to Detail We move quickly here and plans often change at the last minute. You have strong attention to detail from grammar in your writing, to spotting typos in captions, to making up to the minute time and file changes in our content calendar.
Excellent Creative Writing Skills The account is developing a strong and differentiated tone of voice. We are more than just a landing place for our Latino content, we want someone who can use assets and comments to build an impactful, consistent online persona and an engaged community by identifying unique community management opportunities, and editing writer-submitted copy & assets to match our overall tone.
Deep Understanding of Instagram & Twitter Platforms You know what file formats are needed for the platforms, such as how to optimize IGTV videos for in feed preview, when to use a carousel vs a grid take over, when to use a Twitter thread vs individual Tweets, etc. You strive for high quality downloads over screengrabs and are deeply interested in asset performance and the future of each platform.
Ability to Be Nimble Things. Change. Constantly. You’re nimble and don’t get stressed by last minute priority changes or asks. You can adapt quickly to new asset requests without losing sight of other priorities. You identify creative opportunities that start in the community and work to make them bigger and bigger and bigger!
Deep Knowledge of Latino Communities You are well-versed in the many subgroups that make up the Latino community – from cultural references to slang – and are tapped in to the conversations these different groups are having on social.
YOU LOVE COMMUNITY MANAGEMENT Community Management - interacting with our audience, developing relationships and inside jokes, and being willing to be both vulnerable and funny with our users - is the backbone of the Latino accounts. You are strategic in who, when, and what you respond to. You love building online community and being a part of it!

D. Alexander is an early-stage high growth company that is backed by world-class category leader investors and founded by proven entrepreneurs. The company is a pioneering hospitality brand that owns and manages a portfolio of single-family vacation rental properties, operated as a boutique hotel, with a consistent and technology-enabled experience in every home. D. Alexander is capitalizing on a gap in the ‘alternative-stayʼ vacation market, the fastest-growing segment of lodging. Technology has changed the way that single-family homes are bought, sold, valued and managed and a new asset class is emerging, driven by the likes of Airbnb, Vrbo and more. This evolution has presented a unique opportunity for those with the resources and deep domain knowledge in short-term rentals to change the way that groups travel. As a result, D. Alexander is pioneering a new hospitality model and is well-positioned to lead the category.

Your Role: Overseeing performance marketing and revenue management, this position will focus on making data-driven decisions with the end goal of driving maximum revenue and occupancy rates. With a keen eye towards the details, the Manager of PMRM will operate under the mantra of “do more with less”, optimizing the growth strategy on the OTA’s, measuring outcomes and adapting to the consumer. The Manager of PMRM is an expert in creating and executing marketing strategies designed to drive measurable growth. Working closely with D. Alexander’s executive management and other key stakeholders, the Manager of PMRM is responsible for driving buzz and excitement around D. Alexander’s assets, converting more guests and carrying out D. Alexander’s mission of creating unforgettable experiences in memorable places. This is a unique opportunity to get in on the ground floor of an early-stage high growth business that is poised to create an entirely new asset category and change hospitality as we know it today.

In the 1st Month, you will…
· Take a deep dive into our customer experience-first approach, learn all of the benefits of staying at a D. Alexander destination home and the value we strive to deliver.
· Rely on your deep knowledge and experience across performance marketing channels to drive scale, optimize performance and increase guest bookings.
· Learn and get familiar with all other internal systems including but not limited to our property management platform, website platform, salesforce, and guest services platforms.
· Begin to formulate a list of reliable contractors to provide on-site services such as photography and videography.
· Study every asset in the portfolio to be able to best list on the OTA’s.

Sharpen your skills in Month 2 by…
· Employing a data-driven strategy in order to build and execute a digital marketing roadmap across multiple guest-centered channels.
· Playing a central role in new property rollouts, capturing the key elements and using the elements to tell a story of each listing.
· Conduct research by market to analyze supply and demand of rental home inventory, average nightly rates on comparative properties and occupancy rates.
· Gather insights on traveler buying behavior and identify key insights including but not limited to the average lead time to booking, the ratio of bookings by OTA and non-OTA sources, unique in-market partnership opportunities to drive bookings outside of the OTAs or company-owned assets.
· Evaluate dynamic pricing platforms and strategies and deploy methods to maximize gross bookings.
· Leveraging your expertise in pricing accordingly, marketing each property to increase guest bookings.

Execute in Month 3 by...
· Looking at the details, and pulling out big pictures and themes.
· Formulate big ideas from data and analytics.
· Flagging any key learnings and implement solutions that drive bookings.
· Guiding our PR/Marketing strategy to drive maximum revenue through a variety of channels including social media, email and content creation.

Desired Skills and Experiences:
· Bachelors Degree in Marketing, Marketing Analytics or Communication
· 2+ years in a B2C digital marketing role with a data-driven mindset
· Experience creating brand awareness and customer acquisition
· A proactive approach to problem-solving with strong decision-making skills
· Highly responsible, reliable and collaborativeHighly responsive, action and solution-oriented
· High proficiency in the English language (verbal and written)
· Must possess outstanding Sales skills, Guest service skills, professional presentation, and sophisticated communication skills
· Strong understanding of Google Suite and other mainstream software tools or apps
· Early-stage startup experience is a plus
· Hospitality or short-term rental industry (Airbnb/Vrbo) experience is required
· Experience with PMS systems (Guesty, Streamline), OTAs (Airbnb/VRBO), and other vacation rental software products is required
· Experience in implementing dynamic pricing strategies and or utilizing the leading marketing intelligence and pricing platforms (AirDNA, Wheelhouse, PriceLabs, BeyondPricing, PerfectPrice)
· Experience in SEO, organic search, paid advertising and google strategies is a plus
· Demonstrate a high-level understanding of the short-term rental and hospitality industries

Job Description
MARKETING COORDINATOR POSITION

To apply for this position, please be sure to copy and paste the following link into your browser:

https://app.smartsheet.com/b/form/aaa70a987ef8431e9cdc30d7f2d61886

Who we are:

KSS Architects is an award-winning architecture, planning, and interior design firm with offices in Philadelphia, Princeton and New York City. Since our founding in 1983 we have built an impressive portfolio of work for leaders in the fields of education, commerce, and community.

The Marketing Department plays a significant role in communicating our firm’s mission and values, and strategically aligning these with those of potential clients and projects. The ideal candidate must be able to communicate their ideas and approach in a clear and thoughtful manner, work well within a collaborative team atmosphere and should be passionate about the AEC industry.

The Marketing Coordinator will support a wide breadth of department responsibilities, in a dynamic and high-energy environment. The ideal candidate possesses a bachelor’s degree at minimum and 1-3 years of experience in a marketing/proposal development role for a professional services firm. A degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, Writing or a related discipline is preferred. Experience with project lifecycles, marketing campaigns, design, and/or the A/E/C industry is a plus.

Marketing Coordinator Role and Responsibilities:

The Marketing Coordinator will support a wide breadth of projects, including proposal development, graphics development, content development, communications and public relations, opportunity forecasting, website maintenance, and internal/external coordination:
Prepare, edit, and assemble proposals, qualifications, presentations ranging in size and complexity from single page letters to multi-volume bound submissions.
Prepare presentations and interview materials for client interviews, speaking opportunities, and other engagements.
Collaborate with design teams, administration, consultants, and partner firms.
Plan, organize, and maintain accurate website pages, project pages, resumes, business cards, and other project-related data for marketing use.
Format, edit, and graphics creation for web, digital, and print collateral.
Ensure final graphics and layouts are visually appealing and on-brand
Develop graphic content including organizational charts, infographics, tables, and other technical and non-technical graphics that stay in line with brand standards
Support the coordination of conferences, speaking engagements, professional networking events, and company events.
Accomplish additional miscellaneous as-needed projects to support marketing campaign developments and targeted efforts, ex. social/professional networking presence, email blasts.
Required Skills and Capabilities:

Required:

Fluent inMicrosoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook; Adobe Acrobat/Reader, Photoshop, InDesign and Illustrator.

Effective verbal, interpersonal, and written communication.

Ability to work with quick turnaround times while balancing multiple priorities and dynamic workloads with minimal supervision.

Creative mindset with understanding of visual language and ability to transform ideas from concept into final product.

Ability to execute short-term goals infused with long term initiatives.

Job Description
MetroNet has an immediate opening for an energetic; Marketing Coordinator in Ames, IA!

At MetroNet, we pride ourselves on providing cutting-edge technology combined with outstanding customer care. We are a fast-growing telecommunication company, offering 100% fiber-optic technology. MetroNet specializes in fiber to the premise TV, voice and internet services that provide our customers with some of the fastest internet speeds in the world. Recognized for being one of the Best Places to Work in 2020 by Glassdoor. We are committed to revolutionizing the industry by enhancing the overall customer experience and optimizing the talent of our valued associates.

We’re looking for tech-savvy, innovative thinkers to join our team and help us create what’s next!

What is in it for you?
Competitive salary
80% of Medical premiums paid for by company
Company paid Disability and Life insurance
401(k) company match and 100% vested on day 1
Discounted MetroNet service in our serviceable area
Locally owned, friendly, fun atmosphere
Job Summary:

The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for developing and executing local marketing campaigns in assigned markets to gain and retain new and existing customers. Collaborates with key cross functional teams and outside vendors to support campaigns. Monitors market trends, competitive intelligence, and analyzes campaign results to recommend enhancements of local marketing strategies.

What you will be doing:
Identifies, coordinates and executes strategic market level campaigns including but not limited to events, sponsorships, partnerships, community involvement, experiential marketing, and guerilla marketing
Creates and executes go-to market campaigns for multi-dwelling unit properties and homeowner associations
Identifies and negotiates MDU/HOA Referral and Community Affiliate program partnerships
Manages campaign logistics including but not limited to deadlines, payments, assets, staffing, and results tracking
Provides ongoing market monitoring and feedback: market insights, customer contact, and associate engagement
Researches and compiles competitive intelligence to identify key concerns and opportunities
Manages on-going compliance with assigned expense budgets and adheres to purchase request and expense reporting guidelines
Provides tracking, analysis, reporting, and commentary on local marketing campaigns.
Communicates daily, weekly, monthly on local marketing campaigns and initiatives through reports and scorecards
Collaborates with cross functional teams in aligning efforts, resources and budget allocations.
Identifies and coordinates PR opportunities to support local campaign initiatives
Provides excellent internal customer service and maintains open communication with all associates, management and contractors
Maintains inventory of all local marketing assets
Performs other duties as assigned
What You Need For This Position:
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Advertising, Communications, or Sales
2+ years Marketing or equivalent experience required
Previous Cable TV, Internet, or Telecommunications industry experience preferred
Event Planning/Management, Fundraising, Experiential Marketing, Guerilla Marketing, or Sales experience a plus
Highly organized, self-motivated and strong attention to detail
Demonstrated project management and organizational skills; proven ability to manage multiple projects and priorities with excellent follow-through
Strategic thinker who can articulate objectives into actionable campaigns that produce results
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Ability to work in a fast-paced, evolving, collaborative environment
Solid interpersonal skills with a high level of professionalism; in-person, phone and email
Proficient using the latest versions of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Internet software, email and database software
If you have a strong desire to impact, the success of our organization by ensuring we continue to attract and retain committed professionals, please apply today!

MetroNet is an EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
Company Description
Headquartered in Evansville, Indiana, MetroNet is a customer-focused company providing cutting-edge fiber optic telecommunication services, including high-speed Fiber Internet, full-featured Fiber Phone, Fiber IPTV with a wide variety of programming, and a home security product called MetroNet SmartHome.

We got our start in 2005, with our first fiber optic network in Greencastle, Indiana, and have since expanded into 50+ communities throughout Indiana, Illinois, and Kentucky. All MetroNet services are delivered across our 100% fiber-optic network made up of thousands of miles of fiber optic cables connected directly to homes and businesses.

At MetroNet, we are committed to bringing state-of-the-art telecommunication services to the communities we serve by delivering services comparable or superior to those offered in large metropolitan areas. This commitment not only means better internet, television and telephone options for our customers today but also the capacity to continually provide additional products and services in the future as new uses for 100% fiber are developed.

Our commitment to our communities doesn’t stop at bringing exciting new technology. We’re also proud to have local retail stores, staffed with friendly associates and technicians who actually live in the communities we serve. We find it is always reassuring to see a familiar face when your services are installed or when you stop by our store. Our innovative store design allows customers to test drive MetroNet products at interactive kiosks, sign up for services, pay their bills, and much more.

Position Scope:

The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for providing project and administrative support for the Marketing and Sales Team. The position coordinates and completes time-sensitive and confidential work of both a routine nature and project basis.

Strategic Focus Areas:

· Manage, design, implement and administer interdepartmental and cross legacy business group projects and activities which support the growth of the company. Projects may either be an individual or team effort.

· Research and analyze industry trends, competition, regulatory filings and approvals, and intellectual property as directed.

· Optimize resources within assigned areas to maintain compliance standards and cost discipline

· Create a positive image of Anika Therapeutics through communication and interaction with key stakeholders including employees, customers, partners, vendors, and appropriate government and regulatory authorities

Specific Tactical Responsibilities:

· Facilitate the review and approval process for all marketing materials and packaging artworks

· Manage general contact email inquires and manage social media content.

· Administer projects by setting meeting agendas per project plan, measuring task progression and completion, and preparing minutes and/or reports

· Compose memos, documents, correspondence and presentations of a confidential nature for the Marketing and Sales Team as requested

· Maintain corporate contracts database and physical files

· Responsible for other duties and projects as assigned

None

· Minimum 1 year of experience in an office environment, preferably a publicly traded company

· Professional personal and telephone presentation

· Ability to maintain confidential information

Desired Experience, Knowledge, and Skills:

· Proficiency with SaaS applications, such as Prezi, Survey Monkey, and Google Forms.

· Proficiency with databases, such as Endnote and Access.

· Proficiency with secondary research tools, such as NERAC, google scholar, google patents, USPTO, FDA website, PubMed etc.

Description
Position Summary

Looking to work with a creative team who loves aviation? Are you seeking experience in marketing, creative writing and content creation with an industry leading private aviation company? Do you enjoy taking on new challenges and projects? Apply for our marketing coordinator position.

The marketing coordinator will support and contribute to marketing initiatives, while assisting in the development of new communication strategies aligned with the company’s sales and marketing objectives. The ideal candidate is self-motivated, eager to learn, organized and detail oriented. The marketing coordinator will be responsible for executing tasks in line with the company’s strategy across a diverse range of marketing functions including written communications, print and digital advertising, branding, email campaigns, event coordination, graphic design, social media and more. The coordinator will be a member of the marketing department, and work closely with other Clay Lacy departments and outside vendors (graphic designers, copy writers, social media managers, etc.) to achieve their responsibilities and performance objectives.

Performance Objectives
Participate in the development and implementation of the company’s sales and marketing strategy.
Identify stories and write articles for the Clay Lacy blog, Partner communications, and Employee newsletter.
Prepare marketing activity reports and metrics for measuring program success.
Support the maintenance and development of marketing resources such as marketing sales sheets, client databases and campaign subscribers.
Become proficient in the use and capabilities of HubSpot marketing automation software.
Further both business aviation industry knowledge and personal development skills through workshops, research and seminars, and share best practices and new tactics with the team.
Responsibilities
Identifying story lines and writing articles that highlight the people, achievements and value of Clay Lacy Aviation.
Support the marketing manager in establishing marketing plans by setting objectives, planning and organizing support materials and content calendars.
Communicate campaign objectives, timelines and deliverables to sales team and provide instructions for use or promotion.
Coordinate onboarding deliverables and marketing support for new charter aircraft such as creating charter sales sheets, managing photoshoots, updating website listings, coordinating email, press and social media outreach, and updating executive travel and charter publications.
Coordinate, create and deliver written content for a variety of communication outlets including email communications, employee newsletters and blog articles.
Update website content using WordPress; build and send email communications using HubSpot.
Support the events manager with coordination and various responsibilities for meetings, events, sponsorships, and trade shows by identifying, assembling and coordinating project requirements, developing schedules and assignments and coordinating event communications.
Maintain a directory and inventory of sales support materials, ensuring all resources are current and accurate, and coordinate the creation of new materials as needed.
Analyze market trends, customer behavior and competitive landscape, and prepare reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing data. Continually seek and research new sources of prospective customer data and provide recommendations to sales and marketing leadership.
Qualifications
Skills and Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree.
Major in Journalism preferred. (Business, Marketing or other major considered for applicant with strong writing skills). Samples of your work would be welcomed
Excellent writing, communication, and presentation skills.
Proficiency in full Microsoft Office suite. (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)
Experience in WordPress, HubSpot, and Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator) preferred.
Familiarity with content management systems (CMS) and customer relationship management (CRM) tools.
Must be able to lift, pack and move boxes weighing 20-40 pounds.
Must be able to pass drug screening and background checks.
Personality and Character

The ideal candidate will exhibit the following traits:
Strong organizational skills
Good communicator
Trustworthy, responsible and dependable
Friendly, creative and fun
Critical thinker wants to understand the “why” in order to grow in their role and area of responsibility.
Able to multi-task across various projects and deadlines
Seeks feedback and constructive criticism on their work.
Gives feedback and constructive criticism on their team’s work.
Equal Opportunity Employer

In compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act, the company provides reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities and encourages both prospective and current employees to discuss potential accommodations with the employer accommodations with the employer.

About Clay Lacy Aviation

Founded in 1968 by legendary aviator and industry pioneer Clay Lacy. Today, Clay Lacy Aviation is considered the world’s most experienced operator of private jets. Prominent individuals and leading corporations trust Clay Lacy for aircraft management, charter, maintenance, avionics, interiors and FBO services. The company has aircraft operations and regional offices across the U.S., including a full-service FBO at Van Nuys Airport in Los Angeles, and aircraft maintenance centers in Los Angeles, San Diego, and Oxford, Connecticut. Clay Lacy is the authorized dealer for the Quest Kodiak 100 Series II in the Northeastern U.S. With the most knowledgeable team in the industry, Clay Lacy delivers superior safety, service and value to aircraft owners and jet travelers worldwide. Visit claylacy.com for more details.

Job Title: Medical Science Director - Scientific Collaborations Oncology Portfolio - Cross Portfolio
Job Description:
The Position


Purpose:

The Medical Science Director at Genentech puts patients and science at the center of all actions. They drive medical strategy and tactics aimed at maximizing medical progress. They collaborate to drive timely data generation and dissemination. They are expected to maintain an in-depth understanding of the medical strategy and relevant clinical and payer issues, while ensuring Genentech's partners understand key trends and shifts in the external healthcare landscape. They serve as the guardian for high standards of compliance, ethics and safety. This role is organized within a network of experts, and therefore may at any time be performing a variety of medical activities, as needed.

This specific role is focused on the role of scientific collaborations. The individual in this role will be expected to manage complex relationships with the various cooperative groups, the NCI and some private organizations and foundations (e.g., SU2C, Parker Institute, etc;). It will be critical to work in cross functional teams and manage experts within the organization and externally. Legal and compliance background is an advantage and there will be expectation in working through and having accountability for complex agreements, contracts and work relationships. This specific role will focus on the oncology portfolio as a whole, personalized healthcare and working closely with some major academic and private collaborators. There may be some work with the NCI in the pediatric space as well.

Key Responsibilities for all Medical Science Directors:

In this role the Medical Directors will be required to perform one or more of the following activities depending upon areas of expertise or assignment to specific activities, molecules, or disease/therapeutic areas:
Design, execute, and monitor medical strategies, plans and tactics spanning the lifecycle, including but not limited to:
clinical data generation design and management
thought leader interactions
sponsored and supported trials
registries, exploratory data analysis
publications
medical content creation and review
scientific exchange/engagement and scientific communications/collaborations
medical education
scientific congress planning and support
evaluate, synthesize, and visualize clinical and economic data and develop written scientific communication
identify access-related medical issues and opportunities
Actively participate and contribute to relevant communities of practice
Key Accountabilities for all Medical Science Directors:
Depending upon areas of assignment for specific activities or molecules, disease/therapeutic areas or for the full portfolio, acting as a medical individual for relevant study design and monitoring, data interpretation, medical content development and review, scientific exchange and collaboration, clinical training and insights generation to internal stakeholders and external customers.
Accountable for implementing strategy through medical tactics, tapping into the network of relevant expertise and insights
Contribute medical expertise to Genentech work products and coach/mentor others as needed
Facilitate sharing of information within, across and outside of Medical Affairs to enable medical progress
Maintain an in-depth understanding of relevant medical strategy and clinical, patient/caregiver, payer and healthcare/market landscape
Act as a guardian for high standards of compliance, ethics and safety; putting patients at the center of all actions
Scientific Engagement with Genentech's External Stakeholders:
Develop and execute on strategic scientific engagement/collaboration plans and cultivate long-terms strategic partnerships with relevant US-based external experts, academic institutions, professional societies, compendia and guideline entities, and other relevant organizations, including cooperative groups and their foundations, large multi-center research organizations and patient organizations
Guide internal teams on relevant external communications and interactions with strategic partners. As needed or otherwise appropriate, help facilitate contact between relevant internal personnel and external strategic partners
Provide scientific training to contracted HCP speakers
Job Requirements

Qualification:
Advanced Clinical/Science Degree Required (e.g. PharmD, PhD, etc.). Consideration will be given to those with extensive experience within managing collaborations with the NCI and cooperative groups
Required Experience:
3-10 years of pharmaceutical/biotechnology relevant industry experience required- preferably in Medical Affairs or product development or is a recognized expert in the field or therapeutic area (with a minimum of 2 years clinical experience)
Strong academic/teaching background preferred
Understanding of and/or previous experience with Phase I - III and/or Phase IV drug development
Considerable experience in the principles and techniques of data analysis, interpretation and clinical relevance, and medical writing
Proven record in working with the NCI, CTEP, cooperative groups and/or professional societies
Proven record in developing strong relationships with external constituents (therapeutic area experts, external organizations, etc.) preferred
Prior experience with pediatric oncology is also a plus
Proven track record of meeting or exceeding objectives and goals
Skills:
Strong customer orientation/focus
Ability to flex and thrive in an ambiguous environment undergoing transformational change
Works well within teams and is effective in collaborating with others internally and externally
Analytical and problem-solving capabilities and skills. Has demonstrated the ability to anticipate and solve problems of moderate complexity and scope e.g. evaluate, interpret and present highly complex data
Communication and presentation skills; highly effective at summarizing and presenting key considerations and decision-points
Strong business acumen: knows the industry, key competitors, marketplace factors/dynamics
Ability to effectively and efficiently manage multiple priorities
Good interpersonal and influencing skills; can effectively and quickly establish rapport with all key internal/external partners and stakeholders and influence without authority
Good negotiation skills: can drive discussions and decisions towards desired results
Understanding of legal and regulatory considerations impacting pharma/biotech industry and ability and judgement to apply principles to daily activities
Strong attention-to-detail
Business travel, by air or car, is required for regular internal and external business meetings

Listen Technologies Corporation is located in Bluffdale, Utah.

Our employees are our greatest asset, we work to instill a culture of enjoyment and fun, while maintaining a professional work environment.

We hire for the best fit which includes an analysis of a candidate’s skill level, experience, personality and work ethic. As a company, we are motivated by a deep understanding of how sound enriches our lives and believe that everyone deserves to connect to experiences with pure, focused sound.

Established in 1998, Listen Technologies delivers audio directly to the individual so everyone can hear clearly and share in the same great experience. We equip users with personalized assistive listening solutions to listen and engage in environments where hearing is difficult, whether they are in a theme park, house of worship, tour group, theater or other venue. We provide a better way to hear the world.

Our award-winning technologies include:

⦁ ListenRF- utilizing radio frequency (RF) to transmit audio

⦁ ListenIR- audio is transmitted using infrared (IR) light

⦁ ListenTALK- portable, two-way group communication

⦁ Wi-Fi- audio delivered over Wi-Fi via a free app

⦁ Hearing or induction loop- works with hearing aids or cochlear implants

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Content Marketing Manager

Position Title: Content Marketing Manager

Department: Marketing

Reports To: Director of Digital Marketing and Automation

Status: Full Time

Office: Listen Technologies – Headquarters / Bluffdale

Overview:

Key Deliverables:

1. Identify content opportunities to create value adding content for our audience

2. Help create assets like whitepapers and other interactive tools used for building relationships with our audience

3. Manage our social listening strategy to ensure the way we speak and the topics we address resonate with audience needs

4. Own regular email campaign content used to stay top of mind with people in various stages of evaluating our products

5. Manage outside resources for content creation

6. Own internal content calendar to ensure all business units are aligned in how they each message their audience

7. Manage our content publications, email/blog/social media platforms where applicable

8. Drive strategy on website content ensuring content is appealing to our audience while also filling strategic needs, eg/ lead nurturing, SEO friendly

9. Begin learning more about our other digital initiatives to eventually take a larger management role with PPC, SEO, Social Media and/or Demand Generation

Position Overview:

The Content Marketing Manager will work as part of our ‘Direct Revenue’ team supporting primary our B2B product. This team is tasked with growing revenue through marketing and sales of our products that can be sold directly to the end user.

The Direct Revenue team has two goals; we generate leads for our sales team to close. In order to successfully accomplish this our digital marketing campaigns, leverage a wide range of skills and disciplines.

In a “T” shaped approach to digital marketing we expect your deepest background to be in content marketing with proficient understanding of;

Identifying content opportunities

We are looking for an experienced backend software engineer to join our exceptional team of distributed systems engineers. We have embarked on a mission to create highly-scalable and performant micro-services that handle tera-bytes of data and analytics that feed into beautifully designed custom data visualizations. You will be responsible for architecting, implementing and testing new and existing systems that power our flagship product and help humanize the way content marketers interact with customers. Most importantly, your leadership as a senior and experienced member of the team will become an example for others to follow, and you will help shape and define our engineering practices and craftsmanship.
Our Engineering Values
Collaboration: We believe that engineers do their best work when working together in cohesive teams.
Excellence: We believe in doing things the "right way" rather than the "fast way", and holding ourselves to a high standard of excellence.
Growth: We believe engineers do their best work when they are constantly growing, learning, and changing.
Communication: We believe in combining empathy with openness and honesty to set clear expectations and hold each other accountable.
Impact: We believe we're making the world a better place by empowering marketers to really help their customers rather than just sell stuff.

What you'll be doing
Writing beautiful API documentation for all the services you and the team builds for consumption by other developers (we use Swagger).
Design and architect scalable services that are both highly available and performant.
Breaking down product requirements into manageable stories and delegating work to team members.
Refactoring and evolving existing distributed systems to make legacy systems anew.
Collaborating with other functions of the business and engineering department to ensure successful delivery of software.
Who you are:


A bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or related field
8+ years working in backend technologies in addition to Java such as Scala, Python, Golang or a combination of
8+ years working in databases such as MySQL, Postgres or other RDBMS systems
8+ years working with cloud-hosting and deep understanding of AWS, Google Cloud or Azure
3-5+ years working with Docker containers and deep understanding of the internals of how containers work
3-5+ years working with non-relational databases such as Cassandra or Dynamo
3-5+ years building and deploying containers into managed clusters with Kubernetes or equivalent
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Proven professional experience working with non-technical business functions
You enjoy collaborating with product management teams to ensure the best quality product is shipped out the door
You have a keen appreciation for usability and understand your users come first when designing systems
Why You Should Join


At Conductor, we are looking for engaged and passionate engineers that can raise the bar. There is a tremendous opportunity here to have immediate impact in the day-to-day and affect the company's success and growth. We all share in the same values and push each other to meet these standards.

We are made up of a diverse group of people from all backgrounds and include a team of exceptional engineers in Kyiv as well. Wherever you are from, you will find a common ground here for continuing to push forward your career and make a difference in this industry.

Conductor, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Conductor's search and content intelligence platform helps marketers create and optimize content to improve visibility online.

The technology generates customer intent insights that lead to compelling content, increased traffic, and higher organic marketing ROI. Conductor's forward-thinking customers include global and emerging enterprise brands like Citibank, Salesforce, ClassPass, and WeWork.

Job Description:

Are you looking for a high energy, strategic, and fast-paced position as a Managed Services Specialist? Join Relias, the company changing lives throughout the world by helping healthcare organizations improve their clinical outcomes!
Relias provides software and services to more than 10,000 healthcare organizations and providers, addressing the primary concerns of recruiting, retention, risk mitigation, compliance, and the move from fee for service to value-based reimbursements. In addition to unrivaled content, Relias offers pre-hire assessments and in-depth analytics that allows for the demonstration of skill and performance, resulting in better patient, resident and client outcomes, as well as better financial results. We are passionate about our product and our clients; what we deliver is truly something you can be proud to represent. Our clients think so, too – we proudly boast a retention rate close to 100%!

Competitive base salary
Fantastic health and wellness benefits package, including an outstanding 401k match, an unlimited PTO program, and paid holidays, including your birthday!

Growth and career advancement opportunities!

20%+ annual employee promotion and transfer rate

PR CONTENT WRITER/MANAGER

Position Summary

Agora.io is hunting for a great content marketer to join our marketing team and help build out our content strategy and execution. We are looking for someone who is a born storyteller, loves writing, and who is passionate about driving content that generates excellent business outcomes.

Our Content Writer/Manager will manage PR agency, approve storyline, create case studies, website copy, blog posts and legendary advertisements. Youll apply your creativity and proven business writing skills to help build our brand and tell our story, to help Agora.io achieve its growth goals.

Manage PR agency and storyline to drive growth of Agora Share of Voice

Responsible for daily content production, which includes blogs, emails and external marketing communications.

Develop content specific to diverse verticals and international markets.
Measure and track content success and brand reach.

BA/BS in a related field;
3-7 years of experience in a content writing/management/marketing role at a B2B company; extra credit given to candidates who also have experience writing for developer/technical audiences, working in the communications industry, in start-ups, and who have built content marketing programs from scratch;
Experience writing and producing a variety of different content assets;
A gifted communicator, writer, and presenter, with exceptional storytelling ability;
Highly detail-oriented; outstanding organizational and project management skills;
Ability to execute in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment; excited to be a part of a super-fast-growing team;
Upbeat, positive attitude and a collaborative working style.

This position is responsible for driving verticalization for the Thryv product in Healthcare. It will require various types of analysis between industry software products and our Thryv software. Critical thinking skills and working independently are a must. This role will require you to work with various departments cross-functionally, assist with training, meet existing/potential software clients and attend conferences. Manage the Verticalized Thryv Templates and Social Library Posts--Create content for marketing campaigns and social media libraries for the Healthcare vertical.

Build out Requirements for Software Updates and Changes--When submitting changes to developers, requirement documents will need to be created.

Support for Branding and Lead Generation-- Creating verticalized content for our lead generation team and branding team to use in collateral, training or for marketing campaigns.

Ride Along with Sales, Sit with Ops, and Attend Verticalized Conferences Feet on the street and getting in-front of SMBs. This will be through ride days with sales, listening to calls with our support teams and attending vertical specific conferences

• Must be 18 years of age or older.

· Two to four years of experience in product management

· Ability to work independently and collaboratively as a team based on project requirements

· Ability to prioritize projects, features and tasks from various sources

· Work in a fast paced environment that is changing on a daily basis

· Experience with SMB software

· Industry knowledge of the Home Service vertical

· Client facing experience

• Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university

· Content creation experience

· Demonstrate industry knowledge/expertise

Thryv is an equal opportunity employer.

Who We Are:
NAM Strategic Communications is a nationally recognized team that knows how to break through the noise and drive a message. We are savvy digital strategists and experienced spokespeople who leverage cutting-edge tactics to drive news in support of manufacturers’ agenda. Publications such as PR Week, PR News and Bulldog Reporter have hailed our innovative campaigns and top talent as the gold standard in communications and advocacy.
Your Role:
The NAM is committed to building innovative digital content platforms to serve our constituents. How we use our digital presence to engage an array of audiences is critical to the organization’s success. We are looking for a Digital Content Editor to support these efforts.
The Digital Content Editor is a motivated, deadline-driven self-starter who understands the digital content lifecycle, thrives under pressure and operates with a strategic and rapid response mentality. Candidates for this position must have a hands-on approach to their work and must be comfortable rapidly writing and creating interactive material to engage the NAM’s many audiences across multiple platforms, including, but not limited to, Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, email and NAM web properties. Collaborate with the digital team and key stakeholders to create must-read, snackable website, social media and email content based on news, data and audience interest
Scour internet on an ongoing basis, watching and predicting trending conversations and devising ways to create engaging content to add to the conversation productively
Edit and post content in the content management system and social media platforms
Manage editorial infographic placement for your beats; repackage existing NAM content for further audience engagement
Work closely with the NAM’s in-house creative and video production teams to create compelling multimedia content
Brainstorm and implement content ideas and new digital approaches to storytelling
Apply SEO best practices
Assist with paid social execution
Maintain relationships with key stakeholders
Your Qualifications:
Entrepreneurial, highly organized and detail-oriented professional
Superior judgment when it comes to engaging in online conversations and communities while representing your organization
Creative storyteller who knows how to package digital content
Must have experience working within content management systems and social platforms
Must have experience managing content for brands and executives
Technical Skills:
Demonstrated cross-platform digital knowledge, especially SEO, social media, email and mobile publishing best practices
Demonstrated cross-platform digital analytics knowledge, especially pertaining to Google Analytics, native and aggregated social analytics platforms, including Sprout Social and Simply Measured
Experience working with CRM systems, including Salesforce, to interpret data a plus
Experience working with content management systems, including Drupal and WordPress
Experience with Adobe Creative Suite, HTML, CSS, PHP and/or JavaScript a plus
Must be flexible to learning and working within new software/platforms

S./B.F.A. degree in journalism, communications, design or a related field preferred
3+ years of digital content management experience highly desired; background at an online news organization a plus

Washington, D.C.

You will work closely with the Ops, Video, Radio, Digital and Creative teams to create and manage projects/campaigns that assist with the clients' overall marketing goals. You will also be working with vendors to obtain the best rates for the clients' marketing campaigns. We're hiring the right individual not based solely on their skills but on their ability to learn, heart to serve the company, and heart to serve the clients.

Develop clients marketing budgets, track leads, jobs and sales numbers as well as compiling reports for management showing results (ROI)

Have a great attitude – equally happy and excited to take on tedious tasks in addition to large projects

Company Description
Founded in 2013, we are a passionate full-service advertising agency. Our slogan is "Passionately Pursuing our Clients Success" which is more than a slogan, it truly is a way of life. We've adopted the Aloha Spirit because it is the coordination of mind and heart within each person. It brings each person to self. This requires personal desire, passion and self-awareness. Our teams are the best in the industry so we're always looking for passionate talent to join our team. We want each team member to WANT to work at lilikoi agency not have to. We're looking for people who are passionate about their skills, love to go above and beyond for our clients, and what they can contribute for the betterment of the team!

Our Core Values

LOVE
Without love, we have nothing. We LOVE each other, our clients, and our work. Our team models that love through a deep BELIEF, HOPE and TRUST in one another. We strive to care more for others than ourselves. This requires patience, humility, kindness, gentleness, and the will to never give up.

OHANA
Our Ohana is connected through a genuine compassion and love for each other and our clients. We are a close and diverse community bound by loyalty and support. We feel that everyone should know the comfort, joy and peace of being part of an OHANA.

PASSION
Passion demands more from us than is simply required. We exemplify passion when we give our whole heart, soul, mind and strength to our team and our clients.

TRUTH
Together, we are committed to stand firm in TRUTH. We will remain diligent to always communicate truth to each other regardless of the circumstances. Untruth is driven by fear. We will not be afraid to tell the truth to each other, to our clients or in our advertising.

REMARKABLE
We want to be remarkable in everything we do. We want our team, our clients and our work to be worthy of a remark. We strive to deliver remarkable results.

WAC seeks an experienced Video Editor who is passionate about the craft of filmmaking and can work closely with the Design and Marketing teams to produce compelling video content across all channels. Ideal candidates are innovative, curious, self-motivated, can work both independently and collaboratively, and enjoy a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines and fast turn-around times. Our in-house Design team is responsible for a range of content – from WAC’s brand voice and messaging, to product and packaging design for each of our products.

Major Duties and Responsibilities:
Edit a variety of video marketing and social assets with a keen eye towards storytelling and consistency of brand voice and visual style
Audio mixing and color correction/grading
Work collaboratively with Design Director to take projects from conception to completion
Prepare content to spec for a variety of digital distribution channels in a variety of crops and aspect ratios.
Quality assurance and attention to detail in creating and reviewing work
Assisting with video production and post-production as needed
Organize and track assets with digital-asset-management best practices in a shared workflow environment
Skills and Qualifications:
5+ years’ experience in non-linear digital video editing, preferably in beauty, fashion, or a similar innovative, high-energy field
Expert knowledge of Adobe Premiere and Adobe after Effects and experience with the full Creative Cloud suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Media Encoder, etc.)
Advanced knowledge of web video standards and codecs
BS in Filmmaking, Digital Video Production or similar degree/real-world experience
Benefits:

We recognize people as our most valuable asset. Our competitive salary and benefits package includes: paid time off; medical & dental coverage (including family coverage), vision, 401(k), tuition assistance, and continuous training and development.

About WAC Lighting:

Celebrating over 35 years of business and significant growth, WAC strives to be the most recognized and respected lighting fixtures company in the industry. We offer innovative and quality products and provide extraordinary customer service. We are an entrepreneurial company offering excellent career and growth opportunities. For more information, visit our Web site, www.waclighting.com

Sustainability:

We strive every day to develop sustainable lighting by maximizing the aesthetic quality of today’s interior environment while minimizing the impact on our world’s precious natural environment. To achieve this goal, we are developing luminaries that deliver the finest quality of light with the most energy efficient lamping and optic technology available. We acknowledge our responsibility to raise the standards for how lighting quality is provided.

For immediate consideration, please e-mail your resume to: hr@ waclighting.com Given the high volume of responses, only qualified candidates will be contacted. WAC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/D/V encouraged to apply.

Job Description
We're looking for a marketing-savy candidate to help our client continue to market their brand and grow their business. This family-owned client has grown dramatically during the last 15 years and they want to continue to foster this growth. In this entry level role, you will work directly with the management team to update their content on their website, write interesting and informative blogs and continue to improve their digital presence, while helping them execute their marketing strategy. This is a full time, temporary to hire opportunity. The company provides a great work environment, with newly renovated office space, an excellent benefits program upon permanent hire and the opportunity for you to use your creativity on the job.
Four degree in Marketing or Business
Must have Blog/Content writing experience
Proficient with Hubspot and Web Application

Company Description
HW Staffing Solutions is a family owned and operated business founded by Helen Walsh Holman in 1980. We have a strong 31 year history of providing our clients with quality candidates and service without sacrificing values. Helen’s vision and dedication has been carried down by her son Edward Walsh Jr. who as president has contributed to the vision of growth and success of the company through-out New England. We truly understand and respect the value of our clients’ time and need for a staffing partner to listen to what they are saying. Our approach is to offer in-depth customized staffing solutions to meet our clients' needs. Our consultative approach includes reviewing your best hiring practices and incorporating them into our screening process. Dedication and commitment has delivered success and growth for our clients, candidates and our organization.

HW Staffing is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, national origin, veteran status, membership in or application to the uniformed services, physical or mental disability or any other classification protected by applicable law.

Marketing Intern:

You will work closely with our Marketing Associate and President to learn all aspects of our existing marketing activities, including Social Media, content creation/curation, website design/SEO, video creation/promotion, advertising, etc. As you progress throughout the internship, you will become increasingly independent and will be tasked with important projects to expand or improve our marketing program in addition to offering your own creative ideas to improve the overall marketing for the firm.

Requirements:

Rising Junior or Senior at a 4-year institution preferred. Technologically savvy and competent in all aspects of graphic design. The ideal candidate will be creative, driven, and a self-starter, with a desire to learn and grow professionally throughout the internship. Additionally, the ideal candidate will have artistic flair but will desire to "get their hands dirty" with the actual design and implementation of all aspects of our marketing life-cycle. A good understanding of Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop & In-design a must, be familiar with Illustrator, and willing to learn Premiere Pro and After-effects) is preferred.

Why choose us?

At rebel Financial we "rebel" against the traditional mold for financial firms, committing ourselves to financial/investment excellence, and putting "people before profits." We offer a small business environment with a hands-on learning experience that will help you to grow your career professionally. We are on the cutting-edge of industry technology, work with some of the best financial, investment, and tax planning programs, while maintaining our focus as a values-driven social enterprise. We need motivated young creative professionals to help spread the word of how we can help people achieve their financial potential.

We are passionate about moving people forward at TWO MEN AND A TRUCK®! We are growing and so is our marketing team. The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for implementing and overseeing the marketing plans for several TWO MEN AND A TRUCK® locations in the Atlanta metro area with the ultimate goal of growing revenue and increasing market reach. This position will be mainly based out of Tucker, GA, and will support a large territory that reaches from Gainesville, GA to Newnan, GA.

What We Offer
Salary range: $30,000 - $35,000 (DOE) with bonus potential
Paid time off
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Career advancement opportunities
What You'll Do

Marketing Responsibilities
Assess marketing opportunities and new target markets
Execute marketing initiatives
Track and evaluate lead sources through various tools
Track and report impact of all marketing initiatives; measures return on investment
Coordinate bi-annual competitor mystery shop
Assist with external customer service on-line communication including reviews
Community Outreach/PR /Networking
Maintain relationships with our list of charity partners, documents and coordinate donation requests and community involvement; document any resulting PR
Develop a PR calendar and seeks new PR opportunities
Develop, distribute and track all media releases
Coordinate and attend networking events
Initiate and develop relationships with apartment and senior communities, local realtors, mortgage agencies, and other potential commercial customers
Represent the brand at trade shows, events and chamber marketing opportunities
Social Media Management
Develop social media content and calendar
Monitor social conversations
Create social media ads
Report social analytics to Marketing Director
Grow social media followers through quality-driven, meaningful content appropriate for our audience
Other duties as assigned by Marketing Director

What We're Looking For

Because moving is stressful, we seek candidates with a commitment to customer service and an appreciation for variety in your job.
Bachelors Degree in Communications, Business, or related field is preferred but not required
A minimum of two years of related experience, customer service or sales experience is preferred
Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within the Marketing field
Highly creative and motivated
Ability to work independently
Friendly, professional personality
Exceptional oral and written communication skills; comfortable with public speaking
Excellent organizational skills; must be able to multi-task under time constraints
Must be proficient with Microsoft Office applications
Must have a command of social media platforms
Willing to submit to a pre-employment background check and regular drug screens
Must be available to work evenings and weekends on occasion
Work is performed in an office setting with no unusual hazards. The ability to work from offices in Tucker, Fayetteville, and Lawrenceville, GA is necessary.
The qualifications listed above are intended to represent the minimal skills and experience levels associated with performing the duties and responsibilities contained in this job description. The qualifications should not be viewed as absolute standards, but as general guidelines that should be considered with other job-related criteria.
Competitors: All My Sons Moving & Storage, Gentle Giant Moving Company, Atlas Van Lines

Job Description:
Job Title:SharePoint Site Content Manager

Location:Scott Air Force Base, Illinois

Clearance Level: Secret Clearance

Summary:

SecuriGence is looking for a SharePoint Developer and Content Administrator to redesign, migrate and sustain United States Transportation Command (USTRANSCOM) SharePoint collaborative environment. Additionally, the candidate will be responsible to take advantage of the full scope of SharePoint built-in capabilities, especially in the area of content design. The candidate will be responsible for design, install, upgrade and performance monitoring of Microsoft SharePoint and its interface capabilities with other applications as needed; to include migration planning and execution.

Duties:
Analyzing business requirements and application objectives relating to SharePoint 2013
Developing, customizing, enhancing and sustaining SharePoint applications and sites
Maintaining and administering rights and permissions for site collection administrator, site owners and content managers
Engaging clients and vendors to gather requirements and troubleshoot work issues
Providing technical advice on requirements documentation and test planning as required
Configuring and administrating service applications, and managing disk usage across the site collection, and performing maintenance activities
Providing training on the use and application of SharePoint
Migrate data from existing SharePoint sites to DISA DEPS site
Required Skills and Experience:

Experience using JavaScript (including JQuerry), CSS3 (includes Bootstrap and W3.css), HTML5, C#, .Net, SharePoint JavaScript Object Model (JSOM) or Client-Side Object Model (CSOM), ASPX, REST SharePoint Designer 2013 and overall front-end web design

Education and Certifications:
Professional certifications (i.e. MCSD: SharePoint Application, or MCSE: SharePoint certification) desired
Requires US Government Secret clearance
Bachelor's Degree is highly desired and a minimum of five (5) years of relevant SharePoint experience.
About

SecuriGence LLC (SG) is an agile, HUBZone Certified Veteran-owned small business headquartered in the Washington, DC metropolitan region. Established in April 2010 we have been supporting the Department of Defense and other United States Civil agencies in Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Software Development, Cyber Security, and Cloud/Virtualization Management.

Job Description
Job Description VLink is searching for a highly motivated and energetic Marketing Coordinator to work closely with the marketing and inside sales team. From the 1st day, the Marketing Coordinator will contribute to existing marketing programs, while assisting with the development of new marketing initiatives aligned with company goals. The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of digital marketing experience with a wide range of functions, including email marketing, social media, search ads, social media advertising and content marketing in the IT industry. The marketing coordinator must be an organized multitasker able to handle many diverse projects at once and meet tight deadlines. This role reports to the Marketing Manager at VLink’s headquarters in CT. Objectives · Assist in the development and implementation of digital campaigns.· Ensure all marketing efforts serve to achieve identified business goals, analyze and identify improvements for processes, content, and lead generation. · Prepare marketing activity reports.· Provide market research, competitive analysis and campaign results · Support the maintenance of internal tools such as Salesforce · Create social media posts, designing images, whitepaper/ebook designs. · Create or assist in creation of videos. Skills and Qualifications · Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications or any other relevant field.· At least 2 years of past work experience as a marketing coordinator or a similar role in IT industry. · At least 2 years of experience in digital marketing including but not limited to email marketing, content marketing, social media marketing.· Strong written and verbal communication skills of the English language. · Experience with Microsoft Office suite, Photoshop, Adobe Acrobat, Wordpress, Salesforce, email marketing tools, Google Ads is required and experience with marketing automation tools is desired. · Experience creating videos is highly desirable.

Job Description
Reporting to a the CMO, this role will be crucial in helping to drive the creation of strategic messaging, product positioning, customer engagement, competitive differentiation, persona development and content creation.
Product Positioning and Messaging – Own the relationship between the product team and marketing to communicate product updates and changes to customers, prospects, and employees and manage creating, retiring, and updating required marketing materials.
Work with sales and product management to develop and update market-ready messaging that demonstrates thought leadership, articulates our competitive differentiators, current and near-term product capabilities for TimeTrade. Communicate product roadmaps to the sales organization along with competitive positioning and key messages.
Support go-to-market strategy and planning that includes pricing, packaging, and feature delivery across a 12-18 month roadmap.
Run point on product related content strategy including white papers, webinars, event content/presentations, website and social content, video and often serve as editor to other key functional groups like product and corporate communications
Drive the competitive research strategy and execution including compiling, analyzing and distilling competitive information
Make sure the website always reflects up to date product functionality and positioning. Create website content that draws prospect interest and leads them to convert to leads and ultimately customers
Assist in creating materials to support the Sales team
Own customer marketing programs and strategy delivering webinars, product updates, industry information, best practices and thought leadership materials focused on driving retention, referencibility and upsell.
Own customer story development to produce marketable customer quotes
Customer Evangelism – Own customer relationship marketing to develop customer stories, case studies, quotes and references to strengthen our customer relationships and create engaging collateral our sales team can use to strengthen our successful customer experiences.
Managing and Measuring Work - Structure customer marketing programs so that benchmarks can be set and results achieved. Recommend and implement measurement methodologies and analyze program performance on an ongoing basis to ensure continual improvement.
Resource Management - Closely manage product marketing vendors to ensure quality support and execution of programs within timelines and budget.

Skills & Requirements
5-8 years of experience in Product Marketing, Product Management or Sales for a software company
Proven success in complex, solution-oriented market development
"Roll-up-your-sleeves" entrepreneurial attitude
Creative fountain of ideas to drive the business forward, both strategic and tactical
Exceptional writing and communication skillsExperience building impactful marketing collateral and informational content including; whitepapers; interactive product demos; webinars; and web video for content marketing programs
Ability to ‘ask the right questions’ to help shape message and product direction
Natural ability to relate to customers and prospects
Superb collaborator with proven ability to work with cross functional team
Extremely self-motivated and also able to help organize and motivate others
Qualifications

BE authentic. BE influential. BE the expert. Be all that and more at Colliers International.

At Colliers International, we help leaders succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.

Who you are

You are well known for constantly delivering accurate, top quality work for your clients. You successfully guide projects from concept to execution in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment. You are an excellent communicator who can support multiple professionals across the organization regarding their marketing needs. You love working independently and collaboratively to determine effective design solutions for your clients. If these describe you, then you are who we’re looking for!

What you need
1+ years of marketing and administrative support experience in a professional services environment
Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Intermediate proficiency in full Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop)
Positive attitude, motivation and determination to succeed in a marketing role in this industry
Ability to work in an extremely fast-paced environment and multitask effectively
Bonus skills and experience
Commercial real estate experience
Graphic design experience
Degree in marketing, communications, or journalism
What success looks like
You will design/create and implement marketing collateral on an as needed basis as well as provide creative input on projects the team may be tackling
You will work on new business pitches, proposal graphics, infographics, invitations, post cards, signage, etc. as well as manage the Colliers Hub and social media channels for the region
You have experience with project management and execution of marketing collateral and bring a knowledge of marketing campaigns and innovative solutions to your clients

Direct applicants only please, no agencies.

Colliers International provides equal employment opportunity to all persons. About Us


Simon Data was founded in 2015 by a team of successful serial entrepreneurs. We are an enterprise customer data platform that empowers marketers to create personalized data-driven experiences for the customers. We're scrappy problem solvers who believe in tackling big challenges with disruptive thinking and giving our customers the support they need to deliver great next-generation experiences at scale.

Simon Data is a data-first customer experience orchestration platform, designed to disrupt the marketing technology and marketing cloud category. Simon's platform empowers businesses to use enterprise-scale data and machine learning to power customer communications across every channel. Our unique approach allows brands to develop one-to-one relationships with their customers without building a bespoke in-house data infrastructure.

At Simon, we firmly believe that business success starts and ends with people. We all do our best work when we are surrounded by other friendly top performers who want to succeed together. This attitude is core to our values. When you trust your team, invest in their development, and give them ownership, great things happen.

The Role


We are looking for someone to own and develop content marketing strategy that increases our brand awareness, elevates our positioning, and improves sales effectiveness. If you are a person that believes that phenomenal content has the power to transform a business from the top of the funnel down, this is the role for you! You'll be a part of everything from brainstorming with industry specialists to working with our executive team to build top-quality thought leadership.

This will be an exciting opportunity to help shape and bolster Simon Data's position in the industry. This role has wide-reaching goals that will benefit several cross-functional groups. To that end, success will be visible both internally and externally. You will report directly to the Head of Marketing and collaborate with the friendly, encouraging, and whip-smart team at Simon.

What You'll Do
Create and maintain content marketing calendar based on both external market and internal partner input. Facilitate partner consensus on a regular basis.
Own and execute content production process: from idea, to outlinefrom feedback rounds to coordinating on-brand final design
Be responsible for crafting compelling content that drives MCLs, supports nurture strategy, and supports our market positioning
Manage content production relationships where applicable (e.g. freelance writers, team contributors)
Maintain and nurture press relationships as well as proactively seek new opportunities
Support channel marketing efforts with content and strategic insights
Oversee organic strategy related to social media
Support SEO with content and enable our agency relationships with current content strategy and calendar
Ensure that our brand voice is consistently maintained and that we're always writing to delight our client personas
Occasional cross-functional content support
Qualifications
4-8 years experience in content creation, ideally for a high-growth, B2B company
Collaborative style when working across functions, partners, and vendor relationships
Demonstrated ability to drive top of funnel with content
Superior written and verbal communication skills
Ability to use engagement and performance analytics to adapt strategy and focus
Experience in SaaS and marketing tech space
Ability to join and thrive in dynamic conversations with diverse audiences: executives, client-facing conversations, etc.
Capacity to build high-quality content across multiple formats: webinars, guides, blog posts, long-form thought leadership, etc.
Ability to ensure consensus and utilization by the sales team
Visa sponsorship for this role is currently not available.

Diversity


We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer open to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, Veteran status, or any other legally protected status.
