Job Description
Miranda CompaniesinPort St Lucie, FLis seeking to hire afull-time Marketing Coordinatorto help us improve our customer service and marketing campaigns. Are you a creative self-starter with a passion for learning and knack for social media? Do you enjoy having variety in your job? Can you effectively switch between tasks? Are you looking for a company that will value you? If so, read on!

We pay our Marketing Coordinator acompetitive wagebased on experience. We also offer generous benefits includingmedical, vision, dental, paid holidays, and paid vacation. Our team also enjoys acasual work environment. If this sounds like the opportunity that you've been searching for, apply today!

ABOUT MIRANDA COMPANIES

Our company is committed to providing our customers with quality dependable, honest service at affordable costs when it comes to home and office service in south Florida. Family owned and operated since 1981 under the original ownership, Miranda has set the standard in how service and installations get done to perfection, the first time. Our company is certified and fully licensed in plumbing, air conditioning, electrical and leak detection and repair. Our technicians have been drug tested, screened and properly trained. Training is ongoing and includes technical skills, manufacturer lead training, and how to respectfully treat customers in their homes and businesses. We stand by a tradition of making our customers happy by showing up on time, respecting homes and businesses and providing an up-front price after diagnosis.

In addition to internal and external continuing education, we provide our team members withexcellent pay, fantastic benefits, and a team-oriented work atmosphere where success is the norm!

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A MARKETING COORDINATOR

As a Marketing Coordinator, you arrive at the office each day ready to get back to your projects. In this position to love that you have the opportunity to wear multiple hats to help grow our business. You engage your creative and out-of-the-box thinking as you develop social media and email marketing strategies to advance our brand and drive lead generation. Your excellent project management, research, and data analysis skills aid you in your success.

In addition to being part of our marketing team, you have the opportunity to improve our customer service efforts. You follow up with our clients over the phone to learn more about their experience with us. By collecting client reviews, you are able to see where we can improve in our customer service efforts and where we are excelling! You love that you get to engage both your analytical and creative sides in your work and get great satisfaction out of playing a key role in our company's success!

QUALIFICATIONS
Social media and marketing skills
Photoshop or other photo editing software experience
Proficiency in Microsoft Office
Experience with WordPress, Microsoft CRM, and Google Analytics
Ability to resize photos and utilize template software programs
Ability to pass a background check
Do you have an entrepreneurial spirit? Are you attentive to detail and organized? Do you have strong written and verbal communication skills? Is customer service important to you? Can you work quickly and independently? Are you able to juggle multiple projects at once in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment? If so, you may be the perfect social media maven for this position!

WORK SCHEDULE

The typical schedule for this position isMonday-Friday.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial3-minute, mobile-friendly applicationso that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

Our Sr. Enterprise BDRs identify and target outbound opportunities in the $500MM and above enterprise segment. We like to work hard, crush our goals, and then do it again. Passionate about selling a great software product
Driven but you want everyone on your team to succeed

Influencers Church is a multi-site church with over 10,000 members and 10 locations across the USA and Australia. Our environment is fast-paced but we don't work hard alone. We value community and have a fun and fulfilling workplace culture. We are multicultural, multigenerational and not just a network church but a part of the Global Hillsong family!

This position is for a Full time Energetic Video Editor who loves making stories come to life through capturing footage and editing amazing pieces together for internal and external use.

This job will consist of

- Working with a team of staff and volunteers in the Media department under the Senior Pastor to deliver marketing that will show the world the heart and culture of Influencers Church

- Video editing and content creation for various weekend services, social and digital platforms

- Motion graphic creation and light animation work

- Live filming and on-set production

- Project managing requests from departments and campuses through working with Pastors and media team to achieve the needs from each department and weekend services

You are:
Able to visualize the entire timeline, but never lose track of a single keyframe
Excellent at written and verbal communication
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite (with a mastery of After Effects & Premiere Pro)
Proficient and familiar with various live & broadcast camera equipment including but not limited to the Sony A7 range, Canon DSLRs and various cinematic cameras (RED, Arri etc).
Knowledgeable in filmmaking, graphic design, typography, and color theory
Comfortable working between After Effects, Premiere Pro and other motion graphics / animation-based programs
Able to manage multiple projects simultaneously, pro-actively communicating with your team and supervisors
Insanely gifted but grounded and humble
You will:
Deliver engaging visual content, including message recap videos, music videos, teaching content and weekend series bumpers.
Create appealing designs according to the consistent influencers design tone and collaborate with the media team to work on various campaigns including annual conferences, worship tours and more.
Work with our project managers to ensure projects are completed on time and with excellence.
Creatively work under the Media Director to best represent the church with all video content presented through various markets on social media, online and beyond.
EXPECTATIONS //

• Has a real and active relationship with Jesus

• Willingness to adapt and be flexible, while working above and beyond expectations.

• Acts as an advocate of the culture and vision of Influencers

• Low drama, high-momentum, high-capacity, positivity, overcomer, dreamer, creative-can-do-whatever-it-takes attitude.

• High level of initiative and ability to take a proactive approach to work.

• Performs job duties on time with excellence.

• Actively participates in the life of Influencers Church as their church home

Please include at least 2 relevant referees (church leadership preferred) in your resume/application.

Envista is a global family of three companies and more than 30 trusted dental brands, united by a shared purpose: to partner with professionals to improve lives. MedBridge was recently awarded in the 2019 Tech Impact Awards as well as Seattle Magazine's 2018 Leaders in Health Care Awards. We were also named one of the Top 25 Seattle Companies in 2019 by Inc. 5000.

Our mission at MedBridge is to improve the lives of patients, medical providers, and the quality of healthcare globally. We are developing a single, innovative platform that combines impactful clinical education content, patient engagement tools, and practice success tools. We are a team of passionate, resourceful and collaborative individuals at the intersection of online education and healthcare. We truly care about the quality of our product - we love new ideas and build new products that make a difference in peoples lives. As a fast-growing company, we work hard, but we have a great time doing it. If that sounds like you, come help us help others!

As the Accreditation and Content Manager you are responsible for ensuring MedBridge is developing premier quality education that solves the top challenges for our clients. Within the role, you will oversee the execution of highly impactful accredited CE content.

The position will require you to work closely with the content team, stakeholders across the company, and clients to ensure we are effectively addressing content needs of our existing and growing client set. We are looking for a highly motivated over-achiever who flourishes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. The role will incorporate the following accountabilities:

Leadership:
Lead and manage the accreditation team.
Lead cross-team initiatives and projects to ensure high-quality and timely execution.
Establish and track metrics and KPIs for MedBrides CE library.
Actively participate in leadership meetings and ensure strategic initiatives are carried through and executed by the team.
Accreditation:
Enhance processes to ensure MedBridge is exceeding accreditation standards.
Understand regulatory and license requirements of our clients, and be able to incorporate that into our content design process.
Consistently review content development processes for opportunities to improve educational quality of offerings.
Identify opportunities for efficiency/improvement and be able to execute necessary process change.
Be an active participant in maintaining accreditation for national and state boards.
Track accreditation metrics and KPIs
Operations:
Lead process-improvement initiatives to drive increased efficiency and quality across content development.
Refine processes and reduce inefficiencies in process from content roadmapping to filming to ensure optimal learning outcomes and engagement.
Establish and enforce data standards for entry into internal databases and website.
Education Design / Innovation: Partner with the Director of Education and Production to:
Ensure adult learning principles are incorporated into all content.
Track quality outcomes of courses and identify opportunities for efficiency.
Develop instructional methodologies for new content types
About You:
Proven track record of managing complex projects with many moving parts.
Ability to create document and develop processes to scale workflows.
Possess the ability to see the big picture of a project and effectively communicate each detail to essential team members
Attention to detail and quality
A team-oriented mindset and the ability to work with a wide range of individuals.
A willingness to roll up your sleeves to get the job done while not losing sight of the end goal, both during self-managed projects and when working in a team.
An ability to hit the ground sprinting in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is required.
Exceptional at managing your own time, being organized, and staying positive.
Bachelor's degree is required.
3+ years of management experience
5+ years experience in accreditation, education development, content operations.
Our Culture:

Were passionate about building products that improve the quality of life for patients - providing clinicians with the highest quality educational content and tools, on an innovative learning platform;

We believe collaboration is crucial to speedy execution and value in-person interactions across roles;

We move fast and are scrappy, ruthlessly prioritizing to test and deliver new products, features and services for our customers;

Were bootstrapped and proud of it; our success and continued growth are driven by products that customers love and actually pay us for;

We enjoy each other's company - whether at work or company sponsored events, we have fun;

We value our employees, offering 100% employee coverage for medical, dental and vision insurance and a 401(k) program with 50% company matching, up to 2%;

We believe in continued personal growth, offering 2 paid days and an allowance for the professional development of your choice.

Our team is a group of motivated individuals who love to innovate our product and increase its reach within the healthcare community. We're moving extremely fast, and every day offers the chance to learn and grow professionally with a fun group of colleagues.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity,sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

As a Senior Software andSystems Development Engineer...

You will lead Software Engineer tasking including execution of concept-to-delivery processes (Software support of product lines, set requirements, scheduling, cost estimations, detailed design, implementation, testing and documentation).

Have a Bachelor's degree in Physics, Engineering, or Computer Science and relevant professional level experience to include software development skills, with experience in object-oriented design.
Have experience in Unity3D, C , C#, .NET Framework, Java, and/or Javascript.
Have experience with the agile development process and source control software such as Git .
Work effectively in a team environment and be able to multi-task and support multiple development projects concurrently.
Have strong initiative, creativity, breadth of experience, and a desire to learn.
Are able to obtain a Secret clearance by your start date and can ultimately obtain a Top Secret clearance. If selected, you will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet the requirements for access to classified information. Eligibility requirements include U.S. citizenship.

Have a Master's degree in Physics, Engineering, or Computer Science.
Have experience with Windows-based development, simulation interoperability protocols (e.g., HLA), mission-level simulations (e.g., JSAF), physical dynamics and numerical methods, multi-threaded applications, GUI design, UML, OpenGL, and DirectX APIs, visualization, 3d object collision detection and resolution, virtual and augmented reality, and GIS systems.
Have augmented/Virtual Reality development experience with Oculus, Vive, or Hololens.
Are familiar or experience with software engineering tools such as Visual C , OpenSceneGraph, Microsoft.NET, MATLAB, Python, PHP, Windows, SQL, PERL, Unix, cross-platform knowledge, and MS Office.

Have experience with computer graphics, Advance Unix Programming, Computer Architecture, NVIDIA Cuda code, Optimization
Have Game Developer experience, simulation development, core engines, and an understanding of networking and cyber-security.
Why work at APL?

The Johns Hopkins University Applied Physics Laboratory (APL) brings world-class expertise to our nation's most critical defense, security, space and science challenges. With a wide selection of challenging, impactful work and a robust education assistance program, APL promotes a culture of life-long learning. Our employees enjoy generous benefits and healthy work/life balance. APL's campus is located in the Baltimore-Washington metro area. Learn more about our career opportunities at www.jhuapl.edu/careers.

APL is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Job Description:
Quizlet’s mission is to help students (and their teachers) practice and master whatever they are learning. Every month more than 50 million active learners from 130 countries practice and master more than 300 million study sets on every conceivable topic and subject. We are developing new learning experiences by modeling how students learn and drawing upon knowledge acquisition, retention, and pedagogy in cognitive science. We are always seeking to help students master any subject by optimizing study efficiency and engagement.

As our SEO Manager on the growth team, you are responsible for leading every aspect of our SEO strategy, including programmatic content creation, page quality, and SEO hygiene. This includes working with our cross-functional SEO Pod to build and launch A/B tests to improve SEO performance, as well as managing a small team of SEO experts to conduct market research, drive keyword analysis, and inform our longer-term content strategy with a particular emphasis on international growth.
What you'll be doing:
You'll be responsible for setting, testing, and refining Quizlet’s SEO strategy, with a particular emphasis on growing SEO traffic in international markets
You’ll work with a cross-functional team including a PM, designer, analyst, and engineers to support our short- and long-term SEO roadmap
You’ll manage a team of external SEO consultants to review SEO performance, conduct market research and keyword analysis, and identify new opportunities
You'll work with our SEO PM to prioritize experiments that make it easier for teachers and students to find relevant study materials on via organic search
You'll collaborate with product, marketing, business development, design, engineering, and analytics to foster a growth mindset
You'll be the authority on SEO strategy at Quizlet, and make sure that every team is aware of how their roadmaps impact the company’s SEO performance

We'd love to hear form you if:
You have 5-10+ years of SEO experience, including managing SEO strategy for large-scale (1M+ MAUs) consumer web products on growth-oriented projects
Ideally, you have experience leading product-driven SEO efforts for companies with User Generated Content (UGC) platforms that operate internationally
You have strong quantitative skills, and enjoy applying them to your work through impact modeling and experiment analysis
You have experience running A/B tests specifically for SEO projects, and understand best practices for gathering accurate, actionable results
You are comfortable working on a cross-functional team in a fast-paced startup environment with imperfect information and limited resources
You are excited about bringing the magic of Quizlet to 1.4 billion students across the world, improving learning through low-cost online study tools


We hope you are excited about everything you read so far. We highly encourage you to apply for this position, even if you feel you do not meet all the requirements. Quizlet is always looking for amazing folks that believe in our mission and can contribute to our team in various ways - not merely candidates that fit a certain mold.

Quizlet's Team Culture

We are here to make education better and more accessible. We strive to improve the lives of students and teachers at every stage and in every setting. We have a bias for action, take initiative, and hustle to deliver results. We make informed decisions whenever possible but are unafraid to take calculated risks on great ideas to promote learning. We embrace challenges and see effort as the path to mastery. We’re constantly seeking opportunities to learn and we embrace curiosity. Quality matters at Quizlet, and we hold the bar high on everything we do. We sweat the details and take personal accountability and pride in anything that carries the Quizlet name. We speak up, jump in and work with each other to fix problems, and never say "that's not my job." We treat each other with honesty and respect, encourage vigorous debate, and seek critical feedback. We value diversity, humility, transparency, and collaboration as the best paths to our success — as individuals, as a team, and as a company.

Quizlet’s success as an online learning community depends on a strong commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. We are actively working to build a team that is representative of the diverse communities we serve, and an open, inclusive work environment where all employees can thrive. As an equal opportunity employer and a tech company committed to societal change, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ+ community, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Come join us!

Company Overview
PURPLE

Purple exists to meaningfully improve lives through true innovation that evolves comfort from end to end. Our colorful company culture, award-winning marketing, unique (and extremely comfortable) technology, and incredible team make for a workplace you’ll be proud to be a part of. Purple is recognized as one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive companies in the comfort industry. We’re looking for amazing, motivated people who will help us improve lives and invent a better way for Purple. Come along for the ride!
Position Summary
SUMMARY:

As a UI Design Lead at Purple you’ll be joining us during an exciting time of reimagining our brand experience—how we evolve our look and feel to reflect our incredible growth and future opportunities. You will collaborate across the creative team of graphic designers, motion designers, copywriters, content creators, marketers, and leadership to define and drive the brand vision forward on all digital properties. In this role, you will work closely with our UX team to craft our visual brand identity on our digital properties through constant collaboration, iteration, and validation.



We look for and value patient and friendly individuals who are smart, kind, and brave. Curious people with a natural ability to learn quickly and develop points-of-view within a noisy and competitive category. Our team members value people over process, prioritizing effective and respectful collaboration. We look for proactive designers who can take and give direction, lead by example, and enjoy the thinking as much as the making.



RESPONSIBILITIES:
Ideate, concept, and design incredibly polished work that represents the Purple brand through storytelling, presentations, visual direction, prototypes, and everything in between
Translate brand identity standards including typography, photography, color etc., for our digital properties
Foster collaboration across teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities.
Propose concepts that elevate our digital brand experience and have the skillset to bring that to life
collaborating on the content creation to make a more compelling user experience on all digital properties
Work closely with the Creative Director and UX Director to align digital creative strategy to brand, seasonal promotions and product launches and efforts
Build and mentor a team of UI designers to support the growth of our business while actively working on your own projects
Understand and communicate the performance side of design, and also the business aspects of our products.
Directly impact our culture — bring your unique gifts and talents to add your point of view and perspective to our growing team
QUALIFICATIONS:
Hands on, roll up your sleeves, with a positive, unflappable attitude
An exceptional portfolio that reflects a foundation of design principles and awareness of current trends and how they translate to digital mediums
5 years minimum of solid UI design experience
3 years of experience in managing or leading design teams
High standards for craft
A unique point of view. You are trusted to question approaches, processes, and strategy to better serve the team to keep us fresh and distinct in a noisy, competitive industry
Thrives in an environment where ambiguity is part of the norm
Expertise with latest design software including Figma and Adobe CC
Experience working across organizational boundaries to define, manage, and prioritize work, with a collaborative and innovative approach.
Demonstrated ability to communicate complex concepts clearly across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
BENEFITS AND PERKS:
Medical, Dental, Vision
401(k) Match
Generous PTO
Market Money
Earn a Mattress
Purple Swag
Amazing Purple Products
WHY WORK AT PURPLE?
Make your mark: We value innovative thinking. At Purple, you will be empowered to bring your ideas to life as we work together to improve people’s lives through comfort.
Gain unique experience: Be a part of one of the fastest-growing companies in Utah! The contributions you make will matter at Purple as the company continues to grow with you.
Awesome culture: Join the tight-knit team at Purple and you can enjoy working alongside industry experts, making close friends, and annual employee appreciation events.

Overview


Enablement Facilitator – Content Designer

SUMMARY/OVERVIEW:

The Customer Enablement team is driving the Customer Enablement and Technical Training mission for Acoustic.

• Customer Enablement is focused on empowering users to maximize the value they derive from Acoustic solutions to drive software consumption and renewals. • Technical Training is focused on Acoustic employee and implementation business partner training around how to on-board, implement, integrate, and configure use cases within Acoustic solutions.

The Customer Enablement team is responsible for cross functional collaboration with Offering Management, Engineering, Support, Services, Client Success, Content Design, Marketing, and Sales for establishing content creation priorities, coordinating training for new product releases, and assuring consistent user experience.

This role will primarily be responsible for defining and managing enablement for a selected Acoustic product (or group of products), establishing a content creation frameworks & tools, designing/writing course content and certification criteria for users, sourcing and standardizing content from other Acoustic teams, publishing content to the Acoustic Academy, grading learners' assessments, and facilitating live training sessions.

Methods for training include how to videos and tutorials, textual guides and articles, self-paced online training, instructor led classes (both virtual and on-site), and other delivery mechanisms as needed.

The qualified candidate will work with management to determine appropriate training goals and will proactively coordinate ongoing maintenance of all training deliverables based on product roadmaps and received learners' feedback.

Responsibilities


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Develop working knowledge of selected Acoustic products and services.• Develop training plans using multiple methods of training delivery, including hands-on assessments for badges/certification.• Create and deliver industry-leading training (both online and in person) for business users and technical topics.• Manage training content, surveys, certification tests, and other assets hosted in the Learning Management System (Docebo).• Plan, configure, and manage training systems for hands-on exercises and assessments.• Meet or exceed the client’s expectations of knowledge, understanding and professionalism measured by Net Promoter Score, Customer Satisfaction and Customer Effort surveys.• Conduct needs analysis to determine the optimal scope as well as the best method of training delivery.• Proactively analyze learner’s feedback, revise and enhance online training deliverables. • Provide feedback and product enhancement ideas to Offering Management and Engineering.• Schedule and coordinate guest speakers for training classes and webinars as needed.• Facilitate online training sessions and deliver "live" instructor-led training programs.• Train the Trainer based on the created content.• Consistently deliver training materials on time and within budget.

Qualifications


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:

• Experience designing and developing e-learning courses is required, including developing instructional storyboards, content, text guides, and digital editing for multimedia required.• Three (3) years in a similar training design and content creation role preferred.• Experience with MS Office applications, video production (Camtasia), and e-learning authoring applications (Adobe Captivate)• Experience with using Learning Management Systems as well as other solutions for training delivery (e.g. Udemy, YouTube)• Demonstrated ability to understand users' needs and create world class training using principles of instructional design and adult learning theory.• Consistent focus on monitoring the feedback and providing outstanding Customer Experience to learners.• Ability to work collaboratively and effectively with all levels of management and staff within the organization.• Patient, practical and adaptable with desire to grow and develop expertise in digital marketing and analytics.• Strong attention to detail and continuous focus on accuracy of produced deliverables.• Self-motivated, consistently learning new technologies and applying those concepts to customer’s needs.

EDUCATION, TRAINING AND TRAVEL:

• Four (4) year degree in related field or certification in Instructional Design or related field.• Full business proficiency in English (C1/C2), knowledge of additional major global language is a plus.• Ability to work as part of a geographically dispersed team.• Flexibility to accommodate meetings in different time zones, sometimes planned outside of the business hours – for delivering enablement sessions for learners located around the world, as well as communicating with team members. • Up to 10% travel.

If you are interested in the position please send a brief email explaining why you are interested in the position, and providing an overview of at least one marketing campaign or operational overhaul you have successfully implemented to lee@bfklawoffice.com. Please also attach your resume.

Responsibilities
Act as the point of contact among partners, employees, clients and vendors.
Manage information flow in a timely and accurate manner.

Assist with implementing the marketing vision of the companies. Monitor and improve upon company websites and other marketing channels to ensure that copy is consistent with the firm’s vision and core values. Work with partners to develop new marketing initiatives and install those initiatives.

Prepare weekly team meeting agendas and materials.
Plan goals and objectives for office operations and identify the resources (i.e. staff, equipment, funds) required to attain optimal results.

Master at prioritizing work, tasks, projects, and relationships.

Job Title: Manager, Practice Group Business Development & Management (Corporate)
Job Description:
Company Description

null
Job Description

We are Crowell & Moring

Founded with a commitment to build a different kind of law firm, Crowell & Moring LLP today is an international law firm representing clients in litigation and arbitration, regulatory and transactional matters. We are internationally recognized for our representation of Fortune 500 companies in high-stakes litigation, as well as our ongoing commitment to pro bono service and diversity. With more than 500 lawyers based in the United States and Europe, the firm helps international corporations and emerging enterprises navigate complex legal challenges and create business solutions across the globe.

Job Summary

The Corporate Group Manager, Practice Group Business Development & Management (PGBD&M) works with and supports Crowell & Moring’s Corporate practice group. The Manager will develop and implement practice group business development strategies to strengthen and expand relationships with current clients and cultivate new clients. In addition, the Manager will identify and execute approaches to elevate the external and internal profile of the practice. The Manager will also support the leadership of the practice group in management areas, including operations, economics, recruiting and talent development.

The Manager will have the support of an assigned Practice Group Coordinator/Assistant and will report to a Director, Practice Group Business Development & Management.

This position will also work closely with other members of the Client Development & Practice Management Department, including public relations, marketing, and marketing technology, as well as the Financial Planning, Recruiting, Professional Development and Diversity Departments to ensure their initiatives support firm priorities and help drive overall firm strategy.

Primary Areas of Responsibility

Business Development and Marketing

· Partners with practice and working group leaders and assigned Director to develop and implement strategic plans.

· Engages with practice group and attorneys to understand the legal and business needs of clients and the corresponding legal solutions the firm provides. Through practice group “fluency,” contributes high-level business development advice and guidance that demonstrates a thorough understanding of the work the group and lawyers do.

· Drives business development goals of assigned group, including support for generating business leads and opportunities, expanding existing client matters, and identifying and pursuing cross-selling opportunities.

· Develops pitches and proposals, including firm responses to formal RFPs.

· Supports, monitors and reports on the progress of on-going business development efforts and initiatives for assigned groups.

· Works with individual lawyers and advises on business development best practices and strategies to assist in developing their practices.

· In collaboration with Research Services, digests and delivers meaningful research on existing and prospective clients, competitor activity, and industry or market trends to inform and support business development opportunities, strategies, and decisions.

· Develops compelling marketing collateral, website descriptions, and other client facing materials; ensures materials are regularly updated.

· Supports firm-wide efforts related to the knowledge management of pitches, proposals, and opportunities for their assigned groups.

· Ensures matters/experience lists and databases for assigned groups are maintained.

· Supports opportunities to increase brand awareness and profile for assigned practice, including outward facing activities such as sponsored events, in-house presentations, professional speaking opportunities, client alerts, and articles and other publications.

· Works with events team to plan and support practice group events.

· Oversees the timely preparation and submission of the Chambers, Law360 and other ranking submissions for the assigned groups.

Practice Management

· Working with practice group leaders, ensures practice group meetings have strong agendas and are well-run.

· In collaboration with the firm’s Financial Planning & Analysis Department, reviews and analyzes financial reports provided by the Finance Department and updates group leaders on key performance indicators.

· In collaboration with practice group leadership and the firm’s Financial Planning & Analysis Department, oversees the development, submission and ongoing monitoring of the group revenue and expense budgets for the year.

· Collaborates with the firm’s Attorney Recruiting group and Lawyer Development Committee supports recruiting initiatives.

· In collaboration with the firm’s Lateral Partner Recruiting Group, the Attorney Recruiting Group and a Senior Director, Practice Group Business Development & Management, supports the integration of lateral attorneys in the assigned group.

· Assists with other practice management functions as needed.

Qualifications

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

· Demonstrated ability to build strong working relationships across all levels of the organization and work both independently and with others.

· Excellent time management, organization, and prioritization skills.

· Excellent writing skills.

· Experience with content creation and messaging development.

· Strong business and marketing acumen. Ability to leverage research and competitive intelligence to identify business opportunities and support go-to-market strategies.

· Strong knowledge of and familiarity with legal and business environments.

· Knowledge of basic accounting and budgeting principles and experience monitoring and managing budgets.

Education

The position requires a Bachelor’s Degree. A JD, MBA or other related advanced degree may substitute for required experience.

Experience

The position requires a minimum of five (5) years of increasingly responsible, directly related experience during which the necessary knowledge, skills and abilities were attained. Strong preference for candidates with experience working with corporate/transactions attorneys or similar background. Experience in the direct supervision of others on a regular basis preferred. Direct experience in a law firm or professional services environment in any professional capacity preferred.

Additional Information

Crowell & Moring LLP offers a competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package which includes progressive options such as back up child care, wellness programs, cultural events and social activities. We take great pride in our positive, friendly culture that rewards hard work and success, at the same time recognizing the importance of family and community service.

EOE m/f/d/v
Crowell & Moring LLP participates in the E-Verify program.

Job Title: A “Get it Done Creative Genius” Marketing Coordinator
Job Description:
For a Get it Done Creative Genius…

You’re AN INCREDIBLE PARTY PLANNER. Some people call you the hostess/host with the mostess/most. Some people have ideas as great as yours. You happen to get them done. You make everything look great while at the same time getting people excited about coming through all your social media and networking channels. Everyone has a great time when you’re in charge of making things go right.

IF YOU COULD PLAN AWESOME EVENTS, shoot videos, take pictures of parties, network with Radio and TV reps and build your own department of get it done creative crazies all day every day, you’d be in heaven.

I want you to have all of that.

We’re a rapidly growing company that loves to serve our employees first and customers second to MAKE A DIFFERENCE in the Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex. We need someone with your talent and drive to take the execution of all our marketing ideas to the next level. We’ve got the strategy. We’ve got an incredible team. We’ve got an amazing family of customers. We need someone to put the spotlight on them. We need you.

Are you ready for the big chair? Can you handle a $50K SALARY, + lots of BENEFITS like health care, 401K, bonuses and lots of fun working with your teammates? Welcome aboard. We can’t wait for you to make us even better.

You’re too creative for a straight-up desk job. Don’t worry, every day you’ll be doing different things…
Supervising a video shoot in the morning
Carving it into a blog post after lunch
Helping it come alive on social media that afternoon
Networking with radio and TV honchos the next day
Making sure graphics and logos look absolutely perfect
Putting the finishing touches on our community outreach party\
Helping present free heating and cooling systems to families in needs
Setting up photo shoots with Randy and a bunch of kids…
But remember, you’re no intern. I WANT YOU TO LEAD THE SHOW. You’ll be coordinating a seven-figure ad budget, running your own department.

We’re The On Time Experts. You’ve probably heard our ads. If you haven’t, check ‘em out. Get a feel for what we believe. Yep. You’ll get to do all that for an air conditioning and plumbing company that’s better than just about any other company you’ve heard of.

Thousands of people will read this ad. They’ll SEND US A RESUMé after skimming through quickly. But that’d be a mistake. We need someone who reads every detail, who sees what others don’t. So if you don’t include #creative crazy in the subject line, we’re trashing your application. Won’t even open it. If you really want to send us your resumé you can, but we really want to read a letter you’ve written about why you want to work here and some stories about events you’ve organized, complete with pictures, If you attach a video you’ve put together, that’s extra credit. See, you’re already an insider, just because you pay attention to the small stuff! That’s why we want you on our team.

The On Time Experts is a family owned business with great Google reviews. Everyone who works here is DRUG-FREE, SMOKE-FREE, BACKGROUND CHECKED with a clean driving record. No exceptions. No excuses. If you won’t pass a drug test, sayonara, amigo; skip to the next ad. We can’t hire just anyone to be a part of the incredible team we’ve put together. You’ve got to be incredible. But if you’re still reading this, chances are you’re one pretty amazing person.

I’m Randy Kelley. I started in the parts department and worked my way up to ownin’ the company.

I’ve got a whatever it takes tattoo on my heart to serve my employees and my community.

I’m serious about you succeeding and growing your career as far as you want to take it.

COMPANY

AccuWeather, recognized and documented as the most accurate source of weather forecasts and warnings in the world, has saved tens of thousands of lives, prevented hundreds of thousands of injuries and tens of billions of dollars in property damage. With global headquarters in State College, Pennsylvania, and other offices around the world, AccuWeather serves more than 1.5 billion people daily to help them plan their lives and get more out of their day through innovative digital media properties, such as AccuWeather.com and mobile, as well as AccuWeather For Business, radio, television, newspapers, and the 24/7 AccuWeather Network.

Additionally, AccuWeather produces and distributes news, weather content, and video for more than 180,000 third-party websites. Among AccuWeather's many innovative and award-winning features free to the public are MinuteCast® Minute by Minute™ forecasts with Superior Accuracy™. Further, AccuWeather serves more than half of Fortune 500 companies and thousands of businesses globally.

SUMMARY

The Senior Video Producer/Editor (SVP) will be responsible for developing video producer/editing techniques, skills and workflow to ensure the production of the highest quality, most engaging content. The SVP will help improve workflow related to news editing, package production and archiving. The SVP will focus on advancing the team's production understanding and skill level. The SVP will also be responsible for coordinating video production for key series, franchise and ad sales/marketing/promotional requirements and do so with a deadline driven mentality. The SVP is a collaborative team player who works closely with the executive producer, executive editor and other management to develop a specific curriculum intended to improve storytelling and quality editing. The individual will utilize one-on-one and group training to grow storytelling skills that engage audiences and bring editorial concepts to life.

The SVP will introduce and advance After Effects and sound design knowledge. The SVP will also increase staff skill level in virtual reality, augmented reality and other emerging technologies.

The SVP will work in tandem with the Video Content Manager to identify ways to improve video production workflow related to speed, efficiency and prioritization. The SVP will utilize their extensive experience to define the best platforms and file transfer methods for video production collaboration. They will have a strong understanding of digital technology, media management and distribution, and have hands-on proficiency with post-production software: Adobe Premier, After Effects, Pro Tools, etc.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Help develop team competence with fundamental news and storytelling edit capability
Train teams in the use of After Effects, DaVinci Resolve, ProTools, and other finishing software.
Manage a daily post production workflow.
Manage and schedule the completion of edited programming according to the broadcast schedule.
Ensure quality control of all programming delivered for broadcast.
When required, assist in field and studio productions
Help improve content ideation process and conceptualization, covering end-to-end execution of shows/productions including social video content
Mentor and coach more junior members of the team to help develop their post-production skills
Continuously search for tools, plug-ins, software, and other relevant industry innovations to continue improving the overall look and feel of our video content
Build and maintain relationships across a variety of groups including sales, marketing, programming, digital, linear, studio and other show teams
QUALIFICATIONS
At least five years of Cable/TV news production and/or Digital editing experience
Proven ability to take ideas from creation and through execution
Demonstrated ability to produce both short and longform content in a stylized fashion
Must be able to communicate effectively with talent, management and others
Must have a command of production terminology and procedures
Must be knowledgeable on Mac, with strong proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite Production Suite (Photoshop, Premiere), After Effects, as well as an understanding of Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook
Must have experience working with social platforms and live streaming experience
News camera experience and professional audio experience highly preferred
Must be able to multitask and work well under pressure while dealing with
on-air scheduling deadlines
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to deal with multiple projects simultaneously and manage each through to high quality delivery

What is Code Galaxy?

Code Galaxy is the nation's fastest growing kids coding after school online learning program. With our model, kids have blast and can't wait to come back, and parents are thrilled as their children gain confidence learning coding, math, logic, and problem-solving skills as they progress through each level.

What is the Job?

You will strategically plan all SEO initiatives. The SEO specialist will be responsible for link building, long tail content creation, competitor backlink analysis, and on page site optimization. You have experience with developing strategies and implementing a comprehensive SEO plan with a heavy emphasis on link building and creative/scrappy link building strategies.

Use of Research & Analytic Tools to assist with our Research for SEO
Content Strategy Build Outs for SEO

Perform Ongoing Keyword Discovery and Case Studies
Research and implement new search engine optimization techniques
Development and implementation of link building strategies
Work with the development team to ensure SEO best practices are properly implemented on newly developed code
Work with editorial and marketing teams to drive SEO in content creation and content programming
Recommend changes to website architecture, content, linking and other factors to improve SEO positions for target keywords.

Proven SEO experience
Solid understanding of performance marketing, conversion, and online customer acquisition
In-depth experience with website analytics tools- Google Analytics as an example
Experience with Programs like Semrush, Ahrefs, BrightLocal, and other similar software
Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments
Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development and constraints
Knowledge of ranking factors and search engine algorithms
Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in SEO and SEM
BS/MS degree in a quantitative, test-driven field

About Us:

Wilson & Company has a rich history in planning and design, and the right candidate will become part of our bright future. The firm was founded in 1932 and provides services to a diverse client base including railroads; municipal, state, and federal agencies; energy, industrial, and commercial companies; and private developers.

The cornerstone of our success is Higher Relationships, standards in Discipline, Intensity, Collaboration, Shared Ownership, and Solutions. Discipline is doing it right, with attention to details without exception. Intensity is doing what it takes to meet and exceed expectations. Collaboration is working together and bringing out the best in each other. Shared Ownership means we adopt the goals of others as our own. Finally, Solutions are achieved in a win-win environment. We value this commitment to Higher Relationships with our employees, clients, and the communities where we live and work. And for you, our culture intends to help you achieve personal and professional success. Come grow with us!

We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment background checks.

At Farm Credit Mid-America, we believe people are our strongest asset. We are consistently looking to hire individuals from a wide range of experience and capabilities who have a desire to serve. Currently, we have over 1,100 employees across Indiana, Ohio, Kentucky and Tennessee.

BASIC FUNCTION:

The Marketing Coordinator provides support for the marketing department’s ongoing operational needs and annual and project based initiatives. This position also assumes full ownership of the Company Store and the marketing request intake system.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Assist Farm Credit Mid-America and Rural 1st marketing teammates with ongoing support for customer engagement, branding, partner relations and retail engagement initiatives.
Successful ownership of the Company Store, including but not limited to: managing the vendor relationship and assessing vendor performance; product selection and inventory management; management of budget and annual spend; fielding team member requests and questions; and providing an excellent customer experience within a timely manner.
Update and manage marketing dashboard on an ongoing basis; prepare marketing reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing relevant data.
Provide monthly update of marketing team efforts to VP of Marketing to share with senior leadership.
Support with in-take of departmental projects and creative requests from across the association.
Execute processes that track, maintain and distribute all marketing inventory.
Provide administrative support for the marketing department and support ad-hoc needs across the team.
Daily management of marketing mailbox, answering questions or directing inquires to the appropriate resource in a timely and collaborative manner.
Coordinate marketing needs and resources for EVP Chief Lending Officer and senior leadership as needed.
Demonstrate excellent customer service standards.
Represent and communicate Farm Credit Mid-America’s purpose and values and complies with association conduct and security policies and confidentiality expectations.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Associate or Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related field preferred. Minimum of two years’ experience in marketing, administrative support or other relevant business experience required. Farm Credit Mid-America and / or combination of education and experience considered.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of: Association operations; policies and procedures; administrative functions and responsibilities; principles and procedures of writing; principles of project management, Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.

Skills in: Organization and handling details; tact and diplomacy; verbal and creative written communications; managing projects in varying stages of completion, reporting progress, clarifying, explaining, listening, taking directions, problem solving, time management, and coaching others.

Ability to: Be dependable; communicate effectively, get along with others, keep track of people at various stages of progress, make successful presentations, maintain confidentiality, demonstrate integrity and initiative, demonstrate enthusiasm, be flexible, be assertive, use sound judgment, work with speed and accuracy, research, analyze, grasp information quickly, troubleshoot issues, make decisions, solve problems related to projects, gain understanding quickly of the diverse functions within Farm Credit Mid-America, be logical, work independently and as a team member.

MENTAL AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

This job requires the incumbent to have the ability to:
Engage in telephone and face-to-face conversation to serve customers and give and receive information from staff, vendors, outside consultants and the public.
Use computer. This involves reading the screen and keying/typing information.
Speak and make presentations to individuals or groups on technical subjects related to job.
Travel via auto or commercial transportation to carry out essential responsibilities of the job.
Successfully interact with and represent the organization to staff, officers, board members, customers, vendors, and/or the public at all levels.
Provide sound technical advice to leaders and other staff in the subject field(s) related to this position.
Understand and explain various subject matter and consulting concepts, programs, terminology, and methods.
Reason, judge, compare, calculate, evaluate, decide, and critique such information as written material, numerical data, responses to customer needs, and/or other related work activities.
Requirements of the job include the ability to do the work, with or without reasonable accommodations. It is the Association's policy to make reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities. Leadership retains the right to add, subtract or change duties of the position at any time.

Farm Credit Mid-America is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other category protected by law.

Established in 2004, Lakshya Digital, a Keywords Studio, is the largest interactive entertainment and game development services studio in South Asia. We have game production studios in Gurgaon and Pune, and business offices in Tokyo, Japan and San Diego, California.

Our continued success is fueling the need to support overseas growth in India and Japan, as well as further expansion in the US. We are looking for top quality talent to become part of our studio in Redmond, WA, to help facilitate this effort. If you have grown weary of working on the same project doing the same thing from year to year, or if you are interested in experiencing what it is like to simultaneously work on a variety of projects, then dust off your resume, polish up your portfolio and send it to us for consideration.

As the contingent Associate Outsourcing Character Art Director, you will supervise a team to ensure the consistent delivery of top-quality character content, documentation, and production plans that satisfy both externally and internally created specifications for multiple projects. The Associate Art Director must be able to thrive in a highly dynamic and collaborative environment, by being highly organized and detail oriented, with exceptional oral and written communication skills. Our Associate Outsourcing Character Art Director must possess relevant technical skills used in a Lead or Associate Art Director role on at least one AAA Current Gen console game. Previous experience working with an external art team, or as a service vendor, is a big plus.

Responsibilities:
Interface directly with clients to understand their needs and form a solid working relationship.
Collaborate with teams, both on site and oversees, to find production solutions that uphold the client’s quality expectations and adhere to established technical requirements. Contributing innovative and original ideas towards all aspects of production and support of PMs and Account Managers.
Pre-production support for characters and/or environment content including the creation of technical and artistic specifications for art assets, as well as establishing production pipelines per client requirements.
Contribute to internal studio training efforts, working with teams in India and Japan to internalize established processes and best practices. Overseas travel required to fully support this initiative.
Demonstrate and facilitate a strong understanding of color, light, and visual design.
Able to prioritize and provide feedback and review for more than two projects at a time.
Work with the Project Managers and other leads and artists to identify risks, develop solid estimates, pipelines, schedules, and production plans.
Manage and mentor Senior level character Outsource Artists that report to them. . Demonstrate, communicate, and exemplify clear expectations for quality of work, productivity, communication, and professionalism to the team.
Responsible for the quality of all incoming art assets from the projects they are leading and the projects of their direct reports which could include as many as 3 projects and teams of 75+ 3D artists. Actively works to improve approval ratio for their team by providing clear and concise visual and written feedback.
Depending on the project needs, able to create assets in a variety of software packages including, Maya, 3DS Max, Zbrush, Substance, and Photoshop.
Requirements
A minimum of 10 years’ industry experience with at least one published game credited in a Lead or Associate Art Director Role.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong understanding of issue tracking tools like JIRA, or Shotgun.
An expert-level understanding for current-gen game content development processes, pipelines, limitations, and dependencies as it relates to character creation.
Skilled with current tools and technologies; Maya or Max, UE4, Unity, Zbrush, Photoshop, Substance Designer/Painter, and Marvelous Designer.
3D sculpting, modeling, texturing, and material creation skills for creating game content with the proven ability to produce and direct the production of top quality current generation content in a variety of styles for play on multiple platforms.
Able to analyze and understand client aesthetic requirements and translate that into workable feedback for external art teams.
Demonstrated ability to be proactive and self-motivated, work without direct supervision, and present the work of the team and the project in a professional manner.
Previous team leadership experience required on multiple projects; having demonstrated the ability to mentor less experienced artists to achieve top quality and consistent results.
Must be able to travel internationally 10-20% of the year.
BA or equivalent industry experience.
Benefits
Medical, Dental, Vision benefits
Voluntary Long-term / Short-term Disability
401K w/ company match
Work alongside dynamic individuals in the gaming industry
Work within a company with upward career growth opportunities
Convenient location in Redmond
Open/No Cost parking
And MORE!!

Marketing Coordinator

Who we are

The Residential Real Estate Council (RRC), was established in 1976 to provide real estate brokers with shared knowledge and tools. Recognizing the need for advanced education, the Council developed training courses for sales agents and established the Certified Residential Specialist Designation.

Headquartered in downtown Chicago, the RRC is recognized as the leading provider of real estate education and networking for residential real estate agents, and the CRS Designation is considered the most prestigious designations a real estate agent can achieve.

The Residential Real Estate Council is looking for a marketing coordinator with email marketing and digital marketing experience to join our team and work directly under the Marketing Manager in implementing and executing marketing campaigns to promote the council’s education and events, acquire new members and retain current members. We’re looking for someone who is creative, curious and highly proactive, who can work in a fast paced environment producing engaging content, and execute distribution primarily through email and digital marketing platforms. Someone who is not afraid to ask questions and find answers, who can propose new ways of doing things, who understands strategy, and who is highly motivated in getting things done.

Responsibilities
Manage the Council’s advertising sales efforts.
Develop and produce emails and digital marketing campaigns sent by the Council to promote its education products.
Manage marketing calendar for the education products.
Manage and maintain the Adestra email marketing platform
Develops and creates Marketing campaigns and efforts
Manages and report on sales and sale activity by email
Report on results and recommend new approaches and promotions
Other activities as assigned.
This description should not be construed to contain every function or responsibility that may be required to be performed by an incumbent in this job. Incumbents are required to perform other related functions as assigned.

Experience Needed
BA/BS in marketing or other relevant degree
2 to 5 years of related marketing experience
Experience managing marketing programs including website, email marketing, and social medial
Experience in copy writing for marketing/communications with preferred experience in real estate
Proven ability to produce accurate copy, as well as a demonstrated proficiency in editing and proofreading skills.
High level of creativity and initiative; able to balance multiple projects while maintaining attention to detail and meeting deadlines.
Strong verbal communication and interpersonal skills.
Proficient computer skills including MS Office applications and Adobe Creative Cloud.
Ability to work flexible schedule to meet high volume work periods.
Benefits of working for us:
This is a temp to hire position. After 90 days, this position can be converted to a full time role with full benefits.
The Residential Real Estate Council is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status or disability.

Job Title: Software Engineer - React Native / Node.js / Azure
Job Description:
Job Description
We are looking for a software engineer to help create and ship new experiences to our console gaming fans. Part of our vision is to build a scalable ecosystem platform that will support our franchise priorities and serve as a single connection point between our fans, their communities and our experiences. To support this initiative, we are investing deeply and working on creating new experiences for our active players.

Our team strives for continuous improvement with a focus on quality, performance and availability. We are constantly exploring the possibilities of new technologies and encourage our team members to innovate. Qualifications

• Social media experience preferred. Please upload your resume and cover letter in PDF format. Applications that do not upload both documents will not be considered.

Who we are


Who we areThe Spaceship Company (TSC) is an affiliate of Virgin Galactic as a space-system manufacturing organization. Headquartered at Mojave Air and Space Port in Mojave, California, it is building and testing a fleet of WhiteKnightTwo carrier aircraft and SpaceShipTwo reusable spaceships that, together, form Virgin Galactic’s human spaceflight system. Like many Virgin companies across the world, its team of over 400 talented and dedicated engineers, technicians and professionals are drawn together by a willingness to disrupt and challenge the status quo and deliver innovative aerospace solutions to our customers’ needs. TSC’s extensive capabilities encompass preliminary vehicle design and analysis, manufacturing, ground testing, flight testing and post-delivery support.

Our Values

TSC and the greater Virgin Organization have a relaxed and informal culture that encourages individuality and innovation. You will be motivated, enterprising and enthusiastic. Company culture is such that you need to be able to “check your ego at the door”, be a self-starter and possess a sense of humility. You will work well under pressure and thrive on being given challenges and responsibility. You will communicate clearly and be confident and persuasive. You will have a high level of integrity and understand the need of complete confidentiality.

Who You Are The Spaceship Company (TSC) is seeking a Technical Writer whose responsibilities include creating, writing, a variety of technical manuals including maintenance manuals (AMM, CMM, GMM), Pilot Operating Handbooks (POHs), Service Bulletins (SB), Operating Instructions (OI), training documents, and other manuals to S1000D specification, and outputting them into PDF, Interactive Electronic Technical Manuals (IETMs) and other formats. The Technical Writer will be expected to work hands-on with maintainers, engineers, and manufacturing personnel to create best-practices and procedures for custom-built aircraft. The Technical Writer will review and rework any discrepancies related to various aircraft/spacecraft systems. Additionally, the Technical Writer will make sure that the documentation conforms to established style guides and standards and will work with product managers and end users to make sure all technical documentation meets customer requirements. The Technical Writer is expected to become a subject matter expert on aircraft systems by interviewing product engineers, observing performance of production methods, referring to technical drawings and specifications, and engineering illustrations. He/she will oversee preparation of illustrative materials, select drawings, sketches, diagrams and charts. He/she will conduct quality review of materials.

Your Mission
Write and maintain spacecraft technical documentation to include operator, maintenance, training and other supporting materials
Collaborate with document users and product managers to make sure of accuracy, quality, clarity and effectiveness of documentation
Provide and solicit feedback for improvement of documentation and writing processes
Collaborate with other technical writers in development of procedures and methods of writing to reflect best industry practices
What you bring
Bachelors' degree and 5+ years minimum related experience in technical writing, preferably with aviation/aerospace experience
Familiar with space and/or aviation documentation formats, including ATA 100 / iSpec 2200 and/or S1000D authoring and publication standards, AMM, GOM, GMM, POH (including normal and emergency procedures), TO, SB, Technical Directives, Airworthiness Directives, etc.
Ability to work hands-on with cross-functional teams
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to create accurate and concise technical materials
Organized and detail-oriented
Flexible and open-minded
Creative and imaginative, open to unique ways of presenting information
Self-motivated, self-disciplined, and able to work with minimal supervision
Able to work independently and in a team environment
Ability to react to change and thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment
Demonstrated competency in the following:
Content Creation and Publishing Tools
Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project
Experience with SGML/XML
Strong overall computer skills.
Familiarity with aviation/aerospace operations, pilot and maintenance processes
ITAR RequirementsTo conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, applicant must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by ITAR (22 CFR §120.15) or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State.The Spaceship Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with The Spaceship Company is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.

Company Overview
PURPLE

Purple exists to meaningfully improve lives through true innovation that evolves comfort from end to end. Our colorful company culture, award-winning marketing, unique (and extremely comfortable) technology, and incredible team make for a workplace you’ll be proud to be a part of. Purple is recognized as one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive companies in the comfort industry. We’re looking for amazing, motivated people who will help us improve lives and invent a better way for Purple. Come along for the ride!
Position Summary
WHO WE ARE:

We are the Purple eCommerce Team. We are a fast-growing group of customer experience, product management, and digital business experts. Our mission is simple; drive measurable business value by delivering experiences that support our product and brand strategies as well as our customer's motivations, behaviors and needs across their journeys.

WHO YOU ARE:

You are a well-organized and strategic practitioner, with an enthusiasm for owning and driving numerous projects simultaneously. You are passionate about the customer journey and building a consistent brand story across products and platforms. You enjoy working with multiple teams in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, identifying opportunities to solve problems, and building out premier customer experiences throughout our eCommerce landscape.

YOUR ROLE:

We are looking for an experienced and passionate Site Merchandiser to join our eCommerce department. In this role, your primary responsibility will be to deliver product and brand experiences that support customer and business needs and drive outcomes. To achieve this, you will work with the eCommerce, Product, and Creative teams to build compelling, consumer-centric content that clearly and consistently explains our products and brand across Purple’s eCommerce ecosystem.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Research and report on consumer browsing and buying habits with the Analytics and Merchandising teams to identify product and brand messaging that resonates with our customers.
Integrate customer questions and learnings into creative briefs to strengthen product images, videos, and content that is delivered by the Creative team.
Partner with the Product, Creative, and Marketing to understand and differentiate our content across various marketplaces and customer shopping paths while maintaining the Purple brand story.
Manage product, brand, and promotional content delivery onto our web stores through Purple’s CMS platforms across an annual promotional calendar.
Partner with the eCommerce User Experience and Product teams to build new, exciting templates that communicate our product and brand messaging to customers.
Actively work with your team members to estimate content creation activities, delivery estimates, and timelines for single projects.
Develop strong cross-functional relationships with teams such as Product Management, Market Research, Product Development, Marketing, Brand, Analytics and User Experience to deliver experience that supports holistic business needs and points of view.
REQUIREMENTS:
4+ years creating eCommerce content deliverables
2+ years positioning Brand and Product stories into customer journeys
2+ years managing CMS content
2+ years working in an Agile environment
Expert level knowledge and experience identifying and resolving consumer questions and needs across eCommerce platforms.
Intermediate level understanding of the marketing, conversion motivators, and shopping behaviors between wholly owned eCommerce platforms and marketplace environments
Experience interpreting and reporting on multiple-source data and trend analysis such as social, analytics, customer feedback, customer service, etc.
Strong storytelling skills that enables you to turn various qualitative and quantitative data sources into a compelling and easily understood set of content recommendations.
BENEFITS AND PERKS:
Medical, Dental, Vision
401(k) Match
Generous PTO
Market Money
Earn a Mattress
Purple Swag
Amazing Purple Products
WHY WORK AT PURPLE?
Make your mark: We value innovative thinking. At Purple, you will be empowered to bring your ideas to life as we work together to improve people’s lives through comfort.
Gain unique experience: Be a part of one of the fastest growing companies in Utah! The contributions you make will matter at Purple as the company continues to grow with you.
Awesome culture: Join the tight-knit team at Purple and you can enjoy working alongside industry experts, making close friends, and annual employee appreciation events.

The content director is a strategic brand leader responsible for overseeing creative strategy, vision, execution and operations across all media channels—print (magazines, special interest publications and books), digital, video and experiential. With a data journalist’s mindset, she/he is a driving force in business development and advertising sales, helping to ideate and execute new, exciting and scalable growth opportunities for the media brand and team.

Dynamic and assertive, the media content director thrives in a fast-paced environment, loves pushing boundaries and can see and guide the team toward a future ripe with possibilities. She/he fosters a culture in which delivering creative excellence, experimentation and innovation are the norm. A person who leads by example, our content director inspires and delights the team with his or her own bold yet strategically sound creativity and will encourage an environment in which ideas are eagerly shared. Support and mentoring are critical in our team’s DNA.

Our content director is someone with the vision to see beyond a specific project and identify bigger, longer-term opportunities for our brand. Skilled in both print and digital content creation and execution, and serving as editor in chief of the flagship Magazine she/he is highly collaborative and works across teams for the greater good of the brand and business. With charisma to spare and the power to persuade, our content director uses both qualities to sell through ideas that are right for our brand, magazine, and our partners.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
Serves as the media brand guardian, ensuring voice/tone and visual look and feel are carried out cohesively across all channels; collaborates with the Consumer Marketing and Ad Sales team to ensure proper expression of brand in marketing materials.
Serves as editor-in-chief of the bi-monthly Magazine and plays a leading role in content creation of Magazine SIPs.
Actively leads the ideation of omnichannel premium content, ensuring topics are on-brand, ideal for sponsorship and executed to the highest quality caliber.
Builds a strong creative culture among the creative team and shared services.
Serves on hiring team for all editorial and design positions.
Participates in Content team management meetings and training.
Represents brand in media interviews and at conferences nationwide, attending and speaking at key sessions or panels.
Helps lead product innovation for brand and magazine, routinely bringing new ideas to the table as way to expand the breadth and depth of the brands offerings.
Onboards direct reports and participate in the effective onboarding of new staff within the Magazine/ Media team.
Understands all work processes to ensure effective on-boarding of creative staff.
Requirements
College degree in English, journalism or liberal arts required.
10-15 years of relevant experience in digital and print content development and publishing.
At least 10 years’ experience in management of high-performance creative teams.
Proven track record of developing omnichannel content programs that deliver measurable results.
Demonstrated success in building and maintaining positive relationships with direct reports, peers and leadership.
Expertise in providing insightful and effective coaching.
Ease with leading multiple projects at the same time.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, with decisive and direct style.
Excellent interpersonal skills. Must be a good listener and observer.
Effective problem-solver and multitasker, with the ability to quickly shift priorities and work under pressure.
Highly collaborative team player and change agent.
Positive and open-minded, with a strong sense of integrity and fair mindedness.

Company Description

H Mart is an Asian-American supermarket chain that has been in business for over 30 years, specializing in Asian and Western groceries, fresh/frozen meats, seafood and produce.

All H Mart stores are operated by five modern warehouse/distribution centers, one primary food processing facility, and over 4,600 passionate employees that have supported each store every day.

H Mart has been praised by numerous U.S. media for its high quality products and customer-driven environment with annual sales exceeding $1 billion.

Job Description
Fidelity Payment Services is looking to hire an experienced full-time Marketing Coordinator to be available as a resource for the Marketing Department to support and execute marketing projects and contribute to the overall success of the Marketing Department. The ideal candidate has strong project management skills and attention to detail with the ability to successfully manage multiple tasks at the same time. The right fit should have excellent verbal and written communication skills, possess highly effective interpersonal skills and is proactive with a ‘can-do’ attitude.

Duties and Responsibilities:
● Serve as the primary point of contact for Marketing-related inquiries, including phone, email, as well as internal correspondence.
● Act as the liaison between sales agents and internal marketing department.
● Collaborate across teams and departments to help organize, execute and track the tactical and strategic plans and activities implemented by the marketing team.
● Assisting with the planning and execution of events and trade shows.
● Creating digital marketing content and maintaining a social media editorial calendar and posting schedule.
● Researching advertising opportunity, managing and coordinating ad placement.
● Creating presentations, memos and reports.
● Proactively monitoring and increasing brand awareness and reputation, including online reviews as well as ensuring that the company brand is presented consistently.

Requirements and Qualifications:
● 5+ years of proven experience working in an office environment, preferably as part of a Marketing Department or a Marketing Agency preferably in B2B, financial services, or other Fintech services experience, a plus.
● A marketing-related degree is preferred.
● Ability to work effectively within a team and independently.
● High level of professionalism with strong interpersonal skills.
● Demonstrable ability to multi-task and adhere to deadlines.
● Strong organizational skills with excellent attention to detail.
● Excellent verbal and written communication skills including editing and proofreading.
● Self-directed and motivated with excellent problem-solving skills.
● Experience with cross-platform media including digital, social media, and print.
