● Knowledge of animation/video experience, a plus.
● Graphic design skills, a plus.
Company Description
Fidelity Payment Services is a world-class merchant services provider based in Brooklyn, New York that enables businesses to accept credit cards as a form of payment. We also provide a full suite of payment services options to businesses and industries throughout the United States, United Kingdom and Canada, including gift cards, ACH and check services. Founded in 1996, Fidelity has since garnered the distinct reputation as being one of the largest MSP’s in the Northeastern region with merchant retention rates exceeding industry baselines by double digits. The processing platforms utilized by Fidelity are responsible for more than 76% of America’s annual credit card processing volume. Professional in-house underwriting, risk, customer service and technical support departments allow for swift merchant approval and trouble-free processing procedures. Fidelity maintains a full-time staff of over 100 employees and features a network of over 180 certified agents and referral partners with representation in all 50 states, UK and Canada, allowing the company to service tens of thousands of merchants nationwide.
Cardknox, based in Howell, NJ, is premier payments gateway solution and subsidiary company of Fidelity Payment Services. Cardknox is a developer-friendly payment gateway, that has created a marketplace revolution with flexible EMV solutions that can be integrated with POS systems using only a few lines of code. Cardknox serves thousands of customers across every major industry throughout the United States, UK and Canada.

Job Title: Thryv Vertical Product Manager – Home Services
Job Description:
This position is responsible for driving verticalization for the Thryv product in Home Services. It will require various types of analysis between industry software products and our Thryv software. Critical thinking skills and working independently are a must. This role will require you to work with various departments cross-functionally, assist with training, meet existing/potential software clients and attend conferences. Strong written and verbal communication is needed as you will be creating verticalized marketing campaigns and social media posts for our industry templates. This will also include creating content for our branding and lead generation teams. We need someone who can adapt quickly to change and is ready for new challenges each day. This role reports directly to the Sr. Manager Thryv Product.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Software Gap Analysis -- Become a master of Thryv software and competing software’s to perform gap analysis 30%

Manage the Verticalized Thryv Templates and Social Library -- Posts Create content for marketing campaigns and social media libraries for the Home Services vertical

Build out Requirements for Software Updates and Changes -- When submitting changes to developers, requirement documents will need to be created

Support for Branding and Lead Generation -- Creating verticalized content for our lead generation team and branding team to use in collateral, training or for marketing campaign

Ride Along with Sales, Sit with Ops, and Attend Verticalized Conferences -- Feet on the street and getting in-front of SMBs. This will be through ride days with sales, listening to calls with our support teams and attending vertical specific conference

Minimum Qualifications:

• Must be 18 years of age or older.

• Must successfully complete pre-employment screening process

· Two to four years of experience in product management

· Ability to work independently and collaboratively as a team based on project requirements

· Ability to prioritize projects, features and tasks from various sources

· Technical documentation writing

· Speak in-front of people or at a group conference

· Flexibility to travel

· Communicate effectively to developers and in layman’s terms to others who aren’t specialized in the industry

· Work in a fast paced environment that is changing on a daily basis

· Experience with SMB software

· Industry knowledge of the Home Service vertical

· Client facing experience

• Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university

Additional Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

· Content creation experience

· Demonstrate industry knowledge/expertise

Job Title: Corporate Vice President, National Virtual Training Manager
Job Description:
A career at New York Life offers many opportunities. To be part of a growing and successful business. To reach your full potential, whatever your specialty. Above all, to make a difference in the world by helping people achieve financial security. It’s a career journey you can be proud of, and you’ll find plenty of support along the way. Our development programs range from skill-building to management training, and we value our diverse and inclusive workplace where all voices can be heard. Recognized as one of Fortune’s World’s Most Admired Companies, New York Life is committed to improving local communities through a culture of employee giving and service, supported by our Foundation. It all adds up to a rewarding career at a company where doing right by our customers is part of who we are, as a mutual company without outside shareholders. We invite you to bring your talents to New York Life, so we can continue to help families and businesses “Be Good At Life.” To learn more, please visit LinkedIn, our Newsroom and the Careers page of www.NewYorkLife.com.

New York Life’s primary distribution channel is the career Agency sales force of more than 12,000 agents, operating in virtually every major city in the United States. Every agent is affiliated with one of our 117 General Offices. These offices are operated by Agency management teams responsible for agent and management recruiting, development, and sales. Approximately half our agents operate their businesses out of our General Offices, while the other half maintains independent office locations.

Our General Offices are divided up among four Zones. In addition to our Zone offices, an Agency Home Office team responsible for strategy, finance, administration, standards, training, marketing and communications supports our agents and field managers. The Agency operation also comprises teams charged with growing our business in key market segments, including the middle-income market, the advanced (high-net-worth) market, select cultural markets, and the women’s markets. Agents sell individual life insurance, individual annuities, and long-term care insurance products, as well as mutual funds.

Role Overview:
Oversee specific aspects of the Field Development National Training program for our 12,000 agents and Field Agents.
Supervises the National Training team - People and Talent management.
Research and develop the content and delivery methods for online training to different segments of NYL Agents
Facilitates a wide array of training programs that could include: Onboarding, Essential and Progressive development training programs; Specialized Programs; Technology training; Product training
Deliver and implement programs using Adobe Connect and other web technologies.
Build and implement the training standards, systems and best practices for content creation, curation, distribution, archiving and ongoing maintenance.
Partner with DMs, ZTOs (Zone Training Officers) internal business stakeholders and Agency teams to define and build new content based on business plans and established key business goals.
Develop and continually manage an integrated training calendar for key initiatives along within Agency Management.
Conduct regular gap analysis of existing content, identifying sections that need a greater depth of material and removing outdated material. Develop content strategy to address identified gaps.
Review and communicate analytics and key success metrics on an ongoing basis to understand user behavior and help shape and manage content and training strategies.
Build and support metrics on remote adult learning and ROI on Virtual Training.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree
Minimum of 10+ years of relevant experience.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and Adobe Acrobat Pro.
Experience with Adobe Connect and webinar platforms and best practices. Experience with Adobe Creative Cloud a plus.
Must be a strong virtual training facilitator and be able to engage a sales team.
Understanding of Virtual Classroom user experience, especially as it pertains to adult learning and remote virtual learning experience.
Passion for creating great training with actionable knowledge of the digital landscape, including current industry and user trends, emerging technologies, and standards.
Strong writing ability with a focus on eLearning instructional design.
Familiarity and expertise with eLearning training platforms.
Ability to scope, organize and execute multiple projects with interrelated goals.
Must be comfortable with complicated technical and regulatory language.
Extensive experience building training content preferably within the financial services, insurance, or other highly regulated industry.
Proven experience conceptualizing and producing print, digital and web-based training assets.
Project management is a plus.
EOE M/F/D/V

Job Description
Marketing Coordinator

The Center for Innovative GYN Care is a progressive minimally invasive GYN surgical practice that is rapidly expanding into the New York metropolitan market, while continuing to build its Washington DC metropolitan base. CIGC’s marketing team has developed an analytics-driven and comprehensive approach to direct-to-consumer medical marketing. The approach effectively drives patients to the revolutionary GYN practice by educating patients about their options. A Senior Marketing Coordinator is required to scale up the efforts as we grow and expand.

CIGC has more than tripled its business as well as implemented a travel program that has brought hundreds of patients from across the United States and around the globe. CIGC is now poised to expand into new markets, with the same dedication and savvy that has brought success into the Washington DC area.

The Marketing Coordinator’s role will be to collaborate with/manage multiple marketing and media partners with a focus on the organization’s direct-to-consumer marketing campaign and conversions. The Marketing Coordinator will also manage the organization’s CMS and CRM platforms, and support all other marketing efforts. You will need business acumen and technical expertise with Salesforce marketing automation tools. This role requires learning about our company, clients, medical services, and unique marketing differences.

Responsibilities:
Liaise with external marketing and media partners
Work in highly collaborative environment to manage direct-to-consumer marketing campaign and conversions
Oversees and coordinates activities of external firms, troubleshoots, and organizes corrective actions
Maintains and grows internal and external key relationships and partnerships
Reputation Management
Track and report on multiple review sites online
Solicit satisfied patients to leave positive reviews
Gather client testimonials
Build strategies and action plans to address negative reviews
Optimize physician profiles online
Inbound Marketing Management via Pardot:
Deploy email marketing campaigns and manage drip campaigns
Maintain subscriber lists (remove opt outs, etc.)
Report on email metrics, provide recommendations for improving engagement based on analytics trends
Develop layout, copy and creative for company newsletters
CRM Administration:
Using a working knowledge of Salesforce and Pardot, help manage CIGC’s business relationships and deliver actionable data
Create reports, custom dashboards, workflows, and other tasks.
Manage users and provide support for CIGC staff (end users), edit emails, coordinate trainings
Website Development
Oversee and help manage content creation and approvals; post launch support
Manage vendor relationships, including contract negotiation; research new vendors
Analytics
Help to measure and report on ROI using Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Pardot Engagement Studio, Google Analytics, etc.
Digital Marketing
Design and edit corporate marketing materials including such items as business cards, brochures, forms, letterheads, patient forms, and other notices, as well as creative assets for website and social media profiles
Manage marketing and sales materials; replenish or create promotional materials as needed, including placing, tracking and circulating orders
Write, edit, and design content for business profiles including main site and third-party sites, including social media
Budget management: maintain annual budget ledger; ensure invoices are paid on time; work with Accounts Payable to set up vendors; manage credit card reconciliations.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field
3 or more years of experience in the advertising, marketing and communications fields, including deep understanding of CMS and CRM, email marketing management, production of digital and traditional marketing creative, SEO best practices, and digital marketing trends Experience should include project management in a creative environment.
CMS and CRM experience
Proficiency with InDesign, familiarity with HTML, and a basic knowledge of the Adobe Suite preferred
Hands-on experience with Google Analytics
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite
Experience with project management platforms (Asana, Basecamp, Trello)
Experience with healthcare marketing preferred
Thorough and detail oriented, stellar writing and editing skills, deadline and goal oriented, and excellent ability to communicate effectively with others
Strong organizational and project management skills
Self-motivated, with the ability to multitask and adjust to short deadlines and quick project turnarounds
Ability to take complex topics and translate into easy-to-understand, high-converting content
Excellent collaborator able to adapt quickly and learn the team needs
We are an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusion are critical to our growth, strength and ability to innovate. We do not discriminate based upon race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Wyncode Academy

Wyncode is a world-class technology educator immersing ambitious individuals in a demanding and inspiring learning environment engineered to develop successful coders and designers with business acumen. We believe in a disruptive education model and feel that an immersive environment is the best way to learn practical and relevant technology skills quickly.

Since 2014, Wyncode has graduated over 800 developers working at more than 300 technology companies. We have been selected as the South Florida Business Journal Startup of the Year and the Miami-Dade Beacon Council Educator of the Year.

In 2020, Wyncode launched Remote-Live classes, allowing individuals anywhere in the world to attend Wyncode’s award-winning classes in an immersive, hands-on environment.

Overview

Wyncode is looking for a team member with a passion for user acquisition and activation. As Digital Marketing Manager, you will report to the CEO and work with the Admissions and Marketing team. This role is responsible for Wyncode’s online marketing strategy and execution of this strategy. This must be your passion and not just a job in order to succeed.

You will embody Wyncode’s core values of Never Stop Learning, Elevate Others, Keep It Real, Bring Your Best and Exceed Expectations while striving to achieve our mission which is to develop successful coders and designers with business acumen. You will work with and support the Admissions and Marketing team while ensuring that Wyncode’s marketing is fully operational and processes are running smoothly.

Your main KPI will be qualified user acquisition within Wyncode’s budgets and ultimately, your success will be determined by the number of qualified developers, designers, and digital specialists attending Wyncode’s programs. In particular, qualified users are those with an interest in attending and enrolling in our programs and your focus will be on growing the number of fully remote students attending Wyncode’s classes.

Requirements

Accountabilities

The successful candidate will have a history of digital marketing startup success, in particular user acquisition, and will be specifically tasked with the following objectives:
Create, deploy and constantly improve online ad campaigns focusing on user acquisition and cost of acquisition using platforms such as Google, Facebook
Promote and create lead generation activities, such as webinars
Retargeting
Attack business issues with an analytical mindset and an understanding of practical tactics as well as broader strategic actions.
Implementation of strategy across multiple channels, including digital, such as through Facebook and Instagram ads, Google AdWords, content partners
Creation and management of email drip campaigns
Drive user acquisition through paid digital media and increase onsite conversion through optimization of the website, including landing pages
Improve website SEO and ranking to boost organic traffic
Measurement of marketing results with constant iteration to improve outcomes
Experience with online event marketing and event organization, including regular webinar events geared at consumer conversion
Regular reporting on all marketing initiatives, in a detail-oriented data-driven approach, including reporting on key metrics such as conversions by source, spend by campaign and cost per acquisition each week. Report should also include how many leads converted to registrations.
Research and analyze, external forces and factors that may impact performance including economic, technological, competitive and demographics and recommend appropriate actions to capitalize on market conditions and minimize the effects of competitive activity.
Develop and effectively manage online marketing financial budgets with financial controls. The weekly digital marketing budget is around $1500.
Implementation of ROI based marketing, KPIs, conversion optimization and tracking
Turn data into actionable insights to help inform and optimize future campaigns.
Report to CEO on all marketing efforts
Attributes
Data-driven
Analytical
Creative
Detail-oriented
Organized
Self-starter who knows how to execute
Passionate
Fun
Requirements
Minimum 3 years of growth marketing experience at a startup
Experience managing online campaigns
Direct to consumer marketing experience
Experience working with analytics and budgets
Experience managing people is a plus
Proven understanding of principles and tools related to marketing analysis
Ability to lead & drive multiple campaigns simultaneously
Facebook and Google Certifications
A get it done attitude

About News Break

News Break defines a new way for users to engage with local news. Since its founding in 2015, it has grown by leaps and bounds. We’re the nation's largest intelligent local news platform!

News Break is ranked the #1 news app on both iOS and Android. With 11M+ daily active users and 25M+ monthly users (data source: App Annie), we’re also ahead of all major news apps such as The New York Times, CNN News, The Washington Post, Yahoo News, and SmartNews.

We're a series-C startup headquartered at Mountain View, California.

Download Rank: https://www.appannie.com/en/insights/mobile-minute/mobile-minute-news-coverage-takes-new-routes-amid-global-coronavirus-pandemic/

Media Coverage: https://www.axios.com/coronavirus-news-entertainment-8839cb9b-e61f-4ffb-8645-6986bb492ba1.html

For more information, visit www.newsbreak.com/about

About the Role

We are looking for a seasoned Senior Product Manager to lead our publisher platform product, which is our main B2B offering for our publisher partners to create, edit, manage, and monetize their content on News Break. The role is also responsible for the B2C product experience for content discovery, consumption, and user engagement of in-network publisher content on our core News Break app. You will join a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out products that deliver the company’s vision and strategy.

Our Publisher Platform: https://mp.newsbreakapp.com

We already have 2,000+ premium publishers and/or content creators partnering with us on this platform, with daily content creation of 20,000+ articles/videos.

Responsibilities
Gain a deep understanding of customer experience, both in publisher and reader sides
Identify customer pain points, fill product gaps, and generate new product ideas
Create buy-in for the product vision both internally and with key external partners
Translate product ideas into detailed business and technical requirements by working closely with designers, engineers, BD, and leadership
Scope and prioritize development tasks, timeline, and expected outputs. And get alignment with all stakeholders.
Work closely with engineering teams to deliver with quick time-to-market and optimal resources
Drive product launches including working with marketing, business, engineering, and other colleagues
Act as a product evangelist to build awareness and understanding
Continue to drive cross-team collaboration on optimizing the Publisher Platform product
Requirements
Proven work experience in product management for Internet or high tech companies. Startup experience is a plus.
Proven work experience in News, Digital Media, or Content Creator Network is a strong plus
Proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
Proven ability to develop product and marketing strategies and effectively communicate to stakeholders
Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web technologies
Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job
Skilled at working effectively with cross-functional teams in a matrix organization
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Bachelor degree
Benefits

We provide highly competitive compensation package including base salary, bonuses, and options. Benefits include great Medical, Dental and Vision. A flat organization and family-like culture makes this a perfect environment to make huge impact on our product and grow your skill set.

Job Description
Our client is Chicagos premier retail commercial real estate firm. With combined experience exceeding 60 years they have built a business that provides "large firm" services with a "boutique firm" sensibility. Many of their clients are ones where the relationship and trust have been built over time through adding value and being of service. Whether the requirement is one location or one hundred, the firm uses their market knowledge and relationships to equip clients with the tools they need to make the important decisions about locations and meet their store count goals. Over the years our client has developed strong relationships in the product sales and leasing area of commercial real estate. These relationships are built on a true understanding of their clients needs and goals for their properties. Their style of putting themselves in the owners shoes helps them with the advice and guidance that their clients rely on to make their important real estate decisions.

Client Services/Property Marketing

Partner with brokers to develop various marketing materials to promote their lease and sale listings to the local brokerage community, potential tenants and potential investors. Includes the development, creative direction and project management of property marketing (brochures, aerials, maps, e-blasts and other projects as assigned.) for listings and tenant rep accounts. Think creatively, beyond the original request, to help produce marketing materials that push the needle and help the firm stand out amongst competitors.
Prepare market overview maps and aerials to support real estate identification, tours and transactions with our clients.
Manage and coordinate marketing efforts through 3rd party channels such as LoopNet and CoStar.
Execute on these plans by setting realistic expectations with all stakeholders, driving all marketing projects to a successful completion.
Coordinate the creation of marketing collateral, including print brochures, email blasts, websites, and other marketing deliverables with in-house and third-party vendors.
Create and update collateral, using Adobe Creative Cloud, to provide hands-on design and production support, as needed.
Assist with external broker events, including registration, travel, signage and invitations
Drive the companys creative efforts by seeking out new and innovative ways to market our people as well as our properties
Manage content for company website
Manage marketing intern, when applicable; this includes hiring, training, and overseeing their workload, schedule, and deadlines
Office Admin Duties
Managing the day-to-day functions/operation of the office
Covers front desk and main line; maintains a friendly and professional environment by greeting and assisting visiting colleagues, vendors, clients and brokers
General housekeeping to ensure the office is presentable at all times
Maintain and order necessary office supplies and food from appropriate vendors
Liaise with Fed-Ex, UPS, USPS, etc. for all incoming and outgoing packages
Requirements
Proficient with Adobe Creative Suite skills (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator).
Proficient with Microsoft Office 365 Suite.
Graphic design skills a plus
Strong creative skills, and the ability to provide art direction
Technologically savvy, with a hands-on approach to learning new digital solutions.
Understanding of and commitment to client service.
Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously with minimal supervision and under tight deadlines
Enjoy collaborating and working with others.
Find fulfillment in supporting and helping others so they can do their job more effectively

At 10x Genomics, accelerating our understanding of biology is more than a mission for us. It's a commitment. This is the century of biology, and the breakthroughs we make now have the potential to change the world.

We enable scientists to advance their research, allowing them to address scientific questions they didn't even know they could ask. Our tools have enabled fundamental discoveries across multiple application areas, including cancer, immunology, and neuroscience.

Our teams are empowered and encouraged to follow their passions, pursue new ideas, and perform at their best in an inclusive and dynamic environment. We know that behind every scientific breakthrough, there is a deep infrastructure of talented individuals driving the life sciences industry and making it possible for scientists, engineers, clinicians, computational biologists, and more to make new strides. We're dedicated to finding the best person for every aspect of our work because the innovations and discoveries that we enable together will lead to better technologies, better treatments, and a better future. Find out how you can make a 10x difference.

Senior Marketing Content Writer - Based in Headquarters in Pleasanton, CA

10x Genomics is seeking a Senior Marketing Content Writer with a background in life science research and genomics, genetics, bioinformatics, or application of next-generation sequencing. The ideal candidate will have extensive scientific writing and creative storytelling experience.

The Senior Marketing Content Writer is primarily responsible for development of content across the department, including scientific and marketing communications, as well as development of advertising, promotional, and technical materials to support campaign and new product launch plans. This role reports to the Senior Marketing Manager, Content Writing in the Brand and Marketing Communications department. The person in this role will develop captivating content that enhances our brand voice and aligns with the company's strategy. A scientific background and experience in the single cell genomics and/or gene expression market and next generation sequencing (NGS) will make you an excellent candidate for this position.

Key Responsibilities
Develop content strategies and plans to assist in establishing positioning statements and messaging strategies for marketing campaigns and product launches
Establish standards and support the process of crafting messaging statements for marketing campaigns and product launches
Develop, draft, and edit short- and longform content including ebooks, brochures, flyers, guides, researcher interviews, publication summaries, advertorials, blogs, social media posts, videos scripts, plus print and digital ads
Create headlines, taglines, messaging statements, narratives, campaign copy, and clear CTAs to support marketing campaigns and product launches
Identify creative ways to repurpose technical content for marketing purposes
Understand and apply reader-centered copywriting principles and apply these to the creation of scientific and marketing materials
Understand principles of writing for the web, including search engine optimization and search engine marketing
Coordinate routing and review of literature in compliance with 10x Genomics Document Control requirements
Follow 10x Genomics voice and tone in development of scientific and technical content, as well as marketing tactics. Review and evaluate content for compliance with desired message, voice, tone, and style
Work collaboratively with the Creative team to generate creative concepts and align copy ideas
Work collaboratively in a team environment composed of Product Marketing, Marketing Program Managers, Designers, Marcomm Operations, and Regional Marketing teams, along with external agencies and contractors to help build whole story communications for inbound and outbound campaigns and programs
Review publications for annotations, create website summary statements and summarize key publications, monthly for Senior Staff
Required Skills and Background:
Background in life sciences. Minimum of a master's degree; PhD, or other advanced degree is preferred, in a relevant field (such as biology, genetics, biomedical, bioinformatics, biostatistics, or computational biology)
Proven knowledge of single cell analysis and/or gene expression, NGS products and market, along with understanding the buying influences of scientific customers. Ability to understand and interpret genetic/genomic data required
More than 5 years writing experience related to scientific, diagnostic, or medical content
Demonstrated writing skills, with focus on clear, concise communication to targeted technical audiences
Knowledge of scientific publication regulations and best practices
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with demonstrated success in creating and delivering effective presentations to senior-level audiences
Collaborative teamwork and leadership track record, ability to form, maintain, and lead productive cross-functional working teams who complete projects on deadline
Desired Skills and Background
Knowledge of GSuite, Atlassian/Confluence and Internet proficiencies are preferred
Adobe InDesign and html experience a plus
Experience with Workfront or comparable project management system and digital asset management system

Everyone communicates. Its the essence of the human experience. How we communicate is evolving. Technology is reshaping the way we live, learn and thrive. At Ruckus Networks, a Commscope company, we are constantly redefining connectivity to create a smarter, simpler, more connected world. Ruckus Wireless, the Wi-Fi industrys acknowledged leader in innovation, revenue growth, and carrier deployment market share, is seeking more high-caliber talent for our solution engineering organization.

The Senior Solutions Architect position will offer the right candidate the opportunity to play a pivotal role in the success of our sales team and channel partners through the development and showcasing of Ruckus solutions This is a hands-on opportunity and ideal for someone with significant switching and Wi-Fi networking expertise looking to tackle critical business problems and help define and validate new end-to-end solutions with products from Ruckus and our ecosystem partners.

Provide and validate technical content included in Ruckus and partner marketing, sales and training materials

· This position reports to the Manager of Solutions Engineering and is located in Sunnyvale, CA.

Job Description
Does content marketing, storytelling, and digital content creation excite you? What about working on a global team inside an industry-leading company?

We are looking to hire a motivated individual to help drive product marketing for our services portfolio. Your focus will be on services for some of the most technologically advanced electronics on the planet. The ideal candidate will have a technical or professsional services background, quickly gain new technical knowledge, and write compelling content suitable for buyers and buyer-influencers of electrical engineering products and services.

In this role you will be a key member of the Product Marketing team, responsible for Keysight Services. This position will focus on three main tasks.

First, you will conceive and implement content-driven campaigns for your products. You will personally develop the core content, including messaging, whitepapers, eBooks, email marketing, videos, and webcasts. These campaigns will be focused on promoting new product introductions as well as existing products.

Second, you will work with the global sales/field marketing team, product managers, and dedicated Marcom resources to refine your campaign plans and ensure that your content comes alive across digital and physical channels. Your goals are to create engagement and gather new names that can be nurtured into quality marketing leads for your portfolio.

Third, you will ensure that your campaigns support existing Keysight communication channels, and you will be measured on the performance of your content in these channels. This may include e-mails, blogs, social media, keysight.com web pages, paid media advertising, and at physical and virtual events and seminars.

Ultimately, you will have the freedom to create the best possible campaigns and deliver your content to tens of thousands of potential customers. You will have abundant support, including access to designers, branding experts, marketing consultants, e-mail experts, copy editors, graphic artists, and more.

If the idea of creating industry-leading written, audio, and video content excites you, this is the place to be! We are looking for someone who isn’t afraid to take risks, challenges conventional thinking, and brings their whole team to a higher level.
Job Qualifications
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree or University Degree or equivalent (technical studies or marketing preferred)
3+ years of experience in a content-creation field – for example, technical marketing, product marketing, or engineering content development (7+ preferred)
Experience in marketing "services" is strongly preferred
Experience transforming complex topics into digestible concepts
Ability to think creatively and break industry stereotypes
Excellent writing skills - a passion for storytelling and digital content is a plus
Experience developing product marketing campaigns (messaging, whitepapers, eBooks, application notes, videos, and webcasts)
Proven success working with global, cross-functional teams
Position can be based anywhere, working remotely in US or Canada.

LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY – THIS IS A LOS ANGELES BASED POSITION (Lenax does not pay for relocation or travel expenses for interviews).

Since its inception in 1993, Lenax Construction Services, Inc. (LENAX) has provided quality construction services and project controls to a diverse range of engineering, design, and construction firms. LENAX services a broad range of markets, including airports, transportation, industrial, correctional, universities, and marine. LENAX is a goal-oriented and customer-driven independent consulting business, aimed at adding value and strength to our clients program teams.

LENAX is looking for a Marketing Coordinator to support the efforts of the Marketing team.

Key Identifiers for the Position:
Experience supporting Marketing and/or Business Development, within the Architecture, Engineering, and Construction industries;
Strong Administrative skills and experience utilizing, including advanced skills in MS Office: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, etc. within prior roles;
Must have experience utilizing all facets of a Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system and database (preferably Cosential)--not just data entry! Must be able to fully use, develop, manage, run reports, update, and etc.
Must have demonstrated proficiency in document set-up, creation, grammar, sentence structure, phraseology. Experience converting candidate resumes into standard, client templates--using creativity, understanding of position descriptions, roles and requirements!
Strong graphics skills and experience, including Adobe Creative Suite, including InDesign (Photoshop and Illustrator, a plus).
Understanding of Industry terminology and processes, including knowledge and understanding of the RFP process.
Experience supporting Social Media campaigns--using resourcefulness, ability to source imagery, and develop succinct, direct and meaningful headlines and notifications.
Time Management skills, ability to take direction, and run with multiple projects, based upon priorities set by Supervisor.


Position Summary

The Marketing Coordinator will support the Marketing Manager with Marketing tasks. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, helping prepare proposals and presentations, organizing/updating database of project information, coordinating meetings, writing proposal material, and driving the LENAX social media campaign. The ideal candidate must have excellent interpersonal skills, be able to work well with all levels of the organization, be detail-oriented, and proficient in desktop publishing, such as InDesign and Adobe Acrobat. Experience with a Construction, Architecture or Engineering firm is required.Job Description:

The Marketing Coordinator s duties include, but are not limited to the following:
Gathers and researches information to include in proposals, including resumes and project summaries.
Reviews, organizes and edits written documentation to improve clarity.
Formats candidate resumes into the appropriate template; contacts candidates and follows through on gathering any missing information. Patterns resume to reflect the candidate s meeting position specifications.
Completes administrative forms for proposals.
Creates, and updates employee Master resumes and LENAX project descriptions regularly, based on information gathered from timesheet project billing information and data files.
Supports the creation, maintenance, and development of Cosential, a CRM database.
Updates leads/opportunities, wins/losses, resumes, project descriptions, company contacts, and text libraries in Marketing s Cosential database.
Collaborate with the Marketing Manager, Executives, Project Managers and relevant consultants in the proposal preparation process.
Assists in the graphic development of marketing tools such as brochures, company website, special projects, hiring posts, business cards, statements of qualifications, etc.
Edit project images, employee headshots, company event images, etc.
Design themed graphics for special projects such as holiday party or summer picnic.
Design social media graphics in accordance with the social media calendar.
Update website and perform SEO.
Obtain permission from clients to use images on website or marketing material.
Conducts client development research.
Coordinates with technical staff to develop, research, track, and follow-up on leads.
Maintains certification calendar and facilities renewals as the deadlines approach.
Works with the Marketing Manager to develop LENAX's social media campaign, and facilitate posting distribution amongst various platforms (Twitter, LinkedIn, etc.).
Assist with special administrative and research projects as needed.
Assist in the day to day hard and electronic file organization.
Register/Calendar industry events for pre-bidding opportunities and industry functions.
May assist with special projects, at the direction of the Supervisor, Vice President, Director of Engineering, President, or other LENAX management.
May assist in general office administration, including answering phones, forwarding calls, taking messages; electronic and hard-copy filing; office organization; supplies orders, and etc.
Handles various administrative tasks for the VP and Director of Engineering, including expense reporting, making travel arrangements, meeting arrangements, and various tasks that may involve creating spreadsheets, tracking information, gathering information, data-entry, office organization, filing and etc.
May assist in scheduling meetings on-site and at client sites, including coordinating with vendors for food & beverage, etc.

Bachelor's degree in related field (business, marketing, engineering, etc.) preferred, other degrees such as Communication, Journalism, and English are acceptable, in combination with skills training, certifications and directly-applicable work experience.
Ideal candidates should possess a minimum of two or more (2+) years of experience in a marketing role within the Architecture / Engineering / Construction (A / E / C) industry.

A good understanding of the RFP and proposal process is required.
Advanced user in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and Adobe Creative Suite including InDesign (Photoshop and Illustrator a plus).
Must have demonstrated, written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills.
Experience working in a professional office setting, and interacting with employees, management and vendors in a highly professional manner.
Must have proven office and administrative skills, including knowledge of document creation, formatting, and filing protocols (document control principles, a plus). Advanced word processing skills required.
Ability to collaborate with the Marketing and Proposal Managers, Project Executives, Project Managers and relevant consultants in the proposal preparation process.
Good understanding of marketing principles within the A / E / C Industry.
Strong experience with designing marketing material is preferred.
Previous experience with the creation, maintenance, and development of CRM databases (Cosential CRM Preferred) is desired.
Proficiency in working-with and executing social media campaigns, and utilizing a variety of platforms to disseminate targeted information.
Must be resourceful, and possess the ability to utilize creativity, experience, business and marketing skills and tools, to approach work assignments.
Must be a self-starter with the ability to manage multiple priorities/tasks, and possess strong organizational skills.
Must be a team player, recognizing the roles of key, LENAX staff who may direct some activities, in coordination with the direct supervisor.
Must be able to take and follow directions from direct supervisor, in coordination with other, LENAX senior management and department heads. Will take initiative to address any assignment conflicts with one s Supervisor, and discuss prioritization before taking action.
Knowledge and experience with office procedures, systems, and protocols required.
Strong and effective communication, writing, and computer skills are essential.
Must be able to independently manage a challenging workload when faced with unexpected changes in priorities and deadlines.

This is an excellent opportunity for an individual who wants to gain valuable experience executing marketing campaigns for our film festival(s), film programming, and other organization events, with a strong focus on writing and copyediting. ABOUT KENDO

Kendo Holdings, Inc. is a San Francisco-based beauty brand developer and wholesaler owned by LVMH Moët Hennessy - Louis Vuitton, the world's largest luxury group. A play on the words can do, Kendo has become the hub of creativity and next generation beauty product development for global Sephora channels and selective retailers outside of Sephora.

Through original development, collaborations and acquisitions the Kendo stable of brands will always be creative, inspiring and innovative. A dynamic engine of speed, expertise and market-savvy, the Kendo team continues to redefine the beauty industry through great product, great storytelling, great retail and direct-to-consumer partnerships. This shows up in everything we do and in what we stand for:
ENTREPRENEURIAL SPIRIT: We seek creative ways to get things done
PERSEVERANCE: We are moved by Winston Churchill's words, never, never, never give up'
GENEROSITY: The power of giving
STORYTELLING: Creating authentic stories to inspire
QUALITY OBSESSION: Our product quality is a reflection of ourselves
FUN: Work, life, and fun are woven of a single fabric
The Kendo house of brands currently includes: Bite, KVD Vegan Beauty, Marc Jacobs Beauty, Ole Henriksen and Fenty Beauty.

The ideal candidate loves the beauty industry, can win over hearts and minds with creative storytelling, can sift through multiple data sources to find actionable opportunities, and has an aptitude to manage multiple projects. RESPONSIBILITIES

P&L ownership

Participate in the content creation process including creative briefs, providing feedback, passing assets to third-party marketing partners and assuring error-free content is loaded on site and in all marketing channels.
Digital Marketing Expert

Optimize owned channels, including email and SEO, leveraging the insight of outside experts as needed.
Manage relationship with third-party marketing partners, including paid ads and affiliates. Continually inform them of campaigns, product launches and KPI targets. Assure they are delivering the best consumer experience to drive sales with a test-and-learn mindset.
Identify opportunities to AB test copy and visual content; share and implement learnings.
Stay current on innovations in digital marketing and ecommerce technologies and through conferences and competitive benchmarking.
Website Development and Operations

Partner with Product Development to devise development roadmap and prioritize site enhancements.

Research new technologies to determine if they add value to the customer journey. Regularly review portfolio of digital tools for alternatives.
Partner with warehouse operations and customer service teams to ensure on-time delivery of orders and on-brand client experience at every touchpoint.
Lead & Manage
Cultivate strong relationships with cross-functional teams including: Brand Management, Brand Marketing, Creative, and Finance.
Manage portfolio of third-party vendors with duties that include setting clear expectations, measuring goals and assuring deliverables are met.
Manage and develop one direct report with potential for additional reports.
REQUIREMENTS
BA or BS degree. MBA preferred.
Minimum 7 years combined work experience in ecommerce and digital marketing.
Fluent understanding of best-in-class digital marketing and ecommerce practices.
Advanced analytical skills with the ability to interpret and translate data into action. Advanced Excel skills required. Experience with Google Analytics preferred.
Experience with ecommerce platforms such as Salesforce Business Manager and Shopify.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with an apt for influencing and storytelling.
Experience leading direct and indirect teams with a track record for developing others.

Company Description
Ad-VANCE Talent Solutions, Inc. is a Total Source Human Resources provider specializing in temporary and temp-to hire staffing, pre-employment screening & assessment, and seasonal & project based workforce management.

Ad-VANCE offers employers a “One Stop” solution to their most pressing recruiting and hiring and challenges. From sourcing skilled employees for project work, to coordinating the prescreening of candidates for full time hire on an on-going basis, Ad-VANCE can provide flexible options that compliment any company’s hiring process.

We are independently owned and operated, which allows us to offer a level of flexibility, cost-effectiveness, and service that is unmatched in our industry. Our business is based on creating value for our clients, problem solving, and reducing hiring and retention headaches.

Ad-VANCE has grown to become the Florida Gulf Coast area’s recognized leader in staffing solutions. We have built strategic business partnerships with the area’s leading public and private employers through our “can do” attitude and non-traditional approach.

SERVICES PROVIDED:

Job Title: Manager, Practice Group Business Development & Management
Job Description:
Company Description

null
Job Description

We are Crowell & Moring

Founded with a commitment to build a different kind of law firm, Crowell & Moring LLP today is an international law firm representing clients in litigation and arbitration, regulatory and transactional matters. We are internationally recognized for our representation of Fortune 500 companies in high-stakes litigation, as well as our ongoing commitment to pro bono service and diversity. With more than 500 lawyers based in the United States and Europe, the firm helps international corporations and emerging enterprises navigate complex legal challenges and create business solutions across the globe.

Job Summary

The Manager, Practice Group Business Development & Management (PGBD&M) primarily works with and supports Crowell & Moring’s Intellectual Property practice group. The Manager will develop and implement practice group business development strategies to strengthen and expand relationships with current clients and cultivate new clients. In addition, the Manager will identify and execute approaches to elevate the external and internal profile of the practice. The Manager will also support the leadership of the practice group in management areas, including operations, economics, recruiting and talent development. The Manager may also have responsibility for a working group, initiative, or secondary practice group as assigned.

The Manager will have the support of an assigned Practice Group Coordinator/Assistant and will report to a Director, Practice Group Business Development & Management.

This position will also work closely with other members of the Client Development & Practice Management Department, including public relations, marketing, and marketing technology, as well as the Financial Planning, Recruiting, Professional Development and Diversity Departments to ensure their initiatives support firm priorities and help drive overall firm strategy.

Primary Areas of Responsibility

Business Development and Marketing

· Partners with practice and working group leaders and assigned Director to develop and implement strategic plans.

· Engages with practice group and attorneys to understand the legal and business needs of clients and the corresponding legal solutions the firm provides. Through practice group “fluency,” contributes high-level business development advice and guidance that demonstrates a thorough understanding of the work the group and lawyers do.

· Drives business development goals of assigned group, including support for generating business leads and opportunities, expanding existing client matters, and identifying and pursuing cross-selling opportunities.

· Develops pitches and proposals, including firm responses to formal RFPs.

· Supports, monitors and reports on the progress of on-going business development efforts and initiatives for assigned groups.

· Works with individual lawyers and advises on business development best practices and strategies to assist in developing their practices.

· In collaboration with Research Services, digests and delivers meaningful research on existing and prospective clients, competitor activity, and industry or market trends to inform and support business development opportunities, strategies, and decisions.

· Develops compelling marketing collateral, website descriptions, and other client facing materials; ensures materials are regularly updated.

· Supports firm-wide efforts related to the knowledge management of pitches, proposals, and opportunities for their assigned groups.

· Ensures matters/experience lists and databases for assigned groups are maintained.

· Supports opportunities to increase brand awareness and profile for assigned practice, including outward facing activities such as sponsored events, in-house presentations, professional speaking opportunities, client alerts, and articles and other publications.

· Works with events team to plan and support practice group events.

· Oversees the timely preparation and submission of the Chambers, Law360 and other ranking submissions for the assigned groups.

Practice Management

· Working with practice group leaders, ensures practice group meetings have strong agendas and are well-run.

· In collaboration with the firm’s Financial Planning & Analysis Department, reviews and analyzes financial reports provided by the Finance Department and updates group leaders on key performance indicators.

· In collaboration with practice group leadership and the firm’s Financial Planning & Analysis Department, oversees the development, submission and ongoing monitoring of the group revenue and expense budgets for the year.

· Collaborates with the firm’s Attorney Recruiting group and Lawyer Development Committee supports recruiting initiatives.

· In collaboration with the firm’s Lateral Partner Recruiting Group, the Attorney Recruiting Group and a Senior Director, Practice Group Business Development & Management, supports the integration of lateral attorneys in the assigned group.

· Assists with other practice management functions as needed.

Qualifications

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

· Demonstrated ability to build strong working relationships across all levels of the organization and work both independently and with others.

· Demonstrated ability to organize and prioritize work in a dynamic and complex environment to meet deadlines and daily requirements.

· Demonstrated ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both orally and in writing with attorneys, staff, vendors and clients.

· Experience with content creation and messaging development.

· Strong business and marketing acumen. Ability to leverage research and competitive intelligence to identify business opportunities and support go-to-market strategies.

· Strong knowledge of and familiarity with legal and business environments.

· Knowledge of basic accounting and budgeting principles and experience monitoring and managing budgets.

Education

The position requires a Bachelor’s Degree. A JD, MBA or other related advanced degree may substitute for required experience.

Experience

The position requires a minimum of five (5) years of increasingly responsible, directly related experience during which the necessary knowledge, skills and abilities were attained. Strong preference for candidates with experience working with intellectual property attorneys or similar background. Experience in the direct supervision of others on a regular basis preferred. Direct experience in a law firm or professional services environment in any professional capacity preferred.

Additional Information

Crowell & Moring LLP offers a competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package which includes progressive options such as back up child care, wellness programs, cultural events and social activities. We take great pride in our positive, friendly culture that rewards hard work and success, at the same time recognizing the importance of family and community service.

EOE m/f/d/v
Crowell & Moring LLP participates in the E-Verify program.

Job Description:
BigCommerce, named a 2019 "Best Place to Work" in Austin, is looking for a technically savvy, data-driven content marketer whose focus is on growth. In this role you'll have the opportunity to positively influence the trajectory of a billion dollar company in a trillion dollar industry by working directly on customer acquisition through content strategy and creation. This role will allow you to work across the entire business, including Marketing, Sales, Product, and our Executive Leadership team.

The Content Marketing Manager will collaborate cross-functionally to develop integrated content strategies designed to support the entire funnel, from acquisition through to conversion. This role will be responsible for strategizing as well as writing content, and will report to the Director, Content Marketing. This person should be a skilled Marketing professional, with a strong communications background.

You Must...
Have 5+ years experience creating credible, professional content that moves people and builds brands.
Have a diverse writing portfolio and skill set which includes a mix of long-form content and short-form copy for a variety of channels.
Have roots in brand and product marketing with an emphasis on strategic storytelling.
Have a proven track record of creating impactful marketing content with the help of data and prose.
Have experience with ecommerce software and/or enterprise software.
Understand how content should support the buyer's journey.
What You'll Do:


Content Strategy and Creation
Partner with Brand, Product, Partner and Demand Generation teams to create full-funnel, integrated content strategies in support of marketing goals.
Write compelling, original content and highly creative copy for a variety of marketing materials including blog posts, ebooks, emails, infographics, podcasts, video scripts, web pages, webinars, video scripts and more.
Make strategic recommendations for relevant content types based on objectives, distribution channels, and past performance data.
Identify opportunities to repurpose and repackage content in order to amplify message, visibility and lead generation.
Identify content performance KPIs and continue to refine the content strategies based on performance metrics.
Uphold the integrity of BigCommerce content by ensuring content is consistent with the brand voice and style, as well as optimized for search and user experience.
Regularly audit evergreen and seasonal content to ensure accuracy, consistency and relevancy.
Position yourself as an industry influencer and thought leader, speaking on behalf of BigCommerce's beliefs, insights, future-casting and customer needs.
Grow Grow Grow
Identify and execute on new content opportunities to generate and advance leads through the sales funnel.
Strategize cross-functionally both internally and externally with Marketing, Sales, Brand, Product and Design teams, as well as partners, customers, influencers and experts for maximum content impact.
Think BIG across all content ideas and initiatives –– always keeping the needs of enterprise prospects in mind.
Who You Are:


Undergraduate degree in Marketing, English, Journalism, or similar field.
5+ years of highly successful online marketing experience in either software including B2B and SaaS, or at an ecommerce brand or agency.
Technically Experienced
Content Production (WordPress)
SEO (Ahrefs, MarketMuse)
Analytics (eg. Google Analytics)
CRM (eg. Salesforce, Marketo)
HTML knowledge preferred
Strategist - You understand how different marketing messages and channels affect business people in different buyer segments and different parts of the customer journey from acquisition to retention.
Customer Focused - You want to deliver the best experience possible for future and current partners, as helping our partners' businesses grow is the #1 goal at BigCommerce.
Problem Solver - You can see hidden problems and probe a variety of sources for answers, are able to look beyond the obvious, and can identify and creatively solve complex problems.
Psychology - Interest in human psychology and how different psychological triggers work together.
Communicator - Excellent written/verbal communication and customer relationship skills are critical both working with people internally and externally.
Collaborative - You have demonstrated success working cross-functionally in larger organizations, and have the ability to forge strong bonds and work collaboratively with key external and internal partners.
Composed - You know how to execute consistently in a fast-paced, high pressure, dynamic environment and carry out self-directed responsibilities.
Personable - You are seen as positive, energetic, and exude a strong sense of teamwork by working effectively, respectfully, and efficiently with all team members.
Eager Learner - You pick up on things quickly, enjoy learning new skills and knowledge, and are adept at staying ahead of the curve on relevant industry, company, product, or technical knowledge.
Ethical - You believe in our mission, share our values and understand that it's not just about what you get done, but also how you do it.
Diversity & Inclusion at BigCommerce

We have the opportunity to build not only a great business, but a great company, with soul. Our beliefs and commitment to diversity and inclusion are a central part of achieving that. Our dedication to diversity and inclusion is grounded in two things: a moral belief in the dignity, value, and potential of every individual, and a practical belief that diverse, inclusive teams will create the best outcomes for our customers, partners, employees, and company. We welcome everyone to be a part of our journey.

Job Title: Senior Product Designer - Real-Time Mobile Communications
Job Description:
Our mission is to protect life.
We’re out to make the world a safer place by solving big problems and taking on the public safety challenges of our time. From our company's inception building the TASER device to a full suite of hardware and software solutions, we are focused on providing police agencies with the state-of-the-art devices and services they need to successfully serve and protect us. In the next few years, we're going to eliminate the burden of paperwork in policing, so officers can increase the time they spend building relationships and serving in their communities. We’ll put video at the heart of the police record so our justice system can get to the truth faster. And we won't stop innovating until the bullet is rendered obsolete.

It’s a big mission, but it’s one we’ll pursue relentlessly every single day.

Our Product
We are building a new product that will help first responders at the most critical moment – when they’re responding to a call for service. How do we get first responders the right information, at the right time, and in the right format, so that they can arrive at the scene prepared and ready to act? How can we equip them to coordinate with each other and their partners (fire, medical, other neighboring agencies)? The right solution will utilize intelligent mapping and routing, real-time communications, applications of artificial intelligence, and a heavy focus on making industry-leading experiences usable for both for first responders doing 60 MPH in a 35 zone and for dispatchers handling hundreds of calls a day.

Check out our future vision for Axon products here: https://vimeo.com/333871354
Check out our future vision for our records product here: https://vimeo.com/221924983
Read about our ethics board: https://www.axon.com/info/ai-ethics

Our Team
We believe that happy teams take good care of their customers, so we foster a friendly, open, introspective team culture that encourages everyone to speak their mind and deliberately avoids red tape, unnecessary rituals, politics, and jerks.

We believe we can only succeed if we deeply understand our customers and get to know them personally. We spend a lot of time with law enforcement officers to learn about their needs, watch their experience and see the real impact of our work. Your first ride-along with a patrol officer will forever change your perception of what the job is, and what the city is like.
Your Day-to-Day
Lead product design for mobile public safety communications. You'll own the full design process, from initial research and discovery through concepting, detailed design, testing and working with Engineering on implementation.
Partner closely with Product Management leadership on initial product definition and ongoing product evolution and execution.
Turn complex interactions involving a diverse set of users, a complex physical environment, social interactions, regional differences, and an ecosystem of hardware devices and software applications, into simple experience solutions.
Collaborate with Product Managers and UX Researchers to initiate, execute, and extract insights using a variety of research methods: observational, interviews, participatory, usability testing, competitive analysis, etc.
Collaborate with other design leads across product teams to ensure great user experiences across all of our products.
Participate in hiring across the larger product design and product management & engineering organizations keeping a high bar.
Contribute to defining global design mobile patterns, vision, and processes for Axon products.
Contribute to defining the general product design vision and process at Axon.
Be an ambassador and champion for the design culture at Axon.
Present products and feature ideas and execution up to executive level.
Qualifications
6+ years of product design experience with at least 2 years of leading major product design initiatives
Bachelor's degree in Interaction Design, Graphic Design, Industrial Design, HCI or related field. A master's degree is considered a plus.
At least 2 years experience researching, designing and shipping complete mobile applications for iOS and Android with a moderate to high level of complexity (enterprise workflows or complex consumer purchasing / content creation flows rather than simple consumer flows).
A proven track record of applying user-centered design processes and methodology to product definition, design, and development. You have experience with every stage of the design process, including: research, sketches, wireframes, high fidelity mock-ups, prototyping, and usability testing.
You enjoy collaborating on early product definition as much as you enjoy working with the larger product and engineering teams on implementation.
Strong conceptual skills and proven ability to rapidly prototype and design to communicate ideas to others.
A broad skillset with deep specialization in at least one area (IA, UX, visual, etc).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to clearly explain your ideas and decisions in a way that anyone can understand.
Highly knowledgeable of the latest design tools and proficient at quickly learning new ones. We currently use Sketch, Abstract and Invision, but are always evaluating new tools.
Able to function both independently and in a collaborative team environment. Comfortable in both leader and follower roles.
Experience with geospatial product design such as location tracking and map design is considered a big plus.
Experience with designing instant messaging, chat, or push-to-talk solutions is is considered a plus.
A great portfolio available for review.
Compensation and Benefits
Award-winning office and working environment with the newest technology.
Competitive salary and a comprehensive benefit package.
Discretionary PTO.
Fun team activities and outings.
Flexible working hours.
Options for training in the US.
Opportunities to ride along with local law enforcement.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Vera is hiring a Communications Manager to join a diverse and growing team and to manage communications for our conditions of confinement work including our Restoring Promise initiative, which centers the people most impacted by our workincarcerated people and corrections staff. Our Restoring Promise initiative seeks to transform living conditions for incarcerated young adults (ages 18-25) and working conditions for staff in jails and prisons across the country. It anchors a larger organizational communications campaign to transform the American prison system by centering human dignity and racial justice.

The Communications Manager is responsible for implementing integrated strategies to promote this effort, change narratives and norms, and ultimately build public support.

Who We Are

The Vera Institute of Justice, founded in 1961, envisions a society that respects the dignity of every person and safeguards justice for everyone. Vera is committed to securing equal justice, ending mass incarceration, and strengthening families and communities.
We study problems that impede human dignity and justice.
We pilot solutions that are at once transformative and achievable.
We engage diverse communities in informed debate.
We harness the power of evidence to drive effective policy and practice.
We work with others who share our vision to tackle the most pressing injustices of our dayfrom mass incarceration, racial disparities, and the loss of public trust in law enforcement to the unmet needs of the vulnerable, the marginalized, and those harmed by crime and violence. Vera has offices in New York City, Washington, DC, Los Angeles, and New Orleans. Vera is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity in the workplacespecifically, we value diverse experiences with regard to educational background and justice system contact. We hire employees that reflect our values: respect, independence, collaboration, and commitment.

Restoring Promise

The Restoring Promise initiative is a partnership between the Vera Institute of Justice and MILPA. MILPA is a mission-driven cadre of primarily formerly incarcerated staff members who are committed to building next-generation infrastructure and the leadership needed to address structural and racial inequities while promoting cultural healing. Together, we identify forward thinking corrections agencies and collaborate to transform living conditions for incarcerated young adults (ages 18-25) and working conditions for staff in jails and prisons across the country. Two core values, rooted in the name, guide the initiative:

Restoring calls for truth telling and healing, a process by which people most impacted by the justice system are partners in reform; and

Promise acknowledges the failed promise to generations of young people, demands commitment to supporting them in realizing their full potential, and asks us to look forward toward a vision of ending the prison model of justice.

Reporting to the Project Director of Restoring Promise and the Managing Director of Communications, the Communications Manager will help the team drive campaign strategy and amplify our work.

What Youll Do

The Communications Manager will work with Restoring Promise and communications leadership to develop and run a national campaign organized around conditions of confinement and anchored in the work of Restoring Promise. This campaign will use a full suite of communications activitieseditorial, video, media, social media, validators, and advisorsto shape public norms and narratives about the people who live and work in prisons by defining the challenges of prison conditions, lifting up new thinking, and promoting actions and evidence of those who are working to buck convention, and challenge us to imagine a world without prisons. We dont just want to reach bigger audiences, we want to reach the right audiences.

The Communications Manager will be responsible for:
Helping develop a national communications campaign. Executing a comprehensive communications strategy that includes traditional media, digital media, web and other creative content
Managing communications strategies and projects:
Partnering with Restoring Promise and communications staff to manage projects and needs
Communicating with project leadership, the staff of partner organizations, and government agencies regularly regarding communication opportunities and needs
Working in partnership with the Restoring Promise Creative Content Associate to develop content and oversee a website and brand development process
Implementing strategies to garner local and national mediaprint, online, radio, television, and podcaststhat shift the narrative about what prisons are for and center the lives of incarcerated people and their families as well as people working in jails and prisons
Managing day-to-day media outreach and helping develop messaging strategy for Restoring Promise and related communications campaigns regarding conditions of confinement
Pitching local and national media
Cultivating and building relationships with reporters
Responding to media requests, ensuring reporters have the correct information, and coordinating interviews with Vera and MILPA staff as necessary
Monitoring news developments and tracking justice-related news, seeking opportunities to bring Restoring Promise work to diverse audiences
Tracking all media hits mentioning Vera, MILPA, and Restoring Promise and reporting in real-time
Overseeing marketing and content creation:
Developing a strategy and taking the lead on implementation of public facing creative content (fact sheets, brochures, videos, data visualizations, interactive maps, photo essays, etc.)
Developing and executing an integrated social media strategy around the campaign
Drafting campaign materials that make the essential connection between the issues plaguing our justice system and our countrys history of racism including pitches, press releases, media advisories, op-eds, letters, fact sheets, brochures, statements, articles, and other campaign materials as needed
What We Need in You

Knowledge and interest in social justice. You dont have to be an expert in criminal justice, but you need to be paying attention, be committed to anti-racism, have worked in some area of social justice, and have an established career in communications.

A tactical tilt. You can see the tactics needed to execute a communications campaign and/or a finished product. You have experience managing communications campaigns and large-scale projects from start to finish. You can identify communications related risks and opportunities, and project manage around them. Youre comfortable reaching out daily to media outlets to pitch, confirm, and coordinate coverage. Youre social media savvy and well-versed in the media landscape.

Exceptional writing, editing and communication skills. You have the ability to write various kinds of campaign materials for target audiences including talking points, pitches, press releases, statements, media advisories, op-eds, blog posts, and letters to the editor.

A deep commitment to racial equity. In a system built on racism and inequity, we are working to ensure equity both in our workplace and in the world. You incorporate this value and share it with others. You bring an intersectional lens and are comfortable facilitating with a sensitivity to navigating power dynamics across race, class, and position (i.e. people who are incarcerated, people who are formerly incarcerated, family and community members impacted by incarceration, stakeholders, agency leadership, line staff).

A collaborator and rigorous thinker, with exceptional problem-solving skills. Collaboration is a core Vera valuewe thrive when we learn and build on each others ideas and are open to giving and receiving feedbackboth in our team and across the institution. You have strong social and emotional intelligence and embrace opportunities to learn and grow. You exercise sound judgement, are adept at problem solving, and pause before acting, mindful of the consequences when urgency trumps processes, inclusion, or relationships.

Management and leadership. You are detail-oriented and able to see the big picture. You keep track of multiple competing deadlines and priorities. You center race equity and inclusion in your approach and decision making as a manager and team member. You excel at working independently and as a member of a team.

Additional Qualifications
At least five years of progressive strategic communications experience, including campaign strategy and execution, media relations, and developing creative content
Ability to develop and track quantitative and qualitative metrics
Last, but not least, you love to travel and can do so frequently.
Salary

Based on experience and including excellent benefits.

How to apply

Please submit a cover letter and resume. Applications will be considered on a rolling basis until the position is filled. Online submission in PDF format (through Veras career page) is preferred. No phone calls, please. Only applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.

ATTN: Human Resources / Communications Manager, Restoring Promise
Vera Institute of Justice
34 35th St, Suite 4-2A, Brooklyn, NY 11232
Fax: (212) 941-9407
Please use only one method (online, mail or fax) of submission.
No phone calls, please. Only applicants selected for interviews will be contacted.

Vera is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without unlawful discrimination based on race, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, military status, prior record of arrest or conviction, citizenship status, current employment status, or caregiver status.

Vera works to advance justice, particularly racial justice, in an increasingly multicultural country and globally connected world. We value diverse experiences, including with regard to educational background and justice system contact, and depend on a diverse staff to carry out our mission.

For more information about Veras work, please visit www.vera.org.
