Who we are


Who we areThe Spaceship Company (TSC) is an affiliate of Virgin Galactic as a space-system manufacturing organization. Headquartered at Mojave Air and Space Port in Mojave, California, it is building and testing a fleet of WhiteKnightTwo carrier aircraft and SpaceShipTwo reusable spaceships that, together, form Virgin Galactic’s human spaceflight system. Like many Virgin companies across the world, its team of over 400 talented and dedicated engineers, technicians and professionals are drawn together by a willingness to disrupt and challenge the status quo and deliver innovative aerospace solutions to our customers’ needs. TSC’s extensive capabilities encompass preliminary vehicle design and analysis, manufacturing, ground testing, flight testing and post-delivery support.

Our Values

TSC and the greater Virgin Organization have a relaxed and informal culture that encourages individuality and innovation. You will be motivated, enterprising and enthusiastic. Company culture is such that you need to be able to “check your ego at the door”, be a self-starter and possess a sense of humility. You will work well under pressure and thrive on being given challenges and responsibility. You will communicate clearly and be confident and persuasive. You will have a high level of integrity and understand the need of complete confidentiality.

Who You Are The Spaceship Company (TSC) is seeking a Technical Writer whose responsibilities include creating, writing, a variety of technical manuals including maintenance manuals (AMM, CMM, GMM), Pilot Operating Handbooks (POHs), Service Bulletins (SB), Operating Instructions (OI), training documents, and other manuals to S1000D specification, and outputting them into PDF, Interactive Electronic Technical Manuals (IETMs) and other formats. The Technical Writer will be expected to work hands-on with maintainers, engineers, and manufacturing personnel to create best-practices and procedures for custom-built aircraft. The Technical Writer will review and rework any discrepancies related to various aircraft/spacecraft systems. Additionally, the Technical Writer will make sure that the documentation conforms to established style guides and standards and will work with product managers and end users to make sure all technical documentation meets customer requirements. The Technical Writer is expected to become a subject matter expert on aircraft systems by interviewing product engineers, observing performance of production methods, referring to technical drawings and specifications, and engineering illustrations. He/she will oversee preparation of illustrative materials, select drawings, sketches, diagrams and charts. He/she will conduct quality review of materials.

Your Mission
Write and maintain spacecraft technical documentation to include operator, maintenance, training and other supporting materials
Collaborate with document users and product managers to make sure of accuracy, quality, clarity and effectiveness of documentation
Provide and solicit feedback for improvement of documentation and writing processes
Collaborate with other technical writers in development of procedures and methods of writing to reflect best industry practices
What you bring
Bachelors' degree and 5+ years minimum related experience in technical writing, preferably with aviation/aerospace experience
Familiar with space and/or aviation documentation formats, including ATA 100 / iSpec 2200 and/or S1000D authoring and publication standards, AMM, GOM, GMM, POH (including normal and emergency procedures), TO, SB, Technical Directives, Airworthiness Directives, etc.
Ability to work hands-on with cross-functional teams
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to create accurate and concise technical materials
Organized and detail-oriented
Flexible and open-minded
Creative and imaginative, open to unique ways of presenting information
Self-motivated, self-disciplined, and able to work with minimal supervision
Able to work independently and in a team environment
Ability to react to change and thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment
Demonstrated competency in the following:
Content Creation and Publishing Tools
Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project
Experience with SGML/XML
Strong overall computer skills.
Familiarity with aviation/aerospace operations, pilot and maintenance processes

Location: This position will be located on-site in either Jacksonville, FL or Florence, KY.

Sr. Analyst responsibilities includes developing and maintaining procedures and training content related to CSSU and ensuring compliance with all policies and standards.

Responsibilities
This role is primarily design and development of training content.
Determine appropriate training solutions for assigned projects, based on the outcome of analyzing business needs, performance goals, and audience.
Design and develop training solutions to support instructor-led, self-directed or blended classroom training models as required.
Design process will require:
Needs assessments
Task analysis
Research of knowledge tasks
Working with subjects matter experts to validate content
The creation of supporting design documents including storyboards and mock-ups.
Design also includes the creation of training assessments/tests.
Development includes:
Constructing end-user classroom materials
Facilitator guides
Assessments
Writing supporting documentation.
Create measurement strategy for client solutions to include the overall assessment approach as well as the design and development of data collection tools and methods to measure the impact of training.
Create project plans, timelines and documentation.
Work extensively with subject matter experts, project teams of varying sizes, and business stakeholders at multiple levels.
Develop and edits procedures to ensure adherence to policies.
Qualifications
High proficiency in content development and editing.
Demonstrated experience incorporating adult learning theory, practices, and methodologies into the creation of training materials used in a business setting.
Two or more years of Instructional Design experience.
Ability to work in a department where adaptability is needed where policies and procedures are consistently being developed and/or are changing.
Experience in media development (i.e. Storyline 3).
Well versed in adult learning theory and instructional design methodology and process.
Detail oriented with strong analytical/probing skills.
Demonstrated project and process management skills with experience managing multiple concurrent instructional design projects.
Bachelors degree in Instructional Design or related field a plus.
Demonstrated understanding of KYC policies and standards a plus. Strong knowledge of Cards customers and systems (IBS, FDR, Sawgrass, RPLID etc) a plus.
Background in Knowledge Management or related field a plus.
Advanced organization and prioritization skills with ability to produce deliverables under tight deadlines.
Advanced skills with MS Office Suite.
Technical writing experience a plus

Job Description
Technical Marketing Manager – Simply Biotech

Are you looking for a new career opportunity with an exciting biotech company?! Then we have got the right team for you! In this role, you are responsible for the duties listed below.

Immediate opening for a Technical Marketing Manager at our client, an “essential business”, located in San Diego, CA who possess:
Must have a PhD in Life Sciences
Must have at least 5 years of marketing experience in life science/biotech industry with in-depth knowledge of DNA/RNA products and services.
Possesses technical writing experience
Able to travel 20%
Email your resumes to rsilas@simplybiotech.com or call 858.683.8559

FULL DESCRIPTION: **For an essential business** The Marketing Manager is responsible for the execution of the go to market strategy for the company. This includes execution of multi-channel marketing programs to generate awareness and demand for our global portfolio of products and CDMO services. The Marketing Manager will use their comprehensive marketing experience, strong technical knowledge, and customer-centricity to promote our products and CDMO services into specific customer segments that include BioPharma, Diagnostic and Life Science in all regions. This collaborative individual will need to work effectively across multiple marketing, sales, and operations functions, leading and influencing cross-functional teams to drive results.

The selected candidate will further possess:
Experience working in a CDMO/GMP environment a strong plus.
Possesses a very strong technical messaging skillset, which is to understand complex topics, abstract the key elements, create concise key messaging capturing value proposition and anchor the messaging across multiple audiences.
Experience in driving B2B marketing campaigns in multiple channels.
Thrives in a fast-paced environment that requires successful management of multiple projects and resources concurrently and with high attention to detail.
Demonstrated knowledge and experience of digital marketing channels (social media, web etc.) and tools (Salesforce, marketing automation etc.).
Collaborates easily and effectively with an ability to influence without direct authority.
Exceptional communication, organization, analytical, digital, project management and planning skills.
Strong working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint).
The selected candidate will be responsible for the following:
Develop and execute against tactical marketing plans to support short and long-term business objectives.
Create marketing content in various forms (written, presentations, video etc.) for deployment across multiple on and off-line channels (print, speakerships, web, social media etc.).
Keep abreast of broad corporate messages, as well as the services/technology portfolio.
Translate and deliver all aspects of a technical messaging campaign (content creation, marketing channels, alignment, briefing, speakerships, trade shows etc.).
Work with internal marcom and liaise with external media agencies to develop campaign requirements, content and creative.
Utilize analytical tools and revenue reporting data to make sound marketing decisions to meet or exceed financial and marketing performance objectives.
Develop product and CDMO service workflows and accompanying content to demonstrate end-to-end solutions for specific applications and support buyer journeys.
Interact with varying levels of leadership to report on progress and escalate challenges.
Provide support to distributor & business development team for implementation of programs to drive lead generation and awareness activities to meet revenue goals.
Effectively utilize web, marketing automation, CRM, and social media tools for digital engagement.
Manage KOL relationships to support product development, campaigns, events, and testimonials.
Attend trade shows to provide technical support including organizing and delivering training workshops and seminars.
Create marketing materials for the launch of new products & CDMO services
For immediate and confidential consideration, please email your resume to rsilas@simplybiotech.com or call 858.683.8559

More information can be found at www.SimplyBiotech.com

Named as a Forbes Fintech 50 the last two years in a row, Marqeta powers innovative payment solutions for many of the apps and services you enjoy daily. Our modern card issuing platform, open API, and advanced analytics provide unprecedented control for companies to issue cards, authorize transactions and manage payment operations in real-time.

We are a team of industry experts and technology innovators who take a dynamic approach to solving challenging problems. We power possibilities for our customers by bringing the best talent together in an open and collaborative work environment that rewards creativity and perseverance.

Marqeta is proud of its Oakland roots and strives to build a global team as diverse as the markets we serve, staying true to our values to Connect the Customer, Find a Way, Make Simple, Take Risk and Build One Marqeta. We are not expecting any single candidate to meet all job requirements listed below, so please apply. It's an exciting time to join Marqeta. As we grow, your career and opportunities will grow as well.

Position Summary


Please note: We are only considering applicants who have payments/fintech industry experience.

Marqeta is looking for a Senior/Product Marketing Manager with a passion for creating inspiring product and solution messaging and shaping and evangelizing great products.

The successful candidate comes from a payment or digital banking background and is smart, ambitious, and experienced in storytelling, creating product content, and understanding customer's needs and requirements.

You will work cross-functionally to drive unified messaging to position Marqeta in two of our six industry segments: Online Travel and Retail, Expense Management

Disbursements (Insurance and Incentives), On Demand Services, Lending, and Digital banking. You will work closely with the rest of the marketing team and your vertical specific sales teams as well as the product and customer success and delivery teams to create the go-to-market strategy for your segment and will champion for your industry's product capability needs.

Primary Responsibilities
Solution Marketing
Solution Messaging: Define your vertical messaging, key benefits, market differentiation, customer value, and the solution positioning for your verticals.
Content Creation: Build out the persona and profiles of your buyers, influencer, and decision makers in your segment. Partner with marketing, sales development, and content team to create compelling product content such as white papers, webinars, website copy, data sheets, demos, blog posts that will inspire your buyers, communicate our value proposition, and differentiate our products effectively.
Industry Expertise and Evangelism: Become a thought leader in your segment and leverage your knowledge of Marqeta products and use cases to evangelize the product internally and across external channels.
Connect Technology to Customer Value:
Truly understand the value of the products and solutions you market and articulate how the technology solves business problems in an effective way.
Work closely with product, engineering, sales and customer success/delivery. Understand the customer needs of your segment as well as competitor products in the segment, and use those findings to evangelize and contribute to GTM and product strategy and roadmap.
Sales Enablement: Work with sales and ABM to create collateral including sales decks, solution briefs, presentations/videos, demo scripts, and battle cards to move deals through to close.
Requirements
5+ years of product marketing experience in the payments/fintech industry.
Demonstrated experience developing positioning and messaging for products that serve multiple use cases and personas.
Prior enablement of a sales organization.
Demonstrated problem-solving skills and the ability to manage complex, cross-functional projects to completion.
Excellent written, verbal, and visual communication skills.
Please note: We are only considering applicants who have payments/fintech industry experience.
Personal Characteristics: Self-driven and results-oriented. You like to get things done and produce results. You are a good communicator and someone who likes working in a high-paced start-up environment. You can collaborate well across a diverse team.

Business Skills: Passionate about product marketing and its strategic role in the organization. You have good business acumen and are an analytical thinker. You are passionate about delivering value to customers and truly understand the value of the technology and products you market and can articulate it in an effective way. You know how to navigate your way around a cross-team organization and build relationships and consensus.

Perks
Rich suite of benefit plans; employee premiums paid 100%
Flexible Time Off
Full paid Parental Leave
Pet insurance
401k plan with a Company match
Competitive pay
Meaningful equity
$250 Monthly Stipend to cover: Cell phone, internet Connectivity & Commuting (3C)
Bi-annual "Hack Week" to support and reward innovation
Open, transparent culture that includes All Hands meetings, Lunch-and-Learns, all-company offsites, etc.
Access to corporate gym membership rates, other discounts and employee perks
Fully stocked kitchen, catered lunches twice a week, breakfast on Fridays and more!
As part of our dedication to the diversity of our workforce, Marqeta is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital/domestic partner status, military and veteran status, genetic information or any other legally-recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances.

From monuments and museums, to stadiums, hospitals, universities, highways, hotels and more, Clark has shaped America’s skyline for over a century. Our work leaves a lasting legacy; the same goes for our people. We owe our success to the leadership, talent, and drive of our employees. With a wide range of opportunities from management, to finance, to engineering and more, explore the many ways to grow your career and build your own legacy at Clark. Come be a part of our team, today!

We're looking for an experienced Marketing Coordinator to become part of our creative, collaborative and high-energy team. As an integral part of this team, you'll have the opportunity to market the company, as well as develop innovative and creative proposals, presentations and other materials that help win new projects for Clark.

Responsibilities:
Develop and execute winning RFQ and RFP responses.
Organize and help lead proposal teams in coordination with our operational leaders and the company’s national Marketing team.
Build collaborative relationships with operations staff to facilitate team synergy, creativity and effectiveness.
Participate actively in developing RFQ or RFP responses, including writing, editing, visual communication, graphics and interactive media.
Help maintain company information, materials and associated Marketing databases.

Bachelor’s degree with a major requiring writing, analytic and communication skills.
1-3+ years of relevant and successful marketing and proposal management experience with experience in architecture, engineering, and/or construction (AEC) industry.
Proven experience coordinating and managing large-scale and complicated proposal efforts.
Strong organizational, planning and project management skills and the ability to coordinate the activities of various team members and to prioritize tasks when faced with multiple deadlines.
Demonstrated ability to write and communicate in a clear and compelling manner, with a strong command of English grammar and editing, as well as attention to detail.
A good eye for visualization, layout and/or graphic design skills to facilitate appealing and effective communication, with experience using Adobe Creative Suite required.

Strong work ethic and problem-solving skills with a “hands-on” and team-oriented attitude.
Some travel required.

Position Title: Senior Manager, Digital Communications

As senior manager, digital communications, you will be responsible to nurture and grow the Esperion brand across our corporate digital channels, our digital
communities and other relevant outlets. Youll translate our passion and purpose to engage with stakeholders and lead a dialogue that creates awareness
for our company and the important work our teams of lipid management experts are doing for patients. Youll create interactive, persuasive content and keep it fresh and relevant to help elevate Esperion to become a leader and influencer in the areas of cardiovascular health in which we contribute. Your daily work will include keeping our information current and compliant in the public domain. Well count on you to champion the best user experience across our sites and serve as a creative and technical advisor for others in our company as they work on digital initiatives.

The ideal candidate is well-versed in Google Analytics, SEO (search engine optimization) and SEO-friendly copywriting and has experience creating, managing, and executing a cross-channel editorial calendar.

Preferred Location: New York, NY or Ann Arbor, MI (or remote pending greater experience)

Essential Duties and Responsibilities*
Plans and develops creative digital ideas and content, both written and visual and owns the content creation process from conception to production. Write engaging and compelling content (website, blogs, email newsletters, social media, etc.) that informs and motivates readers to take action.
Ensure digital content aligns with the Esperion brand and supports commercial, scientific and medical goals.
Develop and oversee an audit process to keep website content up to date and compliant with industry standards and regulations.
Defines user experience and is the steward of Esperions digital presence to optimize website structure, content, and experience to drive organic search.
Ensures current information is immediately available during material events such as quarterly earnings.
Monitors traffic and maintains website performance; Regularly audits websites for expired content.
Evaluates content across the pharmaceutical industry, our partners and competitors to help differentiate our approach and messaging.
Identifies cross-industry trends in digital marketing and keeps pace with most impactful engagement practices.
Devise and manage an effective cross-channel digital content calendar aligned with the organizations business goals in collaboration with other teams including marketing and medical and scientific affairs
Monitor customer feedback to understand content gaps to maximize content needs.
Monitors and draws insights from web analytics dashboards and reports, identifying key areas of importance for content and SEO enhancements.
Create, manage, and execute Company's SEO strategy to increase website traffic, maximize conversions, and generate inbound leads, including optimizing existing website content for better performance.
Develop, manage, and optimize paid and organic social media campaigns (LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, etc.) to build brand awareness and support lead generation.
Conceptualize, create, and promote various communication assets (infographics, downloads, ebooks, etc.) across multiple online channels (website, social media, etc.).
Build a network of bloggers and influencers to promoting Esperion and our mission on the social sites.
Work across the organization to develop, track, and publish actionable reports identifying the effectiveness of SEO and social media content and campaigns.
*additional duties and responsibilities not listed here may be required

Qualifications (Education & Experience)
Relevant bachelors degree or a minimum of 7 years of digital communications experience working in corporate communications experience on the client side or agency
Healthcare experience required, preferably at a publicly held company
Track record of website management and experience in creating content and managing twitter, LinkedIn, and other social media channels.
Ability to demonstrate effective collaboration across multiple business functions to develop corporate messaging
Understanding of sensitivity around material non-public information
Strong attention to detail and project management skills.
Experience managing and executing a cross-channel editorial calendar, from conception to publication and promotion.
The ability to think holistically, seeing the 'big picture' without neglecting the finer details.
Ability to analyze and act on customer feedback and data insights to continuously improve content; familiarity with A/B testing methods, Google Analytics, search engine optimization preferred.
Notice to Agency and Search Firm Representatives: Esperion Therapeutics is not accepting unsolicited assistance from agencies and/or search firms for any job posted on this or a referring site. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by an agency and/or search firm to any employee at Esperion via email, the internet, or in any other form and/or method without a valid written agreement in place will be deemed the sole property of Esperion. No fees will be paid in the event that a candidate is hired by Esperion as a result of an unsolicited agency and/or search firm referral.

Job Title: Senior Consultant - Digital Supply Chain - Digital Asset Management - LA
Job Description:
About You
I am passionate about digital supply chain, and making the entire process of digital content creation through management and distribution more efficient and streamlined.
I am thoroughly organized, have exemplary attention to detail, and demonstrate strong analytical and communication skills.
I am consultative in nature and have a passion for and experience in helping my clients to succeed.
I am an industrious team-player; I’m not afraid to roll up my sleeves and work diligently on any task.
I love to help plan or lead client-facing meetings.
I thrive when working with senior-level members of my team to ensure project goals are met.
I am passionate about the company I work for and love to help with internal initiatives.
I bring an innovative spirit and a superior work ethic to every engagement.
I excel when working with a team, even when faced with demanding deadlines.

Job Description
As an OnPrem Senior Consultant with Digital Supply Chain experience, you will dive deep into the client business, working alongside a project team of other analysts, consultants and/or a project manager. You will engage in different types of consulting projects ranging from the formulation and analysis of business, process, and organizational strategies, to the implementation of technology solutions. You will provide initial reviews of deliverables, identify risks/issues and provide mitigation strategies, give project status to your Project Manager and/or client, and assist with or lead client meetings (e.g. stakeholder interviews, workshops, status updates, etc.)

Our consultants work at our client sites. As with all consultants, you should be willing to travel on occasion for work. In this role, you may have an opportunity to mentor junior resources.

About Us
We’re in the business of making businesses better—people, processes, and systems. We’re an end-to-end technology solutions provider focused on connecting disparate parts within organizations. We bring a balance of IQ and EQ to every engagement, and a depth of business and technical acumen to every problem. We are a team that is driven by following through for our clients, and being upfront, honest and sincere.
Requirements
3-5+ years System Implementation, SDLC, Integration, and Project Management experience
3+ years in consulting / professional services, big firm experience preferred
2+ years of implementation experience for DSC/DAM or other digital media delivery solutions over the full lifecycle (analysis, design, develop, test, deploy, support) at a consulting / professional services firm
Experience managing storage and network solutions to be able to support large file distribution
Knowledge of numerous file formats and codecs with a focus on video
Experience with localization use cases
Demonstrated ability to manage upwards and communicate with leadership
Demonstrated ability to collaborate with subject matter experts, cross-functional resources and business stakeholders to understand and document business requirements
Ability to plan, prioritize and manage custom development project delivery based on business requirements
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, information systems, computer science, business administration or other related fields
Preferred
Experience in Media & Entertainment/Broadcast and/or Consumer Products industries
Experience at a large consulting firm (e.g., Accenture, Deloitte, EY, CapGemini, PWC)
Experience setting up security policies, users, roles, and groups within a DAM system
Agile or Scrum Trained and/or Certified
OpenText experience
Life at OnPrem
We were founded on a culture of collaboration and inclusiveness, and this permeates each of our initiatives, both client-facing and internal. We offer a wide selection of benefits including medical, dental & vision, 401k matching and flexible vacation; we sponsor trainings to advance our teams’ skill sets; we prioritize our employees’ professional growth paths. Currently 200+ people strong in four geographic territories, we’ve been recognized as a “Best Place to Work,” a “Great Place to Work,” “Fastest Growing,” and “A Jewel.”

Visa Status
Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).

Equal Employment Opportunity
OnPrem Solution Partners ensures equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Title: Director of Scientific and Thought Leader Communications
Job Description:
Every immune system has a story to tell the key is knowing how to listen. Our goal is to meaningfully improve people's lives by learning from the wisdom of their adaptive immune systems. It's a bold objective that we're uniquely built to achieve.

At Adaptive, you'll be challenged, you'll be inspired, and you'll be part of an innovative organization making a real impact on improving the quality of life globally. No matter what your role is, you'll find a diverse, team-driven, fun culture where your contributions truly count.

Position Overview

Adaptive Biotechnologies is seeking an experienced medical communications expert to join our Diagnostics Marketing team as Director of Scientific and Thought Leader Communications for our flagship commercial diagnostic product, the clonoSEQ Assay. Reporting to the Vice President, clonoSEQ Marketing, this individual will be responsible for leading the development and implementation of innovative disease state education and communications strategies for clonoSEQ. Through these strategies and supporting tactics, the individual will accelerate Adaptive's effort to expand awareness, knowledge and support for MRD testing in lymphoid cancers with target audiences including clinicians, pathologists and payers.

The Director of Scientific and Thought Leader Communications will develop and refine strategic imperatives for MRD education across disease states, translate those imperatives into an actionable plan and then lead and maintain accountability for implementation of this plan. The individual in this role will have direct ownership and accountability for all unbranded marketing initiatives, and technical product promotion, spanning all communication channels for opinion leader (OL) engagement and medical education. S/he will engage regularly with thought leaders in key disease areas, deepening relationships and soliciting input to inform educational content development. Creation of peer-to-peer educational programs, development of associated scientific content and training of thought leaders to deliver it effectively will be an important part of the role.

The individual in this role will be expected to develop and maintain in-depth knowledge of MRD-related educational needs / gaps. S/he will determine how these needs differ for clinicians at various points along the MRD testing adoption continuum, and then develop and deploy tailored messaging, advertising and programming to address them. S/he must also establish strong comprehension of the medical education landscape, identify and prioritize available delivery channels and integrated content development strategies, and build strategic long-term partnerships with 3rd party medical education providers. S/he will also leverage the marketing team's relationships with patient advocacy groups and identify ways to collaborate with these organizations in pursuit of shared educational goals.

The Director of Scientific and Thought Leader Communications will be a key member of the Diagnostics Team at Adaptive and will contribute actively to shape the direction for ongoing clinical diagnostic marketing and commercialization efforts. S/he will work closely with Marketing and Sales leadership, other marketing team colleagues, Medical Affairs and Market Access to align on and successfully execute against cross-functional educational objectives. The Director of Scientific and Thought Leader Communications will have budget ownership for all unbranded marketing and thought leader communications related initiatives and will have responsibility for managing and optimizing resource allocation throughout the year. S/he will collaborate with other marketing team members as well as agency and other external partners to deliver on these initiatives on-time and on-budget.


Responsibilities
Develop, refine and implement the global market development and disease state education strategy for clonoSEQ, ensuring alignment with the overall brand and company strategy
Lead execution of tactical marketing initiatives focused on the clinician, pathologist and payer communities, both in the US and internationally
Works cross-functionally to align strategies and tactics with Sales, Customer Operations, Medical Affairs, Market Access, Sales Operations and Product Development
Oversee medical education investments for clonoSEQ, exploring innovative and interactive educational opportunities and executing on educational symposia at congresses as needed
Maximize scientific communication opportunities through the creation of tools and content for advisory boards, conference booths and externally facing meetings
Collaborate with key account manager (KAM) team to develop tools and programs to support unbranded educational initiatives in target academic institutions and community practices
Establish and maintain relationships with key external education partners including physician thought leaders and patient advocacy organizations
Create and maintain accountability for a thought leader communication plan in collaboration with Sales, Medical Affairs and Market Access
Align with cross functional teams to design and orchestrate educational programming with thought leaders which meets brand strategic objectives
Manage agency partners and other vendors on marketing campaign and collateral projects, providing vision / direction, content feedback and end-to-end project management
Contribute to performance tracking/monitoring of educational initiatives, including involvement in primary and secondary market research and/or data analytics
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of relevant market dynamics and competitive developments
Requirements
Bachelor's degree required; MBA preferred
Minimum of 10 years of experience and a demonstrated track record developing and delivering strategic medical content to healthcare professionals (including experience with regulated products)
Experience working with publication development
Functional experience in marketing strategy and planning, including specific experience leading technical and disease state educational efforts
Experience in diagnostics, medical device, biotech or pharmaceutical industries preferred
Oncology / hematology experience preferred
Prior people management / team leadership experience preferred
Results-oriented leader in marketing strategy and execution
Excellent structured and unstructured problem-solver
Able to artfully balance strategic thinking with tactical planning and execution
Proactive approach to work; strong personal drive and desire for feedback
Refined interpersonal skills, maturity and good judgment; capable of communicating with and facilitating decisions involving a diverse group of individuals
Strong team player - highly effective in partnering cross-functionally and influencing without authority
Effective project leader able to work autonomously to advance the team toward agreed-upon goals
Ability to clarify and overcome ambiguity; flexibility to adapt to change
Experience managing external vendors, including medical education companies
Proficient in the use of MS PowerPoint and Excel
Excited about a growth-stage company environment and driven to make a difference
Working Conditions

Position based in Seattle, WA. Travel requirements approximately 10%.

Adaptive Biotechnologies is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. Job Title: Senior Technical Artist - Shared Game Engine
Job Description:
Are you passionate about clean workflows, joyous user experiences, and solving challenges for games of all shapes and sizes? Do you want to delight developers with great tools just as much as you want to excite players with great games? Do you come into work eager to figure out how to make an ambitious idea suddenly effortless to create? Blizzard Entertainment's Shared Game Engine team is looking for you, a highly skilled and motivated Senior Technical Artist, to help us shape our development experiences.

Our ideal candidate is a strong technical individual with practical experience in as many production pipeline roles as possible. In this role you will help represent and integrate content creators across Blizzard. You will create example content, new workflows, and tools in the engine ecosystem to help create the most epic entertainment experiences ever. You will add your experience to a team of dedicated engine developers and teams across the company to execute on this shared vision.

We will entrust you with
Creating and integrating sample content representative of Art and Design at Blizzard
Designing systems and workflows that support rapid prototyping and scale to games of epic proportions
Collaborating with Engineers and UX professionals to create Blizzard Quality tools
You bring with you
Deep understanding of game content workflows, such as Character Art, Environment Art, Game Scripting, and Visual Effects
Experience with Lighting and Shaders
A hands-on, solid understanding of C++ (Expert level skills not required)
Strong technical problem-solving ability
Nice to haves
Familiarity with procedural content creation tools, such as Substance Designer and Houdini
Experience with developing plugins, such as Python C Extensions, Maya C++ Plugins, or similar
Deep understanding of runtime performance, optimization, and debugging, especially tools like VTune, NSight, and RenderDoc
Understanding of Production-level art creation
Blizzard Entertainment is a global company committed to growing our employees. We offer generous benefits and perks with an eye on providing true work/life balance. We've worked hard to champion an intensely collaborative and creative environment, a diverse and inclusive employee culture, and training and opportunity for professional growth. Our people are everything, and our core values are real.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Join us!

SDL2017

We are looking for an experienced content writer that can volunteer to handle B2B social media at least one day per week to get the word out about WorkThisWay.

What is WorkThisWay?

In response to the lay offs caused by pandemic we have joined forces with another startup in LA, called Maslo.ai, to provide free access to job matching and a Career Companion so that people can gets job more quickly.

We are doing this through the generosity of partners and benefactors and are working evenings and weekends to make this a reality. It would be amazing to have the help of experienced social media experts.

Requirements

Genuine willingness to create content that will help businesses and recruiters during the current job crisis.

Prior content creation experience with B2B.

Ability to effectively communicate in a time when people are stressed and need real guidance.

Ability to communicate in a respectful and business-like manner.

Willingness to work collaboratively with several companies.

Understanding that you may have access to business discussions that can not be disclosed.

Benefits

You will work with very accomplished artificial intelligence engineers and team members.

Following great work you will receive a recommendation letter from the combined partnership of ThisWay and Maslo.

Once hiring is no longer on 'freeze', you may be prioritized for open jobs with one or both companies, as well as those companies we are partnering with.

This position is strictly 'volunteer' and is an unpaid position. We are not a non-profit.

Applying for this role provides agreement to the terms of a volunteer role.

Job Title: Field Content and Communications Senior Manager
Job Description:
A career at New York Life offers many opportunities. To be part of a growing and successful business. To reach your full potential, whatever your specialty. Above all, to make a difference in the world by helping people achieve financial security. It’s a career journey you can be proud of, and you’ll find plenty of support along the way. Our development programs range from skill-building to management training, and we value our diverse and inclusive workplace where all voices can be heard. Recognized as one of Fortune’s World’s Most Admired Companies, New York Life is committed to improving local communities through a culture of employee giving and service, supported by our Foundation. It all adds up to a rewarding career at a company where doing right by our customers is part of who we are, as a mutual company without outside shareholders. We invite you to bring your talents to New York Life, so we can continue to help families and businesses “Be Good At Life.” To learn more, please visit LinkedIn, our Newsroom and the Careers page of www.NewYorkLife.com

Role Summary

In this role, the Field Content and Communications Sr. Manager, is accountable for managing the day to day operations for point of sale content development and execution. Working closely with the team Marketing content leads for the different point of sale audiences, this role determines which content to develop and when. Additionally, this role will oversee the communications of key marketing initiatives to the field ensuring awareness and adoption.

Key Content Responsibilities
Develop and execute on a content strategy for the point of sale content that Marketing develops for agents and recruiters
Recommends techniques and strategies to improve the quality and efficiency of the content development process
Develop an editorial calendar and ensure stakeholders are well informed and aligned on its execution
Provides leadership for the agile content creation team by providing necessary context and clarification around business needs
Manages prioritization for all tier three Field Marketing content requests accordingly; rank order projects according to business value and timeline needs
Maximizes value delivered by recommending optimal resources to complete the work to support efficiency and effectiveness
Drives the content execution by ensuring content briefs from marketing leads are clear and support desired deliverables
Supports Marketing Leads by ensuring content deliverables meet stated objectives
Key Communications Responsibilities
Optimizes the field marketing communications strategy
Participates in the planning and implementation of key marketing initiatives to the field
Oversees the socialization and distribution of key marketing initiatives to the field
Determines the appropriate communication channels, messaging and key stakeholders for desired outcomes
Develops materials to support the field communications of the marketing initiatives and adoption (e.g. FAQs, how to guides, etc.)
Maintains and builds strong working relationships to improve partnership and increase awareness and adoption of marketing initiatives
Identify & implement new opportunities to drive impact to better drive the outcomes we want
Skills
Ability to problem solve to support strategic decisions
Requires in-depth knowledge and/or breadth of experience in financial services
Ability to anticipate business issues or concerns; recommends improvements
Creative as well as analytical
Can manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, very deadline-driven environment
Strong written communication skills; Communicates complex ideas, persuades and negotiates with others often at senior levels to adopt a different point of view.
Makes decisions guided by strategic vision
Ability to work cross-functionally across the organization necessary
Project and process management skills, including proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Executive presence; self-starter with and a passion to deliver results
Experience
7 to 10 years of financial services marketing experience preferably in communications, content
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively at all levels – peers, executives, agents
Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to roll up sleeves to get the job done
Education
Bachelor’s degree is required, preferably in marketing or related field

Job Title: Strategic Communications Project Manager with Security Clearance
Job Description: Description The Strategic Communications Project Manager is responsible for the overall direction, coordination, implementation, execution, control and completion of specific communications projects while ensuring customer requirements are met and expectations exceeded. The Strategic Communications Project Manager provides leadership, assures quality deliverables, and makes technically sound recommendations based on industry-accepted best practices and management fundamentals. The Strategic Communications Project Manager recognizes the need to evolve the project and processes to meet the strategic communications requirements of each task. The project manager also works with the client to identify requirements and solutions for communications products, graphic design, media development and web site content maintenance and follows through with employees to ensure quality and timely delivery. Requirements The candidate should be knowledgeable of marketing communications best practices, protocols and processes and the outreach channels and marketing vehicles on which those communications are delivered. The candidate must have a conceptual understanding of creative development, media production, web communications, event planning and execution, marketing campaign management, and marketing analytics. This candidate must have excellent communication skills, positive motivation, team building, and leadership development. We are seeking someone who can influence both transformational and event driven changes by focusing on organization design, leadership, culture, change management, communications and training. The candidate should have experience with government contract requirements and interfacing with contract officers. The candidate should understand project budgeting for time and funds to allow for appropriate forecasting based on workload and client needs. Strategic Communications Project Management Skills The candidate must: * Experience managing medium to large Federal Programs that involve graphics design, video production, web content creation, social media programs or projects. * Have strong verbal communications skills to clearly articulate ideas to a technical and non-technical audience. * Establish and enforce quality standards for the team. * Be able to resolve conflicts within the team and with the customer. * Be agile and adaptable in a changing client environment. * Be able to prioritize and balance work requests from various sources. Project Management Skills The candidate must be extremely proficient at project management and display exception problem-solving skills. The candidate must be knowledgeable of the Project Management Institute's (PMI) principles and proficient in using best practices for Project Management. PMP Certification is required. These include: * Develop the project charter, project management plan and sub-plans. * Work with Requirements/Business Analyst to ensure adequate definition of the business requirements, project scope, goals and deliverables. * Assemble and coordinate project staff, in some cases in unison with other PMs. * Develop and maintain project schedule baseline and subsequent changes. * Define and prioritize project tasks and resource requirements. * Host and run team meetings. Provide direction and support to the project team. * Track project deliverables using appropriate tools. * Plan, monitor, and schedule project timelines. * Monitor and report on progress of the project regularly. * Develop metrics and present dashboard reports defining project progress, issues and resolutions. * Implement and manage project changes to achieve project outputs. * Develop and present formal monthly financial and progress reports using standard NDi formats. * Ensure all project artifacts are reviewed and accepted by customer. * Evaluate project results and prepare a detailed project summary and lessons learned account for future reference. Technical Skills * Proficiency using Microsoft Project, the Microsoft Office Suite, and other management software to create dashboards and staffing analysis. * Strong writing skills to write create statements of work, client presentations, white papers, position papers, assist in preparation of proposals and other writing tasks as needed. Desired Skills but not required * Experience in the Agile methodology and related management tools for Agile development operations. * Proficiency using Agile Methodology oriented tools such as JIRA * Use of accounting software, such as Unanet is desirable. Certification/Education: * Professional Management Professional (PMP) required * Must be able to obtain a Public Trust clearance * Bachelor's Degree in Interactive Digital media, Digital Strategy, Media Design, Communication Management, Campaign Strategy or a related Strategic Communications and Media field

The Opportunity

The Marketing department at DeSales pushes the envelope of what it means to engage Catholics in their faith. Part digital/creative agency, part brand marketing, and part software services provider, we cover a lot of ground. We create ads and layouts for two newspapers. We execute integrated, digital and traditional campaigns in concert with PR, production, and events. We run digital campaigns to increase donations for scholarships for education. We broadcast key events live on social to reach those unable to get out of the house. We get all the dioceses in the state together with our interactive executions to spread the message of the true reason for Christmas. We think differently about what it means to be in the service of our diocese. We don't dwell on the past: we look to the future. And we are excited about the challenge.

Marketing Coordinator Position

Support the DeSales mission through the ideation, creation, and execution of marketing programs which bring Catholics into a closer relationship with Christ and encourage them to put their faith into action.

Marketing / Promotional (35% of role)
Execute both traditional and digital marketing campaigns for internal and external clients, and support the ongoing maintenance of our websites.
Project / Office Management (55% of role)
Ensure the smooth operations of the Marketing Team by ensuring all projects are properly set-up and tracked through to completion and directly handling administrative tasks.
Content Creations (10% of role)
Create compelling short-form video content to enhance our website and social media campaigns.

Marketing Coordinator Duties:

Marketing Responsibilities:
Own the creation & execution of all emails to support marketing campaigns; maintain our MailChimp account.
Create & execute digital and social advertising to support marketing campaigns, including all technical aspects of audience creations, placement, testing and monitoring campaigns.
Own the ongoing content maintenance and updates for all Diocesean websites that we manage, excluding Parish and Academy network sites.
Short-form copywriting for promotions, as needed.
Research and various information gathering to support marketing programs.
Proof-read all materials before they leave the department.
Assist in the planning and purchasing print & digital advertising including email blasts, web and email banners, social and print ads.
Other tasks as assigned by management
Project Management Responsibilities:
Act as the primary point of contact for all incoming requests to the department, understanding the timeline, stakeholders, and reason for the request; and priorities requests with the Director of Marketing.
Monitor all project deadlines, highlight risks and working with the Director of Marketing, take remedial actions.
Submit all client billing to finance on a monthly basis.
Ensure all meetings are efficiently run with objectives, agendas, and minutes taken and properly filed.
Own the marketing google drive administration to ensure everyone has access to the appropriate materials.
Own the ongoing maintenance and use of Harvest (our time management system), review and summarize reports; and maintain our Harvest account.
Own the ongoing maintenance, project set-up and use of asana (our project management system), review and summarize reports; and maintain our asana account.
Coordinate and submit the annual CPA Awards nominations.
Own the annual production of the Bluebook
Maintain our calendar of events, contact lists, and other important data.
Other tasks as assigned by management
Content Creation Responsibilities:
Create ad hoc short-form video content to support social media and other digital marketing efforts, as needed.
Qualifications and Skill Requirements
Good understanding of marketing principles including lead generation, sales funnel, branding, and positioning.
Strong understanding of the Catholic faith.
Minimum 1-2 years of experience in Marketing
BS/BA Degree in Marketing preferred
Strong time management & project management skills with the ability to prioritize, multi-task and adhere to deadlines.
Ability to take direction, understand objectives, and proactively complete projects independently.
Excellent written/verbal communication, organizational, and analytical skills.
Careful attention to detail, particularly proofreading for accuracy and consistency.
Experience creating campaigns on email platforms.
Experience with Facebook Business Manager and Google Analytics.
Proficient in G Suite and Microsoft Office Suite.
Experience with Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop, a plus.
A desire to continually learn new skills and collaborate with colleagues to achieve high-reaching team goals.

Job Title:
Sr. Systems Engineer (Security & Networking)

Job Summary:
ATEC Group is a leading Business Information Architecture Firm in the Capital District. We are looking for a self-motivated, multi-disciplined individual with solid field experience in the areas of design, implementation, configuration, and support of infrastructure and networking products.

For more than 30 years, ATEC Group has partnered with leading businesses to design, implement, and support the most technologically advanced IT solutions, while maintaining the highest levels of product knowledge and client satisfaction.

If you are looking for a challenging position, an opportunity to put your technical skills to the test, and a chance the work with leading, cutting-edge technologies, then we have a place for you!

Location: This position is located in Albany, NY.

The successful Sr. Systems Engineer candidate will have the following field experience:

· Minimum 5 years of experience configuring, deploying and troubleshooting complex network designs with various vendors, including but not limited to, Extreme Networks, Cisco Systems, HPE, Fortinet, and Sophos Networking, including switching, routing, firewalling and wireless deployments.

· Experience designing, configuring and deployment of enterprise firewall systems and all their included parts, such as IPSEC VPN, SSL VPN, IPS, application visibility and control, and vendor specific attributes of each system.

· Ability to quickly diagnose and troubleshoot problems in an unfamiliar environments, while maintaining organization and having great communication to the customer and our sales team.

· Building, designing, and upgrading Microsoft Windows Server 2003 - 2019 and Active Directory environments and the supporting sever roles, including DNS, DHCP, WSUS etc., including troubleshooting all aspects of deployment.

· Building, designing, and upgrading Microsoft Exchange 2003 – 2019 environments, including troubleshooting all aspects of deployment.

· Experience designing solutions around Office 365 and performing Office 365 migrations, in an all cloud or hybrid environment.

· Implement and manage anti-spam systems (Barracuda, FortiMail, TrendMicro HES…)

· Network monitoring tools, such as Extreme Management Center, Observium/LibreNMS, SolarWinds Orion and other platforms that monitor server and network infrastructure.

Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):

· Systems Administration (i.e. account management, Active Directory support, data backups)

· Organizing work, setting priorities, and meeting critical deadlines

·
Accurately designing and documenting client infrastructures

·
Reliable transportation

·
Excellent verbal and written communication skills while working with individuals at management and executive levels

This position will also require working closely with our sales team and the customer to identify business and technology needs and assist with architecting the solution.

Consulting guidance and recommendations on topics such as networking, capacity planning, performance tuning, administration, security, and remote monitoring will be required.

Effectively communicating project status, activities, and findings in oral and written formats is also required.

Job Title:
Sr. Storage Engineer

Job Summary:

ATEC Group is a leading Business Information Architecture Firm in the Capital District. We are looking for a self-motivated, multi-disciplined individual with solid field experience in the areas of design, implementation, configuration, and support of infrastructure and networking products.

For more than 30 years, ATEC Group has been partnering with leading businesses to design, implement, and support the most technologically advanced IT solutions, while maintaining the highest levels of product knowledge and client satisfaction.

If you are looking for a challenging position, an opportunity to put your technical skills to the test, and a chance the work with leading, cutting-edge technologies, then we have a place for you!

Location: This position is located in Albany, NY.

Expectations for the Position:

This individual will be a senior technical resource responsible for setting technical direction across the storage and converged infrastructure domains.

These responsibilities will span the block Storage Area Network (SAN), file Network Attached Storage (NAS), Object (S3, Swift, etc.), Backup and File and Print, and converged infrastructure technologies globally, on premise, and in the public cloud. This will include evaluating new technologies, setting strategic direction, executive presentations, and presenting to customers.

The Sr. Storage Engineer will be a thought leader in the storage domain with a strong technical understanding of all infrastructure domains. The individual will be the technical lead for large and complex projects requiring collaboration across infrastructure, platform, and application teams.

The ideal candidate will need to be comfortable interacting and influencing senior/executive leadership, CIO partners, peer infrastructure groups, auditers, operational risk management, security policies and practices, and vendors.

Required Qualifications:

• 7+ years of operating systems analysis experience, operating systems engineering experience, or a combination of both

• 5+ years of leadership experience

• 1+ year of experience with Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) concepts

• 5+ years of SAN (Storage Area Network) experience

• 5+ years of NAS experience

• 2+ years of experience compiling and preparing executive summaries, whitepapers, and presentations for management or senior leaders

• 2+ years of information security experience

• Ability to work outside of regular business hours

• Ability to travel up to 25% of the time

Preferred Qualifications:

• Candidate should have strong knowledge of virtualization fundamentals, including server virtualization, desktop virtualization, and storage and network virtualization

• At least 5-7 years of experience in Implementation of ESXi & Vcenter or Administration of ESXi & Vcenter

• Understand concepts of virtual desktop infrastructure, such as desktop virtualization and application virtualization

• At least 3-5 years of experience in implementation, troubleshooting, and administration of Horizon View components, such as connection servers, security servers, load balancers

• Strong understanding of application virtualization, testing, and publishing of the applications

• Knowledge on servers like Cisco UCS or rack mount servers from Cisco/HP/Dell

• Experience administrating and troubleshooting of desktop images for VDI, Golden Image Patching, installing and publishing new applications, and creating and publishing new desktop pools

• Knowledge on Windows Active Directory systems like Schema, Group Policies, Sites, Trusts, etc.

• Knowledge on Windows 2008/2012 Server & Linux Installation and configuration

• Ability to work on and take ownership of time-bound projects and activities

• Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills

• Experience developing partnerships and collaborating with other business and functional areas

• Knowledge and understanding of backup and recovery solutions

• Ability to articulate complex concepts in a clear manner

• Experience with articulating issues, risks, and proposed solutions to various levels of staff and management

• Knowledge and understanding of cloud computing

• Advanced Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and Outlook) skills

We are looking for an experienced backend software engineer to join our exceptional team of distributed systems engineers. We have embarked on a mission to create highly-scalable and performant micro-services that handle tera-bytes of data and analytics that feed into beautifully designed custom data visualizations. You will be responsible for architecting, implementing and testing new and existing systems that power our flagship product and help humanize the way content marketers interact with customers. Most importantly, your leadership as a senior and experienced member of the team will become an example for others to follow, and you will help shape and define our engineering practices and craftsmanship.
Our Engineering Values
Collaboration: We believe that engineers do their best work when working together in cohesive teams.
Excellence: We believe in doing things the "right way" rather than the "fast way", and holding ourselves to a high standard of excellence.
Growth: We believe engineers do their best work when they are constantly growing, learning, and changing.
Communication: We believe in combining empathy with openness and honesty to set clear expectations and hold each other accountable.
Impact: We believe we're making the world a better place by empowering marketers to really help their customers rather than just sell stuff.

What you'll be doing
Writing beautiful API documentation for all the services you and the team builds for consumption by other developers (we use Swagger).
Design and architect scalable services that are both highly available and performant.
Breaking down product requirements into manageable stories and delegating work to team members.
Refactoring and evolving existing distributed systems to make legacy systems anew.
Collaborating with other functions of the business and engineering department to ensure successful delivery of software.
Who you are:


A bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or related field
8+ years working in backend technologies in addition to Java such as Scala, Python, Golang or a combination of
8+ years working in databases such as MySQL, Postgres or other RDBMS systems
8+ years working with cloud-hosting and deep understanding of AWS, Google Cloud or Azure
3-5+ years working with Docker containers and deep understanding of the internals of how containers work
3-5+ years working with non-relational databases such as Cassandra or Dynamo
3-5+ years building and deploying containers into managed clusters with Kubernetes or equivalent
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
Proven professional experience working with non-technical business functions
You enjoy collaborating with product management teams to ensure the best quality product is shipped out the door
You have a keen appreciation for usability and understand your users come first when designing systems
Why You Should Join


At Conductor, we are looking for engaged and passionate engineers that can raise the bar. There is a tremendous opportunity here to have immediate impact in the day-to-day and affect the company's success and growth. We all share in the same values and push each other to meet these standards.

We are made up of a diverse group of people from all backgrounds and include a team of exceptional engineers in Kyiv as well. Wherever you are from, you will find a common ground here for continuing to push forward your career and make a difference in this industry.

Conductor's forward-thinking customers include global and emerging enterprise brands like Citibank, Salesforce, ClassPass, and WeWork.

At Farm Bureau Financial Services, we make insurance simple so our client/members can feel confident knowing their family, home, cars and other property are protected. Senior SMB/Web Pricing Strategy Manager
Marketing | San Francisco, California

Our agreement with employees
DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what's right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better than we found it. And for that, you'll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.

The team
Our Marketing team creates world-class content and data-driven marketing solutions that communicates the value of DocuSign's Agreement Cloud to reach more customers and help them understand the potential impact DocuSign can have on their business. We design creative for a new business campaign. Refine messaging around new product launches. Organize captivating customer events. Develop innovative social media campaigns. Collaborate on playbooks and training with the Sales team. Marketing is the face and voice of DocuSign and plays a key, high-impact role in how we tell our story.

This position
As the Senior SMB/Web Pricing Strategy Manager, you will be responsible for enabling our SMB growth with pricing strategies for both our direct sales and eCommerce sales channels. You will work directly with senior executives within the organization on sales and pricing strategy, including our c-suite and functional leaders. You will collaborate extensively with eCommerce sales, SMB direct sales, product marketing, product management, and finance to accelerate growth across our company as we create a new software category.

This position reports to the Vice President of Strategy.

Responsibilities
Own packaging and pricing strategy for our eCommerce channel, including designing strategies to drive reach and market penetration while enabling upsell and expansion. You'll partner with our Web Sales team to drive P&P merchandising, messaging, and promotion strategy.
Understand customer needs, create customer value, and highlight competitive differentiation through pricing and sales strategy.
Start with an ambiguous complex problem, frame up strategic issues, identify key assumptions and required information, gather information and analyze data sets to tease out insights, and communicate those insights across the organization to simplify discussions and deliver a decision.
Understand value-based packaging and pricing principles.
Understand eCommerce and SMB direct sales channel dynamics.
Lead discussions 1:1 and across groups to create a common understanding and deliver cross-org alignment.
Drive sales enablement content creation for our SMB sales team and customer support.
Create sales-facing and customer-facing content including presentations, web copy, and datasheets as well as guiding others to create content.
Basic Qualifications
2+ years technology marketing strategy experience with preference for product marketing or pricing/packaging experience
8 years business experience
MBA degree from a top tier business school or equivalent work experience
Preferred Qualifications
2+ years of sales or product marketing experience in B2B SaaS targeting SMB customers
Experience with CRM, Contract Lifecycle Management or related category
Demonstrated ability to work on cross-functional projects
Ability to influence senior leadership
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Capacity to work on cross-functional projects
Experience selling value and understand negotiating strategies.
Strategy consulting experience

DocuSign® helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, hundreds of thousands of customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. Plus, we save more trees together! And that's a good thing.

Job Description:
Marketing Coordinator

This translates into an unparalleled work environment and a superior client experience that thrives on integrity, quality, collaboration, and smart innovation. Through our culture shaped by our values, our mission of positively impacting people through innovative facility solutions will be possible.

The Marketing Coordinators primary responsibility will be gathering and combining content for project proposals and qualifications to support the companys business initiatives within the industry. This position will be responsible for seeking out new project opportunities through research and the use of CRM software. The Marketing Coordinator will create marketing items for presentation to clients to further business opportunities.

Maintain staff resumes

Manage CRM data

Gather content for project sheets and brochures

Maintain proposal tracker

Degree in Marketing,

Communications or related field

3+ years of experience in proposal coordination

Exceptional writing and editing experience

Extremely detail oriented

Excellent communication skills

Responsible for assisting in the conception and execution of custom multimedia projects for paid digital media campaigns on networks like Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat, Pinterest, Google, YouTube, Bing, Outbrain, Taboola and more.

This role will work closely with our creative team to produce, convert and optimize all creative elements needed for all media channels - Facebook, YouTube, Google, and more. You will need to manage multiple productions at once from concept to final deliverables.

Their primary KPI is client revenue, customer satisfaction & retention and net promoter score.

Understand client expectations and internal timelines around creative deliverables.

Create and oversee the development of all creative, delivering a high level of excellence.

Work with our media buying team in developing overall marketing strategies.
Participation in market research, presenting creative concept development, and strategic direction.
Oversee the creative process from inception to final product and ensures quality of content and style to meet clients marketing objectives and the proposed media buying strategies
Foster progressive thinking and the pushing of boundaries
Stimulate professional development and inspiration within the team and direct reports
Be able to succeed in a deadline-oriented, fast-paced environment
Manage your creative team and work with other teams to plan, execute and report
Brainstorm and collaborate on concept development, copywriting tasks, messaging and marketing materials, as well as presentations and client communications

Bachelor's degree in Marketing or related major required.
3+ years of performance marketing experience in digital marketing is required.
Highly knowledgeable with Google and Facebook platforms, keyword research, Google Analytics, & ad creative testing
Ability to problem-solve and structure complex projects/plans with multiple stakeholders and deliverables
Ability to communicate effectively to all employee levels while understanding both the day to day and big picture
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while managing time effectively
Benefits

Join Us On Our Mission

We are a company where the world's best team members execute groundbreaking ideas through digital advertising.

About Jump 450

Jump 450, based in New York City, is a high-growth digital performance marketing agency that has seen rapid growth of over 250% over the past year. They have more than doubled their staff in the past year and expanded their resources to scalably grow their client's businesses. Jump 450's workplace culture, office environment, employee development approach, team engagement, perks, and benefits were part of the criteria that led to Ad Age's and Inc’s Best Places to Work and a 97% employee retention rate.

Jump 450 is the highest paying performance marketing agency in America. The company offers uncapped compensation for employees by sharing ~50 percent of top-line revenues with the team each month. On average, their media buyers make 400% higher than the average media buyer in the country. This work environment has created a triangle of alignment between company management, its employees, and its clients; resulting in Jump 450's clients always having the most skilled and coveted talent working on their accounts across their unique disciplines.

Jump 450’s office space is brand new and in a great complex (Brookfield Place) that has many amenities such as a robust food court, multiple restaurants within a minute walk, green space, water views, and great access to public transportation (Fulton St / World Trade Center / Cortland St / PATH stops within 5 a minute walk).
