Job Description
About Us

STEEZY’s mission is to make dance the next big sporting and fitness category, starting with the best online dance classes.

The Challenge

We’re looking for a laser-focused talented video editor to train under our Director of Video and Video Editor to edit and release content in a quick and timely manner.

This role will solely be focused on editing STEEZY studio classes. We’ll strive to push as much content out as we can to learn quickly and revise, with the right balance of quality for our brand.

As you grow to understand our company and brand, we’ll trust you to take more ownership of editing more classes to support the team. Speed and attention to detail are key indicators of success.

What You Can Expect:
Assist with video recording and editing of STEEZY studio classes
Collaborate across content and marketing team to create impactful content that is on-brand
Improve video and sound quality using various video software
Ensure video content is in correct formatting

What We’re Looking For:
Mastery of video and audio editing software and programs
Ability to multitask across various editing projects with ease
Ability to understand creative direction and execute with seamless precision

What You’re Good At:
Video editing on Adobe Premiere
A mastery of video and audio editing software and programs
Understanding creative direction and executing against direction with seamless precision
Figuring things out – We don’t have all the answers, but someone somewhere does.
Communication – Things move fast, we all need to be on the same page.
Organization – We have lots of files, like a lot. It’s important to keep track of it all.
Multitasking across various editing projects with ease
Working behind the camera – Basic knowledge of camera work
Always asking why – Curious about the world around you.

Extra Bonus Points:
After Effects, Photoshop, Illustrator Skills
Worked with office software (Asana, Slack, Google Apps)
Social media proficiency
Love of dance

What It’ll Be Like:

It’s our mission to make dance accessible to everyone, and we're building an amazing place to work for that mission.

This is paid, but you’re not buying a Ferrari anytime soon. Things here are going to be move really fast and it’s going to be hard work, but we promise you’ll learn a lot.

We’ll invest in you as much as you invest in yourself. We’ll ask you to do things that you probably have no idea how to do and help you figure it out.

We will always judge you on your results and nothing else, and we promise to never ask you to do anything we have never done ourselves.

As a startup, we move fast, stay nimble, focus intently, and put in the grind.

We work hard, but it’s a fun journey, and our students makes it all worth it.
✌STEEZY Squad

Based on the California Consumer Privacy Act of 2018 (CCPA), as an applicant of an open role at STEEZY, below are the pieces of personal information STEEZY will collect from you:
Name
Contact Information (email address, phone number)
Employment History
Education History
We use the above personal information as part of the process to find qualified candidates to fill our open roles. STEEZY does not “sell” a candidate’s personal information as defined under the CCPA. STEEZY discloses candidate personal information to affiliates of STEEZY, partners/third parties who provide services to help us fill our roles, and government agencies as required by law.

About Us
Churchill Mortgage began in 1992 with the core value of providing the highest level of integrity to each and every customer, meaning we tell our customers what is best for them even when it means we won't close their loan. We have found over and over again that treating people the way we want to be treated is not only the right thing to do, but it builds lasting relationships. Responsibilities
(Note: The following duties are typical of those performed by this role. Other related duties may also be performed. Incumbents may not necessarily perform all of the duties listed.)
• Assisting the Branch and the Corporate Marketing Director, while supporting the activities of the marketing team
• Assisting in the creation and production of marketing materials and literature
• Coordinating the creation and production of a wide range of marketing communications
• Providing support for marketing events and exhibitions
• Assisting in the collation of information for promotional and advertising literature
• Writing articles and promotional materials
• Preparing content for the website and social media
• Uploading marketing material to online libraries, internet groups and social media sites
• Updating and maintaining the marketing department's documentation and databases
• Managing events, booking venues and ordering marketing materials
• Other duties may be assigned as business needs require

Skills
Graphic Design, Web Design, Layout, Illustration, Marketing, Desktop Publishing, Internet and Mobile Applications Experience, Negotiation, Team Player, Flexible in a Fast-Paced Environment, Time Management, Self-Motivation, Collaborative Excellence, Extreme Attention to Detail, Project Management, Patience, Positive Attitude, High Work Ethic, Task Focus, Oral and Written Communication, Analysis, Reading, Customer Service, Organization, Math Aptitude, Planning, Professionalism, Proofreading

High proficiency in Adobe PhotoShop, Illustrator, or similar platforms preferred. Experienced in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.) and CMS software also preferred. General knowledge of Social Media strategy and tactics required. Experience in digital advertising and marketing communications is preferred at all.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Job Description
We’re looking for a full-time Marketing/Project Coordinator with a dedicated focus on Marketing and Customer results to join our growing advertising and marketing agency in Simi Valley. Please DO NOT apply if you aren't assertive to get the job/task done, if you don't like a fast-paced environment, and/or daily/hourly/minute-by-minute change bothers you.

The best candidates are highly motivated, results orientated, must be able to work with Excel (formulas, budgets, ROI reports), Word (creating proposals, contracts, or letters), Google Drive (must be comfortable with navigating around Google), be a critical thinker, comfortable navigating the new digital world, able to write in business language when sending emails or working on social media campaigns, be resourceful at all times, and thrives in an environment that is fast paced and where no two days are alike.

You will work closely with the Ops, Video, Radio, Digital and Creative teams to create and manage projects/campaigns that assist with the clients' overall marketing goals. You will also be working with vendors to obtain the best rates for the clients' marketing campaigns. We're hiring the right individual not based solely on their skills but on their ability to learn, heart to serve the company, and heart to serve the clients.

Light travel may be required to visit clients.

Skills and Responsibilities
Develop clients marketing budgets, track leads, jobs and sales numbers as well as compiling reports for management showing results (ROI)
Comfortable working in Excel, must be comfortable with formulas and budgets
Research, maintain and report on marketing data to aid management in determining marketing direction
Monitor and manage clients radio, TV and print spot schedule
Create Digital campaigns to generate leads
Assist in creating materials used for proposals, correspondence and presentation materials and reports
Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time
Ensure all projects are moving along seamlessly through the work process from start to completion
Track and prioritize project timelines and ensuring quality standards are met and have a knack for handling multiple deadlines
Have a great attitude – equally happy and excited to take on tedious tasks in addition to large projects
Proven track record of going above and beyond in previous roles to take on new responsibilities for the betterment of the team

Company Description
Founded in 2013, we are a passionate full-service advertising agency. Our slogan is "Passionately Pursuing our Clients Success" which is more than a slogan, it truly is a way of life. We've adopted the Aloha Spirit because it is the coordination of mind and heart within each person. It brings each person to self. This requires personal desire, passion and self-awareness. Our teams are the best in the industry so we're always looking for passionate talent to join our team. We want each team member to WANT to work at lilikoi agency not have to. We're looking for people who are passionate about their skills, love to go above and beyond for our clients, and what they can contribute for the betterment of the team!

Our Core Values

LOVE
Without love, we have nothing. We LOVE each other, our clients, and our work. Our team models that love through a deep BELIEF, HOPE and TRUST in one another. We strive to care more for others than ourselves. This requires patience, humility, kindness, gentleness, and the will to never give up.

OHANA
Our Ohana is connected through a genuine compassion and love for each other and our clients. We are a close and diverse community bound by loyalty and support. We feel that everyone should know the comfort, joy and peace of being part of an OHANA.

PASSION
Passion demands more from us than is simply required. We exemplify passion when we give our whole heart, soul, mind and strength to our team and our clients.

TRUTH
Together, we are committed to stand firm in TRUTH. We will remain diligent to always communicate truth to each other regardless of the circumstances. Untruth is driven by fear. We will not be afraid to tell the truth to each other, to our clients or in our advertising.

REMARKABLE
We want to be remarkable in everything we do. We want our team, our clients and our work to be worthy of a remark. We strive to deliver remarkable results.

Video Editor

Job Summary:

WAC seeks an experienced Video Editor who is passionate about the craft of filmmaking and can work closely with the Design and Marketing teams to produce compelling video content across all channels. Ideal candidates are innovative, curious, self-motivated, can work both independently and collaboratively, and enjoy a fast-paced environment with tight deadlines and fast turn-around times. Our in-house Design team is responsible for a range of content – from WAC’s brand voice and messaging, to product and packaging design for each of our products.

Major Duties and Responsibilities:
Edit a variety of video marketing and social assets with a keen eye towards storytelling and consistency of brand voice and visual style
Audio mixing and color correction/grading
Work collaboratively with Design Director to take projects from conception to completion
Prepare content to spec for a variety of digital distribution channels in a variety of crops and aspect ratios.
Quality assurance and attention to detail in creating and reviewing work
Assisting with video production and post-production as needed
Organize and track assets with digital-asset-management best practices in a shared workflow environment
Skills and Qualifications:
5+ years’ experience in non-linear digital video editing, preferably in beauty, fashion, or a similar innovative, high-energy field
Expert knowledge of Adobe Premiere and Adobe after Effects and experience with the full Creative Cloud suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Media Encoder, etc.)
Advanced knowledge of web video standards and codecs
BS in Filmmaking, Digital Video Production or similar degree/real-world experience
Benefits:

We recognize people as our most valuable asset. Our competitive salary and benefits package includes: paid time off; medical & dental coverage (including family coverage), vision, 401(k), tuition assistance, and continuous training and development.

About WAC Lighting:

Celebrating over 35 years of business and significant growth, WAC strives to be the most recognized and respected lighting fixtures company in the industry. We offer innovative and quality products and provide extraordinary customer service. We are an entrepreneurial company offering excellent career and growth opportunities. For more information, visit our Web site, www.waclighting.com

Sustainability:

We strive every day to develop sustainable lighting by maximizing the aesthetic quality of today’s interior environment while minimizing the impact on our world’s precious natural environment. To achieve this goal, we are developing luminaries that deliver the finest quality of light with the most energy efficient lamping and optic technology available. We acknowledge our responsibility to raise the standards for how lighting quality is provided.

For immediate consideration, please e-mail your resume to: hr@ waclighting.com Given the high volume of responses, only qualified candidates will be contacted. WAC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/D/V encouraged to apply.

Job Description

2+ years of experience in Marketing

Do you want to be a part of an award-winning team? Digital Resource is continually looking for Digital Marketing Interns to create awesome content, learn the ropes of agency life, and walk out into the industry ready to rock-and-roll. Think youve got what it takes?

About Digital Resource

Digital Resource is a full-service digital marketing agency based in West Palm Beach, FL! We partner with forward-thinking businesses to create custom internet marketing strategies. Our solutions have a proven track record in increasing search engine rankings, building social followings, and most importantly, converting leads into real revenue.

Digital Resource is proud to be an award-winning agency:

· Two-time Inc. 500-ranked company (#262 in 2018; #334 in 2019)

· Great Place to Work Certified

· Entrepreneur Magazines 49th Most-Entrepreneurial Company in America

· South Florida Business Journal #1 Fastest-Growing Company (Under $25 mil)

· The Best of Small Business Awards Best SEO Company & Best Workplace

Qualifications

· Currently pursuing a degree in Marketing, English, Journalism, or a related area of study

· Strong communication & writing skills

· Ability to work independently

· Fast typing speed

· Great research skills

· Strong organizational skills

· Self-motivated and eager to take on responsibilities

· An interest in marketing

Your Role

As a Content Marketing Intern, youll play an important role in the creation of various types of content. Your day-to-day will include:

· Writing blogs for Digital Resource

· Research current industry trends & news for blogs

· Research statistics for infographics & video scripts

· Re-optimizing existing content for search engine optimization

· Assist Content team with creating editorial calendar

· Assist with the creation of Digital Resource marketing collateral

· Collaborate with various teams for content creation

· Uploading optimized content to Digital Resource

· Assisting Content team with client content creation

What Youll Gain

An internship at Digital Resource isnt coffee runs and boring desk work. Were proud to have our interns be an active part of our company culture (wait til you see our prize wheel)! As an intern, youll have the opportunity to gain writing clips and valuable marketing agency experience. Youll work hands-on with our Content and various other teams from conceptualization to execution. Our goal is to ensure you leave our internship program, feeling confident in your knowledge as a budding marketer!

Requirements
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Ability to multitask, accurate, and consistent attention to detail.
Excellent writing, editing (photo/video/text), and communication skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and maintain effective working relationships with highly motivated co-workers.

Job Title:SharePoint Site Content Manager

Location:Scott Air Force Base, Illinois

Clearance Level: Secret Clearance

Summary:

SecuriGence is looking for a SharePoint Developer and Content Administrator to redesign, migrate and sustain United States Transportation Command (USTRANSCOM) SharePoint collaborative environment. Additionally, the candidate will be responsible to take advantage of the full scope of SharePoint built-in capabilities, especially in the area of content design. The candidate will be responsible for design, install, upgrade and performance monitoring of Microsoft SharePoint and its interface capabilities with other applications as needed; to include migration planning and execution.

Duties:
Analyzing business requirements and application objectives relating to SharePoint 2013
Developing, customizing, enhancing and sustaining SharePoint applications and sites
Maintaining and administering rights and permissions for site collection administrator, site owners and content managers
Engaging clients and vendors to gather requirements and troubleshoot work issues
Providing technical advice on requirements documentation and test planning as required
Configuring and administrating service applications, and managing disk usage across the site collection, and performing maintenance activities
Providing training on the use and application of SharePoint
Migrate data from existing SharePoint sites to DISA DEPS site
Required Skills and Experience:

Experience using JavaScript (including JQuerry), CSS3 (includes Bootstrap and W3.css), HTML5, C#, .Net, SharePoint JavaScript Object Model (JSOM) or Client-Side Object Model (CSOM), ASPX, REST SharePoint Designer 2013 and overall front-end web design

Education and Certifications:
Professional certifications (i.e. MCSD: SharePoint Application, or MCSE: SharePoint certification) desired
Requires US Government Secret clearance
Bachelor's Degree is highly desired and a minimum of five (5) years of relevant SharePoint experience.
About

SecuriGence LLC (SG) is an agile, HUBZone Certified Veteran-owned small business headquartered in the Washington, DC metropolitan region. Established in April 2010 we have been supporting the Department of Defense and other United States Civil agencies in Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, Software Development, Cyber Security, and Cloud/Virtualization Management.

Marketing Intern:

You will work closely with our Marketing Associate and President to learn all aspects of our existing marketing activities, including Social Media, content creation/curation, website design/SEO, video creation/promotion, advertising, etc. As you progress throughout the internship, you will become increasingly independent and will be tasked with important projects to expand or improve our marketing program in addition to offering your own creative ideas to improve the overall marketing for the firm.

Requirements:

Rising Junior or Senior at a 4-year institution preferred. Technologically savvy and competent in all aspects of graphic design. The ideal candidate will be creative, driven, and a self-starter, with a desire to learn and grow professionally throughout the internship. Additionally, the ideal candidate will have artistic flair but will desire to "get their hands dirty" with the actual design and implementation of all aspects of our marketing life-cycle. A good understanding of Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop & In-design a must, be familiar with Illustrator, and willing to learn Premiere Pro and After-effects) is preferred.

Why choose us?

At rebel Financial we "rebel" against the traditional mold for financial firms, committing ourselves to financial/investment excellence, and putting "people before profits." We offer a small business environment with a hands-on learning experience that will help you to grow your career professionally. We are on the cutting-edge of industry technology, work with some of the best financial, investment, and tax planning programs, while maintaining our focus as a values-driven social enterprise. We need motivated young creative professionals to help spread the word of how we can help people achieve their financial potential.

We are passionate about moving people forward at TWO MEN AND A TRUCK®! We are growing and so is our marketing team. The Marketing Coordinator is responsible for implementing and overseeing the marketing plans for several TWO MEN AND A TRUCK® locations in the Atlanta metro area with the ultimate goal of growing revenue and increasing market reach. This position will be mainly based out of Tucker, GA, and will support a large territory that reaches from Gainesville, GA to Newnan, GA.

What We Offer
Salary range: $30,000 - $35,000 (DOE) with bonus potential
Paid time off
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Career advancement opportunities
What You'll Do

Marketing Responsibilities
Assess marketing opportunities and new target markets
Execute marketing initiatives
Track and evaluate lead sources through various tools
Track and report impact of all marketing initiatives; measures return on investment
Coordinate bi-annual competitor mystery shop
Assist with external customer service on-line communication including reviews
Community Outreach/PR /Networking
Maintain relationships with our list of charity partners, documents and coordinate donation requests and community involvement; document any resulting PR
Develop a PR calendar and seeks new PR opportunities
Develop, distribute and track all media releases
Coordinate and attend networking events
Initiate and develop relationships with apartment and senior communities, local realtors, mortgage agencies, and other potential commercial customers
Represent the brand at trade shows, events and chamber marketing opportunities
Social Media Management
Develop social media content and calendar
Monitor social conversations
Create social media ads
Report social analytics to Marketing Director
Grow social media followers through quality-driven, meaningful content appropriate for our audience
Other duties as assigned by Marketing Director

What We're Looking For

Because moving is stressful, we seek candidates with a commitment to customer service and an appreciation for variety in your job.
Bachelors Degree in Communications, Business, or related field is preferred but not required
A minimum of two years of related experience, customer service or sales experience is preferred
Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within the Marketing field
Highly creative and motivated
Ability to work independently
Friendly, professional personality
Exceptional oral and written communication skills; comfortable with public speaking
Excellent organizational skills; must be able to multi-task under time constraints
Must be proficient with Microsoft Office applications
Must have a command of social media platforms
Willing to submit to a pre-employment background check and regular drug screens
Must be available to work evenings and weekends on occasion
Work is performed in an office setting with no unusual hazards. The ability to work from offices in Tucker, Fayetteville, and Lawrenceville, GA is necessary.
The qualifications listed above are intended to represent the minimal skills and experience levels associated with performing the duties and responsibilities contained in this job description. The qualifications should not be viewed as absolute standards, but as general guidelines that should be considered with other job-related criteria.
Competitors: All My Sons Moving & Storage, Gentle Giant Moving Company, Atlas Van Lines

Job Description
Reporting to a the CMO, this role will be crucial in helping to drive the creation of strategic messaging, product positioning, customer engagement, competitive differentiation, persona development and content creation.
Product Positioning and Messaging – Own the relationship between the product team and marketing to communicate product updates and changes to customers, prospects, and employees and manage creating, retiring, and updating required marketing materials.
Work with sales and product management to develop and update market-ready messaging that demonstrates thought leadership, articulates our competitive differentiators, current and near-term product capabilities for TimeTrade. Communicate product roadmaps to the sales organization along with competitive positioning and key messages.
Support go-to-market strategy and planning that includes pricing, packaging, and feature delivery across a 12-18 month roadmap.
Run point on product related content strategy including white papers, webinars, event content/presentations, website and social content, video and often serve as editor to other key functional groups like product and corporate communications
Drive the competitive research strategy and execution including compiling, analyzing and distilling competitive information
Make sure the website always reflects up to date product functionality and positioning. Create website content that draws prospect interest and leads them to convert to leads and ultimately customers
Assist in creating materials to support the Sales team
Own customer marketing programs and strategy delivering webinars, product updates, industry information, best practices and thought leadership materials focused on driving retention, referencibility and upsell.
Own customer story development to produce marketable customer quotes
Customer Evangelism – Own customer relationship marketing to develop customer stories, case studies, quotes and references to strengthen our customer relationships and create engaging collateral our sales team can use to strengthen our successful customer experiences.
Managing and Measuring Work - Structure customer marketing programs so that benchmarks can be set and results achieved. Recommend and implement measurement methodologies and analyze program performance on an ongoing basis to ensure continual improvement.
Resource Management - Closely manage product marketing vendors to ensure quality support and execution of programs within timelines and budget.

Skills & Requirements
5-8 years of experience in Product Marketing, Product Management or Sales for a software company
Proven success in complex, solution-oriented market development
"Roll-up-your-sleeves" entrepreneurial attitude
Creative fountain of ideas to drive the business forward, both strategic and tactical
Exceptional writing and communication skillsExperience building impactful marketing collateral and informational content including; whitepapers; interactive product demos; webinars; and web video for content marketing programs
Ability to ‘ask the right questions’ to help shape message and product direction
Natural ability to relate to customers and prospects
Superb collaborator with proven ability to work with cross functional team
Extremely self-motivated and also able to help organize and motivate others

From the 1st day, the Marketing Coordinator will contribute to existing marketing programs, while assisting with the development of new marketing initiatives aligned with company goals. The marketing coordinator must be an organized multitasker able to handle many diverse projects at once and meet tight deadlines. Role Summary:As Mobile Insights Analyst at Sensor Tower, you will drive the creation and publication of customer-facing research into the global app ecosystem. Leveraging our wealth of quantitative data on mobile apps, you will identify emerging trends and opportunities within the market, crafting reports, analyses, and other content based on your findings.The ultimate responsibility for this position will be to provide our customers with meaningful, actionable insights to drive their business growth. This is the ideal position for an analyst who seeks to work with large and extensive datasets in an exciting, rapidly growing, and ever-evolving market.Here is a slide deck that showcases the type of work you will be doing as a Mobile Insights Analyst.A Day in the Life: Jonathan Briskman - Mobile Insights Analyst (SF)What made you want to work at Sensor Tower?I was interested in Sensor Tower because of the culture. It was immediately clear to me that I'd enjoy working with such wonderful people every day. In addition to that, the possibility of having ownership for my own work and the freedom to explore what interested me was incredibly appealing.What does your day to day look like working as a Mobile Insights Analyst?My day to day is a healthy balance between working on long-term projects and assisting the team with more urgent requests. About half of my time is spent creating reports covering some of the most interesting topics in mobile. This includes everything from the initial planning and research, to pulling the data and creating charts. The rest of my time is spent assisting the team on quicker projects. For example, I'll write scripts to pull data for blog posts or press requests.What do you like about working on the Mobile Insights team?We have a diverse set of backgrounds which allows us to lean on each other's strengths. This not only lets us do better work, but helps us all learn from each other and improve at different aspects of our jobs.What is something you've learned while working at Sensor Tower?My role as Mobile Insights Analyst has given me the opportunity to work with every single team at Sensor Tower and I've learned so much about how different teams work and provide value to a business. This has helped me broaden my view of a business and provide value beyond what I was able to with my more limited perspective as a data analyst.Requirements* Bachelor's degree or above in economics, mathematics, statistics, computer science or other field with strong statistical basis* 2+ years applied experience in business intelligence, data mining, analytics, or statistical modeling* A passion for data analysis and presentation of data insights* Practical knowledge and familiarity with querying data from databases (SQL, MongoDB, etc.)* Knowledge of statistical analysis tool sets, coding languages, and techniques (R, Java, Ruby, Python, etc.)* Strong proficiency with one or more statistical visualization or graphing toolkits (MS Excel, Tableau, etc.)* Ability to grasp the concepts of complex products and use cases to investigate, model, and present them (Powerpoint, Keynote, etc.)* Ability to communicate effectively with both technical developers and non-technical marketing business partners* Self-starting attitude, strong written and verbal communication skills and an attention to detailResponsibilities* Analyze large, extensive data sets to collect insights for external facing content* Work with Sr. Mobile Insights Analyst to create roadmap of external facing report-format content* Collaborate with Mobile Insights Strategists to support their content creation by helping define methodology, performing analyses, and answering unconventional questions using data* Build and maintain an array of queries to aid in automating recurring analyses and optimizing complicated data pulls* Create clear, compelling, and illuminating data visualizations for use both internally and in external-facing content such as reports and blog posts* Research and Job Description
Miranda CompaniesinPort St Lucie, FLis seeking to hire afull-time Marketing Coordinatorto help us improve our customer service and marketing campaigns. Are you a creative self-starter with a passion for learning and knack for social media? Do you enjoy having variety in your job? Can you effectively switch between tasks? Are you looking for a company that will value you? If so, read on!

We pay our Marketing Coordinator acompetitive wagebased on experience. We also offer generous benefits includingmedical, vision, dental, paid holidays, and paid vacation. Our team also enjoys acasual work environment. If this sounds like the opportunity that you've been searching for, apply today!

ABOUT MIRANDA COMPANIES

Our company is committed to providing our customers with quality dependable, honest service at affordable costs when it comes to home and office service in south Florida. Family owned and operated since 1981 under the original ownership, Miranda has set the standard in how service and installations get done to perfection, the first time. Our company is certified and fully licensed in plumbing, air conditioning, electrical and leak detection and repair. Our technicians have been drug tested, screened and properly trained. Training is ongoing and includes technical skills, manufacturer lead training, and how to respectfully treat customers in their homes and businesses. We stand by a tradition of making our customers happy by showing up on time, respecting homes and businesses and providing an up-front price after diagnosis.

In addition to internal and external continuing education, we provide our team members withexcellent pay, fantastic benefits, and a team-oriented work atmosphere where success is the norm!

A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A MARKETING COORDINATOR

As a Marketing Coordinator, you arrive at the office each day ready to get back to your projects. In this position to love that you have the opportunity to wear multiple hats to help grow our business. You engage your creative and out-of-the-box thinking as you develop social media and email marketing strategies to advance our brand and drive lead generation. Your excellent project management, research, and data analysis skills aid you in your success.

In addition to being part of our marketing team, you have the opportunity to improve our customer service efforts. You follow up with our clients over the phone to learn more about their experience with us. By collecting client reviews, you are able to see where we can improve in our customer service efforts and where we are excelling! You love that you get to engage both your analytical and creative sides in your work and get great satisfaction out of playing a key role in our company's success!

QUALIFICATIONS
Social media and marketing skills
Photoshop or other photo editing software experience
Proficiency in Microsoft Office
Experience with WordPress, Microsoft CRM, and Google Analytics
Ability to resize photos and utilize template software programs
Ability to pass a background check
Do you have an entrepreneurial spirit? Are you attentive to detail and organized? Do you have strong written and verbal communication skills? Is customer service important to you? Can you work quickly and independently? Are you able to juggle multiple projects at once in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment? If so, you may be the perfect social media maven for this position!

WORK SCHEDULE

The typical schedule for this position isMonday-Friday.

About Us


Simon Data was founded in 2015 by a team of successful serial entrepreneurs. We are an enterprise customer data platform that empowers marketers to create personalized data-driven experiences for the customers. We're scrappy problem solvers who believe in tackling big challenges with disruptive thinking and giving our customers the support they need to deliver great next-generation experiences at scale.

Simon Data is a data-first customer experience orchestration platform, designed to disrupt the marketing technology and marketing cloud category. Simon's platform empowers businesses to use enterprise-scale data and machine learning to power customer communications across every channel. Our unique approach allows brands to develop one-to-one relationships with their customers without building a bespoke in-house data infrastructure.

At Simon, we firmly believe that business success starts and ends with people. We all do our best work when we are surrounded by other friendly top performers who want to succeed together. This attitude is core to our values. When you trust your team, invest in their development, and give them ownership, great things happen.

The Role


We are looking for someone to own and develop content marketing strategy that increases our brand awareness, elevates our positioning, and improves sales effectiveness. If you are a person that believes that phenomenal content has the power to transform a business from the top of the funnel down, this is the role for you! You'll be a part of everything from brainstorming with industry specialists to working with our executive team to build top-quality thought leadership.

This will be an exciting opportunity to help shape and bolster Simon Data's position in the industry. This role has wide-reaching goals that will benefit several cross-functional groups. To that end, success will be visible both internally and externally. You will report directly to the Head of Marketing and collaborate with the friendly, encouraging, and whip-smart team at Simon.

What You'll Do
Create and maintain content marketing calendar based on both external market and internal partner input. Facilitate partner consensus on a regular basis.
Own and execute content production process: from idea, to outlinefrom feedback rounds to coordinating on-brand final design
Be responsible for crafting compelling content that drives MCLs, supports nurture strategy, and supports our market positioning
Manage content production relationships where applicable (e.g. freelance writers, team contributors)
Maintain and nurture press relationships as well as proactively seek new opportunities
Support channel marketing efforts with content and strategic insights
Oversee organic strategy related to social media
Support SEO with content and enable our agency relationships with current content strategy and calendar
Ensure that our brand voice is consistently maintained and that we're always writing to delight our client personas
Occasional cross-functional content support
Qualifications
4-8 years experience in content creation, ideally for a high-growth, B2B company
Collaborative style when working across functions, partners, and vendor relationships
Demonstrated ability to drive top of funnel with content
Superior written and verbal communication skills
Ability to use engagement and performance analytics to adapt strategy and focus
Experience in SaaS and marketing tech space
Ability to join and thrive in dynamic conversations with diverse audiences: executives, client-facing conversations, etc.
Capacity to build high-quality content across multiple formats: webinars, guides, blog posts, long-form thought leadership, etc.
Ability to ensure consensus and utilization by the sales team
Visa sponsorship for this role is currently not available.

About Kavo Kerr

KaVo Kerr is a cohesive organization comprised of two global leaders, united to provide dental excellence and serve as a single premier partner for the dental community. About Envista

Envista is a global family of three companies and more than 30 trusted dental brands, united by a shared purpose: to partner with professionals to improve lives. Envista helps its customers deliver the best possible patient care through industry-leading dental consumables, solutions, technology, and services. Our comprehensive portfolio, including dental implants and treatment options, orthodontics, and digital imaging technologies, covers an estimated 90% of dentists' clinical needs for diagnosing, treating, and preventing dental conditions as well as improving the aesthetics of the human smile. Envista companies, including KaVo Kerr, Nobel Biocare Systems, and Ormco, partner with dental professionals to help them deliver the best possible patient care.

Envista separated from Danaher as an independent company in 2019. We brought with us the proven Envista Business System (EBS) methodology, an experienced leadership team, and a strong culture grounded in continuous improvement, commitment to innovation, and deep customer focus to meet the end-to-end needs of dental professionals worldwide. Envista is now one of the largest global dental products companies, with significant market positions in some of the most attractive segments of the dental products industry. Job Description
The Marketing Program Manager, Customer & Partner - works closely with the Product Marketing, Customer Success, Channel Sales, Digital Marketing, Freelance writers/designers and Business Development teams to deliver fully, integrated programs that drive existing customer engagement and business. In addition, this role provides marketing support for channel lead generation. The role is responsible for creating quarterly go-to market programs that include product upsell/cross-sell, new product launches and channel marketing plans. In addition, project managing content and creative requests required for any current customer or channel marketing program are key aspects of the role.

Responsibilities

· Meet with Customer Success, Channel Sales & Product Marketing to determine market themes for go-to market lead gen efforts, quarterly.

· Receive Product Marketing approval/sign off for new thought leadership materials created

· Develop, implement and manage tactical marketing activities needed to maximize lead gen efforts to hit MQCL goals (IE: creation of webinars, email/Landing Page, email execution, SEM/digital ad creation, content syndication management, podcast producing, social posts, ebook/WP/blog/infographic creation for all stages of buying cycle)

· Once launched, ensure on-going campaign optimization, reporting and analysis are continuously reviewed to gauge success

· Work closely with business development team and/or customer success to ensure customer talk tracks align with GTM messages and attend weekly stand-up calls to provide customer & partner engagement and lead gen update

· Ensure leads are processed correctly into our marketing automation platform and CRM with support from Marketing Operations consultants (IE: create campaign, run quality spot-testing to ensure lead routing works and KPIT reporting for tracking)

· Work with vendors, such as outside adverting agencies & digital partners on a program basis to maximize retargeting/engagement/customer lead gen efforts (IE: Bayshore, Turn) to ensure timely, cost effective execution.

· Manage any customer or partner specific sponsorship schedule including working with internal partners on upcoming sponsorship activity, fulfilling logistical requests and updating internal stakeholders with recent activity metrics.

· Keep up-to-date on regulations and accepts ownership on complying with regulatory requirements.

· Exhibit a passion for customers focused on enhancing relationships, exhibiting high standards of performance and teamwork.

· Be a champion of meeting both internal and external customer needs.

· Support an environment that promotes positive communication and respect.

· Willing to travel up to 20% domestically and internationally to organize events as needed, may include travel on some evenings, weekends, and holidays.

Knowledge, Experience and Technical Skills

· Demonstrated success working with an adverting agency, development and implementation of marketing plans, market assessments, sales strategies, competitive analysis, product launches and MQCL forecasting.

· Highly effective analytical, financial, problem solving and judgment skills.

· Must have strong verbal and written communications skills as well as effective presentation skills.

· Proven ability to meet deadlines, work independently, be detail oriented, extremely organized, and a problem solver.

· Highly organized and process driven individual able to multitask and coordinate many simultaneous projects.

· Strong team player who communicates effectively and thinks creatively.

· Work independently and within the team environment.

· Demonstrated ability to lead and motive others with realistic goals, prioritized to meet business objectives.

· Ability to work in a fast paced environment, with multiple and changing priorities while maintaining strong focus on execution and results.

· Adept at handling multiple complex projects simultaneously under pressure to meet tight deadlines

Education and/or Experience

· Bachelor’s Degree, Marketing, Business, English or other related field

· A minimum of 3-5 years related experience in marketing ideal

· Experience with marketing automation platforms and CRM/Salesforce.com

· Experience working in partnership with an outside advertising agency

Spirion is the leading provider of enterprise data management software to help businesses reduce their sensitive data footprint and proactively minimize the risks, costs and reputational damage of successful cyberattacks. Spirion helps organizations avoid costly data breaches by discovering, classifying, monitoring and protecting personal information, medical records, credit card numbers and intellectual property stored across the enterprise, within email, and in the cloud. MedBridge was recently awarded in the 2019 Tech Impact Awards as well as Seattle Magazine's 2018 Leaders in Health Care Awards. We were also named one of the Top 25 Seattle Companies in 2019 by Inc. 5000.

Our mission at MedBridge is to improve the lives of patients, medical providers, and the quality of healthcare globally. We are developing a single, innovative platform that combines impactful clinical education content, patient engagement tools, and practice success tools. We are a team of passionate, resourceful and collaborative individuals at the intersection of online education and healthcare. We truly care about the quality of our product - we love new ideas and build new products that make a difference in peoples lives. As a fast-growing company, we work hard, but we have a great time doing it. If that sounds like you, come help us help others!

As the Accreditation and Content Manager you are responsible for ensuring MedBridge is developing premier quality education that solves the top challenges for our clients. Within the role, you will oversee the execution of highly impactful accredited CE content.

The position will require you to work closely with the content team, stakeholders across the company, and clients to ensure we are effectively addressing content needs of our existing and growing client set. We are looking for a highly motivated over-achiever who flourishes in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. The role will incorporate the following accountabilities:

Leadership:
Lead and manage the accreditation team.
Lead cross-team initiatives and projects to ensure high-quality and timely execution.
Establish and track metrics and KPIs for MedBrides CE library.
Actively participate in leadership meetings and ensure strategic initiatives are carried through and executed by the team.
Accreditation:
Enhance processes to ensure MedBridge is exceeding accreditation standards.
Understand regulatory and license requirements of our clients, and be able to incorporate that into our content design process.
Consistently review content development processes for opportunities to improve educational quality of offerings.
Identify opportunities for efficiency/improvement and be able to execute necessary process change.
Be an active participant in maintaining accreditation for national and state boards.
Track accreditation metrics and KPIs
Operations:
Lead process-improvement initiatives to drive increased efficiency and quality across content development.
Refine processes and reduce inefficiencies in process from content roadmapping to filming to ensure optimal learning outcomes and engagement.
Establish and enforce data standards for entry into internal databases and website.
Education Design / Innovation: Partner with the Director of Education and Production to:
Ensure adult learning principles are incorporated into all content.
Track quality outcomes of courses and identify opportunities for efficiency.
Develop instructional methodologies for new content types
About You:
Proven track record of managing complex projects with many moving parts.
Ability to create document and develop processes to scale workflows.
Possess the ability to see the big picture of a project and effectively communicate each detail to essential team members
Attention to detail and quality
A team-oriented mindset and the ability to work with a wide range of individuals.
A willingness to roll up your sleeves to get the job done while not losing sight of the end goal, both during self-managed projects and when working in a team.
An ability to hit the ground sprinting in a fast-paced environment where continuous innovation is required.
Exceptional at managing your own time, being organized, and staying positive.
Bachelor's degree is required.
3+ years of management experience
5+ years experience in accreditation, education development, content operations.
Our Culture:

Were passionate about building products that improve the quality of life for patients - providing clinicians with the highest quality educational content and tools, on an innovative learning platform;

We believe collaboration is crucial to speedy execution and value in-person interactions across roles;

We move fast and are scrappy, ruthlessly prioritizing to test and deliver new products, features and services for our customers;

Were bootstrapped and proud of it; our success and continued growth are driven by products that customers love and actually pay us for;

We enjoy each other's company - whether at work or company sponsored events, we have fun;

We value our employees, offering 100% employee coverage for medical, dental and vision insurance and a 401(k) program with 50% company matching, up to 2%;

We believe in continued personal growth, offering 2 paid days and an allowance for the professional development of your choice.

Our team is a group of motivated individuals who love to innovate our product and increase its reach within the healthcare community. We're moving extremely fast, and every day offers the chance to learn and grow professionally with a fun group of colleagues.

As a Senior Software andSystems Development Engineer...

Are able to obtain a Secret clearance by your start date and can ultimately obtain a Top Secret clearance. If selected, you will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet the requirements for access to classified information. Eligibility requirements include U.S. citizenship.

Have a Master's degree in Physics, Engineering, or Computer Science.
Have experience with Windows-based development, simulation interoperability protocols (e.g., HLA), mission-level simulations (e.g., JSAF), physical dynamics and numerical methods, multi-threaded applications, GUI design, UML, OpenGL, and DirectX APIs, visualization, 3d object collision detection and resolution, virtual and augmented reality, and GIS systems.
Have augmented/Virtual Reality development experience with Oculus, Vive, or Hololens.
Are familiar or experience with software engineering tools such as Visual C , OpenSceneGraph, Microsoft.NET, MATLAB, Python, PHP, Windows, SQL, PERL, Unix, cross-platform knowledge, and MS Office.
Have knowledge of content creation tools such as Blender, Photoshop and experience with moblie app development.
Have experience with computer graphics, Advance Unix Programming, Computer Architecture, NVIDIA Cuda code, Optimization
Have Game Developer experience, simulation development, core engines, and an understanding of networking and cyber-security.

Company Overview
PURPLE

Purple exists to meaningfully improve lives through true innovation that evolves comfort from end to end. Our colorful company culture, award-winning marketing, unique (and extremely comfortable) technology, and incredible team make for a workplace you’ll be proud to be a part of. Purple is recognized as one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive companies in the comfort industry. We’re looking for amazing, motivated people who will help us improve lives and invent a better way for Purple. Come along for the ride!
Position Summary
SUMMARY:

As a UI Design Lead at Purple you’ll be joining us during an exciting time of reimagining our brand experience—how we evolve our look and feel to reflect our incredible growth and future opportunities. You will collaborate across the creative team of graphic designers, motion designers, copywriters, content creators, marketers, and leadership to define and drive the brand vision forward on all digital properties. In this role, you will work closely with our UX team to craft our visual brand identity on our digital properties through constant collaboration, iteration, and validation.



We look for and value patient and friendly individuals who are smart, kind, and brave. Curious people with a natural ability to learn quickly and develop points-of-view within a noisy and competitive category. Our team members value people over process, prioritizing effective and respectful collaboration. We look for proactive designers who can take and give direction, lead by example, and enjoy the thinking as much as the making.



RESPONSIBILITIES:
Ideate, concept, and design incredibly polished work that represents the Purple brand through storytelling, presentations, visual direction, prototypes, and everything in between
Translate brand identity standards including typography, photography, color etc., for our digital properties
Foster collaboration across teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities.
Propose concepts that elevate our digital brand experience and have the skillset to bring that to life
collaborating on the content creation to make a more compelling user experience on all digital properties
Work closely with the Creative Director and UX Director to align digital creative strategy to brand, seasonal promotions and product launches and efforts
Build and mentor a team of UI designers to support the growth of our business while actively working on your own projects
Understand and communicate the performance side of design, and also the business aspects of our products.
Directly impact our culture — bring your unique gifts and talents to add your point of view and perspective to our growing team
QUALIFICATIONS:
Hands on, roll up your sleeves, with a positive, unflappable attitude
An exceptional portfolio that reflects a foundation of design principles and awareness of current trends and how they translate to digital mediums
5 years minimum of solid UI design experience
3 years of experience in managing or leading design teams
High standards for craft
A unique point of view. You are trusted to question approaches, processes, and strategy to better serve the team to keep us fresh and distinct in a noisy, competitive industry
Thrives in an environment where ambiguity is part of the norm
Expertise with latest design software including Figma and Adobe CC
Experience working across organizational boundaries to define, manage, and prioritize work, with a collaborative and innovative approach.
Demonstrated ability to communicate complex concepts clearly across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
BENEFITS AND PERKS:
Medical, Dental, Vision
401(k) Match
Generous PTO
Market Money
Earn a Mattress
Purple Swag
Amazing Purple Products
WHY WORK AT PURPLE?
Make your mark: We value innovative thinking. At Purple, you will be empowered to bring your ideas to life as we work together to improve people’s lives through comfort.
Gain unique experience: Be a part of one of the fastest-growing companies in Utah! The contributions you make will matter at Purple as the company continues to grow with you.
Awesome culture: Join the tight-knit team at Purple and you can enjoy working alongside industry experts, making close friends, and annual employee appreciation events.

Quizlet’s mission is to help students (and their teachers) practice and master whatever they are learning. Every month more than 50 million active learners from 130 countries practice and master more than 300 million study sets on every conceivable topic and subject. We are developing new learning experiences by modeling how students learn and drawing upon knowledge acquisition, retention, and pedagogy in cognitive science. We are always seeking to help students master any subject by optimizing study efficiency and engagement.

As our SEO Manager on the growth team, you are responsible for leading every aspect of our SEO strategy, including programmatic content creation, page quality, and SEO hygiene. This includes working with our cross-functional SEO Pod to build and launch A/B tests to improve SEO performance, as well as managing a small team of SEO experts to conduct market research, drive keyword analysis, and inform our longer-term content strategy with a particular emphasis on international growth.
What you'll be doing:
You'll be responsible for setting, testing, and refining Quizlet’s SEO strategy, with a particular emphasis on growing SEO traffic in international markets
You’ll work with a cross-functional team including a PM, designer, analyst, and engineers to support our short- and long-term SEO roadmap
You’ll manage a team of external SEO consultants to review SEO performance, conduct market research and keyword analysis, and identify new opportunities
You'll work with our SEO PM to prioritize experiments that make it easier for teachers and students to find relevant study materials on via organic search
You'll collaborate with product, marketing, business development, design, engineering, and analytics to foster a growth mindset
You'll be the authority on SEO strategy at Quizlet, and make sure that every team is aware of how their roadmaps impact the company’s SEO performance

We'd love to hear form you if:
You have 5-10+ years of SEO experience, including managing SEO strategy for large-scale (1M+ MAUs) consumer web products on growth-oriented projects
Ideally, you have experience leading product-driven SEO efforts for companies with User Generated Content (UGC) platforms that operate internationally
You have strong quantitative skills, and enjoy applying them to your work through impact modeling and experiment analysis
You have experience running A/B tests specifically for SEO projects, and understand best practices for gathering accurate, actionable results
You are comfortable working on a cross-functional team in a fast-paced startup environment with imperfect information and limited resources
You are excited about bringing the magic of Quizlet to 1.4 billion students across the world, improving learning through low-cost online study tools


We hope you are excited about everything you read so far. We highly encourage you to apply for this position, even if you feel you do not meet all the requirements. Quizlet is always looking for amazing folks that believe in our mission and can contribute to our team in various ways - not merely candidates that fit a certain mold.

Quizlet's Team Culture

We are here to make education better and more accessible. We strive to improve the lives of students and teachers at every stage and in every setting. We have a bias for action, take initiative, and hustle to deliver results. We make informed decisions whenever possible but are unafraid to take calculated risks on great ideas to promote learning. We embrace challenges and see effort as the path to mastery. We’re constantly seeking opportunities to learn and we embrace curiosity. Quality matters at Quizlet, and we hold the bar high on everything we do. We sweat the details and take personal accountability and pride in anything that carries the Quizlet name. We speak up, jump in and work with each other to fix problems, and never say "that's not my job." We treat each other with honesty and respect, encourage vigorous debate, and seek critical feedback. We value diversity, humility, transparency, and collaboration as the best paths to our success — as individuals, as a team, and as a company.

Quizlet’s success as an online learning community depends on a strong commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. We are actively working to build a team that is representative of the diverse communities we serve, and an open, inclusive work environment where all employees can thrive. As an equal opportunity employer and a tech company committed to societal change, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ+ community, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. Come join us!

Apply

Overview


Enablement Facilitator – Content Designer

SUMMARY/OVERVIEW:

The Customer Enablement team is driving the Customer Enablement and Technical Training mission for Acoustic.

• Customer Enablement is focused on empowering users to maximize the value they derive from Acoustic solutions to drive software consumption and renewals. • Technical Training is focused on Acoustic employee and implementation business partner training around how to on-board, implement, integrate, and configure use cases within Acoustic solutions.

The Customer Enablement team is responsible for cross functional collaboration with Offering Management, Engineering, Support, Services, Client Success, Content Design, Marketing, and Sales for establishing content creation priorities, coordinating training for new product releases, and assuring consistent user experience.

This role will primarily be responsible for defining and managing enablement for a selected Acoustic product (or group of products), establishing a content creation frameworks & tools, designing/writing course content and certification criteria for users, sourcing and standardizing content from other Acoustic teams, publishing content to the Acoustic Academy, grading learners' assessments, and facilitating live training sessions.

Methods for training include how to videos and tutorials, textual guides and articles, self-paced online training, instructor led classes (both virtual and on-site), and other delivery mechanisms as needed.

The qualified candidate will work with management to determine appropriate training goals and will proactively coordinate ongoing maintenance of all training deliverables based on product roadmaps and received learners' feedback.

Responsibilities


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Develop working knowledge of selected Acoustic products and services.• Develop training plans using multiple methods of training delivery, including hands-on assessments for badges/certification.• Create and deliver industry-leading training (both online and in person) for business users and technical topics.• Manage training content, surveys, certification tests, and other assets hosted in the Learning Management System (Docebo).• Plan, configure, and manage training systems for hands-on exercises and assessments.• Meet or exceed the client’s expectations of knowledge, understanding and professionalism measured by Net Promoter Score, Customer Satisfaction and Customer Effort surveys.• Conduct needs analysis to determine the optimal scope as well as the best method of training delivery.• Proactively analyze learner’s feedback, revise and enhance online training deliverables. • Provide feedback and product enhancement ideas to Offering Management and Engineering.• Schedule and coordinate guest speakers for training classes and webinars as needed.• Facilitate online training sessions and deliver "live" instructor-led training programs.• Train the Trainer based on the created content.• Consistently deliver training materials on time and within budget.

Qualifications


QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:

• Experience designing and developing e-learning courses is required, including developing instructional storyboards, content, text guides, and digital editing for multimedia required.• Three (3) years in a similar training design and content creation role preferred.• Experience with MS Office applications, video production (Camtasia), and e-learning authoring applications (Adobe Captivate)• Experience with using Learning Management Systems as well as other solutions for training delivery (e.g. Udemy, YouTube)• Demonstrated ability to understand users' needs and create world class training using principles of instructional design and adult learning theory.• Consistent focus on monitoring the feedback and providing outstanding Customer Experience to learners.• Ability to work collaboratively and effectively with all levels of management and staff within the organization.• Patient, practical and adaptable with desire to grow and develop expertise in digital marketing and analytics.• Strong attention to detail and continuous focus on accuracy of produced deliverables.• Self-motivated, consistently learning new technologies and applying those concepts to customer’s needs.

EDUCATION, TRAINING AND TRAVEL:

• Four (4) year degree in related field or certification in Instructional Design or related field.• Full business proficiency in English (C1/C2), knowledge of additional major global language is a plus.• Ability to work as part of a geographically dispersed team.• Flexibility to accommodate meetings in different time zones, sometimes planned outside of the business hours – for delivering enablement sessions for learners located around the world, as well as communicating with team members. • Up to 10% travel.
