Assist with monitor and maintain records of all quality complaints/issues, as well as, company responses.
Create/maintain a database of all end user accounts drawn from rebates, show or phone leads including, but not limited to products purchased or samples
Responsibility for creating & maintaining all internal/external product specification files
Other related duties, as assigned
ATTENDANCE REQUIREMENTS
Must be regularly available and willing to work such hours per day as the employer determines are necessary or desirable to meet its business needs; Must be available and willing to travel to such locations and with such frequency as the employer determines is necessary to meet its business needs.
Requires flexibility of work schedule.
PRODUCT SAFETY:
Ensure that BRC GFSI standards are followed on a daily basis.
Communicate to Supervisor, QA Manager/Tech. about any problems that compromise BRC GFSI standards and any TBI policies and procedures.
SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:
Advance reading, writing and mathematics skills.
Ability to work collaboratively and communicate effectively with team members at all levels.
Requires a working knowledge of websites to perform all necessary updates and Social Media marketing
Ability to prioritize, identify problems, and seek solutions, as well as, follow up and follow through on set tasks.
Ability to write routine reports and correspondence.
Proficient Computer Skills: must be proficient in Microsoft software applications, including Outlook, Word, Excel.
EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE:
Some college or BA degree in marketing, sales, business administration.
General knowledge of website management and social media marketing

Job Description
The Opportunity

Reporting to the Vice President Marketing, the Marketing Coordinator will be assisting with implementation of a diverse range of marketing and administrative activities.

Working closely with internal staff, our agencies, and others you’ll be assuming a key role in coordinating effective implementation of TV and video production, digital marketing, internal communications, and other initiatives.

We’re looking for a high-energy problem solver that takes initiative–a multi-tasker who is highly proactive and organized–and maintains the highest quality work standards. Someone who thrives in a fast-paced and sometimes high-pressure environment.

Responsibilities
Project coordination for in-house creative and production projects: developing timelines, budgets, and maintaining regular status reports
Interacting with franchisees and local agencies–providing marketing support
Preparing and producing internal communications and presentations
Implementing company’s responses to customer reviews
Creating and posting social media content
Managing internal digital asset management portal—keeping current and functional
Coordinate new-store on-boarding activities
All other assignments per the VP Marketing and other marketing staff
Ideal Candidate Profile/Experience and Expertise
1-3 years experience in corporate marketing department or agency environment, with an emphasis in digital marketing
Project management experience with creative-oriented projects and interacting with outside agencies and vendors
Basic to intermediate skills with Apple applications (including Keynote and Pages) and MS Office
Low-level (or higher) graphic design skills would be of value

Company Description
Good Feet Worldwide (goodfeet.com) is the privately-owned global franchisor of The Good Feet Store. Based in Carlsbad CA (North San Diego County), we’re an established, fast growing, industry leader with 150 retail locations in 80+ US and international markets.

Job Description
As our Administrative & Marketing Coordinator, you will be responsible for running the administrative side of two synergistic businesses -- a law firm and a real estate sales team. You will also be tasked with shaping marketing plans, executing those initiatives, and efficiently using the data collected from those efforts.

We are looking for someone who has between one and four years of experience in operations and marketing at a small or medium sized business. Experience with the legal or real estate industry is preferred, but not required.

If you are interested in the position please send a brief email explaining why you are interested in the position, and providing an overview of at least one marketing campaign or operational overhaul you have successfully implemented to lee@bfklawoffice.com. Please also attach your resume.

Responsibilities
Act as the point of contact among partners, employees, clients and vendors.
Manage information flow in a timely and accurate manner.
Improve the operational systems, processes and policies in support of the organization's mission. Specifically, you will support better management reporting, information flow and management, business process, and organizational planning.
Assist with implementing the marketing vision of the companies. Monitor and improve upon company websites and other marketing channels to ensure that copy is consistent with the firm’s vision and core values. Work with partners to develop new marketing initiatives and install those initiatives.
Coordinate and oversee the completion of special projects as needed.
Prepare weekly team meeting agendas and materials.
Plan goals and objectives for office operations and identify the resources (i.e. staff, equipment, funds) required to attain optimal results.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree and 1-4 years of marketing and/or operations experience required.
Experience with CRM management and work flow organization and oversight.
Master at prioritizing work, tasks, projects, and relationships.
Experience with social marketing and/or email marketing campaigns.
Two weeks Vacation offered

Flexible worksite office locations between New York And Long Island.

Argo AI was founded to tackle one of the most challenging applications in computer science, robotics and artificial intelligence with self-driving vehicles. Argo AI is developing and deploying the latest advancements in artificial intelligence, machine learning and computer vision to help build safe and efficient self-driving vehicles that enable these transformations and more. The challenges are significant, but we are a team that believes in tackling hard, meaningful problems to improve the world.

We are building a high-performance team that is excited by complex engineering challenges and is passionate about making transportation safer, more affordable and accessible for all.

Argo AI is looking to expand our Simulation Engineering team! The Simulation Engineering team is responsible for building a highly scalable distributed platform for managing, running, and aggregating millions of simulation jobs per day. This is a big compute platform that will generate petabytes of data along and require web services to manage/status workloads.

What you'll do:
Be a part of building a virtual world to allow us to iterate quickly, test safely before getting to a car, and to get enough virtual miles to help build our safety case
Build 3D visualization tooling to enable engineers to monitor and analyze the performance of the autonomous vehicle in the simulated virtual world
Build scenario authoring tools to allow users to create and manage simulation scenarios
Integrate front end software with a scenario management system
What we're looking for:
Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Robotics or a related field
OpenGL experience is strongly desired, although experience with any real time rendering API is helpful
Qt (widgets and/or QML) experience is strongly desired
Web-based front-end architecture experience (e.g TypeScript, React, WebGL) is desired
Hands-on experience with GUI testing frameworks
Experience with modern design architectural patterns for user interfaces
Strong software skills (geometric algorithms and data structure)
Content creation skills (e.g. 3D modelling, vector graphics) are a plus
At Argo AI, we have a strong emphasis on creating a highly effective team environment. Thus, we seek candidates that can work effectively with others across a broad range of disciplines.

Argo AI is an equal opportunity employer that believes in diversity as a strength and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

We know it takes competitive benefits to fuel a team that works hard and enjoys the challenge. At Argo AI, you can expect stellar perks to support your best self:
High-quality individual and family health, dental, and vision insurance
Competitive compensation packages
Employer-matched 401(k) retirement plan
Paid parental leave
Unlimited vacation
Daily catered lunches and snacks
Free onsite or adjacent parking
Commuter reimbursement
Fitness reimbursement
Professional development reimbursement
Argo AI is a LinkedIn Top 50 Startup

Job Description
ATAK Interactive is a full-service creative agency looking to hire a Jr. Account Manager + Graphic Designer to join our growing agency. This is a full-time position for a versatile candidate that can manage clients, design ads + collateral, constantly produce new creative ideas, and energize our customers and team with a radiant energy. If you want to one day be a Creative Director, this is a position which will groom you well.

ABOUT THIS ROLE:

We are looking for a creative and energetic talent to add to our team. In this role, you will work closely with clients on designs, social media campaigns, videos, and other creative endeavors.

Joining ATAK Interactive is an opportunity to take real ownership of your career. We provide our team members with complete freedom to bring in new ideas and strategies to help our clients grow and promote within to our top performers.

If you're looking for a job to pay the bills while you figure out what you want to do long term, this is not for you. If you love marketing, feel under-utilized in your current role and want to bring your talents to a team that will allow you to implement your ideas and foster your leadership abilities, apply today.

THE IDEAL CANDIDATE:
Has at least 3 years graphic design experience
Has at least 3 years working with clients
Has agency experience
Prides themselves on their positive attitude + radiant energy. You know how to get others excited about what you're doing
Master of Adobe Suite, including XD
Can create engaging content via design, video, and photography
Churns out new ideas at a rapid rate and is enthusiastic about seeing those ideas through
Possesses a strong eye and creative direction
Writes clear, concise copy
Has an entrepreneurial spirit and be a self-starter
Must be able to work remote with a Los Angeles-based team
Excellent interpersonal skills, and independent work style
BONUS: Experience with B2B marketing, HubSpot, or LinkedIn Advertising

Company Description
When B2B companies need to outsource marketing, creative, and development resources to support their sales operation, ATAK provides unique and innovative tools that actually get results.

ATAK Interactive is a full-service creative agency. Our services include sales enablement, inbound marketing, account-based marketing, content creation, social media consulting and management, web + graphic design, SEO, ecommerce and web development, email marketing, paid digital marketing, and much more. We're a strong team that believe in one another and hope to find some like-minded candidates to help build on our success.

www.atakinteractive.com

DEPARTMENT:

Marketing

JOB TITLE:

Graphic Designer

CLASSIFICATION:

Non-Exempt

REPORTS TO:

Director of Marketing and Communications

JOB GOAL:

The role of the Graphic Designer is to create visually engaging and informative marketing materials that successfully engage and inform the intended target audiences. The graphic designer will be responsible for creation of new layouts as well as the adaptation of existing layouts for print, website, social media and presentations are expected. Other tasks include support and general production work related to projects within the PA Cyber Marketing and Communications department.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

· Bachelors Degree in multimedia or graphic design or related field

· Design firm or advertising agency work experience preferred

· Diploma or certified courses in design, film, social media, communications, etc. is a plus

· Minimum of one year design development experience including hands on content creation and implementation in all of the following areas: print design, web design, video development, social media content creation and PowerPoint presentation development

· Proficient in Microsoft Office suite

· Innovative, creative, and collaborative

· Proficiency using the Adobe Creative Suite products including InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat, After Effects and Premier knowledge of Dreamweaver is a plus

· Familiarity with the creation of click generating web ads, social media postings and general email marketing campaigns

· Excellent verbal and written communications skills

· Child Abuse Clearance; Pennsylvania State Police Criminal Record Check; Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) Clearance

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

· Utilize modern graphic design styles, to execute the strategies set forth by the Director of Marketing and Communication while maintaining brand integrity within each project.

· Create both static and motion visuals

· Develop and present visual storytelling through infographics

· Design for social media

· Utilize wireframes, storyboards, and prototypes for use in design review

· Conduct general user testing

· Work under pressure, meet deadlines, handle a variety of tasks simultaneously

· Apply results-oriented, design thinking methodology (empathize, define, ideate, prototype, test)

· Multi-task to complete projects in an organized and timely fashion using deadline-driven work ethic

· Conceptualize with internal clients to produce useful creative

· Attend meetings as requested

· Travel as required, must be able to travel

· Work extended hours as needed or requested

· Perform any additional duties deemed necessary to meet the ongoing needs of the organization by the Director of Marketing and Communications

PHYSICAL DEMANDS:

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, sit; use hands to handle or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

This job description is only a summary of the typical functions of the position, not an exhaustive or comprehensive list of all possible responsibilities, tasks, and duties. Additional duties may be assigned as necessary.
Competitors: K12, Agora Cyber Charter School, PA Leadership Charter School

Job Description:
Hotel Equities is an extraordinary lodging company which provides award-winning service, management, development, and consulting for hotels throughout the country. Hotel Equities provides third party management and consulting services for well-known national hotel brands. Currently, we are seeking someone to join our team as a Marketing Coordinator in Atlanta, GA.
Primary Functions of Position
Assists VP of Branding and Communications & Dir. of Marketing through implementation of the marketing and communications strategy.
Executes marketing and communications campaigns.
Maintains HE brand usage and company wide adherence to brand guidelines.
Tracking effectiveness of marketing and communication campaigns.
Executes Hotel Equities’ social media strategy on all platforms, i.e. Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, Google Business, etc., and maintains company website.
Content creation and editing.
Collaborate with BD Coordinator on client gift program.
Works with Marketing Manager to regularly update company marketing materials as it relates to design freshness and accuracy of information.
Draft press releases as needed and in accordance with HE and/or franchisee’s brand standards.
Compiles content and works with graphic designer to create quarterly newsletter.
Tracks marketing and communications expenses to assist in budgeting process.
Maintains promotional materials by coordinating requirements with graphics department; inventorying stock; placing orders; verifying receipt.
Be a resource to field staff by familiarizing yourself with brand product and guideline knowledge.
Researches competitive tools by identifying and evaluating product characteristics, pricing.
Coordinate meetings, conferences and trade show events by identifying, assembling, and coordinating requirements; establishing contacts and assignments; coordinating mailing lists.
Accomplishes organization goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing requests above and beyond normal job duties.
Exploring opportunities to add value.
Assists in coordinating philanthropic events
Special projects and event planning as needed.

2 or 4 yr. College degree required
Hospitality experience preferred
Specific Job Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Marketing, Coordination, Project Management, Understanding the Customer, Process Improvement, Initiative, Planning, Financial Skills, Graphic Design, Editing, Writing or Journalism/Public Relations experience
This job description is not an “all-inclusive’ list of the duties and responsibilities of this position or of the skills and
abilities required to perform this position

About Us

Carlyle Financial is a boutique mortgage lender offering a comprehensive suite of common-sense jumbo home loan products to elite clientele throughout California. With offices at One Market Plaza in the heart of San Francisco and our Beverly Hills branch on South Beverly Drive, we serve silicon valley tech employees, entrepreneurs, entertainment industry professionals, and athletes. Our ability to tailor custom loan solutions and close loans in-house as well as broker through multiple channels affords us a strategic advantage and adds value for our clients.

Job Summary

You will be working as our digital marketing coordinator, planning and executing the day-to-day activities that lead to the successful completion of deliverable projects. You will also assist the Marketing and Sales team members with CRM tasks, social media accounts, etc. You will be expected to work closely and collaboratively with all Sales and Marketing staff, helping us to project manage requests with Design, Development, and Compliance teams. Additionally, you will be responsible for managing marketing campaigns to help expand and grow the Sales team’s presence.

Qualifications
Degree in Marketing or 2-4 years related experience (marketing preferred)
Familiar with social media platforms and strategies.
Working knowledge of Google Suite products required.
Ability to multi-task and take initiative.
Able to take direction and absorb information quickly.
Strong ability to prioritize and a keen sense of urgency and attention to detail.
Great time management and organizational skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects while working within a team structure.
Maintain a positive attitude.
Hardworking, dedicated and energetic.

We Are Proud To Offer

Great Benefits & Work-Life Balance

We offer flexible schedules, paid holidays, and medical, dental and vision insurance to our employees and their dependents.

A Stimulating Workplace

We select our team members with care and foster a positive, agile and connected work environment. We like working here and think you will, too.

Grow With Us

Ready to grow your existing skills? We’ll reimburse industry licensing and other courses to make you happier and more productive in your career.

Carlyle Financial Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

*NOTE: The profile outlined in this summary description indicates the general nature and level of work. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive account of all the responsibilities or minimum qualifications required of an employee assigned to this position.

Job Title: A “Get it Done Creative Genius” Marketing Coordinator
Job Description:
For a Get it Done Creative Genius…

You’re AN INCREDIBLE PARTY PLANNER. Some people call you the hostess/host with the mostess/most. Some people have ideas as great as yours. You happen to get them done. You make everything look great while at the same time getting people excited about coming through all your social media and networking channels. Everyone has a great time when you’re in charge of making things go right.

IF YOU COULD PLAN AWESOME EVENTS, shoot videos, take pictures of parties, network with Radio and TV reps and build your own department of get it done creative crazies all day every day, you’d be in heaven.

I want you to have all of that.

We’re a rapidly growing company that loves to serve our employees first and customers second to MAKE A DIFFERENCE in the Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex. We need someone with your talent and drive to take the execution of all our marketing ideas to the next level. We’ve got the strategy. We’ve got an incredible team. We’ve got an amazing family of customers. We need someone to put the spotlight on them. We need you.

Are you ready for the big chair? Can you handle a $50K SALARY, + lots of BENEFITS like health care, 401K, bonuses and lots of fun working with your teammates? Welcome aboard. We can’t wait for you to make us even better.

You’re too creative for a straight-up desk job. Don’t worry, every day you’ll be doing different things…
Supervising a video shoot in the morning
Carving it into a blog post after lunch
Helping it come alive on social media that afternoon
Networking with radio and TV honchos the next day
Making sure graphics and logos look absolutely perfect
Putting the finishing touches on our community outreach party\
Helping present free heating and cooling systems to families in needs
Setting up photo shoots with Randy and a bunch of kids…
But remember, you’re no intern. I WANT YOU TO LEAD THE SHOW. You’ll be coordinating a seven-figure ad budget, running your own department.

We’re The On Time Experts. You’ve probably heard our ads. If you haven’t, check ‘em out. Get a feel for what we believe. Yep. You’ll get to do all that for an air conditioning and plumbing company that’s better than just about any other company you’ve heard of.

Thousands of people will read this ad. They’ll SEND US A RESUMé after skimming through quickly. But that’d be a mistake. We need someone who reads every detail, who sees what others don’t. So if you don’t include #creative crazy in the subject line, we’re trashing your application. Won’t even open it. If you really want to send us your resumé you can, but we really want to read a letter you’ve written about why you want to work here and some stories about events you’ve organized, complete with pictures, If you attach a video you’ve put together, that’s extra credit. See, you’re already an insider, just because you pay attention to the small stuff! That’s why we want you on our team.

The On Time Experts is a family owned business with great Google reviews. Everyone who works here is DRUG-FREE, SMOKE-FREE, BACKGROUND CHECKED with a clean driving record. No exceptions. No excuses. If you won’t pass a drug test, sayonara, amigo; skip to the next ad. We can’t hire just anyone to be a part of the incredible team we’ve put together. You’ve got to be incredible. But if you’re still reading this, chances are you’re one pretty amazing person.

I’m Randy Kelley. I started in the parts department and worked my way up to ownin’ the company.

I’ve got a whatever it takes tattoo on my heart to serve my employees and my community.

I’m serious about you succeeding and growing your career as far as you want to take it.

Job Title: Manager, Practice Group Business Development & Management (Corporate)
Job Description:
Company Description

null
Job Description

We are Crowell & Moring

Founded with a commitment to build a different kind of law firm, Crowell & Moring LLP today is an international law firm representing clients in litigation and arbitration, regulatory and transactional matters. We are internationally recognized for our representation of Fortune 500 companies in high-stakes litigation, as well as our ongoing commitment to pro bono service and diversity. With more than 500 lawyers based in the United States and Europe, the firm helps international corporations and emerging enterprises navigate complex legal challenges and create business solutions across the globe.

Job Summary

The Corporate Group Manager, Practice Group Business Development & Management (PGBD&M) works with and supports Crowell & Moring’s Corporate practice group. The Manager will develop and implement practice group business development strategies to strengthen and expand relationships with current clients and cultivate new clients. In addition, the Manager will identify and execute approaches to elevate the external and internal profile of the practice. The Manager will also support the leadership of the practice group in management areas, including operations, economics, recruiting and talent development.

The Manager will have the support of an assigned Practice Group Coordinator/Assistant and will report to a Director, Practice Group Business Development & Management.

This position will also work closely with other members of the Client Development & Practice Management Department, including public relations, marketing, and marketing technology, as well as the Financial Planning, Recruiting, Professional Development and Diversity Departments to ensure their initiatives support firm priorities and help drive overall firm strategy.

Primary Areas of Responsibility

Business Development and Marketing

· Partners with practice and working group leaders and assigned Director to develop and implement strategic plans.

· Engages with practice group and attorneys to understand the legal and business needs of clients and the corresponding legal solutions the firm provides. Through practice group “fluency,” contributes high-level business development advice and guidance that demonstrates a thorough understanding of the work the group and lawyers do.

· Drives business development goals of assigned group, including support for generating business leads and opportunities, expanding existing client matters, and identifying and pursuing cross-selling opportunities.

· Develops pitches and proposals, including firm responses to formal RFPs.

· Supports, monitors and reports on the progress of on-going business development efforts and initiatives for assigned groups.

· Works with individual lawyers and advises on business development best practices and strategies to assist in developing their practices.

· In collaboration with Research Services, digests and delivers meaningful research on existing and prospective clients, competitor activity, and industry or market trends to inform and support business development opportunities, strategies, and decisions.

· Develops compelling marketing collateral, website descriptions, and other client facing materials; ensures materials are regularly updated.

· Supports firm-wide efforts related to the knowledge management of pitches, proposals, and opportunities for their assigned groups.

· Ensures matters/experience lists and databases for assigned groups are maintained.

· Supports opportunities to increase brand awareness and profile for assigned practice, including outward facing activities such as sponsored events, in-house presentations, professional speaking opportunities, client alerts, and articles and other publications.

· Works with events team to plan and support practice group events.

· Oversees the timely preparation and submission of the Chambers, Law360 and other ranking submissions for the assigned groups.

Practice Management

· Working with practice group leaders, ensures practice group meetings have strong agendas and are well-run.

· In collaboration with the firm’s Financial Planning & Analysis Department, reviews and analyzes financial reports provided by the Finance Department and updates group leaders on key performance indicators.

· In collaboration with practice group leadership and the firm’s Financial Planning & Analysis Department, oversees the development, submission and ongoing monitoring of the group revenue and expense budgets for the year.

· Collaborates with the firm’s Attorney Recruiting group and Lawyer Development Committee supports recruiting initiatives.

· In collaboration with the firm’s Lateral Partner Recruiting Group, the Attorney Recruiting Group and a Senior Director, Practice Group Business Development & Management, supports the integration of lateral attorneys in the assigned group.

· Assists with other practice management functions as needed.

Qualifications

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

· Demonstrated ability to build strong working relationships across all levels of the organization and work both independently and with others.

· Excellent time management, organization, and prioritization skills.

· Excellent writing skills.

· Experience with content creation and messaging development.

· Strong business and marketing acumen. Ability to leverage research and competitive intelligence to identify business opportunities and support go-to-market strategies.

· Strong knowledge of and familiarity with legal and business environments.

· Knowledge of basic accounting and budgeting principles and experience monitoring and managing budgets.

Education

The position requires a Bachelor’s Degree. A JD, MBA or other related advanced degree may substitute for required experience.

Experience

The position requires a minimum of five (5) years of increasingly responsible, directly related experience during which the necessary knowledge, skills and abilities were attained. Strong preference for candidates with experience working with corporate/transactions attorneys or similar background. Experience in the direct supervision of others on a regular basis preferred. Direct experience in a law firm or professional services environment in any professional capacity preferred.

Additional Information

Crowell & Moring LLP offers a competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits package which includes progressive options such as back up child care, wellness programs, cultural events and social activities. We take great pride in our positive, friendly culture that rewards hard work and success, at the same time recognizing the importance of family and community service.

EOE m/f/d/v
Crowell & Moring LLP participates in the E-Verify program.

COMPANY

AccuWeather, recognized and documented as the most accurate source of weather forecasts and warnings in the world, has saved tens of thousands of lives, prevented hundreds of thousands of injuries and tens of billions of dollars in property damage. With global headquarters in State College, Pennsylvania, and other offices around the world, AccuWeather serves more than 1.5 billion people daily to help them plan their lives and get more out of their day through innovative digital media properties, such as AccuWeather.com and mobile, as well as AccuWeather For Business, radio, television, newspapers, and the 24/7 AccuWeather Network.

Additionally, AccuWeather produces and distributes news, weather content, and video for more than 180,000 third-party websites. Among AccuWeather's many innovative and award-winning features free to the public are MinuteCast® Minute by Minute™ forecasts with Superior Accuracy™. Further, AccuWeather serves more than half of Fortune 500 companies and thousands of businesses globally.

SUMMARY

The Senior Video Producer/Editor (SVP) will be responsible for developing video producer/editing techniques, skills and workflow to ensure the production of the highest quality, most engaging content. The SVP will help improve workflow related to news editing, package production and archiving. The SVP will focus on advancing the team's production understanding and skill level. The SVP will also be responsible for coordinating video production for key series, franchise and ad sales/marketing/promotional requirements and do so with a deadline driven mentality. The SVP is a collaborative team player who works closely with the executive producer, executive editor and other management to develop a specific curriculum intended to improve storytelling and quality editing. The individual will utilize one-on-one and group training to grow storytelling skills that engage audiences and bring editorial concepts to life.

The SVP will introduce and advance After Effects and sound design knowledge. The SVP will also increase staff skill level in virtual reality, augmented reality and other emerging technologies.

The SVP will work in tandem with the Video Content Manager to identify ways to improve video production workflow related to speed, efficiency and prioritization. The SVP will utilize their extensive experience to define the best platforms and file transfer methods for video production collaboration. They will have a strong understanding of digital technology, media management and distribution, and have hands-on proficiency with post-production software: Adobe Premier, After Effects, Pro Tools, etc.

RESPONSIBILITIES
Help develop team competence with fundamental news and storytelling edit capability
Train teams in the use of After Effects, DaVinci Resolve, ProTools, and other finishing software.
Manage a daily post production workflow.
Manage and schedule the completion of edited programming according to the broadcast schedule.
Ensure quality control of all programming delivered for broadcast.
When required, assist in field and studio productions
Help improve content ideation process and conceptualization, covering end-to-end execution of shows/productions including social video content
Mentor and coach more junior members of the team to help develop their post-production skills
Continuously search for tools, plug-ins, software, and other relevant industry innovations to continue improving the overall look and feel of our video content
Build and maintain relationships across a variety of groups including sales, marketing, programming, digital, linear, studio and other show teams
QUALIFICATIONS
At least five years of Cable/TV news production and/or Digital editing experience
Proven ability to take ideas from creation and through execution
Demonstrated ability to produce both short and longform content in a stylized fashion
Must be able to communicate effectively with talent, management and others
Must have a command of production terminology and procedures
Must be knowledgeable on Mac, with strong proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite Production Suite (Photoshop, Premiere), After Effects, as well as an understanding of Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook
Must have experience working with social platforms and live streaming experience
News camera experience and professional audio experience highly preferred
Must be able to multitask and work well under pressure while dealing with
on-air scheduling deadlines
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to deal with multiple projects simultaneously and manage each through to high quality delivery
AccuWeather is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Job Description
Start Date - ASAP

Job Title - SEO Specialist

Department - Marketing

Position Type - Part Time/Contract Basis

What is Code Galaxy?

Code Galaxy is the nation's fastest growing kids coding after school online learning program. In our virtual classrooms kids ages 8-14 learn to code in a fun, engaging way - by playing and building the games and applications they love. With our model, kids have blast and can't wait to come back, and parents are thrilled as their children gain confidence learning coding, math, logic, and problem-solving skills as they progress through each level.

What is the Job?

You will strategically plan all SEO initiatives. The SEO specialist will be responsible for link building, long tail content creation, competitor backlink analysis, and on page site optimization. You have experience with developing strategies and implementing a comprehensive SEO plan with a heavy emphasis on link building and creative/scrappy link building strategies.

Responsibilities
Use of Research & Analytic Tools to assist with our Research for SEO
Content Strategy Build Outs for SEO
Technical SEO Knowledge and Implementation (Important to know how to tag content properly)
Optimizations of Content Copy and Landing Pages for SEO and SEM
Perform Ongoing Keyword Discovery and Case Studies
Research and implement new search engine optimization techniques
Development and implementation of link building strategies
Work with the development team to ensure SEO best practices are properly implemented on newly developed code
Work with editorial and marketing teams to drive SEO in content creation and content programming
Recommend changes to website architecture, content, linking and other factors to improve SEO positions for target keywords.
Requirements
Proven SEO experience
Solid understanding of performance marketing, conversion, and online customer acquisition
In-depth experience with website analytics tools- Google Analytics as an example
Experience with Programs like Semrush, Ahrefs, BrightLocal, and other similar software
Experience with A/B and multivariate experiments
Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development and constraints
Knowledge of ranking factors and search engine algorithms

At Farm Credit Mid-America, we believe people are our strongest asset. We are consistently looking to hire individuals from a wide range of experience and capabilities who have a desire to serve. Currently, we have over 1,100 employees across Indiana, Ohio, Kentucky and Tennessee.

BASIC FUNCTION:

The Marketing Coordinator provides support for the marketing department’s ongoing operational needs and annual and project based initiatives. This position also assumes full ownership of the Company Store and the marketing request intake system.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Assist Farm Credit Mid-America and Rural 1st marketing teammates with ongoing support for customer engagement, branding, partner relations and retail engagement initiatives.
Successful ownership of the Company Store, including but not limited to: managing the vendor relationship and assessing vendor performance; product selection and inventory management; management of budget and annual spend; fielding team member requests and questions; and providing an excellent customer experience within a timely manner.
Update and manage marketing dashboard on an ongoing basis; prepare marketing reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing relevant data.
Provide monthly update of marketing team efforts to VP of Marketing to share with senior leadership.
Support with in-take of departmental projects and creative requests from across the association.
Execute processes that track, maintain and distribute all marketing inventory.
Provide administrative support for the marketing department and support ad-hoc needs across the team.
Daily management of marketing mailbox, answering questions or directing inquires to the appropriate resource in a timely and collaborative manner.
Coordinate marketing needs and resources for EVP Chief Lending Officer and senior leadership as needed.
Demonstrate excellent customer service standards.
Represent and communicate Farm Credit Mid-America’s purpose and values and complies with association conduct and security policies and confidentiality expectations.

Associate or Bachelor’s degree in marketing or related field preferred. Minimum of two years’ experience in marketing, administrative support or other relevant business experience required. Farm Credit Mid-America and / or combination of education and experience considered.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of: Association operations; policies and procedures; administrative functions and responsibilities; principles and procedures of writing; principles of project management, Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.

Skills in: Organization and handling details; tact and diplomacy; verbal and creative written communications; managing projects in varying stages of completion, reporting progress, clarifying, explaining, listening, taking directions, problem solving, time management, and coaching others.

Ability to: Be dependable; communicate effectively, get along with others, keep track of people at various stages of progress, make successful presentations, maintain confidentiality, demonstrate integrity and initiative, demonstrate enthusiasm, be flexible, be assertive, use sound judgment, work with speed and accuracy, research, analyze, grasp information quickly, troubleshoot issues, make decisions, solve problems related to projects, gain understanding quickly of the diverse functions within Farm Credit Mid-America, be logical, work independently and as a team member.

Job Description
Hire Ventures, Inc. is a boutique human resource consulting firm headquartered in Atlanta, GA. Since 2001 we have been providing human resource and recruiting consulting services to small businesses. We work with all types of companies, from the early-stage technology start-ups to family-owned businesses and everything in between. We are driven by purpose to enable our clients to be able to hire and keep the best talent available. We do this by simplifying the tactical side of HR for our clients with proven strategies, processes and services that cover the entire employee life cycle, from sourcing and recruiting of new hires to employee training and development, all while supporting their culture and values.

Hire Ventures, Inc. is currently looking to hire a Marketing Coordinator for our a growing team. This could be the perfect opportunity for someone who is looking for part-time, flexible work in the local Buckhead/Perimeter area.

The ideal candidate will assist in all areas of marketing lead generation and marketing support. They will be comfortable in maintaining various marketing campaigns and have a creative skillset which enables them to brainstorm new initiatives.

Responsibilities
Website Management including updating copy content, managing our e-commerce pages, promo's, opt-ins and offerings, google analytics, making sure plugins & links all work, manage client testimonials, and basically all things www.hireventures.com.
HR Shop Management, including launch strategy, promotions, automation and customer nurturing and follow-up.
Marketing Management, including social media, creating documents and templates, email campaigns and lists, SEO and all things marketing.
Supporting client system ATS implementation and Employer Branding Strategies.
Develop and maintain websites, newsletters, emails, social media campaigns
Contribute to marketing and creative brainstorm initiatives
Identify and propose internal/external ideas and initiatives to help promote general awareness of company brand
Other tasks and projects as needed that may include event planning, PR, content publishing, graphics and other marketing initiatives.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
Website management experience preferably with Wordpress and the common plugins.
eCommerce experience required; Podia experience a plus
2 - 3 years' experience in marketing in B2B SMB environment,
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities, establish a clear plan and ability to deliver
Knowledge of all social networking platforms used for business, especially LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and Pinterest
Must have experience in a corporate business environment and a general understanding of what problems we solve for our clients.
Must be a problem solver, someone who is able to look at the big picture yet have acute attention to detail with the ability to get stuff done.
Thrive in an environment where you can be resourceful, adaptive and be easy to work with.
Exceptional writing and communication skills, with an understanding of incorporating business writing & style with clear messaging that is aligned to our corporate values and goals.
Demonstrated ability to work independently, be motivated, articulate and make sound decisions.
Must be collaborative in nature and be easy to work with.
Must be results-focused ensuring that time spent on tasks will enable actual results.
What it's like to work with the team at Hire Ventures?

We are easy to work with, collaborative in nature and generally nice people, we come from corporate environments and now thrive on solving HR and Recruiting problems for our clients who are typically small to medium size businesses!

We strive to work hard and work smart…we get stuff done! In return, we have full autonomy in our work, with a work life balance that is ours to determine.

MOSCOT is a New York City institution renowned worldwide for its iconic eyewear – The MOSCOT Originals, MOSCOT Spirit, and MOSCOT Sun Collections. MOSCOT infuses its unmistakably refined, downtown aesthetic with over 100 years of eyewear expertise and unparalleled craftsmanship to create its timeless eyewear. While now recognized as a global fashion brand beloved by fans worldwide, MOSCOT remains, at heart, a neighborhood optical shop.

We are looking for someone who is creative to join our MOSCOT family on the visual and graphic design team. This position requires the ability to multitask and work on different projects simultaneously. Ideal candidates will be able to push creative boundaries yet also understand the overall brand aesthetic. Time allocation will be key in this role as some hours will be spent creating graphics and some will be spent with visual displays.

Responsibilities include:
Assist Lead Graphic Designer with visuals and execute the graphics for global window displays
Support in the creation of signage, mock ups, e-mail campaigns, on line promotion, etc.
Implement graphics and communicate with printers
Create branded graphic layouts
Branded content creation
Graphic support for trade show booths
Work closely with the marketing team and existing lead graphic designer to translate out messaging concepts into marketing materials.
Execute creative briefs for printed and digital assets for seasonal based campaigns.
Fulfill creative requests for window displays, invites, posters, flyers, etc.
Facilitate in creating graphics and layouts for the MOSCOT bi-annual style guide catalogue
Complete line sheets and spec sheets for new product releases
Email Designs and Layouts (familiar with Mailchimp or other EMS)
Manage website assets for image optimization
Ability to assist with small scale misc. graphics for shops or stockists (business cards, lens menus, postcards, etc.)
Assist with sourcing / creating content for social media platforms
Requirements
Well versed in Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)
Creative energy and enjoys making things and being hands on
Familiarity with all up to date social media platforms, and/or other marketing
Knowledge of all Microsoft programs
Ability to photograph and retouch display photos
Must have excellent organizational skills, attention to detail
Must have excellent interpersonal skills and follow- up skills
Proactive problem prevention and issue resolution leadership ability
Ability to learn other software programs and desire
Strong verbal and written communication skills required
Ability to work independently and as part of a team

Location: Peoria, IL

Diversified Services Network, Inc. (DSN) is seeking a Marketing Coordinator in Peoria, IL

Investigate and analyze the profitability of markets and products.

An Equal Opportunity Employer

Wilson & Company is seeking a Marketing Coordinator with 6+ years of experience in communications and/or marketing to support our Albuquerque, NM office. This position will work with Project Managers and other company-wide marketing staff to support multiple service lines in responding to Request for Proposals (RFPs), preparing client presentations, assisting with special events, and a variety of other marketing activities as needed.

We are seeking an experienced individual with a well-rounded background in digital marketing. This includes, but is not limited to, marketing communications, campaign planning, and email campaigns, copywriting, digital and traditional advertising, tracking data/analytics, data entry and social media.

Essential Job Functions:
Manage department campaign planning and marketing calendar
Schedule a variety of marketing communications promoting multiple brands and products
Manage email campaigns for multiple business units to 50k+ recipients
Organize, develop and manage marketing collateral and sales tools
Build monthly marketing reports to track analytics & performance
Manage social media calendar and advertising for multiple business accounts
Manage all Trade Show logistics (travel, accommodations, staffing, booth, badges, fees, etc)
Assist in developing and defining product lines, brand identities, marketing communications, and trade show materials
Assist management of website product listings & optimize content for relevant keywords
Assist Director with additional tasks & strategic planning
Assist in updating product data feeds
Required Skills
Experience with Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
A/E/C industry experience a plus, but not required
Excellent writing, editing and verbal communication skills, with keen attention to detail
Detail-oriented with an emphasis on quality work products under deadline pressure
Ability to work well with diverse teams
Excellent organization skills, with the ability to work both independently and collaboratively while managing multiple demands.
Team player who enjoys a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
Knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite is preferable
Required Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, Journalism, or related degree
6 or more years of experience


About Us:

Wilson & Company has a rich history in planning and design, and the right candidate will become part of our bright future. We provide multidisciplinary engineering, architecture, surveying, mapping, environmental, and planning services, and employ staff throughout 15 offices in 9 states. The firm was founded in 1932 and provides services to a diverse client base including railroads; municipal, state, and federal agencies; energy, industrial, and commercial companies; and private developers.

The cornerstone of our success is Higher Relationships, standards in Discipline, Intensity, Collaboration, Shared Ownership, and Solutions. Discipline is doing it right, with attention to details without exception. Intensity is doing what it takes to meet and exceed expectations. Collaboration is working together and bringing out the best in each other. Shared Ownership means we adopt the goals of others as our own. Finally, Solutions are achieved in a win-win environment. We value this commitment to Higher Relationships with our employees, clients, and the communities where we live and work. And for you, our culture intends to help you achieve personal and professional success. Come grow with us!

We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment background checks.

Albuquerque, US-NM

BE THE CHANGE!

Do you want to work for a company that improves lives? This is a great opportunity to work with a dynamic team while supporting a wide variety of activities to promote the ways that Thunder Funding can help carriers in the transportation industry to be more efficient and run a better business. In this role, your key responsibilities will include providing administrative support and coordinating multiple projects, and other initiatives to aid in the growth and expansion of the company’s services and overall brand strategy. As the Marketing Coordinator, you ’ll report to the VP of Technology and also work closely with the VP of Sales, the Sales team, and the Operations team.

IS THIS YOU?

Do you have a passion for writing? In this position, you will maintain the editorial calendar, write, and send out communications to clients and prospects via various marketing channels with clarity speed, consistency and accuracy. You will also often edit various marketing materials and announcements for grammar, spelling, punctuation and syntax.

Are you customer focused? This position will require a commitment to excellent customer service by fielding sales and operations team questions and responding to emails in a timely manner. You will also communicate updates to our VP of Sales and the rest of the management team.

Are you a team player? You’ll be working with a variety of people in all departments, and some outside consultants to support various marketing efforts and promotions.

Do numbers tell you a story? You will be looking at metrics from every campaign and be measuring the success of each to determine the best ROI for the company. In this role you will define the metrics, measure and report on the status of all metrics to the team.

Can you multitask and prioritize? You will assist the VP of Sales in supporting campaigns, trade shows, and new programs. You will also act as a liaison for: cost, coordinating inventory, shipping and setting up trade shows and other events. You will oversee marketing material inventory by utilizing material requirements planning (MRP) reports, projecting consumption levels and recommending reorder quantities along with issuing purchase orders.

Can you coordinate projects? You’ll work with graphic artists and content producers to create marketing collateral for various campaigns and other marketing asset preparation. Separately, you’ll collaborate and support coordinating new marketing initiatives through all stages as well as take an active role in promoting and administering new initiatives. These projects will require setting and effectively managing timelines.

Are you a social media savvy? You will work closely with the VP of Sales to execute the social strategy including maintaining the editorial calendar, producing and posting new content, and reporting on analytics.

Are you adept at technology? You’ll get to use a variety of marketing tools such as our customer relationship management (CRM) and email marketing software to champion and optimize our efforts related to B2B and B2C email campaigns, dealer issues, and national campaigns. You’ll also audit and update all departmental websites including intranet sites, dealer extranets and ancillary sites for accuracy and relevancy.

WHAT YOU NEED

● Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related area and 1 - 2 years related experience and/or training. The equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.

● High proficiency level in either G-Suite & Microsoft Office products.

● Experience with an email marketing system (i.e. EMMA) and/or a marketing automation/CRM system (i.e. Salesforce, HubSpot) are preferred.

● Capacity and comfort level to adapt to new, different or changing requirements and ability to learn quickly when facing new challenges.

● Excellent communication skills with the ability to interact with all levels within the organization as well as strong ability to work in a team environment are required to be successful in this position.

● This job may require some travel (5-10%) at conferences/meetings, trade shows, company meetings, etc.

Job Description


OSIsoft has become a market leader with revenues over $400M and is now investing heavily in marketing talent to grow our success. We are looking for energetic marketing managers to lead global initiatives, from strategy, messaging to execution of successful marketing campaigns. The role will focus on empowering OSIsoft marketing and sales through strategic and innovative digital marketing campaigns. The Global Digital Campaign Manager will grow, create, own and deliver end-to-end campaigns and be recognized for success.

Responsibilities:
Create innovative, successful and measurable demand generation/digital marketing campaigns to drive top of funnel growth and qualified leads to our sales organization, from field to partner to SDRs
Layer key tactics successfully across marketing automation, web marketing, paid demand generation, social media, go to market partners, media & syndication partners, intent data/marketing and demand generation channels to attain program success
Design scalable and re-usable digital campaign structure and elements
Dive deep and apply account targeting tactics, from ABM to predictive to intent marketing

About OSIsoft

OSIsoft is a global leader in operational intelligence. We deliver an open enterprise infrastructure, the PI System™, to connect sensor-based data, systems and people. OSIsoft has installations in 127 countries and is widely used across manufacturing, energy, utilities, pharmaceuticals, life sciences, data centers, facilities and the process industries, as well as the public sector and the federal government. OSIsoft is headquartered in San Leandro, California, U.S.A, with offices around the world.

At OSIsoft, we provide the industry standard in enterprise infrastructure for management of time series data through the OSIsoft PI System™. Our customers rely upon the PI System™ to safeguard data and deliver enterprise-wide visibility into operational, manufacturing and business information. The PI System™ enables users to manage assets, mitigate risks, comply with regulations, improve processes, drive innovation, make business decisions in real time, and to identify competitive business and market opportunities. We are time series data; if the data has a value at a given time, we collect it, store it, and show it to our customers whenever they need it! We let engineers and managers see exactly what’s going on in their processes in real time – useful, right?

OSIsoft is an equal opportunity employer and is an affirmative action employer. Adhering to our tenets, we are pathfinders, we are honest, and we respect people: our customers, partners, and especially our employees. We are committed to an inclusive workplace and accept applications without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or gender characteristic, national origin, religion, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws and ordinances. Job Title: Intern, Cities4Forest Project Implementation, Brown University
Job Description:
WRI Overview

World Resources Institute(WRI) is an independent, nonprofit global research organization that turns big ideas into action at the nexus of environment, economic opportunity and human well-being. We are working to address critical challenges that the world must overcome this decade in order to secure a sustainable future for people and the planet: climate change, energy, food, forests, water, sustainable cities, and the ocean.

Internships at WRI are learning experiences designed for current students, recent graduates, or other candidates who wish to gain knowledge about a specific area of our work. We strive to attract diverse, intellectually-driven candidates who have a passion for sustainability and development. WRI provides many internship opportunities throughout the year in all our programs.

WRI is committed to advancing gender and social equity for human well-being in our mission and applies this principle to our organizational and programmatic practices.

Natural Infrastructure Initiative Overview

The Natural Infrastructure Initiative is an interdisciplinary and cross-programmatic effort to advance nature-based strategies that leverage restoration, protection, and sustainable management of natural and working landscapes and urban green infrastructure, alongside built systems, to provide water and carbon-related services as well as disaster risk strategies and poverty alleviation approaches through the development, implementation and financing of built and nature-based solutions.

With staff in Washington, D.C. (US), Sao Paolo (Brazil) and Mexico City (Mexico), we are catalyzing a global movement to enhance water security and bolster economic development through landscape conservation, restoration and sustainable management. We convene and empower champions at all levels of decision making and provide the best available evidence and guidance to put natural infrastructure strategies into action. In 2019, the Natural Infrastructure Initiative will ramp up the Cities4Forests project to jumpstart our work in cities across the world.

Cities4Forests Overview

Cities4Forests is a cross-programmatic effort – involving WRI’s Water, Forests, and Cities programs – that aims to catalyze political, social, and economic support among city governments and urban residents to integrate inner, nearby, and faraway forests into city development plans and programs. Participants share an aspiration to help reduce deforestation, restore forests and trees, and manage forests more sustainably. Cities4Forests’ goal is to amplify current best practices and extend the deliberate city-forest relationship to the global scale on which cities and forests interact. It is a voluntary coalition involving mayors’ offices— and supported by other subnational agencies such as public water utilities and offices of sustainability—from around the world. Cities4Forests encourages peer-to-peer inspiration and learning, and members receive technical support from institutions with expertise in forests, climate change, water, communications, finance, and policy.

Internship Summary

The Natural Infrastructure Initiative and the Cities4Forests project seek a full-time or part-time Project Implementation Intern to support the project’s Global Implementation Manager with day to day research, outreach, execution and management tasks associated with implementing the Cities4Forests project in its 62 member cities around the world. You will work closely with WRI’s experts in the Water, Forests and Cities programs to help engage with city officials and implement the Cities4Forests project in member cities such as Accra, Addis Ababa, Antananarivo, Jakarta, and/or others. You will develop recommendations and conduct scoping research to focus efforts on the highest impact opportunities in the near term. This internship will provide you with the opportunity to personally engage with city agency officials, international development organizations, and other key stakeholders and decision makers in the fields of forest conservation, urban forestry, and watershed restoration. You will support the roll-out and implementation of the Cities4Forests project in member cities, with considerable opportunities for high-level engagement, impactful research and exciting exposure to this new initiative. See the Learning Outcomes (below) for details on specific projects.

Learning Outcomes

The intern will gain experience in the following areas:
Building your knowledge on the growing nature-based solutions field, particularly policy and technical challenges, and opportunities for scaling this type of work.
Developing your capacity in scoping research methods and project strategy development.
Growing your ability to build and manage international partnerships with multi-sector stakeholders and other high-level officials.
Developing research and management skills and exposure that supports Cities4Forests project implementationand decision-making [60%]
Support the rollout of a programs and tools that are readily available to cities on city-forest issues, to boost implementation of Cities4Forests in member cities.
Contribute with scoping research to the emerging Cities4Forests research agenda, to include latest scientific findings regarding cities and forests, strategic opportunities for cities to better manage trees and forests for the benefit of their residents, particular case studies and insights, and latest developments (policy and financial) in city investments in trees and forests.
Support the execution of an Africa-focused working group through which the African cohort of cities can engage and access technical expertise.
Developing outreach and engagement skills, and applying them to support project planning, relationship building, and to build a solid foundation for Cities4Forests city engagement [20%]
Support city engagement by joining regular city check-ins, strategy development calls, and specific project planning, outreach and delivery.
Support content creation for public engagement plans, to focus on the importance of trees and forests to cities and what cities and residents can do to advance forest conservation, restoration, and sustainable management.
Support with the drafting of opinion pieces, blogs or a blog series, PowerPoint presentations and briefings for city engagement, and interact confidently with city officials.
Learning about, understanding and supporting other Cities4Forests efforts [20%]
Meet weekly with Cities4Forests core team.
Support event planning and execution, data collection and processing, and project development e.g. for “special” high opportunity projects.
There will be time and space outlined for you to focus on and accomplish a relevant project of your own desire.
InternshipQualifications
Degree (or currently enrolled) in environmental science/management, public policy, international development, urban development or similar required.
Experience or interest in understanding how nature-based solutions can help with ecosystem services, water resource management and other sustainable development challenges.
Highly responsible and self-motivated.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and demonstrated strong work ethic.
Ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner.
Excellent qualitative research and writing skills.
Ability to think creatively, and a good sense of humor.
Flexible, able to adapt quickly, and ready to seize opportunities.
Excellent computer skills in Microsoft Office and internet research.
Language skills (especially Spanish, Portuguese, French) are desirable.
University-sponsored: You must be a current student at Brown University.
General Internship Requirements
Applicants must have personal health insurance coverage.
U.S. work authorization is required for this opportunity. WRI does not sponsor interns for visas.
Compensation: University Sponsored: This position is dependent on the student receiving compensation or academic credit from their university program. WRI does not offer compensation for this internship.

Duration: This is a full-time, 12-week summer internship with start date options between May and June based on the student’s availability and need for the project.

How to Apply

Applicants mustapply through the WRI Careers portal to be considered.

The World Resources Institute (http://www.wri.org) is an environmental and development research and policy organization that creates solutions to protect the Earth and improve people’s lives. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, it is WRI’s policy to recruit, hire, and provide opportunities for advancement in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, parental status, protected veteran status, or disability. WRI’s global agenda requires a staff that is diverse – with respect to race, gender, cultural, and international background. Diverse perspectives and experience enhance the way WRI selects and approaches issues, as well as the creativity and applicability of WRI's policy research and analysis. WRI, therefore, encourages applications from U.S. minorities, persons from other countries (especially developing nations), and from women of all backgrounds.

Job Title: Sr. Solutions Architect, Storage - Telco Globals
Job Description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is proud to be the pioneer and widely recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 500 companies in industries such as financial services, pharmaceuticals, and high technology.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for an experienced Storage Solutions Architect to guide our customers on data storage best practices and to help shape the future growth of our storage services. As a storage Subject Matter Expert (SME), you will be an authority on architectures that leverage AWS services to increase availability and drive down costs for our customers.

The ideal candidate is as comfortable white boarding complex software architectures with a roomful of engineers as they are briefing an executive audience. You will get the opportunity to work with a wide array of AWS customers, from well-established tech giants to innovative startups that were born in the cloud. You will also have the opportunity to write whitepapers, deliver technical webinars, speak at events, and file patents for what could potentially be a future AWS product or feature.

Candidates should be a technical domain expert, with experience in storage technologies as well as having in-depth knowledge of solutions in the cloud. Experience working directly with customers is required. Previous experience with AWS is desired but not required. You will get the opportunity to work directly with senior engineers at both customers and AWS service teams.

In this role, you will partner closely with the Storage Business Development and Sales teams to enable large-scale customer use cases and to help drive the adoption of AWS storage services. Thought leadership plays an important part in this role as you look for new ways to maximize value for our customers by establishing best practices and proposing enhancements and features for our storage services. As our portfolio of storage services continues to grow, you will leverage your passion for learning to come up to speed quickly. As an SME, you will be called upon frequently to present to customers and other AWS teams. To help our field teams understand how to integrate AWS storage options into customer architectures, you will also create field enablement materials for the broader SA population.

This role will require travel up ranging from 25% to 50%.

Basic Qualifications

7+ years architecture/pre-sales experience with storage solutions

5+ years experience with advanced storage technologies such as replication, high availability, archiving, backup & restore, and disaster recovery/business continuity

3+ years experience with Linux command-line tools and system configuration

Preferred Qualifications

Professional experience architecting and operating enterprise IT storage architectures and how they integrate into large-scale production applications

Professional experience architecting and operating cloud solutions

Understanding of AWS Storage Services such as S3, Glacier, Elastic File System (EFS), AWS Storage Gateway (SGW), and Snowball. Use of AWS in production a plus.
Understands the role that networking plays in complex storage architectures
Technical enablement experience through content creation and speaking engagements
Scripting experience (Powershell, Python, bash, etc.)

Bachelors or equivalent work experience

Comfortable speaking to large audiences

This position must be located at one of our U.S. AWS Corp. offices with a preference for New York City, NY.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Together we’re building a company that will endure and products people will love for generations to come.

We believe that people do their best in a culture that fosters inclusion, innovation, and success. Our values - Champion the Customer, Take the Lead, Run Together, Ack + Own and Bring Yourself - serve as the foundation of our collaborative and dynamic culture.

Whether it’s conducting a retrospective, participating in our monthly Hackdays, cranking out a new product feature, supporting our two PagerDuty bands, or doing our day to day work, Dutonians live and breathe these five values every day. Together, we solve real customer issues and fulfill our mission of connecting teams to real-time opportunities and elevate work to the outcomes that matter.

Solve for what’s next—at PagerDuty.

Why We Need You

We are seeking a Solutions Marketing Manager to drive positioning, messaging and go-to-market activities across multiple use cases and industries. In this role, you will work closely with Marketing, Growth, Sales, Customer Success and Product Management to deepen our understanding of customer pain points, the solutions they are looking for and buyer behavior that drive purchasing decisions.

How You Impact our Vision

Develop thought leadership through blogs, white papers, commissioned research, industry and partner events and engagement with industry analysts
Identify and work with customers to develop compelling content for case studies and speaking opportunities
About You
Customer-centric mindset and ability to engage with business and technical audiences
Independent self-starter that’s comfortable with ambiguity and developing programs from the ground up
Equally comfortable with strategic planning and tactical execution
Fluent in translating technical capabilities into business value
Ability to quickly synthesize and organize information into actionable insights that can have wide business-impacting reach
Natural curiosity to dig deeper to understand market dynamics and customer motivations
Excellent written, presentation, storytelling and organizational skills
Ability to collaborate and work cross-functionally

5+ years of experience in product marketing, solution marketing, industry marketing, and/or sales for SaaS technologies

Content development for white papers, blogs, solution briefs, video scripts, infographics, webinars, presentation and other written assets
Nice to Haves

Industry knowledge in retail, financial services, healthcare, and media
Bachelors’ degree or equivalent experience

Who we are


Who we areThe Spaceship Company (TSC) is an affiliate of Virgin Galactic as a space-system manufacturing organization. Headquartered at Mojave Air and Space Port in Mojave, California, it is building and testing a fleet of WhiteKnightTwo carrier aircraft and SpaceShipTwo reusable spaceships that, together, form Virgin Galactic’s human spaceflight system. Like many Virgin companies across the world, its team of over 400 talented and dedicated engineers, technicians and professionals are drawn together by a willingness to disrupt and challenge the status quo and deliver innovative aerospace solutions to our customers’ needs. TSC’s extensive capabilities encompass preliminary vehicle design and analysis, manufacturing, ground testing, flight testing and post-delivery support.

Our Values

TSC and the greater Virgin Organization have a relaxed and informal culture that encourages individuality and innovation. You will be motivated, enterprising and enthusiastic. Company culture is such that you need to be able to “check your ego at the door”, be a self-starter and possess a sense of humility. You will work well under pressure and thrive on being given challenges and responsibility. You will communicate clearly and be confident and persuasive. You will have a high level of integrity and understand the need of complete confidentiality.

Who You Are The Spaceship Company (TSC) is seeking a Technical Writer whose responsibilities include creating, writing, a variety of technical manuals including maintenance manuals (AMM, CMM, GMM), Pilot Operating Handbooks (POHs), Service Bulletins (SB), Operating Instructions (OI), training documents, and other manuals to S1000D specification, and outputting them into PDF, Interactive Electronic Technical Manuals (IETMs) and other formats. The Technical Writer will be expected to work hands-on with maintainers, engineers, and manufacturing personnel to create best-practices and procedures for custom-built aircraft. The Technical Writer will review and rework any discrepancies related to various aircraft/spacecraft systems. Additionally, the Technical Writer will make sure that the documentation conforms to established style guides and standards and will work with product managers and end users to make sure all technical documentation meets customer requirements. The Technical Writer is expected to become a subject matter expert on aircraft systems by interviewing product engineers, observing performance of production methods, referring to technical drawings and specifications, and engineering illustrations. He/she will oversee preparation of illustrative materials, select drawings, sketches, diagrams and charts. He/she will conduct quality review of materials.

Your Mission
Write and maintain spacecraft technical documentation to include operator, maintenance, training and other supporting materials
Collaborate with document users and product managers to make sure of accuracy, quality, clarity and effectiveness of documentation
Provide and solicit feedback for improvement of documentation and writing processes
Collaborate with other technical writers in development of procedures and methods of writing to reflect best industry practices
What you bring
Bachelors' degree and 5+ years minimum related experience in technical writing, preferably with aviation/aerospace experience
Familiar with space and/or aviation documentation formats, including ATA 100 / iSpec 2200 and/or S1000D authoring and publication standards, AMM, GOM, GMM, POH (including normal and emergency procedures), TO, SB, Technical Directives, Airworthiness Directives, etc.
Ability to work hands-on with cross-functional teams
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to create accurate and concise technical materials
Organized and detail-oriented
Flexible and open-minded
Creative and imaginative, open to unique ways of presenting information
Self-motivated, self-disciplined, and able to work with minimal supervision
Able to work independently and in a team environment
Ability to react to change and thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment
Demonstrated competency in the following:
Content Creation and Publishing Tools
Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project
Experience with SGML/XML
Strong overall computer skills.
Familiarity with aviation/aerospace operations, pilot and maintenance processes
