Job Title: Intern, Cities4Forest Project Implementation, Brown University
Job Description:
WRI Overview

World Resources Institute(WRI) is an independent, nonprofit global research organization that turns big ideas into action at the nexus of environment, economic opportunity and human well-being. We are working to address critical challenges that the world must overcome this decade in order to secure a sustainable future for people and the planet: climate change, energy, food, forests, water, sustainable cities, and the ocean.

Internships at WRI are learning experiences designed for current students, recent graduates, or other candidates who wish to gain knowledge about a specific area of our work. We strive to attract diverse, intellectually-driven candidates who have a passion for sustainability and development. WRI provides many internship opportunities throughout the year in all our programs.

WRI is committed to advancing gender and social equity for human well-being in our mission and applies this principle to our organizational and programmatic practices.

Natural Infrastructure Initiative Overview

The Natural Infrastructure Initiative is an interdisciplinary and cross-programmatic effort to advance nature-based strategies that leverage restoration, protection, and sustainable management of natural and working landscapes and urban green infrastructure, alongside built systems, to provide water and carbon-related services as well as disaster risk strategies and poverty alleviation approaches through the development, implementation and financing of built and nature-based solutions.

With staff in Washington, D.C. (US), Sao Paolo (Brazil) and Mexico City (Mexico), we are catalyzing a global movement to enhance water security and bolster economic development through landscape conservation, restoration and sustainable management. We convene and empower champions at all levels of decision making and provide the best available evidence and guidance to put natural infrastructure strategies into action. In 2019, the Natural Infrastructure Initiative will ramp up the Cities4Forests project to jumpstart our work in cities across the world.

Cities4Forests Overview

Cities4Forests is a cross-programmatic effort – involving WRI’s Water, Forests, and Cities programs – that aims to catalyze political, social, and economic support among city governments and urban residents to integrate inner, nearby, and faraway forests into city development plans and programs. Participants share an aspiration to help reduce deforestation, restore forests and trees, and manage forests more sustainably. Cities4Forests’ goal is to amplify current best practices and extend the deliberate city-forest relationship to the global scale on which cities and forests interact. It is a voluntary coalition involving mayors’ offices— and supported by other subnational agencies such as public water utilities and offices of sustainability—from around the world. Cities4Forests encourages peer-to-peer inspiration and learning, and members receive technical support from institutions with expertise in forests, climate change, water, communications, finance, and policy.

Internship Summary

The Natural Infrastructure Initiative and the Cities4Forests project seek a full-time or part-time Project Implementation Intern to support the project’s Global Implementation Manager with day to day research, outreach, execution and management tasks associated with implementing the Cities4Forests project in its 62 member cities around the world. You will work closely with WRI’s experts in the Water, Forests and Cities programs to help engage with city officials and implement the Cities4Forests project in member cities such as Accra, Addis Ababa, Antananarivo, Jakarta, and/or others. You will develop recommendations and conduct scoping research to focus efforts on the highest impact opportunities in the near term. This internship will provide you with the opportunity to personally engage with city agency officials, international development organizations, and other key stakeholders and decision makers in the fields of forest conservation, urban forestry, and watershed restoration. You will support the roll-out and implementation of the Cities4Forests project in member cities, with considerable opportunities for high-level engagement, impactful research and exciting exposure to this new initiative. See the Learning Outcomes (below) for details on specific projects.

Learning Outcomes

The intern will gain experience in the following areas:
Building your knowledge on the growing nature-based solutions field, particularly policy and technical challenges, and opportunities for scaling this type of work.
Developing your capacity in scoping research methods and project strategy development.
Growing your ability to build and manage international partnerships with multi-sector stakeholders and other high-level officials.
Developing research and management skills and exposure that supports Cities4Forests project implementationand decision-making [60%]
Support the rollout of a programs and tools that are readily available to cities on city-forest issues, to boost implementation of Cities4Forests in member cities.
Contribute with scoping research to the emerging Cities4Forests research agenda, to include latest scientific findings regarding cities and forests, strategic opportunities for cities to better manage trees and forests for the benefit of their residents, particular case studies and insights, and latest developments (policy and financial) in city investments in trees and forests.
Support the execution of an Africa-focused working group through which the African cohort of cities can engage and access technical expertise.
Developing outreach and engagement skills, and applying them to support project planning, relationship building, and to build a solid foundation for Cities4Forests city engagement [20%]
Support city engagement by joining regular city check-ins, strategy development calls, and specific project planning, outreach and delivery.
Support content creation for public engagement plans, to focus on the importance of trees and forests to cities and what cities and residents can do to advance forest conservation, restoration, and sustainable management.
Support with the drafting of opinion pieces, blogs or a blog series, PowerPoint presentations and briefings for city engagement, and interact confidently with city officials.
Learning about, understanding and supporting other Cities4Forests efforts [20%]
Meet weekly with Cities4Forests core team.
Support event planning and execution, data collection and processing, and project development e.g. for “special” high opportunity projects.
There will be time and space outlined for you to focus on and accomplish a relevant project of your own desire.
InternshipQualifications
Degree (or currently enrolled) in environmental science/management, public policy, international development, urban development or similar required.
Experience or interest in understanding how nature-based solutions can help with ecosystem services, water resource management and other sustainable development challenges.
Highly responsible and self-motivated.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and demonstrated strong work ethic.
Ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner.
Excellent qualitative research and writing skills.
Ability to think creatively, and a good sense of humor.
Flexible, able to adapt quickly, and ready to seize opportunities.
Excellent computer skills in Microsoft Office and internet research.
Language skills (especially Spanish, Portuguese, French) are desirable.
University-sponsored: You must be a current student at Brown University.
General Internship Requirements
Applicants must have personal health insurance coverage.
U.S. work authorization is required for this opportunity. WRI does not sponsor interns for visas.
Compensation: University Sponsored: This position is dependent on the student receiving compensation or academic credit from their university program. WRI does not offer compensation for this internship.

Duration: This is a full-time, 12-week summer internship with start date options between May and June based on the student’s availability and need for the project.

How to Apply

Applicants mustapply through the WRI Careers portal to be considered.

The World Resources Institute (http://www.wri.org) is an environmental and development research and policy organization that creates solutions to protect the Earth and improve people’s lives. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, it is WRI’s policy to recruit, hire, and provide opportunities for advancement in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, parental status, protected veteran status, or disability. WRI’s global agenda requires a staff that is diverse – with respect to race, gender, cultural, and international background. Diverse perspectives and experience enhance the way WRI selects and approaches issues, as well as the creativity and applicability of WRI's policy research and analysis. WRI, therefore, encourages applications from U.S. minorities, persons from other countries (especially developing nations), and from women of all backgrounds.

The Marketing Coordinator collaborates with the Marketing team to produce qualifications, proposals, presentations, and other collateral materials directly related to specific client and project pursuits. The successful candidate will be a skilled writer, collaborative partner and self-starter who thrive in a dynamic and creative environment. The ideal candidate is proactive, highly organized and able to manage multiple projects with hard deadlines. The position is responsible for creating qualifications and proposals, designing marketing materials, managing marketing data, and supporting the marketing team.

Duties and Responsibilities

Proposals and Presentations
Prepare and produce responses to request for qualifications (RFQ/RFPs), statement of qualifications (SOQs), AIA A305 forms, and pre-qual questionnaires.
Support Marketing Manager with content creation, design, and data gathering
Assemble and produce qualifications and Proposals.
Create presentation materials and coordinate deliverables.
Marketing Collateral
Create and design marketing collateral to support sales / BD efforts.
Coordinate and prepare award submittals.
Assist with designing Marketing swag.
CRM
Maintain information in CRM system as it relates to marketing and business development.
Produce Marketing reports.
Events
Coordinate events related to projects, sponsorships, fundraisers, golf tournaments, conferences, trade shows, and meeting.
Attend events as needed.
Assist with creating promotional material related to events.
Administrative Support.
Provide administrative support to the marketing department.
Build and maintain marketing lists and library.
Create and maintain current project list, staff resumes, and project sheets.
Create and maintain inventory of photography, graphics, and marketing archive files.
Maintain the marketing database to ensure the continuous recording of all relevant project, employee resume, and client information.
Maintain marketing material inventory and ordering.
Perform other tasks and duties as needed.


Qualifications

• Minimum of two years of marketing experience required, preferably for an Architectural, Engineering, or Construction firm, or other professional services industry employer

• Excellent writing and editing skills, with the ability to write specific industry-focused content.

• Ability to work in autonomous and independent manner to produce polished and professional product

• Skilled in building effective relationships with frontline, client-facing professionals and fellow support staff colleagues

• Proficiency required in Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop& Illustrator) and Microsoft Office.

• Demonstrable initiative, creativity, flexibility, and persistence

• Excellent organizational skills

• Thrives in a fast-paced, team-oriented, collaborative, and deadline-driven work environment

• Familiarity with principles of graphic design

• Excellent interpersonal skills, including diplomacy and discretion

• Social media experience preferred. Please upload your resume and cover letter in PDF format. Applications that do not upload both documents will not be considered.

Job Title: Sr. Solutions Architect, Storage - Telco Globals
Job Description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is proud to be the pioneer and widely recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 500 companies in industries such as financial services, pharmaceuticals, and high technology.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for an experienced Storage Solutions Architect to guide our customers on data storage best practices and to help shape the future growth of our storage services. As a storage Subject Matter Expert (SME), you will be an authority on architectures that leverage AWS services to increase availability and drive down costs for our customers.

The ideal candidate is as comfortable white boarding complex software architectures with a roomful of engineers as they are briefing an executive audience. You will get the opportunity to work with a wide array of AWS customers, from well-established tech giants to innovative startups that were born in the cloud. You will also have the opportunity to write whitepapers, deliver technical webinars, speak at events, and file patents for what could potentially be a future AWS product or feature.

Candidates should be a technical domain expert, with experience in storage technologies as well as having in-depth knowledge of solutions in the cloud. Experience working directly with customers is required. Previous experience with AWS is desired but not required. You will get the opportunity to work directly with senior engineers at both customers and AWS service teams.

In this role, you will partner closely with the Storage Business Development and Sales teams to enable large-scale customer use cases and to help drive the adoption of AWS storage services. Thought leadership plays an important part in this role as you look for new ways to maximize value for our customers by establishing best practices and proposing enhancements and features for our storage services. As our portfolio of storage services continues to grow, you will leverage your passion for learning to come up to speed quickly. As an SME, you will be called upon frequently to present to customers and other AWS teams. To help our field teams understand how to integrate AWS storage options into customer architectures, you will also create field enablement materials for the broader SA population.

This role will require travel up ranging from 25% to 50%.

Basic Qualifications

7+ years architecture/pre-sales experience with storage solutions

5+ years experience with advanced storage technologies such as replication, high availability, archiving, backup & restore, and disaster recovery/business continuity

3+ years experience with Linux command-line tools and system configuration

Preferred Qualifications

Professional experience architecting and operating enterprise IT storage architectures and how they integrate into large-scale production applications

Professional experience architecting and operating cloud solutions

Understanding of AWS Storage Services such as S3, Glacier, Elastic File System (EFS), AWS Storage Gateway (SGW), and Snowball. Use of AWS in production a plus.
Understands the role that networking plays in complex storage architectures
Technical enablement experience through content creation and speaking engagements
Scripting experience (Powershell, Python, bash, etc.)

Bachelors or equivalent work experience

Comfortable speaking to large audiences

This position must be located at one of our U.S. AWS Corp. offices with a preference for New York City, NY.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Together we’re building a company that will endure and products people will love for generations to come.

We believe that people do their best in a culture that fosters inclusion, innovation, and success. Our values - Champion the Customer, Take the Lead, Run Together, Ack + Own and Bring Yourself - serve as the foundation of our collaborative and dynamic culture.

Whether it’s conducting a retrospective, participating in our monthly Hackdays, cranking out a new product feature, supporting our two PagerDuty bands, or doing our day to day work, Dutonians live and breathe these five values every day. Solve for what’s next—at PagerDuty.

Who we are


Who we areThe Spaceship Company (TSC) is an affiliate of Virgin Galactic as a space-system manufacturing organization. Headquartered at Mojave Air and Space Port in Mojave, California, it is building and testing a fleet of WhiteKnightTwo carrier aircraft and SpaceShipTwo reusable spaceships that, together, form Virgin Galactic’s human spaceflight system. Like many Virgin companies across the world, its team of over 400 talented and dedicated engineers, technicians and professionals are drawn together by a willingness to disrupt and challenge the status quo and deliver innovative aerospace solutions to our customers’ needs. TSC’s extensive capabilities encompass preliminary vehicle design and analysis, manufacturing, ground testing, flight testing and post-delivery support.

Our Values

TSC and the greater Virgin Organization have a relaxed and informal culture that encourages individuality and innovation. You will be motivated, enterprising and enthusiastic. Company culture is such that you need to be able to “check your ego at the door”, be a self-starter and possess a sense of humility. You will work well under pressure and thrive on being given challenges and responsibility. You will communicate clearly and be confident and persuasive. You will have a high level of integrity and understand the need of complete confidentiality.

Who You Are The Spaceship Company (TSC) is seeking a Technical Writer whose responsibilities include creating, writing, a variety of technical manuals including maintenance manuals (AMM, CMM, GMM), Pilot Operating Handbooks (POHs), Service Bulletins (SB), Operating Instructions (OI), training documents, and other manuals to S1000D specification, and outputting them into PDF, Interactive Electronic Technical Manuals (IETMs) and other formats. The Technical Writer will be expected to work hands-on with maintainers, engineers, and manufacturing personnel to create best-practices and procedures for custom-built aircraft. The Technical Writer will review and rework any discrepancies related to various aircraft/spacecraft systems. Additionally, the Technical Writer will make sure that the documentation conforms to established style guides and standards and will work with product managers and end users to make sure all technical documentation meets customer requirements. The Technical Writer is expected to become a subject matter expert on aircraft systems by interviewing product engineers, observing performance of production methods, referring to technical drawings and specifications, and engineering illustrations. He/she will oversee preparation of illustrative materials, select drawings, sketches, diagrams and charts. He/she will conduct quality review of materials.

Your Mission
Write and maintain spacecraft technical documentation to include operator, maintenance, training and other supporting materials
Collaborate with document users and product managers to make sure of accuracy, quality, clarity and effectiveness of documentation
Provide and solicit feedback for improvement of documentation and writing processes
Collaborate with other technical writers in development of procedures and methods of writing to reflect best industry practices
What you bring
Bachelors' degree and 5+ years minimum related experience in technical writing, preferably with aviation/aerospace experience
Familiar with space and/or aviation documentation formats, including ATA 100 / iSpec 2200 and/or S1000D authoring and publication standards, AMM, GOM, GMM, POH (including normal and emergency procedures), TO, SB, Technical Directives, Airworthiness Directives, etc.
Ability to work hands-on with cross-functional teams
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to create accurate and concise technical materials
Organized and detail-oriented
Flexible and open-minded
Creative and imaginative, open to unique ways of presenting information
Self-motivated, self-disciplined, and able to work with minimal supervision
Able to work independently and in a team environment
Ability to react to change and thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment
Demonstrated competency in the following:
Content Creation and Publishing Tools
Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project
Experience with SGML/XML
Strong overall computer skills.
Familiarity with aviation/aerospace operations, pilot and maintenance processes

Company Overview
PURPLE

Purple exists to meaningfully improve lives through true innovation that evolves comfort from end to end. Our colorful company culture, award-winning marketing, unique (and extremely comfortable) technology, and incredible team make for a workplace you’ll be proud to be a part of. Purple is recognized as one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive companies in the comfort industry. We’re looking for amazing, motivated people who will help us improve lives and invent a better way for Purple. Come along for the ride!
Position Summary
WHO WE ARE:

We are the Purple eCommerce Team. We are a fast-growing group of customer experience, product management, and digital business experts. Our mission is simple; drive measurable business value by delivering experiences that support our product and brand strategies as well as our customer's motivations, behaviors and needs across their journeys.

WHO YOU ARE:

You are a well-organized and strategic practitioner, with an enthusiasm for owning and driving numerous projects simultaneously. You are passionate about the customer journey and building a consistent brand story across products and platforms. You enjoy working with multiple teams in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, identifying opportunities to solve problems, and building out premier customer experiences throughout our eCommerce landscape.

YOUR ROLE:

We are looking for an experienced and passionate Site Merchandiser to join our eCommerce department. In this role, your primary responsibility will be to deliver product and brand experiences that support customer and business needs and drive outcomes. To achieve this, you will work with the eCommerce, Product, and Creative teams to build compelling, consumer-centric content that clearly and consistently explains our products and brand across Purple’s eCommerce ecosystem.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Research and report on consumer browsing and buying habits with the Analytics and Merchandising teams to identify product and brand messaging that resonates with our customers.
Integrate customer questions and learnings into creative briefs to strengthen product images, videos, and content that is delivered by the Creative team.
Partner with the Product, Creative, and Marketing to understand and differentiate our content across various marketplaces and customer shopping paths while maintaining the Purple brand story.
Manage product, brand, and promotional content delivery onto our web stores through Purple’s CMS platforms across an annual promotional calendar.
Partner with the eCommerce User Experience and Product teams to build new, exciting templates that communicate our product and brand messaging to customers.
Actively work with your team members to estimate content creation activities, delivery estimates, and timelines for single projects.
Develop strong cross-functional relationships with teams such as Product Management, Market Research, Product Development, Marketing, Brand, Analytics and User Experience to deliver experience that supports holistic business needs and points of view.
REQUIREMENTS:
4+ years creating eCommerce content deliverables
2+ years positioning Brand and Product stories into customer journeys
2+ years managing CMS content
2+ years working in an Agile environment
Expert level knowledge and experience identifying and resolving consumer questions and needs across eCommerce platforms.
Intermediate level understanding of the marketing, conversion motivators, and shopping behaviors between wholly owned eCommerce platforms and marketplace environments
Experience interpreting and reporting on multiple-source data and trend analysis such as social, analytics, customer feedback, customer service, etc.
Strong storytelling skills that enables you to turn various qualitative and quantitative data sources into a compelling and easily understood set of content recommendations.
BENEFITS AND PERKS:
Medical, Dental, Vision
401(k) Match
Generous PTO
Market Money
Earn a Mattress
Purple Swag
Amazing Purple Products
WHY WORK AT PURPLE?
Make your mark: We value innovative thinking. At Purple, you will be empowered to bring your ideas to life as we work together to improve people’s lives through comfort.

Scale is a tech-driven direct-to-consumer company that builds and deploys next-generation CPG brands in the beauty, health and wellness industries. Through our proprietary eCommerce and digital marketing engine, Scale transforms consumers end-to-end online shopping experience while increasing brand loyalty and retention. Scales growing portfolio of five brands and 70+ products helps hundreds of thousands of people live healthier lives.

We are looking for a Copy Editor who is passionate about creating winning direct response campaigns, telling emotionally resonant stories with individuals, and delivering innovative big ideas. You will lead a growing, fast-paced team and generate strong ideas that create real results for multiple brands in the health, wellness and beauty space.

You must have experience in managing copywriting teams, editing copy and assets and providing guidance to our copywriters in order to produce high converting copy, and continually optimize until the campaigns meet their performance goals

In this role, you will be responsible for editing compelling landing pages, ad copy, sales videos, websites, infographics, and more. You will work closely with the acquisition team to create a pipeline of direct response marketing assets that will help achieve customer acquisition and revenue goals.

As the Copy Editor, you will be responsible for managing a team of in-house and freelance writers for our family of websites, across a wide spectrum of channels including google display network, native networks, YouTube, Email, Facebook and other content as required. This position relies on a number of reporting methods, including research and analytics.

As a data driven e-commerce and media company, we couple Data with Creativity - continually measuring advertising performance to optimize performance and effectiveness of our marketing communications and advertising campaigns. You will play an integral part of this process!

We are looking for someone who:
Has a proven track record of producing/editing direct response assets in various forms. Extra points if youve worked within the health and beauty industry.
Has a proven track record of revenue increasing performance
5+ years of related direct response copywriting experience in digital marketing
3+ years of demonstrated experience as a Lead Editor
Can write in multiple brand voices, for different demographics
Continue to grow and improve direct marketing guidelines and develop a repository of DM templates
Can collaborate with team members at all levels to ensure projects are consistent with DM best practices, brand guidelines, compliance and overall project goals
Takes responsibility for the success of the projects they work on
Responsibilities include:
Create persuasive, conversion-focused marketing communications using established direct response selling techniques
Prioritize multiple projects and deliver highly effective and effective creative work
Research and find the best way to present our products to various target markets on different platforms
Edit the work of others effectively to achieve the best performing copy
Collaborate well with Account Manager, account team, designers, and copywriters
Work with Account Manager to build and execute creative strategy through current audience + competitive research, benchmarking, and messaging
Take creative ownership (manage full ideation to execution cycle) and provide out-of-the-box ideas
Assemble mood boards and provide visual direction to designers on creative content
Key Contribution: Be lead generator of ideas and producer of creative content that supports our strategy and goals.
Other duties as assigned
All applicants must provide portfolio/samples of previous work in order to be considered. PDF, Website, URLs of samples are encouraged.

Resumes without writing samples or portfolios will not be considered.

Competitive Salary DOE
Medical, dental, vision and life insurance
Gym membership
Paid time off
Casual Dress
Office Snacks
Company events/Fun Work Culture

Job Description
Hire Ventures, Inc. is a boutique human resource consulting firm headquartered in Atlanta, GA. Since 2001 we have been providing human resource and recruiting consulting services to small businesses. We work with all types of companies, from the early-stage technology start-ups to family-owned businesses and everything in between. We are driven by purpose to enable our clients to be able to hire and keep the best talent available. We do this by simplifying the tactical side of HR for our clients with proven strategies, processes and services that cover the entire employee life cycle, from sourcing and recruiting of new hires to employee training and development, all while supporting their culture and values.

Hire Ventures, Inc. is currently looking to hire a Marketing Coordinator for our a growing team. This could be the perfect opportunity for someone who is looking for part-time, flexible work in the local Buckhead/Perimeter area.

The ideal candidate will assist in all areas of marketing lead generation and marketing support. They will be comfortable in maintaining various marketing campaigns and have a creative skillset which enables them to brainstorm new initiatives.

Responsibilities
Website Management including updating copy content, managing our e-commerce pages, promo's, opt-ins and offerings, google analytics, making sure plugins & links all work, manage client testimonials, and basically all things www.hireventures.com.
HR Shop Management, including launch strategy, promotions, automation and customer nurturing and follow-up.
Marketing Management, including social media, creating documents and templates, email campaigns and lists, SEO and all things marketing.
Supporting client system ATS implementation and Employer Branding Strategies.
Develop and maintain websites, newsletters, emails, social media campaigns
Contribute to marketing and creative brainstorm initiatives
Identify and propose internal/external ideas and initiatives to help promote general awareness of company brand
Other tasks and projects as needed that may include event planning, PR, content publishing, graphics and other marketing initiatives.
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
Website management experience preferably with Wordpress and the common plugins.
eCommerce experience required; Podia experience a plus
2 - 3 years' experience in marketing in B2B SMB environment,
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities, establish a clear plan and ability to deliver
Knowledge of all social networking platforms used for business, especially LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook and Pinterest
Must have experience in a corporate business environment and a general understanding of what problems we solve for our clients.
Must be a problem solver, someone who is able to look at the big picture yet have acute attention to detail with the ability to get stuff done.
Thrive in an environment where you can be resourceful, adaptive and be easy to work with.
Exceptional writing and communication skills, with an understanding of incorporating business writing & style with clear messaging that is aligned to our corporate values and goals.
Demonstrated ability to work independently, be motivated, articulate and make sound decisions.
Must be collaborative in nature and be easy to work with.
Must be results-focused ensuring that time spent on tasks will enable actual results.
What it's like to work with the team at Hire Ventures?

We are easy to work with, collaborative in nature and generally nice people, we come from corporate environments and now thrive on solving HR and Recruiting problems for our clients who are typically small to medium size businesses!

We strive to work hard and work smart…we get stuff done! In return, we have full autonomy in our work, with a work life balance that is ours to determine.

At Farm Credit Mid-America, we believe people are our strongest asset. We are consistently looking to hire individuals from a wide range of experience and capabilities who have a desire to serve. Currently, we have over 1,100 employees across Indiana, Ohio, Kentucky and Tennessee.

BASIC FUNCTION:

The Marketing Coordinator provides support for the marketing department's ongoing operational needs and annual and project based initiatives. This position also assumes full ownership of the Company Store and the marketing request intake system.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Assist Farm Credit Mid-America and Rural 1st marketing teammates with ongoing support for customer engagement, branding, partner relations and retail engagement initiatives.
Successful ownership of the Company Store, including but not limited to: managing the vendor relationship and assessing vendor performance; product selection and inventory management; management of budget and annual spend; fielding team member requests and questions; and providing an excellent customer experience within a timely manner.
Update and manage marketing dashboard on an ongoing basis; prepare marketing reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing relevant data.
Provide monthly update of marketing team efforts to VP of Marketing to share with senior leadership.
Support with in-take of departmental projects and creative requests from across the association.
Execute processes that track, maintain and distribute all marketing inventory.
Provide administrative support for the marketing department and support ad-hoc needs across the team.
Daily management of marketing mailbox, answering questions or directing inquires to the appropriate resource in a timely and collaborative manner.
Coordinate marketing needs and resources for EVP Chief Lending Officer and senior leadership as needed.
Demonstrate excellent customer service standards.
Represent and communicate Farm Credit Mid-America's purpose and values and complies with association conduct and security policies and confidentiality expectations.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Associate or Bachelor's degree in marketing or related field preferred. Minimum of two years' experience in marketing, administrative support or other relevant business experience required. Farm Credit Mid-America and / or combination of education and experience considered.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES:

Knowledge of: Association operations; policies and procedures; administrative functions and responsibilities; principles and procedures of writing; principles of project management, Microsoft Office applications, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.

Skills in: Organization and handling details; tact and diplomacy; verbal and creative written communications; managing projects in varying stages of completion, reporting progress, clarifying, explaining, listening, taking directions, problem solving, time management, and coaching others.

Ability to: Be dependable; communicate effectively, get along with others, keep track of people at various stages of progress, make successful presentations, maintain confidentiality, demonstrate integrity and initiative, demonstrate enthusiasm, be flexible, be assertive, use sound judgment, work with speed and accuracy, research, analyze, grasp information quickly, troubleshoot issues, make decisions, solve problems related to projects, gain understanding quickly of the diverse functions within Farm Credit Mid-America, be logical, work independently and as a team member.

MENTAL AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

This job requires the incumbent to have the ability to:
Engage in telephone and face-to-face conversation to serve customers and give and receive information from staff, vendors, outside consultants and the public.
Use computer. This involves reading the screen and keying/typing information.
Speak and make presentations to individuals or groups on technical subjects related to job.
Travel via auto or commercial transportation to carry out essential responsibilities of the job.
Successfully interact with and represent the organization to staff, officers, board members, customers, vendors, and/or the public at all levels.
Provide sound technical advice to leaders and other staff in the subject field(s) related to this position.
Understand and explain various subject matter and consulting concepts, programs, terminology, and methods.
Reason, judge, compare, calculate, evaluate, decide, and critique such information as written material, numerical data, responses to customer needs, and/or other related work activities.
Requirements of the job include the ability to do the work, with or without reasonable accommodations. It is the Association's policy to make reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities. Leadership retains the right to add, subtract or change duties of the position at any time.

Farm Credit Mid-America is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other category protected by law.

BE THE CHANGE!

Do you want to work for a company that improves lives? This is a great opportunity to work with a dynamic team while supporting a wide variety of activities to promote the ways that Thunder Funding can help carriers in the transportation industry to be more efficient and run a better business. In this role, your key responsibilities will include providing administrative support and coordinating multiple projects, and other initiatives to aid in the growth and expansion of the company’s services and overall brand strategy. As the Marketing Coordinator, you ’ll report to the VP of Technology and also work closely with the VP of Sales, the Sales team, and the Operations team.

IS THIS YOU?

Do you have a passion for writing? In this position, you will maintain the editorial calendar, write, and send out communications to clients and prospects via various marketing channels with clarity speed, consistency and accuracy. You will also often edit various marketing materials and announcements for grammar, spelling, punctuation and syntax.

Are you customer focused? This position will require a commitment to excellent customer service by fielding sales and operations team questions and responding to emails in a timely manner. You will also communicate updates to our VP of Sales and the rest of the management team.

Are you a team player? You’ll be working with a variety of people in all departments, and some outside consultants to support various marketing efforts and promotions.

Do numbers tell you a story? You will be looking at metrics from every campaign and be measuring the success of each to determine the best ROI for the company. In this role you will define the metrics, measure and report on the status of all metrics to the team.

Can you multitask and prioritize? You will assist the VP of Sales in supporting campaigns, trade shows, and new programs. You will also act as a liaison for: cost, coordinating inventory, shipping and setting up trade shows and other events. You will oversee marketing material inventory by utilizing material requirements planning (MRP) reports, projecting consumption levels and recommending reorder quantities along with issuing purchase orders.

Can you coordinate projects? You’ll work with graphic artists and content producers to create marketing collateral for various campaigns and other marketing asset preparation. Separately, you’ll collaborate and support coordinating new marketing initiatives through all stages as well as take an active role in promoting and administering new initiatives. These projects will require setting and effectively managing timelines.

Are you a social media savvy? You will work closely with the VP of Sales to execute the social strategy including maintaining the editorial calendar, producing and posting new content, and reporting on analytics.

Are you adept at technology? You’ll get to use a variety of marketing tools such as our customer relationship management (CRM) and email marketing software to champion and optimize our efforts related to B2B and B2C email campaigns, dealer issues, and national campaigns. You’ll also audit and update all departmental websites including intranet sites, dealer extranets and ancillary sites for accuracy and relevancy.

WHAT YOU NEED

● Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related area and 1 - 2 years related experience and/or training. The equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.

● High proficiency level in either G-Suite & Microsoft Office products.

● Experience with an email marketing system (i.e. EMMA) and/or a marketing automation/CRM system (i.e. Salesforce, HubSpot) are preferred.

● Capacity and comfort level to adapt to new, different or changing requirements and ability to learn quickly when facing new challenges.

The Global Digital Campaign Manager will grow, create, own and deliver end-to-end campaigns and be recognized for success.

About OSIsoft

OSIsoft is a global leader in operational intelligence. We deliver an open enterprise infrastructure, the PI System™, to connect sensor-based data, systems and people. OSIsoft has installations in 127 countries and is widely used across manufacturing, energy, utilities, pharmaceuticals, life sciences, data centers, facilities and the process industries, as well as the public sector and the federal government. OSIsoft is headquartered in San Leandro, California, U.S.A, with offices around the world.

At OSIsoft, we provide the industry standard in enterprise infrastructure for management of time series data through the OSIsoft PI System™. Our customers rely upon the PI System™ to safeguard data and deliver enterprise-wide visibility into operational, manufacturing and business information. The PI System™ enables users to manage assets, mitigate risks, comply with regulations, improve processes, drive innovation, make business decisions in real time, and to identify competitive business and market opportunities. We are time series data; if the data has a value at a given time, we collect it, store it, and show it to our customers whenever they need it! We let engineers and managers see exactly what’s going on in their processes in real time – useful, right?

OSIsoft is an equal opportunity employer and is an affirmative action employer. Adhering to our tenets, we are pathfinders, we are honest, and we respect people: our customers, partners, and especially our employees. We are committed to an inclusive workplace and accept applications without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression or gender characteristic, national origin, religion, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws and ordinances. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Responsible for the quality of all incoming art assets from the projects they are leading and the projects of their direct reports which could include as many as 3 projects and teams of 75+ 3D artists. Actively works to improve approval ratio for their team by providing clear and concise visual and written feedback.
Depending on the project needs, able to create assets in a variety of software packages including, Maya, 3DS Max, Zbrush, Substance, and Photoshop.

A minimum of 10 years’ industry experience with at least one published game credited in a Lead or Associate Art Director Role.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong understanding of issue tracking tools like JIRA, or Shotgun.
An expert-level understanding for current-gen game content development processes, pipelines, limitations, and dependencies as it relates to character creation.
Skilled with current tools and technologies; Maya or Max, UE4, Unity, Zbrush, Photoshop, Substance Designer/Painter, and Marvelous Designer.
3D sculpting, modeling, texturing, and material creation skills for creating game content with the proven ability to produce and direct the production of top quality current generation content in a variety of styles for play on multiple platforms.
Able to analyze and understand client aesthetic requirements and translate that into workable feedback for external art teams.
Demonstrated ability to be proactive and self-motivated, work without direct supervision, and present the work of the team and the project in a professional manner.
Previous team leadership experience required on multiple projects; having demonstrated the ability to mentor less experienced artists to achieve top quality and consistent results.
Must be able to travel internationally 10-20% of the year.
BA or equivalent industry experience.

The Residential Real Estate Council (RRC), was established in 1976 to provide real estate brokers with shared knowledge and tools. Recognizing the need for advanced education, the Council developed training courses for sales agents and established the Certified Residential Specialist Designation.

Experience in copy writing for marketing/communications with preferred experience in real estate

Job Title: Intern, Cities4Forest Project Implementation, Brown University
Job Description:
WRI Overview

World Resources Institute(WRI) is an independent, nonprofit global research organization that turns big ideas into action at the nexus of environment, economic opportunity and human well-being. We are working to address critical challenges that the world must overcome this decade in order to secure a sustainable future for people and the planet: climate change, energy, food, forests, water, sustainable cities, and the ocean.

Internships at WRI are learning experiences designed for current students, recent graduates, or other candidates who wish to gain knowledge about a specific area of our work. We strive to attract diverse, intellectually-driven candidates who have a passion for sustainability and development. WRI provides many internship opportunities throughout the year in all our programs.

WRI is committed to advancing gender and social equity for human well-being in our mission and applies this principle to our organizational and programmatic practices.

Natural Infrastructure Initiative Overview

The Natural Infrastructure Initiative is an interdisciplinary and cross-programmatic effort to advance nature-based strategies that leverage restoration, protection, and sustainable management of natural and working landscapes and urban green infrastructure, alongside built systems, to provide water and carbon-related services as well as disaster risk strategies and poverty alleviation approaches through the development, implementation and financing of built and nature-based solutions.

With staff in Washington, D.C. (US), Sao Paolo (Brazil) and Mexico City (Mexico), we are catalyzing a global movement to enhance water security and bolster economic development through landscape conservation, restoration and sustainable management. We convene and empower champions at all levels of decision making and provide the best available evidence and guidance to put natural infrastructure strategies into action. In 2019, the Natural Infrastructure Initiative will ramp up the Cities4Forests project to jumpstart our work in cities across the world.

Cities4Forests Overview

Cities4Forests is a cross-programmatic effort – involving WRI’s Water, Forests, and Cities programs – that aims to catalyze political, social, and economic support among city governments and urban residents to integrate inner, nearby, and faraway forests into city development plans and programs. Participants share an aspiration to help reduce deforestation, restore forests and trees, and manage forests more sustainably. Cities4Forests’ goal is to amplify current best practices and extend the deliberate city-forest relationship to the global scale on which cities and forests interact. It is a voluntary coalition involving mayors’ offices— and supported by other subnational agencies such as public water utilities and offices of sustainability—from around the world. Cities4Forests encourages peer-to-peer inspiration and learning, and members receive technical support from institutions with expertise in forests, climate change, water, communications, finance, and policy.

Internship Summary

The Natural Infrastructure Initiative and the Cities4Forests project seek a full-time or part-time Project Implementation Intern to support the project’s Global Implementation Manager with day to day research, outreach, execution and management tasks associated with implementing the Cities4Forests project in its 62 member cities around the world. You will work closely with WRI’s experts in the Water, Forests and Cities programs to help engage with city officials and implement the Cities4Forests project in member cities such as Accra, Addis Ababa, Antananarivo, Jakarta, and/or others. You will develop recommendations and conduct scoping research to focus efforts on the highest impact opportunities in the near term. This internship will provide you with the opportunity to personally engage with city agency officials, international development organizations, and other key stakeholders and decision makers in the fields of forest conservation, urban forestry, and watershed restoration. You will support the roll-out and implementation of the Cities4Forests project in member cities, with considerable opportunities for high-level engagement, impactful research and exciting exposure to this new initiative. See the Learning Outcomes (below) for details on specific projects.

Learning Outcomes

The intern will gain experience in the following areas:
Building your knowledge on the growing nature-based solutions field, particularly policy and technical challenges, and opportunities for scaling this type of work.
Developing your capacity in scoping research methods and project strategy development.
Growing your ability to build and manage international partnerships with multi-sector stakeholders and other high-level officials.
Developing research and management skills and exposure that supports Cities4Forests project implementationand decision-making [60%]
Support the rollout of a programs and tools that are readily available to cities on city-forest issues, to boost implementation of Cities4Forests in member cities.
Contribute with scoping research to the emerging Cities4Forests research agenda, to include latest scientific findings regarding cities and forests, strategic opportunities for cities to better manage trees and forests for the benefit of their residents, particular case studies and insights, and latest developments (policy and financial) in city investments in trees and forests.
Support the execution of an Africa-focused working group through which the African cohort of cities can engage and access technical expertise.
Developing outreach and engagement skills, and applying them to support project planning, relationship building, and to build a solid foundation for Cities4Forests city engagement [20%]
Support city engagement by joining regular city check-ins, strategy development calls, and specific project planning, outreach and delivery.
Support content creation for public engagement plans, to focus on the importance of trees and forests to cities and what cities and residents can do to advance forest conservation, restoration, and sustainable management.
Support with the drafting of opinion pieces, blogs or a blog series, PowerPoint presentations and briefings for city engagement, and interact confidently with city officials.
Learning about, understanding and supporting other Cities4Forests efforts [20%]
Meet weekly with Cities4Forests core team.
Support event planning and execution, data collection and processing, and project development e.g. for “special” high opportunity projects.
There will be time and space outlined for you to focus on and accomplish a relevant project of your own desire.
InternshipQualifications
Degree (or currently enrolled) in environmental science/management, public policy, international development, urban development or similar required.
Experience or interest in understanding how nature-based solutions can help with ecosystem services, water resource management and other sustainable development challenges.
Highly responsible and self-motivated.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and demonstrated strong work ethic.
Ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner.
Excellent qualitative research and writing skills.
Ability to think creatively, and a good sense of humor.
Flexible, able to adapt quickly, and ready to seize opportunities.
Excellent computer skills in Microsoft Office and internet research.
Language skills (especially Spanish, Portuguese, French) are desirable.
University-sponsored: You must be a current student at Brown University.
General Internship Requirements
Applicants must have personal health insurance coverage.
U.S. work authorization is required for this opportunity. WRI does not sponsor interns for visas.
Compensation: University Sponsored: This position is dependent on the student receiving compensation or academic credit from their university program. WRI does not offer compensation for this internship.

Duration: This is a full-time, 12-week summer internship with start date options between May and June based on the student’s availability and need for the project.

How to Apply

Applicants mustapply through the WRI Careers portal to be considered.

The World Resources Institute (http://www.wri.org) is an environmental and development research and policy organization that creates solutions to protect the Earth and improve people’s lives. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, it is WRI’s policy to recruit, hire, and provide opportunities for advancement in all job classifications without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, parental status, protected veteran status, or disability. The Marketing Coordinator collaborates with the Marketing team to produce qualifications, proposals, presentations, and other collateral materials directly related to specific client and project pursuits. The successful candidate will be a skilled writer, collaborative partner and self-starter who thrive in a dynamic and creative environment. The ideal candidate is proactive, highly organized and able to manage multiple projects with hard deadlines. The position is responsible for creating qualifications and proposals, designing marketing materials, managing marketing data, and supporting the marketing team.

Duties and Responsibilities

Proposals and Presentations
Prepare and produce responses to request for qualifications (RFQ/RFPs), statement of qualifications (SOQs), AIA A305 forms, and pre-qual questionnaires.
Support Marketing Manager with content creation, design, and data gathering
Assemble and produce qualifications and Proposals.
Create presentation materials and coordinate deliverables.
Marketing Collateral
Create and design marketing collateral to support sales / BD efforts.
Coordinate and prepare award submittals.
Assist with designing Marketing swag.
CRM
Maintain information in CRM system as it relates to marketing and business development.
Produce Marketing reports.
Events
Coordinate events related to projects, sponsorships, fundraisers, golf tournaments, conferences, trade shows, and meeting.
Attend events as needed.
Assist with creating promotional material related to events.
Administrative Support.
Provide administrative support to the marketing department.
Build and maintain marketing lists and library.
Create and maintain current project list, staff resumes, and project sheets.
Create and maintain inventory of photography, graphics, and marketing archive files.
Maintain the marketing database to ensure the continuous recording of all relevant project, employee resume, and client information.
Maintain marketing material inventory and ordering.
Perform other tasks and duties as needed.


Qualifications

• Minimum of two years of marketing experience required, preferably for an Architectural, Engineering, or Construction firm, or other professional services industry employer

• Excellent writing and editing skills, with the ability to write specific industry-focused content.

• Skilled in building effective relationships with frontline, client-facing professionals and fellow support staff colleagues

• Proficiency required in Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop& Illustrator) and Microsoft Office.

• Excellent organizational skills

• Thrives in a fast-paced, team-oriented, collaborative, and deadline-driven work environment

• Excellent interpersonal skills, including diplomacy and discretion

• Social media experience preferred. Please upload your resume and cover letter in PDF format. Applications that do not upload both documents will not be considered.

Job Title: Sr. Solutions Architect, Storage - Telco Globals
Job Description:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is proud to be the pioneer and widely recognized leader in Cloud Computing. Our web services provide IT infrastructure in-the-cloud that is used by hundreds of thousands of developers and businesses around the world. These customers range from start-ups to leading web companies to Global 500 companies in industries such as financial services, pharmaceuticals, and high technology.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for an experienced Storage Solutions Architect to guide our customers on data storage best practices and to help shape the future growth of our storage services. As a storage Subject Matter Expert (SME), you will be an authority on architectures that leverage AWS services to increase availability and drive down costs for our customers.

The ideal candidate is as comfortable white boarding complex software architectures with a roomful of engineers as they are briefing an executive audience. You will get the opportunity to work with a wide array of AWS customers, from well-established tech giants to innovative startups that were born in the cloud. You will also have the opportunity to write whitepapers, deliver technical webinars, speak at events, and file patents for what could potentially be a future AWS product or feature.

Candidates should be a technical domain expert, with experience in storage technologies as well as having in-depth knowledge of solutions in the cloud. Experience working directly with customers is required. Previous experience with AWS is desired but not required. You will get the opportunity to work directly with senior engineers at both customers and AWS service teams.

In this role, you will partner closely with the Storage Business Development and Sales teams to enable large-scale customer use cases and to help drive the adoption of AWS storage services. Thought leadership plays an important part in this role as you look for new ways to maximize value for our customers by establishing best practices and proposing enhancements and features for our storage services. As our portfolio of storage services continues to grow, you will leverage your passion for learning to come up to speed quickly. As an SME, you will be called upon frequently to present to customers and other AWS teams. To help our field teams understand how to integrate AWS storage options into customer architectures, you will also create field enablement materials for the broader SA population.

This role will require travel up ranging from 25% to 50%.

Basic Qualifications

7+ years architecture/pre-sales experience with storage solutions

5+ years experience with advanced storage technologies such as replication, high availability, archiving, backup & restore, and disaster recovery/business continuity

3+ years experience with Linux command-line tools and system configuration

Preferred Qualifications

Professional experience architecting and operating enterprise IT storage architectures and how they integrate into large-scale production applications

Professional experience architecting and operating cloud solutions

Understanding of AWS Storage Services such as S3, Glacier, Elastic File System (EFS), AWS Storage Gateway (SGW), and Snowball. Use of AWS in production a plus.
Understands the role that networking plays in complex storage architectures
Technical enablement experience through content creation and speaking engagements
Scripting experience (Powershell, Python, bash, etc.)

Bachelors or equivalent work experience

Comfortable speaking to large audiences

This position must be located at one of our U.S. AWS Corp. offices with a preference for New York City, NY.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Together we’re building a company that will endure and products people will love for generations to come.

We believe that people do their best in a culture that fosters inclusion, innovation, and success. Our values - Champion the Customer, Take the Lead, Run Together, Ack + Own and Bring Yourself - serve as the foundation of our collaborative and dynamic culture.

Whether it’s conducting a retrospective, participating in our monthly Hackdays, cranking out a new product feature, supporting our two PagerDuty bands, or doing our day to day work, Dutonians live and breathe these five values every day. Together, we solve real customer issues and fulfill our mission of connecting teams to real-time opportunities and elevate work to the outcomes that matter.

Solve for what’s next—at PagerDuty.

Why We Need You

We are seeking a Solutions Marketing Manager to drive positioning, messaging and go-to-market activities across multiple use cases and industries. In this role, you will work closely with Marketing, Growth, Sales, Customer Success and Product Management to deepen our understanding of customer pain points, the solutions they are looking for and buyer behavior that drive purchasing decisions.

How You Impact our Vision
Become the subject matter expert across target verticals and emerging use cases, understanding market trends, customer requirements and key opportunities for PagerDuty
Understand industry terminology and be able to speak in the language of the customer
Develop core messaging and positioning that will drive content creation and sales enablement
Collaborate with Sales, Field Marketing and Growth teams to create campaigns and content to help meet pipeline and revenue goals, in particular webinars and landing pages
Develop thought leadership through blogs, white papers, commissioned research, industry and partner events and engagement with industry analysts
Identify and work with customers to develop compelling content for case studies and speaking opportunities
About You
Customer-centric mindset and ability to engage with business and technical audiences
Independent self-starter that’s comfortable with ambiguity and developing programs from the ground up
Equally comfortable with strategic planning and tactical execution
Fluent in translating technical capabilities into business value
Ability to quickly synthesize and organize information into actionable insights that can have wide business-impacting reach
Natural curiosity to dig deeper to understand market dynamics and customer motivations
Excellent written, presentation, storytelling and organizational skills
Ability to collaborate and work cross-functionally
Minimum Qualifications
5+ years of experience in product marketing, solution marketing, industry marketing, and/or sales for SaaS technologies
Customer-facing experience speaking with developers, IT staff, and senior technical management roles
Content development for white papers, blogs, solution briefs, video scripts, infographics, webinars, presentation and other written assets
Nice to Haves
Working knowledge of agile and devops methodologies, ITIL, ITSM, cloud technologies
Industry knowledge in retail, financial services, healthcare, and media
Bachelors’ degree or equivalent experience

Who we are


Who we areThe Spaceship Company (TSC) is an affiliate of Virgin Galactic as a space-system manufacturing organization. Headquartered at Mojave Air and Space Port in Mojave, California, it is building and testing a fleet of WhiteKnightTwo carrier aircraft and SpaceShipTwo reusable spaceships that, together, form Virgin Galactic’s human spaceflight system. Like many Virgin companies across the world, its team of over 400 talented and dedicated engineers, technicians and professionals are drawn together by a willingness to disrupt and challenge the status quo and deliver innovative aerospace solutions to our customers’ needs. TSC’s extensive capabilities encompass preliminary vehicle design and analysis, manufacturing, ground testing, flight testing and post-delivery support.

Our Values

TSC and the greater Virgin Organization have a relaxed and informal culture that encourages individuality and innovation. You will be motivated, enterprising and enthusiastic. Company culture is such that you need to be able to “check your ego at the door”, be a self-starter and possess a sense of humility. You will work well under pressure and thrive on being given challenges and responsibility. You will communicate clearly and be confident and persuasive. You will have a high level of integrity and understand the need of complete confidentiality.

Who You Are The Spaceship Company (TSC) is seeking a Technical Writer whose responsibilities include creating, writing, a variety of technical manuals including maintenance manuals (AMM, CMM, GMM), Pilot Operating Handbooks (POHs), Service Bulletins (SB), Operating Instructions (OI), training documents, and other manuals to S1000D specification, and outputting them into PDF, Interactive Electronic Technical Manuals (IETMs) and other formats. The Technical Writer will be expected to work hands-on with maintainers, engineers, and manufacturing personnel to create best-practices and procedures for custom-built aircraft. The Technical Writer will review and rework any discrepancies related to various aircraft/spacecraft systems. Additionally, the Technical Writer will make sure that the documentation conforms to established style guides and standards and will work with product managers and end users to make sure all technical documentation meets customer requirements. The Technical Writer is expected to become a subject matter expert on aircraft systems by interviewing product engineers, observing performance of production methods, referring to technical drawings and specifications, and engineering illustrations. He/she will oversee preparation of illustrative materials, select drawings, sketches, diagrams and charts. He/she will conduct quality review of materials.

Your Mission
Write and maintain spacecraft technical documentation to include operator, maintenance, training and other supporting materials
Collaborate with document users and product managers to make sure of accuracy, quality, clarity and effectiveness of documentation
Provide and solicit feedback for improvement of documentation and writing processes
Collaborate with other technical writers in development of procedures and methods of writing to reflect best industry practices
What you bring
Bachelors' degree and 5+ years minimum related experience in technical writing, preferably with aviation/aerospace experience
Familiar with space and/or aviation documentation formats, including ATA 100 / iSpec 2200 and/or S1000D authoring and publication standards, AMM, GOM, GMM, POH (including normal and emergency procedures), TO, SB, Technical Directives, Airworthiness Directives, etc.
Ability to work hands-on with cross-functional teams
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Ability to create accurate and concise technical materials
Organized and detail-oriented
Flexible and open-minded
Creative and imaginative, open to unique ways of presenting information
Self-motivated, self-disciplined, and able to work with minimal supervision
Able to work independently and in a team environment
Ability to react to change and thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment
Demonstrated competency in the following:
Content Creation and Publishing Tools
Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project
Experience with SGML/XML
Strong overall computer skills.
Familiarity with aviation/aerospace operations, pilot and maintenance processes
ITAR RequirementsTo conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, applicant must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by ITAR (22 CFR §120.15) or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State.The Spaceship Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with The Spaceship Company is governed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, marital status, mental or physical disability or any other legally protected status.

Company Overview
PURPLE

Purple exists to meaningfully improve lives through true innovation that evolves comfort from end to end. Our colorful company culture, award-winning marketing, unique (and extremely comfortable) technology, and incredible team make for a workplace you’ll be proud to be a part of. Purple is recognized as one of the fastest-growing and most disruptive companies in the comfort industry. We’re looking for amazing, motivated people who will help us improve lives and invent a better way for Purple. Come along for the ride!
Position Summary
WHO WE ARE:

We are the Purple eCommerce Team. We are a fast-growing group of customer experience, product management, and digital business experts. Our mission is simple; drive measurable business value by delivering experiences that support our product and brand strategies as well as our customer's motivations, behaviors and needs across their journeys.

WHO YOU ARE:

You are a well-organized and strategic practitioner, with an enthusiasm for owning and driving numerous projects simultaneously. You are passionate about the customer journey and building a consistent brand story across products and platforms. You enjoy working with multiple teams in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, identifying opportunities to solve problems, and building out premier customer experiences throughout our eCommerce landscape.

YOUR ROLE:

We are looking for an experienced and passionate Site Merchandiser to join our eCommerce department. In this role, your primary responsibility will be to deliver product and brand experiences that support customer and business needs and drive outcomes. To achieve this, you will work with the eCommerce, Product, and Creative teams to build compelling, consumer-centric content that clearly and consistently explains our products and brand across Purple’s eCommerce ecosystem.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Research and report on consumer browsing and buying habits with the Analytics and Merchandising teams to identify product and brand messaging that resonates with our customers.
Integrate customer questions and learnings into creative briefs to strengthen product images, videos, and content that is delivered by the Creative team.
Partner with the Product, Creative, and Marketing to understand and differentiate our content across various marketplaces and customer shopping paths while maintaining the Purple brand story.
Manage product, brand, and promotional content delivery onto our web stores through Purple’s CMS platforms across an annual promotional calendar.
Partner with the eCommerce User Experience and Product teams to build new, exciting templates that communicate our product and brand messaging to customers.
Actively work with your team members to estimate content creation activities, delivery estimates, and timelines for single projects.
Develop strong cross-functional relationships with teams such as Product Management, Market Research, Product Development, Marketing, Brand, Analytics and User Experience to deliver experience that supports holistic business needs and points of view.
REQUIREMENTS:
4+ years creating eCommerce content deliverables
2+ years positioning Brand and Product stories into customer journeys
2+ years managing CMS content
2+ years working in an Agile environment
Expert level knowledge and experience identifying and resolving consumer questions and needs across eCommerce platforms.
Intermediate level understanding of the marketing, conversion motivators, and shopping behaviors between wholly owned eCommerce platforms and marketplace environments
Experience interpreting and reporting on multiple-source data and trend analysis such as social, analytics, customer feedback, customer service, etc.
Strong storytelling skills that enables you to turn various qualitative and quantitative data sources into a compelling and easily understood set of content recommendations.
BENEFITS AND PERKS:
Medical, Dental, Vision
401(k) Match
Generous PTO
Market Money
Earn a Mattress
Purple Swag
Amazing Purple Products
WHY WORK AT PURPLE?
Make your mark: We value innovative thinking. At Purple, you will be empowered to bring your ideas to life as we work together to improve people’s lives through comfort.
Gain unique experience: Be a part of one of the fastest growing companies in Utah! The contributions you make will matter at Purple as the company continues to grow with you.
Awesome culture: Join the tight-knit team at Purple and you can enjoy working alongside industry experts, making close friends, and annual employee appreciation events.

Scale is a tech-driven direct-to-consumer company that builds and deploys next-generation CPG brands in the beauty, health and wellness industries. We are looking for a Copy Editor who is passionate about creating winning direct response campaigns, telling emotionally resonant stories with individuals, and delivering innovative big ideas. You will lead a growing, fast-paced team and generate strong ideas that create real results for multiple brands in the health, wellness and beauty space.

You must have experience in managing copywriting teams, editing copy and assets and providing guidance to our copywriters in order to produce high converting copy, and continually optimize until the campaigns meet their performance goals

In this role, you will be responsible for editing compelling landing pages, ad copy, sales videos, websites, infographics, and more. You will work closely with the acquisition team to create a pipeline of direct response marketing assets that will help achieve customer acquisition and revenue goals.

As the Copy Editor, you will be responsible for managing a team of in-house and freelance writers for our family of websites, across a wide spectrum of channels including google display network, native networks, YouTube, Email, Facebook and other content as required. This position relies on a number of reporting methods, including research and analytics.

As a data driven e-commerce and media company, we couple Data with Creativity - continually measuring advertising performance to optimize performance and effectiveness of our marketing communications and advertising campaigns. You will play an integral part of this process!

We are looking for someone who:
Has a proven track record of producing/editing direct response assets in various forms. Extra points if youve worked within the health and beauty industry.
Has a proven track record of revenue increasing performance
5+ years of related direct response copywriting experience in digital marketing
3+ years of demonstrated experience as a Lead Editor
Can write in multiple brand voices, for different demographics
Continue to grow and improve direct marketing guidelines and develop a repository of DM templates
Can collaborate with team members at all levels to ensure projects are consistent with DM best practices, brand guidelines, compliance and overall project goals
Takes responsibility for the success of the projects they work on
Responsibilities include:
Create persuasive, conversion-focused marketing communications using established direct response selling techniques
Prioritize multiple projects and deliver highly effective and effective creative work
Research and find the best way to present our products to various target markets on different platforms
Edit the work of others effectively to achieve the best performing copy
Collaborate well with Account Manager, account team, designers, and copywriters
Work with Account Manager to build and execute creative strategy through current audience + competitive research, benchmarking, and messaging
Take creative ownership (manage full ideation to execution cycle) and provide out-of-the-box ideas
Assemble mood boards and provide visual direction to designers on creative content
